Title: Sous Chef
Skills: Attention to Detail|Communication|Culinary Arts|Food Processing|Food Quality|Food and Beverage Operations|High Level Of Accuracy|Oral Communication|Presentations|Quality Control|
Job Description:
About the job

Nestled in the island’s forest-like landscape, gazing towards the boundless beaches of the northeastern Aegean Sea, is Casa Cook Samos. This 128-room adults-only (+16) hotel offers the Casa Cook trademark laid-back luxury in one of the Mediterranean's most historically-rich surroundings. Mythical birthplace of Greek goddess Hera, Samos is for lovers of legends and that off-the-beaten-track kind of beauty.


Inspired by paréa - The Beach House, our F&B offering, opens onto panoramic views of the Aegean Sea and is where guests spend long and lazy afternoons sampling the Mediterranean-inspired menu and sipping freshly made cocktails either at the restaurant or by one of the hotel’s six swimming pools.


At Casa Cook Samos our culture is personal, warm, kind, and open-minded. It is like staying at a friend’s house, where the kitchen is always open. Every team member is integral to us in what we deliver, radiating a positive and infectious energy to encourage guests to adopt the Casa Cook ethos and engage in a fun, enriching holiday experience.


Job description


As a Sous Chef your responsibilities include:


- Direct food preparation process and delegate tasks in day-to-day operations

- Assist the Executive Chef in creating menu recipes and developing dishes

- Supervise the different kitchen stations

- Ensure food quality, presentation and plating are maintained at the highest standard for all dishes

- Assist the Executive Chef with food inventory, stock and ordering

- Ensure HACCP and all other regulations are maintained and staff is trained in sanitation practices

- Train, guide and direct all kitchen staff

- Maintain food cost


To be successful, we are looking for the following:


- Experience in a lifestyle brand

- Degree in culinary arts

- Prior experience as Sous Chef

- Work well in a team

- Team management skills

- Excellent communication skills

- positive and approachable attitude

- Passionate about hospitality with an energetic and polite personality


We offer a seasonal contract (May – October) in a pleasant working environment, accommodation and meals, as well as a competitive salary package.


Get in touch! Send your CV:

gm.samos@casacook.com

Title: Cooks A
Skills: Boutique Hotels|Cooking|Fine Dining|Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP)|Hospitality Service|Mediterranean Cuisine|
Job Description:
About the job

Ψάχνεις εργασία στο χώρο του fine dining; Θες να εξελιχθείς στη 5* γαστρονομική σκηνή της Σαντορίνης; Στείλε μας το βιογραφικό σου!


Το Santo Collection Resorts & Villas του Metaxa Hospitality Group αναζητά για τη βραβευμένη γαστρονομική ομάδα του, για τη σαιζόν 2023:


Cooks A' (Ζεστή & Κρύα Κουζίνα)


Ενδεικτικές αρμοδιότητες θέσης:

  • Προετοιμασία του μενού σύμφωνα με τα πρότυπα και τις οδηγίες του Executive Chef
  • Άριστη γνώση διαχείρισης πρώτης ύλης
  • Διατήρηση καθαρής και τακτοποιημένης κουζίνας
  • Συμμόρφωση με τις διατροφικές οδηγίες και τους κανόνες υγιεινής


Απαραίτητα προσόντα:

  • Απόφοιτος σχολής μαγειρικής τέχνης
  • Αποδεδειγμένη εμπειρία τουλάχιστον δύο ετών σε αντίστοιχη θέση σε ξενοδοχείο 5*
  • Καλή γνώση τεχνικών μαγειρικής
  • Γνώση και εφαρμογή των προτύπων διαχείρισης τροφίμων (ISO & HACCP Regulations)
  • Γνώση αγγλικής γλώσσας


Επιθυμητά προσόντα:

  • Εργασιακή εμπειρία στην Σαντορίνη
  • Θετική στάση
  • Ομαδικό πνεύμα


Προσφέρουμε:

  • Διατροφή στο Staff Restaurant
  • Διαμονή στα εξοπλισμένα και άνετα Staff Houses (ένας συγκάτοικος maximum)
  • Μετακίνηση με τα σύγχρονα transfers συνεργαζόμενης εταιρείας
  • Εξαιρετικό κλίμα εργασίας με κέντρο τον άνθρωπο (εταιρικοί διαγωνισμοί και εταιρικές επιβραβεύσεις, ''Employee of the Month'' και ''Employee of the Year'')
  • Αποπληρωμή εισιτηρίου (τιμή ακτοπλοϊκού) για την άφιξη και την αναχώρηση στη Σαντορίνη
  • Bonus Τέκνου (εάν έχεις γίνει πρόσφατα γονιός) και Bonus Γάμου (εάν έχεις παντρευτεί πρόσφατα)
  • Bonus Ολοκλήρωσης της σαιζόν και Bonus Σύστασης νέου εργαζομένου
  • Δωρεάν πρόσβαση σε εκπαιδεύσεις και προοπτικές εξέλιξης


Στείλε μας το βιογραφικό σου στο hr@metaxahospitality.gr


Βρες το επόμενο επαγγελματικό βήμα που θα σε βοηθήσει να ξεχωρίσεις στα Santo Collection Resorts & Villas.


Work with us – Dream with us – Grow with us

Title: Χειριστής μηχανών παραγωγής και υπεύθυνος βάρδιας βιομηχανίας.
Skills: BRC|ISO Standards|
Job Description:
About the job

Η PAL (www.pal.gr) κατέχει ηγετική θέση στον χώρο της συσκευασίας τροφίμων με εξαγωγές σε περισσότερες από 30 χώρες. Η εταιρεία λειτουργεί με διαδικασίες πιστοποιήσεως BRC ISO, κλπ. Επιθυμούμε να εντάξουμε άμεσα στο δυναμικό μας με έδρα την Κάτω Κηφισιά:


Χειριστής μηχανών παραγωγής και υπεύθυνος βάρδιας βιομηχανίας.


Οι χειριστές είναι υπεύθυνοι για την τήρηση του προγράμματος και τον ποιοτικό έλεγχο παραγωγής με στόχο την βελτιστοποίηση της παραγωγής. Για την συμμετοχή στις εκπαιδεύσεις παραγωγικών θεμάτων και την επικοινωνία και καλή συνεργασία με τους συνάδελφους

Παρέχεται πλήρης εκπαίδευση.


Προϋποθέσεις:

  • Περιοχή Κηφισιάς/Μεταμόρφωσης
  • Γνώσεις Η/Υ
  • Αγγλικά
  • Εκπληρωμένες στρατιωτικές υποχρεώσεις
  • 24ωρη λειτουργία- εργασία σε συνεχείς εναλλασσόμενες βάρδιες (06:00-14:00, 14:00-22:00, 22:00-06:00).
  • Λειτουργία και Σαββατοκύριακα
  • Πλήρης απασχόληση

Προϋπηρεσία σε βιομηχανία και τεχνικές γνώσεις θα εκτιμηθούν.

Title: Σύμβουλος Ομορφιάς
Skills: Beauty|Cosmetics|Customer Service|Retail|Sales|Store Management|
Job Description:
About the job

H Fresh Line ιδρύθηκε το 1992 και είναι μια ελληνική εταιρία παραγωγής και εμπορίας φυτικών καλλυντικών. Σήμερα παράγει πάνω από 300 προϊόντα για την περιποίηση του προσώπου, των μαλλιών και του σώματος. Διαθέτει δική της βιοκλιματική μονάδα παραγωγής 6000m2 στο Κορωπί και ένα εκτεταμένο ιδιόκτητο δίκτυο σημείων πώλησης στην Ελλάδα αποτελούμενο από καταστήματα λιανικής και shop-in-shop σε γνωστά πολυκαταστήματα.

Στα πλαίσια της συνεχούς ανάπτυξης μας, αναζητούμε για τα καταστήματα μας στην Αττική:

Σύμβουλο Ομορφιάς/ Πωλήτρια

Αρμοδιότητες

  • Προώθηση των προϊόντων και των υπηρεσιών της εταιρίας
  • Άριστη εξυπηρέτηση υφιστάμενων και νέων πελατών και ανάπτυξη σχέσεων εμπιστοσύνης
  • Παροχή συμβουλών περιποίησης και καθοδήγηση των πελατών σε ολοκληρωμένες λύσεις προσαρμοσμένες στις ανάγκες τους
  • Άριστη γνώση των προϊόντων, υπηρεσιών και προωθητικών ενεργειών της εταιρείας
  • Επιμέλεια και οργάνωση των χώρων του καταστήματος

Απαραίτητα Προσόντα

  • Απαραίτητη εμπειρία 2-3 ετών σε αντίστοιχη θέση
  • Ανεπτυγμένες επικοινωνιακές και διαπραγματευτικές ικανότητες
  • Προσανατολισμός στην πώληση και στην άριστη εξυπηρέτηση του πελάτη
  • Άριστη γνώση της Αγγλικής (επιθυμητή η γνώση άλλων γλωσσών)
  • Αγάπη και πάθος για τα καλλυντικά
  • Ευχάριστη και δυναμική προσωπικότητα
  • Επιθυμητό πτυχίο ΤΕΙ/ΙΕΚ Αισθητικής
  • Επιθυμητή γνώση χειρισμού ταμείου

Παροχές

  • Ανταγωνιστικό πακέτο αμοιβών και παροχών
  • Bonus πωλήσεων βάσει επίτευξης στόχων
  • Διαρκής εκπαίδευση και επιμόρφωση
  • Άριστες συνθήκες και ευχάριστο εργασιακό περιβάλλον
  • Ευκαιρίες εξέλιξης

Title: Sr. Manager
Skills: Communication|Internal Audits|Interpersonal Skills|Menu Engineering|Negotiation|Presentations|Sales Consulting|Sales Target Management|Talent Management|Team Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Business Context

Unilever Operations (UniOps) aims to transform the experience of working at and doing business with Unilever by simplifying and digitising our operations. Delivering a digitally enabled Future Fit Operation will free up resources and unlock value to deliver Fuel for Growth, one of Unilever's five strategic pillars in 2020. Fuel for Growth is critical to provide the financial flexibility required to invest decisively behind the other Fundamentals. The UniOps goal is to simplify and digitise Unilever's operations by making our global processes and systems more streamlined, better integrated and easier to work with. This means freeing people's time and talents to focus on customers and consumers for profitable and sustainable growth.

Purpose of the role

It's a very exciting time to be part of UniOps, to join & participate in the digitally enabled future-fit business operations. With the ever-growing footprint of UniOps at a rapid pace in the past few years, its equally vital to have a robust financial system, processes, and policy framework to ensure sustainable business operation, which would not only mean solid governance & control on the internal processes but would also mean a holistic assessment of internal and external factors impacting the overall business operations.

The Financial controlling team is responsible for protecting, improving and transforming the value of UniOps. The Chief Accountant UniOps is responsible for end to end financial controllership for UniOps organisation. The role provides in-depth experience in accounting, auditing, controls, risk management and talent management.

Main Accountabilities

Accounting, Reporting & Audits
  • Ensure the accuracy, integrity and timeliness of financial reporting and ensure compliance with any relevant reporting standards.
  • Ensure timely completion of internal audits and external audits and closure of all agreed action.
  • Reporting and control over Unilever Software capitalisation and amortisation process.
Business context:

Food Solutions is Unilever's foodservice business. With operations in 65 countries, we're one of the world's leading foodservice teams. Our success comes from understanding our customers and tailoring our products and services to meet their needs. Working closely with our clients, we develop solutions that help their businesses grow.

Our vision is to be the Best Solution Provider™. To achieve this, we're constantly evolving our products and services. Our sales Consultants are key element to this success: their ability to anticipate and creatively meet our customers' needs keeps us ahead.

More Specifically

As Sales Consultant, you will be responsible to drive sustainable business growth via Customer (Chefs & foodservice businesses) engagement as per Area’s defined contact strategy. You will be responsible for sales targets in assigned territory while growing and maintaining productive relationships with Operators.
  • On-going supervision, evaluation and development of existing customer base through a Multi touchpoint contact strategy face to face and online; providing support, training, menu engineering and recommendations as required, physically and virtually.
  • Prospect, hunt and identify new customers. Develop and execute plan to win and sell to identified prospects.
  • It is an exciting role and a great development opportunity for an ambitious and motivated individual. It’s a role where the right individual can really make a difference.
Main Accountabilities
  • Sales Consultant must be able to work in a shaped B2B foodservice environment (Restaurants, Hotels, Catering) with a special focus on selling fundamentals that include:
  • Analyze the Area’s market potential through market mapping, manage existing customer base & develop a plan for new operators.
  • Implement Contact strategy & update when needed in assigned Area through a time & performance management framework.
  • Exploit all touchpoints (cold calling, partners, digital, visits etc) to contact customers in a timely manner & reach out to new Operators leads.
  • Always on-field to monitor the Area and ensure target achievement.
  • Professionally execute selling skills (Preparation, Opening, Listening & Questioning, Matching & Presenting, Handling objection, Closing, Follow up).
  • Demonstrate easiness in working in a culinary environment (present, cooking demo, sampling, menu consulting) always by following HACCP & safety rules.
  • Be comfortable to work in a digitally transforming environment & be an active part of it.
Competencies
  • Strong Selling skills.
  • Strong communication, negotiation, and organization skills.
  • Strong Culinary Skills & Food Obsession.
  • Team player. Winning mindset, result oriented, interpersonal skills, adaptable in changing environment, ability to operate in a digital way.
Required Qualifications
  • University degree.
  • 3 years’ experience in sales functions, preferably in the Foodservice Industry.
  • Ability to show creativity and work under pressure in kitchen environment.
  • Fluent in English (speaking and writing).
  • Willingness to travel nationally.
  • MS Office, Digital & Social Media.
Competencies
  • Continuous training
  • Progressive work experience and steadily increasing responsibility
  • International career opportunities
  • Competitive remuneration
CVs will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Candidates, who meet specified qualifications, will be contacted by e-mail or telephone.

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

Title: Senior .NET Software Engineer (remote option)
Skills: .NET Core|.NET Framework|C#|Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)|Microsoft SQL Server|Relational Databases|SignalR|
Job Description:
About the job

Who we are

Founded in 1999 in Greece, iteam S.A. is a dynamic technology solutions provider for large and medium sized enterprises. Our purpose is to help our clients Transform, Simplify, Automate, Optimize and Secure, their Business Processes and IT Operations.

Back in 2012 we were chosen by Greece’s flagship airline, to design and develop technology solutions to optimize and automate different functions and related processes. Our exemplary collaboration with this airline introduced us to the fascinating industry of aviation, and led our decision to develop, within iteam S.A., the dedicated Strategic Business Unit (SBU) avibright (www.avibright.com) that offers unique Value-for-Money solutions for airlines.

Our diverse, dynamically growing team of 80+ talented professionals is always on the lookout for more members to join us and work on challenging technology projects, either on premises or remotely!

Our main areas of expertise include:

-Custom Software Development (cloud or on premises): .NET, JAVA SharePoint

-Software Testing

-Business Intelligence

-Machine Learning

-Infrastructure Management

Position Summary

We are looking for passionate Senior-level .NET developers to join our growing team. The positions involve working on various web projects using mainly C#/.NET / .NET Core technology stacks. The successful candidates must be experienced in the field of software development and eager to contribute, work and adapt in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities

-You will be a valuable member of agile teams, designing and implementing features in our solutions

-You will contribute to all phases of the project delivery lifecycle and work closely with business analysts, software and test engineers work closely with business analysts, software and test engineers

-Υou will document your work and communicate it with your team

Requirements

Must-have qualifications:

-You are a software developer with a multi-year working experience as a Senior JAVA Developer or similar role

-You have a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Software Engineering or any other related field

-You have extended experience/knowledge in:

  • Clean code, Design patterns, SOLID Principles
  • .NET Technologies (.NET 6, .NET Framework 4.8, ASP.NET (Framework and Core) MVC, Web API)
  • C# 10 and .NET (Background tasks, async / await, Parallel processing, Value objects, Records, async IEnumerable, SignalR, Implicit operators, Pattern Matching - switch expressions, Creation of Libraries and Middleware)
  • Entity Framework 6 (Basic EF - Fluent API, Code-First integrations, Query filtering, Split merge, Advanced EF, EF interceptors)
  • Testing (Unit testing, Xunit, Moq, Respawn, Fluent Assertions)
  • Other tools and technologies (Active directory, distributed caching w/ REDIS, RabbitMQ, Mediator Pattern w/ mediatR tools, CQRS, Memory and document caching w/ Lucene and NoSQL DB, JSON - Performance for json, Azure CI/CD, Structured logging w/ Serilog, Kubana-ElasticSearch, No SQL DB,HTTP/3)
  • Relational Databases (MS SQL Advanced knowledge and performance)
  • Developing in Azure environment

Highly appreciated qualifications:

  • Front-End technologies (Angular template driven forms, Reactive forms, Advanced RxJS, Modules, Lazy loading, Object Oriented JavaScript, HTML5, SASS)
  • Other tools and technologies (GraphQL, Blazor)
  • Bulk operations, gRpc, microservices, dapper

As a member of our team, we expect that:

-You write code which is readable and performant

-You deliver code that is well-tested and well-documented

-You have analytical and problem-solving skills

-Υou have a positive mindset and are motivated by challenging projects

-You have good communication skills in Greek and English

-You have a legal permit to work in Greece & fulfilled military obligations (if required)

Benefits

-Competitive salary and benefits package based on experience

-Flexible working hours and remote working option

-Complimentary private health insurance

-Corporate laptop

-Corporate phone

-Development opportunities through technical training, certifications, attendance to conferences, meetups etc.

-Potential for career growth within the company and the ability to follow your career aspiration

-Teamwork and collaboration centered working environment that offers challenging goals, autonomy and mentoring

Title: Senior Frontend Engineer
Skills: Agile Methodologies|D3.js|Git|JavaScript|Jest|Material-UI|React.js|Selenium|Test Automation|Unit Testing|
Job Description:
About the job

Description

Our job is to help with a preliminary diagnosis of Dementia, with emphasis on Alzheimer’s Disease. We focus on helping healthcare experts, pharmaceutical companies and policymakers making informed decisions regarding patients and their cognitive status. We are a tech-based startup that focuses on data science, machine learning, and B2B solutions.


Role

As a Front End Developer, you help design, develop and deploy multiple features for the services offered. Leveraging your expertise to help implement a complex product while ensuring high-quality solutions and performance.


Responsibilities

  • Design product solutions according to the needs of the customer (e.g. clinicians, pharma industries, policymakers, etc.)
  • Create stunning and responsive user interfaces that remain functional and intuitive both in web and mobile
  • Design and create UI/UX that takes into account the specific needs of elderly people and people with mild cognitive impairment
  • Personalize the end user’s experience
  • Design and create insightful dashboards and reports for the end-users
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders of varied backgrounds (researchers, UX professionals, designers, etc)


Job Qualifications

Technical knowledge is critical, but attitude is even more important. We're looking for people that like to walk the uncertain path and want to discover how to do things that haven’t been done before. We are a team and are looking for team players. We are looking for people that only see challenges, not obstacles. We are disrupting the market so where others find problems we provide solutions.


Technical Requirements

  • At least 3 years of experience in frontend development using React (up-to-date knowledge of latest features such as Hooks and Context API)
  • Experience with Javascript visualization libraries (e.g. D3.js, Chart.js etc.)
  • Experience with Material-UI or other responsive UI frameworks
  • Experience with Web Audio API
  • Experience with Git or similar version control systems


Nice to have

  • Experience with Agile methodologies and keeping up-to-date Kanban boards
  • Experience with Jest/Enzyme (or similar tools) for unit testing
  • Experience with E2E testing frameworks such as Cypress or Selenium
  • Experience with deploying containerized applications in cloud platforms
  • Knowledge of Typescript or Flow


What we offer

  • Bucketfuls of challenging problems to solve, so hopefully that's your thing!
  • One of the best learning experiences of your life. You'll get to work with extremely smart and capable people, with interdisciplinary background
  • Very competitive salary
  • Choosing your own working conditions is one of our strongest beliefs

Title: Senior Cloud DevOps Engineer
Skills: Cloud Infrastructure|Configuration Management|Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)|DevOps|Kubernetes|Software Development|System Configuration|System Performance|
Job Description:
About the job

We are looking for an agile and experienced Cloud DevOps Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will support and enhance our CI/CD infrastructure, and will collaborate with the development team to maintain and evolve our platforms.


While the technical skills are important, the candidate should also have the willingness to take the initiative to research and suggest new ideas.

Key Responsibilities


  • Lead and manage the development of DevOps processes, protocols and tooling (off the shelf and custom).
  • Responsible for ensuring high availability and acceptable levels of performance of mission critical applications.
  • Review and approve all technical documentation in online tools (Changes, Validation docs, systems proposals/recommendation, etc).
  • Liaise with other technical teams (i.e. operations, development, networking, security teams, QA, etc.) as well assist in joint Projects.
  • Automate and Maintain CI/CD Pipelines including Patches and Setups
  • Automate Performance/Load Testing
  • Maintain, Automate, Virtualise, and Containerise our Environments and Infrastructure
  • Database Backups


Required skills/experience


  • 5 or more years of working experience in software development with C#, .NET
  • Bachelor or Master’s degree or equivalent experience.
  • Experience in leading/managing and mentoring a team of DevOps professionals.
  • Container and Orchestration Experience with APIs and Microservices (Kubernetes, Docker)
  • Hands-on experience in cloud infrastructure and best practices
  • Deep understanding of and extensive experience with configuration management, CI/CD, and other DevOps tools (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, etc)
  • Plan, organize and document complex system design activities.
  • Ensure System configuration is consistent with institutional policies/procedures.
  • Knowledge of programming languages and operating systems, current equipment and technologies in use, system performance monitoring tools.
  • Communicate technical/complex information both verbally and in writing to peers, senior management, and other non-technical personnel.
  • An ability to establish and maintain cooperation, understanding, trust and credibility within the team.
  • Perform multiple tasks concurrently and respond to emergency situations effectively.
  • Ability to work on multiple IT projects, as well as manage day to day operations.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills.


Benefits:


  • We offer a highly competitive salary and benefits, directly dependent on the candidate’s qualifications and skills.
  • Excellent working environment which encourages team spirit, cooperation and continuous learning.
  • Flexibility to work remotely
  • Rewards and recognition schemes are among the benefits
  • Long term employment, holidays and vacation time, career opportunity with professional growth and development


Does this sound like you?

Please send your CV to recruit@validata-software.com quoting ‘C-DevOps0323’ in the subject.

Title: Senior PHP Developer

About the job

DigitalWise, a fast-growing 360 advertising agency, is seeking a talented Senior PHP Developer with more than 5 years of experience to join our team.


Skills

PHP (Vanilla, Laravel)

JavaScript (jQuery, Vue)

MySQL

HTML

CSS

WordPress (Expert level, custom themes & plugins development)

Title: DevOps Engineer [SDOE0323]
Skills: Apache TomEE|Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)|DevOps|Elastic Stack (ELK)|Gitlab|Maven|Travis CI|
Job Description:
About the job

Are you a talented DevOps Engineer with strong technical skills, and the ability to innovate, multi-task, and work in an agile environment? Then, join our fast-growing team for Product Development and Projects Implementation in Europe, Middle East & Africa.

Voiceweb has been one of the early pioneers of speech and NLP technologies since 2001, building next-generation Artificial Intelligence, Natural Language Understanding and Machine Learning products with focus on Multimodal and Cross-Channel User Interfaces for our clients in Europe, Middle East & Africa.

The position requires individuals who enjoy taking on challenges, prioritize and meet deadlines, have a collaborative work ethic and teamwork spirit, working closely with a local and remote team of developers, speech scientists, engineers and subcontractors. The role is hybrid combining a blend of in-office and remote working.

We have:

  • A state-of-the-art, highly innovative Product platform, the first of its kind globally, that we continuously expand/improve to maintain our leadership
  • A team of seasoned experts to collaborate with
  • International clients and projects in 3 continents
  • An open mind to new technologies, methodologies, challenges and innovation

We are looking for you if you have:

  • At least 3 years of experience in a similar position
  • Proven experience with
  • Build tools & scripts (Maven or similar like Ant, Gradle)
  • CI/CD tools: Gitlab, CircleCI, Jenkins or similar like Bamboo, Hudson or TravisCI
  • Configuration Management tools: Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Salt
  • Git merge request review and approve
  • Container Orchestration: Nomad, Kubernetes, Docker Swarm (standalone or their cloud offerings by Azure/GCP/AWS)
  • Application Performance & Monitoring: Elastic Stack
  • Central Log Management: Grafana, Prometheus, Kafka, Application Traces
  • Experience with any infrastructure monitoring tool (open source or commercial)
  • Solid experience in the deployment and administration of web application stacks (e.g. Nginx, Apache, Tomcat/TomEE/PHP-FPM)
  • Experience with Observability Toolbox such as Sentry
  • Thorough knowledge of Linux Administration and performance alignment

Optionally, you might also have:

  • Experience with Sonarqube, Junit and Selenium integration into a devops pipeline
  • Other Systems experience in areas such as Networking, Security, DB Administration, Backups, Windows systems and Microsoft 365 applications.


You are:

  • Proficient in English, both verbal and written
  • Hard worker, task, deliverables and quality oriented
  • Highly knowledgeable and efficient in standards and documentation
  • Self-motivated, with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities
  • Fun to work with and be around, like we are
  • Passionate, enthusiastic and with a desire to meet objectives and company targets
  • Responsible and accountable, with multi-tasking abilities, sound judgment and professionalism
  • Efficient, proactive, organized, with problem solving and time management skills
  • Quick to adjust inside a rapid-changing environment

We offer:

Title: Quality Assistant
Skills: Chemical Engineering|Distribution Network|Engineering|International Markets|Problem Solving|Product Quality|Quality Control|Quality System|Research and Development (R&D)|Training and Development (HR)|
Job Description:
About the job

Who are we?

LALIZAS is a company that manufactures marine equipment with a commercial presence in 130 countries. We hold a leading position in the European and International Marine market with over 40 years of experience and expertise in life saving equipment.

Our vision is to produce high quality products and distribute them in international markets through our well‐established distribution network. This vision, along with the care for the customers and the indispensable input of the employees, have resulted to the company's growth and will continue to contribute positively in our continuous development.

Why join LALIZAS?

LALIZAS considers its people as the most valuable asset for its strategic planning, policies, values and vision. Therefore invests in them at all organization levels and constantly aims to further development. By setting high selection standards and especially by emphasizing on the approach, the recruitment and the development of executives with expertise and will, LALIZAS provides a career path full of challenges and professional goals.

Therefore, if you wish to join this fast- growing and dynamic team, now is your chance to apply for our “Quality Assistant” job opening.

What you will be doing:

  • Support the Quality Control Department in all its activities
  • Participate/conduct and register the QC control of final products/RM/Semi finished items according to the company Quality system
  • Test new products under development and new production procedures. Follow up and suggest constant improvements on QC procedure
  • Undertake own and contributes in team projects.

Core competencies of the ideal candidate:

  • University Degree in Mechanical/Electrical/Chemical Engineering
  • Experience in Quality Control in a Production Unit and/or Laboratory and/or R&D Department will be considered as an asset
  • Excellent knowledge of the English language. Additional languages will be appreciated
  • Very good MS Office knowledge. Very good knowledge of Internet applications
  • Desirable knowledge of AutoCAD or other similar software
  • Problem-solving skills, creativity, strong written and verbal communications skills and ability to meet tight deadlines

What’s in it for you?

  • Opportunity to be part of an innovative and growing company
  • Continuous training and development
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Friendly working environment

Title: Embedded Firmware Engineer
Skills: C (Programming Language)|CANopen|Embedded Systems|EtherCAT|Firmware|Industrial Automation|Microcontrollers|Profinet|Robotics|STM32|
Job Description:
About the job

Embedded Firmware Engineer - Motion Control and Robotic Systems

RoboteQ is an international company, a subsidiary of Nidec Motor Corporation, a renowned maker of Motor Controllers and Navigation Sensors for Mobile Robots, Industrial Automation, and Electrification of off-road Vehicles.

We are pleased to announce an opportunity for an Embedded Firmware Engineer based near Athens, Greece.

Summary of Role

In this role as Firmware Engineer, you will be working with a highly motivated team to bring to market innovative solutions for customers in the AGV, Robotics and Industrial Automation Markets. Key aspects for this role will be to develop, test, and document new firmware algorithms to support our platform products.


Primary Responsibilities

  • Perform ARM Microcontroller firmware implementation or modify existing firmware to adapt it to new hardware or to upgrade interfaces, improve performance or optimize implementation.
  • Provide technical documentation for the design, implementation, and testing of the firmware
  • Produce and review technical documents, specifications, and test procedures.
  • Create and execute functional test setups.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer Science.
  • 3 years’ experience programming Microcontroller Peripherals such as GPIO, timers, USARTs, CAN, I2C, SPI, etc. especially with ARM Cortex (STM32 and NXP) microprocessors.
  • Proficient in C programming, Integrated Development Environments, firmware versioning tools, and test tools.
  • Experience in motor drive techniques for PMAC, AC Induction, IPM Motors is considered a plus.
  • Knowledge of communication Fieldbuses: CANOpen, UDS, EtherCAT, Profinet, EthernetIP, etc is considered a plus.
  • Understanding of Electricity and Electronics.
  • English language: good speaking and writing level.
  • Good communication skills, positive attitude, and eagerness to learn.


Location:

  • Markopoulo, Attica, Greece, 19003


Reference:

  • RQ-EFE2301_DS

Title: DevOps Engineer (m/f/d)
Skills: Agile Methodologies|Azure DevOps Services|C#|SQL|XML|
Job Description:
About the job

Position name

DevOps Engineer (m/f/d)


About your LPA Team

Lucht Probst Associates has provided expert knowledge to banks and financial institutions for their client business for over 22 years. Our software solutions have been a key component in our success. We build cutting-edge applications that are used in the most important Global banks.

In an interdisciplinary, agile team, we further develop well-established LPA software solutions, from requirements analysis to go-live. At the same time, we implement new projects together with our clients, from small customisations to completely new web applications.


Your responsibilities

  • As a DevOps Database Engineer (m/f/d), you will be responsible for deploying, supporting, enhancing our proven software solutions for the capital market business: in LPA-cloud environments or at the customer’s place of business.
  • You will oversee the conception and completion of technical modifications in direct contact with our customers and help optimizing the stack in data, performance driven approach
  • Enhance and use our fully automated Azure Devops CI/CD Pipeline for builds, testing and deployments to Microsoft Azure cloud services
  • Evaluating and introducing new technologies and concepts will be another aspect of your work.
  • You will clarify technical issues and develop IT concepts with focus programming, databases and performance optimization
  • And last but not least: You will have fun on the job and continuously grow as a professional


Your ticket

  • A degree in computer science or commercial information technology would be desirable You can also win us over if you have a similar certification of your expertise
  • You are experienced in the operation of Windows and Linux Client and server infrastructures
  • You can confidently work with SQL incl. SQL tuning, XML, Powershell, GIT
  • You have gained experience in the practical use of Microsoft technology stacks (ASP.NET, C#, EF, REST, WCF, MS SQL, …), preferably in agile projects.
  • You have previously worked with such cloud-computing platforms as Azure or Visual Studio Team Services, Azure DevOps
  • You have very good skills in spoken and written English

You will fit right into our team if you want to assume responsibility and solve complex questions. Do you enjoy exploring new things, set the highest quality standards for your work and do not take yourself too seriously so that you can enjoy teamwork? If so, you are exactly the right person for us.

Our features

  • Fintech meets consulting: a growing company with a start-up flair.
  • Team-oriented, good-humored working environment that will provide you with exciting responsibilities each day.
  • We place a premium on team spirit, a quality that is also reflected in our daily interaction with one another.
  • We have flat hierarchies that extend all the way to the executive suites.
  • An office in the heart of Athens & good connections to public transport
  • A wide range of professional development opportunities
  • Regular employee events and flat-rate coffee, soft drinks, and fruit


*Only CVs in English are accepted.

Title: Senior Facade Engineer
Skills: Design|Engineering|Facade|Facade Design|
Job Description:
About the job

BBI - Intrakat RT Joint Venture: An exciting Joint Venture between Bouygues Batiment International S.A. and Intrakat S.A., to build the Riviera Tower in Ellinikon, Greece.

This iconic structure, with 50 storeys and a height of 200m, will stand as the highest building in Greece.

Building our team, we are currently looking for a Senior Façade Engineer to welcome to our Project.


Key Responsibilities:


• Assist the Façade Manager on daily duties

• Collaborate with project teams, including architects, contractors, and clients, to ensure façade systems are integrated effectively into the building design.

• Ensure that all façade designs meet the required building codes and regulations.

• Anticipate activities on site by implementing follow up and management tools for works supervision

• Manage the procurement of materials and equipment necessary for the installation of façade systems.

• Supervise works on Site: logistics, permit of work, method statement, progress, quality and compliance of installation with specifications, standards and approved drawings

• Μanage the daily activities of the appointed façade works contractor, in respect of Health and Safety, Quality and program.

• Coordination with Subcontractors

• Conduct site visits to assess the feasibility of façade designs and address any potential challenges.

• Conduct regular site inspections to monitor the progress of façade installations and resolve issues.

• Attend project meetings and provide regular updates on the progress of façade installations.

• Prepare and implement handing over process


In addition to the duties and responsibilities listed above, the job holder may be required to perform other duties assigned by the line manager from time to time, outside the normal sphere of work as may be reasonably requested.

The job holder will be required to undertake such flexible and additional working hours as may be necessary, within reason, to facilitate the efficient fulfilment of the duties required by position.


Requirements:


• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering (Architecture, Civil, Structural, or Mechanical).

• Fluent in Greek and English is a must

• A minimum of 5 years of experience in façade engineering. (Focus on high-rise buildings will be considered as a plus).

• Strong technical knowledge of building façades, including curtain wall systems, cladding, and glazing.

• Strong knowledge of building codes and regulations related to façade systems.

• Proficiency in relevant design software, such as AutoCAD, REVIT and BIM.

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members and clients.

• A strong commitment to quality and safety, with a keen eye for detail.

• Ability to handle multiple tasks at once

• Excellent organizational skills

• Attention to H&S matters

• Understanding of Greek H&S construction laws

• Must be able to work on-site in Ellinikon Athens, Greece

• Must be authorized to work legally in Greece


If you are passionate about building façades and have a proven track record in this field, we would like to hear from you. Apply now and join our team of experts in delivering exceptional projects.

About the job

About us:

For 90 years now, Helios Pasta Industry has been producing high-quality-pasta made from 100% durum-wheat-semolina and is the only pasta industry in Greece that produces also innovative “special” pasta. We have long experience in the production of private label products, handles more than 30 brands globally and produces more than 80 different shapes of pasta and a variety of recipes. Helios is IFS V6 certified within the higher level score and its products have received over 70 awards for their superior taste and quality, packaging, healthiness and purity.


About the job:

We are looking for a Junior IT Support to maintain, upgrade and manage our software, hardware and networks and supply first level support on company systems and users.

  1. Install and configure software and hardware
  2. Manage network servers and technology tools

  3. Fluent English language

Additional expertise on Fortigate firewalls, Storagecraft Backup Software, Office365and IP Telephony will be a plus.


Personal Characteristics:

  1. problem-solving abilities
  2. Excellent communication skills

The company offers competitive remuneration package, pleasant working environment and real opportunities to develop within the role and the company.

About the job

Back End Magento Developer


DigitalUp is a 360o fast growing Digital Agency, specialized in the field of e-Commerce & Digital Marketing, providing services that aim to develop and update our client’s business. We develop, design and promote modern websites & eshops. Our team’s unique combination of experience, knowledge, new technologies & hard work is our competitive advantage. Our portfolio varies from small/medium businesses to multinational companies (ex. The Body Shop, Bozikis, ckontova, Crocodilino, Ulla Popken).

Title: Pricing & Data Analyst, Nestlé Supply Chain
Skills: Analytical Skills|Analytics|Communication|Customer Satisfaction|Data Analysis|Data Analytics|Flawless Execution|Process Optimization (Manufacturing)|Purchase Orders|Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP)|
Job Description:
About the job

Be a Force for Good!

At Nestlé we touch millions of people’s lives every single day through the work we do and the products we create. This way we are helping to shape a happier, healthier future for individuals and families, for communities and for the planet. Join a dynamic global team of people that want to be a part of something that changes the world in a positive way. A human-centric place to work with amazing opportunities, across 186 countries, to grow, push the boundaries and deliver work with real impact. We recruit people who respect our values, we provide equal opportunities for all, and we protect everyone's privacy. We do not tolerate any form of harassment or discrimination. Our aim is to create workplaces where everyone feels included and able to bring their whole selves to work. This commitment starts at recruitment and continues to the end.

Position Snapshot

Nestlé Customer Service, Athens, Greece

Reporting to: Head of Customer Supply Chain

Undefined period of time contract. act. rate 100%

Position Summary

To effectively drive the execution of the commercial policy (pricing, discounts, rebates) in SAP and deliver process improvements with the use of data analytics, in order to provide top class service to customers.

A day in the life of...
  • Implementation, maintenance, and execution of Commercial Policy in SAP for all categories and distribution channels.
  • Vendor invoice registration, Purchase Orders creation and credit notes issuance.
  • Customer Life Cycle management.
  • Resolution of exceptions across end-to-end process ensuring flawless execution and customer satisfaction.
  • Close collaboration with internal partners (Supply Chain, Sales, etc.)
  • Leads Data analysis and process optimization projects.

What Will Make You Successful
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems or related field.
  • Very good SAP and MS office knowledge (especially excel).
  • Experience with Business Analytics (i.e. MS Power Platform) is considered a significant plus.
  • 2-3 years of experience in Customer Service in similar market environment would be a plus.
  • Good communication and analytical skills.
  • Fluency in Greek & English.

Why you should apply
  • Join the leading Food & Beverages company in the world with more than 83bio CHF sales.
  • Be part of one of Supply Chain’s most dynamic teams.
  • Engage with our people from all over the world and join exciting local or international projects and assignments.
  • Enjoy the wide range of Nestlé benefits such as comprehensive Pension, Health Care & Life Insurance programs, increased Parental leaves, Flexible Work plans, Baby Support plan & Pet Support plan.
  • Develop and challenge yourself in a fast-moving environment.
  • Contribute to a team focusing on offering the best customer experience.

A.I.

We are currently implementing a new exciting AI tool that is helping us and you schedule interviews in a more flexible way. Therefore, we kindly ask you to keep an eye on your email (and potentially spam/ junk email inbox), as you can expect an invitation with interview timeslots to choose from. We would also encourage you to say `yes´ to receive WhatsApp notifications, as you will also receive the interview invitation here and you will be able to book your interview directly from WhatsApp. As this is new, we welcome any feedback you might have on our new interview scheduling tool. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to Victoria Karkouli, at 2106884347

About the job

CoreNetworks is offering consulting and integration services in the areas of Corporate & Industrial sector. We design, implement and maintain network & systems with the underline security infrastructure for the above ecosystems.


Job Qualifications and Requirements:

Key Responsibilities:

· Design and implement new network solutions and improve current network environments.

· Create accurate network diagrams and documentation. 

· Monitor, maintain and configure all network related equipment in all sites and respond to alerts and outages. (LAN & WAN devices, such as Routers, Firewalls, Switches and Access Points)

· Configuration of routing, switching and load balancing devices.

· Update network equipment to the latest firmware releases.

· Monitor, install, configure, maintain, and optimize core infrastructure service, operating system, hardware upgrades, issue analysis, troubleshooting and service optimization.

· Implement and manage new security tools and services.


Requirements:

· University/College degree in Computer Science, or relevant field.

· A minimum of 5 years prior experience in Network Engineering.

· Hands-on experience with monitoring, network diagnostic and network analytics tools.

· Understanding of LAN/WAN connectivity, Telephony, routers, firewalls, and security solutions and concepts.

· Strong ability to multi-task with results-oriented mindset.

· Fluency in English language (both oral and written skills).

· Ability of travelling in Greece as well as abroad is required.


Optional Skills (will be considered a plus):

· Good knowledge of Cisco’s portfolio of equipment.

What the company offers:

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Title: Senior Java Software Engineer (remote option)
Skills: Java|Microsoft Azure|Spring Framework|
Job Description:
About the job

Who we are

Founded in 1999 in Greece, iteam S.A. is a dynamic technology solutions provider for large and medium sized enterprises. Our purpose is to help our clients Transform, Simplify, Automate, Optimize and Secure, their Business Processes and IT Operations.

Back in 2012 we were chosen by Greece’s flagship airline, to design and develop technology solutions to optimize and automate different functions and related processes. Our exemplary collaboration with this airline introduced us to the fascinating industry of aviation, and led our decision to develop, within iteam S.A., the dedicated Strategic Business Unit (SBU) avibright (www.avibright.com) that offers unique Value-for-Money solutions for airlines.


Our diverse, dynamically growing team of 80+ talented professionals is always on the lookout for more members to join us and work on challenging technology projects, either on premises or remotely!


Our main areas of expertise include:


-Custom Software Development (cloud or on premises): JAVA, .NET, SharePoint

-Software Testing

-Business Intelligence

-Machine Learning

-Infrastructure Management


Position Summary

We are looking for passionate Senior JAVA Developers to join our growing team. The positions involve working on various applications using mainly Spring. The successful candidates must be experienced in the field of software development and eager to contribute, work and adapt in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.


Responsibilities

-You will be a valuable member of agile teams, designing and implementing features in our solutions

-You will work closely with business analysts, software and test engineers

-Υou will document your work and communicate it with your team and the client

-You will be writing and reviewing code and your code will be reviewed


Requirements


Must-have qualifications


-You are a software developer with previous working experience as a Senior JAVA Developer or similar role

-You have a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Software Engineering or any other related field

-You feel right at home with:

  • OOP and design patterns
  • Relational Databases (MySQL, SQL Server), SQL

-You have working knowledge of frameworks such as JPA, Hibernate, Junit 5

-You have experience in implementing REST or SOAP Java APIs

-You have experience in some (or all) of the following:

  • Microservices, containerized applications, including Docker and Kubernetes
  • Modern authorization mechanisms such as JSON Web Token
  • Message oriented middleware (e.g. JMS, Kafka)
  • Automation tools such as Maven
  • Git for Source Control (CLI and GUI)

-Cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure


Highly appreciated qualifications


-Experience in some (or all) of the following:

  • Angular or React, TypeScript, CSS3, HTML5, JavaScript
  • Responsive CSS framework such as Bootstrap
  • Node.js, Webpack, Babel
  • Testing frameworks such as RestAssured, WireMock, Mockito
  • CI/CD pipelines, e.g., Jenkins, Azure Pipelines


As a member of our team, we expect that:


-You write code which is readable and performant

-You deliver code that is well-tested and well-documented

-You have analytical and problem-solving skills

-Υou have a positive mindset and are motivated by challenging projects

-You have good communication skills in Greek and English

-You have a legal permit to work in Greece & fulfilled military obligations (if required)


Benefits

-Competitive salary and benefits package based on experience

-Flexible working hours and remote working option

-Complimentary private health insurance

-Corporate laptop

-Corporate phone

-Development opportunities through technical training, certifications, attendance to conferences, meetups etc.

-Potential for career growth within the company and the ability to follow your career aspiration

-Teamwork and collaboration centered working environment that offers challenging goals, autonomy and mentoring

Title: Senior System Analyst

Job Description:
About the job

JOBID: SAN-050523

Golden A/S (Συστήματα Ισχύος Α.Τ.Ε.Ε.), a marine automation company is currently seeking to recruit a System Analyst with strong SCADA Engineering background with keen sense of punctuality, presentation and details. The System Analyst will be joining our IT team and manage all the process from system segmentation, system development planning, system development process monitoring, system testing planning, SCADA project System co-ordination. Industry sector is Marine / Yachting. Projects in Greece and Italy.


Responsibilities for Systems Analyst

  • Develop, analyze, prioritize, and organize requirement specifications, data mapping, diagrams, and flowcharts for developers and testers to follow

  • Define and coordinate the execution of testing procedures, and develop test cases to serve the overall quality assurance process
  • Provide documentation of all processes and training as needed
  • Develop and implement maintenance procedures, monitor systems health, gather system statistics, and troubleshoot reported errors and alarms
  • Perform design, implementation, and upgrades of information systems to meet the business and user needs
  • Implement best practices for scalability, supportability, ease of maintenance, and system performance

Qualifications for Systems Analyst

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or information technology, or equivalent experience
  • 4-6 years experience working with information technologies and systems analysis
  • Strong computer, hardware, software, and analytical skills
  • Proven ability to assess business needs and translate them into relevant solutions
  • Strong understanding and knowledge of the principles and practices associated with database maintenance and administration
  • Experience installing, configuring, documenting, testing, training, and implementing new applications and systems
  • Working knowledge of a wide variety of programming languages
  • Excellent analytical skills


General:

  • Ability to work well under pressure
  • Demonstrate ability to handle work professionally, independently and efficiently
  • Continuous improvement mindset.
  • Proactive at work.
  • Detailed-oriented


People/Relations:

  • People-oriented personality
  • Good team player with good attitude, integrity, interpersonal, organisation and time management skills
  • Demonstrate Good communication skill with Technical Manager.


Benefits:

  • Medical Insurance
  • Mobile Phone
  • Laptop
  • Productivity Bonus
  • Premium Salary
  • Continuous development opportunities

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Skills: Code Review|Computer Science|Data Architecture|Databases|Object Oriented Design|Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)|Python (Programming Language)|Software|Software Development|Software Development Methodologies|
Job Description:
About the job

We are looking for a software engineer to enhance the development team. You will code, drink coffee, code, search how to code, ask ChatGPT, get some more coffee and code.

WeConnect develops software integration platforms and implements custom software projects. We mainly use Python, C#, RESTful API, React, PostgreSQL but we are open to any new technology.

We need you if working environment is important to you; you like being a part of a high-performing team. You are a software enthusiast and love adopting new technologies. You get bored easily and you learn fast. You speak your mind, and you don’t hesitate to propose changes and take decisions.

Responsibilities

  • As a software engineer, in your everyday life you code. You investigate what is the best approach to a real-life issue. You discuss with the team the possible approaches; you select what seems the best fit and you materialize it.
  • You test what you developed and add comments on the way for documentation purposes.
  • You are involved in technical design of new features.
  • As you get more experienced, you become the owner of specific modules.
  • You like technical stuff, and you are eager to pick up new skills and talents as you go. New technologies fascinate you.
  • Your code will help users execute business processes in an easier and automated way. You are incurious what these processes are, why and how the users will utilize them.


Benefits

  • Work-life balance
  • Work from home, from a café, from the beach, from a mountain top when you feel like it
  • Work in a casual environment where the rest of the team supports you in every step
  • Learn continuously; technical skills, soft skills, you name it
  • Be encouraged to take your time to try new ways, new technologies


Qualifications

  • Passion for software.
  • Attention to detail.
  • A bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or other related field with quantitative focus.
  • At least 2 years experience in any programming language in a similar position.
  • Fluent Greek & English (Written and verbal).


Good to have

  • Familiarity with APIs and Object-Oriented languages.

Title: Mastercard Graduate Launch Program 2022 – (Athens, Greece) Products and Solutions
Skills: Attention to Detail|Communication|Interpersonal Skills|Problem Solving|Professional Skills|Skilled Multi-tasker|Written Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Job Title

Mastercard Graduate Launch Program 2022 – (Athens, Greece) Products and Solutions

We believe that opportunity is for all of us.

This is Mastercard Launch.

Who are Mastercard?

Mastercard is a technology company in the global payments business. We connect consumers, financial institutions, merchants, governments, and businesses worldwide and enable them to use secure and convenient electronic forms of payment. Mastercard is a driving force at the heart of commerce, enabling global transactions and bringing insight into the payments process to make commerce faster, more secure, and more valuable to everyone involved. As a critical link among financial institutions and millions of businesses, cardholders, and merchants worldwide, Mastercard provides services in more than 210 countries and territories. You find more information on www.mastercardworldwide.com.

Mastercard Launch

There are some skills you can teach. And some you can inspire. Mastercard Launch gives recent graduates both—immersing emerging talent in an 18-month journey where they will challenge the status quo, engage in meaningful and practical sessions, drive Decency and Belonging, our mission to be a Force for Good and be the ultimate catalyst for personal and professional growth. The Launch program is for change makers, those who dare to be greater and who wish to make a real impact on the world. We invite you to bring your passion, share your talent and make the most of this truly Priceless experience.

What it is

Launch Will Include Development Opportunities Such As

An 18-month program that educates, inspires personal growth, and builds professional confidence to create a Priceless career with Mastercard.
  • Professional skills learning
  • Business-driven rotations or experiences
  • Networking and career conversations
  • Impactful assignments that drive business results

You will have the opportunity to work with your peers on various business projects which aim to provide enhanced work experience outside of your day-to-day role.

You will work with our dedicated leaders–successful managers and executives across Europe who inspire, mentor, and coach others toward successful careers here at Mastercard.

What you’ll do

Mastercard has been driving digital transformation to spread new payment solutions. During the last few years, Mastercard supported the creation, launch and implementation of numerous solutions to give the opportunity to its cardholder to use their preferred device to make payments. Mastercard provides solutions based on the latest technologies, such as Biometrics, Artificial Intelligence and Big Data, to its clients and partners for secure, fast, and simple payments.

The Product and Solutions team is responsible for driving core business and innovations by launching new products and payment platforms, adopting new business models, and embracing new networks and building new service revenue streams to underscore Mastercard’s thought and service leadership in digital.

Major Accountabilities
  • Provides support in projects relating to launching new products and

services and new business models
  • Assists in performing analysis on new business opportunities, product

performance and supports agreements for certain designated areas (e.g.

financial & data technology)
  • Collaborates with business units to enable better decision making and

supports the delivery of strategy and performance
  • Watches the market developments and trends and brings new ideas to the

table on how Mastercard can differentiate, grow and innovate its product

universe

What you’ll need
  • To available to start from 4th September 2023
  • A final year Bachelors degree student, due to graduate between Dec-2022

to August 2023, with a minimum predicted classification of a UK 2.1 or

equivalent GPA of 3.0
  • Well-rounded individual with significant extracurricular involvement
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong strategic and conceptual aptitude
  • Proven team player with excellent interpersonal skills
  • Attention to detail and possessing the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced,

deadline-driven environment
  • Advanced Word, Excel, and PowerPoint skills
  • Languages: English and Greek to a professional standard

Corporate Security Responsibility

 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must
  • Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
  • Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
  • Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
  • Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Title: Bar Supervisor
Skills: Design|Garden|
Job Description:
About the job

Τα ξενοδοχεία COLORS, έχοντας ήδη παρουσία σε Θεσσαλονίκη και Αθήνα, προσφέρουν μία μοναδική εμπειρία σε όλους τους πελάτες τους, συνδυάζοντας σύγχρονο design και εξαιρετική φιλοξενία με προσωποποιημένη εξυπηρέτηση.


Στην Θεσσαλονίκη, το Garden Bar που λειτουργούμε έχει γνωρίσει μεγάλη επιτυχία και αποτελεί πλέον σημείο αναφοράς σαν ένα από τα καλύτερα Casual εστιατόρια της πόλης.Το μενού μας είναι brunch και στην συνέχεια μετατρέπεται σε ένα all-day Wine and Cocktails Restaurant.


Η θέση που προσφέρουμε είναι για full-time εργασία, 12 μήνες στην Αθήνα. Προσοχή: η θέση είναι Working Manager position.


Πέρα από την μοναδική κουλτούρα των COLORS, οι εργαζόμενοι μας απολαμβάνουν:


  • Ξεκάθαρο περιβάλλον ανάπτυξης και καθοδήγησης
  • Συνεργασία με κορυφαίους managers και directors
  • Σταθερό περιβάλλον με ασφάλεια και μεγάλο χώρο για πρωτοβουλίες
  • Σταθερότητα σε πληρωμές και παροχές
  • Ευκαιρία για προσωπική ανάπτυξη εντός ενός αναγνωρισμένου ομίλου.
  • Εξαιρετικό κλίμα ομάδας
  • Σταθερή καθοδήγηση και εκπαίδευση


Τα ζητούμενα


• Αποδεδειγμένη εμπειρία στην ίδια θέση

• Υπεύθυνος/η για την ομαλή λειτουργία του bar

• Άριστη γνώση των classic cocktails, και δυνατότητα παρασκευής signature cocktails

• Καλή διαχείριση των αποθεμάτων

• Επικοινωνία με τους πελάτες / κάλυψη εξατομικευμένων αναγκών

• Διαχείριση παραπόνων και άμεση εξάλειψή τους

• Προσαρμοστικότητα, απόδοση υπό συνθήκες πίεσης

• Επαγγελματισμός, υπευθυνότητα

• Κριτική σκέψη και ικανότητα επίλυσης προβλημάτων

• Ηγετικές ικανότητες και πνεύμα ομαδικότητας

Title: Senior Software Consultant

Job Description:
About the job

We are Entersoft Group of companies, a leading business software and services provider in South East Europe and the Middle East offering a comprehensive and integrated business software suite with ERP, CRM, Retail, WMS, Mobile, e-Commerce and B.I. applications.


Our mission is to provide constantly innovative and effective full range integrated Enterprise Applications along with high quality services and support our customers to ensure optimized efficiency. With more than 20 years of experience, 4.000 customers and 500 employees, we continuously invest in advanced technologies and professional development of our people to ensure maximum efficiency and long-term collaborations.

  • Have a project leader role: planning, organizing and managing the completion of a project. Provide guidance and coaching to the team members

  • Advanced SQL knowledge
  • Strong interpersonal skills
