Title: Real Estate Sales Consultant
Skills: Commercial Real Estate|Estate Sales|Proptech|Real Estate|Real Estate Sales|Residential Real Estate|Sales|Sales Consulting|
Job Description:
About the job

Ποιοι είμαστε;

Η Prosperty είναι μια PropTech εταιρεία, ήδη διαθέτει 3 γραφεία και δραστηριοποιείται σε 3 χώρες, ενώ έχει αναγνωριστεί ως η μεγαλύτερη τεχνολογική πλατφόρμα ακινήτων στη Νοτιοανατολική Ευρώπη.

Στην Prosperty βελτιώνουμε καθημερινά τις διαδικασίες αγοράς, πώλησης και ενοικίασης ακινήτων με απλό, ανέπαφο και αποτελεσματικό τρόπο χωρίς αβεβαιότητα και άγχος. Μέσω της πλατφόρμας μας, προσφέρουμε μια μοναδική και ταυτόχρονα απλή και αποτελεσματική εμπειρία στους πελάτες μας. Η διαφορά μας με τα παραδοσιακά μεσιτικά γραφεία είναι η τεχνολογία και τα δεδομένα που χρησιμοποιούμε σε συνδυασμό με την επιτυχημένη ολοκλήρωση όλων των διαδικασιών κλεισίματος συμβολαίου, καθώς και η δυνατότητα προώθησης του ακινήτου μέσω στοχευμένων καμπανιών marketing. Οι άνθρωποί μας είναι το επίκεντρο σε ό,τι κάνουμε και η αιτία της ανάπτυξης και της επιτυχίας μας, με απώτερο στόχο την εξυπηρέτηση των πελατών και των αναγκών τους. Με την πρόσφατη πιστοποίηση που λάβαμε ως Great Place to Work, σκοπεύουμε να συνεχίσουμε να επενδύουμε στους ανθρώπους μας και να δημιουργούμε ένα άριστο εργασιακό περιβάλλον με απεριόριστες ευκαιρίες για δια βίου μάθηση και ανάπτυξη.



Για περισσότερες πληροφορίες μπορείς να ανατρέξεις εδώ: https://theprosperty.com/about-us



Ποιον ψάχνουμε;

Αναζητούμε μία/έναν Real Estate Sales Consultant που θα αποτελεί τον σύνδεσμο μεταξύ των αγοραστών και των πωλητών. Οι αρμοδιότητες περιλαμβάνουν την καθοδήγηση αγοραστών και πωλητών και την άριστη εξυπηρέτησή τους.



Με τι θα απασχολείσαι;

● Καθοδήγηση και υποστήριξη όλων των εμπλεκομένων με σκοπό την αγορά, την πώληση ή την ενοικίαση ακινήτων, στη σωστή τιμή και με τους ευνοϊκότερους όρους

● Διερεύνηση και καταγραφή των αναγκών των πελατών και εύρεση των κατάλληλων ακινήτων που πληρούν τα κριτήριά τους

● Συμβουλευτικές υπηρεσίες προς τους ιδιοκτήτες για τη βέλτιστη προώθηση των ακινήτων τους

● Εκτίμηση της αξίας των ακινήτων μέσω των δεδομένων και τεχνολογικών εργαλείων της Prosperty

● Παρουσίαση ακινήτων online ή/ και δια ζώσης σε πιθανούς αγοραστές / ενοικιαστές

● Διατήρηση, ενημέρωση και προώθηση των διαθέσιμων ακινήτων

● Συνεργασία με τα υπόλοιπα τμήματα της εταιρείας, με σκοπό την αποτελεσματικότητα και τη σωστή προώθηση των ακινήτων

● Προσωπική προώθηση μέσω μέσων κοινωνικής δικτύωσης και δικτύωση στο χώρο της Real Estate αγοράς

● Συνεχής ενημέρωση σχετικά με την αγορά και τις βέλτιστες πρακτικές.



Τι πρέπει να διαθέτεις;

● Ικανότητα πωλήσεων και διαπραγμάτευσης

● Εξοικείωση με τεχνολογικά συστήματα και βάσεις δεδομένων

● Άριστη γνώση αγγλικών (ή/και επιπλέον γλώσσας)

● Ικανότητα βέλτιστης εξυπηρέτησης και δημιουργίας μοναδικής εμπειρίας σε πελάτες

● Εξαιρετικές επικοινωνιακές δεξιότητες

● Ικανότητα επίλυσης προβλημάτων

● Ικανότητα αυτόνομης εργασίας, χωρίς ανάγκη για επίβλεψη

● Προσοχή στη λεπτομέρεια

● Οργανωτικές δεξιότητες

● Συνέπεια, αξιοπιστία και υπευθυνότητα

● Ομαδικότητα



Τι προσφέρουμε;

● Πρόσβαση σε έτοιμο χαρτοφυλάκιο της Prosperty για άμεσες πωλήσεις

● Πρόσβαση σε αποκλειστικό δίκτυο ζητήσεων αγοραστών

● Πρόσβαση σε state-of-the-art τεχνολογικά συστήματα και δεδομένα αγοράς

● Συνεχή εκπαίδευση

● Υποστήριξη για την ενίσχυση του προσωπικού ψηφιακού προφίλ στα μέσα κοινωνικής δικτύωσης

● Πρόσβαση σε ξεχωριστά benefits ανάλογα το επίπεδο σου

● Ένα μοντέρνο και σύγχρονο περιβάλλον εργασίας, πιστοποιημένο ως “Great Place to Work” έπειτα από επίσημη αξιολόγηση

● Διαρκή ανάπτυξη και ευκαιρίες ανέλιξης



Μια εξαιρετική ευκαιρία για να γίνεις μέλος μιας καινοτόμου εταιρείας που επενδύει διαρκώς στην ανάπτυξη των εργαζομένων της!

Title: Network Engineer
Skills: Asterisk (PBX)|Compensation|Computer Science|Digium|Employee Benefits|Events|FreePBX|Network Systems|Topology|Voice over IP (VoIP)|
Job Description:
About the job

About the job


UTELIT vision is to attract the most talented people in our industry and to support and develop them not only to fulfill their role description but also to go beyond expectations!

To meet our current corporate needs, we would like to bring to our team another VoIP & Network systems Engineer, based in Pallini, Attica.

More specifically you will:


Cooperate with other team members:

  • Participate in the presales process in collaboration with other departments/ team members
  • Work with other Engineers to plan, design and improve business services
  • Collaborate with colleagues in technical related issues while running your own tech projects.


Lead Projects:

  • Create/Revise project documentation
  • Lead project/solution implementation
  • Perform project/ solution implementation tasks
  • Ensure that the project's time frames are met
  • Conduct client meetings for requirements gathering and/or consultancy on new technologies and solutions


Provide Technical Support:

  • Perform upgrade and/or other related tasks on clients’ VoIP & Network infrastructure
  • Provide support and troubleshooting in existing VoIP & Network infrastructure.
  • Provide Level 1 & 2 support and troubleshooting to resolve VoIP or Network outages for the remote sites, resolve operational issues and restore services.
  • Provide expert level root cause analysis for issue troubleshooting.
  • Determine bottlenecks, enhance automation of repetitive tasks
  • Monitor and maintain all VoIP & Network related equipment in all sites and respond to alerts and outages
  • Conduct fault investigation in lab environment

Implement, configure, monitor and optimize clients VoIP & Network infrastructure

  • Work within established configuration and change management policies and tools
  • Maximize VoIP & Network systems performance by monitoring performance, troubleshooting VoIP & Network problems and outages, scheduling upgrades and collaborating with VoIP & Network architects on systems optimization
  • Select and implement security solutions, policies, and procedures in conjunction with the company’s security team
  • Upgrade VoIP & Data equipment to the latest stable firmware releases
  • Setup the configuration of routing, switching and load balancing devices as well as Voice Gateways, PBXs, Endpoint devices.


Follow Education Plan:

  • Gain technical specialization on specific products/technologies/solutions
  • Participate in events for further education/development


Survey on Clients’ Network Infrastructure

  • Design the VoIP & Network systems for customers premises, following security practices and standards, aiming for reliability, security, easy troubleshooting, maintainability
  • Provide reviews for client's topology drawings and design concepts.


Other responsibilities

  • Draft and maintain service documentation and processes
  • Liaise with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution
  • Implement and coordinate housekeeping
  • Update network documents
  • Update network designs


Requirements:

  • University or College Degree in Network Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Digital Systems or relevant technology-related field
  • 3 years of VoIP and/or Network Engineer experience
  • Hands-on experience with Networking technologies (Cisco, Fortinet, Ruckus, Huawei, Mikrotik, Checkpoint preferred) as well as monitoring, network diagnostic and network analytics tools.
  • Hands-on Experience with VoIP technologies monitoring, problems diagnosis & troubleshooting, Linux OS, Server systems (IBM, HP, DELL etc)
  • Hands-on Experience with configuring SIP Phones (Yealink, Grandstream preferred)
  • Hands-on experience with Enterprise Wireless Solutions (Ruckus, Cisco, Meraki, Aruba, Fortinet, Mikrotik, Ubiquity)
  • You are fluent in English language (both oral and written skills)
  • As a person, you are a fast learner, agile and quick to grasp new concepts and software products
  • Genuine interest in exploring and working with new technologies
  • Have patience and good communication skills, ability to own a project and communicate directly with clients in greek & english to complete project commissioning
  • Ability to work both independently and within multi-discipline teams … in our Company, we work, above everything else, as a TEAM. You are an excellent team player (and able to work independently as well when time comes!)
  • Communication/ Presentation skills and customer focused attitude
  • Availability to travel abroad


Nice to Have

  • Experience with Load Balancing/ Application Delivery (Fortinet ADCs, etc.)
  • Network & Security Certifications (Cisco CCNA, CCNP preferred, Fortinet NS1,2,3, NSE4 preferred, Ruckus, Huawei, Mikrotik MTCNA-MTCRE preferred).
  • VoIP systems Certifications (Sangoma, Red Hat, Digium, Loway, Asterisk®, Kamailio (SER), FreePBX preferred)
  • Basic understanding of virtualization (eg. VMware)
  • Hands-on experience with Programming/Scripting (Python etc)
  • Operational level understanding of Layer 7 inspection and filtering along with various routing technologies, and understanding of Linux OS.
  • Drivers License (Car preferred)

Thus, we provide:

  • ﻿A competitive compensation package combined with additional benefits according to professional experience (i.e Ticket restaurant vouchers, Laptop and Corporate mobile subscription, Trainings and certifications, Private health insurance plan, leased car etc)
  • An extensive training program upon induction and throughout employment
  • Educational expenses for courses, certifications, and books
  • Exceptional opportunities to learn and develop in a competitive environment
  • Prospects for professional growth

Title: Project Manager
Skills: Budgeting|Business Acumen|Business Development|Financial Analysis|HORECA|Management|Project Implementation|Project Management|Project Planning|Time Management|
Job Description:
About the job

We are currently looking for a Project Manager who will be responsible for a variety of projects related to the HORECA market. The job holder will report directly to the CEO.

Main responsibilities:

  • Run & implement special projects assigned by the CEO, regarding business development & new business opportunities in the HORECA Market
  • Gather, analyze and evaluate info & data to assess risk and impact of various projects & new business development opportunities.
  • Design and propose the best possible project plan given constraints of time, resources and cost for the assigned projects, in order to fully ensure the covering of all aspects (People, Organization, Processes, Technology and Facilities).
  • Administer overall team activities to implement the projects in a compliant and reliable manner. This includes development of clear project objectives, managing & tracking timelines & critical milestones, establishing contingency & acceleration plans, facilitating team decisions and issue resolution, risk management and coordinating team meetings and minutes
  • Act as a consultant coach and advisor for employees within the assigned aspect area and actively intervene when necessary, in order to better facilitate the project’s progress.
  • Participate in meetings, alongside the CEO, with various internal & external partners/associates & follow up on actions agreed.

Candidate Profile:

  • University Degree in Finance, Economics, Business or Engineering
  • Master’s Degree in Business would be considered an asset.
  • Previous Experience in Project Management managing and working with cross-functional project teams
  • Ability to multitask, participate in different projects at the same time.
  • Very good knowledge of Microsoft Office and Asana
  • Excellent oral and written knowledge of English language. Knowledge of other languages will be considered as a plus
  • Strong coordination and planning skills
  • Proactive way of acting
  • Excellent communication skills and interpersonal abilities, including negotiation skills
  • Deep understanding of Business Strategy, business dynamics and commercial value drivers (Business Acumen/ Commercial thinking)
  • Experience in financial analysis and demonstrated understanding of financial statements, forecasting & budgeting
  • Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions
  • Critical thinking
  • Results/Goal Oriented and customer focus way of working

Remuneration Package:

  • Competitive salary
  • Bonus
  • Company Car
  • Medical insurance
  • Work in a financially healthy and growing company

Title: Network Project Manager
Skills: Activity Planning|Business Requirements|Communication|Communications Management|Information and Communications Technology (ICT)|Key Performance Indicators|Network Strategy|Project Plans|Stakeholder Management|Telecommunications|
Job Description:
About the job

Role purpose:
Network Project Manager is responsible for leading network programs or projects of particular complexity and business importance for Vodafone Greece. He/She must be able to negotiate with Network Strategy & Engineering management and Vodafone Greece Business & IT stakeholders, product scope details and delivery timelines, setup corresponding Project structures, coordinate stream leaders and ensure delivery according to requirements following approved budget, time and agreed quality KPIs.


He/She manages, exposed to C-band senior stakeholders program & project management activities such as requirements gathering, scope definition, activities time planning, team staffing, cost controlling, risk management, stakeholder and communication management.

Key accountabilities and decision ownership:
  • Manages the full lifecycle of Network programs and projects: feasibility study, development, testing, acceptance and implementation of network platforms, in all Network technology areas (Mobile&Fixed Access, Voice&Data Core, Services, Transmission & Transport, Digital & OSS)
  • Interfaces and collaborates with Network Strategy & Engineering Market Delivery Manager for Greece, vertical Managers and Network domain experts allocated for aforementioned Projects, as well as VF Greece Business stakeholders
  • Apply Feasibility Assessment & Delivery Management Network Strategy & Engineering processes
  • Defines the project plan in agreement with all parties involved including the external stakeholders. Defines the detailed project activities and monitors/tracks them permanently
  • Builds the projects organizational model and makes sure that resources are available at all times, so that project deliverables are not affected (no business impact)
  • Responsible for the information flow/ communication within the team and with the main stakeholders, internal and external to Network Strategy & Engineering (stage gate approval, complete technical solution sharing and associated costs)
  • Performs risk management and change management as part of the project activities to make the business requirements of the external customers are met, including costs, timelines and agreed quality KPIs
  • Permanently tracks projects’ evolution and timely reports project status to VF Greece Market Delivery Manager & related stakeholders
  • Implement solid program & project management principles and related PM tools across the organization. Support NSE depts., with processes and tools, in managing the projects they run inside their units

Key Deliverables:
  • Project plans, on time delivery within approved budget for all programs & projects, with impact in VF Greece network elements
  • Other project management documents: project charter, activity planning, resource planning, status report, budget report, risks & issues log
  • Timely accurate reporting of all projects; prevent roadblocks by early identifying and raising issues to the VF GR Market Delivery Manager

Core competencies and experience:
  • Excellent communication skills – ability to report on an executive level
  • Ability to lead complex programs , coordinate project managers, work within virtual teams and interface with multi-national domain experts
  • Strong results oriented and customer focused mentality
  • Process, program & project management
  • Good knowledge of the overall network architecture (all domains)
  • Strong stakeholder management
  • At least 3-years of experience in managing Network Projects, preferably cross departmental

Must have technical and professional qualifications:
  • University degree


(preferable: computer science, telecommunications or equivalent)


  • Good awareness of wider technology aspects in telecommunications and ICT
  • Project Management certifications (Waterfall, Agile/SAFe)
  • Inter-functional relationships between network elements
  • Financial acumen

What's in it for you:
  •   Competitive pay, bonus & remuneration package
  • Private Health & Medical Insurance
  • Hybrid way of working: a blend of remote and office-based working, including the option to work up to 20 days from abroad
  •   Remote work equipment to help you create a comfortable, ergonomic workspace at home 
  •   Unlimited access to learning resources and trainings
  •   Vodafone Parental Leave: 16 weeks of fully paid parental leave to all employees regardless of gender, sexual orientation or length of service
  •   Spirit of Vodafone Day: one day each quarter dedicated to your personal development
  •   Extra days off: Vodafone Day, Family Day, Volunteering Day 
  •   Needless to say, we cater for your communication wherever you are
  • Office amenities (subject to the office location): such as restaurant, beauty corner, gym and parking
  • Special employee offers and discounts


#Vodafonespirit #Togetherwecan

Title: Software Developer & Custom Engineering Consultant
Skills: Agile Development|Computer Science|FinTech|Full-Stack Development|JavaScript|Microsoft SQL Server|Portfolio Management|Product Certification|Risk Management Software|Software Development|
Job Description:
About the job

Finvent, since 2001, a successful regional provider of award-winning software and services for the investment management industry and the exclusive distributor and professional services partner of SS&C Advent Software.

Our clients span across 15+ countries and include asset managers, wealth managers, Pension Funds, hedge funds, family offices, fund managers, and fund administrators. Our solutions streamline their processes for portfolio management, trading, and order management, risk management & compliance, portfolio accounting, fund distribution, remote client services, performance analytics, reporting, and more.

Description

We are seeking a talented and service-minded person to join our team as a Software Develop & Custom Engineering Consultant, Investment & Risk Management Software Unit.

In this role, you will help our clients across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa by implementing and advising on technology solutions to streamline their processes, for increased efficiencies and reduced operational risk.

This is a unique opportunity to blend strong development expertise with financial industry knowledge & skills, in a vibrant, international work environment. You get to tap into the knowledge of leading financial institutions as well as our experienced team, to learn and develop skills that will ultimately help you progress your career, and grow a solid network within the fintech industry.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and test software along with the rest of the agile team while ensuring stakeholders remain satisfied with the results.
  • Ensure that the team remains laser-focused on delivering value to the market and not just code.

Ø Experience with SQL Server Reporting Services is a plus.

Ø Relevant University Degree Education in computer science or another relevant technical degree

Ø Highly positive if knowledgeable with JavaScript/UI frameworks and full-stack development skills.

Ø Familiarity with agile development methodologies and familiar with test-driven development.

Ø Very good communication skills in English and Greek is required. Communication skills in additional European languages skills are very desirable.

Ø Knowledge of the financial industry and fintech is a plus but not required

Benefits

On top of challenging work and a competitive salary, we are offering:

• Competitive salary and bonus payment plans

• International product certification and continuous training programs

• International travel and global professional experience as well as working flexibility

• Become part of a mission-driven team that constantly learns and improves

Title: Scrum Master
Skills: Analytical Skills|Backlog Management|Employee Benefits|English|Kanban|Lean Processes|Problem Solving|Scrum|Servant Leadership|Team Leadership|
Job Description:
About the job

As a Scrum Master/Delivery Lead, you will be responsible for overall day to day management of the project team in terms of resources, tasks, workflow, deliverables, weekly burn, team member support, progress & reporting.


What will you be doing?


  • Enable multiple talented cross-functional teams to high perform and deliver quality, mission critical solutions to local and international Clients.
  • Create an environment where delivery teams are highly aligned and autonomous. Focus is given on the continuous improvement of our delivery processes ensuring that teams work collectively together to achieve their common goals, deliver quality outputs within budgets and timeframes that meet our Clients’ and stakeholders’ expectations.
  • Work closely with key roles such as upper Management, Heads of Engineering, Tech Leads and Project Managers to ensure clarity and excellence while removing the team’s impediments.
  • Facilitate delivery framework events/meetings, workshops required to create alignment and clarity. Run & Facilitate Daily Scrum, Sprint Backlog Refinement & Planning, Sprint Review & Demos.
  • Encourage Team Retrospectives and surface change initiatives, creating an ecosystem of continuous improvement loops across the organization.
  • Produce team agile metrics & reports and continuously introduce agile practices to enable better work planning, work estimation, work breakdown and reporting.
  • Engage in client-facing Agile delivery projects with the Client’s Product Owners and Technical stakeholders.
  • International travel and working at Client locations may be required.


Who are we looking for?


  • Passionate & talented individuals with previous experience of working with teams using an agile delivery framework or methods, fundamentally with Scrum. Experience in larger scale frameworks like LeSS, SAFe would also be appreciated, as well as, on other lean methods like Kanban, XP, or any combination of the above.
  • Self-motivated individuals with strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. Ones who have the mindset to innovate and the ability to prioritize tasks & meet challenging schedules at a top-notch quality level and always focused on our Clients’ needs & absolute benefit.
  • Professionals who demonstrate servant leadership traits such as listening, empathy, awareness, foresight, etc., with willingness to be a role model for the team and act from a responsibility state.
  • Team players who will ensure effective coordination, establish feedback loops, and enable overall orchestration among various teams, stakeholders, and Clients.


What do your qualification look like?


  • University degree in Computer Science or Business studies.
  • 1 – 3 years of related prior experience in a similar role (Team Leader, Service Delivery Manager, Scrum Master and/or Product Owner).
  • English language, at least C1 Cambridge level.
  • Prior experience in digital banking software or FinTech will be considered a plus.
  • Having worked in an international environment across multiple cultures, is desired.


What do we offer?


  • Competitive compensation & benefits package, including Group Medical & Life insurance.
  • Career Development opportunities through challenging international projects, promotions, progressions.
  • A team oriented working atmosphere in our modern and functional facilities which make everyday life at the office truly enjoyable. Our offices are in the southern Attica suburbs with a convenient location for both those who use public transportation (bus & tram) and travel with their own vehicle.
  • Flexible / Hybrid working model.
  • Regular social / fun / athletic events.
  • Opportunities to support our local community through ‘giving-back’ (CSR) initiatives.


Our Selection Process


Once you apply, your application will be reviewed by our recruitment team. If you’ve got the skills and the experience we are looking for, you will be invited to have an initial conversation with our Talent Acquisition team, where you’ll get to find out more about our company & the opportunity, while we can learn more about you.


If things go well, you can expect 2 – 3 interviews with the hiring team, after which a decision will be made.


If we are both successful in identifying a ‘match’ between us, and you accept our offer, our People & Culture team will help you through our onboarding process.


_________________________


Advantage FSE is an equal opportunity employer. Our company does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, pregnancy, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital, or any other legally protected status, while we make reasonable accommodations for disabled employees. Finally, we strictly prohibit the harassment of any individual based on their protected status. This policy applies to all areas of human resources related actions including recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits, transfer, and social & recreational programs.

Title: Project Manager (French Speaker)
Skills: Attention to Detail|Contingency Planning|English|French|Manage Complex Projects|PRINCE2|Presentations|Problem Solving|Project Coordination|Written Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

With more than 20 years of proven experience, QUALCO is a leading Fintech solutions provider, offering a wide range of analytics-driven, highly scalable enterprise software solutions in over 35 countries worldwide. Our end-to-end technology solutions cover a wide range of needs for Banking, Financial Services, Utilities, Insurance, Retail organisations, and beyond.



We are looking for an experienced Project Manager to join our Project Management team in Athens. The successful candidate will take on the management of key clients' projects with the goal of delivering every project on time, within budget and within scope, while building positive long-term relationships with our clients.

Responsibilities

  • Manage complex projects and coordinate project teams, to deliver and ensure quality throughout the project;
  • Define scope and expected deliverables, align stakeholders and influence decision processes, determine success metrics, and track against milestones;
  • Manage changes to the project scope, schedule, and costs;
  • Monitor risks proactively, drive prioritization, balance business needs versus constraints. and take mitigation actions and contingency planning; and
  • Develop effective presentations and project update materials to communicate project status to key stakeholders (C level & Technical resources).


Requirements

  • A very good educational background, preferably in the fields of computer science or engineering;
  • 5+ years of experience in a Project Management role in software application projects, preferably in the Banking, or Finance sectors;
  • PMP or Prince II certification;
  • Excellent client facing, analytical and problem solving skills;
  • Solid organizational skills, attention to detail and multi-tasking skills;
  • Excellent teamwork skills to coordinate virtual teams;
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines while being flexible and responding to change;
  • Firm command of the French & English language and excellent verbal and written communication skills.


Benefits

On top of a challenging work environment, we are offering:

💸 Competitive compensation, ticket restaurant card, and annual bonus programs

💻 Cutting-edge IT equipment, mobile, and data plan

🏢 Modern facilities, free coffee and beverages, and indoor parking

👨‍⚕ Private health insurance, onsite occupational doctor, and workplace counselor

🏝️ Flexible working model

🤸‍♂️ Onsite gym, wellness facilities, and ping pong room

💡 Career and talent development tools

🎓 Mentoring, coaching, personalized annual learning and development plan

🌱 Employee referral bonus, regular wellbeing, ESG, and volunteering activities

Your race, gender identity, expression, age ethnicity, or disability make no difference in Qualco Group. We want to attract, develop, promote, and retain the best people based on their abilities and behavior.

Disclaimer: Qualco Group collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties. We will keep your resume in our database for any future consideration. In case you want to be deleted from our database, please contact us.

Title: Project Manager
Location: Xánthi, Eastern Macedonia and Thrace, Greece
Skills: Attention to Detail|Communication|Compensation|Computer Literacy|English|Entrepreneurship|Leadership|Organization Skills|Project Management|Technical Project Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Sunlight Group Energy Storage Systems is a world-leading technology company and provider of innovative industrial and off-road energy storage solutions, with 30+ years of experience. We specialize in the development and production of lead-acid and lithium-ion batteries for industrial mobility, leisure mobility, and ESS applications. These products are manufactured and assembled in Sunlight’s state-of-the-art facilities in Greece, Italy, Germany, Israel, and USA, and distributed to more than 115 countries.

Driven by our commitment to inspire our people and unlock their potential, and steadfast in our commitment to Diversity, Equality & Inclusion, we have created an agile and innovative environment that promotes open communication and collaboration, while offering continuous learning and development opportunities to the 3,100+ people we employ across the organization.


Keen to further empower our team by onboarding more talent, we are currently looking for a high caliber Project Manager to join our IPCEI team in Athens or in Xanthi. The project manager will be responsible for managing different projects, ensuring schedule & budget targets are met among other KPIs. The incumbent, based ideally in Xanthi (if based in Athens but should be available to spend 50% of his/her time in Xanthi) will have to manage internal & external stakeholders and communicate effectively issues and risks in a timely manner This is a global role in a very demanding manufacturing environment which will open numerous career opportunities to advance further in the battery manufacturing industry, the fastest growing industry in Europe and globally, currently & for the years to come.


Key activities and responsibilities of this role include:

  • Establishes and tracks projects schedule & critical path
  • Ensures that deadlines are followed
  • Creates & maintains project & sub-project budgets
  • Ensures projects are delivered on budget
  • Defines project objectives & project scope
  • Actively manages risk & external dependencies
  • Effectively communicates risks to relevant stakeholders & escalate on a need basis
  • Enforces health and safety protocol
  • Prepares progress reports for senior management
  • Identifies the resources needed for the project
  • Oversees the implementation of project improvements


Job requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering
  • At least 5 years of experience in technical project management in industrial or construction environment
  • Official Project Management certification is considered a plus
  • Excellent leadership abilities
  • Superb interpersonal, communication & organization skills
  • Ability to solve problems under pressure
  • Attention to detail
  • Excellent computer literacy skills
  • Fluency in English & Greek (verbal & written) is a must
  • EU permit and fulfilled military obligations – where applicable


Despite your experience and skills, you never stop learning, cultivating an out-of-the-box thinking, a growth and entrepreneurial mindset, embracing ownership and agility. You are impact-focused, proactive and open to change. Last but not least, you are able to communicate scientific principles and applications both in Greek and English - we are a multicultural team! - you are a real team player who can build strong relationships with various stakeholders and thrive among global talents in a positive work environment.


What we offer you

To start with, we give you the opportunity to thrive in a restless team and grow your potential in an innovative environment. As per your compensation and rewards package, this is a preview:

  • A competitive salary based on experience and topped up with other bonuses.
  • Company healthcare plan
  • Continuous learning opportunities. Allocated training budget that can be spent on books, online courses or other training materials.
  • Established framework for career development
  • International mobility opportunities

Title: Scrum Master
Skills: Agile Project Management|Agile Software Development|Backlog Management|Coaching & Mentoring|Communication|Facilitation|Kanban|Persuasive Speaking|Problem Solving|Retrospectives|
Job Description:
About the job

Role purpose:
Digital is changing our world faster than ever before, and our customers expect and deserve a great experience every time they deal with us, which is why we are adopting agile ways of working to become a truly customer centric Digital Telco company. The Scrum Master is responsible to lead the transformation by enabling teams adopting agile practices throughout the product development lifecycle.

Key accountabilities and decision ownership:
  • Coach and mentor individuals and teams on Agile methods and practices (e.g Scrum, Kanban)
  • Facilitate team ceremonies such as daily scrums, reviews, planning and retrospectives to ensure the full team engagement
  • Lead team’s continuous improvement efforts through retrospectives and experimentation
  • Coordinate with other delivery teams, stakeholders, and partners to manage risks, interdependencies, and impediments
  • Partner with the Product Owner in ensuring backlog management best practices are being applied (e.g INVEST principles, aligning priorities)
  • Increase teams’ transparency through the proper use of artifacts (e.g. backlog) and information radiators (e.g. team metrics)
  • Foster psychological safety within teams to align with the organizational culture
  • Create an environment where teams feel empowered, motivated to deliver innovative outcomes by adopting self-management practices
  • Act as an organizational enabler in the adoption of agile practices within the organization

Functional Skills, Credentials And Experience
  • Master’s or Bachelor’s Degree in Technology, Business or other related field
  • Experience in agile software development environment and methods preferred
  • Project management practices know-how will be a plus
  • JIRA/Confluence or equivalent experience preferred
  • Maintaining a good balance between business and technical savviness
  • Having worked in complex and scaled multinational organization strongly preferred

Behaviours and Other competencies:
  • Natural “servant” leader, with strong ability to coach and develop others
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills with the ability to inspire, influence and update delivery teams & senior executives
  • Excellent facilitation, organization, and problem- solving skills
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to convey information to others in a simple and clear way, being an empathic listener as well as persuasive speaker
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and working in fluid, fast changing environment

What's in it for you:
  •   Competitive pay, bonus & remuneration package
  • Private Health & Medical Insurance
  • Hybrid way of working: a blend of remote and office-based working, including the option to work up to 20 days from abroad
  •   Remote work equipment to help you create a comfortable, ergonomic workspace at home
  •   Unlimited access to learning resources and trainings
  •   Vodafone Parental Leave: 16 weeks of fully paid parental leave to all employees regardless of gender, sexual orientation or length of service
  •   Spirit of Vodafone Day: one day each quarter dedicated to your personal development
  •   Extra days off: Vodafone Day, Family Day, Volunteering Day
  •   Needless to say, we cater for your communication wherever you are
  • Office amenities (subject to the office location): such as restaurant, beauty corner, gym and parking
  • Special employee offers and discounts


#Vodafonespirit #Togetherwecan

Title: Sales Account Coordinator
Skills: Account Management|Education|English as a Second Language (ESL)|Information Technology|International Markets|Key Accounts|Marketing|Sales|Sales & Marketing|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description Summary

MM Educational Group is seeking a Sales Account Coordinator to join our International Sales team. As a Sales Account Coordinator, you will play a key role in maintaining strong relationships with our clients, ensuring their needs are met and exceeded. You will be responsible for managing the day-to-day operations of our accounts, including coordinating client requests, and monitoring project timelines. The ideal candidate will also be able to gain an in-depth understanding of the needs of the market and present our educational solutions to potential partners.

About MM Educational Group

MM Educational Group is an international content creator that delivers complete educational solutions. It consists of nine distinct companies that collectively develop content and provide educational materials and services in four subject areas: English Language Teaching (ELT), Computing - ICT, Maths, and Science. MM Educational Group is committed to spreading knowledge, a mission which it continuously pursues through the provision of localized educational solutions with global standards.


Key Responsibilities

· Manage key accounts.

· Pursue prospective international markets to expand.

· Implement the company’s marketing strategy in each country of responsibility.

· Act as brand ambassador, representing MM Educational Group in various international and local trade fairs.

· Establish active communication and engagement with other departments to ensure that orders and other requests are processed promptly.

Required skills and qualifications.

· Bachelor’s degree in finance/sales/marketing or relevant field

· Ideally 1-2 years of relevant work experience in an organized Sales and/or Marketing department

· Excellent knowledge of English language (verbal and written). Other foreign languages will be considered as a plus.

· Computer skills and general computer literacy are required.

· Experience in the field of education or publishing will be considered as a plus.

· Excellent multi-tasking and organizational skills are required.

· Availability to travel on a frequent basis.

· Other skills to be considered as a plus: time-management, communication, and presentation skills.

Benefits

· Competitive remuneration package

· Laptop and mobile phone

· Opportunities to grow beyond the current role.

Title: Senior Project Manager
Skills: Construction Management|Contract Negotiation|Energy Industry|Engineering|Offshore Wind|Project Management|Project Managers|Project Portfolio Management|Substation|Wind Energy|
Job Description:
About the job

Paralos Energy, a well-established energy projects construction company is seeking to recruit a Senior Project Manager with a previous experience in construction management energy projects. The Senior Project Manager will be joining our projects team to plan and oversee a wide variety of energy projects from beginning to end including but not limited to: High Voltage Substations, Wind Farms and HV/MV Transmission lines, in the Greek area as well as abroad.

Responsibilities

  • You oversee a team of project managers, handling a project portfolio from beginning to end
  • You are responsible for maintaining key communication with the customers and all corresponding authorities
  • You participate in contractual negotiations, manage the budget and estimate costs
  • You ensure the availability of necessary equipment, materials, and manpower needed according to time schedule
  • You support the team of project managers, by collaborating with subcontractors, engineers, and key team members of the project team
  • You follow up the procedure for the appropriate permits and licenses from authorities for construction sites
  • You ensure all deadlines are met

Qualifications

  • You hold a University Degree in Engineering or Business sector.
  • You have at least 10-year experience in a similar role. Experience in a construction company related to energy sector will be considered as a plus
  • You have very good knowledge of Microsoft Office and Microsoft Project
  • You are fluent in English. Knowledge of other languages will be considered as a plus
  • You are highly organized and have a team working and problem-solving attitude
  • You have a previous experience in a leadership role with strong and proven leadership skills
  • You are able to multitask with a strong understanding of core manager duties
  • You have excellent communication skills and interpersonal abilities, including negotiation skills

What we Offer

  • Interesting and diversified opportunities in the fast-growing energy sector
  • Interdisciplinary teamwork in a successful and dynamic company
  • Friendly working atmosphere

Title: IT Support Analyst
Skills: Application Support|Audio Conferencing|Communication|Desktop Computers|On Site|Problem Management|Program Control|Service Levels|Service-Level Agreements (SLA)|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

The opportunity


Project: Mace and Jacobs have partnered to form a consortium that is leading all real estate and construction delivery related PMC and Programme Management services for the Ellinikon development.


In its role as Lamda’s real estate delivery partners on this programme, Mace/Jacobs JV are providing consultancy from programme/PMC as well as cost and commercial management, to design and construction management.


The IT Support Analyst will be responsible for the co-ordination of the differing information streams through Ellinikon project delivery lifecycle. This role will support the delivery function of the project and the Head of Reporting at programme level. It will be fundamental to understand and report clear programme controls information and have excellent communication skills. This role will require close interface between the admin functions of the consultants and contractor and other relevant stakeholders by supporting the project leadership with clear and transparent data.


Your Responsibilities Will Include


  • Logging and updating all technology enquiries that reach you (by phone, email, IM, or in person etc) in the central ticketing system. Ensure that tickets are updated daily, unless there is an agreement evidenced for them to be on hold for a specific time.
  • Providing technical desktop and application support to staff in person on site, or to remote workers as required.
  • Undertaking technical troubleshooting and research issues with the relevant manufacturers or vendors as required.
  • Escalating tickets that require help from other resolvers in order to deliver best practice customer service (ITIL) or to achieve Service Levels of Agreement (SLA).
  • Being involved in both reactive and problem management of customer Technology issues in line with best practices. Contribute to Problem Record documents and conference calls as required.
  • Taking ownership of work required on site to create and support processes.
  • Maintaining a regular connectivity with the IT Support teams of both the JV partner related to planned as well as ad-hoc IT related issues.
  • Supporting and liaising with Lamda’s Service Management team in setting up and or trouble shooting MS Teams/Virtual Conferencing issues.


About You


You have a degree or equivalent suitable qualification along with professional experience with project or programme management. You are digitally savvy, can build lasting client relationships and lead strong, motivated teams. You will have a construction or project management background and be hungry to grow your career and enjoy the opportunities Mace has to offer.

Title: IT Project Management Associate
Skills: Communication|Computer Science|Product Demonstration|Project Evaluation|Project Implementation|Project Plans|Project Risk|Requirements Analysis|Risk Assessment|Stakeholder Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description & Summary

The opportunity

A career within Technology Consulting services will provide you with the opportunity to help organisations develop strategies that transform their technology capabilities and solve their most critical challenges. We are one of the leading providers of Technology Consulting services in Greece, assisting organisations to get value from technology investments and bring together the skills to deliver improvements in people, processes, and technology.

Due to the continued growth of our practice and consistently high demand for technology consulting services, we are now recruiting an IT Project Management Associate in our Technology Consulting team in Athens.

We are looking for highly motivated and talented individuals who have a commitment to excellence in client service and are passionate about how technology could be an enabler in our digital world.

The role entails
  • Develop project management plan
  • Elaborate project scope and objectives, and deliver tasks prioritization
  • Contribute to project risk assessments and development of mitigation plans
  • Contribute to project external and internal stakeholders management
  • Contribute to project requirements analysis phase
  • Utilize industry best practices, techniques, and standards throughout entire project execution
  • Monitor project progress and propose adjustments as needed
  • Report and escalate issues when necessary
  • Contribute to delivery of presentations and demonstrations
  • Contribute to post-project evaluation

What We Are Looking For
  • University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration or other relevant fields

  • Organisational skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to meet deadlines
  • Technical fluency

What’s In It For You
  • PwC is all about people, encouraging high performance and quality. At PwC, you will have:
  • Continuous training and career development opportunities whilst learning from a wide range of top professionals.
  • The chance to work with the biggest clients in Greece across a number of industries.
  • Access to a global network of firms and global mobility opportunities.
  • Compensation package, life and medical plan, rewards and recognition schemes, flexible working program etc.

Who We Are

PwC in Greece is the largest professional services firm in the country, with premises in Athens, Thessaloniki, Patras & Ioannina and approximately 1900 employees. More than 250,000 people in 156 countries across our network share their thinking, experience and solutions to develop fresh perspectives and practical advice. This enables us to provide top-quality industry-focused assurance, tax and advisory services to our clients.

All applicants will be acknowledged and treated in the strictest confidence.

Title: Sustainable Energy Associate - Greece or Remote
Skills: Communication|Energy Audits|Energy Efficiency|Energy Industry|Energy Management|Environmental Science|Renewable Energy|Sustainable Energy|Techno|Written Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we are collaborating with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world’s most complex challenges.


Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®.


Job Purpose


Support the expansion of Tetra Tech’s presence in Europe and Eurasia by serving its existing projects, act as a hub for additional growth in the region utilizing proven energy sector experience and help power a just energy transition for all.


Job Description


As the Sustainable Energy Associate, Europe, you will have the chance to be part of a newly formed team tasked with managing, sourcing, and executing consulting engagements focused on energy sector projects, initiatives, or policies to drive the energy and climate transition.


Working with other members of our team, you’ll support project implementation, particularly in Europe & Eurasia, with a focus on clean energy, decarbonization, and the alignment of sustainable energy policies with best practices.


During your time with us, you will also have the opportunity to support the implementation of cost-benefit analyses and modeling within projects related to the appraisal of sustainable energy investments and provide guided support to business development activities, with a view to collaborating on new opportunities and approaches for new clients.


If you’re ready for the challenge, we’re looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us power a just energy transition for all.


The location of this position will be in Athens, Greece or remote.


Minimum Qualifications


  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, economics, or environmental sciences.
  • 2 years of experience in the energy sector, preferably with consulting experience, working with a variety of clients.
  • Experience on energy efficiency technologies and relevant techno-economic aspects and through understanding of the respective European related policy and regulatory framework (energy acquis).
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.


Preferred Qualifications


  • Willingness to travel internationally to project locations and conferences
  • Experience working for or collaborating with other international donor funded projects


About Tetra Tech


Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 470 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees—22,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development.


Explore our open positions at https://www.tetratech.com/careers. Follow us on social media to learn more about our people, culture, and opportunities:


LinkedIn: @TetraTechCareers


Twitter: @TetraTechJobs


Facebook: @TetraTechCareers


Tetra Tech is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity, inclusion, and equity are among Tetra Tech’s core values. Throughout our history, the company has prioritized equitable inclusion of all people. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information and any other characteristics protected by the law. We invite resumes from all interested parties. Please visit our website at www.tetratech.com to see the array of diverse services and exciting projects we are currently working on.


Tetra Tech is a VEVRAA federal contractor and we request priority referral of veterans for available positions.


We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.


Please no phone calls or agencies.


Additional Information


  • Organization: 154 ESI

Title: Network Engineer
Skills: Border Gateway Protocol (BGP)|Cisco Systems Products|EIGRP|Firewalls|Google Cloud Platform (GCP)|Troubleshooting|VLAN|VMware|VMware vSphere|Virtual Private Network (VPN)|
Job Description:
About the job

At Alpha Bank, we are shaping the future of banking in Greece.


Through our large-scale Transformation Program, we are changing the way we operate, the way we deliver results and the way we service our Customers.


· We understand our Customers’ needs and design experiences around them

· We work in partnership and invite diversity of skills and perspectives

· We are forward-thinking and drive continuous improvement

· We make things happen; we execute quickly and focus on what is essential


If you are a change enthusiast who sets ambitious goals and works with a sense of purpose, we want to get to know you!


Join our team and #be_part_of_tomorrow


#AlphaBank #TheAlphaBlueprint #Tomorrow


Job Description


The Network Engineer will be placed in the Bank’s IT Infrastructure & Operations Division. She/he will be responsible for configuring and supporting the various networking components and systems within ALPHA BANK’s Datacenter, WAN and Campus infrastructures.

The ideal candidate should be self-motivated, with analytical thinking and problem-solving, willing to learn the environment, train alongside with experienced engineers to achieve within a year all the Professional level expertise and certification.


What you will be doing


  • Network Supervision.
  • Configure, troubleshoot and manage network equipment.
  • Configure and manage network surveillance applications
  • The administrator will also participate in drafting technical specifications (in collaboration with Business representatives, IT Application Administrators, Project Managers), evaluate vendor solutions, monitor performance, analyze system trends, automate system processes, manage incidents.


What you need to have


  • A Bachelor’s or a Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science and Engineering or in any other related discipline.
  • Work experience at least 5 years in implementation, troubleshooting and management of data networks.
  • Certifications in corresponding networking technologies and especially CISCO equipment in professional level.
  • Experience and knowledge (in-depth) of network communication protocols. IP, TCP, UDP, HTTP, IPSEC, etc.
  • Experience and knowledge (in-depth) of networking protocols and technologies (EIGRP, BGP, STP, VLANs, EtherChannel, QoS, etc.)
  • Good understanding of Data Center network concepts and architectures
  • Experience and knowledge of network security components (Firewall, VPN, Network Access Control, Certificate management, etc)
  • Knowledge in WiFi networks
  • Excellent command of the English language (both written and spoken).


What will be considered an asset


  • Experience and Certifications in public cloud networking (Azure, AWS, GCP)
  • Experience and Certifications in Datacenter private cloud technologies (Cisco ACI, VMware NSX-T)
  • Experience in VMware Vsphere Distributed switches (VDS)
  • Experience in the implementation of Network Load Balancing and higher-Level Protocols (http, https, etc.)
  • Experience in the operation of Network Management systems


What we offer


It’s all about our people. At Alpha Bank, you will enjoy:


  • A friendly and collaborative working environment that supports taking initiative and action.
  • A culture that centers around learning and continuous development and encourages everyone to bring their best self to work.
  • The opportunity to challenge your thinking through your participation in complex tasks and transformation projects.
  • Being part of a large organization with a leading role in the Greek economy and a strong presence in the community.
  • A competitive salary and benefits.


All applications will be acknowledged and treated in utmost confidence.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Skills: Analytical Skills|Data Analysis|Data Analytics|English|Greek|Online Research|Quality Assurance|Research Skills|Social Media|Training|
Job Description:
About the job

We are hiring freelance English & Greek speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.


This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.


Requirements

  • Full Professional Proficiency in English & Greek
  • You must be living in Greece for the last 2 consecutive years
  • Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
  • You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Greece
  • Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
  • Applicants must be 18 years or over.


Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.


Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

  • Earn extra income
  • Access to our community wellbeing initiative
  • Remote work & Location Independence
  • Be your own boss
  • Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
  • Be a part of an online community


TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com




If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam89@telusinternational.ai

Title: Senior Python Developer

Job Description:
About the job

We are expanding our team and are currently looking for Senior Python Developers to work on a range of tools which help banks automate their business processes. Python Developer responsibilities include writing and testing code, debugging programs and integrating applications with third-party web services. To be successful in this role, you should have experience using server-side logic and work well in a team.


Ultimately, you’ll build highly responsive web applications that align with our business needs.

- Solid experience as Python Developer

- Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Flask, Django or FastAPI).

- Familiarity with Cloud and REST APIs

- Understanding of databases and SQL

- Knowledge of JavaScript and the AngularJS framework is a plus

- Knowledge of object-relational mapping (ORM)

- BSc in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field

- Knowledge of multi-tenant systems, secure coding practices, and authentication/authorization

- Knowledge on ML algorithms based on Supervised Learning (e.g. KNN algorithm, Decision Tree (classification and regression), Support vector machines (SVM), LightFM algorithm).

- Familiarity with front-end technologies


Benefits


· Highly competitive salary and additional benefits and perks.

· Remote, onsite or hybrid working model

· Long-term challenging job

· Creative work, Agile methodology, banking projects

· Free drinks, coffee and snacks.

· Holidays and vacation time

· Career opportunity with professional growth and development

· Friendly team with an excellent team spirit



If this sounds interesting and you think we might “click”, please send your CV to recruit@validata-software.com quoting ‘PD2023’ in the subject.

Title: Senior DevOps Engineer
Skills: Amazon Web Services (AWS)|Continuous Delivery (CD)|Continuous Integration (CI)|Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)|DevOps|GitFlow|Good Clinical Practice (GCP)|Google Cloud Platform (GCP)|Microservices|Microsoft Azure|
Job Description:
About the job

Let’s Build the Next Industrial Revolution Together


Behind every product is a person


At Vimachem, we’re using technology to empower the people who manufacture medicines for our world. This is why we are developing the world’s biggest manufacturing intelligence AI platform. The platform is built using cutting-edge technology, written in a modern, testable and object-oriented manner that promotes reusability, generic functionality and high performance. We use microservice architecture that enables rapid, frequent and reliable delivery of large and complex applications.


We are a tech company with offices in NYC and Athens, currently looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join our Athens team!


What will you do as a Senior DevOps Engineer?

  • You’ll get to sharpen your skills on the latest tech stack in the areas of DevOps tooling, CI/CD, Containerization, orchestration, and cloud infrastructure.
  • Build and operate a highly available Microservices Cloud platform.
  • Design, develop, test, and deploy scalable, secure, and highly available software using best in class technologies.
  • Establish best practices and build tools to drive the use of CI/CD and the adoption of infrastructure/platform components by engineering teams at Vimachem.
  • Monitor and manage our environments by integrating telemetry and observability into the platform.
  • Maintain best practices around notifications and response processes.
  • Implement DevOps infrastructure components and best practices, working in Azure environments.
  • Deploy CI/CD pipelines across multiple environments.


The main qualifications for this Senior DevOps Engineer role are:

  • Bachelor's degree (or equivalent work experience or specialized training) in Information Technology (IT), Computer Science (CS), Software Engineering, or related discipline.
  • 4 years of experience developing/maintaining Cloud solutions.
  • Experience in building highly available, scalable, distributed systems in a Microservices based architecture.
  • Experience with at least one of the following cloud providers: Azure, AWS, GCP
  • Strong scripting skills (BASH/Python/Powershell etc.)
  • Proficiency in *nix
  • Experience with Git, Git Flow, Azure DevOps
  • A solid grasp of development, automation, and monitoring tools and practices.
  • Hands-on experience in continuous delivery and continuous integration of CI/CD pipelines.
  • Working knowledge of Containerization, network protocols, encryption, and security.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Quick learner with a growth mindset.
  • Strong interpersonal, written, verbal communication skills with an ability to multi-task.
  • Excellent organizational, prioritization, and time management skills.
  • Self-motivated and innovator.
  • Accountable, self-sufficient with a can-do attitude.


Working At Vimachem:


We are building a strong, diverse team that values hard work, families, and personal well being.

Benefits of working with us include:

  • Competitive salary and sign on bonus.
  • We offer a hybrid or fully remote working environment with outmost flexibility.
  • Benefits package including Health insurance, Life insurance, Short-term Disability, Long-term Disability, Commuter Benefits, Parental Leave, and Retirement Plan.
  • Monthly allowance for lunch & commuting expenses.
  • Continuous training and LinkedIn Learning accounts.
  • A buddy will support you with onboarding.
  • Latest i7, lots of RAM, fast SSD.
  • Fitness subsidies.
  • Virtual company events, free office snacks and happy hours.
  • Relocation package and relocation bonus for Greek expats.



We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Help us build an inclusive community that will transform manufacturing.

Title: Business Advisor
Skills: Business Planning|Business Process Improvement|Coaching|Teamwork|
Job Description:
About the job

Περιγραφή ρόλου
Ως Business Advisor και μέλος της μεγαλύτερης ομάδας Β2Β πωλήσεων στον χώρο των τηλεπικοινωνιών, δίνετε έμφαση στη παροχή κορυφαίας εξυπηρέτησης πελατών, προτείνοντας αποτελεσματικές και καινοτόμες λύσεις σε κάθε επιχείρηση. Είναι απαραίτητη η προγενέστερη εμπειρία σε εξυπηρέτηση πελατών, καθώς ως Business Advisor, θα είστε υπεύθυνοι για τη δημιουργία ισχυρών σχέσεων με τους υπάρχοντες πελάτες, αλλά και πιθανούς μελλοντικούς πελάτες.

Οι αρμοδιότητές σας
  • Επίτευξη μηνιαίων στόχων
  • Καθημερινή αναζήτηση και επιδίωξη σύναψης συνεργασίας με νέους πελάτες, στον χώρο εργασίας τους
  • Παρουσίαση υπηρεσιών και λύσεων σε υπάρχοντες και μελλοντικούς πελάτες
  • Πάθος για γνώση σε καινοτόμες λύσεις τεχνολογίας
  • Καθοδήγηση των πελατών σας στη νέα ψηφιακή εποχή

Τι περιμένουμε από εσάς
  • Πτυχίο ΑΕΙ, ΤΕΙ
  • Εμπειρία στις πωλήσεις (Προϋπηρεσία σε B2B Sales θα εκτιμηθεί)
  • Ομαδικό πνεύμα
  • Ενθουσιασμό, πάθος και έντονη πελατοκεντρική φιλοσοφία
  • Επικοινωνιακές και διαπραγματευτικές ικανότητες
  • Φιλοδοξία για εξέλιξη

Τι σας προσφέρουμε
  • Ανταγωνιστικό πακέτο αποδοχών
  • Μηνιαίο Bonus επίτευξης στόχων
  • Ψηφιακά εργαλεία για την επίτευξη των στόχων σας
  • Εξαιρετικό περιβάλλον εργασίας
  • Ευκαιρίες επαγγελματικής εξέλιξης
  • Πρόσληψη μέσω συνεργάτη του Ομίλου

Περιοχές απασχόλησης
Αναζητούμε ανθρώπους για το δίκτυο ιδιόκτητων καταστημάτων της Vodafone και την αλυσίδα καταστημάτων συνεργατών (franchise shops) στις παρακάτω περιοχές:


  • Αττική: Αθήνα (Κέντρο), Κηφισιά, Βριλήσσια, Παλαιό Φάληρο, Μαρούσι, Χαλάνδρι, Πειραιάς, Πετρούπολη, Μενίδι, Ελευσίνα, Μαραθώνας, Νέα Μάκρη, Ρφήνα, Σαλαμίνα, Μαρκόπουλο, Ασπρόπυργος, Μέγαρα
  • Υπόλοιπη Ελλάδα: Σέρρες, Κατερίνη, Κοζάνη, Θεσσαλονίκη, Καβάλα, Ορεστιάδα - Διδυμότειχο, Βέροια, Αλεξανδρούπολη, Δράμα, Καλαμάτα, Πάτρα, Άρτα, Αγρίνιο, Αίγιο, Κέρκυρα, Κεφαλλονιά, Σάμος, Σύρος, Ηράκλειο, Χανιά, Σαντορίνη, Κως

Dcontrol, a industrial/marine automation integrator seeks the new member of its team. The right candidate will be an Automation/Electrical engineer with experience in PLC programming and SCADA systems developing. Enthusiastic with new technologies, willing to learn and share knowledge.

Additional Assets:

We offer:

  • Corporate laptop and equipment
  • Continuous training in new technologies
  • Opportunity for business development

Title: Project Manager
Skills: Communication|English|IT Project Management|IT Projects|Problem Solving|Project Documentation|Project Management|Project Management Software|Project Plans|Vendor Contracts|
Job Description:
About the job

About Avis

We don't just rent cars. We're changing the way people move. Across our world-famous brand, we're leading the way for the global mobility industry. We aim to develop integrated products and services that will offer entirely new travel possibilities with more convenience and flexibility than ever before.

We're looking for the very best talent to join us, and in return we offer a collaborative working environment, committed to fostering innovation and putting the customer at the heart of everything we do.


About Your Opportunity

As a Project Manager, you will work for Avis PMO Office, under the auspices of IT Directorate and you will manage resources, schedules, risks, and potential impacts of changes to project stakeholders for various IT Projects. Furthermore, you will communicate with team members both intracompany and from various vendors to ensure their understanding and their commitment to project tasks, objectives, quality goals and deadlines.


Duties and Responsibilities


  • Ensure the successful initiation, planning, execution, controlling and closing of IT Projects under the guidance of the Head of PMO
  • Keep constantly updated and complete project documentation including project charter, time-plan, resource utilization levels, correspondence, deployment plans, vendor contracts, purchase orders and progress reports
  • Provide timely and accurate project progress reporting to the Head of PMO and to Top management
  • Use best-in-class project management methodologies including waterfall and agile according to project specific needs to achieve project goals on time, while managing risk and changes
  • Develop and maintain a baseline project plan and its iterations on MS Project and in-house Project Management Tools
  • Conduct project team meetings and communicate the meeting minutes including tasking, issues tracking, action items, and follow-ups between meetings
  • Manage vendors and sub-contractors towards project goals


Desired Skills and Experience

  • BSc degree in Computer Science or relative field
  • Working experience of 2-3 years in the areas of IT Consulting or IT Project Management
  • A PMP, or a PMI-ACP certification or an MSc in Project Management will be considered a plus
  • Excellent knowledge of the English language (oral & written)
  • Excellent communication, organizational & problem-solving skills
  • A recommendation letter from a former employer or a good academic reference will be highly appreciated.



What we Offer

  • Competitive salary package
  • Health and life insurance
  • Pension program after 1 year of employment
  • Continuous onboarding support through our Buddy program
  • Opportunity to work in a fast-growing industry with talented people
  • Training opportunities and a continuous feedback performance management system

Title: IT-Manager
Skills: Administrative Assistance|Communication|Computer Science|Information Technology|Negotiation|Problem Solving|Technical Support|Technology Solutions|Technology Trends|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

Die timeframe Familie wächst weltweit. Wir bieten Ihnen neue berufliche Perspektiven mit anspruchsvollen Aufgaben und schneller Verantwortungsübernahme. Wir gestalten seit über 20 Jahren die Zukunft der Kundenbetreuung in vorderster Reihe mit. Ob Inbound, Outbound oder Non-Voice: Unsere Dienstleistungen erhöhen Flexibilität, Sicherheit und Effizienz im Unternehmen unserer Kunden.

Als weltweit erfolgreich wachsendes Unternehmen bietet die timeframe Familie leistungsbereiten und versierten Fachkräften, die mit fundierten Fachkenntnissen und ausgewiesener beruflicher Expertise zum weiteren Erfolg unseres Unternehmens beitragen wollen, verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben und attraktive berufliche Perspektiven.


Als IT Manager (m/w/d) übernehmen Sie unser dezentrales IT Team und arbeiten in enger Kooperation mit dem Vorstand, sowie IT Dienstleitern

Sie finden klare Worte, haben echte Führungsqualität und legen dabei Wert auf Kundenorientierung. Sie steuern internationale IT-Projekte, verantworten deren Ressourcen sowie Budgets und stimmen sich zudem mit den Stakeholdern ab. Dabei lieben Sie es, sich stetig auf neue Herausforderungen und Aufgabenstellungen einzulassen und in einem sehr dynamischen, stark wachsenden sowie flexiblen Umfeld mit Ihrem Know-how Lösungen voranzutreiben.


Können Sie sich in diesen Aufgaben wiederfinden?

  • Führung und kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung des IT-Teams
  • Ressourcen- und Budgetplanung
  • Reporting
  • Verantwortlich für die Stabilität sowie die Umsetzung taktischer Maßnahmen und Optimierungen der IT-Landschaft
  • Aufbau und Etablierung von neuen IT Services inkl. deren Beschreibung und Qualitätsmanagement
  • Review und Kommunikation von kritischen IT Infrastrukturveränderungen (Change Management)
  • Betreiben eines adäquaten und zeitnahen Eskalationsmanagements bei IT-Problemen
  • Sicherstellung und Kommunikation konzernweiter IT Standards, Prozesse und Security Richtlinien
  • Kundenkontakt im IT Bereich
  • Interne und externe IT Projekte auch beratend
  • Beratungsfunktion für das operative Senior Management im Rahmen der IT Infrastruktur


Das sollten Sie mitbringen:

  • Eine ausgeprägte „Hands on Mentalität“
  • Ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
  • Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in vergleichbaren Tätigkeitsumfeld
  • Erfahrung in der Führung von Mitarbeitern und Teamfähigkeit
  • Erfahrung in Mitarbeiterauswahl, -motivation und -entwicklung
  • Verhandlungsgeschick und Erfahrung in der Betreuung von Dienstleistern
  • Kommunikationsstärke, Gestaltungswille und Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen
  • Hohe Service- und Lösungsorientierung
  • Deutsch: Verhandlungssicher
  • Englisch: Fließend
  • Bereitschaft zu nationalen und internationalen Reisen
  • Führerschein: Klasse B

#wespeakyourlanguage


Kontakt:

timeframe AG

Gänsemarkt 1

45127 Essen

Phone +49 201 650 57 670

www.timeframe.eu

Title: Network Security Engineer
Skills: Application Security|Checkpoint|LAN-WAN|Layer 3|Local Area Network (LAN)|Network Engineering|Network Security|Networking|Remote Access|Wide Area Network (WAN)|
Job Description:
About the job

Job description:

Network Security Engineer



We are seeking for an experienced Network Security Engineer to join our Data Network Subdivision within our Group IT General Division.

As a Network Security Engineer, you will be analyzing our organization's security infrastructure technical needs and requirements, and stating its design, integration, and operations. You will be contributing to the creation of the most effective and secure solutions, suggesting improvements regarding our infrastructure’s performance, capacity, and scalability.

Your key responsibilities will be to:

  • Lead technical implementations, upgrades, configurations, changes, and level 3 support for all network security systems/platforms.
  • Determine organization’s network security needs to identify and mitigate potential threats.
  • Test and maintain network infrastructures including software and hardware devices.
  • Integrate new systems into existing network architectures and collaborate with IT teams on various projects.
  • Maintain all network related documentation libraries such as network diagrams and procedure documents.
  • Keep up-to-date on new and emerging security technologies and threats.

You will be a great candidate for us if you have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field. Postgraduate studies will be considered as an additional asset.
  • At least 3 years of proven work experience in the Network and Network Security field.
  • Good understanding of networking concepts and protocols and experience in LAN/WAN infrastructures.
  • Previous exposure in managing F5 or Citrix load balancers, Checkpoint Firewalls and IPS modules.
  • In depth knowledge of Network Security, Layer 3 Technologies and Cloud providers infrastructure.
  • Experience with VPN Architecture, Remote Access Solutions, Network Automation.
  • Advanced network troubleshooting skills, utilizing packet capture/analysis packages such as Wireshark, etc.

And you share the same Value Based Behaviors:

  • Learn & self-improve with every opportunity
  • Bring high impact results
  • Build mutually beneficial relationships when interacts with clients or colleagues
  • Bring people around to your idea, solution or direction
  • Develop new solutions, minimise complexity
  • Gain other people's trust

Benefits
