Title: German speaking Senior Consultant, Advisors
Skills: Analytics|Client Presentation|Client Relations|Corporate Strategy|Intellectual Capital|Line Management|Presentations|Product Management|Project Delivery|Structured Thinking|
Job Description:
About the job

Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Job Title

German speaking Senior Consultant, Advisors

German speaking Senior Consultant – Strategy & Transformation

Advisors Client Services, Data & Services

Mastercard Data & Services provides cutting-edge data analysis and services to Fortune 500s, governments, and nonprofits to make multimillion-dollar business decisions and grow their organizations. Our Advisors Client Services team combines traditional management consulting with Mastercard’s rich data assets, proprietary platforms, and technologies to provide clients with powerful strategic insights and recommendations. Mastercard Advisors works with a diverse global customer base across industries, from banking and payments to retail and restaurants.

The Advisors Client Services group has five specializations: Strategy & Transformation, Performance Analytics, Business Experimentation, Marketing, and Program Management. Our Strategy & Transformation consultants lead clients through impactful decision-making as they tackle strategic, tactical, operational, and transformational business challenges. They apply a broad set of problem-solving techniques to improve the client’s overall strategy, performance, and operations.

Positions for different specializations and levels are available in separate job postings. Please review our consulting specializations to learn more about all opportunities and apply for the position that is best suited to your background and experience: https://careers.mastercard.com/us/en/consulting-specializations-at-mastercard

Roles and Responsibilities

Client Impact
  • Manage deliverable development and workstreams on projects across a range of industries and problem statements
  • Contribute to and/or develop strategies and programs for large, regional, and global clients by leveraging data and technology solutions to unlock client value
  • Manage working relationship with client managers, and act as trusted and reliable partner

Team Collaboration & Culture
  • Develop sound business recommendations and deliver effective client presentations
  • Plan, organize, and structure own work and that of junior project delivery consultants to identify effective analysis structures to address client problems, synthesize analyses into relevant findings, and create impactful storylines
  • Lead team and external meetings, and lead or co-lead project management
  • Contribute to the firm's intellectual capital and solution development
  • Grow from coaching to enable ownership of day-to-day project management across client projects, and mentor junior consultants

Qualifications

Basic qualifications
  • Undergraduate degree with 3+ years of relevant work experience in consulting, corporate strategy, business intelligence, business line management, or product management
  • Fluency in English and in German
  • Experience managing clients or internal stakeholders
  • Logical, structured thinking, and affinity for numerical analysis
  • Advanced Word, Excel, and PowerPoint skills
  • Ability to perform multiple tasks with multiple clients in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
  • Eligibility to work in the country where you are applying, as well as apply for travel visas as required by travel needs

Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience managing tasks or workstreams in a collaborative team environment with third parties
  • Experience coaching junior delivery consultants
  • Relevant industry expertise
  • MBA or master’s degree with relevant specialization (not required)

Corporate Security Responsibility

 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must
  • Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
  • Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
  • Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
  • Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Title: System Engineer
Skills: Employee Benefits|
Job Description:
About the job

SysteCom provides top-notch technology solutions and services across various verticals. We aim to help our clients create a secure and productive digital environment to grow their businesses.

We are looking for the newest addition to this high-qualified team.


About the job

The System Engineer will help implement new solutions and support, maintain, and grow the infrastructure of the company’s corporate clientele. They will work alongside the Management, Sales, Technology, and Technical teams to ensure the highest performance and ability levels and manage any problems. They will work as part of a team while maintaining their autonomy, self-managing priorities and day-to-day actions, and managing projects.

In bullets, the tasks that the System Engineer will handle are:

  • Implement new projects assigned to existing and new customers
  • Provide on-site and remote technical support to the company's customers
  • Handle proactive support, upgrades, and migrations in the customers existing infrastructure
  • Be an active member of the team that suggests and designs additional services and new solutions for the customers


Position requirements and qualifications

To conduct the tasks assigned successfully, the System Engineer will have to cover the following requirements and qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or 3 years of related field experience
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server operating systems, Microsoft Active Directory, and Windows Deployment (installation, configuration, troubleshooting)
  • Comfortable in Azure with at least 2 years of experience
  • Experience in virtualization environments (Hyper-V and/or VMware)
  • Experience in Microsoft Exchange Servers (on-premises and/or O365)
  • Experience in Group Policies, DHCP, DNS, TCP/IP
  • Troubleshooting skills on server hardware

Any of the following will be considered a plus:

  • Microsoft certifications
  • Office 365 experience
  • Experience in the implementation & support of LAN/WAN networks


Additional skills

Apart from covering the knowledge requirements, the System Engineer should also have the following skills:

  • High level of problem-solving skills and logical thinking
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (in both Greek and English)
  • Excellent customer handling skills
  • Ability to work effectively under pressure
  • Team player with highly developed interpersonal communication skills
  • Self-motivated with the mentality to take initiative and pay attention to detail
  • Passion for new technologies


Benefits

The System Engineer will work in a high standards business environment alongside experienced and certified professionals. They will be provided with all possible means to develop professionally and enjoy the team spirit which is encouraged internally. More specifically we are offering:

  • Salary based on the qualifications/skills
  • Flexibility on WFH
  • Continuous training and developing new skills
  • Corporate laptop
  • Corporate mobile


Apply by sending your CV to hr@systecom.gr with the code “SSE” in the subject.


Notes:

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

All personal information presented to us either in writing or verbally will be treated with confidentiality.

Title: Sr. Specialist GBS HR and Payroll Greece & Cyprus
Skills: Affinity|Analytical Skills|Communication|Document Creation|External Audits|Payroll Administration|Retail Accounting|SAP HR|Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP)|Subject Matter Experts|
Job Description:
About the job

Purpose & Overall Relevance For The Organization

adidas Shared Services delivers high quality services for Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Retail Accounting, eCommerce Accounting and other Finance processes as well as HR Services for adidas companies located in Europe and Americas.

Within the framework of HR Services, we are providing excellent services and business competence regarding all HR Services related processes. As HR Services strives to combine competent and professional business partnering with a constant enhancement of services in an efficient and value-adding way, the role is vitally supporting this target by following key responsibilities.

Key Responsibilities
  • Performing general and more complex administration of HR Services tools, programmes, and processes on a local and partially European and global level.
  • Provide consultancy services and service excellence to the HR community regarding general and more complex issues.
  • Handle standard & complex inquiries & support through ticket service or via phone (if required) to employees, HR, Finance and third parties.
  • Perform within the HR Services team all defined processes which are related to all employee life-cycle actions including mobility topics on a regional or global level.
  • Create all kinds of HR documents along the employee life cycle such as employment contractual packages incl. mobility attachments, promotions, offboarding checklists etc. according to defined processes and standards.
  • Perform and oversee bulk document creation and distribution processes
  • Maintain personnel and organizational data according to defined processes and standards incl. mass uploads
  • Ensure digitalization of documents and ensure a proper and accurate handled archiving of documents according to defined standards and processes
  • Oversee and execute transfer calculations and determination of appropriate salary offer for international employees.
  • Administrate the invoicing, billing, and recharging of costs for mobility benefits.
  • Administrate all type of local benefits (Ariba tool including)
  • Handle reporting’s according to relocation, tax, and immigration data for national and international employee.
  • Timely execution of standard and complex payroll tasks according to defined processes, schedules, and service levels in accordance with regional and local guidelines.
  • Transmit employee lifecycle data to Payroll Provider, perform payroll validations and ensure Payroll Provider executes accurate payroll calculations.
  • Support the continuous improvement of payroll processes and the use of systems.
  • Timely reporting and preparation of declarations and ensuring appropriate communication with tax authorities, social security, and all other state institutions.
  • Support Manager HR and Payroll, SEE in Internal and External Audits
  • Participate regularly in workshops and meetings held by subject matter experts.
  • Act as a role model in compliance with the relevant laws and regulations as well as adidas’ Fair Play Code of Conduct and other internal policies and company agreement.
Key Relationships
  • GBS Operations and Process Excellence teams
  • Employees
  • External authorities, consultants, and suppliers
  • HR Experts: Rewards, Mobility and Talent
  • HR Partners
  • Finance (Controlling, Taxes)
  • Legal department
Knowledge, Skills And Abilities
  • Good level of affinity to and experience with Business computing solutions, ideally with SAP HR
  • Very good analytical skills and detail-oriented work style
  • Ability to work with high volume and transactional administration issues
  • Team player mentality
  • Strong customer focus and service minded
  • International mind-set
  • Ability to work under pressure as well as prioritizes and completes tasks in order of importance
  • Good understanding of Greek and Cypriot legal and tariff regulations

Title: Energy Analyst (Business Area: Performance Minerals EMEA)
Skills: Carbon Emissions|Data Control|Enablon|Energy Assessment|Energy Efficiency|Energy Systems|Google Data Studio|Google Sheets|Hedging|Renewable Energy|
Job Description:
About the job

The Company


The world leader in mineral-based specialty solutions for industry, with over 16,000 employees and over 200 sites worldwide, Imerys delivers high value-added, functional solutions to diversified set of industrial sectors, from processing industries to consumer goods. The Group draws on its knowledge of applications, technological expertise and its material science know-how to deliver solutions based on beneficiation of its mineral resources, synthetic minerals and formulations. These contribute essential properties to customers’ products and performance, including refractoriness, hardness, conductivity, opacity, durability, purity, lightness, filtration, absorption and repellency. Imerys is determined to develop responsibly, in particular by fostering the emergence of environmentally-friendly products and processes.


If you want to grow your skills and develop your career, find out more at www.imerys.com


The Position


Energy Analyst (Business Area: Performance Minerals EMEA)


Job Summary


Role


PM EMEA Business Area: 80 sites in 24 countries - 3700 employees - €1.2b revenue - Energy costs ca. 240 m€ in 2022. Context: Imerys is committed in meeting the 1.5°C carbon emission reduction trajectory by 2030.


  • Member of the energy assessment team
  • Energy & carbon emissions data control and analysis
  • Contribution to significant energy/carbon emission reduction projects


Responsibilities


  • Active member of the BA team for the Group energy assessment program. This program aims at identifying and prioritizing improvement actions, and encompasses sourcing, purchasing, process efficiency. Within the team, the energy analyst is responsible for the utilities, maintenance and systems optimization.
  • Responsible for the BA energy & emissions data management through the reporting system (Enablon). Help the energy manager establish the quarterly energy and emissions report, and energy consumption forecast allowing energy hedging and risk management
  • Design and implement new energy and emissions dashboards. Train and support the users to set up and analyze their energy dashboards and KPIs to allow decision making
  • Help and support the establishment of the BA carbon emission reduction roadmap to comply with new Group objectives (1.5°C reduction trajectory by 2030), by simulating different scenarios based on identified levers (energy efficiency, fuel switching, electrification of processes,, etc)
  • Provide support to important energy related projects to ensure successful implementation (Renewable energy program, fuel switching and heat recovery projects)
  • Key interfaces: BA CoE, Group Energy Assessment team, BA operations


Accountability


  • YoY Energy efficiency improvement
  • Emission reduction as per Group trajectory target
  • Energy assessment deliverables
  • Energy & Carbon emissions data management (reports, dashboards, analyses)


Title, position in the organization & grading


  • Title : Energy Analyst
  • Reporting to : BA Energy Manager within the Center of Excellence team
  • Location: any Imerys location in Europe
  • Travels: up to 40% in Europe for energy assessments


Competencies and experience
  • Key competencies
    • Engineering/Science/Energy background
    • Strong interest in energy systems & climate change topics
    • Analytical skills and ability to summarize
    • Strong skills in Google sheets / Excel including advanced formulas and graphic functions, knowledge in Google data studio will be an advantage
    • Continuous Improvement mindset
  • Ideal background/ experience
    • Engineer or equivalent
    • 0-5 years of experience
  • Typical profile

Title: IT Business Analyst
Skills: Analytical Skills|Business|Business Analysis|Information Technology|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Overview

The Business Analyst ensures the liaison between the business side and the IT side of an IT project. The Business Analyst is knowledgeable in the business and in the applications of his area and bridges both. The Business Analyst is responsible for the analysis and all related documentation for his allocated IT projects. The Business Analyst defines how the scope of the IT project will be implemented within the existing applications, working closely with the software development team. His role includes establishing and maintaining strong regional relations for knowledge sharing and activities to achieve synergy with other BAs in the region, as well as with business units and regional/group teams.


How can You help us?

If you have expertise in the following areas, then apply!


Project Management


You...

  • ensure successful delivery of projects keeping timelines and costs within the project-endorsed targets
  • lead major development and deployment projects, ensuring documentation in place
  • define projects scope and timeline and provides a regular update on the project progress, and raise an alert in case of issues
  • leading project steering committee
  • ensure communication between project team members
  • update project documentations


Business requirement management


You...

  • bridge business and IT solutions manage business relations with stakeholders (including key users, lab managers, and business unit managers) on IT initiatives to ensure successful implementation
  • manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle
  • prepare specifications and documentation
  • ensure quality and timely delivery of the solutions
  • provide regular updates on assigned requirements


Technical tasks

You...

  • define requirements, user stories, and test cases
  • prepare changes for Change Advisory Board
  • execute test plans on the delivered solution
  • participate in the release process by doing manual testing of the release packages on the User Acceptance environment
  • support master data migration during projects and system configuration
  • provide training to users on its application scope and post-go-live support of any new solution deployed
  • prepare training materials, technical and end-user documentation



Qualifications

Ideally, you would be educated in the fields of Chemistry, Microbiology, or Information Systems.


Experience

  • Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development
  • Experience aligning IT with business initiatives and in project coordination
  • Experience with ERP-like deployment projects in a mid-size organization and specifying requirements for business applications


Additional Information

You should have outstanding analytical and creative problem-solving skills and should be a logical and efficient person with keen attention to detail. We are looking for a self-organized person, who is able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it.

If you have strong customer orientation, and excellent listening skills, furthermore your communications skills are excellent and you are a team player, then you are the expert whom we are looking for.

B2-level English and Greek are a must.


What can we do for you?

We offer a competitive compensation package with a hybrid work environment. You will be provided with a personal development plan and medical insurance. A stable workplace and calming work environment are guaranteed.

Are you ready to use your expertise to find new ways to grow your career? Apply now!


Company Description


Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company that provides a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries. The Group believes it is the world leader in food, environment, and pharmaceutical product testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences, and supporting clinical studies. In addition, Eurofins is one of the key emerging players in specialty clinical diagnostic testing in Europe and the USA.

Group's key figures are approx. 4.56 billion Euros turnover, over 900 laboratories across 50 countries, and about 55,000 staff.

Title: Project Manager
Skills: Building Codes|EPLAN|Electrical Engineering|Energy Industry|Engineering|Microsoft Office|Offshore Wind|Project Management|Substation|Wind Energy|
Job Description:
About the job

Paralos Energy, a well-established energy projects construction company is seeking to recruit an Electrical Engineer with a previous experience in energy projects construction management. The Electrical Engineer will be joining our projects team to plan and oversee a wide variety of energy projects from beginning to end including but not limited to: High Voltage Substations, Wind Farms and HV/MV Transmission lines, in the Greek area as well as abroad.


Responsibilities

  • You oversee construction projects from beginning to end
  • You manage the budget and estimate costs
  • You determine the necessary equipment, materials, and manpower needed
  • You ensure supplies and equipment are ordered and delivered according to schedule
  • You ensure compliance with safety regulations and building codes
  • You collaborate with subcontractors, engineers, and key team members of the project team
  • You follow up the procedure for the appropriate permits and licenses from authorities for construction sites
  • You ensure all deadlines are met
  • You keep all stakeholders aware of the progress on projects and prepare reports regularly
  • You conduct site visits to monitor progress and quality standards


Qualifications

  • You hold an Electrical Engineering Degree
  • You have at least 1 year experience in a similar role. Experience in a construction company related to energy sector will be considered as a plus
  • You have very good knowledge of Microsoft Office
  • You have knowledge of Microsoft Project as well as engineering softwares (CAD software, EPLAN)
  • You are fluent in English. Knowledge of other languages will be considered as a plus
  • You are highly organized and have a team working and problem-solving attitude
  • You have previous experience in a manager role with strong and proven leadership skills
  • You are able to multitask with a strong understanding of core manager duties
  • You have excellent communication skills and interpersonal abilities, including negotiation skills


What we Offer

  • Interesting and diversified opportunities in the fast-growing energy sector
  • Interdisciplinary teamwork in a successful and dynamic company
  • Friendly working atmosphere

Title: Project Manager
Skills: Construction Management|Project Management|Renewable Energy|Solar Energy|
Job Description:
About the job

Join a rapidly growing renewable energy company that matters to the future! We are looking to strengthen our Technical team with a highly skilled and driven Project Manager based in Marousi, Athens with regular visits to the Project sites.


What you’ll do:

  • Implement project governance and ensure regular status reporting.
  • Monitor the project budget, producing cost reports, performing analyses to assist in reducing costs while maintaining productivity and schedule.
  • Conduct regular project inspections and supervising of work progress, quality of work and safety conditions requiring attention
  • Manage the construction contracts (i.e. checking of invoices, managing notifications, claims, etc.) with partners, engineers, subcontractors and coordinating their work to ensure all work is within project scope and specifications according to the specific contracts
  • Continually monitor the projects to assure adherence to company and regulatory processes and procedures.
  • Ensure the projects comply with Health, Safety and Environmental obligations.
  • Ensure appropriate levels of communication are maintained with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Ensure all necessary measures to comply with the Grid Code to be able to feed electricity into grid at commissioning.
  • Manage the completion of the works listed in the Punch List during Operations Phase
  • Support Operations for matters related to the construction contracts until final acceptance certificate.
  • Provide support where needed during the Development Phase.


What you have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in an Engineering related field.
  • 1-5 years of experience in construction with medium and large size projects (combined experience in solar & wind energy will be considered a plus).
  • Good working knowledge of Software/Computer programs (i.e. AutoCAD, PM tools, Microsoft Office)
  • Excellent organization and time management skills.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks and autonomously set priorities.
  • Excellent use of Greek and English language.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Genuine interest for the Renewable Industry Sector.


Click Apply to be redirected to our Application page or email us your CV at careers@national.energy

Title: Technical Project Manager
Skills: Analytical Skills|Defense Industry|Hardware Design|Negotiation|Project Management|Project Plans|Technical Project Management|Time Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Intracom Defense (IDE) is the leading defense company in Greece with significant international activity. IDE designs, develops and manufactures products and systems that incorporate advanced in-house developed technologies in the areas of Missile Electronics, Tactical Communication and Information Systems, Border and Area Security solutions, Hybrid Electric Power Systems and Unmanned Surface and Air platforms.


IDE is a registered NATO supplier and participates in international development and production programs, as well as in international collaborations for the production and export of defense equipment.


IDE is currently looking for a dynamic and ambitious Technical Project Manager to join the Programs Management Department. This role includes the delivery of every project on time, within budget and scope by coordinating all the activities and resources required and being in continuous cooperation with customers.


Responsibilities

The ideal candidate will:

  • develop a detailed project plan to track progress.
  • coordinate internal and external resources for the successful execution of technical R&D projects.
  • ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and budget.
  • ensure resource availability and allocation.
  • perform risk management.
  • manage the relationship with the clients and stakeholders.
  • create and maintain comprehensive project documentation and reporting.


Qualifications & Experience

Required:

  • University Degree in Electrical or Electronics Engineering.
  • Solid technical background and understanding of Hardware/Electronics.
  • At least 5 years proven working experience in Project or Technical Project Management in the fields of Electronics/Hardware design and development.
  • Excellent command of the English language.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office.
  • Availability to travel abroad.

Desired:

  • MBA or PMP / PRINCE II Certification.
  • Knowledge of the Defense Industry and previous working experience in this field.


Personal Characteristics:

  • Willingness to take initiative and drive results.
  • Strong negotiation skills and ability to influence and challenge options.
  • Detail oriented personality with analytical thinking.
  • Very good planning and time-management skills.
  • High sense of accountability and great ability to work effectively as part of a team.


Benefits

INTRACOM DEFENSE offers:

  • Fast-paced working environment.
  • Opportunities for continuous learning of state-of-the-art technology and career development.
  • Competitive remuneration package directly dependent on the candidate's qualifications and experience.
  • Group private medical insurance.
  • Company bus from metro stations.
  • Onsite dining facilities.


All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Title: Project Manager in the Energy Sector
Skills: Analytical Skills|Climate Change|Communication|Energy Industry|European Union|Greek|Presentations|Project Management|Project Teams|Teamwork|
Job Description:
About the job

About Us

Grant Thornton Greece is a member firm of Grant Thornton International Limited (GTIL), one of the leading organizations delivering audit, tax and advisory services. Every day we provide a diverse range of organizations with the kind of business and financial advice it takes to do this. Our ideas and insight empower our clients to make big decisions about the future and unlock their growth.

If you want to be part of this incredible journey Grant Thornton Greece has the opportunity for you!

The key responsibilities of this role will include:

The key requirements of this role are:

To be successful at this role you need the following:
  • Effective communication and rapport building skills
  • Ability to develop and deliver high quality services and solutions

What will we offer to you?

What you will need to do next?

Joining the Grant Thornton Greece family is easy! If you feel that you meet the criteria, have the passion to succeed and have the Grant Thornton values simply apply online by uploading an -up-to-date CV with your application and leave the rest to us!

We will ensure that all our resourcing activities are fair, transparent and consistent across the Greece. We want to ensure that the candidate experience is of the highest professional standard.

The Company is committed to providing equality of opportunity for all employees.

Title: IT Manager
Skills: Communication|Computer Science|IT Management|Information Technology|Legal Compliance|Problem Solving|Resource Allocation|Risk Assessment|Security Protocols|WiFi|
Job Description:
About the job

Scorpios

Scorpios is a growing hospitality brand that brings people together around music, food, and mindfulness — always within a stunning natural landscape. Taking inspiration from the culture and history of its location, each project is intended as a platform for local creatives to exhibit their talents as well as a hub for the global Scorpios community to gather. Since its opening as a beachside music venue on Mykonos in 2015, Scorpios has grown into a global lifestyle hospitality brand with expanded offerings. Scorpios is now looking to build a highly dedicated team to drive the brand to its highest potential.

Job Description

Scorpios & Soho House are looking for an experienced IT Manager to oversee our organization's technological infrastructure and ensure its optimal performance. The ideal candidate will have a passion for technology, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage a team of IT professionals. The successful applicant will hold a key role within Scorpios and SOHO House as an expert in his field leading decisions, supporting future developments, and taking ownership of operations.

Opportunities For All

Scorpios was created to bring diverse communities of people together, and we take the same approach when building our teams. We thrive on differences and believe it is critical to our success as a global company. Scorpios is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace that seeks to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We therefore encourage applications from all genders, races, religions, ages, and sexual orientations, as well as parents, veterans, people living with disabilities, and any other groups that could bring diverse perspectives to our business.

Scorpios ecosystem includes

  • POS Equipment (Printers, Service Stations, POS machines, etc.)
  • Network (Ethernet, Wi-Fi)
  • Hardware (Servers, PC, Laptop, Mac, Printers, etc.)
  • CCTV (IP Camera, NVR)
  • Online Services (Bookings, HR, CRM, ERP, etc)

Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement IT policies and procedures to ensure the security and integrity of our technological infrastructure.
  • Manage and monitor the performance of our IT systems, including networks, servers, hardware, and software.
  • Ensure that our IT infrastructure is compliant with industry standards and regulations.
  • Identify and implement new technologies that can enhance our operations and improve productivity.
  • Evaluate risk and develop risk mitigation processes (network recovery – backup processes)
  • Manage a team of IT professionals, providing training and mentorship to ensure their ongoing professional development.
  • Collaborate with other departments to identify and address technology-related issues.
  • Assure legal compliance.
  • Develop and manage the IT budget, ensuring that resources are allocated effectively to support business objectives.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in IT management or a related field.
  • In-depth knowledge of network architecture, hardware, software, and security protocols.
  • Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to manage a team effectively.
  • Experience developing and implementing IT policies and procedures.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Familiarity with industry standards and regulations related to IT infrastructure and security.
  • Ability to manage a budget effectively and allocate resources strategically.
  • Familiarity with POS Systems is desirable (Oracle Solutions)
  • Hospitality industry experience is a considerable asset.
  • Good command of English language is mandatory.
  • European Union Nationality with available working permission
  • The role is subject to 35% travel requirement.

Candidate Profile

  • Internal drive and willingness to work in a demanding, challenging, and fast-paced work environment.
  • Flexibility in working hour schedule and willingness for medium term relocation.
  • Strong ability and self-motivation to overcome problems at work in a resourceful, efficient, and effective way, working independently or in a team.
  • Committed and engaged towards the philosophy and cultural values of Scorpios.
  • High-achiever mindset with a sense of work perfectionism

Benefits

Scorpios offers a competitive salary with career development opportunities, based on the candidate's qualifications and skills. Accommodation is also provided during relocation period. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to work in a stimulating and motivating environment that is committed towards its employees.

The role is subject to traveling requirements to Scorpios venues.

Title: Business Process Consultant / Senior Consultant
Skills: Analytical Skills|Business Administration|Business Process|Business Process Analysis|Business Process Re-engineering|English|Problem Solving|Process Analysis|Quality Management|Six Sigma|
Job Description:
About the job

What Impact will you make?


#YourOpportunity


We are currently looking for an enthusiastic Business Process Consultant / Senior Consultant to join our dynamic and highly motivated Digital Customer team in Athens.


Deloitte is the first ranked consulting company delivering business advisory and technology enabled business transformations across the globe. Within Deloitte, our teams focus on delivering trusted high-end technology advisory services.


Should you be a cloud technologies enthusiast, with a great affinity for the business side of a problem, interested in helping our clients maximize the value of their customer relationships, passionate about improving processes and motivated to take on new challenges across industries, in Greece as well as internationally, this is the opportunity to do so.


At Deloitte, you will gain exposure to a variety of industries and business models, helping your career growth and professional development.


#YourRole


Your role as a Business Process Consultant / Senior Consultant will focus on the delivery of client engagements, by understanding objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning your own work to objectives and setting personal priorities, teaming with others across businesses and borders and taking accountability for own and team results. In this role, you will build relationships and exercise your communication skills in order to positively influence your peers and other stakeholders. You will commit to personal learning and development by actively seeking opportunities for growth, you will share knowledge and experience with others, and act as a strong brand ambassador, embracing our purpose and values in order to put these into practice in your professional life.


During your tenure as a Business Process Consultant / Senior Consultant, you will demonstrate and develop your ability to:


  • Analyze and document the client’s current state process designs by using business process management techniques (e.g. BPMN, RACI, SIPOC, VSM, etc.).
  • Identify and document any pain points/quality issues/inefficiencies/non-value-adding activities leading to poor performance
  • Define the process efficiency metrics (KPIs) and the appropriate SLAs
  • Generate business requirement documents for key process improvement projects (use tools as FMEA, etc)
  • Initiate various short-, medium- and long-term process improvement projects, and provide guidance until their completion.
  • Deliver key messages with clarity, confidence and poise to instill confidence in clients
  • Apply a global and diverse perspective to problem solving
  • Understand how business functions operate and how sector trends impact a client’s business
  • Communicate project expectations and results to all stakeholders in a timely and clear form
  • Be able to facilitate client workshops to analyze as-is processes and re-engineer them.


#WinningRequirements


To qualify for the role you must have:


  • University Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or related fields
  • Master’s Degree in Business Administration (MBA) or Process Reengineering / Optimization or Quality Management will be considered a plus
  • At least 4 years of Business Process Analysis experience preferably in the Financial Services/Banking and/or Insurance and/or Public Sector
  • Experience in Consulting will be considered a plus
  • Good knowledge of ARIS BPM software will be considered a plus
  • Very good knowledge of process improvement techniques (e.g. Lean, Six Sigma), certification will be considered a plus
  • Familiarization with Design Thinking methodologies, Agile approach & Total Quality Management Tools (PDCA, A3 Thinking, etc)
  • Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills focusing on continuous improvement
  • Strong interpersonal and communications skills in English
  • Military obligations fulfilled where applicable


#AboutConsulting


Five core competency areas make up our Consulting service line:

  • Strategy, Analytics and M&A
  • Customer and Marketing
  • Core Business Operations
  • Human Capital
  • Enterprise Technology and Performance


We exist to solve complex problems



Our consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. Each member of our Consulting team is energized by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.


We are committed to collaboration

Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge. In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities.


We create long-term, sustainable impact

We often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come.


#ChooseDeloitteif:

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.


ABOUT DELOITTE


Our services

Deloitte offers Global professional services that include Audit, Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.

We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients, in Greece and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within.


Our Purpose

Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.


Our values

At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements.


Our talent experience

From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the centre of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.



Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

Title: Senior Software Engineer

Job Description:
About the job

Description:


We are expanding our team, so if you feel that you need to move on with your career in a place like ours, let us know!

Benefits

  • Latest IT equipment
  • Opportunities for initiative-taking
  • Remote working options

Title: Technical Project Manager
Skills: Project Management|Team Leadership|
Job Description:
About the job

Technical Project Manager


TFM Group is one of the largest omnichannel retail pharmacy group of companies in Greece.

Holding a leading position in the online market while leveraging the physical retail points and enhancing the customers' journey in all channels both online and offline.

As the clientele is growing and new channels and services are added we are constantly seeking to develop and reinforce our technology and infrastructure. This is why we are seeking to onboard talented professionals with a passion for technology and innovation in our journey of becoming not just the market leader but a state of the art e-commerce platform.


We are currently looking for a technical project manager who will be responsible for managing current projects in areas:


  • E-shop
  • ERP
  • Database & API


Your main responsibilities will be to:

  • Perform project management for multiple projects, including, planning and proposals for enhancing the overall technology of the Group, provide the definition of tasks and deliverables, review of project deliverables, quality control, risk analysis & management, status reports, problem reporting & management, follow up
  • Draft project management deliverables such as the Business Case, Project Strategy or Vision documents
  • Develop a detailed project plan and track activities against plan providing regular, accurate, and timely reports
  • Participate in functional and technical working groups and progress meetings
  • Ensure delivery of projects on time, within the scope and budget, manage successfully any changes that may arise. Manage and minimize the potential risks of the projects
  • Maintain comprehensive project documentation
  • Coordinate effectively the project team (including external stakeholders) ensuring that team members’ priorities are aligned
  • Act as liaison between the departments of the company and sub-contractors
  • Report directly to the COO of the Group


Qualifications


  • Degree in Management or Finance or Information Technology or other relevant disciplines
  • Experience in Project Management & Projects Delivery
  • Problem-solving mindset and adaptability
  • Customer, Quality and Results-oriented approach
  • Good communication skills and Teamworking spirit
  • Excellent command of the English language (written & oral)

What we offer

  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Success as defined by you. We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • A dynamic and fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues

Title: SysAdmin and DevOps Engineer
Skills: Data Integration|Data Mapping|Data Structures|Elasticsearch|Knowledge Graphs|Natural Language|Natural Language Processing (NLP)|Pattern Recognition|Query Languages|Speech Recognition|
Job Description:
About the job

About Cognizone


Cognizone is a scale-up in the domain of open & linked open data that brings expertise to its client to support them in their transition to publish openly their data. Cognizone works in multiple domains such as labor market & education, legislation, research projects to name a few.


@ Cognizone you’ll get involved with state-of-the-art technologies and innovative projects, but that’s not all!

You’ll be part of a fast-growing company.

You’ll feel inspired by your colleagues who are fully dedicated to their jobs.

You’ll work in a multi-national environment with colleagues from all over Europe (and even beyond!).


As a SysAdmin and DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing our infrastructure, ensuring seamless deployment of applications, and working closely with our development team to enhance performance and reliability.


Specific responsibilities:


  • Administer, monitor, and maintain Linux servers, network devices, and cloud infrastructure
  • Automate deployment, configuration, and management processes using tools like Ansible
  • Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, GitLab CI, or similar tools
  • Collaborate with development teams to optimize application performance and troubleshoot issues
  • Establish and enforce best practices for system security and reliability
  • Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure maximum uptime
  • Assist in capacity planning and scaling of infrastructure to meet business requirements
  • Stay current on emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously improve our processes or infrastructure


We would like you to have the following:


  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
  • At least 3 years of experience in system administration and DevOps roles
  • Strong knowledge of Linux server administration, including troubleshooting and performance tuning
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS and Azure)
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Proficiency in scripting languages such as Bash and Python
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
  • Strong communication skills to collaborate with your team
  • Good knowledge of English
  • Knowledge of French is a plus


Nice to have:

  • Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, RHCE, or similar)
  • Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools (e.g., ELK Stack, Dynatrace)


What we offer:


  • Get involved with state-of-the-art technologies and innovative projects
  • Be part of a fast-growing company
  • A competitive salary including benefits
  • A variety of challenging projects to test your skills
  • Feel free to visit our website: www.cogni.zone

Title: Project Manager
Skills: Account Management|Client Accounts|Client Relations|Communication|Communication Training|Oral Communication|Priority Management|Project Management|Service Delivery|Team Management|
Job Description:
About the job

OVERVIEW:


Guidepoint connects clients with vetted subject matter experts—Advisors—from our global professional network. Our clients leverage the insights and perspectives shared by our Advisors to stay informed and make better business decisions. Our multinational client list includes nine of the top 10 global consulting firms, hundreds of hedge funds (including five of the largest firms), and many of the largest private equity firms and Fortune-ranked companies. Guidepoint’s seventeen offices on four continents provide 24/7, quick and agile service. For more information, visit www.guidepoint.com.


Play a vital role in Guidepoint’s success.


As a Project Manager on the Client Service team, you will be responsible for managing key client accounts and overseeing a team of Associates to best match our clients with the right Advisors for their projects.


Who We Are:


  • Team-oriented and collaborative
  • Hard-working professionals who strive for excellence
  • Built-in mentorship to help you drive and improve your project management and customer service skills, to deliver excellent results for clients
  • Hands-on leadership to help you develop your career and provide opportunities for upward mobility within Guidepoint
  • Guidepoint is passionate about your career growth: Check out our Client Service Career Trajectory.


What YOU will own:


  • Serve as the main point of contact responsible for the day-to-day relationship and service delivery for our clients
  • Coordinate and work with a team of Associates to Execute requests for clients who are conducting research and due diligence on industry trends, market opportunities, new products and technologies, and more
  • Provide training to Associates regarding best practices around prospective Advisor sourcing, recruiting, interaction, and screening in order to provide the best Advisor match for each client project
  • Work closely with the Business Development teams to optimize your clients’ use of Guidepoint’s services
  • Work with other Project Managers on the team to provide industry guidance for projects


Experience YOU Bring:


  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree
  • 2 - 4 years of client-facing or account management experience
  • Previous experience managing a team


Skills YOU will Bring:


  • Outgoing personality with the ability to speak with people at all professional levels
  • Excellent priority management and ability to work within tight deadlines
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Effective time management and organizational skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work both individually and as part of a team
  • Fluency in English is required, and knowledge of additional languages is preferred (French, Spanish, German, etc.)
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment
  • PMP certification is neither required nor desired.


What We Offer:


  • Competitive compensation including a performance-based bonus
  • Private health insurance
  • Entrepreneurial environment, autonomy, and fast decisions
  • Casual work environment


Interview Process:


  • Meet your Guidepoint Recruiter!
    • Initial Candidate Screen
  • Meet the Guidepoint Teams!
    • Hiring Manager Interview
  • Mock Assessment (Role Dependent)
    • Complete a stimulated client request and gain more insight into the role
  • Interview Process Outcome


At Guidepoint, our success relies on the diversity of our employees, advisors, and client base, which allows us to create connections that offer a wealth of perspectives. We are committed to upholding policies that contribute to an equitable and welcoming environment for our community, regardless of background, identity, or experience.

Title: Senior System Engineer
Skills: Active Directory|Domain Name System (DNS)|Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)|Firewalls|Routers|System Administration|System Deployment|Virtualization|Windows|Windows Server|
Job Description:
About the job

On behalf of our client, a leading provider of tech solutions with presence in Greece & abroad, we are looking for a talented Senior System Engineer to join their vibrant team of engineers.

A day in the life of a Senior System Engineer

  • Support company systems and ensure performance & availability
  • Provide 2nd & 3rd Level support to external partners on network and Windows servers
  • Install, troubleshoot and Deploy Windows-based Web and DB Servers
  • Develop and maintain configuration management solutions
  • Visit clients on premise to provide technical support

Your day to day

  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a similar position
  • BSc in IT/Computer Science or related discipline
  • Good Knowledge in Virtualization Technologies
  • Experience in Windows Servers( DNS, DHCP, Active Directory)
  • Understanding of supporting LAN & WAN technologies
  • Experience in Networking switches, firewalls & routers

We love your personality if you

  • have client orientation
  • act like an owner
  • are in love with new technologies
  • enjoy being a team player

What’s in it for you

You will have the opportunity to work on innovative projects and within a pleasant environment in a fast-growing company with collaborative climate, strong corporate culture, and commitment to team building. Additionally, you will enjoy the following benefits:

  • Modern workspace
  • Private Insurance
  • Continuous training
  • Annual bonus scheme

Title: Senior
Skills: Asterisk (PBX)|Linux|SIP Trunking|Voice over IP (VoIP)|
Job Description:
About the job

Major shipping company with a fleet of more than 100 commercial vessels, and worldwide presence, is looking for a Senior VoIP/PBX Engineer to join its Information Technology department.


What you will bring, qualifications:

- A degree in Computer Network Engineering, Computer Systems Engineering, Computer Science or relevant discipline

- Expertise in VoIP networks design, deployment and troubleshooting (Asterisk [multi-site], FreePBX, Grandstream devices), in premise & cloud installation of Asterisk / PBX in Virtualized environment. SIP trunking, least cost routing, LDAP integration company wide, VPN site-to-site & road warriors, multi-site support, high availability setups

- Excellent knowledge of IP networks

- More than 3 years of enterprise IT operations experience

- Experience in bare metal servers commissioning (Dell, HP)

- Good communication skills and excellent problem solving abilities

- Very good use of English language, both spoken and written

- A positive, can-do attitude, promoting teamwork and delivering results


What you will do:

- Design and maintain the existing corporate VoIP infrastructure & services

- Implement and deploy corporate VoIP infrastructure & services

- Get involved in the design of the company's IT - VoIP operations services and procedures


Nice to have:

- Strong Linux (Debian, Centos) and Open Source Software ecosystem background (any certifications highly appreciated LFCS, LFCE, RHCSA etc.)

- Experience in virtualized environments preferably using Open Source solutions (Proxmox, KVM, Docker)

- Experience in High Availability/Disaster Recovery solutions

- Post graduate degree and professional training certifications

- IP networking professional certifications

- Experience in private and public cloud environments (certification is a plus)


What we offer:

- A competitive salary, higher than the IT industry average, provided candidate meets the requirements

- Full time employment

- Training and certification according to skills and work needs

Title: System Engineer
Skills: Analytical Skills|Computer Science|Problem Solving|System Administration|Systems Engineering|Systems Planning|Ticketing Systems|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

Sword Services Greece is seeking to recruit a high caliber, energetic individual to join our newly established Software Development team in Greece as System Engineer. The successful candidate will work in a multinational environment on a multitude of tasks supporting our core business in large International Information Systems. The company is currently expanding its activities in Greece offering an optimum career advancement opportunity for the successful candidate who should combine a relevant educational and professional background, with enthusiasm and eagerness.

What You Will Do...
  • Install, configure, maintain and troubleshoot a wide range of systems and services;
  • Participate in the design, implementation, and support of IT infrastructure;
  • Configure storage, servers, fabric switches and systems, Microsoft servers (Cluster Services, File Services, Active directory Services, Certificate Authority services), Virtual Infrastructure (VMware, Hyper-V), Linux and AIX Servers, infrastructure Kubernetes clusters, storages and backup systems;
  • Deploy new operating systems and features, middle ware applications as well as provide enhancements to existing applications and software;
  • Daily maintenance of the systems (e.g., patching, upgrading, scripting for automations, monitoring through corporate available tools, etc.) ;
  • Interact and negotiate with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure system-related products and services.

What Is Your Experience...
  • University/College Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or relevant technology field;
  • A proven record of 3-5 years working experience on administration of IT System Infrastructure with a mixed of Windows/Linux and Virtual/Cloud environment;
  • Excellent experience in development, systems’ implementation and applications;
  • Good Knowledge of OS (Windows, LINUX, AIX, Virtualized environments & Kubernetes);
  • Knowledge of cloud system technologies as Microsoft Azure and Amazon AWS will be considered as a plus;
  • Experience with systems planning, security principles, and general software management best practices;
  • Experience in ticketing systems (e.g., Jira);
  • Excellent command of the Greek & English language, both written and spoken;
  • Completed military obligations for male candidates.

Personal Characteristics…
  • Attention to detail and a strong sense of responsibility;
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Proactively manage own tasks and projects to agreed deadlines;
  • Ability to work effectively & efficiently with various diverse work teams (Development, Testing, Business Analysis & Project Management).

What We Offer To You…
  • Competitive remuneration package;
  • Meal voucher card;
  • Private medical plan;
  • Private pension plan;
  • Shuttle bus;
  • Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies;
  • Training & Development plan;
  • Employee recognition plan;
  • Work in a certified “Diversity Charter” company;
  • Teambuilding events;
  • Social responsibility initiatives;

Applications must be in the English language

Title: Release Manager
Skills: Communication|Key Performance Indicators|Manufacturing Process Improvement|Organization Skills|Problem Solving|Project Management|Release Management|Service-Level Agreements (SLA)|Software Development|iGaming|
Job Description:
About the job

iGaming:


If it’s iGaming, we know a thing or two. Light & Wonder’s digital team leads the global gaming market, providing jaw-dropping content and innovative software that powers the world's most successful online gaming providers.


Position Summary


Light & Wonder is the global leader in cross-platform games and entertainment. The company brings together 5,000 employees from six continents to connect content between land-based and digital channels with unmatched technology and distribution. Guided by a culture that values daring teamwork and creativity, Light & Wonder builds new worlds of play, developing game experiences loved by players around the globe. The company’s OpenGaming(tm) platform powers the largest digital-gaming network in the industry. Light & Wonder is committed to the highest standards of integrity, from promoting player responsibility to implementing sustainable practices. To learn more, visit lnw.com.


Light & Wonder is on the look out for a Release Manager to join the team and help us create better!


Global Planning 


  • Create a Game Content release calendar for both new and legacy titles based on the games roadmap 
  • Maintain the release calendar, steer it and propose optimizations based on discussions with relevant stakeholders 
  • Work alongside the Studio Portfolio Manager to understand games roadmap and how that feeds into release calendar 
  • Co-ordinate with the Programme team and studios on new market and legacy game releases 
  • Ensure the delivery of all releases to agreed timescales  
  • Ensure that mid- and long-term delivery risks are identified, understood, and dealt with in a manner that mitigates risks to the release content and schedule 
  • Ensure efficient release orchestration with all key stakeholders 


Release Closure


  • Own every release and oversee efficient closing in all relevant systems. 
  • Communicate product release closure status to the various stakeholders.  
  • Ensure release documentation is provided in a timely delivery. 
  • Ensure that releases have passed all internal and external requirements on all platforms. 
  • Ensure that release specific risks and issues are identified, understood, and dealt with in a manner that mitigates risks to current release scope, quality, and schedule. 
  • Schedule the release readiness reviews before deployment and milestone reviews after each release. 


Quality


  • Define and control the expected level of release quality of every release in collaboration with relevant stakeholders.
  • Promote and take actions to ensure that releases constantly meet defined quality standards.  
  • Lead the relevant Go-Live activities to deploy the content successfully. 


Process


  • Lead on the improvement of the content release process, including feeding back on improvements required to any areas that support this process. 
  • Actively participate in the recurring assessment and the evolution of the release pipeline .
  • Actively participate in the development of improved delivery methods, including data driven KPIs and SLAs.
  • Proactively gather and share updates on internal and external quality. 


People 


  • Manage coordination of release delivery teams and relevant stakeholders.
  • Create a culture of ownership within the release management function.
  • Promote a continuous improvement mindset within the team.


Qualifications


  • Proven experience with process improvements and ability to work with relevant teams to deliver objectives  
  • Working in multiple time zones 
  • Excellent communication and organization skills   
  • Problem-solving mindset and analytics skills  
  • Excellent at multi-tasking with ability to delegate  
  • Very good knowledge of Jira  
  • Working knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle 
  • Experience with build and release processes for content, preferably with exposure to dealing with multi-jurisdiction release processes 


Nice to have


  • LEAN Six Sigma 
  • Experience of working with Casino iGaming Industry   
  • Experience of working with DevOps and Agile methodologies 
  • Strong project management background  
  • Familiarity with Build automation pipelines such as Jenkins


Additional Information


Why would you enjoy working with us at Light & Wonder?


  • Competitive benefits, an open and supportive environment as well as a modern and exciting workplace.
  • The opportunity to interact with global teams on a regular basis and the possibility to switch teams and projects as you and our business continues to develop and grow.
  • Exciting projects with opportunities for creating positive change to our game engineering ecosystem.


And if that is not enough; you will get to enjoy a stunning work location and flexible working whilst we provide you with the guidance and development skills you need to progress quickly and enhance your career.

Title: Client Executive
Skills: Account Management|Brokering|Budget Proposals|Easily Adaptable|Interpersonal Skills|Presentations|Professional Manner|Programme Design|Service Standards|Social Influence|
Job Description:
About the job

Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC) is the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The Company’s 76,000 colleagues advise clients in 130 countries. With annual revenue over $17 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses. Marsh advises individual and commercial clients of all sizes on insurance broking and innovative risk management solutions. Guy Carpenter develops advanced risk, reinsurance and capital strategies that help clients grow profitably and pursue emerging opportunities. Mercer delivers advice and technology-driven solutions that help organizations redefine the world of work, reshape retirement and investment outcomes, and unlock health and wellbeing for a changing workforce. Oliver Wyman serves as a critical strategic, economic and brand advisor to private sector and governmental clients. For more information, visit mmc.com, follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter or subscribe to BRINK.


Marsh McLennan Greece is seeking candidates for Client Executive based in the Athens office!


What can you expect?


An outstanding opportunity has become available for an experienced Client Executive to join our sales team at Marsh. The successful applicant will lead account management process with a diverse range of clients.


What is in it for you?



  • Great team environment with energetic and supportive colleagues
  • Work-life balance
  • Professional environment where your career path is supported and really matters in our global organization
  • A team that strive to deliver best practice, market leading service and solutions with a focus on client service excellence


We will count on you to:



  • Manage a portfolio of predominantly large, complex and/or multinational clients, mainly on Construction and Energy Sector
  • Identify, and agree strategies for, clients’ risk management, risk financing and insurance needs and objectives
  • Work on all aspects of account management and service delivery to clients, ensuring client needs are identified and met in line with agreed service standards
  • Lead and sign off insurance programme design activities
  • Deliver consultancy services
  • Produce budget proposals and negotiate fees
  • Host client and insurer meetings in conjunction with specialist broker and client service teams
  • Strive to deliver best practice, market-leading service and solutions for all clients
  • Recognise and document revenue generation, growth and other opportunities by actively developing additional business from existing portfolio and other sources.


What you need to have:



  • University degree from a reputable university, preferably in Insurances, Risk Management or Engineering
  • 3+ years’ experience in insurance company or international broking house
  • Fluent in both written and spoken English
  • Ability to work effectively as a part of a team
  • Excellent communication, presentation and training skills
  • Experience in building and maintaining client relationships
  • Energetic, self-motivated and result-oriented
  • Proficiency with MS Office applications


What makes you stand out?



  • Dynamic with previous client facing experience
  • The ability to remain calm under pressure and be able to work flexibly when required
  • A professional attitude with excellent inter-personal and communication skills
  • Demonstrated experience in developing effective relationships and influencing stakeholders to achieve required outcomes
  • Ability to understand compliance related documentation and legislation to identify outcomes which meet business needs
  • Excellent time management and organisational skills
  • Flexibility and adaptability to take on tasks that may be outside your comfort zone


R_223867

Title: Experienced SAP Professionals
Skills: Attention to Detail|Business Planning and Control System (BPCS)|Commercial Awareness|Communication|Greek|Integrated Business Planning (IBP)|Oral Communication|Problem Solving|SAP Products|Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP)|
Job Description:
About the job

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


Our SAP Consulting team is involved in the Business Development and Implementation of solutions based on SAP solutions and platforms, for its wide and multi-Industry customer base in Greece and other European countries.


We’re looking for an Experienced SAP Professional to join our team and assist us with numerous projects in Greece and abroad.


The opportunity


In Consulting, we are building a better working world by transforming businesses through the power of people, technology and innovation.


As a member of our SAP Consulting team, you will contribute to SAP related engagements, helping our clients transform their business & maximize their performance. The specific position is based in Athens and requires working in multi-disciplinary teams to provide a range of services with focus in SAP implementation projects & methodologies.


We are looking for professionals with experience in the following areas:


  • S/4HANA and Industry Solutions
  • SAP for SuccessFactors
  • C/4HANA
  • BW/4HANA
  • ARIBA
  • BPC
  • IBP
  • SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)


To qualify for the role you must have


  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Economics, Finance, Information Technology, Engineering, HR Business Administration or another related field.
  • 3 - 5 years of professional experience with SAP and at least 2 full lifecycle SAP implementations
  • Previous working experience (and/or SAP implementations) in Financial Services, Utilities, Healthcare and Retail industries will be appreciated
  • SAP certifications will be considered as an asset
  • Previous working experience in international consulting environments (or projects)
  • Ability to work effectively within a team, strong communication and client facing skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication in English and Greek.
  • Willingness and ability to travel and work abroad for international assignments.


Skills And Attributes For Success


  • Strong analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills
  • An ability to interact with teams at all hierarchical levels
  • Strong attention to detail with a logical and methodical approach
  • Team working and communication skills
  • Excellent business acumen and commercial awareness


What We Look For


We are in a strong position to build on our existing client-base which varies by market sector, and by size. These projects are demanding an increased level of classic consulting skills - more intensive client interaction and up to senior executive and board level.


The team will be strengthened by experienced candidates who bring with them, or are willing to rapidly develop, both consulting skills and expertise in the effective business application of SAP technology.


What We Offer


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:


  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.


EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.


#betterworkingworld

Title: Windows System Administrator
Skills: Communication|Employee Benefits|Internet Information Services (IIS)|Microsoft Servers|Powershell|Service-Level Agreements (SLA)|Software Development|System Administration|Troubleshooting|Windows Server|
Job Description:
About the job

At Alpha Bank, we are shaping the future of banking in Greece.


Through our large-scale Transformation Program, we are changing the way we operate, the way we deliver results and the way we service our Customers.


· We understand our Customers’ needs and design experiences around them.

· We work in partnership and invite diversity of skills and perspectives.

· We are forward-thinking and drive continuous improvement.

· We make things happen; we execute quickly and focus on what is essential.


If you are a change enthusiast who sets ambitious goals and works with a sense of purpose, we want to get to know you!


Join our team and #be_part_of_tomorrow

#AlphaBank #TheAlphaBlueprint #Tomorrow


Job Description


The Windows System Administrator will be placed in the Bank’s IT Infrastructure & Operations and will be responsible for administering Microsoft Servers. The position will also assist in setting up, configuring, administering and recovering systems effectively and efficiently, communicating with team members and business stakeholders, and meeting very strict SLA’s. This position will also participate in Windows Clustering design and have the responsibility for implementing any configuration.

The ideal candidate will be self-motivated with strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills, and the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and work both independently and in a team environment.


What you will be doing


  • Keep the systems up to date regarding any security, vulnerability and risk framework of the organization.
  • Monitor the performance and availability of the systems and perform capacity planning.
  • Interacts with other team members and cross-IT staff on support and project activities
  • Develop automations.


What you need to have


  • A Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or any other relevant technical-oriented field.
  • One (1) to three(3) years of relevant experience as a System administrator.
  • English language skills (B2 level).
  • Excellent skills in MS Windows Server operating systems, scripting and system automation (PowerShell etc.).
  • Ability to communicate technical information clearly and concisely to senior level technical staff, engineers or vendors during troubleshooting or escalations.
  • At least three (3) years of experience in Microsoft Windows Systems Administration.


What will be considered an asset


  • Experience in DevOps Essentials.
  • Microsoft IIS experience.
  • Willingness to learn and develop.
  • Team player attitude, adaptability to change.
  • Ability to work well under pressure and follow deadlines.
  • Determination and focus on delivering qualitative results.
  • Strong communication skills.


What we offer


It’s all about our people. At Alpha Bank, you will enjoy:


  • A friendly and collaborative working environment that supports taking initiative and action.
  • A culture that centers around learning and continuous development and encourages everyone to bring their best self to work.
  • The opportunity to challenge your thinking through your participation in complex tasks and transformation projects.
  • Being part of a large organization with a leading role in the Greek economy and a strong presence in the community.
  • Flexible working options.
  • A competitive salary and benefits.


All applications will be acknowledged and treated in utmost confidence.

Yellow Pages is the longest-running Greek professional Advertising Agency, which has had the privilege of operating in the market since 1971, when the first printed professional catalog was published.
