Title: Clinical Supplies Officer
Skills: Clinical Supplies|Clinical Trials|Contract Research Organization (CRO)|Good Clinical Practice (GCP)|ICH|Inventory Management|Quotations|Supply Management|Timeline Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Heads, a global CRO, is seeking a Clinical Supplies Officer based in Athens (Greece) for its growing international hematology/oncology Clinical Trials program.


The Clinical Supplies Officer is collaborating closely with the Senior Clinical Supplies Manager and is responsible for the successful execution of supply chain activities for multiple clinical trials both domestically and internationally. The individual in this role will be responsible for the coordination, procurement and management of drug product supply as well as for other clinical supplies and distribution activities for clinical trials. The selected candidate will follow a general multiple myeloma training, as well as study specific training sessions.


This is a full-time job.


Main responsibilities:

  • Provide oversight for operations related to clinical packaging, labeling, distribution, returns and destructions.
  • Being responsible for IMP/non-IMP shipment orders according to supply plan or as requested by Clinical Trial Management team.
  • Initiate packaging campaigns with the assigned vendor and provide oversight to ensure on-time delivery.
  • Work closely with Clinical Operations to monitor and track clinical trial enrollment plans and actual enrollment.
  • On-going monitoring of recruitment, drop-out rates, and actual supply needs, critical to managing the study needs. Ensure continuous re-assessment of project needs as recruitment and the study progress.
  • Provision of ongoing budget tracking activities so that projects are run in accordance with client approved quotations.
  • Prepares any presentations required by Project Management and participates in Sponsor Calls..
  • Continuous track progress towards objectives and advise management of any issues impacting project timelines and provide solutions to the problems.
  • Collaborate with Clinical Project Managers to develop the drug distribution strategy for each trial and lead the development, review and acceptance testing of IRT or equivalent when applicable.


Education Requirements:

  • University graduate (Bachelor degree in Life and or Health Sciences is preferred) and post-graduate degrees are considered an asset.
  • Attendance in ICH-GCP training course is preferred.



Professional Experience requirements:

  • Experience in Supply Management, preferably in Clinical Supply Management or experience in Pharmaceutical Development or other Clinical Operations or Regulatory roles is preferred, but not required.


Join us to be part of a multidisciplinary team of highly skilled scientists and healthcare professionals in the forefront of Clinical Research within a friendly work environment.


Competitive remuneration package comes on top.

Title: Financial Analyst
Skills: Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA)|Communication|Corporate Actions|Efficiency Optimization|Financial Modeling|Macros|Presentations|Problem Solving|Project Finance|Quantitative Analytics|
Job Description:
About the job

Grant Thornton Greece is a member firm of Grant Thornton International Limited (GTIL), one of the leading organizations delivering audit, tax and advisory services. Every day we provide a diverse range of organizations with the kind of business and financial advice it takes to do this. Our ideas and insight empower our clients to make big decisions about the future and unlock their growth.

If you want to be part of this incredible journey Grant Thornton Greece has the opportunity for you. Our Strategy and Investments department is continuously growing, supporting clients of all different sizes across many different sectors and is currently seeking to employ a Financial Analyst.

Job Description

The key responsibilities of the Financial Analyst will include:
  • Supporting the full acquisition process of new projects;
  • Contributing to consultancy research and data analysis;
  • Supporting the project team to help our clients implement policies and strategies;
  • Building sophisticated financial models and draft reports and presentations in the course of our ongoing projects;
  • Interacting on a frequent basis with customers;

For whom we’re looking for:
  • At least 2-year experience in advisory services projects (corporate finance, project finance, business reorganization, efficiency improvement, project management);
  • Someone who holds a Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant area (finance, business, economics);
  • A professional qualification or part qualification (ACA/ACCA or CFA) will be considered as an asset
  • An experienced in financial modelling skills, capable of building sophisticated financial models. Prior experience in the use of VB and Macro tools with MS-Excel will be considered an asset;
  • Someone who is able to work in a team and to tight deadlines and flexible in approach
  • Someone who is able to communicate in English and is an experienced user of MS Office

To be successful as a Financial Analyst in Grant Thornton Greece you need the following:
  • Organizational and time management skills, ability to work on a step-by-step basis, analytical thinking, collaboration and problem-solving skills
  • Effective communication and rapport building skills
  • Ability to develop and deliver high-quality services and solutions
  • A customer-centric approach to finance and business operations
  • An extremely high work ethic
  • Motivation for career progression and development

What will we offer to you?
  • Friendly and dynamic working environment, in which you can develop your skills and competencies
  • Competitive remuneration and benefits package
  • A workplace with a strong focus on values and work-life balance and the joint aim to provide the best possible solutions for our clients
  • Formal training, coaching and mentoring
  • Your professional and personal success is our commitment

What will you need to do next?

Joining the Grant Thornton Greece family is easy! If you feel that you meet the criteria, have the passion to succeed and have the Grant Thornton values simply apply online by uploading an -up-to-date CV with your application and leave the rest to us.

We will ensure that all our resourcing activities are fair, transparent and consistent across Greece. We want to ensure that the candidate experience is of the highest professional standard. The Company is committed to providing equality of opportunity for all employees.

Title: Sales Director, Solar Power Business
Skills: Engineering|Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC)|English|Forecasting|International Sales|Negotiation|Procurement|Product Delivery|Sales|Solar Power|
Job Description:
About the job

A Bright and Exciting Opportunity


LESSO Group is a Hong Kong-listed (2128.HK) manufacturer of building materials with an annual revenue of over USD4.5 billion from its global operations.


LESSO New Energy, a flagship division of the Group, specialises in making solar panels, inverters, and energy storage systems, and providing new-energy solutions.


Founded in 2022, LESSO New Energy has been growing with spectacular pace. We have a production capacity of 7GW for solar panels in early 2023, and expect a global capacity of over 15GW by the end of 2023.


We are rapidly expanding our global team. We welcome aspiring professionals from around the world to join us for this bright and exciting journey of building a solar-powered world.


Responsibilities


1. Develop business relationships with distribution partners and expanding sales coverage of the company's products and services in Greece

2. Design, develop, and implement sales plan to achieve sales target for the country

3. Manage entire selling process, from forecasting and pitching to actual product delivery and payment collection, for your accounts

4. Develop a sales team in Greece

5. Represent the company in industry exhibitions and conferences in Greece

6. Report to Global Sales Headquarters


Requirements


1. Minimum 3 years of experience in selling PV products and services in Greece, or in a local EPC (engineering, procurement, and construction) firm specialising in the PV industry

2. Solid knowledge of the solar power industry and other new-energy industries in Greece

3. Fluent in English or Chinese

4. Strong communication and negotiation skills


Benefits


1. Attractive and competitive commission policy

2. Fast growth in market share, and greater opportunities for personal career growth

3. Collaboration with an international and diverse team from all over the world

Title: Data Engineer
Skills: Airflow|Business Intelligence (BI)|Computer Science|Data Modeling|Data Warehousing|English|Python (Programming Language)|SQL|SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)|SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


Accepted is a dynamic, modern, professional services company with remarkable culture and values. We are constantly trying to empower the culture of responsibility and freedom to everyone, by favoring autonomy and creating ownership. We give our people the freedom to “include themselves” to the job and we are forging a growth mindset. Peoples’ engagement is one of our most important goals. Thus recognizing the importance of our peoples’ career development, their growth mindset and continuous improvement, we are reinforcing their strengths by giving them the freedom to try something new and innovative within a safe and managed environment.


Are you in the job that feels right for you?


We desire a diversity of backgrounds and beliefs, which is also being reflected in our workforce. We are looking for world class software developers with strong foundations and continuous learning mentality, who want to join our team and our projects.


Job Description


As a Data Engineer you will - among other things - have the exciting task to:


  • Help your team build data pipelines to help extract data from various sources and transform and maintain the data
  • Assist with integration, consolidation, data cleansing and data structuring for use in analytics applications
  • Build and design data models and data architecture that improve accessibility, efficiency, governance and quality of data
  • work alongside colleagues in our highly innovative data insight team as well as collaborating with a wide range of teams across the business


Qualifications


Technical qualifications:

  • Proficiency in programming languages with a focus on big data (Python and Spark)
  • Proficiency in Sql with Minimum 5 years of professional development of ETL/ELT flows (especially using Microsoft tools)
  • Expertise in Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse (Kimball – Inmon methodologies and data modeling, Data Vault 2.0)
  • Experience with Cloud Platform and Architecture (ideally Azure)
  • Experience on Databricks ecosystem in Azure.
  • Solid understanding of Microsoft Business Intelligence solutions (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS)
  • Experience with orchestration tools (e.g. Airflow, Prefect, Dagster)
  • Familiar with Git or other version control tools


General qualifications:

  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Engineering or Statistics / Mathematics is mandatory
  • Relevant Master's Degree will be considered as a plus
  • Solid communications skills & problem solving attitude
  • Adaptability in high demanding environments and team spirit
  • Completed military service (male applicants)
  • Fluency in English is a must


Interview process


  1. Our first communication via phone call to get to know each other better
  2. Introductory video call with our HR team
  3. Technical Interview
  4. Time to offer


What to expect at the technical interview?

The interview has the format of a whiteboard interview, during which you will be able to talk about, present your expertise and exchange ideas around the technology stack requirements of the job vacancy, as well as more generic software engineering principles and best practices.


Where You'll Be:

  • Where in the world? For this role, it can be within Athens in which we have a work location at Agia Paraskevi
  • Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences
  • A cool work environment that promotes work-life balance


Benefits

What we offer:


  • Competitive salary and incentives relevant to seniority
  • Medical & Prescription | Dental | Life coverage
  • Annual bonus up to 1.5 salary based on your performance appraisal
  • Ticket Restaurants
  • Domain Trainings and Certifications
  • Constant coaching and a working culture which fosters continuous personal improvement
  • Mentoring Sessions all over the year
  • Career succession path relevant to performance appraisal



All applications will be treated as confidential.

Our vision is to provide a compelling work environment to work in, that promotes work-life balance, recognizing diversity and appreciating employees contribution, as well as respecting their individual values.Accepted is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, age, status as an individual with a disability

The Senior Database Developer will be working on Big Data platforms. He/she will be collaborating with other data engineers to develop advanced data management / analytics solutions.

Title: Project Manager
Skills: Client Delivery|Communication|Cooperation|Leadership|Problem Solving|Project Delivery|Project Management|Project Teams|Software Development|Teamwork|
Job Description:
About the job


Description

As a Project Manager you will be responsible for leading Client delivery teams and ensuring that all projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to a high standard of quality.

The ideal candidate will have experience in Agile delivery methodologies and software development life cycles, as well as a proven track record of successful project delivery.

Responsibilities

  • Champion the agile delivery methodology and lead several Clients’ Delivery Teams
  • Act as a Scrum Master for Delivery teams and facilitate all scrum ceremonies across all delivery teams
  • Facilitate all planning of the agile delivery teams to get all deliverables on time
  • Understand estimation processes and provide insights to the estimates of the project team
  • Ensure that delivery teams are appropriately resourced to deliver based on their needs
  • Work closely with the product owners to keep the backlog tidy and smoothly feed the delivery teams with work
  • Maintain the documentation of the deliverables across all delivery teams
  • Identify risks and mitigate them, escalating in advance to supervisor and/or Head of Architecture and Delivery where necessary
  • Protect the delivery teams by putting people before process and ensuring that energy is channeled to value
  • Propose ways to improve all aspects of project management
  • Cooperate with other colleagues on issues and processed that require cross-functional cooperation
  • Participate in projects as a team member or leads projects as an accountable owner, contributing time, skills, and knowledge

Requirements

  • At least 5 years of experience as a Project/Delivery Manager or similar role in the IT industry
  • Strong understanding of Agile delivery methodologies and software development life cycles
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills
  • Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to manage multiple priorities and projects
  • Experience working with Android technology and e-commerce platforms is a plus

We offer

  • Competitive compensation depending on experience and skills
  • The individual career path
  • Social package
  • English classes with certified English teachers
  • Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
  • Flexible work hours

About EPAM

  • EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to positively impacting our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to learn and grow continuously. You will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential. EPAM is committed to providing our global team of 60,000+ EPAMers with inspiring careers. EPAMers lead with passion and honesty and think creatively. Our people are the source of our success, and we value collaboration, try always to understand our customers' business, and strive for the highest standards of excellence

Title: Digital Marketing Analytics Lead for HP.com
Skills: A/B Testing|Ad Serving|Digital Marketing|Display Advertising|Google Ads|Media Evaluation|Paid Social Media|Search Engine Marketing (SEM)|Search Engine Optimization (SEO)|Web Analytics|
Job Description:
About the job

HP is seeking an experienced Marketing Analytics leader who is passionate about optimizing the business through the intersection of marketing data and experimentation. As an Analytics Lead, you will partner cross-functionally to optimize various marketing initiatives and drive key performance indicators (KPI’s) forward for the hp.com online stores worldwide.

You will collaborate with digital marketing teams and be seen as a subject matter expert for interpretation of results and assessment of strategic initiatives. You will also work on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Role will require you to Lead and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives. Furthermore, you will act as an expert providing direction and guidance to process improvements and establishing policies. Frequently represents the organization to external customers/clients. Exercises significant independent judgment within broadly defined policies and practices to determine best method for accomplishing work and achieving objectives. May provide mentoring and guidance to lower-level employees.

Responsibilities
  • Experience working with Digital Marketing Channel Teams and Proven track record of supporting channels with Data and Insights
  • Drive material improvements to acquisition, retention, and customer lifetime value activities through analysis & experimentation of campaigns spanning across all channels.
  • Optimize media budgets and gross margins and serve as an extension to the demand generation team responsible for SEM, SEO, Paid Social, Programmatic, and other Marketing channels.
  • Strong Expertise in data analytics tools like SQL, R/Python with in-depth knowledge and understanding of business intelligence platforms such as Datorama, Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx, etc.
  • Experience in modeling techniques such as Multimedia Mix, Multi Touch Attribution, Predictive Analytics, etc.
  • Strong knowledge and working experience in Google Marketing Platform, especially in Analytics (GA 360, GA4), Google Tag Manager, Data Studio, Optimize
  • Exposure to Data Management Platforms and Customer Data Platforms
  • Expertise in the full spectrum of digital analytics including but not limited to tag management, web analytics, A/B testing, campaign optimization, audience management, paid media measurement.
  • Familiarity with AI/ML techniques applicable to marketing analytics
  • Evolve and refine measurement frameworks and KPIs for Customer Measurement
  • Develop program initiatives utilizing segmentation strategies based on customer behaviors, business drivers and economics, competitive environment and past program results.
  • Expertise in web analytics. Hands on experience on building dashboards and segmentation in Adobe analytics. Understand the different component of Adobe analytics.
  • Provide thought partnership in customer web/mobile engagement & journey, lifecycle activities and website optimization.
  • Develop program initiatives utilizing segmentation strategies based on customer behaviors, business drivers and economics, competitive environment and past program results.
  • Benchmark, communicate and track program results against plan.
  • Be able to quickly translate business problems to an analytical solution-based framework.
Education And Experience Required
  • Solutions-oriented thinker who can adequately assess and prioritize business needs and translate those into thoughtful and creative digital executions.
  • Analytical thinker with exceptional strategic planning and problem-solving skills
  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist, Data Analyst, or Data Engineer. Preferably for a digital media, MarTech, digital subscription business, and/or technology business
  • 3+ years' experience in experimentation design, A/B testing, propensity score analysis, linear regression modelling and/or probabilistic modelling at scale
  • BA or BS in Marketing or Data Science; master's preferred.
  • 7+ years marketing and project management or operational experience.
  • Experience in Marketing database such as MRM or CRM applications; statistics background a plus.
  • Demonstrable experience with digital marketing, SEM, social media and display advertising
  • In-depth knowledge of google trends and similar web with ability to think strategically on leveraging insights for campaign development.
  • Experience with GA360, AdWords, Display Networks or relevant digital experience platforms
  • Advanced statistics background for analytical positions preferred (advanced degree with research and statistical focus background).
Knowledge And Skills
  • Advanced understanding of marketing attribution including multi-touch & ML (Machine Learning)
  • Proven expertise in experimental design (including but not limited to A/B testing), principles of causal inference, and statistical techniques.
  • Deep understanding of components of Digital Marketing Programs: Audiences, Platforms (Facebook, Google, Programmatic), Creative and Measurement
  • Certification in Google AdWords/Facebook PPC is a plus.
  • Hands on experience with SEM Platforms and Adobe or Google Analytics
  • Familiarity with web design, tagging and marketing tracking parameters.
  • Proven ability to make trade-offs in the face of uncertainty.
  • Expert knowledge of marketing principles, practices, tactics, and tools.
  • In-depth knowledge of marketing activities, practices, and procedures.
  • In-depth knowledge of and/or experience in business and marketing strategies.
  • Excellent written/oral communications and analytical skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal and project management skills; ability to build and manage virtual teams.
  • Excellent negotiating and change management skills.
  • Ability to interface effectively with management team and functional disciplines.
  • Excellent influencing and consensus-building skills.
  • Excellent execution skills.
About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

Title: Online Data Analyst

Job Description:
About the job

We are hiring freelance English & Greek speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.


This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.


Requirements

  • You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Greece
  • Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Job Description:
About the job

What We Do: AI Service Management (AISM):


Aisera offers the world's first AI-driven service experience solution that automates operations and support for IT, Sales and customer service, making businesses and customers successful by offering consumer-like self-service resolutions to users. Aisera fast tracks the digital transformation journey with user and service behavioral intelligence that drives end-to-end automation of tasks, actions, and business processes. Aisera is a top-tier, VC-funded startup headquartered in Palo Alto, Calif. and a strategic partner with AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, ServiceNow and Salesforce.


Aisera has received numerous recognitions, including the following: Forbes AI50; CNBC Upstart 100 Top Startup; Gartner Cool Vendor; Red Herring Top 100 Global Innovator; CIO Innovation Startup Award; CIO Review Top ITSM Solution; Aragon Research Hot Vendor; TiE50 Startup Award; and Silicon Review 50 Most Admired Companies.

Our team members operate with a high degree of empathy for our customers and each other.

Title: Senior Systems Engineer
Skills: Analytical Skills|Computer Science|Domain Name System (DNS)|Linux|Problem Solving|System Administration|Systems Engineering|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


A day in the life of a Senior System Engineer


As a Senior System Engineer, you will work closely with a highly skilled team of domain experts to support a multitude of VMWare and Linux-based core infrastructure technologies.


Your main duties will be to:


  • Administer and design enterprise-wide infrastructure solutions based on VMWare & Linux
  • Plan and execute system Change Management tasks involving relevant datacenter technologies
  • Establish service automations
  • Fulfill service requests and resolve incidents
  • Coordinate with the DevOps, Network and Security Engineering teams as part of incident response, project implementations and architecture initiatives
  • Conduct technical evaluations
  • Interact and collaborate with all levels of the team to provide analysis, recommendations, and direction related to service functionalities.
  • Maintain the respective documentation of the relevant services, systems, and processes.


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, the leading IT company in Greece, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe. 


Qualifications

Title: Hotel Representative
Skills: Brochures|Communication|French|Guided Tours|Refunds|Service Quality|Service Standards|Tour Operators|Tour Packages|Travel|
Job Description:
About the job

About the Company

Meeting Point International is a leading Global Destination Management Company offering tailor-made products and concepts to a wide spectrum of Tour Operators and Travel Organizations worldwide. We provide first class destination management solutions such as; the provision of hotels, transfers, excursions, representation and all ground handling services.

As part of FTI Group, the third largest Tour Operator in Europe, Meeting Point is a worldwide company providing destination management services for travel professionals. Current destinations we operate in include popular Mediterranean holiday hot-spots such as: Spain, Greece, Turkey, Italy, Croatia and Cyprus, USA, the Caribbean, Thailand, the UAE, Oman and many others.


For our Meeting Point Hellas Team , we are currently looking for a Hotel Representative in Rhodes Island

Job Purpose Overview

Hotel Representatives are the face of Meeting Point and represent our company to our many guests. They provide guests with information and support during their stay to ensure that they have amazing holiday memories. Hotel Representatives also support the business through the sale of in-destination products and services.


Main Tasks and Responsibilities

Visit guests in hotel as per scheduled timings and provide engaging and informative welcome meetings with up to date information

· Handle travel problems, complaints or refunds in coordination with the supervisor.

· Coordinate with operations team to assure services provided are punctual

· Answer clients queries via telephone or mail on time and notify supervisor of the same.

· Maintain polite and formal dialogue with guests at all instances

· Provide full, accurate information about the destination, use promotional techniques and materials (brochures, discounts) to sell tour packages.

· Maintain an in-depth knowledge on all offered excursions from all destinations including timings and pricing.

· Determine clients’ destination preferences and advise them on appropriate service and cost.

Experience and Qualifications

·0-2 years of experience in a relevant industry OR 2-4 years of experience in a relevant industry and on-job practical training.

· Excellent communications skills particularly using the French language

· A naturally outgoing and friendly personality with a passion for service excellence to consistently deliver and demonstrate Meeting Point service standard


What we offer

· Competitive remuneration

· Excellent working environment

· Career development

Title: Process Engineer
Skills: Analytical Skills|Cost Reduction|English|Lean Processes|Mechanical Engineering|Problem Solving|Process Design|Process Engineering|Six Sigma|Total Productive Maintenance (TPM)|
Job Description:
About the job

SOVEL

is looking for a

Process Engineer

to join the team in Almyros-Magnesia



Sidenor, is looking for a Process Engineer for its SOVEL Steel Plant in Almyros-Magnesia. With 60 years of industry know-how and expertise Sidenor is the largest steel industry in Greece and constitutes the steel production and trading segment of Viohalco. Sidenor Group is a leading steel producer in Southeastern Europe with 6 production units in Greece, Bulgaria, Northern Macedonia and Cyprus.



The Group's products are available in more than 50 countries with a significant contribution to the economic growth, such as those of steel reinforcing for building and infrastructure projects, shipbuilding and various other industrial applications.



As a Process Engineer, you will report to the Production Senior Manager, and you will be responsible for the meltshop process design, operation and implementation. You will be assigned to improve hot metal processes in order to maintain efficiency, reduce cost and improve sustainability.



Your Role


  • Follow Health & Safety regulations in accordance with the company’s policies and standards.
  • Manage refractory material applications, operation & maintenance, across the complete hot metal process from the electric arc furnace to the continuous casting machine
  • Analyze workflows within and across all sections of the mill to determine how the entire mill can work better
  • Develop, configure and optimize industrial processes from inception through to start up and certification
  • Assess processes, take measurements and interpret data
  • Design, run, test and upgrade systems and processes
  • Develop best practices, routines and innovative solutions to improve production rates and quality of output
  • Perform process simulations
  • Manage cost and time constraints
  • Perform risk assessments
  • Provide process documentation and standard operating procedures



Your Profile


  • Diploma in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline required
  • 2-3 years’ experience in similar positions
  • Knowledge of process related standards and process engineering software packages
  • Knowledge and working experience of advanced operations excellence methodologies, tools (Lean 6sigma, TPM) and process simulations will be a plus
  • Health & Safety Culture
  • Excellent command of English language (written and verbal)
  • People Management and organizational skills
  • Analytical thinking with interpersonal skills
  • Problem solving skills

Title: IT Administrator
Skills: System Administration|
Job Description:
About the job

About us
 This is your opportunity to join an internationally awarded service design and digital transformation agency. At Linakis.digital, we are committed to our ongoing evolution, with the dynamic foundation of our business growth being our dedicated and skilled people. We are proud of our friendly work culture and we continually aim to create an optimal employee experience that embraces a healthy work life balance.

Job Overview
 Our company is seeking an experienced IT Administrator to join our team. The ideal candidate must have a minimum of 3 years of experience in the IT industry and be able to provide technical support to our employees and clients, maintain the company’s computer systems, and ensure the security of our network.

Key Responsibilities
  • Provide technical support to employees regarding computer hardware and software issues
  • Install, configure, and maintain computer hardware and software
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to computer systems and network connectivity
  • Manage user accounts and access permissions
  • Monitor and maintain the security of the network and computer systems
  • Develop and maintain system documentation and user manuals
  • Keep up-to-date with industry trends and technologies to ensure the company’s IT infrastructure is up-to-date
  • Maintaining Web Servers (IIS, Apache, Nginx), Domains, Hosting and SSL renewals
  • Familiarity with Linux operating systems

Skills and Attributes to Succeed
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in an IT Administrator or similar role
  • Strong knowledge of computer hardware and software systems
  • Experience with Windows and Linux operating systems
  • Familiarity with network protocols and security
  • Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work well in a team environment

Nice to have:
  • Experience with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
  • Experience with Firewall and Switches Systems, preferable FortiNet products
  • Familiarity with virtualization technologies such as VMware or Hyper-V
  • Knowledge of database systems such as MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server
  • Ability to automate tasks using scripting languages such as PowerShell, Bash, or Python
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve complex issues.
  • Relevant certifications such as Cisco CCNA, CompTIA A+, Network+, Security+, Microsoft Azure Certificates or other industry-recognized certifications in networking and system administration.

Benefits of working with us
  • Competitive salary and Private Medical-Life Insurance
  • An individual and well-structured introduction and training when onboard
  • Training budget for personal & professional development
  • Friendly and highly motivated colleagues
  • Hybrid working model with flexible hours
  • Career progression opportunities
  • Continuous competencies development
  • A spacious workplace that promotes co-creation, collaboration, and improvement

About the job

Sword Services Greece is seeking to recruit a high caliber, energetic individual to join our newly established Software Development team in Greece as Project Manager. The successful candidate will work in a multinational environment on a multitude of tasks supporting our core business in large International Information Systems. The company is currently expanding its activities in Greece offering an optimum career advancement opportunity for the successful candidate who should combine a relevant educational and professional background, with enthusiasm and eagerness. ****

Personal Characteristics…

  • Detailed oriented;
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills;

Title: Sharepoint Administrator
Skills: Customer Relationship Management (CRM)|English|Information Technology|MCSA|Office 365|Powershell|SharePoint|SharePoint Administration|Troubleshooting|Windows Server|
Job Description:
About the job

At Alpha Bank, through our large-scale Transformation Program, we are changing the way we operate, the way we deliver results and the way we service our Customers.


· We understand our Customers’ needs and design experiences around them.

· We work in partnership and invite diversity of skills and perspectives.

· We are forward-thinking and drive continuous improvement.

· We make things happen; we execute quickly and focus on what is essential.


If you are a change enthusiast who sets ambitious goals and works with a sense of purpose, you can make a difference! We are a team that loves to jointly design, test and learn and we would love to welcome you in our tribe!


Join our team and #be_part_of_tomorrow


#AlphaBank #TheAlphaBlueprint #Tomorrow


Job Description


The SharePoint Administrator will be placed in the Bank’s IT Infrastructure & Operations Division and will be responsible for administering SharePoint Products (On-prem and Online). The position will also assist in setting up, configuring, administering and recovering other Windows Systems effectively and efficiently, communicating with team members and business stakeholders, and meeting very strict SLA’s.

The ideal candidate will be self-motivated with strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills, and the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and work both independently and in a team environment.


What you will be doing


  • Keep the systems up to date regarding to any security, vulnerability and risk framework of the organization.
  • Monitor the performance and availability of the systems and perform capacity planning.
  • Interacts with other team members and cross-IT staff on support and project activities
  • Develop automations.
  • Reviewing usage and activity reports and making adjustments to ensure optimized user-experiences.
  • Performing maintenance of the SharePoint platform and servers.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving SharePoint issues or malfunctions.


What you need to have


  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or any other relevant technical-oriented field
  • At least two (2) years of experience as a SharePoint Administrator (on-prem, Online)
  • Experience in Office 365 (especially SharePoint Online and Teams)
  • Excellent skills in MS Windows Server operating systems, scripting and system automation (PowerShell etc.)
  • Experience in Power BI reports
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills / Customer focus -client relationship management
  • Fluency in English language, both written & spoken


What will be considered an asset


  • Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA: 2012/2016)
  • Microsoft 365 Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate
  • Microsoft PowerShell experience


What we offer


It’s all about our people. At Alpha Bank, you will enjoy:


  • A friendly and collaborative working environment that supports taking initiative and action.
  • A culture that centers around learning and continuous development and encourages everyone to bring their best self to work.
  • The opportunity to challenge your thinking through your participation in complex tasks and transformation projects.
  • Being part of a large organization with a leading role in the Greek economy and a strong presence in the community.
  • Flexible working options.
  • A competitive salary and benefits.


All applications will be acknowledged and treated in utmost confidence.
