Title: Product Designer
Skills: Figma (Software)|Key Metrics|Product Design|Prototyping|Usability|Usability Testing|User Flows|User Interface Design|Visual Design|Wireframing|
Job Description:
About the job

Viva Wallet is a leading European cloud-based neobank, delivering the future of payments, now. With presence in 24 markets, it is the payment institution with the largest footprint in Europe. Viva Wallet's mission is to change the way businesses pay and get paid, offering truly unifying, yet localized, end-to-end advanced digital payments solutions and embedded banking services tailored to their needs. Latest innovations include "tap-on-phone Viva Wallet POS app" turning any Android mobile to a card terminal, and "Smart Checkout" payment gateway that can increase conversion by 21%. An advocate of sustainable cashless economy, Viva Wallet harnesses the power of their disruptive in-house technologies to provide digital payments services in 19 languages and 9 currencies, featuring over 24 payment methods.

We are looking for a talented Product Designer to join our product management team. If you genuinely love what you do, you are driven and passionate, then we want to hear from you. We love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution that truly solves customer needs and you, as Product Designer, will be running user testing and product discovery workshops.

Once that's done, you will be part of its implementation in cooperation with the engineering team in presenting the final solution during the design reviews. We are not stopping here, we believe in continuous improvement, so you'll review the performance of the release, identify learnings and find ways to enhance it.

More specifically as a Product Designer, you will:


  • Work closely with developers to see design through to implementation
  • Identify the key metrics for the projects you are involved in and take ownership for achieving their success
  • Create user flows and wireframes to build user interface mockups, prototypes
  • Collaborate and communicate on a daily base with the Design Team, Product Managers, Engineers, Data Analysts, and other colleagues to understand requirements and provide solutions
  • Present product ideas to team members for brainstorming
  • Contribute to research initiatives (usability tests, surveys and interviews)
  • Keep up to date on current industry trends


Requirements

  • At least 2 years of experience in Product Design
  • A portfolio featuring examples of product design work
  • Strong design skills across iOS, Android and web platforms
  • Experience with Figma design, prototyping and external library management
  • Ability to think at a high level about product strategy and clearly articulate design decisions
  • Ability to understand technical implications of design decisions
  • Ability to take initiative
  • Love to solve problems and be challenged
  • Strong UX focus and understanding of human behavior
  • Keep eye for detail
  • Excellent use of English and Greek (written and oral)
  • Clean visual design sense
  • Team player with excellent communication skills
  • To be a constant learner. You will be always growing — both personally and within the team
  • Familiarity with HTML and CSS (optional)

Please make sure that you have included in your application a sample link of your UI/UX Portfolio. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.



Benefits

  • A competitive salary (based upon your skills and experience)
  • Annual bonus based on targets' achievement
  • Private medical and life insurance
  • Integrity, teamwork, transparency, and regular feedback to develop your skills
  • A chance to grow within a fast-moving European Fintech Company / Neobank

Title: Project Mechanical & Process Control Engineer
Skills: Control Logic|Control System|Control Systems|Distributed Control System (DCS)|English|HAZOP Study|Mechanical Engineering|Piping and Instrumentation Drawing (P&ID)|Process Control|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

MYTILINEOS is a leading global industrial and energy company with a strong presence in all five continents covering two business Sectors, the Energy Sector and the Metallurgy Sector, is currently seeking to hire a Project Mechanical & Process Control Engineer.


Responsibilities:

  • Control & safety systems design (DCS, Integrated Control system, PLC, ESD).
  • Design Review of Instrumentation & Control design, including control logic diagrams, P&IDs, system descriptions, technical specifications, datasheets, I-O database, architecture block diagrams.
  • Technical evaluation of Vendor’s I&C documentation & equipment.
  • Coordination with other engineering disciplines, e.g., Process, Electrical, Mechanical.
  • Performance of Control Systems FATs.
  • Participates and supports Hazard & Risk analysis studies, HAZID, HAZOP, SIL assessment & verification.
  • Provides technical assistance, support and troubleshooting to the site commissioning personnel.
  • Involves in interface, project meetings with Vendors, other disciplines, Customer representatives.


Requirements:

  • Engineering Degree or Diploma in Mechanical Engineering
  • 3-5 years of experience in a relevant position (power, oil & gas sector)
  • Excellent knowledge of the English language.
  • Strong knowledge of computer applications, especially MS Office.
  • Critical thinking & troubleshooting capability.
  • Previous Site/Commissioning experience is a plus.
  • Communication skills.
  • Confident to deal with management, Customer.

Title: Technical Support Intern
Skills: Communication|Computer Engineering|Computer Science|Customer Support|Emerging Technologies|Information Technology|Interpersonal Communication|Operating Systems|Technical Support|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

Transforming the Future with the Convergence of Simulation and Data

Technical Support Intern

Do you like a challenge, are you a complex thinker who likes to solve problems? If so, then you might be the new Altairian we are searching for. At Altair, your curiosity matters. We pride ourselves on a business culture that enables open, creative thinking, and we deeply value our employees and their contributions towards our clients' success, as well as our own.

Job Summary

 What You Will Do:
  • Provide Licensing support for Altair's suite of products
  • Provide Installation support for Altair's suite of products
  • Support customers on the Altair One cloud platform
  • Communicate with customers, collect their requirements, present solutions and gather feedback
  • Documentation workflows and communicate improvements to the program management team
  • Write and maintain Knowledge Base articles related to Licensing, Installation and Altair One in the Altair Community Portal

Basics

 What You Will Need:
  • Must be at least a Junior (undergraduate) currently, pursuing a degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Strong Interpersonal and communication skills (English, B2 or higher).
  • Must be driven and excited to learn new technology.
  • Have a good understanding of various operating systems
  • Must be a team player, able to work well with others as well as independently.

Preferred
  • Experience with Linux
  • Familiarity with creating digital content
  • Familiarity with Scripting

How You Will Be Successful
  • Envision the Future
  • Communicate Honestly and Broadly
  • Seek Technology and Business “Firsts”
  • Embrace Diversity and Take Risks

What We Offer
  • Outstanding Work/Life Balance
  • Collaborative environment
  • Flex Time
  • Competitive salary

Why Work With Us

Altair is a global technology company providing software and cloud solutions in the areas of product development, high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists, and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.

Our vision is to transform customer decision making with data analytics, simulation, and high-performance computing and artificial intelligence (AI).

For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation, and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. To learn more, please visit altair.com .

Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD

At our core we are explorers; adventurers; pioneers. We are the brains behind some of the world’s most revolutionary innovations and are not only comfortable in new and uncharted waters, we dive in headfirst. We are the original trailblazers that make the impossible possible, discovering new solutions to our customer’s toughest challenges.

Altair is an equal opportunity employer. Our backgrounds are diverse, and every member of our global team is critical to our success. Altair's history demonstrates a belief that empowering each individual authentic voice reinforces a culture that thrives because of the uniqueness among our team.

Title: Project Manager
Skills: Analytical Skills|Commercial Awareness|Communication|Customer Relationship Management (CRM)|Hospitality Industry|Problem Solving|Project Cost|Project Management|Project Managers|Technical Competence|
Job Description:
About the job

ANICON is currently recruiting for Project Managers (Construction) for our Athens Office to service projects in Athens and multiple projects across Greece.


Due to continued success in securing projects throughout Athens and the surrounding regions in Greece, we are looking for dynamic Project Managers, with a strong focus on the Private Sector, to join our experienced team based in the Athens Office.


You will work with our team through an exciting growth phase for the business and will play an important role in helping to achieve or aim of influencing and building the more equitable, resilient and prosperous future we deserve.


Our projects relate to a variety of high profile local and international clients in the residential, hospitality and commercial sector giving our Project Managers a diverse and exciting workload. This is a fantastic opportunity for professionals looking to work in a growing, dynamic and sociable office and make a real impact. In return, we will reward you and provide the necessary support to take your career to the next level.


Responsibilities:

  • Provide high quality project and programme management standards across the whole project lifecycle;
  • Advise clients on the project cost, programme, risks and issues;
  • Lead and manage multi-disciplinary professional teams;
  • Lead communications and relationships with clients and their stakeholders
  • Produce monthly reports including project programmes, risk registers etc.
  • Implement effective and efficient communication tools.


Requirements:

  • Experience in leading and managing a multi-disciplinary team.
  • Experience in the adoption and management best practice Project Management techniques
  • Experience of both pre and post contract Project Management responsibilities and be able to deliver this service effectively to Clients.
  • The ability to manage a project throughout its lifecycle.
  • Hold or be working towards RICS Qualified or similar Project Management Qualification.


The Individual:

  • A courteous manner with a high level of professionalism - the ability to liaise with colleagues at all levels.
  • A disciplined thinker and analytical, numerate, problem solver who has the judgement and the capacity to think complex issues through and develop effective solutions in a timely fashion.
  • The drive and self-motivation to have achieved a degree qualification and to continuously develop their technical and behavioural skills.
  • Ability to work and communicate effectively within multidisciplinary teams.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • An ability to influence others by sound judgement and good sense
  • These roles have excellent prospects for an individual who has a strong ambition to progress and enjoys working collaboratively within a vibrant team. As well as technical competence, we are looking for someone with the ability to think laterally, who possesses first class communication skills, has strong commercial awareness, who will provide an exemplary service to our Clients.


ANICON is committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we value applications from all backgrounds, cultures and ability.


ANICON recognise that there are many well qualified people who are looking to further their career, but who cannot commit to full time employment. We support flexible working arrangements and are interested to discuss how we can accommodate individual requirements.

Title: Business Analyst
Skills: Analytical Skills|Business Requirements|Communication|Functional Specifications|Manuals|Oral Communication|Problem Solving|User Acceptance Testing|User Requirements|User Stories|
Job Description:
About the job

With more than 20 years of proven experience, QUALCO is a leading Fintech solutions provider, offering a wide range of analytics-driven, highly scalable enterprise software solutions in over 35 countries worldwide. Our end-to-end technology solutions cover a wide range of needs for Banking, Financial Services, Utilities, Insurance, Retail organisations, and beyond.




We are currently looking for a Business Analyst to join our team. As a member of this team you will focus on supporting commercial, technical projects and initiatives, in the IT areas of CRM and Integration. Your role will focus on the delivery of client engagements, by understanding clients' objectives, aligning your work to these objectives and setting personal priorities, liaising with others across all lines of business and taking accountability for own and team results.

Qualifications:

  • Communication skills: Understand clients' needs and their business flows (e.g. Banks), via business analysis and convert them into functional requirements i.e. acting as the "translator" between business and technical teams. Acts as a bridge between technical and business aspects both for the client and the firm and analyze the needs of large systems and breaking them down into smaller manageable parts.
  • Synthesize clear takeaways from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods.
  • Own and develop trusted relationship with associated areas within the organization.
  • Update documentation framework by drafting processes, user manuals, policies and all documents accompanying IT as well as non-IT initiatives.
  • Evaluate current operating models and design new ones in accordance with clients strategic objectives.
  • Coordinate with Product Managers and/or third parties to analyze business requirements communicating the proposed approach to the respective division managers.
  • Ensure business integrity in terms of what has been built is aligned with the new business requirements so that the proposed solution has consistency with what the company already has built and what it stands for.
  • Work with and facilitate cross-functional teams to ensure that client's business goals are addressed through IT as well as non-IT initiatives.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders of the respective divisions to understand new business requirements or change requests and provide feedback on possible solutions for implementation with the associated risks.


Requirements

  • University Degree in Business or Software Development Field.
  • Master's Degree in Business Administration, Finance or Information Technology will be considered a plus.
  • Familiarity with various operating systems/languages and databases as well as understanding of IT strategic solutions.
  • Minimum of 2-4 years in IT projects preferably in the Financial Services/Banking.
  • Experience as a consultant and/or in projects related to Loans products will be considered as an asset.
  • Experience in business process design and understanding of applications with preference in CRM, ERP, RPA and BPM.
  • Produce high quality work products (such as user requirements, functional specifications, user stories, user manuals, UAT scenarios).
  • Software Development Process experience will be considered a plus.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information.
  • Well organized, self-driven, flexible and able to work in a high-volume, fast-paced, and deadline-driven environment.
  • Passion to work in a multidisciplinary teams and projects.
  • Creativity and analytical thinking to solve complex problems.
  • Self-motivation for continued learning and development.
  • Commitment to providing excellent quality work and building client relationships.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in both formal and informal settings.
  • Excellent knowledge of MS Office.
  • Fluent in English and Greek, both written & spoken.


Benefits

On top of a challenging work environment, we are offering:

💸 Competitive compensation, ticket restaurant card, and annual bonus programs
💻 Cutting-edge IT equipment, mobile, and data plan
🏢 Modern facilities, free coffee and beverages, and indoor parking
👨‍⚕ Private health insurance, onsite occupational doctor, and workplace counselor
🏝️ Flexible working model, hybrid/remote benefits & home equipment benefits
🤸‍♂️ Onsite gym, wellness facilities, and ping pong room
💡 Career and talent development tools
🎓 Mentoring, coaching, personalized annual learning and development plan
🌱 Employee referral bonus, regular wellbeing, ESG, and volunteering activities

Your race, gender identity, expression, age ethnicity, or disability make no difference in Qualco Group. We want to attract, develop, promote, and retain the best people based on their abilities and behavior.

Disclaimer: Qualco Group collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties. We will keep your resume in our database for any future consideration. In case you want to be deleted from our database, please contact us.

Title: Superintendent engineer
Skills: Marine Engineering|Maritime Industry|Mechanical Engineering|Naval Architecture|Team Spirit|Technical Support|Troubleshooting|Vessel Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Maran Dry Management Inc., one of the world’s leading ship management companies and part of the Angelicoussis Group is looking for an experienced and motivated Superintendent Engineer.


Key Responsibilities

  • Monitors the performance and maintenance of the assigned vessels through the screening of technical records and reports;
  • Ensures vessels compliance with PMS;
  • Instructs Chief Engineers on the actions to be taken in order to correct performance & technical deficiencies. Supervises repairs until corrective action is verified;
  • Raises and monitors requisitions for spare parts following analysis of performance/inventory reports/vessels’ requisitions;
  • Attends and inspects assigned vessels at defined intervals;
  • Attends dry dockings and repairs;


Candidate must have

  • Degree in Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering or Mechanical Engineer
  • Minimum 2-3 years of office experience in a similar position of a reputable bulk carrier company
  • On board working experience will be considered an asset
  • Experience in New Buildings Site Office will be considered an asset
  • Fluent in English (oral and written)
  • Team spirit, multi-tasking and crisis resolution ability


This position requires frequent travel.


The Company offers an attractive compensation and benefits package and a friendly working environment. All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Assistant Accountant
Skills: Accounting|Analytical Skills|Attention to Detail|
Job Description:
About the job

Howden Hellas Insurance & Reinsurance Brokers S.A., member of Howden Group Holdings, is seeking to hire an Assistant Accountant.


The successful candidate will support the Fiduciary department by performing administrative tasks, including processing and recording transactions, account reconciliation, preparing reports and budgets, fielding communications with clients and vendors, fact-checking and filing.


Key responsibilities:

  • Internal communication with departments to finalize monthly production.
  • Controlling/assisting in reconciling claims.
  • Reconciliation of clients’ balances.
  • Collections of monthly client balances.
  • Preparing accounts payable checks for distribution.
  • Ensuring timely payments, taking a proactive role in managing and collecting receivables.
  • Handling banking needs for clients, including routine monitoring of bank account balances.
  • Communicating and corresponding with clients & intermediaries.
  • Monthly group insurance reconciliations and creation of annual spreadsheets.
  • Overviewing of the balances of insurance and reinsurance companies.


Key competencies/skills:

  • Analytical thinking and problem solving.
  • Attention to detail with an ability to reconcile complex accounts.
  • Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
  • Accurate, efficient, organized, and agile, with the ability to prioritize tasks as needed.
  • Effective communication with internal teams and external stakeholders.
  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills.
  • Teamwork Oriented.


Key qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting and/or Finance.
  • Excellent use of Greek and English language (oral and written).
  • Computer literature (MS Office, excellent use of Microsoft Navision and Power BI is considered as a plus).
  • 1-3 years of experience in a treasury department (ideally in an insurance related company).


For all males: military (national service) obligations must be fulfilled.


Position: permanent contract

Location: Athens Premises-Headquarters


Our firm offers a competitive remuneration package according to proven experience and skills, learning & development opportunities, Life & Health Insurance scheme and continuous support on career growth through a network of 10.000 professionals in more than 90 territories.

Interested applicants should forward their Curriculum Vitae to hr@howden-brokers.com by quoting Fin/AssFid-Mar 23.


All applications will be considered in strict confidence; however, only relevant profiles will be considered in the recruitment process.

Title: National Geographic Day Tours Operations Specialist | Athens
Skills: Client Relations|Communication|English|New Product Rollout|Operations|Product Promotion|
Job Description:
About the job

The National Geographic Day Tours Operations Specialist will be responsible for coordination and quality supervision of National Geographic Day Tours (NGDT), ensuring a consistent delivery of a high-quality standard of service, including but not limited to, operational training, best practice documentation, operational guidelines and manuals to deliver National Geographic Day Tours


This role will be the link between National Geographic and TUI MM teams Destinations delivery, Operations Hubs, L&D and Billing in order to successfully implement Day Tours and setting the base for implementation in future destinations.


This is a locally employed position and is offered as a Seasonal Contract. You must have the right to live and work in Greece before applying. If you live in Europe and would like to work abroad – please search for our 'flexible' jobs.


About The Job


  • Act as a single point of contact with Nat Geo team, compile reports on the feedback received from cruise lines on the NGDT and share these with Nat Geo. In the same time will need to act on the comments received by Nat Geo directly and provide a resolution as response.
  • Act as a single point of contact between the project leads and the Ops and delivery team for the duration of the project roll out and implementation
  • Coordinate with the destinations the guides allocation to the NGDT, the training (onboarding and progress) and the set up in our systems as well as monitor the guides performance
  • Work with Learning & Development in perfecting the guides training based on the guides feedback and ensure that all Ops and Delivery colleagues working with the NGDT are fully trained


About You


  • 2-3 years’ experience in ground operations with several clients and multiple destinations
  • High knowledge of the cruise industry and Shorex processes
  • Very good communication skills, able to develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients and colleagues
  • Good analytic capabilities
  • Takes initiative and is able to find solutions and come up with improvement plans for operational issues
  • Travel availability
  • English proficiency


About Our Offer


  • Competitive salary and benefits as standard
  • Career progression opportunities in more than 50 countries worldwide
  • Develop yourself as part of a friendly, richly diverse and virtual international team
  • Exceptional approach to your learning - access to free learning platforms & language lessons


TUI Musement is a leading Tours & Activities business. It combines a scalable digital platform with local service delivery, to offer excursions, activities, tickets and transfers in more than 50 countries worldwide. There are over 130,000 ‘things to do’ in all major holiday and city destinations, which are distributed through B2B partners, via the Musement and TUI websites and direct to TUI customers. We also offer services to cruise lines through Intercruises Shoreside & Port Services in ports worldwide.


TUI Musement sold around 10 million excursions, tours and activities delivered by our international colleagues located around the world and is one of the major growth areas of TUI Group.


We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.


#TUIJobs #TUIMusement #LetsTUIIt

Title: Εκπρόσωπος πωλήσεων Sme-Soho
Job Description:
About the job

Η MYTILINEOS, μία από τις κορυφαίες βιομηχανικές επιχειρήσεις της Ελλάδας με ισχυρή διεθνή παρουσία στους τομείς δραστηριότητας Μεταλλουργίας, Ηλεκτρικής Ενέργειας & Φυσικού Αερίου, Ολοκληρωμένων Έργων & Υποδομών και Διεθνούς Ανάπτυξης Ανανεώσιμων Πηγών & Αποθήκευσης Ενέργειας, αναζητά να στελεχώσει τη θέση του Εκπρόσωπου Πωλήσεων Sme-Soho για την περιοχή της Αττικής, με έδρα το κατάστημα του Περιστερίου, για την Δραστηριότητα της Εμπορίας Ηλεκτρικής Ενέργειας και Φυσικού Αερίου.

Κύριες Αρμοδιότητες:

Η θέση αναφέρεται στον Υπεύθυνο Πωλήσεων Λιανικής και περιλαμβάνει τις παρακάτω αρμοδιότητες:
  • Εύρεση πελατολογίου με σκοπό την σύναψη σύμβασης Ηλεκτρικής Ενέργειας, σε οικιακές και επαγγελματικές παροχές.
  • Εύρεση πελατολογίου σε περιοχές που υπάρχει διαθεσιμότητα Φυσικού Αερίου, με σκοπό την σύναψη σύμβασης σε οικιακές και εμπορικές παροχές.
  • Ανάλυση των αναγκών του πελάτη με στόχο την παρουσίαση των βέλτιστων λύσεων.
  • Οργάνωση ημερήσιου και μηνιαίου πλάνου επισκέψεων, με σκοπό την βέλτιστη αποτελεσματικότητα.
  • Ευρεία γνώση και παρακολούθηση της αγοράς, δίνοντας ανατροφοδότηση στην εταιρεία.
  • Προσήλωση στην επίτευξη ποσοτικών και ποιοτικών μηνιαίων και τριμηνιαίων στόχων, που ανατίθενται από την εταιρεία

Requirements
  • Πτυχίο ΑΕΙ/ΤΕΙ/ΙΕΚ
  • Δίπλωμα αυτοκινήτου
  • Γνώση της αγγλικής γλώσσας
  • Τουλάχιστον 3ετής προϋπηρεσία σε θέση πωλήσεων, ιδανικά στην αγορά της ενέργειας ή της κινητής / σταθερής τηλεφωνίας.
  • Δραστήρια και δυναμική προσωπικότητα με όρεξη για δουλειά.
  • Δημιουργικότητα και άνεση στην επικοινωνία.
  • Υψηλή διαπραγματευτική ικανότητα.
  • Προσανατολισμός στον πελάτη και στην επίτευξη στόχων.
  • Ευχέρεια με την τεχνολογία και τις προσφερόμενες λύσεις προς τους πελάτες.

Title: Game Tester Opportunity!
Skills: English|Game Design|Game Development|Game Mechanics|Google Sheets|Microsoft Excel|Nintendo Switch|Problem Solving|Quality Assurance|Xbox One|
Job Description:
About the job

Are you passionate about videogames?

Are you an avid gamer looking for testing opportunities?

Do you want to be paid to play avant-garde games yet to be released on the market?

If you answered yes to any of the above, this opportunity is definitely for you!


Company Summary:

MoGi Group (TransPerfect Gaming Division) is an award-winning multilingual video games services company dedicated to world-class translation, localization, player support, games testing, cybersecurity, tool development, art design, and community management services. Our successful community management and player support departments support countless exciting games and titles worldwide, helping developers to manage their communities in multiple languages, while our localization department helps bring games of all genres to the world in over 50 languages.


Position Summary:


We are looking for gamers with different gaming preferences and different backgrounds from all around the world to join us in playtests, which is basically playing a game and providing feedback while performing specific tasks, giving you a chance to play games before anyone else, having your voice heard, and getting paid while you're at it!


  • Participate in playtests to evaluate video games and provide feedback on the game's gameplay, graphics, sound, and other aspects, as well as the overall player experience.
  • Working as part of a team by communicating and sharing knowledge via the provided chat channels.
  • Following and completing checklists, documents, and surveys as required.
  • Completing all other tasks that are deemed appropriate for the role and assigned under the project.


Essential skills, qualifications and experience:

  • 18 years of age or older.
  • Passionate about the gaming industry, with a strong understanding of video game mechanics and design.
  • Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal, to provide clear and concise feedback.
  • Able to follow instructions, with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Motivated to learn new skills while working collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Working knowledge of Excel or Google Sheets.
  • Flexibility to work non-traditional hours if needed.
  • A high school diploma or equivalent is required (a degree in computer science, game design, or a related field is a plus, but not required).


Desired skills, qualifications and experience:


  • Previous experience in playtesting, or a background in Quality Assurance or game development.
  • Familiarity with bug tracking software and other tools commonly used in game development.
  • Advanced knowledge of analytics and data management.


Essential for set-up:


  • Own a Gaming PC that can run any current games at least on low settings
  • Processor: Intel i5 / AMD Ryzen 5 (or equivalent)
  • RAM: 8GB>
  • GPU: 2GB> VRAM
  • Own one of the following gaming consoles: Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch
  • A headset with microphone.
  • A Discord account.


We also have other opportunities such as full-time or part-time Functional or Localization Game Testers in our studios around the world, as well as embedded testers within development teams for those who have specific knowledge (coding, audio design, art, etc.). To find out more, please fill out the survey in the link below and you will be contacted if your profile meets the criteria.


https://link.edgepilot.com/s/1f05749f/R9UCF5r9XUWnqs6PYtKK_w?u=https://ecv.microsoft.com/VQgJiZJ0tD



MoGi provides equal employment opportunities to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.


We celebrate diversity as one of our core values and we have a clear goal: to be an inclusive workplace where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay and do their best work. Together with passionate, creative and collaborative colleagues, we are working to ensure accessibility is for everyone.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Skills: Analytical Skills|Business Administration|Business Analysis|Consulting|Interpreting Data|Presentation Skills|Problem Solving|Reporting & Analysis|Strategy|
Job Description:
About the job

efood is a constantly evolving environment, and we strive to innovate and raise the bar on customer experience in the last mile and delivery industry! We focus on continuous innovation and introduction of pioneering new services and as our operations are expanding in new areas, our business is enriched with complexity and diversification.


We are currently in search for an experienced Senior Business Analyst who will work closely with our Executive Team and our Business Leaders across divisions. This role will focus on analyzing and interpreting data and information, and providing valuable insights and recommendations to our Top Management.


What you’ll do:

  • Collaborate with Senior Management across divisions to collect valuable insights and information
  • Analyze and interpret data to unearth issues and comprehend the causes
  • Track KPIs, compile unified reports and present findings to the executive team
  • Formulate recommendations and solutions with attention to the Executive Team’s requirements and provide practical advice
  • Develop and implement detailed project plans to drive changes and improvements
  • Organize and execute assigned business projects
  • Provide guidance for any occurring problems, challenges and issues


What you’ll need:

  • Broad knowledge of the many facets and diverse areas of business and market forces
  • 4+ years of experience as a Business Consultant, Business Analyst, or similar role in Consulting firms - Big 4 experience will be considered an asset
  • Excellent analytic skills and knowledge of reporting tools and business analysis models to effectively present actionable insights at various levels throughout the organization
  • Ability to synthesize data and problem-solving skills in order to provide solutions and recommendations that will increase profitability and efficiency
  • High operational and strategic acumen; logical and quick thinking, with the ability to take into consideration multiple dependencies
  • Strong interpersonal, negotiation and presentation skills
  • BSc in Business Administration, Engineering or similar; MSc/MA/MBA will be an advantage
  • Excellent verbal and written communication in Greek and English


What we offer:

  • We recognize qualitative work and we want our people to feel appreciated! That’s why we offer an attractive remuneration package for what you bring in!
  • We share a passion for food, so you will certainly appreciate the ticket restaurant card 💳 to spend in restaurants and/or food supplies. We are efooders after all!
  • We take care of you with Private Medical & Life Insurance from day #1 to keep you healthy and safe!
  • We want you to grow with us 🚀 ! And to help you keep improving, we provide you access to our online training platform where you can study 📖 topics for your personal and professional growth!
  • Are you a cappuccino lover ☕? Do you desperately want a cookie? Our inhouse cafeteria got you covered!
  • If you want to stay in shape 🏋️ , our in-house gym awaits you fully equipped!


Life @efood

At efood, no day is the same as the one before!


efooders know that working and having a good time aren't the opposite and that’s why every day at efood is a new adventure!


We always aim higher and we thrive in finding solutions to push our limits further! We care about our customers, our employees, our society.

We seize every opportunity to celebrate achievements and milestones, but we also celebrate small things (like Fridays!)


Every efooder is part of a fast-growing multinational company, with endless opportunities for professional growth and acquisition of new skills! We have an established, yet super creative and fun working environment, with talented and ambitious people whose ultimate goal is to maintain efood as the ideal workplace! [In 2021, we were honored with a 3rd place award from the Great Place to Work® Institute]


Hungry enough to join us?

Title: Solutions Architect
Skills: Computer Science|English|Java|JavaServer Faces (JSF)|Model-View-Controller (MVC)|NoSQL|SQL|Software Development Methodologies|Spring MVC|Web Services|
Job Description:
About the job

We are looking for a Solutions Architect with experience and passion in technical analysis and holistic solution design of future capabilities and features that drive customer value. In this role, you will be a member of team responsible for designing, developing and testing in order to create software solutions aligned to the needs of the business and external customers.


Your daily work routine will include:

  • Guide a software project from inception to actual implementation and delivery;
  • Be active part of the development team and contribute during the development cycle;
  • Assess and propose technologies to ease project development and ensure sustainability;
  • Gather, clarify, address and potentially challenge clients' requirements;
  • Facilitate communication and remove impedance points between teams;
  • Mentor and train team members while circulating re-usable techniques and building blocks throughout the account;
  • Set and address quality concerns from a contractual viewpoint;
  • You love to work in an environment, which appreciates diversity and you can prove high ethical standards;
  • People pride you with a can-do attitude.



Requirements

  • BSc in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field;
  • Minimum of 10 years of professional experience as a software engineer in a corporate environment;
  • Proven multi-year working experience as a software architect;
  • Excellent experience in either Spring or Java EE;
  • Experience using modern architecture modelling techniques such as C4;
  • Solid experience in full-stack application design and development, notably in RESTful web services, dependency injection frameworks and server-side (JSF, Spring MVC) or client-side (Angular) technologies;
  • Solid experience of relational database management systems or NoSQL/messaging systems;
  • Understanding of the Agile Software Development methodologies;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (B2 or higher);
  • Good team spirit and accountable for working in a multi-cultural and international environment.


What is in it for you?

  • A permanent contract with a compensation package that includes private medical insurance, meal vouchers, mobile plan, etc.
  • Learning opportunities, in-house trainings, continuous coaching.
  • Fun, respectful and supportive work environment that promotes work-life balance.
  • Mobility opportunities to work abroad, in case of interest, as we have various job openings in our Group.


Why Trasys Greece?

  • Strong team spirit attitude.
  • Dynamic, intelligent, agile and talented teams.
  • Large-scale challenging international projects.
  • Allows you to take the ownership of your work from the beginning, having specific responsibilities.
  • Active and meaningfully present in various IT communities (MoT, Angular, JHUG, etc.).


Trasys Greece, part of NRB Group, is an equal opportunity employer who welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

Title: Senior Backend Engineer (.Net)
Skills: .NET Core|.NET Framework|Amazon Web Services (AWS)|Back-End Web Development|C#|English|Git|Microsoft SQL Server|Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)|
Job Description:
About the job

Do you want to be part of the next big thing in FinTech?


Our partner, a German based international player, is an independent payment service provider that offers a wide range of payment processing services, international merchant accounts and IPSP accounts. The company provides online and mobile payment solutions through its own international banking network, and its own connected alternative payment solutions.


A new development team is currently being established in Thessaloniki. It has both the mindset & originality of an exciting start up, with lean/agile practices, a flat hierarchy, but with the stability & security of being a world-famous organization as well.


For the new office in Thessaloniki (Greece) we are currently looking for a:


Senior Backend Engineer (m/w/d), in full-time and permanent employment. Onsite, hybrid or fully remote.


JOB DESCRIPTION

You enjoy laying the foundations for how engineering is practiced within the company. In order to design and deliver excellent product quality, you collaborate with cross functional and cross international development teams, as well as with team leads and architects. You will work closely with front-end developers to deliver consistent and reliable app experiences. Your primary goal is to improve usability for the customers.


Your responsibilities:


  • Implement the backend of the application and ensure that the software functionality matches the product requirements.
  • Develop and document comprehensive application logic and API endpoints.
  • Handle function-testing and maintain a excellent code quality.
  • Maintain comprehensive documentation (user guide, release log, etc.).
  • Follow agile principles.


Your profile:


  • Bachelor's degree (higher education in the field of Information technology desirable).
  • Previous experience as a Backend developer or similar role.
  • Technical background and good understanding of Software development life cycle (SDLC).
  • 3+ years’ experience with MSSQL, C#, .NET Core.
  • Experience with AWS, Docker containers, Microservices, Elasticsearch, Git.
  • Good knowledge of English.
  • Strategic mindset that results in new ideas that drives the business forward.
  • Team player with great problem-solving and good organizational skills.


What’s in it for you?


  • Competitive remuneration above market average.
  • Private health insurance & flexible work arrangements.
  • State of the art technologies.
  • Career progression, trainings, personal & professional development.
  • Employee Assistance Program - anonymous platform regarding mental health, financial aid, relationship advice, career advice etc.
  • Flat hierarchy & open-door culture.
  • Tech conferences, meetups & team events.
  • Top location & high-tech equipment.

Title: Senior IT Network Engineer
Skills: Cisco Systems Products|Firewalls|ITIL|Network Engineering|Routing Protocols|Troubleshooting|VLAN|Virtual Private Network (VPN)|Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP)|Voice over IP (VoIP)|
Job Description:
About the job

Are you interested in working with a leading education technology player, the global leader in the assessment and certification of professional skills industry with presence in more than 200 countries worldwide? If so, this is the chance to apply now! 📥


PeopleCert is looking for a Senior IT Network Engineer that will be responsible for the support of all IT activities. You will contribute your domain specific knowledge, skills and best practices working closely with a team of talented professionals who have created an ISO 27001 certified operational environment operating on 24/7 basis, based on a hybrid infrastructure with heavy virtualization on Cloud and Office 365 services.


As a Senior IT Network Engineer, your tasks will include the following:

  • Establish the networking environment by installing, configuring, testing, and documenting the equipment/network systems according to design and specifications.
  • Lead the performance of day-to-day networking tasks to ensure network reliability, availability, and serviceability within minimal interruption.
  • Provide technical support, respond to work orders and tickets from the users, analyze and solve reported network problems.
  • Collaborate closely with IT network manager, IT network team members as well as IT support and systems teams, with the ability to work on multiple office locations
  • Ensure your work and presence is aligned with company’s values “Quality - Passion - Integrity – Innovation,” at all times.


What we look for:

  • University Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field
  • 7+ years of hands-on networking experience.
  • Excellent command of the English language (C2 level certification desired, LanguageCert C2 LTE or C2 IESOL certificate would be a plus) and excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
  • Strong work ethic, team spirit, excellent problem-solving and technical troubleshooting skills.
  • General knowledge of VoIP technologies including QoS
  • Strong experience of Network Technologies including routing Protocols Static routing, VRRP/HSRP, VLANs, SPAN, Ethernet technologies, ACL, VPNs, SNMP.
  • CCNA, ACMA, SolarWinds or ITIL certifications will be considered a plus.
  • Network monitoring and Capacity Management experience e.g. PRTG, SolarWinds, Syslog
  • Excellent understanding of Network & Firewalls platforms (Cisco, Palo Alto, ClearPass)
  • Strong experience of Wireless Technologies Ubiquiti Networks
  • Hands-on experience in the development and production of complex documentation for installation, network topology, and troubleshooting of communications hardware or software. Experience working with Network Topology mapper or similar tools will be considered a plus.
  • Hands-on experience in the configuration of firewall security settings to access permissions groups for individuals and sets up provisions for incoming data.
  • Hands-on experience in network technology upgrade or expansion projects, including installation of hardware, software, and integration testing, as well as coordinating these activities without disturbing function of other systems.


What we offer:

  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Work in an international, dynamic and fun atmosphere
  • Two free vouchers for all certifications from PeopleCert's Portfolio per year for all employees
  • Complimentary coffee and tea in all our premises
  • Huge learning experience in using best practices and global environment
  • Constant personal and professional development
  • 100% Virtual Hiring Process


If you want to become a member of our international, dynamic and agile team that creates world leading software products, then we should certainly like to hear from you!


About PeopleCert


PeopleCert is a global leader in assessment and certification of professional skills, partnering with multi-national organizations and government bodies for the development & delivery of standardized exams. Delivering exams across 200 countries and in 25 languages over its state-of-the-art assessment technology, PeopleCert enables professionals to boost their careers and realize their life ambitions.


Quality, Innovation, Passion, Integrity are the core values which guide everything we do.

Our offices in UK, Greece, and Cyprus boast a culture of diversity, where everyone is different, yet everyone fits in. All of us at PeopleCert are committed to the reflection of the diversity and inclusion of our customers and the communities in which we do business.

Working on Home Office (HO) Secure English Language Tests (SELTs)

Any person who is engaged by PeopleCert to work on the SELT service must undergo a Background Check (the results of which must be acceptable to PeopleCert and the HO) prior to commencing their SELT duties. All SELT personnel will be required to complete a declaration (provided by PeopleCert) where the existence of any criminal record and/or bankruptcy must be declared.

  • If working on the SELT service in the UK, background checks will include:
  • A basic or enhanced Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) check
  • Right to Work in the UK check (including nationality, identity and place of residence)
  • HO security check (Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) or Counter Terrorist Check (CTC)
  • Financial background check
  • Employment reference check.
  • If working on the SELT service anywhere in the world (outside of the UK) personnel will undergo background checks that are equivalent to those stated for the UK.

In addition, if personnel are required to speak to SELT candidates they must be appropriately skilled in English language and, where SELT services are provided anywhere in the world (outside of the UK), the official language of the relevant country.


All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

“We Grow Together”.

Title: Junior Sourcing Manager
Skills: Analytical Skills|Business Administration|Communication|English|Microsoft Excel|Negotiation|Product Management|Retail Category Management|SAP Products|
Job Description:
About the job

Your Purpose

As a Junior Sourcing manager, you will be a member of the Commercial team, who will be actively involved in all aspects of sourcing management for both National and Own Brands Portfolio as well as in numerous of projects to ensure growth in sales & shares as well as customer (internal and external) satisfaction.


What you will focus on

  • Search for new suppliers, via different channels, network research, trade directories, participation in exhibitions, site visits, always aiming at the optimal category performance
  • Negotiate with suppliers regarding products that belong to the category of your responsibility, for the whole stores network, and ensure buying high quality products (national and own brands) under the best possible terms
  • Negotiate promotional activities, ensuring maximum product category effectiveness
  • Secure privileged agreements with different suppliers when it comes to associated costs by focusing mainly on saving resources while at the same time maintaining high quality and timely delivery
  • Resolve any arising matter in the context of the agreement implementation


What you have

  • BSc in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics, Finance, or any relevant field. MSc would be considered an asset
  • Working experience 2 to 4 years, in a relevant position at the FMCG sector or product management
  • Fluency in English language, both written and spoken
  • MS Office literacy. Knowledge of SAP would be considered an asset


What you bring

  • Customer oriented – excel at retail, results driven
  • Togetherness – value team’s ideas, each member’s uniqueness and safeguard belonging
  • Entrepreneurial Perception – solid understanding of the food market
  • Structured Thinking – follow procedures accordingly
  • Authentic Communication – deliver messages in a clear, compelling and concise manner
  • Analytical Thinking – numerical proficiency


Start your retail journey and live our values of care, teamwork, humor, integrity and courage


We care for you

  • Room to grow and develop via numerous opportunities for learning, professional development and career advancement
  • A safe and healthy workplace and a friendly environment which respects each employee’s individuality and personality


A place where everyone belongs

We strive to be a better place to work where our people reflect the markets we serve, where their voices are heard and valued, they find purpose in their work, and can grow and contribute to their fullest. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Skills: Angular|Apache|Communication|DevOps|Google Cloud Platform (GCP)|Microsoft Azure|Nginx|Oral Communication|RedGate|TypeScript|
Job Description:
About the job

With more than 20 years of proven experience, QUALCO is a leading Fintech solutions provider, offering a wide range of analytics-driven, highly scalable enterprise software solutions in over 35 countries worldwide. Our end-to-end technology solutions cover a wide range of needs for Banking, Financial Services, Utilities, Insurance, Retail organizations, and beyond.

We are looking for passionate DevOps Engineer with a broad range of technical knowledge to join our DevOps team that consists of full stack developers utilizing a variety of Java and Angular technologies. Above all we are looking for bright, interested, and motivated people, keen to take on a technically a challenging position working within a team atmosphere.

Responsibilities:

  • Administrate and maintain and optimize functions of the delivered software solutions;
  • Effectively troubleshoot and restore server services and network interfaces, that at necessary for the service offering;
  • Develop and document software to support our test automation infrastructure for our JAVA and angular applications;
  • Develop and document software to support our build and release DevOps pipelines;
  • Participating in all phases of the development life cycle, automating everything that can be automated;
  • Designing and implementing integration solutions in an ecosystem of disparate software products Implementing security and data protection mechanisms;
  • Contributing to application strategy and planning, and;
  • Staying up to date with emerging technologies and formulating concepts and ideas for additional products, tools, and services to be provided Design / develop integration interfaces.


Requirements

  • BSc in Computer Science, Network Engineering or Electronic Engineering;
  • 2+ years of professional experience as a DevOps Engineer;
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git and code branching practices;
  • Experience in web frameworks, ideally Java;
  • Familiar with container tools, such as Docker and good understanding of Kubernetes and Kubernetes' tools ecosystem;
  • Experience with configuration of at least one major web server, e.g., Nginx, Apache Http;
  • Experience in working with the Atlassian suite of tools (JIRA, Bitbucket, Bamboo, Confluence) will be considered a plus;
  • Knowledge in designing, building, and working with Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD) Pipelines;
  • Proven expertise with at least one cloud hosting platform (ex: AWS, GCP, Azure);
  • Familiar with agile methodologies and experience in estimation and time management;
  • Ability to work efficiently both on own initiative and within a team;
  • Experience with Source Code management (GIT);
  • Good knowledge of Oracle;
  • Basic knowledge of Angular 2+ and TypeScript;
  • Working experience with continuous integration practices and tools will be considered a plus;
  • Working experience with RedGate tools will be considered a plus;
  • Be self-motivated and demonstrate initiative, and;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


Benefits

On top of challenging work environment, we are offering:

💸 Competitive compensation, ticket restaurant card, and annual bonus programs
💻 Cutting-edge IT equipment, mobile and data plan
🏢 Modern facilities, free coffee and beverages, indoor parking, and company bus
👨‍⚕ Private health insurance, onsite occupational doctor, and workplace counselor
🏝️ Flexible working model, hybrid/remote benefits & home equipment benefits
🤸‍♂️ Onsite gym, wellness facilities, and ping pong room
💡 Career and talent development tools
🎓 Mentoring, coaching, personalized annual learning and development plan
🌱 Employee referral bonus, regular wellbeing, ESG and volunteering activities

Your race, gender identity and expression, age ethnicity or disability make no difference in Qualco. We want to attract, develop, promote, and retain the best people based only on their ability and behavior.

Disclaimer: Qualco collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties. We will keep your resume in our database for any future consideration. In case you want to be deleted from our database you can contact us.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Skills: Analytical Skills|English|Git|Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM)|Linux|Linux KVM|Linux System Administration|Problem Solving|STAT|Version Control|
Job Description:
About the job

M-STAT is seeking an enthusiastic and talented DevOps Engineer to join its IT team and work on M-STAT's data-centers.

Our tech team has a great expertise in the development and continuous operation of complex projects and services. We explore every platform’s API through demanding projects for big and well-known brands of the Greek Market.

Main responsibilities:

  • Work with the development team and provide a highly available platform for M-STAT services.
  • Conduct scheduled security reviews and audits that ensure the high level of security required by M-STAT customers.
  • Deploy and manage Linux servers that support M-STAT's core business.
  • Optimize performance and enhance reliability of M-STAT's platform.
  • Automate and monitor backups and other scheduled tasks.
  • Support M-STAT's staff with day to day operations.

Must-have skills:

  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in administration of Linux systems.
  • Strong Linux CLI experience.
  • Linux KVM experience.
  • Strong focus on information security.
  • Familiarity with ISO 27001 standards.

Desired skills:

  • MySQL administration.
  • Apache httpd administration.
  • Kafka administration.
  • Redis.

M-STAT offers:

Title: Production Manager
Location: Komotiní, Eastern Macedonia and Thrace, Greece
Skills: Analytical Skills|Communication|Cost Reduction|English|People Management|Plant Management|Problem Solving|Production Management|SAP Products|Teamwork|
Job Description:
About the job

Sunlight Group Energy Storage Systems is a world-leading technology company and provider of innovative industrial and off-road energy storage solutions, with 30+ years of experience. We specialize in the development and production of lead-acid and lithium-ion batteries for industrial mobility, leisure mobility, and ESS applications. These products are manufactured and assembled in Sunlight’s state-of-the-art facilities in Greece, Italy, Germany, Israel, and USA, and distributed to more than 115 countries.

Driven by our commitment to inspire our people and unlock their potential, and steadfast in our commitment to Diversity, Equality & Inclusion, we have created an agile and innovative environment that promotes open communication and collaboration, while offering continuous learning and development opportunities to the 3,100+ people we employ across the organization.


Keen to further empower our team by onboarding more talent, we are looking for an experienced Production Manager to join our Production Department in Komotini Recycling Plant, Greece. The role is responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of the daily production process, the efficient equipment operation of the factory as well as the implementation and achievement of quantitative and qualitative targets with the best functional and efficient way.



Key activities and responsibilities of this role includes:


  • Leads and monitors the production process; makes periodic checks and adjusts equipment or work practices according to standard operating procedures to optimize efficiency and maintain H,S&Environmental standards
  • Oversees production output versus specifications and is responsible for the achievement of agreed production performance targets
  • Monitors status of daily production requirements and oversees performance throughout the shifts.
  • Identifies issues in the production process and provides recommendations for improvement according to best practices and company’s standards for the efficient and according to schedule production volumes
  • Sets the production workflow to meet demands, specifications, and deadlines
  • Reviews personnel performance according to KPI’s, identifies training needs and provides coaching and direction as needed
  • Identifies recruitment needs, and ensures dissemination of know-how within the factory though training initiatives
  • Supervises and motivates the team, focusing on creating a high performing culture
  • Provides support for work relevant issues and recommends adjustments in job training to improve productivity and efficiency according to manufacturing principles.
  • Monitors and analyzes production KPI’s, providing weekly and monthly reports to Plant management; recommends improvements and creates respective action plans in partnership with various teams (e.g. AQ, HR, QC etc.)
  • Makes suggestions and cooperate with other depts to the Cost Reduction initiatives for continues improvement.
  • Monitors the safe usage of equipment, safeguard that all employees follow the H&S procedures as required and makes recommendation to H&S team for improvement if needed.
  • Monitors the efficient operation of equipment and practices to ensure the full Environmental compliance and provides recommendation for improvement of Environmental protection.
  • Provides support for work relevant issues and recommends adjustments in job training to improve productivity and efficiency


Job requirements

  • +10 years of working experience in Production and at least +3 in Managerial position in industrial/ manufacturing environment
  • BSc in Engineering (Mechanical, Chemical, Electrical) - MSc is a must
  • Excellent MS Office knowledge; SAP use will be highly appreciated
  • Fluency in English & Greek
  • Very good knowledge of health and safety regulations
  • Strong people management skills, self-motivation and teamwork mentality
  • Demonstration of analytical and organizational skills
  • Strong multi-tasking, decision-making and problem-solving skills



What we offer you


To start with, we give you the opportunity to thrive in a restless team and grow your potential in an innovative environment. As per your compensation and rewards package, this is a preview:

  • A competitive salary based on experience and topped up with other bonuses.
  • Company healthcare plan
  • Continuous learning opportunities. Allocated training budget that can be spent on books, online courses, or other training materials.
  • Established framework for career development
  • International mobility opportunities

Title: Site Engineer
Skills: Budget Management|Construction Management|Engineering|Residential Development|
Job Description:
About the job

Grammikos Group, a fresh, fast - growing residential development and investment company, is looking for an ambitious and experienced Site Engineer to join our team.

The Site Engineer will be an integral member of our core construction team. He/she will be responsible for the construction of the company’s projects, leading construction related engagements, overseeing construction activities, and ensuring the high quality of deliverables to Grammikos’ clients.

Qualifications:

- Degree in civil engineering / architect engineer. Master’s Degree is a plus.

- 5-8 years of professional experience in construction management of residential / hospitality projects.

- Hands - on experience in construction documentation.

- Experience in budget management.

- Experience in management and coordination of multiple construction engagements/Sub Cos.

- Solid corporate background.

Requirements:

- Ability to lead and oversee multiple tasks in parallel.

- Excellent use of MS Office and task management apps

- Know-how in use of AUTOCAD

- Excellent organization and time management skills

- Familiarity working with procedures and processes, yet, with an entrepreneurial mindset.

- Strong analytical skills.

- Negotiation skills.

- Problem solving and result - oriented attitude, positive thinking.

- Team player with affinity to multilevel communication.

- Strong verbal and written communications skills (both Greek and English).

- Ability to work individually and as part of a team.

As a member of Grammikos Group, you will be involved in the entire process of launching and implementing new development projects, from the early stages of handling the construction preparation, until the new owners’ step into their home. The company offers an exciting working environment with career development prospects.

If you feel you fit to be a Grammikos team member, and see this challenge as an opportunity, please send us your CV at: HR@Grammikos.com

Title: Technical Support Engineer
Skills: Acting|Customer Service|Customer Success|Networking|Product Service|Sales|Service Orientation (Social)|Technical Support|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

We are looking for engineers to provide Level 2 & 3 technical support for our Document Understanding Platform, named ImageTrust, to major global enterprise customers (Fortune 500 and more).


Summary / Role Purpose

The role of the Technical Support Engineer at Captonomy Consulting is a broad mix of infrastructure engineering, business process design and technical support. Offering an unparalleled opportunity to learn and grow, you can impact some of the largest institutions around the globe in several industries including finance and healthcare. As a Technical Support Engineer you will help tackle our customers’ greatest pain points and design end-to-end systems creating meaningful solutions. When required, you will collaborate with our core development team in order to deliver complete and comprehensive resolutions to break-fix issues and customized offerings.


What you will be asked to do/Your main duties will be:

  • Support and maintain customer installations who use our product (ImageTrust), which is based on Java and Typescript/HTML tech.
  • Perform System troubleshooting and problem investigation
  • Create and maintain the tickets in our internal ticket system
  • Create and update the knowledge base for known issues
  • Provide L2 & L3 support to end-customers’ product owners
  • Liaison with other teams to identify issues, and support issue resolution
  • Trigger investigations (registration of problems) to identify root causes and prevent potential impacts on the application (proactive monitoring)
  • Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams
  • Take ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution
  • Work in a flexible schedule: our Business Development team works in two shifts (10am-6pm and 2.30pm-11pm) to align with our parent US company,
  • Participate in the Release management of our System (from testing to generating patches or new binaries) and deployment
  • Write customization scripts/code in JavaScript and/or Java


As a candidate we would like you to have the following:

  • Education and degree (BS/MS/PhD) in Information Technology
  • 2-4 years of experience in similar position
  • Understanding of systems and networks (e.g. basic network protocols, operating systems, etc.)
  • Being able to write simple to intermediate code in JavaScript, Java and SQL
  • Have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills that can be applied to identify problems such as installation and configuration failures, integration misalignments, etc
  • Professional level proficiency with the English language is mandatory, both spoken and written, due to communication with English speaking customers
  • Military obligations fulfilled


What we offer:

  • Competitive salary based on qualifications + private health insurance for you and your immediate family
  • Continuous mentoring and learning opportunities for professional development of software development and business process management skills
  • A unique opportunity to learn new technologies and work on high-end products that are used by the largest corporations in the world
  • Excellent working environment in a modern office space
  • Proximity to public transport lines (suburban railway)


More info about the Company

Image Access (www.imageaccesscorp.com) is a leading US national specialist in information technology projects that demand mission critical complex document handling and enterprise-wide workflow. For over 30 years, Image Access has achieved outstanding success in integrating workflow and document management solutions within large public sector and Fortune 100 companies nationwide. Image Access implements large-scale, high-volume image, document and content management applications. Our expertise in enabling high-volume systems provides our customers highly efficient, cost-effective solutions that reduce cycle times and significantly improve processing efficiency.


You will be working for Captonomy Consulting, a subsidiary company of Image Access Corp which is the software-building company in the group, with offices at Vrilissia, Athens. Your on-site presence is required (this is not a remote job). If you are currently a non-Greek resident, you need to have the appropriate permit to live and work in Greece and you are expected to relocate by yourself.

Title: Γραμματέας
Job Description:
About the job

Η MYTILINEOS αποτελεί κορυφαία διεθνή βιομηχανική και ενεργειακή εταιρεία με δυναμική παρουσία και στις 5 ηπείρους με δύο επιχειρηματικούς Κλάδους, τον Κλάδο Ενέργειας και τον Κλάδο Μεταλλουργίας αναζητά να στελεχώσει τη θέση του Γραμματέως.

Κύριες Αρμοδιότητες:
  • Υποστηρίζει τους Προϊστάμενους Αδειοδότησης, Κατασκευής και Λειτουργίας ΑΠΕ και τα στελέχη διαχείρισης αδειοδότησης ΑΠΕ στις αρμοδιότητές τους και τον Δ/ντή σε συγκεκριμένα προγράμματα και θέματα, όταν απαιτείται.
  • Διαχειρίζεται προγράμματα και ενημερώνει αρχεία σχετικά με την παρακολούθηση της αδειοδοτικής πορείας των έργων σε συνέργια με το χρονοδιάγραμμα, σχέδιο ενεργειών και τις οδηγίες του Προϊσταμένου Υπηρεσίας Αδειοδότησης ΑΠΕ ή/και του Δ/ντή.
  • Συντάσσει αναφορές σχετικά με την Υπηρεσία Αδειοδότησης ΑΠΕ, προς τις άλλες Δ/νσεις με τις οδηγίες του Προϊσταμένου Υπηρεσίας Αδειοδότησης ΑΠΕ ή/και του Δ/ντή.
  • Συντάσσει τις αναφορές προς τις αρμόδιες Υπηρεσίες (ΡΑΕ, κα) με τις οδηγίες του Προϊσταμένου Υπηρεσίας Αδειοδότησης ΑΠΕ ή/και του Δ/ντή.
  • Διαχειρίζεται συμβάσεις και πληρωμές των εξωτερικών συνεργατών.
  • Να υποστηρίζει όλες τις εσωτερικές διοικητικές και οικονομικές διαδικασίες της Τεχνικής Δ/νσης.
  • Να παραλαμβάνει – αρχειοθετεί και προωθεί την εσωτερική και εξωτερική αλληλογραφία της Τεχνικής Δ/νσης
  • Να τηρεί γενικό πρωτόκολλο εισερχόμενης και εξερχόμενης αλληλογραφίας
  • Να εξασφαλίζει την ηλεκτρονική αρχειοθέτηση όλης της Τεχνικής Δ/νσης.
  • Να υποστηρίζει την εφαρμογή των διαδικασιών των Συστημάτων Διαχείρισης της Εταιρείας.
  • Να αναλαμβάνει τη σύνταξη των εξοδολογίων των ταξιδίων και μηναίων εξοδολογίων των Προϊσταμένων της Τεχνικής Δ/νσης.
  • Να ελέγχει τα εξοδολογία του προσωπικού λειτουργίας σταθμών ΑΠΕ και να παρακολουθεί μέσω του λογιστηρίου τη πληρωμή τους.
  • Να παρακολουθεί τις ανάγκες της Δ/νσης σε γραφική ύλη κλπ, εξοπλισμού γραφείων και να γίνονται οι ανάλογες παραγγελίες.
  • Να οργανώνει τα επαγγελματικά ταξίδια της Τεχνικής Δ/νσης, τις συναντήσεις εντός και εκτός της εταιρείας καθώς και τα ετήσια σεμινάρια και εκπαιδεύσεις.
  • Να παρακολουθεί τις εσωτερικές διαδικασίες της ΜΥΤΙΛΗΝΑΙΟΣ και να ενημερώνει τη Τεχνική Δ/νση
  • Να επικοινωνεί με Υπηρεσίες/Συνεργάτες όταν αυτό κρίνεται απαραίτητο.
  • Να αντικαθιστά την Βοηθό Αδειοδότησης, Κατασκευής, Ανάπτυξης & Λειτουργίας ΑΠΕ όταν απαιτείται

Requirements
  • ΑΕΙ ή ΤΕΙ Τεχνικής κατεύθυνσης/
  • Αγγλικά
  • 3-5 χρόνια σε παρεμφερή δραστηριότητα
  • MS Office
  • Ικανότητα στην επικοινωνία
  • Ικανότητα σε θέματα προγραμματισμού και οργάνωσης.
  • Γνώση οικονομικών θεμάτων.
  • Γνώσεις στο SAP θα εκτιμηθεί

Title: Information Technology Engineer

Job Description:
About the job

On behalf of our client, a global provider of IT solutions with great history, we are currently looking for a self-driven IT Engineer, to join its IT Infrastructure team.

Your day-to-day

  • Responsible for User Management & Technical Support
