Title: IT Business Analyst
Skills: Business Process|Business Requirements|Business Rules|Communication|Databases|Fit/Gap Analysis|Gap Analysis|IT Business Analysis|User Acceptance Testing|User Requirements|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


About Netcompany-Intrasoft


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


A day in the life of an IT Business Analyst


As an IT Business Analyst, you will be part of a highly skilled team that designs, develops, deploys, customizes, and supports the development and implementation of large-scale applications regarding E-Government and EU Institutions Projects.


Your main duties will be to:


  • Participate and/or lead the workshops with the customer, in order to gather business requirements and perform a fit/gap analysis
  • Undertake the writing of the Project’s Deliverables
  • Map user requirements to system capabilities
  • Participate in the implementation of the configuration, parameterization, and customization of software modules
  • Coordinate with the developers' team for software customizations
  • Monitor the implementation of software customizations of the provided systems
  • Perform Unit & Integration Tests of software customizations & custom development
  • Participate and/or lead the User Acceptance Test (UAT), support activities and act as a point of contact for the Customer’s Users
  • Act as liaison between the customer stakeholders and communicate issues raised by the Customer to the respective technical teams


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, a leading IT company, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts in Greece. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe.


Qualifications


If you have


  • Degree in Computer Science or relative discipline
  • Experience in Analysis and Design of information systems
  • Analytical thinking personality with problem-solving abilities
  • Effective communication and strong presentation skills
  • Fast learning skills and quick adaptation in complex business environments
  • Fluency in the English language


…then this position is suitable for you!


It would also be a plus if you had


  • Experience in Agile methodologies
  • Experience in ERP consulting and implementation
  • Experience with Business Process Model and Notation
  • Experience with Business Rules Management System
  • Experience in UAT
  • Experience in software development and databases


This position comes with


  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business), and fast career growth
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Land Manager
Skills: Communication|English|Financing|Greek|Negotiation|Organization Skills|Project Management|Renewable Energy|Wind Energy|
Job Description:
About the job

Who are we?

We, VALOREM are originally a French renewable energy Independent Power Producer (IPP) active in wind, solar, hydro and MRE. For almost 30 years, We’ve been working towards energy transition. We control the entire process of developing renewable energies, from studies to financing, construction and operation. Our services include the sale of electricity to corporate companies and utilities. Now with close to 400 employees, we are headquartered in France and are also active in Europe, Finland, Greece and Poland. We are looking for new colleague to join our team to make Green Transition happen.


Job Purpose

We are hiring a Land Manager to supervise the land securing of our RES portfolio in Greece.


You would be working with for example the following tasks

· Manage land securing of all VALOREM Greece Wind and Solar PV portfolio from early discussion with private and public landowners, to all type of land contracts negotiation and signature

· Ensure the project land securing process is going fast enough and according to the project timeline managed by the Project Manager

· Supervise the local real estate agents hired by the Company to obtain the cadaster information and to facilitate contacts with landowners

· Work closely with our lawyers to ensure the contracts signed are legally robust enough

· Register all type of land contracts and according to the procedures in place in collaboration with local lawyers

· Supervise the public land auction process with the Municipality and following the legal approach validated by the Management

· Inform on a regular basis the Project Manager of the project land securing progress, share without any delay any difficulties and propose solutions and/or alternatives

· Share with the Project Manager any relevant information gathered during local discussion with landowners and Municipalities about the project and the local context

· Inform the Country Manager about any new land securing opportunities detected in the Greek territory

· Responsible, together with the Project Manager about the image of the company on site and maintain an adequate level of business relationship with all local stakeholders

· Participate to local communication events as per requested and together with the Project Manager


Desired Background

· 3-5 years of experience as land manager / surveyor engineer and ideally in the renewable energy sector

· Passion for renewable energy industry

· Adaptable to changing conditions

· Can do attitude

· Commercially oriented, listening mode and strong negotiation skills

· Ability to communicate with both private and public landowners, including municipalities

· Comfortable in working in international environment

· Autonomous

· Good organization skills

· GIS knowledge is an asset

· Languages: Greek & English essential. Fluency in French is an asset.

· Driving license

· Ability to travel whenever necessary with overnight stays

What can we offer ?


  • Competitive salary
  • Additional benefits
  • Great colleagues and open team atmosphere
  • A chance to join us in building REN Valorem Hellas into a known and well trusted partner, customer and supplier in Greek renewable energy market
  • Contribute to the Green Transition / building renewable future


Location: Athens, Greece

Contract: Permanent, Full time

Title: IT Applications Engineer
Skills: Computer Science|Database Development|Databases|English|Planned Preventative Maintenance|Problem Solving|SQL|Scripting|Technical Support|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


Thenamaris is a global ship manager of high specification modern ocean-going vessels. We help deliver goods to people around the world, enriching their lives. We do this by safely managing a world class fleet of ships, providing the highest levels of service to our principals and clients. Thenamaris (Ships Management) Inc. manages Tanker vessels, Thenamaris ConBulk Inc. manages bulk carriers and containerships, while Thenamaris LNG Inc. manages LNG and LPG carriers.


Job Description


Thenamaris invites high caliber professionals with the requested qualifications to apply for the position of IT Applications Engineer in the Fleet IT Applications team of the Information Technology department.


The IT Applications Engineer is responsible for a set of IT applications that serve the company’s core marine processes. The role involves supporting and enhancing these processes with viable and sustainable IT solutions by managing, configuring and supporting software platforms, formulating their architecture and leading the implementation of integration processes across IT systems. In addition, the IT Applications Engineer co-ordinates with external vendors for integrating their solutions with existing company applications, and ensures the quality and timeliness of their deliverables. He/she promotes IT security by providing access to authorized users, maintaining data integrity and establishing proper controls. He/she remains up to date regarding technological developments and recommends future upgrades of software components in the company’s IT landscape.


The position is permanent and is based in Athens (Vouliagmeni) Greece.


Qualifications


To be considered for this role, you should meet the following requirements:


  • University degree (BSc and preferably also MSc) in Information Systems Management/Computer Science or related discipline. Alternative educational backgrounds will be considered only if the required technical knowledge applies
  • Proven professional experience of minimum five (5) years is required
  • Extensive experience in software/database development and SQL scripting
  • Working experience in shipping maritime sector in areas of Planned Maintenance, Safety and Procurement Cycle will be considered an asset
  • Excellent organizational, problem solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to work independently
  • Ability to collaborate effectively and perform as a team member
  • Proficiency in English at an oral and written level


If you are in search of a first-class working environment in the global ship management industry and meet the above qualifications, we look forward to receiving your application.


Additional Information


If you are in search of a first-class working environment in a dynamic fast-growing ship management company and meet the above qualifications, we look forward to receiving your application.


Please read the Thenamaris Notice on the Processing of Personal Data as well as our Privacy Policy.

Title: SAP Professionals
Skills: ABAP|Business Process Design|Full Cycle|SAP ERP|SAP Fiori|SAP HANA|SAP Products|SAP Projects|Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP)|Technical Specs|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description & Summary

The opportunity

We are a Global Partner of SAP with more than 9,200 SAP professionals in 61 countries and 129 live S/4 HANA projects, assisting organizations to get value from technology investments and bring together the skills to deliver improvements in people, processes, and technology.

Our SAP practice in PWC Greece has more than 60 professionals. Due to the continued growth of our practice and consistently high demand for technology services, we are now recruiting SAP Professionals for our team.

We are looking for SAP Applications Consultants in the areas of S/4HANA FI/CO/FICO/MM/SD/PM/PP/BPC modules, and ABAP Developers.

The role entails
  • Design of business processes with the use of SAP’s best practices.
  • Develop technical specifications for custom applications.
  • Assess ECC environments on the move to S/4 HANA.
  • Support SAP projects in migration, cutover, testing, training and integration.
  • Contribute actively in business development activities; participate in the RFP process; preparing the necessary documentation.

The successful candidate should have
  • University degree and preferably postgraduate studies in Computer Science, Finance, Business Administration, Supply Chain or other relevant fields.
  • Participation in >1 full cycle projects and at least 2 years of experience in SAP projects or support for Junior positions
  • Participation in >2 full cycle projects and at least 4 years of experience for Senior positions
  • Knowledge on Fiori use and setup is an advantage
  • Relevant professional certifications in SAP is an advantage
  • Understanding of industry specific operations in any of the following sectors: Consumer Products, Retail, Utilities or Shipping is desirable.

What’s in it for you

PwC is all about people, encouraging high performance and quality. At PwC, you will have:
  • Continuous training and career development opportunities whilst learning from a wide range of top professionals.
  • The chance to handle different projects for big clients.
  • Access to a global network of firms and global mobility opportunities.
  • Life and medical plan, rewards and recognition schemes, flexible working program, mobile phone etc.

Who we are

PwC in Greece is the largest professional services firm in the country, with premises in Athens and Thessaloniki and approximately 1700 employees. More than 250,000 people in 158 countries across our network share their thinking, experience and solutions to develop fresh perspectives and practical advice. This enables us to provide top-quality industry-focused assurance, tax and advisory services to our clients

Title: Organizational Design & People Analytics Sr. Specialist
Skills: Analytical Skills|Attention to Detail|English|Interpersonal Skills|Microsoft Excel|Microsoft Office|Presentation Skills|Problem Solving|SAP Products|SAP Successfactors|
Job Description:
About the job

About Us:


OPAP is the top gaming company in Greece and among the most recognized ones in its sector worldwide. We aim at establishing OPAP as a world-class entertainment and gaming company, having long-term strategic priorities focus on the customers, on the people, on the network, on the products and on the digital-technological capabilities. We are currently a highly esteemed employer, offering career opportunities and a unique work experience to exceptional professionals and talented young people, through our dynamic Selection & Recruitment Program as well as our Internship/Graduate Programs. Our main objective is to develop a high-performing Team by attracting new talents, as well as developing and creating stronger bonds between our people.





So what’s the challenge…


The Organizational Design & People Analytics Senior Specialist’s role is to act as a core pillar for the enhancement of business operational efficiency, clarity of accountabilities and effectiveness of OPAP grading structure. In addition, the job holder will generate insights and reports, leveraging data from various HR activities to enable accurate data driven decision making.


Your day to day will include:


  • Reviewing and assessing OPAP Group organization structures, and proposing improvements to meet operational needs in cooperation and alignment with business owners
  • Handling the analysis of job accountabilities and proceeding to the development of the job descriptions focusing on the enhancement of job clarity and ownership
  • Reviewing the changes or the modifications in job accountabilities and structures and assessing their impact to the business, to identify the relative weight of the jobs and safeguards their proper placement to company’s job banding framework
  • Supporting the reviews and provision of rationale on the proposed band changes, validating their accuracy in terms of organizational design principles and banding framework criteria
  • Cooperating with business owners and senior management and working closely with the HRBPs and other HR teams, for understanding business mandate and needs and creating the suitable solution
  • Safeguarding the availability of structures and job descriptions to all employees through the company’s online platform
  • Developing reports and presentation on all topics related with the team operations, e.g. organization structures, job banding, job accountabilities etc. according to requests from management
  • Supporting the development of career ladders and paths of the jobs enabling the career progression and advancement of the employees
  • Participating in the analysis of HR data and the preparation of HR dashboards and HR performance reports for all People related KPIs
  • Supporting the design and creation of automated reporting tools to improve the level of employee data analysis and assisting in the development of valuable management insights


What you need to succeed:


  • BSc in Economics, Business Administration, Psychology or other relevant field. MSc in Human Resource Management is desirable
  • 4+ years of relevant hands-on experience acquired from large organizations or HR consulting firms
  • Very good knowledge of HR systems and processes across HR functions
  • Very good understanding of the job analysis and evaluation methodology. Hands-on experience in these fields is strongly desirable
  • Exposure in the delivery of organization structure re-design projects
  • Strong familiarity with HR Applications (e.g. SAP SuccessFactors) and digital reporting tools e.g. Power BI, SAP Analytics
  • Strong business acumen
  • Excellent presentation skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
  • Excellent organizational skills, ability to prioritize work activities and adapt in changing conditions
  • A team player attitude with excellent interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate effectively with multiple teams and stakeholders
  • Experienced user of Microsoft Office and advanced user of Microsoft Excel
  • Excellent command of the English language (oral and written)




What we offer to our candidates:


  • Opportunity to work with #dynamic people full of #passion #integrity & #fun
  • Modern & award winning workplace environment
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Competencies’ & Career Development opportunities
  • Private health coverage



OPAP Group is an equal opportunity employer



Does this sound like you? If yes, we would love to meet you!

Title: Senior Project Engineer, Project Planning
Skills: Block Diagrams|Confidentiality|Diagram Design|Electrical Layouts|Flow Diagrams|Interpersonal Skills|Oracle Enterprise Manager|Oral Communication|Reactivation|Sensitive Information|
Job Description:
About the job

Operations Group


Transocean is focused on being the employer of choice for the drilling industry.


We are challenging ourselves every day to push the performance of the company through technological advances and passion for our work.


Job Summary


The Project Engineer will participate in the design development and modification of various structures, equipment and systems for conversion, refurbishment, and upgrades to mobile offshore drilling units. Position duties include development of work packs, scopes of work and procurement specifications, vendor expediting, and resolution of engineering issues arising in a global fleet. Supervise OEM and Third Party contributors to complete surveys and identified scopes of work. Responsibilities also include accurate scheduling, budget preparation, communication and presentations to integrate into the corporate stage gate process. Travel to worksites will be required and may be up to 40% per year.


Job Description


Job Description


Key Roles and Responsibilities


  • Coordinate with and supervise OEM’s and 3rd party contributors to conduct surveys, site visits, vendor surveillance, off-site planning
  • Attend rigs, shipyards, worksites, vendor facilities as required for surveys in support of project planning activities
  • Coordinate with OEM’s and 3rd party contributors in project estimating activities and cost reduction techniques
  • Develop and maintain dialog and interface with internal engineering stakeholders for scope validation
  • Plan and track project procurements with project managers and internal purchasing departments
  • Actively contribute to Marketing Bid Support efforts by providing well developed work scopes and accurate cost estimates as required during the production of Project Cost Workbooks and Reactivation Cost Workbooks.


Education:


  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering


Experience:


  • Preferred: 5-7 years of Offshore Oil and Gas experience
  • Must be comfortable review general arrangements, block diagrams, flow diagrams and other relevant OEM documentation used when developing work packs. A good understanding of ABS, DNV, API, and related industry regulations and standards is required.
  • Must have excellent organizational and interpersonal skills. Must be capable of simultaneously managing multiple tasks and coordinating the efforts of others contributing to solutions to engineering problems.
  • Must exhibit effective written and oral communication skills. The individual must be able to work independently and within a team environment. Should be a self-starter and able to take initiative as required. Must be confident acting on assigned tasks with minimal supervision.


Skills:


  • Good knowledge of project management techniques including planning, budget control, contract administration and resource management are a plus.
  • Ability to produce accurate project cost estimates within a compressed timeline.
  • Excellent organizational, time management, workload prioritization, critical thinking skills.
  • Ability to deal with frequent change and manage competing demands.
  • Ability to perform under pressure and deliver a quality work product.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal; Excellent interpersonal skills.
  • This position requires the individual to cultivate and maintain a broad network of resources in order to be successful
  • Proficiency in Microsoft applications, with particular focus on Excel, Word, PowerPoint. Advanced Excel skills are preferred
  • Able to read and understand MODU technical documentation including General Arrangement Drawings, Piping & Instrumentation Diagrams, Structural Drawings, and Electrical Schematics, Functional and Detailed Vessel and Equipment Specifications.
  • Must have a strong sense of accountability and be capable of maintaining a high degree of confidentiality with sensitive information.


Additional:


  • WORKING CONDITIONS: Work is performed in corporate offices as well as at worksite locations such as onboard rigs and in shipyards worldwide. The Project Engineer may be required to work more than 40 hours per week, including weekends.
  • Requires Specific Offshore Experience


Pre-Requisite/ Qualification


  • Must successfully complete pre-employment drug screen.
  • Must successfully complete pre-employment background check.


If you want to push yourself to great achievement, let Transocean develop your career.

Title: Executive Secretary
Skills: Administrative Assistance|Attention to Detail|Business Administration|Clerical Skills|Curriculum|Easily Adaptable|Events|Executive Administrative Assistance|Multitasking|Time Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Howden Hellas Insurance & Reinsurance Brokers S.A., member of Howden Group Holdings, is seeking to hire an Executive Secretary.


The successful candidate will provide high-level administrative support to High Executives and senior staff by handling a wide range of secretarial tasks in a timely and professional manner, organizing daily tasks, making sure that everything runs smoothly and all office needs are met.


Key responsibilities:

  • Providing high-level administrative support and assistance to the Executives and Senior Staff.
  • Managing an active calendar of appointments
  • Arranging complex travel plans.
  • Drafting agendas, developing, compiling, and distributing presentations
  • Performing general secretarial tasks including drafting letters, memos, invoices, reports, and other documents.
  • Reminding of important tasks and deadlines.
  • Liaising with suppliers and clients when necessary.
  • Receive and interact with incoming visitors, supporting switchboard activities when required.
  • Organizing events & conferences.
  • Maintaining databases and keeping accurate records.
  • Performing additional duties as assigned by Executives.


Key competencies/skills:

  • High degree of professionalism and responsibility.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Multitasking, effective organization, prioritization and time management skills.
  • Attention to detail, results oriented.
  • Adaptability, self-motivation, flexibility & Speed.
  • Problem solving mind-set, ability to effectively solve office-related issues.
  • Ability to work under pressure and unsupervised.
  • Teamwork oriented.


Key qualifications:

  • University Degree in Business Administration or equivalent - certified secretarial studies will be considered as a plus.
  • Excellent command of Greek & English, both verbal and written is a prerequisite.
  • Excellent knowledge of MS Office;
  • A minimum of 3 years' experience in a similar role supporting Senior Executives.


Position: permanent contract

Location: Athens Headquarters

Our firm offers a competitive remuneration package according to proven experience and skills, learning & development opportunities, Life & Health Insurance scheme and continuous support on career growth through a network of 10.000 professionals in more than 90 territories.


Interested applicants should forward their Curriculum Vitae to hr@howden-brokers.com by quoting ExeSec/Mar23.

All applications will be considered in strict confidence. However, only relevant profiles will be considered in the recruitment process.

Title: IT Solutions Architect
Skills: Archimate|Communication|Microservices|Oracle Certification Program (OCP)|Problem Solving|Software Development|Solution Architecture|Spring Framework|TOGAF|Technical Documentation|
Job Description:
About the job

Sword Services Greece is seeking to recruit a high caliber, energetic individual to join our Software Development team, being based in Athens as an IT Solutions Architect . The successful candidate will work in a multicultural environment supporting our core business in large Information Systems for the European Commission. The company is currently expanding its activities in Greece offering optimum career advancement opportunities for the successful candidates who should combine relevant educational and professional background with enthusiasm and eagerness.

What You Will Do...
  • Design and Review the architecture of Information Systems;
  • Analyze the integration of different information systems;
  • Produce software architecture documents, blueprints, best practices;
  • Assist in the technical documentation of the offered solutions to customers;
  • Communicate system architecture to technical and business audiences;
  • Define product solutions leveraging defined functional component model libraries and the product line architecture roadmap;
  • Propose IT products based on cost benefit analysis and research;
  • Define, document and develop best practices, design patterns and technology standards;
  • Provide technical leadership to development teams;
  • Research and monitor technology developments and industry trends, assesses their relevancy to the organization, and makes recommendations to enhance productivity
  • Analyze current solutions and identifies opportunities for improvements and automation
  • Contribute to the Architecture Repository and participate in the Architecture Board

What Is Your Experience…
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar;
  • Minimum 7 years of experience in software development of Information Systems;
  • At least 3 years of experience working as an IT Solution Architect;
  • Extensive hands-on experience with Java EE or Spring;
  • Experience providing technical leadership to development teams;
  • Experience working in Agile teams;
  • Experience developing applications on microservices architecture;
  • Familiar with TOGAF and ITIL.

Experience in the following technologies will be considered an asset :
  • Experience in SOA, Data Processing, Streaming (preferably Kafka) and Cloud Native Architectures;
  • Migrating applications to the cloud;
  • Knowledge of ML / AI / NLP / Data Analytics (preferably hands-on);
  • Web development frameworks (preferably React) and CMS (Drupal);

Title: Site Manager (Civil-Mechanical-Electrical)
Skills: AutoCAD|CPM Scheduling|Communication|Constructability|Electrical Engineering|English|Health and Safety Executive (HSE)|Influencing Others|Interpersonal Skills|Project Management|
Job Description:
About the job

MYTILINEOS a leading global industrial and energy company with a strong international presence covering two business Sectors, the Energy Sector and the Metallurgy Sector is currently seeking to hire a Site Manager.



Main Responsibilities:

  • Support, review and provide constructability feedback on the completion of engineering specifications for construction and supply contracts for assigned projects.
  • Review construction schedule that incorporates information from system design and engineering, plan to accomplish project goals and provide leadership to the project teams, external contractors, supply chain and reporting project management and company management. Critical path management.
  • Maintain familiarity with contracts and documents to ensure that work is executed in accordance with METKA-EGN’s expectations and that the work fulfils contractual requirements.
  • Develop effective relationships with contractors, suppliers, engineers, consultants, local officials, and team members to ensure successful, timely completion of deliverables that support the project goals.
  • Develop effective and supportive relationships with colleagues including those with responsibilities in other areas of the company such as development, operations, tax, accounting, finance, electricity sale, insurance, legal, etc.
  • Monitor and oversee civil, structural, mechanical, and electrical work at the project site to ensure it meets contractual obligations.
  • Ensures projects are built according to plans created and submitted as well as to their standards.
  • Cross functional co-ordination with – Engineering, Project management, Supply Chain, Logistics, Quality, and all support functions as needed.
  • Ensures the works are performed according to the HSE plan.
  • Ensures the periodical construction, quality, and HSE reports are generated on time.
  • Review all contractors’ QA plans & procedures and bring all plans into conformance with project requirements, supported by the project team.
  • Reviews drawings and procedures periodically and suggests changes if necessary.
  • Support the Site Engineers with responses to subcontractor RFIs.
  • Foster and develop a positive project team effort and assist in resolving differences.
  • Review of projects on a day-to-day basis against the progress milestones.
  • Identify, source, and qualify subcontractors and suppliers for project.
  • Performs regular inspections and meetings to review site conditions, discuss and define areas of responsibility, clarify all issues and to ensure accurate scheduling of project related activities.
  • Acts as METKA-EGN representative onsite during all equipment deliveries.
  • Conducts audits of site conditions and equipment installation of subcontractors on the site.
  • Performs audits of the jobsites to verify accurate completion of scope of work, supported by the Quality and Compliance Engineer. Documents and communicates all discrepancies.
  • Identifies and communicates all application and installation concerns. Communicates concerns back to Senior management for required resolution and future issue prevention.
  • Works safely always. Adheres to all applicable safety policies. Complies with all company policies, procedures, and standards.
  • Assist the Project Manager with controlling costs and managing adherence to budget.
  • Assist the Project Managers with the verification of monthly progress claims from subcontractors.
  • Must be willing and able to take initiative to protect the interests of METKA-EGN and customers.
  • High degree of communication and interpersonal skills to work with customers, vendors, and influence others.
  • High degree of technical competency in electrical, civil, and mechanical application.
  • Ability to maintain consistent attendance.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, civil engineering or other.
  • Proven track record in the construction of solar parks with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in large scale solar parks (minimum 5MW)
  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD and MS Office.
  • Languages: English essential
  • Excellent communication, organization, administration, and interpersonal skills
  • Proven ability to manage a large team.
  • Ability to operate in a highly technical or particularly complex field.

About the job

Tank container operating company Transnet S.A. is seeking for an Operations Coordinator, entry level or with a few years of experience in the freight forwarding operations field (sea, road, rail). Fluent English is a must.

Title: EU Project Management Officer

Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


We are looking for a Project Management Officer (PMO) for our offices in Athens


A day in the life of a Project Management Officer


As a PMO, you will be focused on assisting in the Project Management Office and the Project Managers in coordinating activities of EU projects.


Your main duties will be:
  • Work closely with project managers to assist in day to day operations and project execution activities
  • Communicate with external partners and support them with the ongoing coordination processes of the projects

  • Monitor and prepare invoice requests
  • Gathering data about project progress and producing reports:
    • Monthly project reports
    • Project metrics trend analysis
    • Executive reporting
  • Report project progress through dashboard presentations
  • Assist in offer preparation


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, a leading IT company, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts in Greece. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe.


Qualifications


If you have


  • Bachelor degree or higher
  • Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in a similar role
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Expert knowledge of MS Office, SharePoint
  • Knowledge of standard methodologies such as PRINCE2 or guidelines such as PMBOK
  • Fluency in English and at least one other European language


…then this position is suitable for you!


It would also be a plus if you were


  • A good communicator with excellent presentation skills
  • Able to develop realistic work schedules and meet tight deadlines
  • Proactive and self-confident
  • Self-motivated and result-oriented
  • An analytical mind with attention to detail
  • A team player, also able to work independently


This position comes with


  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business), and fast career growth
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

About the job

Are you ready to join a world leader in the exciting and dynamic fields of the Pharmaceutical and Medical Device industries? PQE Group has been at the forefront of these industries since 1998, with 40 subsidiaries and more than 2000 employees in Europe, Asia and the Americas.


Following a new opportunity, we are currently looking for a GCP Auditor to join our European team in Greece.


You will be responsible for:


  • Prepares and conducts GCP audits as guided by PQE team.

  • Evaluates and ensures that Quality Management System, Personnel, Premises, Equipment & Systems, Processes, and Documentation of suppliers/contractors are in compliance with GCP requirements.
  • Escalates immediately to PQE and Client’s Management any critical compliance issues.

About you:

  • English language proficiency

Location: Greece.


As a member of the PQE team, you will be part of a challenging, multicultural company that values collaboration and innovation. PQE Group gives you the opportunity to work on international projects, improve your skills and interact with colleagues from all corners of the world.

If you are looking for a rewarding and exciting career, PQE Group is the perfect place for you.

Apply now and take the first step towards an amazing future with us.

Title: Customer Service Representative
Skills: Attention to Detail|Communication|Customer Experience|Customer Service|Customer Service Representatives|Customer Support|Customer-Focused Service|Data Privacy|Phone Etiquette|Skilled Multi-tasker|
Job Description:
About the job

Role And Responsibilities


Join our team in Athens where you’ll be the first and main point of contact for our in-house customer experience. You’ll manage daily operations related to customer services, as well as training centre administration and reception tasks.


In this varied role you’ll help prepare training documentation, manage trainee files and data, and provide crucial support to ensure regulatory pre-requisites are met within this highly regulated and safety critical industry. As well as the administrative tasks, you’ll be the focal point for customers in our centre and organise logistics and scheduling activities.


We’re looking for you to be organised with high attention to detail, as well as a real focus on data protection considerations and a customer-oriented mindset.


The role we are offering you


  • Act as the first point of contact for all customers, clients, and guests during their time in the training centre
  • Working across front and back-office functions to ensure customer service delivery expectations are being met and exceeded
  • Preparing client material for course delivery and ordering/ printing course documentation as well as managing training devices
  • Assisting customers with their logistics (hotels, taxis, visas etc)
  • Managing local customer requests related to scheduling, changes, remedial training
  • Ensuring facilities are ready, prepared, and organised in support of training activities
  • Identifying and resolving any issues related to facility, training, or administration that may affect the experience of our customers


Our ideal candidate has:


  • Experience in an administrative role involving managing, storing, and preparing documentation and personal records
  • Good working knowledge of computer applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint
  • Proficient in English language
  • Customer-focused and strong communication skills


Location:


Athens, Greece.


This is a fully office-based role.


What kind of person will succeed in this team?


We’re looking for you to have strong attention to detail in order to manage a variety of documents and information. You’ll need to be focused on the important of data protection to handle personal records, as well as being comfortable operating in a highly regulated, safety-critical industry. Lastly, strong communication (written and verbal) is a must as well as a customer-focused outlook.


About Us


With over 10,000 employees located in 35 countries, CAE is a global leader in training for the civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare markets. To learn more: www.cae.com


Position Type


Regular


CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.


Equal Employment Opportunity


At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.


As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.


At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, neurodiversity or age.


The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Skills: Amazon Web Services (AWS)|Ansible|Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)|English|Linux|Microsoft Azure|PostgreSQL|Puppet (Software)|SQL|TeamCity|
Job Description:
About the job

Novibet is looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer professional to join our growing organization and be part of an international team.


If the integration of developers and operations teams by automating infrastructure, automating workflows and continuously measuring application performance, sounds like you, then we would like to meet you!


Novibet, founded in 2010, is an established GameTech company operating in Europe and LATAM (Greece, Brazil, Ireland, Italy, Mexico, Chile, Ecuador), through its offices in Greece & Malta. Licensed and regulated by MGA, ADM and HGC, and Irish Revenue Commissioners, Novibet is committed to delivering the best sports betting and gaming experience to an ever-expanding customer base.


Your Role


  • Plan, build and maintain our infrastructure and always be on a constant lookout to improve our environment
  • Work closely with developers to create and improve deployment strategies and pipelines
  • Closely monitor our existing infrastructure and act if any anomalies will found
  • Create and maintain documentation of our internal systems
  • Develop and maintain solutions for operational administration, system/data backup, disaster recovery, and security/performance monitoring
  • Deploy applications via automation with configuration management tools
  • Help define, document, evolve, and evangelize high engineering standards and best practices across multiple areas
  • Move quickly and intelligently - seeing technical debt as your nemesis


Requirements


  • 2-3 Years’ experience as a DevOps or similar role
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft & Linux Servers administration
  • Experience with VCS tools (GIT or SVN)
  • Experience with orchestration tools (Ansible, Chef, Salt, Puppet)
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines and knowledge how to administer and manage the tool such as TeamCity or Jenkins
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms work from an infrastructure standpoint (Azure, AWS or gCloud)
  • Experience with databases (MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL etc.)
  • Good understanding of networking
  • Experience working with virtualized environments
  • Knowledge of at least one Scripting language (BASH or Python/php)
  • Professional level in Greek & English language (both verbal and written)


Benefits


Our employees are our most important asset and that's reflected in the way we treat our people! We are proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees, including:


  • Friendly working atmosphere
  • Strong mentality of lifelong learning and professional development
  • Career opportunities within a fast-paced environment
  • Part of an international team, based in Athens and Malta
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Outstanding health medical plan etc.


Novibet regrets that due to the large volume of applications received, we will only consider those who solely correspond to job requirements as listed above.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Title: Πωλητής/ Οδηγός Ex-Van (outsourced) 31/12/2023
Job Description:
About the job

Overview


Η PepsiCo Hellas φιλοξενεί μερικά από τα πιο αγαπημένα προϊόντα τροφίμων και αναψυκτικών στον κόσμο όπως τα καθημερινά αγαπημένα σας Lay's, Quaker, Pepsi, Doritos και τους χυμούς Ήβη, για να αναφέρουμε μερικά. Έχουμε μια εκπληκτική φήμη για την ανάπτυξη και την κυκλοφορία προϊόντων που αγαπούν οι καταναλωτές μας. Είμαστε περήφανοι που είμαστε ένα εξαιρετικό μέρος για εργασία και κερδίσαμε πρόσφατα το βραβείο του Καλύτερου Εργοδότη για την Ελλάδα!


Σε μεγαλύτερη κλίμακα, η PepsiCo παράγει το μεγαλύτερο χαρτοφυλάκιο τροφίμων και αναψυκτικών δισεκατομμυρίων δολαρίων στον κόσμο, συμπεριλαμβανομένων 22 σειρών προϊόντων που κάθε μία παράγει περισσότερα από δισεκατομμύριο σε ετήσιες λιανικές πωλήσεις.


Responsibilities


Ζητάμε να καλύψουμε τη θέση του/της: Πωλητή / Οδηγού Ex-Van (31/12/2023)


Περιγραφή θέσης:


  • Υπεύθυνος για την πώληση και παράδοση παραγγελιών στους πελάτες
  • Διαχείριση πληρωμών και εισπράξεων
  • Επίσκεψη προκαθορισμένων σημείων/πελατών
  • Merchandising των προϊόντων στα σημεία επίσκεψης
  • Διαχείριση των αποθεμάτων και διασφάλιση της ποιότητας και διαθεσιμότητας των προϊόντων
  • Γέμισμα των ραφιών και των σταντ σύμφωνα με τα πρότυπα της εταιρείας
  • Χρήση POP υλικού
  • Εξασφάλιση της σωστής λειτουργίας του οχήματος
  • Εβδομαδιαία επικοινωνία με τον Διευθυντή για ενημέρωση για τις δραστηριότητες των πωλήσεων.


Qualifications


  • Άδεια οδήγησης: κατηγορία Γ
  • Πιστοποιητικό Επαγγελματικής Ικανότητας (Π.Ε.Ι.)
  • Κάρτα Ψηφιακού Ταχογράφου
  • Καλές επικοινωνιακές δεξιότητες
  • Εμπειρία σε Πωλήσεις ή Διανομή είναι επιθυμητή
  • Επίτευξη αποτελεσμάτων, πελατοκεντρική προσέγγιση, αυτοπεποίθηση
  • Καλή γνώση Αγγλικών θα θεωρηθεί επιπλέον προσόν
  • Πτυχίο πανεπιστημίου θα θεωρηθεί επιπλέον προσόν

Title: Oncology & R&D Comms, Manager (m/f/d)
Skills: Content Development|Corporate Communications|Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA)|External Communications|Hematologic Malignancies|Internal Communications|Media Relations|Project Implementation|Research and Development (R&D)|Science Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description


Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a


Oncology & R&D Comms, Manager(m/f/d) for our Global Corporatr Public Affairs team within the Johnson & Johnson organization with primary location in Neuss/Nordestedt, Germany for a maternity leave cover.


Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for more than 130 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.


With $93.8 billion in 2021 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 260 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 137,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.


Role as Communications Manager supports Leader, Global Oncology & R&D Communication, Hematologic Malignancies, as well as provides world-class support for the Global Oncology & R&D team. Coordinates the delivery of on-market product portfolio and pipeline support activities for the dynamic and growing Oncology TA / Hematologic Malignancies. Supports the planning and implementation of external and internal communications plans and stakeholder activation strategies for disease areas of focus (Multiple Myeloma (MM), Myeloid and B-Cell Malignancies (with a particular focus on MM). Serves as a key contributor to the Global Oncology & R&D Communication team: pipeline / portfolio plans, operational excellence (trackers, budgets), social media support. Coordinates with the Global Oncology Communication team and global TA business partners to plan and execute internal communications, supports workforce activation to engage and inspire TA employees, GCSO and 1,200+ partners from global, regional and local functions. Aligns with the regional and local businesses (commercial), supply chain, corporate GCPA functions and CoEs. Drives strategic TA, R&D, Sector, J&J Innovation and Enterprise value. Executes and independently leads/contributes to help ensure R&D Comm team delivers business results and strengthens expertise and capabilities of the global GCPA function.


Responsibilities
  • External Communications: Helps foster business growth and stakeholder trust/advocacy by supporting and implementing effective external global communication strategies
    • Supports the implementation of integrated communication activities for Hematologic Malignancies R&D and the global product business
    • Acquire and apply knowledge from deep internal and external networks; multi-stakeholder insights; and develop a broad understanding of the business, competitive and industry priorities to strengthen product business and reputation outcomes, support scientific positioning and issues management, and help shape the environment for the TA’s medicines and solutions
    • Helps driving business outcomes by identifying and applying key outcome metrics
    • Supports key TA communication activities with content development, plan and tactical execution (events, project logistics)
    • Supports media management with research and the drafting of messages and message maps; and a focus on social media activation
    • Demonstrates excellence in proactive global monitoring and analysis of product and TA related issues that may impact stakeholder trust and company reputation
    • Aligns with the regional and local businesses (commercial), supply chain, other Sectors, corporate GCPA functions and CoEs
    • Develops strong relationships with communication and business teams and acts as trusted enabler and executor of projects to create long-term business value for the TA, R&D, Sector and Enterprise
    • Helps drive meaningful business outcomes for the TA, R&D, Sector and Enterprise, based on robust understanding of the business and reliable project execution
  • Internal Communications for Oncology: Drives employee engagement and advocacy by supporting effective workforce communication and leading with a One Team mindset
    • Leads on implementation of workforce activation to engage and inspire TA and GCSO employees and 1,200+ partners from global, regional and local functions
    • Partners closely with relevant TA business partners, HR, and others to ensure integrated, seamless, consistent Enterprise-wide workforce communication
    • Drives outcomes and engagement by applying a measurement approach to organizational communication, incorporate relevant metrics that are indicators of employee engagement, and strengthen strategies and tactics according to these learnings
    • Models and leads with a One Team mindset to unify, collaborate and drive for best Enterprise outcomes
    • Models and inspires a continuous improvement mindset to ensure the team stays on the leading edge of communications, change management, technology, social and other key trends
    • Develops and applies superior written, oral and visual communications in a variety of styles and formats
    • Promotes diversity and inclusion at all times
    • Shows curiosity and volunteers for project work to develop skills and broaden contact and influencer network
    • Anticipates to proactively address issues and identify opportunities
  • Operational Portfolio Management for Oncology Communications
    • Manages planning and critical operational aspects for the Global Oncology Communications team (trackers, pipeline overviews, plans, charts, etc.)
      • Liaises with TA business partners and PR agencies for coordination
    • Plans and coordinates events with appropriate follow up and impact assessment(s)
Job Qualifications


  • Proven self-starter and performer with 4+ years of experience managing communication in a healthcare-related company/field, NGO, government or public relations agency; proven track record of successful, independent execution of public relations/communications, corporate communication, science communication, product communication, public affairs, and/or media relations strategies
  • Global mindset and successful track record of working in a global or regional function, with direct experience of implementing international projects, and of competent internal and external stakeholder interactions on an international basis
  • Demonstrated knowledge of R&D processes and the global landscape and key issues for biopharmaceutical science and innovation
  • Demonstrated ability to support communication and business leaders and project teams
  • Demonstrated ability to build authentic relationships and trust with internal and external stakeholders
  • Team player, open and transparent communicator
  • Experience dealing with media including social media
  • Reliable and efficient project execution and strong organizer, analytical skills
  • Demonstrated ability of managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced, global, diverse matrix/remote environment
  • Exercise a high level of confidence and independent judgment in regular business situations


Required Leadership Competencies


  • Live Our Credo & Pursue Our Purpose – Serves as a role model for making Credo-based decisions; supports and influences creation for a trusting, collaborative and ethical work environment; maintains higest standards of ethics, quality, compliance and accountability.
  • Connect – Cultivates meaningful external relationships and partnerships outside of J&J on a global scale, adding value and insights for the enterprise; insight-driven to proactively uncover critical unmet needs and turn them into new opportunities. Forges internal collaboration across the enterprise.
  • Shape – Translates insights into innovative and viable products or solutions, creating value; challenges the status quo and leads change management activities, creating positive change; takes and properly manages risks, while maintaining the highest standards of quality and compliance, contributing to value creation.


Do you strive to join an outstanding team that is dynamic and constantly evolving? Is career growth and opportunity appealing to you? Apply to this opportunity today.


Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.


At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional, and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.


For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com

Job Description:
About the job

On behalf of our client, a global provider of IT solutions with great history, we are currently looking for a self-driven IT Engineer, to join its IT Infrastructure team.

Your day-to-day

  • Ensuring continuous & uninterrupted operation of the company's infrastructure and its branches (workstations, servers, networks, backup etc)
  • Responsible for User Management & Technical Support
  • Installation & maintenance of software of all types

We love your personality if you
