Title: IT Project Manager
Skills: Communication|Greek|IT Solutions|Oral Communication|Presentations|Project Management|Risk Analysis|Technical Writing|Waterfall Project Management|Writing|
Job Description:
About the job

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


The opportunity


We are currently seeking highly motivated people to join the Technology Consulting practice in our Consulting Service Line, which is a leading provider of professional services to clients of all major industries.


Working together, we help clients better assess and improve their operations, grow revenue and manage risks to increase shareholder value. You will build valued relationships with clients and other members of our team and focus on high-impact opportunities and projects.


Your Key Responsibilities


  • Project management including proposals for project strategies, planning, definition of tasks and deliverables, quality control, risk analysis and management, status reports, problem reporting and management systems, follow up and organization.
  • Guide project activities and review deliverables as applicable.
  • Participate in functional and technical working groups and progress meetings, collaborate effectively with project stakeholders in Waterfall or Agile or hybrid delivery environments.
  • Estimate costs, timescales and resource requirements for the successful completion of each project to agreed terms of reference.
  • Prepare and maintain project and quality plans and tracks activities against the plan, provide regular and accurate reports.
  • Monitor costs, timescales and resources used, and take action where these deviate from agreed tolerances. Ensure that delivered IT systems/solutions are implemented within these criteria.
  • Manage the change control procedure gaining agreement for revisions to the project from project sponsors.


To qualify for the role you must have


  • University degree in a relevant subject.
  • 2- 10 years of professional experience in IT Solutions Project Management.
  • Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills in Greek and English.
  • Good knowledge of English, both written and verbal.
  • Willingness to learn and continuously expand technical and business skills
  • Travelling availability and potential work on projects abroad.
  • Completed military obligations (where applicable).
  • Proven experience in managing the full life-cycle (all phases) of an IT project
  • Knowledge and experience with Waterfall and/or Agile and/or hybrid delivery methodologies
  • Experience in an Agile team role (e.g. Scrum Master, Product Owner, Tribe/Chapter Lead, Release Train Engineer) would be an additional asset although not a prerequisite
  • Very good MS- Project and MS-Office skills; JIRA tool skills are desirable
  • Project Management and/or Agile certifications are desirable


What We Look For


What’s most important is that you’re dedicated to working with your colleagues as part of a high-performing team. You’ll need to demonstrate enthusiasm, high motivation and passion to develop fast in a multinational working environment. You’ll need to thrive in picking up new skills and talents as you go, so natural curiosity, a lot of questions and the confidence to speak up when you see something that could be improved are essential. If you’ve got the right combination of technical knowledge and communication skills, this role is for you.


What We Offer


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:


  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.


EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: IT Support Assistant
Skills: Computer Science|Desktop Computers|Embedded Systems|Endpoint Security|Local Area Network (LAN)|Network Printers|Operating Systems|Printers|Windows Desktop Administration|
Job Description:
About the job

TNL Group is a leading Marine Electronics and Satellite Communications vendor in the South-Eastern European Shipping Market, established in 2002. We have achieved remarkable growth during the last two decades, becoming a "Single Contact Point" and providing our customers' vessels with Reliable, Highly Qualitative, and Budget Adaptive Solutions. Our approach to the market incorporates Understanding the customers' needs, Innovation, and Professionalism, facts that constitute the company's Key Success Factors.


Our highly specialized and experienced office and technical personnel are pivotal to achieving demanding objectives and advancing its capabilities to serve its customers better. We are looking to hire an IT Support Assistant to support our IT infrastructure, including employee workstations and network printers. As an IT Support Assistant, you will be responsible for resolving users' everyday technical issues, configuring new working stations, and maintaining the operational IT status of the company.


To ensure success as an IT Support Assistant, you should have a basic understanding of technical terms like Active Directory, Routing & Switching, and Endpoint security.


IT Support Engineer Responsibilities:

  • 1st-degree repairs of office system devices (pc, monitors, printers, etc.)
  • Troubleshooting users' workstations, network, and software issues
  • Workstation operating system upgrades
  • Control and configuration of new devices and software
  • Basic networking skills & knowledge. Backup in NAS
  • Setting up and supporting VPN connections
  • Installation and support of platforms for all kinds of online meetings (Webex, Zoom, Teams, etc.)
  • Installation and maintenance of programs such as Acrobat Pro, Microsoft Office, etc.


IT Engineer Requirements:

  • Technical School or College Certificate in computer science or a similar field
  • Knowledge & previous experience in computer hardware systems
  • Knowledge of LAN and wireless networks
  • Ability to troubleshoot basic software and hardware issues
  • Good knowledge and understanding of Windows desktop operating systems
  • Understanding of IP networks, routing, switching, VPN, and firewalling
  • Basic knowledge of Active Directory
  • Endpoint security
  • Fluency in English, both oral and writing


Required Competences:

  • Efficient in problem-solving
  • Good communication skills, teamwork, and collaboration
  • Comprehend corporate environments
  • Ability to perform under pressure
  • Energetic and enthusiastic about IT technologies
  • Team player, friendly and sociable with others
  • Adaptive to new environments


Benefits

TNL Group provides an excellent working environment that encourages team spirit, cooperation, and continuous learning. Remuneration is competitive and aligned with the market standards and the candidate's qualifications.


Education and continuous personal improvement constitute significant priorities for the company to keep abreast with the technological evolution and maintain its high growth rate and strategic position.

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Skills: Black Box Testing|Communication|Design Documents|Manual Testing|Quality Assurance|Software Testing|Technical Design|Test Automation|Test Cases|Test Planning|
Job Description:
About the job

With more than 20 years of proven experience, QUALCO is a leading Fintech solutions provider, offering a wide range of analytics-driven, highly scalable enterprise software solutions in over 35 countries worldwide. Our end-to-end technology solutions cover a wide range of needs for Banking, Financial Services, Utilities, Insurance, Retail organisations, and beyond.



We are looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer to join a new Product development team, which is integrated within the Engineering Division, and ensure that we deliver strong and reliable solutions to our clients. We welcome self-motivated, detail oriented and enthusiastic testers, passionate about quality, thus focused to deadlines and customers.




Responsibilities:

  • Participate actively in scrum ceremonies to estimate, prioritize and plan test activities;
  • Review user stories and acceptance criteria in order to develop effective test plans in collaboration with the development team;
  • Ensure business requirements testability by reviewing specifications and technical design documents;
  • Prepare detailed Test Cases and execute manual testing to verify functional and non-functional business requirements and confirm that system meets customer expectations.
  • Design and implement automation scripts to cover functional and regression scenarios
  • Execute the automated test suite and review test results
  • Communicate own progress and escalate issues in a timely manner;
  • Record, follow-up and close identified defects when resolved;
  • Maintain test documentation including test cases, scripts, and manuals;
  • Support customer User Acceptance Testing (Issues tracking, resolution and re-testing);
  • Contribute to our On Time/On Budget/On Quality success story!


Requirements

  • Have a relevant B.Sc./B.A. degree;
  • +3 years of experience in Quality Assurance and in software manual testing;
  • Experience in working with Selenium, Webdriver, Jenkins CI is considered a plus;
  • Demonstrated experience with black box testing techniques;
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment;
  • Desire to grow in areas of expertise as needed by the evolving needs and goals of the company;
  • Possess a firm command of both the Greek and English language (oral and written); and
  • Have a working experience in Jira/ (Or willing to gain).


Benefits

On top of challenging work environment, we are offering:

💸 Competitive compensation, ticket restaurant card, and annual bonus programs
💻 Cutting-edge IT equipment, mobile and data plan
🏢 Modern facilities, free coffee and beverages, indoor parking, and company bus
👨‍⚕ Private health insurance, onsite occupational doctor, and workplace counselor
🏝️ Flexible working model, hybrid/remote benefits & home equipment benefits
🤸‍♂️ Onsite gym, wellness facilities, and ping pong room
💡 Career and talent development tools
🎓 Mentoring, coaching, personalized annual learning and development plan
🌱 Employee referral bonus, regular wellbeing, ESG and volunteering activities

Your race, gender identity and expression, age ethnicity or disability make no difference in Qualco. We want to attract, develop, promote, and retain the best people based only on their ability and behavior.

Disclaimer: Qualco collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties. We will keep your resume in our database for any future consideration. In case you want to be deleted from our database you can contact us.

Title: CSV PM
Skills: B2|Computer System Validation|Computerized System Validation (CSV)|English|GAMP|Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP)|Process Validation|Quality Control|Report Preparation|User Requirements|
Job Description:
About the job

We are a service provider company, leader in the Pharmaceutical and Medical Device sectors since 1998. With more than 2000 employees, 45+ nationalities and 32 subsidiaries all over the world (Europe, Asia and the Americas), joining PQE means join a multicultural and challenging company with many local and international projects, and colleagues from all over the world.

Due to a constant growth, we are looking for a CSV Consultant to join our team in Greece

Responsibilities include, but are not limited, to the following:

  • Resolution of fundamental Computer System Validation compliance issues
  • Align with e‐Compliance on project management and life cycle documentation deliverables for GxP relevant projects
  • Ensure all project related risks are well managed and deliverables are validated (for GxP)/tested (for non‐GxP) in accordance to SOPs and the associated CSV requirements
  • Ensure completeness and consistency of project life cycle documentation
  • Ensure all project related issues and deviations are recorded, approved and dispensed accordingly (including ensuring proper deviation report preparation and approval)
  • Collect and manage the user requirements from various departments into specifications and details, including support to establish user requirements, IQ/OQ/PQ documentation(i.e. protocols, acceptance criteria, and close out reports)
  • Prepare project and life‐cycle reports and review/approve all other documents to ensure compliance with SOPs
  • Ensure all project and lifecycle documents achieve the goal of traceability, and these are all retained in document repository (Document Navigator) and approved in accordance to the prescribed SOPs.

Requirements:

  • Technical Degree (Engineering, Chemistry, Informatics,..)
  • Strong experience in Pharmaceutical Companies, running activities such as Equipment validation, Computerized Systems Validation, Quality Control
  • Knowledge of GMPs requirements
  • Knowledge of ALCOA and GAMP practices
  • English language proficiency (at least B2)
  • Availability to Travel up to 20%



Our collaborators are engaged, developed, challenged and well-rewarded for performance.We recognize the importance of leadership at all levels of our organization in order to succeed in a challenging business environment, and we are committed to providing practical processes and programs to identify, develop and inspire all our current and future leaders.

Title: Economist – Comms and Media Production
Skills: Article Writing|Bid Processes|Communication|Media Production|Oral Communication|Project Management|Proofreading|Research Skills|Strategy Implementation|Working Effectively|
Job Description:
About the job

What we do

Alma Economics combines unparalleled analytical expertise with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly.


We are a team of economists, social researchers, data scientists, developers and creatives working together on critical issues facing our society today. Our work spans multiple policy areas, including education, health and social care, housing and homelessness, the environment, public finance, and international development, among others.


Our diverse staff combines decades of experience in economic and social research at the highest levels with the ability to develop state-of-the-art tech tools and powerful communications.


We work with some of the most forward-thinking organisations in the voluntary, public, and private sectors. Our clients include most UK government departments, the Welsh Government, the Scottish Government, councils across the country, arms-length bodies, and several leading charities.


Internationally, we work with major supranational organisations including the World Bank, UNICEF, the WHO, the OECD, and the European Commission, as well as a number of national governments in Europe, Africa, the Middle East and Asia.


The role

Alma Economics is looking for an economist and effective communicator / media producer to join our growing Comms and Media Production department. You will be a key member of a dynamic team working to bring the fascinating narratives that emerge from the work done by Alma Economics to a broad audience.


Drawing on your economics background, you will work closely with the Research and Tech teams to understand their work and identify the most engaging stories. You will then use this information to develop content that is accessible to a broad audience, including policymakers, journalists, and the general public. This will include writing articles, producing videos, creating infographics, and developing other types of multimedia content including podcasts, etc.


The ideal candidate will have some comms experience and be eager to further broaden their skills. We are continually looking to improve and broaden our capabilities, and so are looking for economists with a passion for storytelling who can both produce compelling content as well as help shape the future of our communications as a whole.


Finally, you will also work with our Commercial Team to help prepare bids for new client projects.


Key responsibilities

  • Develop engaging and accessible content that draws on your knowledge of economics and social research to create fascinating narratives that inform and engage
  • Work with the Research and Tech teams to understand our latest research findings and products and communicate them effectively in compelling narratives
  • Create a range of content that is accessible to a broad audience, including policymakers, journalists, and the general public
  • Use social media platforms to promote content and engage with audiences, making the best use of available formats
  • Collaborate with internal teams to devise and implement strategies to meet the communication goals of clients
  • Assist with the day-to-day management of social media accounts.
  • Assist the Commercial Team with the drafting, copy-editing, and proofreading of bids for new client projects
  • Support the overall operation of the Comms and Media Production department, assisting with day-to-day tasks including project planning and management


Required skills

  • A degree in economics, social research, or a related field
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience of creating engaging content across different media formats to a high standard
  • Experience working effectively as part of a team
  • Experience with social media platforms and strategy development, ideally with a track record of audience growth
  • Project management capabilities from planning to completion
  • Organized, capable of working on multiple projects over different timescales


Working arrangements

Alma Economics is a friendly and informal place, and our offices are designed for both work and play. We enjoy working from the office as we foster a strong culture within modern and fun spaces, allowing for casual catch ups, mentoring, brainstorming and teambuilding.


We do not have a one-size-fits-all WfH policy. Most staff members work from home for one or two days during a typical week, while it is also possible to arrange to WfH for more extended periods (e.g., 2-4 weeks) to visit family or travel.


While most staff work 5-day weeks, for most full-time positions we also offer the option of a 4-day working week, either from day one or as an arrangement employees can transition into later in their Alma career.


Our offices are disabled-accessible, and we are committed to providing all necessary support to colleagues that require it, but we are also happy to consider remote working arrangements for applicants with disabilities or health conditions that prevent them from working on-site.


We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and ensure that no one receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of age, gender, sexual orientation, disability or physical condition, marital status, race, or religion.


Check out more employment opportunities at Alma Economics and our tips for applicants here: www.almaeconomics.com/tips-for-applicants

Title: IT Applications Engineer
Skills: Computer Science|Database Development|Databases|English|Planned Preventative Maintenance|Problem Solving|SQL|Scripting|Technical Support|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


Thenamaris is a global ship manager of high specification modern ocean-going vessels. We help deliver goods to people around the world, enriching their lives. We do this by safely managing a world class fleet of ships, providing the highest levels of service to our principals and clients. Thenamaris (Ships Management) Inc. manages Tanker vessels, Thenamaris ConBulk Inc. manages bulk carriers and containerships, while Thenamaris LNG Inc. manages LNG and LPG carriers.


Job Description


Thenamaris invites high caliber professionals with the requested qualifications to apply for the position of IT Applications Engineer in the Fleet IT Applications team of the Information Technology department.


The IT Applications Engineer is responsible for a set of IT applications that serve the company’s core marine processes. The role involves supporting and enhancing these processes with viable and sustainable IT solutions by managing, configuring and supporting software platforms, formulating their architecture and leading the implementation of integration processes across IT systems. In addition, the IT Applications Engineer co-ordinates with external vendors for integrating their solutions with existing company applications, and ensures the quality and timeliness of their deliverables. He/she promotes IT security by providing access to authorized users, maintaining data integrity and establishing proper controls. He/she remains up to date regarding technological developments and recommends future upgrades of software components in the company’s IT landscape.


The position is permanent and is based in Athens (Vouliagmeni) Greece.


Qualifications


To be considered for this role, you should meet the following requirements:


  • University degree (BSc and preferably also MSc) in Information Systems Management/Computer Science or related discipline. Alternative educational backgrounds will be considered only if the required technical knowledge applies
  • Proven professional experience of minimum five (5) years is required
  • Extensive experience in software/database development and SQL scripting
  • Working experience in shipping maritime sector in areas of Planned Maintenance, Safety and Procurement Cycle will be considered an asset
  • Excellent organizational, problem solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to work independently
  • Ability to collaborate effectively and perform as a team member
  • Proficiency in English at an oral and written level


If you are in search of a first-class working environment in the global ship management industry and meet the above qualifications, we look forward to receiving your application.


Additional Information


If you are in search of a first-class working environment in a dynamic fast-growing ship management company and meet the above qualifications, we look forward to receiving your application.


Please read the Thenamaris Notice on the Processing of Personal Data as well as our Privacy Policy.

Title: Junior Logistics Coordinator
Skills: Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)|Infor Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)|Logistics Management|Microsoft Excel|Warehouse Management Systems|
Job Description:
About the job

Στη ΦΟΥΡΝΑΡΑΚΗΣ Α.Ε. αναπτύσσουμε, εμπορευόμαστε και διακινούμε τα πιο δυνατά Brands βιομηχανικών εργαλείων και μηχανημάτων, όπως τα BENMAN και FF GROUP. Τα τελευταία 40 χρόνια κατέχουμε ηγετική θέση στην ελληνική αγορά ενώ διαθέτουμε ένα ταχύτατα αναπτυσσόμενο δίκτυο πωλήσεων σε όλη την Ευρώπη, στοχεύοντας να γίνουμε ένας από τους πρωταγωνιστές και στην ευρωπαϊκή αγορά. Για το λόγο αυτό, επενδύουμε συνεχώς στην πρόσληψη και ανάπτυξη νέων στελεχών ενώ τα τελευταία χρόνια αυξήσαμε το εργατικό μας δυναμικό συνολικά σε όλες τις βαθμίδες κατά 20% κάθε χρόνο. Στα πλαίσια της ανάπτυξής μας αναζητούμε τον/την κατάλληλο/-η υποψήφιο/-α για να ενδυναμώσει την ομάδα της Διαχείρισης Εφοδιαστικής Αλυσίδας στο υπερσύγχρονο Κέντρο Διανομής μας, για τη θέση:


Junior Logistics Coordinator


(Κωδ. Θέσης: JunLoC)


Αρμοδιότητες:


  • Οργάνωση και διεκπεραίωση παραγγελιών πελατών
  • Έλεγχος και ενημέρωση διαθεσιμότητας προϊόντων
  • Έκδοση παραστατικών
  • Επικοινωνία με πελάτες-προμηθευτές για παραδόσεις προϊόντων
  • Παρακολούθηση και διαχείριση φορτώσεων
  • Διαχείριση & εποπτεία επιστροφών
  • Παρακολούθηση μεταφοράς και διανομής παραγγελιών


Απαραίτητα προσόντα:


  • Πτυχίο ανώτερης ή ανώτατης εκπαίδευσης, κατά προτίμηση Logistics, Διοίκησης Επιχειρήσεων ή Λογιστικής
  • Προϋπηρεσία τουλάχιστον 2 ετών σε μεγάλη εταιρεία σε αντίστοιχη θέση
  • Πολύ καλή γνώση λογισμικού ERP (Entersoft θα θεωρηθεί επιπλέον προσόν) και λογισμικού WMS
  • Καλή γνώση MS Office (ειδικά Excel)
  • Άριστη γνώση της αγγλικής γλώσσας
  • Εξαιρετικές επικοινωνιακές δεξιότητες
  • Διάθεση και ευχέρεια εργασίας σε απαιτητικό περιβάλλον
  • Οργανωτικό πνεύμα και συνεργασία στα πλαίσια μίας ομάδας


Παροχές:


  • Ανταγωνιστικό πακέτο αποδοχών
  • Συνεργασία με προοπτικές επαγγελματικής εξέλιξης σε μια μεγάλη εταιρία ηγετική θέση στον χώρο της, που αναπτύσσεται σταθερά και γρήγορα
  • Εξαιρετικό περιβάλλον εργασίας, αξιοκρατικό που εκτιμώνται και ανταμείβονται όλα τα αξιόλογα στελέχη
  • Συνεχής εκπαίδευση και επιμόρφωση

Title: Lead SW Engineer / Systems Performance
Skills: C (Programming Language)|Computer Science|Linux|Multitasking|OpenStack|Python (Programming Language)|Scripting|Unix|Virtualization|
Job Description:
About the job

Lead SW Engineer / Systems Performance

Location: Greece, Patras

Talent Area: Product Development/Engineering

Job posting title: Lead SW Engineer / Systems Performance


Position Summary

You will join a team of experienced and talented system software engineers based in Patras, Greece, with years of history delivering high-quality carrier and enterprise grade products, in a fast-paced business environment, and will have the potential to collaborate with fellow engineering teams across the globe.

The Lead Performance Engineer will envision, design, develop, execute, monitor, analyze and maintain system performance enhancements, performance profiling and tests, performance characterization solutions and automation for our core networking product - NetScaler.

Demonstrates expertise and tenacity in root-causing performance bottlenecks and treats the product as a white box for isolating and/or fixing associated defects. Uses clear, concise, logical steps and excellent judgment to understand the performance issue before trying to tackle it. Reaches solutions by clear-cut, methodical approaches or more creative and lateral angles. Is able to make low level code changes into the system and observe/optimize performance.

This position requires passion for designing and building excellent, performance-tuned code for systems and offers the opportunity to increase your skills and competencies to new levels. Our market leadership and large installed customer base also present a unique opportunity to experience real-life field deployments and problem-solving techniques that will become an invaluable individual career asset. You will own (multi) platform performance improvements for cornerstone networking functionality of the NetScaler product line and design/execute realistic load testing scenarios for our on-prem or on-cloud releases. You will also have the opportunity to design and execute performance comparison activities vs all key competitors. This is a position with high visibility across the organization that will give you the opportunity to make significant contributions to our product while working with a multitude of teams, across geographies, on a variety of projects.


Responsibilities

  • Identify, track and quantify system limitations & performance issues
  • Troubleshoot performance related bottlenecks and provide solutions for dealing with them
  • Ideate and drive forward themes for further performance improvements of the NetSaler product suite, ranging from platform level optimizations, to feature level enhancements. Coordinate with fellow teams across Geo’s in planning and implementing said improvements
  • Participate in performance analysis and discovery sessions with Customers, Product Management, Support, fellow Engineering teams
  • Coordinate, orchestrate and review functional and technical specifications, as well as create/execute test cases, test plans and automation scripts
  • Review capacity plans and production usage trends, assisting product and engineering teams to create suitable real-world usage profiles and baselines
  • Perform breakpoint analysis to ensure acceptable levels of performance
  • Cross check across time and releases in order to identify potential problems, omissions, and open issues
  • Present clear metrics to both technical and non-technical staff
  • Own the projects, from start to finish, with minimal supervision
  • Work under accelerated software development cycles, and help ensure that shipped products meet rigorous standards of quality and are delivered on time


Qualifications and Requirements

The position requires a Performance Engineer and/or Software engineer professional, with 4-8 years of related work experience in software requirements, design, development and maintenance, preferably in Linux. At least 3 years of work experience is required for Individuals holding a M.Sc. in Computer Science or related discipline (2 year for Ph.D.) with a specialization relevant to our product lines and/or processes.


Essential requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline
  • Relevant experience with low level system improvements, performance or/and scaling enhancements
  • Prior experience to system level testing, performance, capacity, longevity testing
  • Programming experience (mid-level to senior) - C
  • Unix knowledge (mid-level to senior)
  • Excellent TCP/IP networking skills and related protocols knowledge
  • Proven analytical skills for data-driven decision-making with emphasis to operational efficacy
  • Relentless and tenacious approach when pursuing product issues to their root cause
  • Ability to work well with engineering and non-engineering personnel
  • Excellent verbal and written Greek and English communication skills
  • Proficient at multitasking in a highly dynamic, fast-paced environment
  • Ability to work independently without supervision


Desirable attributes

  • Exposure to cloud services: OpenStack/AWS/Azure/Google Cloud
  • Containers / Kubernetes
  • Python / Scripting programming experience
  • Relevant knowledge of performance testing tooling. E.g. Spirent, IXIA, T-Rex, Netropy, etc.

Job Description:
About the job

Job description

P.P.A. S.A., founded in 1930, is a modern and dynamic company strengthening the position of the port on the global map of shipping, tourism and trade, while bringing multiple benefits on a local, social and cultural level. Furthermore, the company promotes equal opportunities, protects diversity and encourages inclusiveness by not accepting any kind of discrimination either in terms of selection, recruitment, remuneration, training or other work activities.

Title: Senior Project Engineer, Project Planning
Skills: Block Diagrams|Confidentiality|Diagram Design|Electrical Layouts|Flow Diagrams|Interpersonal Skills|Oracle Enterprise Manager|Oral Communication|Reactivation|Sensitive Information|
Job Description:
About the job

Operations Group


Transocean is focused on being the employer of choice for the drilling industry.


We are challenging ourselves every day to push the performance of the company through technological advances and passion for our work.


Job Summary


The Project Engineer will participate in the design development and modification of various structures, equipment and systems for conversion, refurbishment, and upgrades to mobile offshore drilling units. Position duties include development of work packs, scopes of work and procurement specifications, vendor expediting, and resolution of engineering issues arising in a global fleet. Supervise OEM and Third Party contributors to complete surveys and identified scopes of work. Responsibilities also include accurate scheduling, budget preparation, communication and presentations to integrate into the corporate stage gate process. Travel to worksites will be required and may be up to 40% per year.


Job Description


Job Description


Key Roles and Responsibilities


  • Coordinate with and supervise OEM’s and 3rd party contributors to conduct surveys, site visits, vendor surveillance, off-site planning
  • Attend rigs, shipyards, worksites, vendor facilities as required for surveys in support of project planning activities
  • Coordinate with OEM’s and 3rd party contributors in project estimating activities and cost reduction techniques
  • Develop and maintain dialog and interface with internal engineering stakeholders for scope validation
  • Plan and track project procurements with project managers and internal purchasing departments
  • Actively contribute to Marketing Bid Support efforts by providing well developed work scopes and accurate cost estimates as required during the production of Project Cost Workbooks and Reactivation Cost Workbooks.


Education:


  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering


Experience:


  • Preferred: 5-7 years of Offshore Oil and Gas experience
  • Must be comfortable review general arrangements, block diagrams, flow diagrams and other relevant OEM documentation used when developing work packs. A good understanding of ABS, DNV, API, and related industry regulations and standards is required.
  • Must have excellent organizational and interpersonal skills. Must be capable of simultaneously managing multiple tasks and coordinating the efforts of others contributing to solutions to engineering problems.
  • Must exhibit effective written and oral communication skills. The individual must be able to work independently and within a team environment. Should be a self-starter and able to take initiative as required. Must be confident acting on assigned tasks with minimal supervision.


Skills:


  • Good knowledge of project management techniques including planning, budget control, contract administration and resource management are a plus.
  • Ability to produce accurate project cost estimates within a compressed timeline.
  • Excellent organizational, time management, workload prioritization, critical thinking skills.
  • Ability to deal with frequent change and manage competing demands.
  • Ability to perform under pressure and deliver a quality work product.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal; Excellent interpersonal skills.
  • This position requires the individual to cultivate and maintain a broad network of resources in order to be successful
  • Proficiency in Microsoft applications, with particular focus on Excel, Word, PowerPoint. Advanced Excel skills are preferred
  • Able to read and understand MODU technical documentation including General Arrangement Drawings, Piping & Instrumentation Diagrams, Structural Drawings, and Electrical Schematics, Functional and Detailed Vessel and Equipment Specifications.
  • Must have a strong sense of accountability and be capable of maintaining a high degree of confidentiality with sensitive information.


Additional:


  • WORKING CONDITIONS: Work is performed in corporate offices as well as at worksite locations such as onboard rigs and in shipyards worldwide. The Project Engineer may be required to work more than 40 hours per week, including weekends.
  • Requires Specific Offshore Experience


Pre-Requisite/ Qualification


  • Must successfully complete pre-employment drug screen.
  • Must successfully complete pre-employment background check.


If you want to push yourself to great achievement, let Transocean develop your career.

Title: Sr Account Manager Athens base
Skills: Account Management|Business Development|Business Relationship Management|Communication|Customer Satisfaction|Performance Metrics|Presentation Skills|Presentations|Sales Performance|Strategic Thinking|
Job Description:
About the job

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

Role Description

The position will be responsible to serve Customers for installed base and develop, drive and grow the Honeywell business in Greece.

This position will report to the Regional Sales Manager Italy and East Med.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.

Purpose of the Job
  • Establish and own the territorial and major accounts plans and sales strategies in Greece aimed at serving, protecting and expanding customer installed base, as well as creating new installed base.
  • Primary customer interface responsible for the development of business, and management of relationships, with all the Customers into the area.
  • Understanding of the customer’s business drivers, and organization, and an understanding of the Honeywell´s offering and the value proposition to drive to real business outcomes.
  • Dissemination of key messages, initiatives, and of information pertaining to Honeywell Process Solutions offerings.
  • Business partner to the customer, establishes a defensible barrier to competitors, maximizes the business potential of their customers, and acts as the primary Customer interface for all products, solutions and services with this customer.
  • Expand installed base talking competitive migrations on competition installed base and new installation in expansions and green field projects.
  • Champions the customers’ needs and requirements within the Honeywell organization
Principal Responsibilities
  • Business Relationships: Develop and sustain long term customer relationships; Establish these relationships while engaging customers at all levels including senior levels of the customer organization; Early engagement in the customer buying process diagnosing customers’ needs and tailoring solutions to match
  • Sales Process: Manages the day to day and strategic: maintaining a balanced approach to superior customer service and strategic account planning; quarterly results and long term account goals; Identifies new sales opportunities and focuses on providing consultative support by building value propositions for solutions into the account; Manage and build customer contacts, serving as the customer’s ambassador , ‘trusted advisor’ and advocate; Focal point for relationship strategies, account and sales plans, proposal strategies, contract negotiations, etc.
  • Drives sales campaign and strategic initiatives.
  • Plan for account growth in the long term
  • Customers: Customers at all levels in an organization including executive level decision makers; pursue growth through regular face to face meetings and winning new customers to enlarge the assigned customer base
  • People Management: Leverages and marshals cross functional company resources to address customers’ drivers and initiatives in a consultative manner; Guides and leverages management and executive sponsor interactions with the customer; Leads peers by influence to ensure coordination and support to pursue orders.
Networks and Contacts

Internal
  • Regional Sales Manager (direct Manager for this role)
  • EMEA BTI/CGI leaders
  • HPS (Honeywell Process Solutions) lines of business professionals and managers and support functions
  • Sales Operations professionals
  • Proposal and estimating leaders
  • Customer marketing/technical solutions consultant
  • Law team (contract management team)
External
  • End Customers Executives, commercial contacts, partners EPCs and OEMs.
Supervisory Responsibilities
  • High level of interaction with Regional Sales Managers, leading the internal pursue team and driving the opportunities by influence.
Geographic Scope & Travel Requirements
  • Geographic responsibilities is Greece territory.
  • Frequent Travel is a standard requirement of the job, frequency may vary with an expected 50/70%.
Key Performance Measures
  • Key sales performance metrics (results Vs target; YOY growth, pipeline generated)
  • Opportunities planning and sales CRM regular update
  • Quality and strength of account plans and strategy
  • Early engagement
  • Customer visits
  • Right /diverse contact points in customer organization
  • Developing and Executing account management plan
  • Pipeline development at min 3x the target
Requirements
  • Proven multiyear sales experience in industrial environment with focus on both DCS-ESD as well as higher layers applications such as APC OTS, plus Operations and Business Applications
  • Business Development mentality – eager to meet new customers and show the value of new offerings
  • Hungry to win/get results
  • Availability to Travel
  • Experience operating as a leader in an international, highly matrix organization; multi-country management experience is a plus
  • Experienced in complex sale, including early engagement in the customer buying cycle at senior levels, building long-term strategic and executive relationships, team selling and opportunity planning
  • Understand the strategic direction of the vertical/initiative/business division
  • Good knowledge of customers’ businesses and drivers
  • High energy, able to stay focused long hours
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills
  • Works well in the matrix and with the functional organization (country and business organizations)
  • Establish credibility and respect for self and Honeywell internally & externally
  • Disciplined, responsive and reliable when committing to actions
  • Engages early and follows through
  • Leadership: leads others toward a goal (internal influence, organization knowledge, networking)
  • Knowledge of customer business, understanding customer needs
  • Quickly adapt to innovation and market changes
  • Strategic thinker with solid Account Management Planning
Location
  • Greece preferably Athens
What We Can Offer You
  • Dynamic, stimulating and creative international work environment
  • A culture that fosters inclusion, diversity and innovation
  • The chance to work with cutting edge products and solutions
  • A competitive salary package
  • Multiple possibilities to grow within the company structure
  • A culture that fosters inclusion, diversity and innovation
If this is your dream role, then we'd love to hear from you.

What else do you have to know?

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Additional Information
  • JOB ID: HRD184288
  • Category: Sales
  • Location: Athens,Greece
  • Exempt
Global (ALL)

Title: Executive Secretary

Howden Hellas Insurance & Reinsurance Brokers S.A., member of Howden Group Holdings, is seeking to hire an Executive Secretary.

Title: IT Solutions Architect
Skills: Archimate|Communication|Microservices|Oracle Certification Program (OCP)|Problem Solving|Software Development|Solution Architecture|Spring Framework|TOGAF|Technical Documentation|
Job Description:
About the job

Sword Services Greece is seeking to recruit a high caliber, energetic individual to join our Software Development team, being based in Athens as an IT Solutions Architect . The successful candidate will work in a multicultural environment supporting our core business in large Information Systems for the European Commission. The company is currently expanding its activities in Greece offering optimum career advancement opportunities for the successful candidates who should combine relevant educational and professional background with enthusiasm and eagerness.

What You Will Do...
  • Design and Review the architecture of Information Systems;
  • Analyze the integration of different information systems;
  • Produce software architecture documents, blueprints, best practices;
  • Assist in the technical documentation of the offered solutions to customers;
  • Communicate system architecture to technical and business audiences;
  • Define product solutions leveraging defined functional component model libraries and the product line architecture roadmap;
  • Propose IT products based on cost benefit analysis and research;
  • Define, document and develop best practices, design patterns and technology standards;
  • Provide technical leadership to development teams;
  • Research and monitor technology developments and industry trends, assesses their relevancy to the organization, and makes recommendations to enhance productivity
  • Analyze current solutions and identifies opportunities for improvements and automation
  • Contribute to the Architecture Repository and participate in the Architecture Board

What Is Your Experience…
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar;
  • Minimum 7 years of experience in software development of Information Systems;
  • At least 3 years of experience working as an IT Solution Architect;
  • Extensive hands-on experience with Java EE or Spring;
  • Experience providing technical leadership to development teams;
  • Experience working in Agile teams;
  • Experience developing applications on microservices architecture;
  • Familiar with TOGAF and ITIL.

Experience in the following technologies will be considered an asset :
  • Experience in SOA, Data Processing, Streaming (preferably Kafka) and Cloud Native Architectures;
  • Migrating applications to the cloud;
  • Knowledge of ML / AI / NLP / Data Analytics (preferably hands-on);
  • Web development frameworks (preferably React) and CMS (Drupal);
  • Professional certification(s) such as Oracle Certified Master (OCM), TOGAF, ArchiMate or AWS Certified solutions architect;
  • Knowledge of the IP domain.

Personal Characteristics...
  • Attention to detail and strong sense of responsibility;
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Proactively manage tasks and projects to agreed deadlines;
  • Ability to work effectively & efficiently with various diverse work teams (Development, Testing and Project Management);
  • Ability to persuade and influence others on the best approach to take;

What We Offer To You…
  • Competitive remuneration package;
  • Meal voucher card;
  • Private medical plan;
  • Private pension plan;
  • Shuttle Bus;
  • Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies;
  • Training & Development plan;
  • Employee Recognition plan;
  • Work in a certified “Diversity Charter” company;
  • Teambuilding events;
  • Social responsibility initiatives.

Applications must be in the English language

Title: GR Category Manager
Skills: Analytical Skills|Category Management|Customer Research|Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG)|Market Analysis|Problem Solving|Relationship Building|Research Projects|Retail Category Management|Strategy Alignment|
Job Description:
About the job

Site Name: Athens


Posted Date: May 11 2023


Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Advil, Voltaren, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.


Job Title


Country Category Manager GR


Right now, we’re in start-up mode. Giving those who join us the amazing opportunity to shape our company and the working experience we are building.


We are now looking for a great talent to join our Commercial Excellence department in Greece. You will be reporting directly to Category Management Lead Greece & Israel.


In this role you will be responsible to build strategic recommendations regarding category development opportunities, customer portfolio management, Customer CATMAN projects, planograms and visibility strategy for both MM and PH channels for the country under your responsibility.


Your role will include…


Development of visibility strategy:


  • Owning the Country planning process and setting the strategy for shelf visibility with direct contribution to 3/1 Plan
  • Being a source of strategic expertise for commercial teams and owning the capability build programme across the market.


Drive on and off line execution:


  • Being responsible for driving in-depth category expertise, shopper & customer research projects, category insight mining in order to provide business with full understanding of shopper / customer behavior / trends and new opportunities for Haleon.
  • Playing an active role in Core Assortment Strategy and portfolio strategy development partnering with Customer Marketing, marketing, sales and NRM
  • Leading strategic customer Category Management projects through relevant KAMs
  • Being a subject matter expert, identifying gaps & opportunities and creating recommendations to sales for execution.


Business Partnering:


  • Collaborating closely with GRI Category Management Lead and aligning on key priorities and projects
  • Collaborating with ComEx Team with focus on 3/1 Plan delivery
  • Collaborating with cross functional teams at Haleon in respect to customer actional plans
  • Supporting sales team with all CATMAN and e-commerce related projects
  • Supporting KAMs in building relationship with key trade partners


Why you?


Qualifications & Skills:


  • Education: University degree in economics or business administration, sciences or engineering
  • Language: Greek and English (fluent)
  • Min 2 years of proven CATMAN experience from a global FMCG company
  • Background in sales, marketing, customer marketing, analytics, or related field
  • Team Management experience
  • Strong experience in leading strategic process and alignment, in a way that builds real buy-to ensure execution follows strategic alignment
  • Strong change management experience
  • Strong analytical skills with proven ability to transition them into insights
  • Best in class problem solver / strong solution orientation


Please kindly send your CV in English


Why Join Us?


The future of everyday health is changing. And we’re the people changing it. In front of us is an incredible opportunity to go beyond what any of us have done before. And make everyday health more achievable, more inclusive and more sustainable. For more and more people. So join us, as we build one of the world’s leading consumer healthcare companies. Join us to innovate our category-leading brands. To better understand people’s everyday health needs. To tackle the biggest barriers that stand in their way. To change individual and societal behavior.  Join us to work with colleagues who share your restless energy. To explore your interests. To stretch yourself to do the best work of your career. And join us, as together we build a working experience that encourages us all to lead happier, healthier, more productive lives.  The way we see it, every day is an opportunity for better. And we’re going all in to realize it.


Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/


At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone. We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.


As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information, which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.


Haleon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.


Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, Haleon may be required to capture and report expenses Haleon incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure Haleon’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements.

Title: Site Manager (Civil-Mechanical-Electrical)
Skills: AutoCAD|CPM Scheduling|Communication|Constructability|Electrical Engineering|English|Health and Safety Executive (HSE)|Influencing Others|Interpersonal Skills|Project Management|
Job Description:
About the job

MYTILINEOS a leading global industrial and energy company with a strong international presence covering two business Sectors, the Energy Sector and the Metallurgy Sector is currently seeking to hire a Site Manager.



Main Responsibilities:

  • Support, review and provide constructability feedback on the completion of engineering specifications for construction and supply contracts for assigned projects.
  • Review construction schedule that incorporates information from system design and engineering, plan to accomplish project goals and provide leadership to the project teams, external contractors, supply chain and reporting project management and company management. Critical path management.
  • Maintain familiarity with contracts and documents to ensure that work is executed in accordance with METKA-EGN’s expectations and that the work fulfils contractual requirements.
  • Develop effective relationships with contractors, suppliers, engineers, consultants, local officials, and team members to ensure successful, timely completion of deliverables that support the project goals.
  • Develop effective and supportive relationships with colleagues including those with responsibilities in other areas of the company such as development, operations, tax, accounting, finance, electricity sale, insurance, legal, etc.
  • Monitor and oversee civil, structural, mechanical, and electrical work at the project site to ensure it meets contractual obligations.
  • Ensures projects are built according to plans created and submitted as well as to their standards.
  • Cross functional co-ordination with – Engineering, Project management, Supply Chain, Logistics, Quality, and all support functions as needed.
  • Ensures the works are performed according to the HSE plan.
  • Ensures the periodical construction, quality, and HSE reports are generated on time.
  • Review all contractors’ QA plans & procedures and bring all plans into conformance with project requirements, supported by the project team.
  • Reviews drawings and procedures periodically and suggests changes if necessary.
  • Support the Site Engineers with responses to subcontractor RFIs.
  • Foster and develop a positive project team effort and assist in resolving differences.
  • Review of projects on a day-to-day basis against the progress milestones.
  • Identify, source, and qualify subcontractors and suppliers for project.
  • Performs regular inspections and meetings to review site conditions, discuss and define areas of responsibility, clarify all issues and to ensure accurate scheduling of project related activities.
  • Acts as METKA-EGN representative onsite during all equipment deliveries.
  • Conducts audits of site conditions and equipment installation of subcontractors on the site.
  • Performs audits of the jobsites to verify accurate completion of scope of work, supported by the Quality and Compliance Engineer. Documents and communicates all discrepancies.
  • Identifies and communicates all application and installation concerns. Communicates concerns back to Senior management for required resolution and future issue prevention.
  • Works safely always. Adheres to all applicable safety policies. Complies with all company policies, procedures, and standards.
  • Assist the Project Manager with controlling costs and managing adherence to budget.
  • Assist the Project Managers with the verification of monthly progress claims from subcontractors.
  • Must be willing and able to take initiative to protect the interests of METKA-EGN and customers.
  • High degree of communication and interpersonal skills to work with customers, vendors, and influence others.
  • High degree of technical competency in electrical, civil, and mechanical application.
  • Ability to maintain consistent attendance.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, civil engineering or other.
  • Proven track record in the construction of solar parks with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in large scale solar parks (minimum 5MW)
  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD and MS Office.
  • Languages: English essential
  • Excellent communication, organization, administration, and interpersonal skills
  • Proven ability to manage a large team.
  • Ability to operate in a highly technical or particularly complex field.

Title: Accounting & Tax Supervisor - Athens
Skills: Balance Sheet Review|Balance Sheets|Certified Public Accounting|Expenses|Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG)|Financial Audits|Financial Policies|Greek|Gross Profit Analysis|Journal Entries (Accounting)|
Job Description:
About the job

Location


Marousi, Athens, GR


We, as Arla Foods - a European dairy cooperative with over 19,000 employees and 12,600 farmers - stand for a strong community with pronounced Scandinavian values and strong roots in our local markets. Our cooperative principle enables us to be particularly close to our farmers - the owners of Arla - and motivates us every day to do only the best for our farmers, colleagues, our milk, our consumers, and our environment! We are convinced that together we will achieve the best results!


Are you passionate about data analysis to drive strategy in a sustainable way? Then this is your opportunity to obtain insights into the world of Finance through a growing FMCG Company.


As our new Accounting & Tax Supervisor you will be responsible for the Accounting Team and report directly to the Finance Manager. You will collaborate closely with Sales, Sales Controlling, Customer Service and Marketing colleagues. This job is a great opportunity to accelerate your career in the FMCG industry!


Your Key Responsibility


  • Manage and oversee the daily operation of accounting Department
  • Coordinate the monthly book close/ Submit the Monthly Results
  • Actual financial reporting
  • Supervise Accounts re-conciliation of journal entries
  • Supervise Accounts Payable
  • Account reconciliation and analysis Prepaid / Accrued Expenses, Deposits, Inter-company balances
  • Plan, coordinate and execute annual financial audit
  • Assist in the compilation of information for the Company’s annual tax returns
  • Coordinate relationship with all public authorities and banks
  • Develop and implement policies and procedures with emphasis on internal controls
  • Special projects as required
  • Reporting Marketing Spend, Promotion, Debtor Aging, Inventory level, Out-Of-Stock
  • Reconcile statistical SAP-gross profit with Financial Reporting
  • Balance Sheet reconciliations
  • Financial compliance to national law and Arla Foods’ financial policies/IFSR


Your profile


  • You have a university degree in Economics, Finance or comparable qualification
  • You have a recognized accountancy qualification - ideally CIMA and you are a Holder of a valid Greek accounting certification
  • Holder of A’ class accountant license
  • You have minimum 5 years’ post-qualification work experience including leadership, ideally in the FMCG/food sector
  • You have Hands-on experience with tax-audits and audits in general
  • You are a skilled IT-user (SAP, BW, MS-office)
  • You are fluent in Greek and English, both orally and written


Application and contact


Please apply through our website under reference of your salary expectations and your earliest availability. For further information please contact Katharina Kalra Jessen under +491725875788.


Equal opportunity


Arla Foods is a company with equal opportunities for everyone regardless of age, race, gender, or any other criteria that is not a professional qualification for an open position. Purely for reasons of readability we have chosen to create all our job postings in male format. Title: Database Administrator
Skills: Analytical Skills|Communication|Databases|High Availability (HA)|Performance Tuning|Proactive Monitoring|Query Writing|Replication (Computing)|Server Configuration|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

iGaming:


If it’s iGaming, we know a thing or two. Light & Wonder’s digital team leads the global gaming market, providing jaw-dropping content and innovative software that powers the world's most successful online gaming providers.


Position Summary


The primary tasks are focused on ensuring excellent uptime and performance of the DB and as such, a DB administrator has a good understanding of RDBMS operation in general, good knowledge of best practices, and a passion for ensuring the highest standards of uptime through proactive monitoring, pre-emptive tuning and general attention to detail. In this role, you will be primarily responsible for MSSQL databases, with secondary responsibilities for databases from other vendors, so a desire to learn multiple platforms is key.


As a member of a geographically dispersed group of database experts, the DBA is required to work on a shared backlog of time-sensitive tasks and deliver high quality DB services to the Company. This is only possible through efficient teamwork, prompt escalation and excellent communication skills.


We’re looking for a DBA to join our growing team!


What we are looking for:


  • Great communications skills
  • Able to articulate and explain complex situations calmly to non-technical individuals
  • Have a positive drive attitude
  • Have the ability to work and coordinate with a diverse team across different time zones
  • Can work off Hours when needed
  • Experience in virtualized environments


Qualifications:


  • At least 4 years’ experience as a DBA
  • Experience in Installation/Upgrades:
  • though command line and/or using configuration file
  • SQL Server versions (Clustered/Availability Groups…)
  • Configure Replication
  • Experience in Backup/Restore/Recovery:
  • Full/Differential/Transaction log backup
  • Full/Point-In-Time restore
  • Testing backup methodology (test restore)
  • Database Corruption recovery
  • Experience in MSSQL HA/DR features:
  • Failover Cluster Instances (FCI)
  • Log shipping
  • Mirroring
  • Availability Groups
  • Replication
  • Experience in Troubleshooting:
  • Troubleshooting Highly transactional databases
  • High Availability and Disaster Recovery (Clustering / Availability Groups / LogShipping / Mirroring )
  • DB Performance Issues (Optimised hardware, Optimised SQL configurations)
  • SQL Incident Investigation (Logs/Audits/Monitor)
  • Using wait statistics / DMVs
  • Problematic Queries
  • Analysing execution plan giving recommendations (indexing/rewriting query)
  • Locking/Blocking process and how to resolve them
  • Experience in Performance Tuning:
  • Optimize queries
  • Optimize server configuration
  • Improve disk/storage layout
  • Familiar with SQL versions and features


Qualifications


Years of Related Experience


At least 4 years


Work Conditions


Light & Wonder is the global leader in cross-platform games and entertainment. The company brings together 5,000 employees from six continents to connect content between land-based and digital channels with unmatched technology and distribution. Guided by a culture that values daring teamwork and creativity, Light & Wonder builds new worlds of play, developing game experiences loved by players around the globe. The company’s OpenGaming(tm) platform powers the largest digital-gaming network in the industry. Light & Wonder is committed to the highest standards of integrity, from promoting player responsibility to implementing sustainable practices. To learn more, visit lnw.com.

Title: Cloud Systems Administrator
Skills: Amazon Web Services (AWS)|Ansible|Apache|Cloud Computing|Docker Products|Git|Linux|Nginx|OpenShift|Tomcat|
Job Description:
About the job

At Alpha Bank, we are shaping the future of banking in Greece.


Through our large-scale Transformation Program, we are changing the way we operate, the way we deliver results and the way we service our Customers.


· We understand our Customers’ needs and design experiences around them.

· We work in partnership and invite diversity of skills and perspectives.

· We are forward-thinking and drive continuous improvement.

· We make things happen; we execute quickly and focus on what is essential.


If you are a change enthusiast who sets ambitious goals and works with a sense of purpose, we want to get to know you!


Join our team and #be_part_of_tomorrow


#AlphaBank #TheAlphaBlueprint #Tomorrow


Job Description


The Cloud Systems Administrator will be placed in the IT Infrastructure and Operations Systems Division and will be responsible for supporting cloud, Windows and/or Unix infrastructure.


What you will be doing


  • Configuring and supporting cloud systems.
  • Setting up private clouds.
  • Monitoring patches and permissions and repairing deployments.
  • Creating policies for cloud computing systems.
  • Monitoring network performance and cloud resources.
  • Establishing connections among cloud networks.
  • Integrating cloud systems into current environments.
  • Managing requests for cloud services modifications.
  • Evaluating and implementing new technologies.
  • Establishing cloud system security methods and procedures.
  • Inspecting cloud providers, programs, software and other cloud clarifications.
  • Documenting system infrastructure.
  • Resolving operational and security issues.


What you need to have


  • A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or in Electrical Engineering (or in another related field).
  • At least three (3) years of professional experience in Cloud System Administration.
  • Excellent skills in Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) and Windows as well as in scripting and system automation (Perl, Bash, etc.). RHCSA or RHCE or an equivalent certification will be highly evaluated.
  • Linux and Windows troubleshooting and performance monitoring experience.
  • Application server (JBoss EAP, Tomcat) and web server (Apache httpd, Nginx) administration experience.
  • Familiarity with Elastic Stack infrastructure administration.
  • Hands-on experience in containerization technologies and tools (OpenShift, Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Administration experience in Red Hat Satellite.
  • Experience in Infrastructure automation and configuration (Ansible).
  • Experience in using NoSQL databases and distributed messaging systems, such as Redis and Kafka, in the context of low latency and high transaction volume systems.
  • Familiarity with virtualization technologies like VMWare Server/ESX.
  • A solid understanding of LAN/WAN networking.
  • Excellent command of the English language.
  • Well-rounded personality with proven people management skills.
  • Advanced organizational skills, coupled with the ability to manage projects of varying length.



What will be considered an asset


  • A postgraduate degree in Computer Science or in a relevant IT discipline.
  • Working knowledge of Containers – Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift.
  • Ansible Automation Platform administration experience. Familiarity with Security Standards (CIS, PCI/DSS) and ability to implement them at server level, utilizing SCAP Tools and profiles.
  • Familiarity with SecDevOps and CI/CD tools and pipelines (Azure DevOps, Git, Nexus RM).
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, Google).


What we offer


It’s all about our people. At Alpha Bank, you will enjoy:


  • A friendly and collaborative working environment that supports taking initiative and action.
  • A culture that centers around learning and continuous development and encourages everyone to bring their best self to work.
  • The opportunity to challenge your thinking through your participation in complex tasks and transformation projects.
  • Being part of a large organization with a leading role in the Greek economy and a strong presence in the community.
  • Flexible working options.
  • A competitive salary and benefits.


All applications will be acknowledged and treated in utmost confidence.

Title: GR Category Manager
Skills: Analytical Skills|Category Management|Customer Research|Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG)|Market Analysis|Problem Solving|Relationship Building|Research Projects|Retail Category Management|Strategy Alignment|
Job Description:
About the job

Site Name: Athens


Posted Date: May 11 2023


Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Advil, Voltaren, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.


Job Title


Country Category Manager GR


Right now, we’re in start-up mode. Giving those who join us the amazing opportunity to shape our company and the working experience we are building.


We are now looking for a great talent to join our Commercial Excellence department in Greece. You will be reporting directly to Category Management Lead Greece & Israel.


In this role you will be responsible to build strategic recommendations regarding category development opportunities, customer portfolio management, Customer CATMAN projects, planograms and visibility strategy for both MM and PH channels for the country under your responsibility.


Your role will include…


Development of visibility strategy:


  • Owning the Country planning process and setting the strategy for shelf visibility with direct contribution to 3/1 Plan
  • Being a source of strategic expertise for commercial teams and owning the capability build programme across the market.


Drive on and off line execution:


  • Being responsible for driving in-depth category expertise, shopper & customer research projects, category insight mining in order to provide business with full understanding of shopper / customer behavior / trends and new opportunities for Haleon.
  • Playing an active role in Core Assortment Strategy and portfolio strategy development partnering with Customer Marketing, marketing, sales and NRM
  • Leading strategic customer Category Management projects through relevant KAMs
  • Being a subject matter expert, identifying gaps & opportunities and creating recommendations to sales for execution.


Business Partnering:


  • Collaborating closely with GRI Category Management Lead and aligning on key priorities and projects
  • Collaborating with ComEx Team with focus on 3/1 Plan delivery
  • Collaborating with cross functional teams at Haleon in respect to customer actional plans
  • Supporting sales team with all CATMAN and e-commerce related projects
  • Supporting KAMs in building relationship with key trade partners


Why you?


Qualifications & Skills:


  • Education: University degree in economics or business administration, sciences or engineering
  • Language: Greek and English (fluent)
  • Min 2 years of proven CATMAN experience from a global FMCG company
  • Background in sales, marketing, customer marketing, analytics, or related field
  • Team Management experience
  • Strong experience in leading strategic process and alignment, in a way that builds real buy-to ensure execution follows strategic alignment
  • Strong change management experience
  • Strong analytical skills with proven ability to transition them into insights
  • Best in class problem solver / strong solution orientation


Please kindly send your CV in English


Why Join Us?


The future of everyday health is changing. And we’re the people changing it. In front of us is an incredible opportunity to go beyond what any of us have done before. And make everyday health more achievable, more inclusive and more sustainable. For more and more people. So join us, as we build one of the world’s leading consumer healthcare companies. Join us to innovate our category-leading brands. To better understand people’s everyday health needs. To tackle the biggest barriers that stand in their way. To change individual and societal behavior.  Join us to work with colleagues who share your restless energy. To explore your interests. To stretch yourself to do the best work of your career. And join us, as together we build a working experience that encourages us all to lead happier, healthier, more productive lives.  The way we see it, every day is an opportunity for better. And we’re going all in to realize it.


Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/


At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone. We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.


As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information, which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.


Haleon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.


Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, Haleon may be required to capture and report expenses Haleon incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure Haleon’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements.
