Title: Senior Software Engineer / Dev Lead (Python)
Skills: Analytics|Back-End Web Development|Computer Science|Data Analytics|Data Pipelines|Data Science|Data Visualization|Relational Databases|Software Development|Visualization|
Job Description:
About the job

About DBx: DBX accelerates knowledge and insight development ahead of time in Commodities trading. We help commodity analysts & traders to decide effectively and react fast, optimizing their next move in the volatile market. Using our AI infrastructure, we are developing a world-class, real-time Data-as-a-Service platform using deep domain expertise and the latest in Machine Learning and Satellite Earth Observation technologies. DBX is used by top-notch Hedge Funds, Trading houses, Media organizations & commodity producers to gain insights, and plan and execute their next market move.

About the Role: We offer an exciting opportunity for a Senior Software Engineer/ Dev Lead to design and deliver state-of-the-art architectures and technology stacks, as well as a global technology product vision for our Data-as-a-Service platform. To make this happen, you will work at the intersection of data pipelines, machine learning, and data visualization, collaborating with commodity trading deep domain experts, and product and data teams. This will be the first member of the engineering team, hence the plan is that the successful candidate will lead the team once it grows.

What you will do in this role:

  • You will have the unique opportunity to design, build and maintain technology product architecture, features, and infrastructure while shaping the direction of the team.
  • Work closely with the CEO (founder), product team, and data team to build an advanced supply chain visibility solution
  • Develop back-end and as well front-end modules
  • Setup and drive the QA automation and DevOps pipeline
  • Design / Develop / Maintain integration interfaces
  • Data storage solution (eg. Database) structure, design, administration, and tuning


Requirements

What you bring to the team:

  • 5+ years of working experience in end-to-end full-stack software engineering involving data pipelines, machine learning, and data visualization
  • Demonstrable Python development skills. Experience with additional programming languages is welcome (e.g Javascript, R, etc.)
  • Working experience with Linux infrastructure technology on top of Cloud Computing platforms (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, etc)
  • Working experience with relational databases (design, administration, tuning)
  • Technical leadership in the implementation of software projects
  • Passion for learning and innovation
  • Excellent command of written and spoken English
  • Master's or Bachelor's university degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or exceptional practical experience


Benefits

What we offer:

  • Opportunity to join a fast-growing company early on, work in a young, driven team and learn from experienced leaders with deep expertise in commodities trading.
  • Competitive base salary with additional performance incentives
  • Coverage under the company's collective health insurance plan
  • Fun and well-equipped work environment that includes our in-house restaurant with healthy, freshly cooked lunches every day

Strict adherence to Confidentiality, Intellectual Property and Non-Compete provisions is expected.

All applications will be considered under the terms and conditions of confidentiality in accordance with the regulations of personal data protection.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. At Signal, we believe that diversity of opinions, approaches and viewpoints is key to our innovation and success and we encourage that with our hiring, development and rewards practices. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristics by law and take actions to eliminate those from our workplace.


Desired Skills and Experience

  • SQL
  • python

Title: Technical Lead, Quality Engineer
Skills: Communication|Graphic Design Principles|Quality Assurance|Quality Engineering|Test Automation|Test Coverage|Testing Tools|Web Applications|White Box|White Box Testing|
Job Description:
About the job

Job description:

Role Overview

This role is part of the engineering team that applies the best of open source technologies to a challenging domain where software meets network.

As a Quality Engineer Lead, you’ll play a crucial role in leading test automation and infrastructure development, testing new design and architectural choices which have a significant impact on our systems, our business and most importantly, our customers.

To do this, you’ll have in-depth knowledge and understanding of Quality Assurance, web application software, and design principles. You must have industry-leading technical abilities and excellent communication skills.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work directly with Developers, UX Designers and Product Managers in an agile environment and all phases of software development to ensure the quality of our applications and platforms
  • Establish and continuously improve quality engineering processes and practices
  • Expose defects at services, architecture and application code in a way that developer can respond quickly and mentor other QEs
  • Improve the Developer Experience by automating tests and continuously improve the automation infrastructure

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field
  • 3+ years’ experience as a developer, QA Engineer, or as a Software Development Engineer in Test
  • 3+ years’ experience in white box testing preferably in react and nodejs
  • 3+ years’ experience to programmatically test the product, measure test coverage, develop the best automation, drive testability and diagnostic ability into the product, while promoting best practices in quality areas
  • API automation testing
  • Ability to triage issues and multitask on multiple products and projects
  • Demonstrated leadership abilities in an engineering environment in driving operational excellence and best practices
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment
  • Provide technical interviews in his area of expertise
  • Lead construction of working documents within the team and put forward suggestions that are helpful to agile development process, development speed and quality in a timely manner
  • Ability to decompose tasks into separate units and provide guidelines to Senior Engineers

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with open source test tools
  • Working experience with unit test automation frameworks
  • Experience building test frameworks for applications on various platforms
  • Ability to identify key technical points and potential value in a certain technical discipline



PCCW Global does not sponsor for immigration and other non-immigrant visas for this role.

PCCW is an equal-opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates. Information provided will be treated in strict confidence and will only be used for recruitment-related purposes. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the employer's personal data policies, a copy of which will be provided immediately upon request.

Title: SW Engineer in Test
Skills: Groovy|JMeter|Selenium|SoapUI|Software Development|Software Testing|Test Automation|Test Cases|Test Scripts|XML|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany - Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with a strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: https://www.netcompany-intrasoft.com


Job Description


A day in the life of a Software Engineer in Test


As a Software Engineer in Test, you will be a part of a vibrant team who design, develop, deploy, customize and support technologies for large-scale software applications of EU institutions / Products / Public Sector. You will have the opportunity to be exposed to a wide variety of services and technologies in order to develop a solid background in the field of applications development.


Your everyday life will mainly consist of working for one of the most important phases of the S/W development lifecycle.


Your main duties will be:


  • Understand the business logic for the system under test
  • Familiarize with the architecture of the system under test
  • Analyze the tests to be automated and identify the most appropriate test automation methodology/technology
  • Implement and maintain test automation scripts/frameworks
  • Participate in PoC for evaluation of various tools, frameworks, methodologies
  • Participate in the building of a CI pipeline
  • Automate tests for any of the following test types (functional, performance, usability, compatibility, cross-browser, component)
  • Analysis of test results for troubleshooting, qualitative and quantitative analysis


Qualifications


If you have


  • Degree in Information Technology or another relevant field
  • Experience in Software Testing including expertise in writing Test scripts for Functional, Regression and Performance tests
  • Experience in various tools/frameworks such as Selenium, SoapUI, JMeter
  • Work experience in the creation of Test Cases, Test Scripts, Test Reports and participation in Test Cycles
  • Complete understanding of the Agile Software Development methodologies
  • Excellent command of the English language (written & oral)


…then this position is suitable for you!


It would also be a plus if you had


  • Knowledge in WebServices (SOAP & RESTful), Cucumber, Serenity, TestNG, JUnit, Mockito, REST Assured API and Jira, Jira XRay, Javascript, Typescript, Microservice Architectures, Kafka, Arquillian and Spring Boot are considered a plus
  • Work experience in Java, .Net, Groovy, SQL, XML


This position comes with


  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business, STSC internal trainings), and fast career growth
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: People Advisory Services | Manager
Skills: Client Relations|Communication|Customer Satisfaction|Interpersonal Skills|Leadership|Presentation Skills|Presentations|Problem Solving|Strategic Thinking|Timelines|
Job Description:
About the job

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


The opportunity


Working in a multi-national creative environment, you will be given the opportunity to work on challenging projects, gaining exposure and interact in a fast-paced environment.


We, at the People Advisory Team of EY Greece, are giving the best of ourselves every day to fulfill our purpose; to build a better working world by creating the best experiences for the people of the organizations we work with. We believe, and have solid proof, that putting humans@center is the only successful way forward for individuals, organizations, and ecosystems. We are currently seeking highly driven people to join our team and help us make our vision a reality.


Working with us you should expect to explore the areas of Organizational Design & Workforce Planning | Change Management & People Transformation | Performance & Rewards Optimization | Culture & Leadership Development | Learning & Talent optimization | Board Effectiveness always looking for new ways to apply sustainability principles and innovative thinking across everything we do.


What We Are Looking For


We are seeking for a People Advisory Manager to join our high-performing team. You will need to thrive in picking up new skills as you go, so natural curiosity and the ability to develop new solutions and minimize complexity are essential. If you believe in yourself, if you understand that change is the only constant and you can build mutually beneficial relationships when interact with others, we would love to meet you!


Your Key Responsibilities


Being part of the People Advisory Team, as a Manager, you are expected to be a strategic thinker with excellent people management skills and high responsibility for new business development.


You will have a leading role in both realizing the team strategy and growing our client impact. This will involve leading on client development initiatives and drawing on the support of the wider team to put forward and oversee high impact change, people and talent solutions.


You will be working in teams of EY professionals across different functions with diverse backgrounds, aiming to deliver quality services to our clients. You’ll work with leading organizations to help them create long term value with their people and you’ll use your knowledge and experience to bring out-of-the-box solutions to them.


You will enhance your knowledge and experience across a wide range of domains and industry sectors, you will have the opportunity to experiment with new concepts and work with or guide teams to deliver exceptional experiences for our clients.


You will also be participating in market, sales and business development activities for our Consulting Services. As part of our team you will be expected to take on responsibility early, while continuously developing your personal skills through learning, experiences and coaching.


Skills and attributes for success:


  • Leading the execution of people management and transformation engagements
  • Managing engagement economics
  • Developing and maintaining productive working relationships with clients
  • Guiding and developing team members
  • Working with different levels of Stakeholders to understand their needs, compose elements of complex solutions and plan on end-to-end delivery
  • Working across service-lines contributing to delivering a holistic approach for the client
  • Possess in depth business acumen and demonstrate ability to quickly assimilate new knowledge
  • Remain current on new developments in advisory services capabilities and industry knowledge
  • Ability/flexibility to travel on overseas assignment as the need arises
  • Strong leadership and team-building abilities
  • Project management skills and experience
  • Strong analytical, problem solving, numerical and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work under tight timelines
  • Demonstrated integrity, values, principles and work ethic


To qualify for the role, you must have:


  • 6-8 of previous experience working in a professional services, public or private sector organization, having gained considerable experience in the areas of people management and/or organizational transformation
  • Excellent academic background, including at a minimum a Master degree, preferably in business and/or human sciences.
  • Experience in managing Organizational Development and/or HR Transformation projects (Digital HR Transformation, Performance management Systems, HR Processes etc.)
  • Experience in working with diverse and agile teams; ability to adapt to different team roles depending on the nature of each project
  • Professional certifications related to Human Resources Management will be considered as an asset
  • Strong written, verbal communications skills and presentation skills in Greek and English. Fluent English is a pre-requisite. Knowledge of additional languages will be appreciated
  • Proficiency with MS Office is a prerequisite. Knowledge of human resources management information systems (HRMS) will be considered as an asset.
  • Multi-sector & international experience will be considered as an asset.


What We Offer


 


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:


  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Gain international experience: You’ll be able to work with EY professionals across world and share best practices and approaches.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.


The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.


EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Skills: .NET Core|.NET Framework|EtherCAT|Industrial Automation|JavaScript|JavaScript Frameworks|Profinet|REST APIs|React.js|SignalR|
Job Description:
About the job

Senior Software Engineer - Motion Control and Robotic Systems

RoboteQ is an international company, a subsidiary of Nidec Motor Corporation, a renowned maker of Motor Controllers and Navigation Sensors for Mobile Robots, Industrial Automation, and Electrification of off-road Vehicles.

We are pleased to announce an opportunity for a Senior Software Engineer based near Athens, Greece.

Summary of Role

In this role as Software Engineer, you will be working with a highly motivated team to bring to market innovative solutions for customers in the AGV, Robotics and Industrial Automation Markets. Key aspects for this role will be to develop, test, and document PC tools to support our platform products.


Primary Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, troubleshoot, debug, and implement software products and solutions in accordance with established standards.
  • Provide technical documentation for the design, implementation, and testing of the software.
  • Produce and review technical documents, specifications, and test procedures.
  • Create and execute functional test setups.
  • Keep up with technology and introduce new approaches/best practices to peers to gain technical knowledge and to resolve technical difficulties.
  • Develop and execute unit tests to validate code.
  • Research, explore and select the best possible methods and components for the company products.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer Science.
  • 3+ years’ experience with .NET stack - (such as .NET Core, .NET 4.8, Windows Forms and ASP.NET).
  • Good knowledge of SignalR and RESTful APIs.
  • Experience in any one of the modern JavaScript frameworks (React.js, Angular.js, Vue.js ... etc.).
  • Strong experience with multi-threading programming models.
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git and CVS.
  • Knowledge of communication Fieldbuses: CANOpen, UDS, EtherCAT, Profinet, EthernetIP, etc. is considered a plus.
  • English language: good speaking and writing level.
  • Good communication skills, positive attitude, and eagerness to learn.


Location:

  • Markopoulo, Attica, Greece, 19003


Reference:

  • RQ-SWE2301

Title: Senior Technical Operations Engineer
Skills: Communication|Linux System Administration|Problem Solving|System Administration|Technical Operations|Technical Support|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

iGaming:


If it’s iGaming, we know a thing or two. Light & Wonder’s digital team leads the global gaming market, providing jaw-dropping content and innovative software that powers the world's most successful online gaming providers.


Position Summary


Light & Wonder is the global leader in cross-platform games and entertainment. The company brings together 5,000 employees from six continents to connect content between land-based and digital channels with unmatched technology and distribution. Guided by a culture that values daring teamwork and creativity, Light & Wonder builds new worlds of play, developing game experiences loved by players around the globe. The company’s OpenGaming(tm) platform powers the largest digital-gaming network in the industry. Light & Wonder is committed to the highest standards of integrity, from promoting player responsibility to implementing sustainable practices. To learn more, visit lnw.com.


We are looking for a Senior Technical Operations Engineer to join our team. In this role you will work with our customer facing portal product. The portal has a lot of integrations to game and payment systems as well as our own backend account system. We have an advanced ecosystem of products handling player data, transactions and third party integrations for gaming operators around the world.


As a Senior Technical Operations Engineer you will be responsible for ensuring that our customer-facing applications are supported, maintained and installed correctly. The role involves both support work as well as working on new customer implementation projects. You will be focusing on technology and software and handle incoming incidents, change requests, problems and in-depth root cause analyses. You will also be working closely with the product and development teams to ensure we get the most out of the software.


Responsibilities:


  • Software deployments using Ansible
  • Ensure Incidents assigned to the team are being managed within agreed SLAs
  • Triage, troubleshoot and resolve issues with system availability, latency or performance.
  • Setup and maintain monitoring of systems and ensure alarms are documented in up to date Knowledge Base Articles.
  • Create and maintain Runbooks used by the team


You will work in a geographically distributed team of experienced colleagues that all work with the same systems and product. It is a fast-paced environment where each team member play a central role for the business.


Qualifications


  • We are looking for a person who has previous experience of working in a Systems Administration, SRE or DevOps role with an application focus.
  • Strong background in Linux and automated deployments using tools like Ansible.
  • We believe that you love troubleshooting and get excited when you need to investigate problems or learn new features.
  • You are a flexible team player with strong problem-solving skills, have a passion for business and the ability to communicate with different stakeholders within the organisation.
  • As a person you are curious and always want to improve yourself as well as the team.
  • We also believe you have experience of working with ITIL processes and knowledge about industry leading public IaaS solutions such as AWS.


Years Of Related Experience


At least 4 years


Additional Information


Light & Wonder leads the global gaming market, providing innovative software that powers the world’s most successful operators and online gaming providers.


We pride ourselves on product innovation and technical excellence and are constantly adding new applications and new functionality to our product suite, used by billions of end users.


Want to be part of our story?


We are a group of distributed multidisciplinary engineers, passionate about casino gaming, focused on a few highly scalable distributed platforms on a hybrid technology stack running in public and private clouds.


The teams are small and move fast -- all members are expected to be able to achieve maximum results with minimal direction.

Title: Front End/BI Developer
Skills: DAX|Dashboards|Data Analytics|Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)|HTML|Microsoft Power BI|SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)|SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)|User Interface Design|Visualization|
Job Description:
About the job

Join the Hempel marine Solutions team and help decarbonize the shipping industry

As a trusted partner in the marine coating industry, Hempel is helping vessel owners reduce their CO2-emissions through a combination of high-performance coating systems and continuous hull monitoring. As part of the process which will directly showcase performance to our partners, the Data and Technology team is looking to expand the team with a frontend developer of web and BI solutions.

Be part of the digital revolution within marine coatings

You will get the opportunity to become a central stakeholder and developer in the production of a major web application and a range of BI tools used by Hempel and it’s customers, including UI and UX design, as well as implementing various graphing tools for efficient visualization of big datasets. Additionally, you will also support in porting visuals from a local solution, with the possibility of doing miscellaneous backend development.

The Main Focus Areas For This Role Are
  • Frontend design – Planning and execution of design choices related to UI and UX, as well as managing overall brand compliance of the solutions
  • Planning – Engaging with technical and commercial stakeholders to select the correct frameworks/tools for different use cases
  • Frontend implementation – Coding in HTML, CS, JS and JS-based frameworks/libraries on web applications and Power BI for BI tools.
  • Graphical implementation – implementing various graphical utilities, such as graphs, plots, and interactive visualizations.
  • Continuous implementation and maintenance of web application and associated BI tools.
You will be joining a dedicated team of fifteen colleagues in the Marine Data and Technology team, working across our Global Services and Marine Business Units. Half the team is based in Lyngby, Denmark, while the other half is based in different countries in Europe and Asia.

We are looking for a frontend developer with an eye for elegant design and efficient UX

As our ideal candidate you hold a strong talent for pre-production design as well implementation within various web-frameworks. You have worked with one or more projects which combined the use of HTML, CSS, and JS, to produce a sleek and consistently designed website. Experience within JS-based frameworks is a plus. When faced with unique challenges, you generally gravitate towards the simplest solution. As a person you are thorough, disciplined and reliable with a tendency to plan ahead.

The Main Requirements For The Role Are
  • A structured and design-minded approach to complex issues. An ability to visualize complex data as plots is a plus.
  • Web-based design in HTML, CSS and JS, with experience in a JS-based framework/library.
  • Experience in designing UX/UI for at least one major web-based project – This includes projects from educational institutions, previous work, or personal projects.
  • Experience within any of the following is a plus – Git, Node package manager, Svelte, Power BI, python, database connections, and CI/CD tools.
  • Curious by nature and able to combine your structured logic with a creative approach to find solutions to challenges you haven’t faced before
  • Fluent in English
A world leading supplier of trusted coating solutions

At Hempel we’re guardians of our customers’ most valuable assets. From vessels to windmills and homes, our coatings can be found around the globe. They bring colour to our homes and places of work, and increase the performance of assets and equipment, increasing return on investment. With business in mind and people at heart we always work together to influence our road ahead. We want you to be part of our growth journey and of a great, global family.

We´re proudly owned by the Hempel Foundation, a corporate foundation that supports good causes around the globe, with specific focus on education of children in need, research into sustainable coatings technology and protecting the planet´s biodiversity.

Application and further information

To apply for this position, please submit your application letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system by clicking the link ‘Apply’ at the top.

Final deadline for applications is 21st of May 2023.

For further information about the job, please contact Head of Marine Data and Technology, Mads Raun Bertelsen, on madb@hempel.com.

Application due

2023-05-22

Seniority Level

Associate

Job Functions

Analyst, Information Technology

Industry

Chemicals

Across the globe, Hempel’s coatings solutions protect surfaces, structures and equipment. They extend asset lifetimes, reduce maintenance costs and make homes and workplaces safer and more colourful. Hempel was founded in Copenhagen, Denmark in 1915 by J.C. Hempel, and is solely owned by the Hempel Foundation, which not only ensures a solid economic base for the company, but is dedicated to making a difference in the world by empowering children to learn, supporting coatings science and sustaining biodiversity.

Title: Technology Advisory, Senior Associates
Skills: Cloud Computing|Communication|Computer Science|IT Governance|Microsoft SQL Server|Project Management|System Performance|Technology Consulting|Troubleshooting|Written Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description & Summary

The opportunity

Due to the continued growth of our practice and consistently high demand for technology consulting services, we are now recruiting Senior Associates in our Technology Advisory team in Athens.

We are looking for highly motivated and talented individuals who have a commitment to excellence in client service and are passionate about how technology could be an enabler in our digital world.

We are looking for professionals with extensive consulting, technological and industry experience who will help our clients solve their complex issues from strategy through execution.

What You Will Be Doing
  • Contribute to the creation of IT / Cloud Strategies and Transformation Programmes. Evaluate alternative options and trade-offs to drive the execution of the IT / Cloud strategy taking advantage of opportunities to optimise technology, improve performance and enable digital transformation.
  • Assess and design Technology Operating Model(s), covering IT Governance, IT Functional and Technology aspects.
  • Develop Solution Architectures and Application Landscape(s) / Technical Plans based on best practices and standards.
  • Define and manage complex projects or programmes of the Technology Consulting Team by utilising appropriate project management methods and tools using ether predictive (plan-driven) or adaptive (iterative/agile) approaches.
  • Contribute to marketing and business development activities of the Technology Consulting Team including designing and development of product playbooks, selling pitching decks, etc.
  • Develop high impact Technology Consulting proposals, developing detailed project scope, deliverables and work plans.

What we are looking for
  • University degree in Computer Science or other relevant fields, advanced degrees (MBA, and/or other Master’s Degree) viewed favourably.
  • Relevant Experience working with customers on IT / Digital transformation projects.
  • Experience with cloud computing and/or cloud adoption/transformation.
  • Expertise in building something from scratch and seeing it through; envisioning the big picture, setting goals and developing programs from concept to execution.
  • Proven track record of executing high-impact projects in cross industry practices (e.g. Financial Services, Consumer Industrial Products and Services, Public Sector & Health Care, Energy & Utilities) from consulting point of view.
  • Clear and concise spoken and written communication style tailored to each specific audience. Ability to communicate technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences.

What’s in it for you

PwC is all about people, encouraging high performance and quality. At PwC, you will have:
  • Continuous training and career development opportunities whilst learning from a wide range of top professionals
  • The chance to handle different projects for big clients
  • Access to a global network of firms and global mobility opportunities
  • Compensation package, rewarded based on performance, life and medical plan, rewards and recognition schemes, flexible working program, bus service etc.

Who we are

PwC in Greece is the largest professional services firm in the country, with premises in Athens,Thessaloniki and Patras and approximately 1700 employees. More than 250,000 people in 156 countries across our network share their thinking, experience and solutions to develop fresh perspectives and practical advice. This enables us to provide top-quality industry-focused assurance, tax and advisory services to our clients.

Title: Junior Associates and/or Associate Lawyers for Employment Law
Skills: Command|Communication|English|Labor and Employment Law|Law|Legal Advice|Legal Document Preparation|Legal Ethics|Problem Solving|Relationship Building|
Job Description:
About the job

DESCRIPTION OF POSITION

POTAMITISVEKRIS is looking for Junior and Associate lawyers who would like to join its Employment Law team. By joining us you will become part of a busy and continuously growing group, dealing with a diversified client portfolio and a varied caseload in all industry sectors, involving both advisory and litigation.

YOUR ROLE

Your role will focus on the delivery of client engagements by understanding expectations and demonstrating personal accountability and teamwork, exercising effective communication and relationship-building skills. You will commit to personal learning and development, delivering exceptional legal services and demonstrating an enthusiastic and client orientated work ethic, excelling both in advising clients and litigating on their behalf.

OUR REQUIREMENTS

To qualify for the role, you must have:

  • Life – Work balance
  • Strict adherence to morality and legal ethics
  • Positive attitude, straightforwardness, loyalty, team spirit, and ambition to excel
  • Willingness to develop and work as a lawyer within a large law firm

  • Excellent command of the English language
  • Strong recommendations from law school professors, previous employers, or clients

WE OFFER

  • Life – Work balance
  • A promising work environment and career path prospects
  • A competitive remuneration package
  • A private healthcare plan

APPLICATION

To apply, please send us your resume (ideally 1 page, not longer than 2) and a cover letter (1 page at most) explaining why you want to join us and what you have to offer to: careers@potamitisvekris.com. In the Subject Field of the e-mail please write Vacancy code BQ_0123.

If you apply for any role within POTAMITISVEKRIS your personal data will be processed in accordance with our recruitment privacy notice.

Title: Πωλητής/ Οδηγός Ex-Van (outsourced) 31/12/2023
Job Description:
About the job

Overview


Η PepsiCo Hellas φιλοξενεί μερικά από τα πιο αγαπημένα προϊόντα τροφίμων και αναψυκτικών στον κόσμο όπως τα καθημερινά αγαπημένα σας Lay's, Quaker, Pepsi, Doritos και τους χυμούς Ήβη, για να αναφέρουμε μερικά. Έχουμε μια εκπληκτική φήμη για την ανάπτυξη και την κυκλοφορία προϊόντων που αγαπούν οι καταναλωτές μας. Είμαστε περήφανοι που είμαστε ένα εξαιρετικό μέρος για εργασία και κερδίσαμε πρόσφατα το βραβείο του Καλύτερου Εργοδότη για την Ελλάδα!


Σε μεγαλύτερη κλίμακα, η PepsiCo παράγει το μεγαλύτερο χαρτοφυλάκιο τροφίμων και αναψυκτικών δισεκατομμυρίων δολαρίων στον κόσμο, συμπεριλαμβανομένων 22 σειρών προϊόντων που κάθε μία παράγει περισσότερα από δισεκατομμύριο σε ετήσιες λιανικές πωλήσεις.


Responsibilities


Ζητάμε να καλύψουμε τη θέση του/της: Πωλητή / Οδηγού Ex-Van (31/12/2023)


Περιγραφή θέσης:


  • Υπεύθυνος για την πώληση και παράδοση παραγγελιών στους πελάτες
  • Διαχείριση πληρωμών και εισπράξεων
  • Επίσκεψη προκαθορισμένων σημείων/πελατών
  • Merchandising των προϊόντων στα σημεία επίσκεψης
  • Διαχείριση των αποθεμάτων και διασφάλιση της ποιότητας και διαθεσιμότητας των προϊόντων
  • Γέμισμα των ραφιών και των σταντ σύμφωνα με τα πρότυπα της εταιρείας
  • Χρήση POP υλικού
  • Εξασφάλιση της σωστής λειτουργίας του οχήματος
  • Εβδομαδιαία επικοινωνία με τον Διευθυντή για ενημέρωση για τις δραστηριότητες των πωλήσεων.


Qualifications


  • Άδεια οδήγησης: κατηγορία Γ
  • Πιστοποιητικό Επαγγελματικής Ικανότητας (Π.Ε.Ι.)
  • Κάρτα Ψηφιακού Ταχογράφου
  • Καλές επικοινωνιακές δεξιότητες
  • Εμπειρία σε Πωλήσεις ή Διανομή είναι επιθυμητή
  • Επίτευξη αποτελεσμάτων, πελατοκεντρική προσέγγιση, αυτοπεποίθηση
  • Καλή γνώση Αγγλικών θα θεωρηθεί επιπλέον προσόν
  • Πτυχίο πανεπιστημίου θα θεωρηθεί επιπλέον προσόν

Job Description:
About the job

HELIX2 one of the most innovative and modern companies for analytical and diagnostic medical equipment, is steadily expanding


HELIX2 rapidly gained trust in the market, providing quality, expertise and reliability. We managed to become a safe choice on a wide range of applications for laboratory products and instruments as well as analytics and diagnostics equipment.

With a strong portfolio of worldwide recognized product providers and manufacturing companies such as Sysmex, T2 biosystems, Tuttnauer, Diatech, Tescan with specialized and trained executives, with constant technical support and spare parts coverage, we are always close to our customers and their needs.

Above all, we are a group of friendly, young and enthusiastic people with passion for personal and professional development.

We are seeking for an experienced Field Service Engineer


The role of this individual involves installing, monitoring, updating and maintaining systems in the field, diagnosing any hardware or software faults with these systems and solve the issues either in person or over the phone. The role requires a mix of electrical, mechanical, hydraulical, pneumatical and computer using skills. His/Her location will be in Athens but based on service needs she/he will have to travel occasionally around Greece.

Our collaboration will be easy and productive, if you are familiar with …

  • On-site installation & configuration
  • Personnel training
  • Maintaining and monitoring systems
  • Performing total system level trouble-shooting on complex multi-symptom problems
  • Responds to call-outs in a timely fashion
  • Following work instructions, in order to set up a system or fix a fault
  • Leading critical operations & maintenance tasks remotely or on site
  • Communicating with clients to determine needs and explaining complex issues
  • Responsible for driving customer satisfaction through remote connectivity and Service Excellence
  • Actively participating in projects as assigned in order to achieve department and company’s goals
  • Drafting and submitting reports
  • Assisting in Account Sales visits, help training others where necessary, and identifying Sales opportunities and communicating them to account team.
  • Staying current with the latest technologies according to the company’s orientation.


You will feel more confident in this position if you possess …

  • 3-5 years proven working experience in technical support or relevant experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in Biomedical/Electronics Engineering
  • Strong communication, technical analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Customer-oriented attitude; deals tactfully and effectively with differences of opinion, excellent listening and interpersonal skills
  • Basic knowledge of Network and Communication Technology
  • Working knowledge of MS office tools (MS Project, MS office, ... )
  • Project Management and ERP/CRM Tools
  • Motivated, dedicated, hardworking, flexible

· Good communication skills, excellent team player

  • Fluency in English and in Greek

· Valid driving license, active driving experience

  • Ability to travel

We offer …

· Stable and long term collaboration based on mutual respect

· Friendly working environment, encouraging professional learning and growth Competitive remuneration package

· Career development opportunities

· A dynamically growing business environment

· Continuous training opportunities

· A support package that typically includes: company vehicle, fuel-card, mobile phone, laptop and equipment

Title: Product Owner eCommerce
Skills: Amdocs CRM|Backlog Management|Creative Ideation|Digital Product Development|Product Road Mapping|Product Vision|Release Management|Sprint Planning|User Stories|Workload Prioritization|
Job Description:
About the job

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Product Owner eCommerce. We have many hardworking and dedicated peers that would love for you to work with them. We are committed to continuous improvement. We are always looking for new and innovative ways to improve quality, reduce costs, build excellent solutions, and grow customer happiness.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities
  • Responsible for the lifecycle of the assigned product and its services (content, package)
  • Contribute with the other Product Owners to the Products’ roadmap and development based on market needs, competition and company’s directions
  • Own and execute the product roadmap.
  • Prioritize and maintain the product backlog for assigned products, balancing the requirements and expectations of related stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders, teams and customers to co-develop the product vision, strategy, and for Product Roadmap alignment.
  • Provide the voice of the business to cross-functional product teams to: clarify feature, user story and content requirements and translate the product vision into a roadmap/release plan and actionable tasks.
  • Work effectively with cross-functional agile teams and various stakeholders including business and functional leaders, key users, business analysts, solution architects, UX/UI designers, software engineers, testers, C/X etc.
  • Continuously revisit the business needs, refine priorities, outline milestones and deliverables, and identify opportunities and risks.
  • Ensure that a new product in development or a new feature of an existing product, is proven to be desirable, viable and functional.
  • Follow progress of work and address production issues during sprints
  • Analyse preferences and requests of end users
  • Keep track of industry trends
  • Act as Evangelist of the assigned Product

Who Are We Looking For

We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
  • A minimum of 5 to 10 years’ experience as a Product Owner ideally focused on FinTech Industry
  • Product development experience with one or more of: Payment Gateways, Online Checkout solutions, OmniChannel solutions, advanced eShops, m-commerce, e-commerce in general, etc.
  • Experience in digital product development lifecycle from ideation, insight to launch and aftermarket support
  • Strong experience in understanding the customer needs (customer outcomes orientation) when it comes to digital solutions and scoping them in an efficient manner
  • Proficiency in authoring, owning and prioritizing epics, features, user stories, backlog grooming, prioritization, sprint planning and release management activities
  • Hands-on experience managing all stages of the product life cycle
  • Understanding of all aspects of Agile/Kanban product development and delivery
  • A proven track record of success in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with multiple competing and often conflicting priorities
  • Excellent technical acumen, curiosity, and familiarity with emerging technologies
  • Winning attitude, self motivation, excellent teamwork and presentation skills
  • Communication skills and flexibility necessary to work with collocated/remote and cross-functional teams
  • Strong critical thinking, analytical problem-solving skills
  • Experience and knowledge of the Fintech industry strongly preferred
  • Ability to manage work time to ensure the accomplishment of specific goals

Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Title: Experienced SAP Consultant
Skills: ABAP|Code Design|Process Design|SAP FICO|SAP HR|SAP PP|SAP Products|SAP Sales & Distribution|Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP)|Technical Specs|
Job Description:
About the job

ARE YOU READY to step up to the New and take your technology expertise to the next level?

Through unmatched industry experience, leading technologies from our ecosystem partners and startups, and the largest delivery network in the world, we provide a powerful range of capabilities that can be tailored to our client’s most complex business needs. With over 100 innovation hubs deployed around the world, we help clients continuously innovate at speed and at scale so they can outpace their peers. You will bring innovation, intelligence and industry experience together with the newest technologies to help clients innovate at scale and transform their businesses.

Technology is one of four services–the others are Strategy and Consulting, Interactive and Operations.

WORK YOU’LL DO

Accenture is SAP's leading business partner and the first to be working with SAP end-to-end from product innovation, to development and delivery of SAP S/4HANA and new industry solutions.

We are looking for candidates who are passionate for technology, to cover different roles across various SAP areas:



  • Financial Accounting and Controlling (SAP FICO)

  • Material Management (SAP MM)

  • Sales and Distribution (SAP SD)

  • Project System (SAP PS)

  • Plant Maintenance (SAP PM)

  • Production Planning (SAP PP)

  • Fiori

  • SuccessFactors

  • Code Development (ABAP)

    • As SAP Consultant, you will be assigned and trained to one of the above areas, you will analyze business requirements, design & implement technology solutions for SAP applications. The ideal candidates will join our growing SAP team, will receive official SAP training and will participate in interesting SAP projects within major Greek and multinational companies!

    Responsibilities:

  • Requirements Analysis, Process Design, Business Blueprint creation

  • Provide functional and technical specifications for solutions in your assigned area

  • Configure SAP in the respective areas and test it and present solutions to clients, train users, participate in workshops

    • WHO WE´RE LOOKING FOR?

  • AEI/TEI Graduate (Master is considered a plus)

  • Min. 2 years of previous experience in SAP for 2 years or more

  • Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment

  • Good communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skill, Greek and English language is a must

    • WHAT´S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Competitive salary and benefits, including but not limited to: life/health insurance, performance based bonuses, monthly vouchers, company car (depending on management level), flexible work arrangements, employee share purchase plan, TEA Accenture, parental leave, paid overtime (if needed) and various corporate discounts

  • Continuous hard and soft skills training & development through global platforms & local academy

  • Career coaching and mentorship to help you manage your career and develop professionally

  • Ongoing strengths and skills based evaluation process

  • Various opportunities to develop your career across a spectrum of clients, industries and projects

  • Diverse and inclusive culture

  • Corporate citizenship initiatives (access to volunteering opportunities, charity work etc.)

  • Under our Brain Regain initiative, extra relocation benefits may apply

    • In case your profile is a match for the role, you will receive an email requesting to download our new innovative mobile App, Enter Accenture Greece for Android or iOS devices . Then, you will be able to log in by using your personalized credentials provided by our Recruitment Team within 48 hours and start your Accenture Journey!

    To learn more about Accenture, and how you will be challenged and inspired from Day 1, please visit our website accenture.com/gr-en/.

    The safety and well-being of our candidates and employees remain our priority. Please note that the recruitment process for opportunities in Accenture Greece will be conducted only via online format during the current period.

Title: Virtualization System Engineer
Skills: Citrix Products|English|Language Skills|Linux|PowerCLI|Powershell|System Administration|Troubleshooting|VMware|Virtualization|
Job Description:
About the job

At Alpha Bank, we are shaping the future of banking in Greece.


Through our large-scale Transformation Program, we are changing the way we operate, the way we deliver results and the way we service our Customers.


· We understand our Customers’ needs and design experiences around them

· We work in partnership and invite diversity of skills and perspectives

· We are forward-thinking and drive continuous improvement

· We make things happen; we execute quickly and focus on what is essential


If you are a change enthusiast who sets ambitious goals and works with a sense of purpose, we want to get to know you!


Join our team and #be_part_of_tomorrow


#AlphaBank #TheAlphaBlueprint #Tomorrow


Job Description


The Virtualization Engineer will be placed in Virtualization Domain of the IT Infrastructure and Operations Division and will be responsible for administering and monitoring Citrix and VMware environments to ensure optimized performance, security and high availability. The Virtualization Domain team utilizes compliance-oriented methodologies. He/She must be able to work as part of the Virtualization team, focused to support continued development of the Citrix and VMWare infrastructure. This role requires a resource with excellent communication skills and an ability to learn about and understand a broad range of technical issues. Teamwork, the ability to function calmly under pressure, and flexibility are crucial attributes to bring to this position.

Tasking will include serving intermediate complexity requests, performing moderate troubleshooting activities using available tools, and providing technical support to the other Domains of the Bank.


The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated and must also have a basic system administration skillset in Windows and Linux.


What you will be doing


  • Monitor the performance and availability of the systems (Citrix infrastructure XenApp/XenDesktop VDI), VMware infrastructure products).
  • Implementing virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) and enabling template management.
  • Keep the systems up to date with regard to any security, vulnerability and risk framework of the organization.
  • Resolving intermediate complexity requests
  • Participate in simple or mid-range complexity projects involving vMWare and Citrix products
  • Keeping informed of developments in VMware and Citrix technologies and products.


What you need to have



  • A Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or in a related discipline.
  • One to two (1-2) years of relevant experience as a System / VMware / Citrix administrator.
  • English language skills (B2 level).
  • Base OS knowledge (Windows, Linux)
  • VMWare virtualization basics knowledge
  • Citrix Fundamental knowledge (Virtual Apps and Desktops)
  • Infrastracture troubleshooting skills
  • Good understanding of IT security, patching, update and upgrade.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize tasks.
  • Willingness to learn new technologies.
  • Good communication skills along with the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
  • Ability to communicate technical information clearly and concisely to senior level technical staff, engineers or vendors during troubleshooting or escalations.
  • Nice to have: Experience with scripting (PowerShell, PowerCLI) or programming language (as an asset)
  • Nice to have: Fundamental knowledge of data center networking, SAN storage



What we offer


It’s all about our people. At Alpha Bank, you will enjoy:


  • A friendly and collaborative working environment that supports taking initiative and action.
  • A culture that centers around learning and continuous development and encourages everyone to bring their best self to work.
  • The opportunity to challenge your thinking through your participation in complex tasks and transformation projects.
  • Being part of a large organization with a leading role in the Greek economy and a strong presence in the community.
  • A competitive salary and benefits.


All applications will be acknowledged and treated in utmost confidence.

Title: EY Wavespace Leader
Skills: Design Thinking|Digital Designs|Financial Responsibilities|Journey Mapping|Key Performance Indicators|Managing Meetings|Process Efficiency|Project Delivery|Service Development|Technology Implementation|
Job Description:
About the job

At EY Wavespace (EY wavespace Athens), we reimagine what is possible for business. We help teams to reframe their thinking and align to find answers fast.


Our immersive approach brings the right people together from across an organization; EY and beyond- virtually, in person, or using a blend of both. It gives teams the mindset and tools to think differently and solve problems at speed. It’s an increasingly complex, digitized, fast-changing and interconnected world and as part of the Wavespace practice, you’ll help leading companies across industries strategize and execute on their future vision and experience.


The opportunity


With rapid growth across digital and virtual collaboration, we’re looking for the lead of the EY Athens Wavespace in a wide range of focused areas; whether you’re interested in digital strategy, experience design, sales strategy, work experience of the future, digital program activation or social, we have a role for you. Whichever you choose, you can expect to work in a truly leading-edge environment, surrounded by some of the most engaging and knowledgeable colleagues in the business.


This is also an opportunity to get into a rapidly evolving practice as we expand and be a part of creating and executing a vision for the future in an entrepreneurial environment within the larger firm.


As the public face of EY Wavespace, it is expected from you to confidently engage and influence diverse groups. You will position Wavespace as a powerful and clearly differentiated facility, capability and brand within the Greek market.


Your Key Responsibilities


As Wavespace Leader, you will act as an advisor who can help mentor both Wavespace and broader EY personnel and clients, and be ultimately responsible and accountable for scaling the Wavespace Greece operations, impact and returns.


To be successful in this role, you should have deep experience in both digital transformation and corporate innovation, preferably with domain expertise across key sectors. A technical background in strategy, experience design and digital technology is extremely advantageous to the role.


More specifically, the successful candidate should:


  • Be the face and leading force for the development of Athens Wavespace and its team, to run Wavespace and support account and project teams to deliver client events.
  • Engage with Service Line and Sector teams to develop repeatable, scalable Wavespace offerings that can be customized for priority clients
  • Contribute to business development and client pursuit activities by providing inputs and review of Wavespace related proposals and presentations for potential clients and partnerships, as well as identifying any follow-on client engagement opportunities
  • Support the operations, planning, and development of the Wavespace brand, marketing and communications program in Greece
  • Engage confidently with senior communication stakeholders, for example with the ability to translate complex issues into coherent problem statements. Be able to influence and persuade clients and stakeholders through a practical approach to solving issues and gaining stakeholder agreement
  • Lead the design and execution of the short and medium term Wavespace Greece strategy, roadmap and plan to deliver on agreed key performance indicators and targets, annually.
  • Take full financial responsibility for Wavespace Greece including full budgetary responsibility and delegated authority (as agreed)


Skills And Attributes For Success


  • Strong influencing leadership experience
  • People management with strong communication skills
  • Development and fostering of key market and internal relationships
  • Experience in project-based delivery
  • Entrepreneurial spirit
  • Understanding EY’s client’s reality and challenges
  • Subject matter expertise for the development of collaborative session designs to support the client in reaching desired outcomes and outputs faster and in a more innovative way
  • Ability to oversee the delivery of Wavespace sessions, ensuring a high-quality seamless experience for all participants, an inclusive process that engages all, an action oriented event that maintains pace and a focus on outcomes that are both practical and short term.
  • A depth of understanding and inquisitiveness to support the digital enablement of the collaborative experience


To qualify for the role, you must have:


  • 10+ years professional experience including any mix of consulting, digital/innovation, product management with a commercial element
  • Strong academic record and eagerness for continuous development
  • Strong digital product and service development experience
  • Large scale meeting management and facilitation
  • Project delivery experience in any of the areas below (not mandatory but would be greatly appreciated):
  • Digital Transformation & Digital Design
  • Technology Implementation
  • Organizational Operating & Delivery Modelling and implementation
  • Process Efficiency (definition, implementation and measurement)
  • Customer Experience mapping/journey mapping
  • Design Thinking


What We Look For


We’re seeking passionate leaders with a strong digital vision and a desire to stay on top of both customer experience and digital trends and who value diversity and inclusion who team to provide our clients with innovative solutions. If you have a genuine passion for helping clients define and execute on their digital vision, EY’s Wavespace Practice could be the next step in your professional journey.


What We Offer


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:


  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.


EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.


#betterworkingworld

Title: Teamlead DevOps
Skills: Amazon Web Services (AWS)|Bitbucket|Java|JavaScript|Jenkins|Kubernetes|Microsoft Azure|SQL|Team Leadership|Terraform|
Job Description:
About the job

MVI Hellas - part of the MVI Group with over 1000 employees - is a successful partner for innovative IT projects in the automotive industry. Our focus is on the future trends of the mobility industry: autonomous driving, digital sales, car sharing and ConnectedCar.

In this exciting environment, MVI has positioned itself as a trustworthy and successful IT partner. Innovative solutions for vehicle networking and marketing, e-mobility, process digitalization, after-sales or security / quality assurance are just as much a part of our portfolio as the professional handling of new business models (e.g. agile fixed price).


We focus on a familiar working environment, a good work-life balance and optimal training opportunities - because people are in focus. We are always looking for highly motivated and committed employees to enhance our team.


Teamlead DevOps

You want to lead a cross-functional team and be responsible for the continuous improvement of the user experience for new and existing applications in the automotive environment? Then become the leader of our DevOps team!

  • You will lead an agile, interdisciplinary team consisting of business analysts, product owners and other developers
  • You communicate with the customer and ensure that all relevant information for the project is available
  • You coordinate resources to ensure the success of the project
  • You consider the technological framework conditions and ensure consistent and stable IT solutions that are of high quality and usability for our users
  • You ensure the reusability and standardization of your solutions, as well as the continuous improvement of software quality
  • You drive technical improvements and new features and evaluate new frameworks and technologies
  • Familiarity with IT operations such as incident & configuration management


Qualifications

  • You have a university degree in computer science, electrical engineering or equivalent studies / experience
  • You have comprehensive knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, Jenkins, Kubernetes, GitHub/ Bitbucket and Terraform
  • You have experience with AWS/Azure
  • You have experience for more than 2 years in team management
  • You are good in SQL or other databases
  • You have already had initial contact software collaboration tools such as Jira and Confluence
  • You are familiar with Java and JavaScript
  • You have conflict solvings skills as well as Leadership ability
  • Your language skills are fluent in English


Additional Information

  • Permanent employment contract
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Work on interesting and dynamic topics in an international team at one of the key partners in the automotive industry
  • Extensive training and development opportunities
  • Open-door culture at all hierarchical levels
  • Flexible working hours
  • Company and team events
  • Work-Life-Balance: 26 vacation days & flexible working hours
  • 100% Remote, Hybrid or On-Site in our new office in Greece!


We look forward to receiving your application in english. Please highlight your earliest possible starting date and salary expectation.


For more information about the process you are welcome to contact:

Ivonne Suttner

+30 693 6784279

Title: Customer Service Representative - English
Skills: Communication|Computer Literacy|Contact Centers|Customer Experience|Customer Service|Customer Service Representatives|Customer Support|Employee Engagement|Phone Etiquette|Skilled Multi-tasker|
Job Description:
About the job

Bringing smiles is what we do at TTEC… for you and the customer. As a Customer Service Representative – English our state-of-the-art location in Athens, Greece you’ll be a part of creating and delivering amazing customer experiences while you also #ExperienceTTEC, an award-winning employment experience and company culture.


What You’ll Be Doing


Do you have a passion for helping others and giving them peace of mind? In this role, you’ll work to resolve the customer’s issues before escalating to the next level. Whether it’s getting answers for customers quickly, consulting on products with compassion or resolving their issues with a smile, you’ll be the difference between their customer experience being just average or an exceptional one.


During a Typical Day, You’ll


  • Answer incoming communications from customers
  • Conduct research to provide answers for customers to resolve their issues


What You Bring To The Role


  • Must reside in the Athens area to be considered for this position
  • Fluency in English
  • 6 months or more of customer services experience
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Recognize, apply and explain your product or service knowledge
  • Computer savvy
  • Resident of or ability to immediately relocate to Athens, Greece and gain work authorization expediently


What You Can Expect


  • Knowledgeable, encouraging, supporting and present leadership
  • Diverse and community minded organization
  • Career-growth and lots of learning opportunities for aspiring minds
  • 25 days annual leave per year 
  • Excellent premises during training and when you come to the site for employee engagement activities in Athens, Syngrou Fix metro station 
  • Relocation assistance available
  • And yes...all the competitive performance bonus opportunities and benefits you'd expect and maybe a few that would pleasantly surprise you


A Bit More About Your Role


We’ll train you to be a subject matter expert in your field, so you can be confident in providing the highest level of service possible whether through voice, chat or email interactions. We trust you already have the necessary ingredient that can’t be taught – a caring and supportive nature that will shine through as you help customers. You’ll also have a chance to make great new friends within the TTEC community and grow your career in a dynamic, family-friendly atmosphere.


You'll report to a Team Lead. You’ll contribute to the success of the customer experience as well as the overall success of the team.


About TTEC


Our business is about making customers happy. That’s all we do. Since 1982, we’ve helped companies build engaged, pleased, profitable customer experiences powered by our combination of humanity and technology. On behalf of many of the world’s leading iconic and disruptive brands, we talk, message, text, and video chat with millions of customers every day. These exceptional customer experiences start with you.


TTEC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. TTEC embraces and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce that respects and empowers the culture and perspectives within our global teams. We strive to reflect the communities we serve by not only delivering amazing service and technology, but also humanity. We make it a point to make sure all our employees feel valued and comfortable being their authentic selves at work. As a global company, we know diversity is our strength. It enables us to view projects and ideas from different vantage points and allows every individual to bring value to the table in their own unique way.


Primary Location


Greece-Attica-Athens


Job


_Customer Care Representative

Title: Scrum Product Owner
Skills: English|Product Development|Project Management|Scrum|Sprint Planning|Strategy|Team Management|Time Management|User Experience (UX)|User Interface Design|
Job Description:
About the job

Novibet is looking for the next Scrum Product Owner, to join our team in our HQ in Athens.


If you think you are the perfect fit, we invite you to read further and apply to meet you!


Novibet, founded in 2010, is an established GameTech company operating in Europe and LATAM (Greece, Brazil, Ireland, Italy, Mexico, Chile, Ecuador), through its offices in Greece & Malta. Licensed and regulated by MGA, ADM and HGC, and Irish Revenue Commissioners, Novibet is committed to delivering the best sports betting and gaming experience to an ever-expanding customer base.


Your Role


  • Manage a product development team as the scrum product owner
  • Work with product and business stakeholders to create and maintain the product development roadmap
  • Work with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders, including analytics, design/user experience, engineering, and user enablement
  • Work with solution architects and business analysts on the analysis and the technical feasibility of projects
  • Translate product roadmap features into well-defined product requirements including features, user stories, and acceptance test criteria
  • Manage the backlog and facilitate sprint planning and retrospectives
  • Assist the development team throughout the sprints and facilitate their ceremonies
  • Mitigate any impediments impacting the release and sprint goals
  • Map out project dependencies to inform the necessary sequence of development
  • Ensure that the team is aligned with strategies implemented across the tech organization
  • Responsible and Accountable for high quality deliverables on Novibet’s platform
  • Collaborate with global commercial services partners to co-develop a roadmap and drive products and features from concept to launch in a fast-paced environment
  • Work in an Agile environment and continuously review the business needs, refine priorities, outline milestones and deliverables, and identify opportunities and risks
  • Prioritize and maintain the sprint backlog for assigned products, balancing the requirements of stakeholders
  • Understand, Acknowledge and Distribute the sense of urgency within the team
  • Be the primary communication and link between stakeholders and teams


Requirements


  • BSc/MSc degree in relevant Information Technology subject
  • At least 3 years of product development or project management experience, preferably in game tech
  • Experience running medium to large/complex projects with multiple dependencies using Agile (Scrum) processes in planning, implementation and support of business application components, including change & release management
  • PMP or Prince II or Scrum certification is desirable
  • Team management experience is desirable
  • Sufficient level of technical background in software development will be considered as a plus
  • Gaming market knowledge will be considered as a plus
  • Excellent communication skills, especially with stakeholders and leadership, that allow to understand product strategy and anticipate needs
  • Time management skills
  • English language (both verbal and written)
  • Focus on efficiency, user experience, and process improvement


Benefits


Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in the way we treat our people!

We are proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees, including:


  • A friendly working atmosphere
  • Strong mentality of lifelong learning and professional development
  • Career opportunities within a fast-paced environment
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Outstanding health medical plan etc.


Novibet regrets that due to the large volume of applications received, we will only consider those who solely correspond to job requirements as listed above.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Title: Scrum Product Owner
Skills: Agile Development|Communication|Product Development|Programming|Representational State Transfer (REST)|Scrum|Software Architecture|User Experience (UX)|User Interface Design|Voice of the Customer|
Job Description:
About the job

We are Kaizen Gaming


Kaizen Gaming is the leading GameTech company in Greece and one of the fastest-growing in Europe, with the Stoiximan brand in Greece and Cyprus and Betano in Germany, Romania, Bulgaria, Portugal, Brazil, and Chile. Our aim is to leverage cutting-edge Technology in order to provide the optimum experience to those who trust us for their entertainment.



The Role


As a Scrum Product Owner and part of an Agile development team at Kaizen Gaming, you will drive the vision and development of products by using agile best practices in order to maximize the business value of the team's deliverables.



Responsibilities:


  • Drive one Scrum team as the Product Owner;
  • Provide vision and direction to the Agile development team throughout the project;
  • Create requirements in the forms of epics and stories;
  • Manage the backlog and iteration planning process;
  • Lead the planning product release plans and set the expectations for the delivery of new functionalities;
  • Mitigate impediments impacting the release/sprint goals;
  • Support the team and organization by using agile / scrum best practices and promote agile values;
  • Partner with product management and business stakeholders to create and maintain a product backlog according to business value or ROI;
  • Explore the market to identify opportunities and represent the voice of the customer to the team.



Requirements


Our ideal future co-worker has a strong sense of ownership, takes pride in developing our products and cannot find rest until every customer has a great user experience. We expect you to have:


  • At least 2 years of working experience as a Product Owner in a technological environment;
  • Solid agile experience;
  • Proven ability to define a set of requirements that pinpoint business challenges and identify technical and business changes required to address them;
  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely across technology and business teams;
  • Familiarity with online sports betting and casino products is an asset;
  • Good understanding of technology, programming languages and software architecture is considered a plus.


Kaizen Gaming Perks


🕑 We offer both work from the office (hybrid model) & remote working options.

💸Competitive salary package and bonus scheme.

🏃 A buddy will support you with your onboarding.

👩‍⚕️ Health and life insurance for you and your family.

📚 LinkedIn learning account & continuous training.

💰 Monthly allowance for lunch & commuting expenses.

💻Nice rigs - 2.5K monitor, latest i7, tons of RAM, fast SSD.

⭐Clear career paths & a developmental 360° feedback framework.

✈️ Relocation package and "Brain Gain" relocation bonus for Greek expats.

DevOps Engineer (5983/DE/ESS/GR)

We brainstorm, we laugh, and, occasionally, we party (there's a lot to celebrate), but we also appreciate people's need for quiet time and focused work. We're growing fast so we're looking for a Full Stack Developer to join the Brand team!
