Title: Technical Lead, Quality Engineer
Skills: Communication|Graphic Design Principles|Quality Assurance|Quality Engineering|Test Automation|Test Coverage|Testing Tools|Web Applications|White Box|White Box Testing|
Job Description:
About the job

Job description:

Role Overview

This role is part of the engineering team that applies the best of open source technologies to a challenging domain where software meets network.

As a Quality Engineer Lead, you’ll play a crucial role in leading test automation and infrastructure development, testing new design and architectural choices which have a significant impact on our systems, our business and most importantly, our customers.

To do this, you’ll have in-depth knowledge and understanding of Quality Assurance, web application software, and design principles. You must have industry-leading technical abilities and excellent communication skills.

Key Responsibilities
  • Work directly with Developers, UX Designers and Product Managers in an agile environment and all phases of software development to ensure the quality of our applications and platforms
  • Establish and continuously improve quality engineering processes and practices
  • Expose defects at services, architecture and application code in a way that developer can respond quickly and mentor other QEs
  • Improve the Developer Experience by automating tests and continuously improve the automation infrastructure
Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field
  • 3+ years’ experience as a developer, QA Engineer, or as a Software Development Engineer in Test
  • 3+ years’ experience in white box testing preferably in react and nodejs
  • 3+ years’ experience to programmatically test the product, measure test coverage, develop the best automation, drive testability and diagnostic ability into the product, while promoting best practices in quality areas
  • API automation testing
  • Ability to triage issues and multitask on multiple products and projects
  • Demonstrated leadership abilities in an engineering environment in driving operational excellence and best practices
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment
  • Provide technical interviews in his area of expertise
  • Lead construction of working documents within the team and put forward suggestions that are helpful to agile development process, development speed and quality in a timely manner
  • Ability to decompose tasks into separate units and provide guidelines to Senior Engineers
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with open source test tools
  • Working experience with unit test automation frameworks
  • Experience building test frameworks for applications on various platforms
  • Ability to identify key technical points and potential value in a certain technical discipline



PCCW Global does not sponsor for immigration and other non-immigrant visas for this role.

PCCW is an equal-opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates. Information provided will be treated in strict confidence and will only be used for recruitment-related purposes. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the employer's personal data policies, a copy of which will be provided immediately upon request.

Title: Solution Architect
Skills: Analytical Skills|Architecture|Communication|Data Architecture|Information Analysis|Problem Solving|Solution Architecture|Technical Architecture|Technical Solution Design|Telco|
Job Description:
About the job

Role purpose:
Being part of an agile team, the Solution Architect is responsible for the technical analysis and holistic solution design of future capabilities and features, including external dependencies, cross-domain APIs, and technical enablers / stories.

Key accountabilities and decision ownership:
  • Translate the overall vision and target architecture into corresponding solution designs
  • Design end-to-end solutions and cross domain integration and APIs
  • Define non-functional, operational, and quality requirements
  • Perform feasibility analysis
  • Provide guidance to delivery teams to ensure alignment
  • Define technical features to enable business capabilities, fostering re-use of existing components
  • Facilitate solution compliance to security, privacy, and regulatory needs
  • Oversees technical debt and technology obsolescence at solution level
  • Advocate adoption of new technologies into solutions

Core competencies, knowledge and experience:
  • Master’s or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Systems Analysis, or other related field
  • Three to five years of experience in at least three disciplines, such as business, information, solution or technical architecture, application development, middleware, information analysis, database management or operations in a multitier environment
  • Extensive exposure to multiple, diverse technologies and processing environments
  • Experience in solution architecture and design in a telco business context

Behaviours and other competencies:
  • Experience working with agile methodologies / in agile teams would be highly appreciated
  • Ability to influence, mentor, and collaborate with agile development teams
  • Excellent analytical, technical, and problem solving skills, with high-levels of creativity
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills, with both technical and business audiences
  • Self – motivated, strong time-management skills, with the ability to juggle multiple balls

What's in it for you:
  •   Competitive pay, bonus & remuneration package
  • Private Health & Medical Insurance
  • Hybrid way of working: a blend of 60% remote and 40% office-based working, including the option to work up to 20 days from abroad
  •   Remote work equipment to help you create a comfortable, ergonomic workspace at home
  •   Unlimited access to learning resources and trainings
  •   Vodafone Parental Leave: 16 weeks of fully paid parental leave to all employees regardless of gender, sexual orientation or length of service
  •   Spirit of Vodafone Day: one day each quarter dedicated to your personal development
  •   Extra days off: Vodafone Day, Family Day, Volunteering Day
  •   Needless to say, we cater for your communication wherever you are
  • Office amenities (subject to the office location): such as restaurant, beauty corner, gym and parking
  • Special employee offers and discounts


#Vodafonespirit #Togetherwecan

Title: Construction Manager
Skills: Construction Management|Health & Safety|Project Management|Renewable Energy|Solar Energy|
Job Description:
About the job

Join a rapidly growing renewable energy company that matters to the future! We are accelerating the construction of our portfolio and are looking for exceptional candidates to strengthen our project and construction management teams. We are looking for a Construction Manager to be based on Site in Viotia or Korinthia to oversee the construction of our Solar portfolio in the area.

What you’ll do :

  • Oversee and manage construction projects from conception to completion.
  • Directly manage and supervise National Energy’s site personnel (ensure safe operations, allocate duties, manage attendance, ensure compliance with company codes and policies on all matters)
  • Review the project in-depth to schedule deliverables and estimate extra costs.
  • Oversee all onsite and offsite construction activities to monitor compliance with IFC drawings and H&S regulations and Company’s standards.
  • Inspect tools, materials and equipment and track inventory.
  • Make sure that subcontractor’s contractual conditions of performance are met.
  • Review the work progress on daily basis and report to the Project Manager
  • Ensure daily internal status update reports are prepared and shared timely.
  • Plan to prevent problems and resolve any emerging ones.
  • Negotiate terms of agreements, draft contracts and obtain permits and licenses if needed.
  • Analyze, manage, and mitigate project risks.
  • Ensure quality construction standards and the use of proper construction techniques.
  • Collaborate with the Project Manager and the extended project team.
  • Produce the relevant reports for the sites.
  • Liaise with local authorities on behalf of National Energy as required.
  • Build, maintain, and strengthen the relationships with the local community.

What you have:

  • Relevant Degree in Engineering
  • At least 5 years of experience in Construction of which at least 3 years in Solar projects
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Greek. Good knowledge of English will be considered an advantage
  • Health & Safety Certification will be considered a plus
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Office

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Skills: Business Understanding|Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)|Computer Science|Debugging|Interpersonal Skills|Node.js|REST APIs|Software Development|TypeScript|WebSocket|
Job Description:
About the job

FlexCar is growing rapidly and we are looking for a dynamic and results-oriented individual to join our Software Development team as a Full Stack Engineer.

Who We Are

We are well on our way of executing our vision to reimagine the way consumers own a car, enabling them to access the vehicle they always dreamed of in a flexible and accessible way, providing a superb, all-inclusive service. At FlexCar, we minimize advance payments, eliminate security deposits, and offer the ultimate flexibility with regards to lease duration - without any hidden fees, commitments, or charges. Launched in 2018, we are now amongst the fastest growing companies in Europe and have raised over 210 million from prominent local and international investors. We are constantly looking for aspiring people & minds that are eager to be part of an exciting journey and a very strong professional team. If you want to be part of that, get on board!

People at FlexCar

Our people are our most valuable asset and what keeps us going, so we pay close attention to who we bring onboard. We are an equal opportunity employer and we take pride in celebrating our team's diversity and inclusion. Therefore, we are looking for genuinely good and motivated people with appropriate ethics that are eager to solve problems and excited to be part of a growing team and company.

Position Summary

We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer to join our Development team and work on various web-based applications, using cutting-edge technologies, leveraging cloud services, and applying agile practices. The Full Stack Engineer will participate in all software development life cycle activities, debugging, configuring, and troubleshooting existing systems, developing new software solutions, and always writing clean, efficient, readable, and testable code.

Our technology stack

At FlexCar, we develop innovative web solutions using Node.js that bring value to our customers, partners, and colleagues. Everything we built is dockerized, pushed through CI to our Git repos, and eventually deployed to AWS. Application and data integration between our COTS core systems is delivered via an API-based, middleware that continuously evolves.



Requirements

Core Competencies:

  • Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or another related discipline.
  • 3-5 years of relevant professional experience in the development and architecture/ design of web-based applications.
  • Good knowledge of TypeScript and JavaScript.
  • Extensive experience with Nodejs and VueJS (or React).
  • Strong knowledge of NoSQL databases (such as MongoDB).
  • Good understanding of REST APIs, AJAX, and WebSockets.
  • Hands-on experience with Docker.
  • Version Control Flow (GIT Flow).
  • Knowledge of HTML5, CSS3.



Experience in the following will be a plus:

  • AWS services, including Elastic Beanstalk, Amplify, and VPC.
  • IoT device and data management and processing.
  • Software development with Scrum or other agile frameworks.
  • Jira or related task & issue tracking tool.
  • Analysis, design, implementation, deployment (Github CI/CD Actions), support and monitoring of web applications.
  • CRM (Hubspot) and/ or ERPs (JDE).

Additional Skills:

  • Strong planning, organizational, and time management skills with attention to detail.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to coordinate a number of tasks with a wide range of stakeholders in a startup environment.
  • Ability to work independently meanwhile acting as part of a wider team.
  • A business understanding to complement your technical capabilities.
  • You are an automotive enthusiast!


Benefits

  • Opportunity to work in one of the fastest-growing scaleups
  • A working environment with an amazing culture that is based on Respect, Fairness, and Transparency
  • Private Health Insurance
  • Free coffee, snacks and beverages
  • Car benefits
  • Ongoing training and development
  • Extra days-off
  • Competitive salary

All applications will be treated with utmost confidence and will only be seen by members of our recruitment team.

Title: Associate, Client Service - Bilingual French/English
Skills: Academic Achievement|Business Research|Client Services|Communication|Contact Centers|Customer Experience|Executive Search|Office Administration|Russian|Subject Matter Experts|
Job Description:
About the job

The Client Service team is the backbone of Guidepoint’s success. The team is responsible for efficiently delivering Guidepoint’s services to our clients around the world. We work to understand each client’s unique business questions and help them gain critical insights to stay informed and make better business decisions. Come work with us to deliver the best service in the industry and help our clients make some of the most important business decisions in today’s economy.


What You’ll Do:


  • Review and analyze client research requests and use a range of resources to identify the most relevant subject matter experts across geographies, industries, and topics for each project
  • Utilize the phone, LinkedIn, and other outreach methods to recruit new Advisors to join the Guidepoint network by effectively communicating why their expertise is a good match for the specific project you’re working on
  • Screen experts for their suitability for specific client projects and create professional profiles for client consideration
  • Operate with a teamwork mentality that leads to building and maintaining strong relationships with other Guidepoint employees, offices, and Advisors
  • Gain expertise on the various industries our clients work in order to make sure Guidepoint always finds the right experts for a given project


What You Have:


  • Bachelor’s degree with high level of academic achievements / Young Professional (m/f) with first working experience
  • Strong team player with entrepreneurial mind and „can do“-attitude along with pro-active and results-oriented work style
  • Prior experience in executive search, market / business research or management consulting is a plus
  • Outgoing personality with the ability to speak with individuals at all professional levels
  • Intellectual curiosity and desire to learn
  • Strong communication skills
  • Fluency in French and English is essential; very good knowledge of additional languages (Russian, Spanish, German, etc.) is highly desirable
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment


What We Offer:


  • Competitive compensation
  • Private health insurance
  • Entrepreneurial environment, autonomy and fast decisions
  • International exposure to the global Guidepoint service teams
  • Casual work environment and compelling people
  • Summer and winter team events


About Guidepoint


Guidepoint, a leading expert network firm, connects clients with vetted subject matter experts—Advisors—from their global professional network. Guidepoint clients leverage the insights and perspectives shared by Advisors to stay informed and make better business decisions. Its slate of services, including phone consultations, surveys, events and proprietary data insights products, help professionals to gain comprehensive understanding of a topic before making strategic or investment decisions. Guidepoint’s multinational client list includes 9 of the top 10 consulting firms and some of the largest hedge funds, private equity firms and Fortune-ranked public companies. For more information, visit www.guidepoint.com

Title: IT Quality lab specialist
Skills: Chemical Manufacturing|Citrix Products|Communication|Computer Science|Databases|Information Technology|Microsoft SQL Server|SQL|Technology Consulting|WS|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description


Role: IT Quality Lab Specialist


Location: Athens, Greece


English: Fluent & Greek


Duties & Responsibilities


  • Understand the needs of business regarding existing IT services, as well communicate gaps in IT services that you identified together with business coordinators.
  • Foster collaboration of IT and the laboratory community, to deliver and implement technology solutions that support the business objectives to improve productivity, and enhance processes
  • Provide direction in the usage of state-of-the-art IT technologies and methodologies.
  • Support the ongoing maintenance, optimization, 3rd-level support and technology consulting.
  • Serve as an expert to design, build, and implement technical platforms and applications for global standard solutions in the lab environment.
  • Leverage knowledge of lab informatic applications/systems and underlying architecture.
  • Consult business regarding the integration of Lab Floor Systems into the IT Infrastructure environment. Support business in negotiations with, vendors of laboratory equipment, regarding IT requirements and needs of laboratory environment.
  • Strong collaboration with the IT Infrastructure department and domain architects


Job Requirements


Mandatory Requirements


  • Excellent spoken and written English is mandatory.
  • Very good communicator
  • Professional experience with equipment in pharma and/or biopharma and/or chemical industry and very good understanding of IT infrastructure that is needed to run the equipment and systems
  • Technologies knowledge including Operating Systems (Linux, Windows), Databases (MS SQL, PostGreSQL), Servers (WS 2019), and basic knowledge of network technologies, Citrix, and VMWare environment and ITIL processes


Nice to Have


  • Degree in Computer Science or Management Information Systems / Science background.
  • Understanding of aspects of the pharma and/or biopharma and/or chemical industry in terms of Legal, Compliance, GxP, Computer Validation and Regulatory Requirements.


About Us


We are a Brazilian company with over 30 years of experience in delivering IT services worldwide, ranging from IT outsourcing to application development or IT staffing. We have a direct presence in 39 countries, through our 88 offices located throughout the world and we enjoy working for over 500 active clients. While more than 300 of them are multinational corporations, we have managed to become the preferred partner of many small-to-midsize local and regional companies as well. Most of our clients come from industries such as financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical, services, technology, public sector and utilities.


Stefanini has career opportunities locally and around the world for professionals interested in a vibrant, passionate, team-oriented workplace. If you are a customer-centric person with a "get it done" attitude, come over for coffee and a talk on your future career with us!


Learn more about us on www.stefanini.com and join us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram where we regularly post insights from our colleagues.

Title: Assistant Waiter - Runner
Skills: Communication|Customer Satisfaction|Follow Directions|Food and Beverage Operations|Guest Experience|Guest Service|Hotel Management|Hygiene|Professional Communication|Service Standards|
Job Description:
About the job

Scorpios

Scorpios is a growing hospitality brand that brings people together around music, food, and mindfulness — always within a stunning natural landscape. Taking inspiration from the culture and history of its location, each project is intended as a platform for local creatives to exhibit their talents as well as a hub for the global Scorpios community to gather. Since its opening as a beachside music venue on Mykonos in 2015, Scorpios has grown into a global lifestyle hospitality brand with expanded offerings. Scorpios is now looking to build a highly dedicated team to drive the brand to its highest potential.

Job Description

Scorpios is searching for an energetic Assistant Waiter - Runner who will have the responsibility to support the Waiter/Waitress throughout the service duties. The successful candidate will constantly ensure that our guests are served properly and effectively, in such a way that no aspect of service will interfere negatively to their amusement while at Scorpios. He/she will also efficiently assist in the service of food and beverages in Scorpios following strict procedures, in terms of quality standards, and should possess adequate knowledge on how to handle all serving equipment. The candidate must be able to create a pleasant and welcoming environment, at all times, for our guests and constantly display feelings of positivity and calmness.

Opportunities For All

Scorpios was created to bring diverse communities of people together, and we take the same approach when building our teams. We thrive on differences and believe it is critical to our success as a global company. Scorpios is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace that seeks to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We therefore encourage applications from all genders, races, religions, ages and sexual orientations, as well as parents, veterans, people living with disabilities, and any other groups that could bring diverse perspectives to our business.

Responsibilities

  • Deliver services of exceptional quality that increase customer satisfaction
  • Always follow Scorpios service standards and procedures on how to serve drinks, beverages and food
  • Organize table settings and maintain tables dirt-free and tidy
  • Maintain pleasant interaction with guests at all times
  • Follow directions from the Waiter/Waitress in order to ensure exceptional guest service
  • Preserve the workstation organized and stocked in order to better accommodate the needs of the Waiter/Waitress and of our guests
  • Thorough inspection of products concerning quality and taking corrective steps when needed to avoid customer dissatisfaction
  • Checking whether guests meet age requirements for purchase and consumption of alcohol
  • Constantly remain guest focused and promote exceptional guest experience
  • Always follow strict hygiene procedures along with the Food & Beverage regulations

Requirements

  • Proven working experience as an Assistant Waiter - Runner for minimum 2 years in 5* Hotels, High-End Restaurants or comparable, in terms of quality, Beach Compounds
  • Very good knowledge of English language. Additional languages will be considered a plus
  • Computer literacy

Candidate Profile

  • Internal drive and willingness to work in a demanding, challenging and fast‐paced work environment
  • Strong ability and self-motivation to overcome problems at work in a resourceful, efficient, and effective way, working independently or as part of a team
  • Professional communication skills along with an innate teamwork mentality

Benefits

Scorpios offers a competitive salary with career development opportunities, based on the candidate's qualifications and skills. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to work in a stimulating and motivating environment which values and is committed towards its employees.

Scorpios offers a seasonal working contract from May to September.

Title: Senior Energy Consultant
Skills: Command|Communication|Energy Management|Energy Markets|English|Manage Complex Projects|Presentation Skills|Presentations|TSO|Technical Reports|
Job Description:
About the job

About Us

Grant Thornton Greece is a member firm of Grant Thornton International Limited (GTIL), one of the leading organizations delivering audit, tax and advisory services. Every day we provide a diverse range of organizations with the kind of business and financial advice it takes to do this. Our ideas and insight empower our clients to make big decisions about the future and unlock their growth.

If you want to be part of this incredible journey Grant Thornton Greece has the opportunity for you!

The key responsibilities of this role will include:
  • Support the full acquisition process of new projects
  • Contribute to consultancy research and data analysis
  • Manage projects to help our clients implement policies and strategies
  • Draft technical reports and presentations in the course of our on-going projects
  • Interact on a frequent basis with customers

The key requirements of this role are:
  • Post-graduate degree in a relevant area (engineering, energy management, economics, finance)
  • At least 8 years of professional experience in energy
  • Knowledge of and experience in electricity and/or gas regulation and policies at national and EU level
  • Prior experience in electricity or gas TSO, DSO or utility will be considered as an advantage
  • Ability to manage complex projects
  • Familiarity with the strategies and programmes of EU donor agencies and IFIs
  • Knowledge of software on energy markets modeling will be an asset
  • In-depth ability to use IT office programs, to treat data and to analyze documents
  • Excellent command of spoken and written English
  • Strong writing, communication and presentation skills
  • Willingness to travel abroad

To be successful at this role you need the following:
  • Effective communication and rapport building skills
  • Ability to develop and deliver high quality services and solutions
  • An extremely high work ethic
  • Motivation for career progression and development

What will we offer to you?
  • Friendly and dynamic working environment, in which you can develop your skills and competencies
  • Competitive remuneration and benefits package
  • A work place with a strong focus on values and work-life balance and the joint aim to provide the best possible solutions for our clients
  • Formal training and counseling
  • Your professional and personal success is our commitment

What you will need to do next?

Joining the Grant Thornton Greece family is easy! If you feel that you meet the criteria, have the passion to succeed and have the Grant Thornton values simply apply online by uploading an -up-to-date CV with your application and leave the rest to us!

We will ensure that all our resourcing activities are fair, transparent and consistent across the Greece. We want to ensure that the candidate experience is of the highest professional standard.

The Company is committed to providing equality of opportunity for all employees.

Title: Automation Test Engineer
Skills: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)|Git|Gitlab|JUnit|JavaScript|Jenkins|OpenShift|REST APIs|Representational State Transfer (REST)|TestNG|
Job Description:
About the job

Are you a coder with a passion for quality?

Do you enjoy the art of creating automated ways to ensure the software's quality standards?

We'd like to meet you!


We are looking for an Automation Test Engineer to join one of our teams that works for a client facing web portal with a high level of integration, high traffic volume and zero downtime expected. You will be part of a cross- functional team, practicing Agile Scrum methodology at team level, and SAFe model at domain level.

Your role will be to collaborate with Product Owners and development teams to review business requirements and design test cases. You will contribute to the creation and maintenance of automation tests for web applications using our existing test automation frameworks and actively participate in all relevant Agile meetings, providing feedback to the development team. Part of your role will be also to communicate automation test results and highlight any potential quality risks, and author and maintain the test related documentation.


Qualifications


  • University-level degree (or higher education institute) in Computer Science, Information Technology, or relevant field of study.
  • At least 3-4 years of experience in automation testing.
  • Excellent knowledge of testing and development methodologies and their interaction.
  • Very good knowledge of testing and development tools such as Robot, Selenium, and SOAPUI.
  • Solid experience in relational databases, Jenkins and Git
  • Familiar with understanding requirements, use cases, and design specifications and able to define detailed test cases from these artifacts.
  • Experience with microservices, containers, docker, docker-compose and Kubernetes will be an asset
  • Good oral and written communication skills.
  • Very good command of the English language.


What’s in it for you

  • We want you to be well compensated for what you bring in, so we offer an attractive salary package
  • Not a morning person? Enjoy our semi-flexi working hours! Just make sure you’re here to grab a coffee with your team before the Scrum meeting 😉
  • Your health matters to us, so you’re secured with a health insurance plan from day one
  • We chat a lot, so you’ll be equipped with a mobile phone & data plan
  • If you’re a big foodie (like us) you’ll appreciate the ticket restaurant card to spend in restaurants or grocery shops to spoil yourself and your family
  • Enjoy snacking during breaks? Grab some fresh fruits from our kitchen available in the office each week
  • Developer’s fuel is coffee, and the supply source is in our kitchen!
  • We are excited for challenges, so your are invited to take part in exciting projects that make a difference in peoples’ lives at national and European level
  • We never stop learning and evolving! To keep up with ARHS level, join our own training sessions and online courses that we provide
  • We love the ARHS vibes so we gather on a smaller and bigger occasions to celebrate good times together! Take a sneak peek: https://bit.ly/2YD4FxS

Title: Infrastructure Architect

Job Description:
About the job

With more than 20 years of proven experience, QUALCO is a leading Fintech solutions provider, offering a wide range of analytics-driven, highly scalable enterprise software solutions in over 35 countries worldwide. Our end-to-end technology solutions cover a wide range of needs for Banking, Financial Services, Utilities, Insurance, Retail organizations, and beyond.




Reporting to the Senior IT Director the Infrastructure Architect will work alongside different business leaders and units to design solutions that achieve business goals while also working within existing and/or legacy systems.


Responsibilities:

  • Design, review, and co-ordinate integration of infrastructure for new and existing systems;
  • Liaise and co-ordinate with the teams providing infrastructure services & support both internally & externally;
  • Maintain a full map of the infrastructure in use within the Qualco Group of companies;
  • Analyse existing systems to ensure security and efficiency;
  • Recommend improvements or alternative technologies to better meet business needs;
  • Manage and lead the Network Engineer role.


Requirements

  • 2 years experience in the role of Infrastructure Architect or similar role;
  • 5 years wider experience working in an IT role;
  • Experience specifying environments within MS Azure;
  • Good understanding of Microsoft Technology;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Greek & English;
  • Team Leadership Skills;
  • Strong Interpersonal/collaboration/teamwork skills.





Benefits

On top of a challenging work environment, we are offering:

💸 Competitive compensation, ticket restaurant card, and annual bonus programs

💻 Cutting-edge IT equipment, mobile, and data plan

🏢 Modern facilities, free coffee and beverages, and indoor parking

👨‍⚕ Private health insurance, onsite occupational doctor, and workplace counselor

🏝️ Flexible working model

🤸‍♂️ Onsite gym, wellness facilities, and ping pong room

💡 Career and talent development tools

🎓 Mentoring, coaching, personalized annual learning and development plan

🌱 Employee referral bonus, regular wellbeing, ESG, and volunteering activities

Your race, gender identity, expression, age ethnicity, or disability make no difference in Qualco Group. We want to attract, develop, promote, and retain the best people based on their abilities and behavior.

Disclaimer: Qualco Group collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties. We will keep your resume in our database for any future consideration. In case you want to be deleted from our database, please contact us.

Title: Site Engineer

Job Description:
About the job

Adecco HR is the global leader in HR services, certified in Greece with ISO 9001:2008 in the fields of search and selection services and temporary placement. Adecco is currently seeking, on behalf of its client, a fast growing engineering company, for a dynamic professional to cover the following position:


Site Engineer

Title: Product Owner (m/w/d)
Skills: Amazon Web Services (AWS)|Cloud Computing|Cloud Development|Computer Science|Containerization|Docker Products|Git|Java|Scrum|TypeScript|
Job Description:
About the job

Do you want to be part of the next big thing in FinTech?


Our client, a German based international player, is an independent payment service provider that offers a wide range of payment processing services, international merchant accounts and IPSP accounts. The company provides online and mobile payment solutions through its own international banking network, and its own connected alternative payment solutions.


A new development team is currently being established in Thessaloniki. It has both the mindset & originality of an exciting start up, with lean/agile practices, a flat hierarchy, but with the stability & security of being a world-famous organization as well.


For the new office in Thessaloniki (Greece) we are currently looking for a:


Product Owner/Manager (m/w/d)

For full-time and permanent employment. Onsite, hybrid or fully remote.


JOB DESCRIPTION


You show an innovative mindset to design, create and deliver products that meet customers’ needs and that users love. You are responsible for managing the products throughout their life cycle and creating KPI’s to quantify and measure success. As an expert in delivering complex products, you will interact with internal and external stakeholders. Your passion is to create a seamless experience for end users and merchants looking to go live on our platform or use our products and services. Therefore, you take care of product definition, end-to-end product development planning and go-to-market planning.


Your responsibilities:


  • Act as a Product Owner across different Scrum teams and be the main point of contact between teams and stakeholders.
  • Work closely with the teams, assist them to meet the objectives and provide feedback on the product increments.
  • Align the product roadmap with all stakeholders and contribute to the long-term vision.
  • Define detailed product requirements based on high level product roadmap and refine them through cross-department and stakeholder discussions.
  • Manage and prioritize product backlog items, write high-quality user-stories with well-defined acceptance criteria.
  • Work closely with technical leads and Agile Project Managers to drive release planning and execution.
  • Oversee the development stages, evaluate product progress and report it to stakeholders.
  • Set and manage cross-functional team priorities and gracefully handle changes in priorities.
  • Collect, detail and prioritize customer specifications and requirements.
  • Document use cases to demonstrate the business value of product features.
  • Work closely with UI/UX designer to define the best workflows.
  • Prepare product demos to stakeholders.
  • Prepare and distribute release notes for the product releases.


Your profile:


  • Bachelor degree (higher education in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related fields) or equal education.
  • Previous experience as a Product Owner or similar role, ideally in a FinTech environment.
  • In depth knowledge of agile methodologies like Scrum, Kanban, etc.
  • Experience with Project Management & Issue Tracking Tools like Jira, Confluence.
  • Experience with product roadmap creation, user journeys and user stories definition, and stakeholder management.
  • Awareness of customer, user and product needs.
  • Proficient in customer interviews, A/B testing or other customer research techniques.
  • Experienced in cross-department collaboration.
  • Ability of proposing impactful solutions to influence product roadmap.
  • Excellent knowledge of English.
  • Flexibility and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Initiative team player with effective communication, facilitation, presentation, and negotiation skills.
  • Positive and motivated mindset with excellent organizational skills and sense of responsibility.
  • Team player with great problem-solving and good organizational skills.


What’s in it for you?


  • Competitive remuneration above market average
  • Private health insurance & flexible work arrangements
  • International projects using state of the art technologies
  • Flat hierarchy & open-door culture
  • Tech conferences, meetups and team events
  • Top location & high-tech equipment


Interested? Then apply for the position using the applicant button. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on +49 221 66 999-700. We are looking forward to meet you!


Your contact: Despoina Chourmouziadou, Recruiter

Title: Assistant Restaurant Manager

Job Description:
About the job

Company Info

Nusr-Et, the most popular and prestigious brand of Meat Enthusiasts, committed to provide the highest quality meat with a unique experience, is offering “Assistant Restaurant Manager” role for you. If you’re enthusiastic to contribute in a fast-paced environment and be part of Brand’s success story please apply the post below.

Title: Accountant/ Controller
Skills: Accounting Software|Finance|Financial Statements|General Ledgers|International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS)|Journal Entries (Accounting)|Ledger Management|Legal Requirements|Legislative Relations|Statutory|
Job Description:
About the job

About us – we are a challenger bank in Southeast Europe and regional leader in alternative payment solutions, building an ecosystem by combining financing and shopping to address customers’ needs. Our successful business model and customer-focus approach allowed us to be one of the most profitable and efficient banks in the region. We currently serve customers in Romania, Germany, Bulgaria & Lithuania.


We have now expanded our global footprint in Greece with thousands of merchants and consumers. Do you want to play a key role in our unique success story?


If yes, we are looking for an Accountant/ Controller to join our Team in Greece!


What You Get To Do In This Role


  • Perform regular bookkeeping activities in accordance with GR GAAP/IFRS
  • Prepare timely the statutory financial statements under GR GAAP/IFRS
  • Prepare the month-end/year-end trial balance as well as the closing journal entries
  • Manage monthly reconciliations and filings for MyData online platform
  • Prepare and file various corporate tax returns (VAT, CIT, Withholding Taxes) along with any other tax-related submissions, where required (stamp duty and/or other levies etc.)
  • Prepare payments by verifying documentation
  • Monthly reconciliation of all general ledger accounts and bank accounts
  • Perform fixed assets register maintenance
  • Analyze and update accounting books and accounting applications parameters to cover legislative and internal requirements
  • Provide accounting support to other back-office units
  • Comply with state and local financial legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation
  • Analysis and implementation of systems and procedures to enhance workflow
  • Prepare reports for management/ad hoc reports

Desired Skills and Experience

  • BSc in Accounting/Finance or other relevant degree
  • MSc and/or professional qualifications will be considered an advantage
  • Must have minimum of 4 years of proven experience in accounting and tax from the Banking sector and/or BIG 4 accounting firms
  • Advanced knowledge of statutory accounting principles, IFRS and tax legislation
  • Proficient in MS Office (MS Excel, MS Word)
  • Fluent level of English, both written and verbal
  • Strong analytical skills, high level of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Strong ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  • Outstanding organizational & time management skills
  • Excellent verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to effectively handle multiple tasks simultaneously in a deadline driven environment
  • Confidentiality and integrity


In Return, We Will Give You


  • Opportunity to be a part of growing organization where you can see the difference you made!
  • Competitive Salary
  • A friendly environment & team of passionate multinational professionals. Don’t be surprised if you talk to 16+ nationalities @ TBI Bank!


If this sounds like something you’d be interested in, we'd love to hear from you!


To apply for this position, please send us your CV in English.


Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interview.

Title: Receptionist
Skills: Administration|Communication|Inbound Marketing|Multitasking|Proactive Monitoring|Skilled Multi-tasker|Workload Prioritization|
Job Description:
About the job

Do you have enthousiasm and passion for fashion? Are you personable and you like to work in a fast - paced environment?

AXION LTD on behalf of its client, a well known multinational fashion company, is currently seeking to recruit a


Receptionist


Main Responsibilities

· Greet and welcome guests as soon as they arrive at the office

· Direct visitors to the proper person and office

· Answer, screen, and forward incoming phone calls

· University degree

· Excellent command of English language

· Proficient with Windows and Microsoft Office

Candidate skills/attributes

· Ability to be resourceful and proactive in dealing with issues that may arise

· Ability to organize, multitask, prioritize, and work under pressure

· Being team player

Benefits

· Friendly environment

· Career Opportunities

· Private Insurance

All applications will be treated with the strictest confidentiality

Title: Sales Administrator (part-time) outsourced
Skills: Account Management|Administrative Assistance|Analytical Skills|Customer Satisfaction|Office Administration|Order Processing|Organization Skills|Sales Operations|Sales Processes|Teamwork|
Job Description:
About the job

Overview


Η PepsiCo Hellas φιλοξενεί μερικά από τα πιο αγαπημένα προϊόντα τροφίμων και αναψυκτικών στον κόσμο όπως τα καθημερινά αγαπημένα σας Lay's, Quaker, Pepsi, Doritos και τους χυμούς Ήβη, για να αναφέρουμε μερικά. Έχουμε μια εκπληκτική φήμη για την ανάπτυξη και την κυκλοφορία προϊόντων που αγαπούν οι καταναλωτές μας. Είμαστε περήφανοι που είμαστε ένα εξαιρετικό μέρος για εργασία και κερδίσαμε πρόσφατα το βραβείο του Καλύτερου Εργοδότη για την Ελλάδα!


Σε μεγαλύτερη κλίμακα, η PepsiCo παράγει το μεγαλύτερο χαρτοφυλάκιο τροφίμων και αναψυκτικών δισεκατομμυρίων δολαρίων στον κόσμο, συμπεριλαμβανομένων 22 σειρών προϊόντων που κάθε μία παράγει περισσότερα από δισεκατομμύριο σε ετήσιες λιανικές πωλήσεις.


Responsibilities


  • Λήψη, καταχώρηση παραγγελιών και ορθή τιμολόγηση - Ολοκλήρωση των διαδικασιών πώλησης μέσω των ηλεκτρονικών συστημάτων.
  • Συντονίζει τις δραστηριότητες των πωλητών και των pickers(αποθήκης) με στόχο την δημιουργία των παραγγελιών.
  • Υποστηρίζει τους πωλητές και τους οδηγούς-διανομείς ώστε να εργάζονται αποτελεσματικά - Παρακολουθεί το απόθεμα της αποθήκης και ενημερώνει τους πωλητές και τους svr για τυχόν προβλήματα που προκύπτουν.
  • Εξυπηρέτηση πελατών - Παροχή όποιας πληροφορίας χρειαστεί στους δυνητικούς πελάτες για τη συνεργασία της εταιρείας μαζί τους.
  • Διαχειρίζεται, τις τηλεφωνικές κλήσεις με πελάτες καθώς και την αλληλογραφία.
  • Επικοινωνία με τμήματα της εταιρίας όπως το ΙΤ με στόχο την επίλυση προβλημάτων


Qualifications


  • Γνώση βασικών αρχών λογιστικής.
  • Εμπειρία με λογισμικό διαχείρισης γραφείου όπως MS Office (ιδιαίτερα, MS Excel και MS Word)
  • Γνώση αγγλικών.
  • Ωράριο 16.00 – 20.00

Title: Data Engineer
Skills: Applied Mathematics|Cloud Computing|Data Migration|Data Mining|Data Modeling|Data Processing|Data Visualization|Machine Learning|Microsoft SQL Server|Statistics|
Job Description:
About the job

At Teleperformance Greece we are looking for a Data Engineer to work with us as a senior visionary who translates business requirements into technology requirements and defines data standards and principles. The successful candidate will play a key role in designing and building data solutions that drive business insights and enable data-driven decision making.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain data models that support business requirements and including AI-powered data analytics needs.
  • Design and implement data analytics solutions, including machine learning models, deep learning models, and natural language processing (NLP) models.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to deliver high-quality data solutions that meet business requirements.
  • Design and implement data governance policies and procedures to ensure data quality, accuracy, and compliance with regulations.
  • Define and maintain data standards and policies, including data security and privacy.
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to other technical teams on data architecture best practices.
  • Research and evaluate new data technologies and tools to improve our data architecture.
  • Ensure that data architecture aligns with enterprise architecture principles and guidelines.


Knowledge – Qualifications - Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering or a related field
  • Proficient knowledge of English language (B2/C1 level for Writing, Speaking, Listening & Reading)
  • Applied math and statistics
  • Data visualization and data migration
  • RDMSs (relational data management systems) or foundational database skills
  • Database management system software, especially Microsoft SQL Server
  • Databases such as NoSQL and working experience on cloud computing such as AWS, GCP and especially on Azure
  • Data processing frameworks such as Hadoop and Spark
  • Information management and data processing on multiple platforms
  • Machine learning algorithms and libraries such as scikit-learn and TensorFlow, Keras and PyTorch
  • Data mining and modeling tools, especially ERWin, Enterprise Architect and Visio
  • Programming languages, especially Python,R and Java, as well as C/C++ and Perl
  • Operating systems, including UNIX, Linux, Solaris and MS Windows
  • Application server software, especially Oracle
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve complex data and AI issues.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.


Experience:

  • At least 24 months of experience in a similar position

Title: Στέλεχος Γενικής Διεύθυνσης Δικτύου Καταστημάτων (Πάρος, Μύκονος, Λασίθι, Καλαμάτα)
Skills: APS|Benefits Design|Cross-Selling|Employee Benefits|Job Description Development|LinkedIn|Sales|
Job Description:
About the job

Στέλεχος Γενικής Διεύθυνσης Δικτύου Καταστημάτων (Πάρος, Μύκονος, Λασίθι, Καλαμάτα)


Η Eurobank αναζητά ικανά στελέχη για την Γενική Διεύθυνση Δικτύου Καταστημάτων, με κύριο στόχο την υπεύθυνη και άρτια εξυπηρέτηση των πελατών, που συναλλάσσονται καθημερινά στα καταστήματα της Τράπεζας.


Οι βασικές σου αρμοδιότητες θα είναι:


• Έγκαιρη διερεύνηση των αναγκών των πελατών και προσφορά λύσεων και προτάσεων στο πλαίσιο της συμβουλευτικής εξυπηρέτησης (cross selling)

• Διαχείριση του Ταμείου, ATM, APS, ώστε να εξασφαλίζεται η συμφωνία μετρητών/ παραστατικών και το κλείσιμο ταμείου

• Παρακολούθηση και διερεύνηση των εξελίξεων της αγοράς και του ανταγωνισμού για την ενημέρωση των πελατών και διαχείριση, καθοδήγηση και ανάπτυξη του ανατεθειμένου πελατολογίου μέσω της ανάλυσης οικονομικών στοιχείων των πελατών

• Υποστήριξη του Υποδιευθυντή και Διευθυντή Καταστήματος στην ολοκλήρωση των καθημερινών εργασιών


Θα είσαι εξαιρετικός/ή υποψήφιος/α για την θέση αυτή, εαν έχεις τα παρακάτω:


• Εργασιακή εμπειρία 1 - 3 έτη σε χρηματοοικονομικό/ασφαλιστικό χώρο; εργασιακή εμπειρία σε τραπεζικό οργανισμό θα θεωρηθεί πρόσθετο προσόν

• Πτυχίο ΑΕΙ με κατεύθυνση στα χρηματοοικονομικά/διοίκηση επιχειρήσεων; Μεταπτυχιακός τίτλος σπουδών θα θεωρηθεί πρόσθετο προσόν

• Επιθυμητή Πιστοποίηση στην Ασφαλιστική Διαμεσολάβηση

• Πολύ καλή γνώση χειρισμού Η/Υ (MS Office) και εξοικείωση με digital εργαλεία επικοινωνίας

• Πολύ καλή γνώση της αγγλικής γλώσσας σε προφορικό και γραπτό λόγο


Οι αξίες μας τις οποίες θα θέλαμε να μοιράζεσαι κι εσύ, είναι οι παρακάτω:


• Να μαθαίνεις & να βελτιώνεσαι συνεχώς, αξιοποιώντας κάθε ευκαιρία

• Να φέρνεις αποτελέσματα που έχουν σημαντική επίδραση

• Να χτίζεις σχέσεις αμοιβαίου οφέλους, όταν αλληλοεπιδράς με πελάτες ή συναδέλφους

• Να επηρεάζεις με τις ιδέες, λύσεις και προσεγγίσεις σου

• Να βρίσκεις λύσεις και να μειώνεις την πολυπλοκότητα

• Να κερδίζεις την εμπιστοσύνη των άλλων


Benefits

Η Eurobank προσφέρει προοπτικές επαγγελματικής εξέλιξης σε ένα δυναμικό και σύγχρονο περιβάλλον εργασίας, ένα ανταγωνιστικό πακέτο αποδοχών καθώς και παροχές τις οποίες μπορείς να δεις εδώ:

https://www.eurobank.gr/el/omilos/stadiodromia-konta-mas/giati-stin-eurobank/pleonektimata-ergasias-stin-eurobank/


Λήξη Αγγελίας: 29/05/2023


Ακολούθησε μας στο LinkedIn και ενημερώσου για όλα τα νέα μας.


Σεβόμαστε τα προσωπικά σου δεδομένα. Όλα τα στοιχεία της αίτησης και του βιογραφικού σου παραμένουν αυστηρά εμπιστευτικά.

Title: System Administrator
Skills: CentOS|Linux|Microsoft Azure|Microsoft SQL Server|Office 365|SQL|SharePoint|System Administration|Ubuntu|Windows Server|
Job Description:
About the job

About Ambience Services


Ambience Services is an innovative company, providing IT, Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Services and Business Process Outsourcing. What makes us different, is our strong desire to challenge the status quo, inspire and create ground-breaking solutions. We build relationships of trust with our clients, on solid foundations of quality and know-how, while creating great experiences, through great customer service.


Our team consists of experienced professionals with a passion for their work. They are the cornerstone of our company’s dynamic culture and stand as strong and reliable partners towards our customers’ concerns and needs. Therefore, we have built a diverse environment that maximizes employee engagement and performance, based on our key value to invest on and develop our people and teams.


The Role


We are looking for an experienced System Administrator to manage, configure, and maintain our IT systems, to troubleshoot our database & services and manage the backup activities.


For this position, you should be able to diagnose and resolve problems quickly and have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary teams and users. Your goal will be to ensure that our technology infrastructure runs smoothly and efficiently.


Key Responsibilities


  • Installs, configures, develops, maintains, upgrades and repairs Windows servers, storages, virtual environments (VMs) and network equipment
  • Performs daily operational support and event monitoring of all information systems and services, including Windows AD, DNS, IIS, Microsoft SQL Server, Office 365, Microsoft Sharepoint, Bitdefender, DarkTrace, Microsoft Exchange, and enterprise applications eg AroTRON and Exelysis Dialer
  • Troubleshoots hardware and software errors by running diagnostics, documenting problems and resolutions, prioritizing problems, and assessing impact of issues
  • Conducts inspections on events and configurations in the on-premise as well as the cloud infrastructure
  • Performs regular backup operations and implements appropriate processes for data protection, compliance with security and any other regulatory requirements
  • Creates, maintains, and executes backup procedures on databases and systems (cloud and on premise)
  • Performs systematically database checks and addresses any resulting errors
  • Proactively works with the IT team to analyze and resolve performance and other IT related issues


Requirements


  • Experience of at least 4 years in similar position
  • Working experience in MS Windows Server is a must
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, System Administration, or a closely related field
  • Very good knowledge of MS SQL Server, Microsoft Infrastructure, Linux (CentOS & Ubuntu) is required
  • Working experience with Microsoft Azure is desired
  • Organized with the ability to prioritize and multi-task effectively
  • Possesses analytical skills and pays attention to details
  • A team-player with excellent communication skills
  • Reliable with patience and professionalism


Benefits


  • Competitive remuneration and benefits package
  • Bonus upon success
  • Private medical insurance
  • A team who is eager to provide the best possible solutions for our clients
  • Formal training and development of your skills
  • A place where your professional and personal success is our commitment

Title: Energy Efficiency Sr. Associate - Greece or Remote
Skills: Clean Energy Technologies|Communication|Energy Audits|Energy Efficiency|Energy Industry|Energy Management|MDBs|Renewable Energy|Sustainable Energy|Written Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we are collaborating with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world’s most complex challenges.


Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®.


Job Purpose


Support the expansion of Tetra Tech’s presence in Europe and Eurasia by serving its existing projects, act as a hub for additional growth in the region utilizing proven energy sector experience and help power a just energy transition for all.


Job Description


As the Energy Efficiency Sr. Associate - Europe, you will have the chance to be part of a newly formed team responsible for managing, sourcing, and executing consulting engagements focused on energy sector projects, initiatives, or policies to drive the energy and climate transition.


Working with other members of our team, you’ll support the technical delivery across our projects focused on clean energy, decarbonization, and the alignment of sustainable energy policies with best practices globally.


During your time with us, you will also have the opportunity to support the delivery and management of a portfolio of Tetra Tech projects, help execute a business development plan for Europe and Eurasia and cooperate closely with other Tetra Tech operating units in Europe with a view to collaborating on new opportunities and approaches for new clients.


If you’re ready for the challenge, we’re looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us power a just energy transition for all.


The location of this position will be in Athens, Greece or remote.


Minimum Qualifications


  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, economics, or environmental sciences
  • 5 years of progressive consulting experience in the energy sector, preferably with experience working with a variety of clients, to include MDBs (multilateral development banks) and donors.
  • A deep understanding of clean energy technologies and lifecycles and experience on energy efficiency projects identification and development (buildings and/or industrial).
  • Understanding of the European sustainable energy market, and related regulatory framework (energy acquis).
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.


Preferred Qualifications


  • Willingness to travel internationally to project locations and conferences.
  • Oral and written communication skills in German, French or Spanish.


About Tetra Tech


Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 470 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees—22,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development.


Explore our open positions at https://www.tetratech.com/careers. Follow us on social media to learn more about our people, culture, and opportunities:


LinkedIn: @TetraTechCareers


Twitter: @TetraTechJobs


Facebook: @TetraTechCareers


Tetra Tech is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity, inclusion, and equity are among Tetra Tech’s core values. Throughout our history, the company has prioritized equitable inclusion of all people. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information and any other characteristics protected by the law. We invite resumes from all interested parties. Please visit our website at www.tetratech.com to see the array of diverse services and exciting projects we are currently working on.


Tetra Tech is a VEVRAA federal contractor and we request priority referral of veterans for available positions.


We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.


Please no phone calls or agencies.


Additional Information


  • Organization: 154 ESI

Title: Field Engineer
Skills: Business Growth|Client Relations|Computer Literacy|Engineering|Field Operations|Office 365|Remote User Support|Service Quality|Support Services|Technical Support|
Job Description:
About the job

Network Dynamics has existed in its current form since 2005, created by a group of I.T. Engineers with more than 35 years of total experience in Network Support Services, Onsite Support Services, Data Center Services and Project Management throughout EMEA and APAC. Network Dynamics have head offices based out of Hong Kong, Sydney, Australia, Athens, Greece, and London, United Kingdom. Network Dynamics place a great emphasis on the quality of services they offer and proudly states that its strongest “means of advertising” are its customers.


Job Brief

We are searching for a handy and seasoned field engineer with extensive experience working on-site, directing on-site functions, and enhancing efficiency and customer service. Your technical expertise will assist our organization in increasing client satisfaction, improving efficiency, managing risk, diagnosing problems, and complying with laws and regulations.


The ideal candidate for this role should possess excellent technical skills, be a good communicator, and pay meticulous attention to detail. The exceptional field engineer should diagnose and resolve problems, improve efficiency, mitigate risk, encourage business growth, and enhance and sustain relations with clients.


Field Engineer Responsibilities


· Performs specified scheduled maintenance tasks as per contract with client.

· Running field operations, offering technical support, and troubleshooting on-site issues.

· Coordinates with Remote Support for cases that need on-prem work.

· Collaborates with relevant departments of ND for work required.

· Communicates any client requests to ND FE team supervisor.

· Overseeing equipment testing, maintenance, installation, and planning.

· Drafting and submitting reports to superiors and other key individuals.


General Requirements


· Is a licensed driver and motorbike/car owner.

· Has a working command of the English language.

· Can work individually or as a team member.

· Excellent problem-solving skills backed by solid technical knowledge.

· Analytical and critical thinking skills.

· Technically savvy and computer literate.

· Great communication skills.

· Good understanding of safety guidelines.

· Versatile and service-oriented mindset.

· Ability to work under pressure and complete tasks in a timely manner.

· Reference from the previous employer is welcome.

· Fulfilled military obligations for male candidates.


Technical Requirements


· Windows (7, 10, 11) client OS support

· Microsoft Office 365 familiarity

· Can setup entire small LAN by themselves (5-10 clients with ALL equipment including network cabling) and support day 1 operation

· Solid understanding of TCP/IP principles

Title: Internships in Project Management
Skills: Analytical Skills|Communication|Computer Science|Coordinating Activities|English|Negotiation|Problem Solving|Project Management|Project Management Office (PMO)|Teamwork|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description

About Netcompany - Intrasoft

We are Netcompany - Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with a strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.

For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: https://www.netcompany-intrasoft.com/.

Job Description

We are looking for an intern as Project Management Assistant in Athens

We are looking for inspired talents that will be part of highly skilled teams that will contribute to project management. The ideal candidate will have to assist the Project Management Office and the Project Managers in coordinating activities of EU projects.

Qualifications

If you are
  • Current student status at BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Finance, Management, Mathematics or other relevant fields
  • Eligible to attend an internship program through your university or academic institution

If you have
  • Very good knowledge of the English language (written and oral)
  • An analytical mind with problem-solving abilities
  • Self-motivated and eager to learn new technologies
  • Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills

…then this position is suitable for you!

By attending an internship at Netcompany-Intrasoft you will have the opportunity to:
  • Work with competent teams delivering challenging IT projects engage in a well structured international environment
  • Learn cutting-edge technologies
  • Establish a strong candidacy for permanent employment
  • Have the equipment for home-based work
  • Use our corporate buses to transport from and to work

Additional Information

We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.

The safety and well-being of our candidates and employees remain our top priority. Please note that the recruitment process in Netcompany - Intrasoft will be conducted virtually for the upcoming months, following the Covid-19 pandemic safety measures.

Our culture

Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values:

Be the link of a great team that forms a unique network across departments, countries and business units and operates with trust, open communication, transparency and respect.

We make it happen with our expertise, accountability and solution-driven attitude. We always strive for improvement, always with an eye on the big picture.

We learn & evolve by embracing a culture of building on our experiences, sharing our knowledge and developing our skills. We are always open to new ideas and invite all #NetcompanyIntrasoftPeople to contribute with theirs.

We fuel creativity in every aspect of our everyday life; in the solutions and products we design and the initiatives we undertake.

We share customer success by understanding their unique needs, corresponding to their vision, and exceeding their expectations.

#BePartOfSomethingGreat
  • Please submit your CV in English

All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Backend Developer

Job Description

We are recruiting for Backend Developers in Greece for our growing Digital Solutions business. Candidates will be responsible for the design, development and code quality of our product offerings to our maritime customers.

What You Will Do:

Working in an Agile environment, you will participate in daily scrums with the aim of achieving your sprint goals.

Title: Operations Engineer
Skills: After-Sales|Communication|Decision-Making|Electrical Engineering|Equipment Installation|Microsoft Office|Problem Solving|Sales Order Processing|Teamwork|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Accountabilities:

  • Handle project from take-over stage from the Sales Department to hand-over stage to customer and After Sales Dept. and ensure delivery of a trouble-free product as per Mitsulift’s standard.
  • Supervise the installation teams and ensure the installation process is carried out according to Mitsulift Standards and maintain the highest installation and safety quality within the allocated budget.
  • Deliver continuous quality service to each customer by constantly providing satisfactory maintenance and repair work as per Mitsulift standards.
  • Supervise the maintenance teams and ensure the maintenance process is carried out according to Mitsulift standards and maintain the highest maintenance and safety quality.


Main Tasks:

  • Track all installation projects, monitor works planning schedule, and follow up on progress to ensure final product being delivered meets the pre-selected standards and sales order specifications and conditions.
  • Supervise technicians and provide them with adequate technical support to ensure satisfactory execution and completion of major installation tasks adequately and on time.
  • Handle the on-site preparation of all materials needed for installation and follow up on outstanding issues such as snags.
  • Oversee handing over of the project to the client and to the maintenance team.
  • Supervise maintenance technicians by checking service vouchers and maintenance sheets and by inspecting assigned sites and maintenance work conducted and provide them with support to ensure adequate execution of work and their adherence to Mitsulift’s standard of conduct.
  • Handle technicians’ daily schedule and work orders to ensure maintenance rounds and reconstructions are being carried out as assigned.
  • Prepare and conduct safety meetings for the team, ensure conformity to safety guidelines and investigate work accidents.


Qualifications:

  • Electrical Engineering degree from a reputable university
  • 3+ years of experience in a similar role
  • Fluency in English, spoken and written
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office
  • Core Competencies: Communication, Customer Focus, Ownership and Pro-activeness, Problem Solving and Decision Making, Result Focus, Safety Focus, Teamwork, Work Ethics and Values.
  • Technical Competencies: Electrical and Mechanical knowledge, Trouble shooting, Problems Diagnostic, Versatility.

Title: Security Engineer
Skills: Analytical Skills|Cisco Systems Products|English|Information Technology|Network Security|Problem Solving|SAP ERP|Security Architecture Design|
Job Description:
About the job

SIDENOR

is looking for a

Security Engineer

to join the IT team in Maroussi


With 60 years of industry know-how and expertise Sidenor is the largest steel industry in Greece and constitutes the steel production and trading segment of Viohalco. Sidenor Group is a leading steel producer in Southeastern Europe with 6 production units in Greece, Bulgaria, Northern Macedonia and Cyprus.


The Group's products are available in more than 50 countries with a significant contribution to the economic growth, such as those of steel reinforcing for building and infrastructure projects, shipbuilding and various other industrial applications.


As the Security Engineer, you will report to the IT Director and will be part of Steel Segment IT Department and your role aim to support internal network Infrastructure environment along with Viohalco’s Security team. You will be responsible to adopt and implement the Group Security Policy and follow the set of security standards and best practices for the organization.



Your Role


  • Perform installation, configuration, and maintenance of network equipment and network operating Systems
  • Manage, review and monitor network and infrastructure security devices such as firewalls, UTM, VPN Gateway and WAF
  • Managing Cisco and FortiGate network devices
  • Constantly monitor security Level and recommend security enhancements as needed
  • Create and update documented procedures of network security policies
  • Respond to any internal or external audits of the organization
  • Conduct training for the workforce in order to enhance the security awareness


Your Profile


  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Technology/Computer Science/Business Administration or other related disciplines
  • 3+ years of experience in a similar role
  • Good knowledge of Security Design Architecture, OSI model, TCP/IP model, Network Security and Protocols
  • Vendor certifications and/or Industry cybersecurity certifications will be considered an asset
  • Experience in managing Network Access Control & in technics and White Hat attacks on resources to exploit vulnerabilities
  • Excellent communication skills (Greek & English)
  • Experience in threat hunting and incident response handling
  • Good analytical, problem solving, and time management skills
  • Network security issue-resolving approach with proactive mindset skills

Title: DevOps Engineer
Skills: Analytical Skills|Attention to Detail|CI|Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)|DevOps|English|Gitlab|Problem Solving|Python (Programming Language)|Unix Administration|
Job Description:
About the job

Sword Services S.A. Greece is seeking to recruit a high caliber, energetic individual to join our Software Development team in Greece as a Development and Operations Support Engineer (DevOps). The successful candidate will work in a multinational environment on a multitude of tasks supporting our core business in large International Information Systems. The company is currently expanding its activities in Greece offering an optimum career advancement opportunity for the successful candidate who should combine a relevant educational and professional background, with enthusiasm and eagerness.
What You Will Do...
  • Implement, administer and maintain Linux virtual infrastructure, databases and applications servers, including provisioning, backups and restores, upgrades and monitoring;
  • Develop and manage the automated build system, automated deployment system, continuous integration environment;
  • Automate monitoring tools to monitor system health and reliability to support high uptime requirements;
  • Automated creation of machine images and Containers
  • Troubleshoot software and infrastructure issues as needed;
  • Communication complex technical solutions to a broad range of stakeholders within the business;
  • Stay up to date with emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities.
What Is Your Experience…
  • Bachelor’s degree in a CS/IS/IT/System Administration related field or equivalent experience;
  • 2+ years in a DevOps or equivalent role with a strong background in Linux/Unix Administration;
  • Very good knowledge in containerization technologies (i.e., Docker, Kubernetes);
  • Working knowledge of Helm Charts;
  • Experience with automating deployment (CI/CD) using DevOps tools (i.e., Ansible, Jenkins);
  • Experience with Version control systems (i.e., Git, GitLab, SVN);
  • Excellent command of the English language both written & spoken;
  • Ability and willingness to learn new tools and technologies.
Experience in the following technologies will be considered an asset:
  • Experience designing and supporting cloud environments;
  • Working knowledge of SonarQube, Nexus;
  • Working knowledge of Argo CD;
  • Working knowledge of AWS Administration;
  • Knowledge of scripting languages such as Bash and Python;
  • Troubleshooting and debugging application related network issues;
  • Certification in Cloud Technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS) is considered a plus;
  • Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service.
Personal Characteristics…
  • Self-starter able to execute independently, on a deadline, and under pressure;
  • Attention to detail and a strong sense of responsibility;
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Proactively manage own tasks and projects to agreed deadlines;
  • Ability to work effectively & efficiently with various diverse work teams (Development, Testing and Project Management)
What We Offer To You…
  • Competitive remuneration package;
  • Meal voucher card;
  • Private medical plan;
  • Private pension plan;
  • Shuttle Bus;
  • Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies;
  • Training & Development plan;
  • Employee Recognition plan;
  • Work in a certified “Diversity Charter” company;
  • Teambuilding events;
  • Social responsibility initiatives.
Applications must be in the English language

Title: ICT Infrastructure Team Leader
Company: DESFA SA – Hellenic Gas Transmission System Operator
Skills: Active Directory|English|Firewalls|Fortinet|Information and Communications Technology (ICT)|LAN-WAN|Microsoft Servers|Office 365 Administration|Routers|Windows Server|
Job Description:
About the job

Within the Information & Communication Technology Department, we are looking for an experienced ICT Infrastructure Team Leader to lead our ICT Infrastructure management team. Your call will be to deliver, manage, maintain, and develop a resilient and secure ICT infrastructure as per company processes and requirement along with ensuring infrastructure and telecommunication management services.


  • Planning, coordination and implementation of the ICT infrastructure development and maintenance projects
  • Coordinate the infrastructure and telecommunication management services
  • Define technical requirements and provide execution of ICT development projects for the implementation of new infrastructural and telecommunication solutions in compliance with requirements, timings and budget agreed.
  • Implement and operate infrastructure level security measures to maintain adequate levels of cyber security and data protection.
  • Coordinate the response & recovery activities of the ICT Business Continuity Incident response team, under the management of the Crisis Committee and contribute to the response & recovery activities of the Cybersecurity Incident response team.
  • Develop technical specifications for ICT goods and services sourcing and licensing and provide contract management for the infrastructure and telecommunication management and maintenance agreements.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field required. A master’s degree will be considered a plus
  • At least 8 years’ experience in the ICT Infrastructure area in a corporate environment holding a team leader position
  • LAN/WAN configuration skills (including routers and firewalls, TCP/IP Network Protocols, etc.), and computer security best practices.
  • Extensive current version knowledge of systems including Microsoft Windows Server; Microsoft Azure; Office 365 administration; Microsoft Active Directory management, Cloud+ and/or Cloud security.
  • Good Knowledge of Fortinet fabric will be considered a plus
  • Excellent fluent English required


Soft Skills

Strong interpersonal and communication skills | Project Management | Customer Service Orientation | People Management | Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical matters in an easily understandable way



Why DESFA?

Playing a leading role in the energy transition era, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment offering equal opportunities to all qualified candidates, driven by our core values of integrity, excellence, sustainability, and innovation.

We aim to attract and develop the best talent providing a performance – based growth platform for our Employees.


In addition to the challenging work, we offer a competitive compensation scheme, while supporting the sustainability of work-life balance.


In general, candidates, whose profile is in line with the open position, will be contacted and will receive feedback within 1-2 months. For further information please contact hr@desfa.gr



Disclaimer: DESFA collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties, other than providers supporting the recruitment process. We will keep your resume in our database for future consideration for two (2) years from the end of the year you submitted it. In case you want to be deleted from our database you can contact us at hr@desfa.gr. You can always exercise your rights provided for in the GDPR and get more information on how we process your data by addressing our DPO at dpo@desfa.gr.
