Title: SQL and Database Developer
Skills: Database Administration|Database Development|Databases|Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)|Performance Tuning|Resolving Issues|SQL|SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)|SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)|Stored Procedures|
Job Description:
About the job

With more than 20 years of proven experience, QUALCO is a leading Fintech solutions provider, offering a wide range of analytics-driven, highly scalable enterprise software solutions in over 35 countries worldwide. Our end-to-end technology solutions cover a wide range of needs for Banking, Financial Services, Utilities, Insurance, Retail organizations, and beyond.




The role of SQL & Database Developer will work in the Group IS Database support team reporting to the Senior IT Director. The role will be focused on developing and maintaining the data warehouses and reporting databases/activities for the Qualco group of businesses.

Responsibilities:

  • Development, deployment, and maintenance of T-SQL (queries, views, procedures & functions);
  • Development, deployment, and maintenance of ETL packages;
  • Ensuring that the data warehouses provide data for the reporting ecosystem and for servicing internal customer's requests;
  • Monitoring and resolving issues within the data warehouses and reporting systems;
  • Monitoring and resolving data consistency;
  • Maintaining the database including backups, data quality and security;
  • Assisting in the development of reporting applications;
  • Maintain appropriate documentation, for example, data dictionaries and data flow documentation


Requirements

  • Must have:
    • 4 years experience of SQL and database development including:
      • 2 years experience in developing and maintaining T-SQL, Queries, stored procedures & functions;
      • 2 years experience in developing and maintaining MS SSIS packages (or similar ETL tool);
      • 2 years experience of MS SQL Server, showing familiarity with Management Studio;
    • Experience working within an Agile development environment;
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
    • English fluency and strong communication skills, both verbal and written;
    • Attention to detail & accuracy.
  • Good to have:-
    • Familiarity with Data Warehouse concepts (ETL, Staging/Target Area, OLAP-SSAS, Dimensional Modelling, Data Marts etc.) and knowledge over Microsoft tools supporting these technologies;
    • Familiarity with reporting tools like Power BI and SSRS;
    • Experience using Azure DevOps in conjunction with building SSIS packages;
    • Experience in database administration, for example, performance tuning, backups, and security;
    • Experience with Qualco's collection and core systems QCR, QLM;
    • .NET Application and Web development.


Benefits

On top of a challenging work environment, we are offering:

💸 Competitive compensation, ticket restaurant card, and annual bonus programs

💻 Cutting-edge IT equipment, mobile, and data plan

🏢 Modern facilities, free coffee and beverages, and indoor parking

👨‍⚕ Private health insurance, onsite occupational doctor, and workplace counselor

🏝️ Flexible working model, hybrid/remote benefits & home equipment benefits

🤸‍♂️ Onsite gym, wellness facilities, and ping pong room

💡 Career and talent development tools

🎓 Mentoring, coaching, personalized annual learning and development plan

🌱 Employee referral bonus, regular wellbeing, ESG, and volunteering activities

Your race, gender identity, expression, age ethnicity, or disability make no difference in Qualco Group. We want to attract, develop, promote, and retain the best people based on their abilities and behavior.

Disclaimer: Qualco Group collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties. We will keep your resume in our database for any future consideration. In case you want to be deleted from our database, please contact us.

Title: IT Sales Account Manager
Job Description:
About the job

Role purpose:
The job holder will be the IT Sales Account Manager for Vodafone Business Computing, Data Storage, Cloud Services & IOT Solutions. The role includes exploring prospect opportunities, and establishing and maintaining business relationships with enterprise customers in order to achieve sales targets.

Key Accountabilities And Decision Ownership
  • Develop new business opportunities with prospect customers by introducing Vodafone’s Business Computing, Data, Cloud Services & Internet of Things Solutions
  • Perform daily customer visits, enquire with customer IT decision makers (CTO, CIO, IT Directors, and Managers) & analyse customer business requirements to recommend products and services that maximize value
  • Advocate for migration to Dedicated Computing, Colocation, Private Cloud, Public Cloud Services (Azure & IBM Cloud) & Solutions
  • Position Vodafone’s proposition versus competition for new solutions and versus existing solutions for existing customer implementations
  • Achieve the sales targets for IT services & solutions through offer preparation and submission in cooperation and support from Vodafone’s IT Solution Architects
  • Collaborate with the mobile sales team to identify and grow opportunities within the assigned territory
  • Clearly communicate account status and sales cycle progress in weekly and monthly updates
  • Become the lead contact point for all customer account management matters
  • Build and maintain trustful and long term relationships with customers and be the contact of choice for their IT solutions lifecycle and Digital Transformation journey
  • Inspire and ignite attention to Vodafone’s offer of IT and Cloud Services & Solutions

Core competencies, knowledge and experience:
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Results oriented and attention to detail
  • Inspired for effective communication in technical and commercial terms and ability to explain the benefits of Cloud economics
  • Ability to understand the customer’s IT operation model and propose the benefits of moving to Vodafone’s cloud solutions
  • Relevant minimum 5 years’ experience in IT sales in business and enterprise customers
  • Experience with XaaS (as a Service) business models and economics
  • Passion for continuous learning of new technologies and stay current with latest Cloud services & solutions
  • Self-drive and commitment to create awareness, consideration and adoption of innovative services and solutions

Technical / Professional qualifications:
  • University degree or Diploma in IT or related field
  • At least 4 years experience in a relevant field
  • Excellent speaking and writing English skills

What's in it for you:
  •   Competitive pay, bonus & remuneration package
  • Private Health & Medical Insurance
  • Hybrid way of working: a blend of remote and office-based working, including the option to work up to 20 days from abroad
  •   Remote work equipment to help you create a comfortable, ergonomic workspace at home 
  •   Unlimited access to learning resources and trainings
  •   Vodafone Parental Leave: 16 weeks of fully paid parental leave to all employees regardless of gender, sexual orientation or length of service
  •   Spirit of Vodafone Day: one day each quarter dedicated to your personal development
  •   Extra days off: Vodafone Day, Family Day, Volunteering Day 
  •   Needless to say, we cater for your communication wherever you are
  • Office amenities (subject to the office location): such as restaurant, beauty corner, gym and parking
  • Special employee offers and discounts


#Vodafonespirit #Togetherwecan

About the job

Company Description
OpenBet’s mission is to power growth and player engagement for operators through a global betting ecosystem that delivers at scale, at speed, at every great sports event. Our 1000 talented colleagues are the market's top team. We achieve billions of bets in a season; 60,000+ per second (more transactions than Amazon on Prime Day); 100% uptime (zero Superbowl crashes!) and we're built on 25 years of imaginative technology that is iterated daily.
OpenBet has established a premium client base of more than 75 operators worldwide and has 34 licences across the fastest growing regulated sports betting markets in North America, Europe and Asia Pacific. The team is growing at scale driven by accelerated demand for our products and significant investment. We offer the speed, dynamism and growth opportunities of a start-up, underpinned by the stability and strength of a global employer.
Working at OpenBet every day is an opportunity for you to create exciting betting entertainment for millions of sports fans across the globe.
Want to be part of our evolving future growth?
Job Description
Working within the IT team and closely with other business units, you will be a strong communicator and quickly understand the needs of the business, to ensure the infrastructure is underpinned with the best technologies and processes. The role will be a balance between project and BAU work. There is a significant number of ongoing integration projects as part of a series of acquisitions and mergers.
As a member of the team, you will:
  • Responsible to maintain all aspects of the organization's global network systems including software, hardware and respective provider services.
  • Administer and maintain a wide variety of network devices for LAN/WAN, wireless, and telecommunications.
  • Analyze and troubleshoot network problems and recommend upgrades and changes.
  • Work with IT Management to assess the organization's current and future network needs.
  • Perform network monitoring, resolve incidents and changes.
  • Provide weekly status reports of work-related activities.
  • Interact with users as a second level of escalation to the service desk.
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation.
Qualifications
If you are the right candidate for us you will be able to demonstrate:
  • Minimum 4 years of Network Administration experience.
  • CCNA certification holder.
  • Deep understanding of the TCP/IP protocol stack.
  • Experience configuring and troubleshooting with OSPF, EIGRP & BGP Routing Protocols managing redistribution and filtering in overlapping large enterprise IPv4 networks.
  • Solid understanding of IP subnetting, VLANs, FHRP and STP concepts.
  • Experience with Cisco and Fortinet Networking equipment in an enterprise environment.
  • Understanding of QoS Design and Implementation and Network Security including Next Generation Firewalling, Web Application Firewalling, IDS/IPS, etc.
  • Experience with Cloud providers e.g. Azure/AWS Experience and knowledge of Multi Region & Multi-Tenant Topologies.
  • In depth knowledge of VPN technologies IKEv1, IKEv2, IPsec, GRE, SSL and DMVPN and remote access technologies such as OpenVPN and Cisco AnyConnect.
  • Experience configuring and supporting Cisco Wireless Network Platforms (Cisco WLC & Meraki)
  • Experience with SNMP-based network monitoring platforms (e.g. SolarWinds Orion NPM, Cacti, Nagios, Zabbix).
  • DNS, DHCP, NTP, RADIUS and IPAM deployment and administration experience.
  • Deep understanding of Video Conferencing Architectures and Codec’s.
  • Understanding of TDM and IP Trunk side phone system technologies – PRI’s, SIP Trunks, etc.
  • Deep understanding of IP Telephony Systems / Technology and integration with networks.
  • Willing to work in a hybrid model and to provide after works hours service when required.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, including fluency in oral and written English.
It would also be great to see these skills/experiences as well:
  • CCNP certification.
  • Experience in IT projects related to large company acquisitions/mergers.
  • Project management methodologies and techniques.
Additional Information
Why would you enjoy working with us at OpenBet?
  • Competitive benefits, including pension plan and private insurance for you and your family members as well as extra leave days for volunteering and other purposes.
  • The opportunity to work within a truly international Company, where you can expect the diversity and the opportunities of the world, mixed with a people friendly culture.
  • A wide palette of training opportunities and internal and external learning sources, from onboarding, to on-the-job training by our subject matter experts.
  • As a software house, we have a relaxed but highly professional environment with excellent facilities available, including on-site canteen & gym, showers, video, board and electronic sports games as well as lending library.
  • We love to get together and throw a number of group events, to celebrate new comers, enjoy some good meals together and show off our sport talents as part of company tournaments (basketball, table tennis and others!).

Title: Senior Network Engineer/Administrator
Skills: Border Gateway Protocol (BGP)|EIGRP|First Hop Redundancy Protocol (FHRP)|Fortinet|Network Administration|Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)|Routing Protocols|Subnetting|Transport Layer Security (TLS)|VLAN|
Job Description:
About the job

Who are we?

Cegeka is a European provider of IT solutions, services, and consultancy. Born as a local family company in 1992, Cegeka passed through a fascinating journey. We are grown into a trusted European player with broad expertise, happy customers, and engaged employees.

In close cooperation with our customers, we offer a range of diverse IT solutions in infrastructure, digital workplace, software, cloud, data, and security. The customer-oriented approach is in our DNA: we do not work for, we work together with our customers, acting both as an IT supplier and as a trusted partner.

It is our ambition to become the leading European orchestrator of digital business platforms and ecosystems in our focus markets.


What we are looking for:

As an Application Support Engineer, you will be part of Cegeka Application and Integration team that supports business-critical applications used by our customers and you will be involved in maintaining the applications, doing incident management, as well as developing improvements to further help out the customer.

The team is customer-facing and has local engineers who maintain the onsite presence, supported by the remote engineers and they work together with the functional application managers at the customer, which has a very good impact on the customer satisfaction score.

The team has day shifts, the duration of a shift being 8h30min (break included). Additionally, standby (on-call) work is required, by rotation.


What you will do:

  • Automate tasks that, currently, are performed manually
  • Install and maintain various systems and software, covering the correspondent administrative actions as well
  • You will also be responsible for incident handling, changes, and backfill (mailbox management, ticketing system activities)
  • Assist in the technical projects, providing the necessary installations and configurations of the hardware and system software
  • Investigate the internal client’s IT environment in a proactive and critical manner, making the necessary improvement proposals
  • Handle the IIS management and integration management tools


What you need to have:

  • At least three years of experience in the IT field and previous experience with application management
  • Programming and scripting skills for infrastructure management as PowerShell scripting or similar scripting experience.
  • Windows Server Administration knowledge (Linux would be a plus)
  • Knowledge of AZ-900
  • You are familiar with the ITIL Framework (Certification is a plus)
  • Agile (Scrum method) experience would be preferred
  • Websphere, AS400 (iSeries), Biztalk, and MQ are nice to have skills

Title: Product Manager
Skills: Analytical Skills|Business Administration|Communication|English|Marketing|Microsoft Excel|Microsoft Office|Microsoft PowerPoint|Product Management|Product Road Mapping|
Job Description:
About the job

Overview


About PepsiCo


PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers more than one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo generated more than $79 billion in net revenue in 2021, driven by a complementary beverage and convenient foods portfolio that includes Lay’s, Doritos, Cheetos, Gatorade, Pepsi-Cola, Mountain Dew, Quaker, and SodaStream. PepsiCo's product portfolio includes a wide range of enjoyable foods and beverages, including many iconic brands that generate more than $1 billion each in estimated annual retail sales.


Guiding PepsiCo is our vision to Be the Global Leader in Beverages and Convenient Foods by Winning with PepsiCo Positive (pep+). pep+ is our strategic end-to-end transformation that puts sustainability and human capital at the center of how we will create value and growth by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for planet and people. For more information, visit www.pepsico.com.


Building a more sustainable food system is critical for the health of our communities and the planet we all share. Take a look at the latest efforts by PepsiCo to fight climate change, protect natural resources, and more: https://pepsico.com/sustainability/strategy


Why PepsiCo Hellas?


PepsiCo Hellas currently employs around 1000 people at its 2 sites, including our headquarters in Athens. With well-known strong brands such as Pepsi, Lay’s, Quaker and Lipton, we are constantly ranked in the Top 3 Employers in the Country. We pride ourselves on being a great place to work and were rewarded for the the 7th time with the Top Employer certification Greece and Europe. Joining PepsiCo means joining a dedicated team where innovation and forward thinking are encouraged.


We are an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity and inclusivity at our company; it is an essential part of our success. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, pregnancy or maternity, marital/civil partnerships, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation, gender or gender reassignment, disability or race including color, nationality, ethnic or national origin. Please also visit www.pepsico.com/about/diversity-and-engagement for more information on what we do in practice to embrace diversity and inclusivity in the working surroundings and in society.


Responsibilities


Role Description


The main objective of this role is to provide onsite support to users, infrastructure, and local operations. The role manages local IT asset and inventory, plans for refresh cycles; role addresses end user tickets and provides resolution where needed per end user expectations and communicates various notifications.


Provides second level support based on incidents and support request from Service Desk, requested by customers, in a timely manner and according to agreed standards, procedures and KPIs. Maintain desktops, laptops, printers, tablet, desk phone , handhelds, mobile phones and peripheral equipment.


Accountabilities


  • Provides full-cycle technical support of IT equipment (as a smart hands): acceptance from the supplier, commissioning, delivery to users, repair through authorized service centers, utilization.
  • Represents of IT Operations on a site, manages regional specific Field Service operations (i.e. walk-in, ticket logging, trouble-shouting, support, reporting, customer satisfaction, major incident resolution).
  • Initiates OS and equipment refreshes per approved cycles.
  • Perform stocktaking activities, coordinate overall IT asset accounting (equipment receipt, issuing, internal transfer, disposals, utilization, etc.)
  • Smartphones purchase with mobile phone provider tools , phones provisioning , manage stock and warranty RMA for Smartphones and support for 150 Tablets\HHC, manage and control packages on mobile phones.


Qualifications


Key Skills/Experience Required


  • Good understanding of IT infrastructure, End User Computing, PC, Security Tools, Smartphones, Compute, Network infrastructure
  • Be a result-driven, communicative person who can work independent / remotely from a manager.
  • Strong teamwork, customer oriented
  • Supplier management experience (Basic level)
  • Effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
  • Process orientated mindset - experience with ServiceNow, toolset (or similar) is an asset.
  • Ability to translate and present complex technical information/solutions into end-user language
  • Experience working within an international organization
  • Team player


Educational Background


  • Ideally educated to degree level or equivalent standard (IT preferable)
  • B2 – Intermediate Level English (communication skills) mandatory – high level preferred
  • Certification in ITIL Foundations preferred
  • Certification in Networks would be considered as a plus
  • Driver’s license - preferred

Title: IT Field Analyst (outsourced)
Skills: Communication|Cybersecurity Tools|End User Training|Key Performance Indicators|Mobile Telephony|Service Operations|ServiceNow|Smartphones|Supplier Management|Technical Support|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


A day in the life of a Technical Project Manager


As a Technical Project Manager, you will be part of a vibrant and highly skilled agile team that designs, develop, deploy, customize, and support our IT projects while you will have the opportunity to be exposed to a wide variety of services and technologies.


Your main duties will be to:


  • Perform project management for multiple projects, including, planning, the definition of tasks and deliverables, review of project deliverables, quality control, risk analysis & management, status reports, problem reporting & management, follow up
  • Draft project management deliverables such as the Business Case, Project Strategy or Vision documents
  • Develop a detailed project plan and track activities against plan providing regular, accurate, and timely reports
  • Participate in functional and technical working groups and progress meetings
  • Ensure delivery of projects on time, within the scope, and within budget; manage successfully any changes that may arise. Manage and minimize the potential risks of the projects
  • Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation
  • Coordinate effectively the project team (including external stakeholders) ensuring that team members are motivated
  • Act as liaison with the customer and sub-contractors


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, the leading IT company in Greece, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe. 


Qualifications


If you have:


  • Degree in Management or Finance or Information Technology or other relevant disciplines
  • Experience in Insurance services
  • Problem-solving mindset and adaptability
  • Customer, Quality and Results-oriented approach
  • Good communication skills and Teamworking spirit
  • Excellent command of the English language (written & oral)


…then this position is suitable for you!


It would also be a plus if you had:


  • Commercial awareness
  • A PMI Certification


This position comes with


  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business) and fast career growth
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values:


Be the link of a great team that forms a unique network across departments, countries and business units and operates with trust, open communication, transparency and respect.


We make it happen with our expertise, accountability and solution-driven attitude. We always strive for improvement, always with an eye on the big picture.


We learn & evolve by embracing a culture of building on our experiences, sharing our knowledge and developing our skills. We are always open to new ideas and invite all our colleagues to contribute with theirs.


We fuel creativity in every aspect of our everyday life at Netcompany - Intrasoft; in the solutions and products we design and the initiatives we undertake.


We share customer success by understanding their unique needs, corresponding to their vision, and exceeding their expectations.


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Job Description:
About the job

Role purpose:
Do you wish to create design technical specifications and high-quality solutions that meet Vodafone reporting requirements; If yes, then become member of our Information Technology Team, driving transformation solutions across Vodafone.


The Analytics & Billing Engineer is end to end accountable for the design and delivery of BI projects.

Key accountabilities and decision ownership:
  • Review requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations
  • Work closely with Project Managers and external suppliers to develop detailed specification documents with clear project deliverables and timelines and to ensure the timely completion of deliverables
  • Define appropriate architecture and other technical solutions and make recommendations to Business
  • Support colleagues to identify emerging technologies or applications and consider the opportunity to integrate them into operations and activities
  • Responsible for all test & development environments required for project delivery
  • Estimate tasks required to complete various development projects including time and resources
  • Estimate tasks required to complete various development projects including time and resources

Core competencies and knowledge:
  • At least 2 years of work experience in a similar position, preferably in the Telecommunications and Information Technology field
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and Oracle database design
  • Experience handling large data sets using SQL and databases in a business environment
  • Knowledge of OLAP technologies and BI Analytics, along with understanding different data warehousing and dimensional modelling concepts
  • Knowledge of the following tools: SAP BO, Oracle ODI
  • Knowledge of the Telco Industry and its products
  • Knowledge of Data streaming technologies (Kafka, Spark Streaming) will be appreciated
  • Higher education in Computer Science or a related field

Behaviours and other competencies:
  • Ability to influence and collaborate with vendors & suppliers
  • Solid analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Self – motivated with strong time & priorities management skills
  • Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills
  • Promoter of cooperation and commitment within a team to achieve goals and deliverables
  • Management of own time, priorities, and resources to achieve goals
  • Excellent written and verbal communication. skills in both Greek & English

What's in it for you:
  •   Competitive pay, bonus & remuneration package
  • Private Health & Medical Insurance
  • Hybrid way of working: a blend of remote and office-based working, including the option to work up to 20 days from abroad
  •   Remote work equipment to help you create a comfortable, ergonomic workspace at home 
  •   Unlimited access to learning resources and trainings
  •   Vodafone Parental Leave: 16 weeks of fully paid parental leave to all employees regardless of gender, sexual orientation or length of service
  •   Spirit of Vodafone Day: one day each quarter dedicated to your personal development
  •   Extra days off: Vodafone Day, Family Day, Volunteering Day 
  •   Needless to say, we cater for your communication wherever you are
  • Office amenities (subject to the office location): such as restaurant, beauty corner, gym and parking
  • Special employee offers and discounts

Title: Analytics & Billing Engineer

Job Description:
About the job

Excelya, one of the leading independent CRO in Europe.


Created in 2014, Excelya is a people-centered Contract Research Organization (CRO) that excels with care.


We offer a personal and authentic experience within a young, ambitious health company on the path to becoming the clinical research leader in Europe thanks to our 800 Excelyates. Our unique one-stop provider service model - leveraging full-service, functional service provider and consulting - allows our Excelyates to evolve through a diverse array of projects. In collaboration with preeminent experts, Excelya advances scientific, managerial and human knowledge to improve the patient journey.


For our team members, excelling with care means benefitting from a stimulating professional environment that encourages personal, intellectual, and operational participation so that together we can be the best in our field. We commit to giving each Excelyate the means to express their natural talents, develop their full potential and invest their unique selves in our unique project.

To learn more about us, visit www.excelya.com


What we Offer:


  • Quick growth and opportunity for leadership positions – Lead CRA, Line Manager and many more
  • Highly competitive remuneration package
  • Company car
  • Mobile phone/internet
  • Laptop
  • Medical private insurance
  • Food vouchers


Essential Functions:

Accompanied by Project Managers, the Clinical Research Associate will be responsible for performing the following tasks:


  • Monitoring of international clinical trials on phases I to IV
  • Conduct monitoring of clinical studies
  • Ensure the monitoring and scientific, technical and regulatory quality of international studies
  • Perform investigational product ( IP) inventory, reconciliation and reviews storage and security. Verifies the IP has been dispensed and administrated to the subjects / patients according to the protocol. Verifies issues or risks associated with blinded or randomized information related to IP. Applies knowledge of GCP / local regulations and organizational procedures to ensure IP is appropriately re( labelled), imported and released / returned.
  • Routinely reviews the Investigator Site File ( ISF) for accuracy, timeliness and completeness. Reconciles contents of the ISF with the Trial Master File ( TMF). Ensures the investigator / physician site is aware of the requirement of archiving essential documents in accordance with local guidelines and regulations
  • Contribute to the administrative missions required to set up and monitor clinical studies
  • Carry out monitoring and co-monitoring visits with local CRAs to ensure the quality of the data collected, source documents and archiving of investigative documents
  • Interpret the information collected by the various stakeholders in the study and contribute to the implementation of corrective or preventive actions if necessary
  • Be in contact with the study investigators
  • Revise the study sites if necessary
  • Prepare the centers and contribute to the audits and inspections
  • Write visit reports in English
  • Ensure the traceability of the deviations encountered according to a CAPA procedure


Education and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in a life science- related field
  • A minimum of 1 or 2 years' experience in monitoring activities as a CRA within the international clinical trials in the pharmaceutical industry
  • Knowledge of Good Clinical Practice / ICH Guidelines and other applicable regulatory timelines
  • Knowledge of the following systems: E-TMF, E-CRF
  • A mastery of Risk-Based Monitoring (remote visit)
  • Excellent communication , presentation and interpersonal skills
  • Fluency in written and oral English essential.

Title: Clinical Research Associate II

Job Description:
About the job

Η εταιρία D.Nomikos SA, που δραστηριοποίεται πάνω από 100 έτη στη βιομηχανία τροφίμων με τρείς εργοστασιακές εγκαταστάσεις εντός ελλαδικού χώρου, αναζητά ένα στέλεχος πληροφορικής , που θα ενταχθεί στο δυναμικό της , ώστε να βοηθήσει στην ανάπτυξη, τη συντήρηση και την αντιμετώπιση προβλημάτων της υποδομής μηχανοργάνωσης της .

Αρμοδιότητες
• Διαχείριση και παρακολούθηση όλων των εγκατεστημένων συστημάτων
• Εγκατάσταση, διαμόρφωση, συντήρηση λειτουργικών συστημάτων, τόσο διακομιστών όσο και τερματικών .
• Εγκατάσταση και διαχείρηση εφαρμογών λογισμικού και αντίστοιχων εργαλείων
• Διαχείριση των διαθέσιμων firewall clusters , VPNs και συστημάτων antivirus.
• Χρήση εργαλείων παρακολούθησης για την βελτίωση επιδόσεων προσδιορισμός πιθανών λύσεων και συνεργασία με τους προγραμματιστές για την υλοποίηση αυτών των διορθώσεων
• Διαμόρφωση , εφαρμογή και διατήρηση στρατηγικών ασφάλειας (π.χ παρακολούθηση της σωστής εφαρμογής της πολιτικής για τη δημιουργία αντιγράφων ασφαλείας ή του Business continuity plan)
• Συμμετοχή στον σχεδιασμό πληροφοριακών συστημάτων και συστημάτων λειτουργικής υποστήριξης
• Επικοινωνία με προμηθευτές , εταιρίες-συνεργάτες πληροφορικής και λοιπό προσωπικό ΙΤ για την επίλυση προβλημάτων
Απαιτήσεις
• Πτυχίο Πληροφορικής ή σχετικού πεδίου
• 3+έτη εργασιακή εμπειρία στην εγκατάσταση, τη διαμόρφωση και την αντιμετώπιση προβλημάτων σε εταιρικά περιβάλλοντα
• Εμπειρία στη σχεδίαση , διαχείριση και καλή γνώση περιβάλοντος windows active directory
• Windows Servers (2012R2, 2016,2019)
• Windows 10
• Εμπειρία στο Cloud (Aws, Microsoft Azure , etc)
• Εμπειρία σε τεχνολογίες virtualization (π.χ VMWARE Vsphere, Microsoft Hyper-V)
• Εμπειρία σε email servers (Ms Exchange, Kerio , etc)
• Εμπειρία σε antispam technologies
• Εμπειρία σε εγκαταστάσεις υλικού (hardware)
• Εμπειρία σε διαχείρηση ενεργού δικτυακού εξοπλισμού (firewalls, switches)
• Professional certifications, θα θεωρηθούν πλεονέκτημα π.χ :
• Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE)
• VMWARE VCTA OR VCP
• Cisco CCNA
• CompTIA A+
• ITIL
• Γνώση κάποιας γλώσσας προγραμματισμού scripting (π.χ. powershell , Python)
• Πολύ καλή γνώση λογισμικού γραφείου (Microsoft Office, ERP)
• Διαχείριση χρόνου, οργανωτικές δεξιότητες, ιεράρχηση προτεραιοτήτων
• Πολύ καλή γνώση της Αγγλικής Γλώσσας
• Επικοινωνιακές δεξιότητες
• Δυνατότητα μετακίνησης για την κάλυψη αναγκών των εργοστασίων

Title: Information Technology Specialist
Job Description:
About the job

Location: Athens (Greece)

Job type: Permanent, Full time

About The Opportunity

As Franchise Head, you will define the Franchise strategy, aligned to organization’s strategic priorities, ensuring execution of strategic and tactical planning including currently marketed products and any future products in this therapy area.

About Growing With Us – In This Role You Will

  • Hold Franchise P&L, lead sales forecasting and resource allocation across country
  • Lead and empower the Franchise Team and enable strong cross functional and agile Ways-of-working providing strategic guidance and vision
  • Develop data-driven directions that drive greater customer and market understanding, empower launch strategies, lead to business development opportunities, and help meet commercial objectives
  • Support brand team to develop & execute Brand strategy and tactical plan in close cooperation with cross-functional team members
  • Monitor market trends and developments, market research studies and KPIs (sales, market share, sales force effectiveness, etc.) to drive improvements in business and customer experience. Assess effectiveness develop and implement strategy / tactics adjustment
  • Prepare and support launch readiness and business cases in collaboration with region
  • Build and lead the implementation of the cross-functional franchise tactics, from market access to commercial success
  • Focus on external engagement by developing professional partnerships with key stakeholders. Focus on internal engagement by building network with key stakeholders at above country level enabling optimal patient access to therapies and outstanding services to customers
  • Cultivate a culture of continuous learning and experimentation, support team members on capability building, build a growth mindset culture with a deep focus on reinventing the customer engagement model
  • Focus on Sales Force coaching and development
  • Encourage & foster best practice sharing among countries & franchises & scaling up campaigns & projects
  • Ensure alignment among the Franchise team members, delegate tasks and responsibility to appropriate personnel, match skills and abilities to maximize effectiveness
  • Drive transformation based on SPC global guidelines. Serve as role-model in terms of customer orientation, to develop a high performing customer centric organization
  • Lead local divestments and participate in global divestment projects

About you: qualifications, education and work experience

  • Degree in Marketing, Economics, Health Economics, management engineering or equivalent
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in pharmaceutical commercial roles – previous experience in Specialty Care roles will be an advantage
  • Marketing skills - Brand planning/execution across all channels (omnichannel)
  • Sales skills focused on leading & empowering sales team
  • Launch experience – preferably from more markets
  • Demonstrated understanding of business environment
  • Ability to cultivate effective relationships, and to influence and collaborate internally and externally at all organizational levels
  • Resilience, rigor, reliability, and discretion
  • Good analytics, structure & synthesis skills; capability to deal with a vast number of information and prioritize according to business relevance
  • Humility, not driven by personal agenda
  • Self-driven, Results-oriented; Demonstrate a high-level drive, passion, and ambition for optimal results
  • Experience of managing effective business transformation
  • Skills for people development, high performing team formulation
  • Develop fresh approaches to deliver results

Inspire your journey - what Sanofi can offer you:

  • An international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent team
  • An attractive, market-oriented salary aligned with your qualifications
  • An individual and well-structured introduction and training of new employees
  • Professional career opportunities in dynamically developing working environments
  • As a globally successful and constantly growing company, Sanofi provides international career paths as well

If the description fits your experience and has captured your interest, please apply so we can get in contact with you!

Discover our Code of Conduct, that serves as the moral compass that guides us when chasing the miracles of science to improve people’s lives. Please ensure to have read this document, before applying.

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

Job Description:
About the job

AGEMAR ESTATES SΑ, a property holding company and part of the Angelicoussis Group, is looking for an experienced and motivated Energy Infrastructure & Maintenance Engineer.


Key Responsibilities

  • Monitors the building maintenance programme and suggests ideas to improve consumption and achieve energy savings;
  • Controls and analyses energy consumption data in the building;
  • Inspects and oversees energy systems, including heating, ventilation, air conditioning (HVAC) & lighting systems to determine energy usage or potential energy savings;
  • Manages the control systems of the building's facilities (BMS, Fire detection, CO, etc.);
  • Participates in all responsibilities, procedures and obligations of the Maintenance department;
  • Plans and supervises the construction and maintenance of building structures and facilities;
  • Reviews architectural, mechanical, or electrical designs and specifications to evaluate energy efficiency or determine economic and engineering feasibility;
  • Coordinates technicians’ teams;
  • Selects and inspects equipment for the building;


Candidate must have:

  • University degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering
  • 2+ years of experience in a similar position or in the supervision of construction and/or maintenance of large buildings
  • Excellent computer skills
  • Very good knowledge of AutoCAD and energy applications
  • Fluency in the English Language (written and oral)
  • Good communication skills


The Company offers an attractive compensation and benefits package, as well as career opportunities. All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Job Description:
About the job

Hi, this is the first step in your adidas journey. For more than 70 years we've been creating the best sports gear and inspiring millions of people to change their lives through sport. Our core value is people. adidas is a team of rebellious optimists. We lead an active lifestyle, creating innovations to balance sports and nature, looking at the world without borders or prejudice, and inspiring change in our customers. Retail stores are the first point of contact with our consumers and the heart of adidas brand. Want to be a part of the ride? Join us now!

We Offer
  • Competitive compensation & rewards (bonuses, referral program, etc.).
  • Free uniform sets twice a year.
  • Discount on adidas products online and in all own stores.

  • Private life and medical insurance.
  • Pension plan.

Employees Appreciate In Us
  • Supportive team that accompanies you all the way in the company and inspires you to win new challenges.

About the job

Description - External


The Ford Pro Software Onboarding Team Lead is responsible for the supervision of the customer onboarding team and provides support for operational initiatives, which include: identifying process improvement initiatives in the onboarding process, analysis of customer contact and escalation data, identification of workforce gaps and resolution, and presenting recommended action plans to the FPS Operations Manager based upon research performed. The post holder is required to be a Subject Matter Expert about the client’s relevant products and services, proactively keeping their own knowledge, and the team’s knowledge, up to date and accurate to provide a first -lass customer onboarding experience.


Additionally, the Onboarding Team Lead will lead their team to high levels of customer satisfaction for all assigned program activities; this will include assisting employees with escalated onboarding challenges and questions providing guidance to the team member and/or assisting with the training/contact to ensure best outcome for the customer.


Responsibilities
  • Analyze and prioritize tasks for employees. Maintain employee workloads to ensure customer onboarding requirements are met.
  • Manage the onboarding call flow processes.
  • Interact with Business Partners as needed including:
    • Attend Business Partner meetings to resolve issues and discuss program changes and enhancements.
    • Handle special Business Partner report requests.
    • Keep abreast of anticipated program launches and changes.
    • Inform Manager on all Business Partner interaction.

    • Set up for all new hires (ID's and cubicles).
    • Maintain discussion logs.
    • Managing attendance.
    • Administer disciplinary action as necessary.
    • Recognize and reward excellent team performance.
    • Employee engagement and moral building.
    • Time sheet approval and submit corrections timely.
    • All other matters as it relates to daily management of the staff.
  • Work with Operations Manager on monthly business reports and process improvement initiatives as needed.
  • Evaluate and coach back customer service skills in quality assurance process.
  • Be a Subject Matter Expert about the client’s relevant products and services and proactively keep knowledge up to date with current and future enhancements/changes
  • Ensure employees have the necessary training and job aids to perform their job responsibilities.
  • Strive to continuously improve Touchpoint and Pulse Survey results and employee satisfaction.
  • Be visible and available, interacting with the team as much as possible through team meetings, walking the floor, one-on-one meetings, etc.
  • Adhere to and support all Percepta and Business Partner quality initiatives, systems and policies.
  • Support all Percepta Contact-Centre policies and procedures.
  • Attend and participate in team meetings and Team Leader meetings.
  • Communicate and generate enthusiasm and commitment for a positive work environment that fosters team performance.
  • Complete training courses as directed by Operations and/or Learning & Development.
  • Maintain professional working relationships.
  • Complete additional tasks / projects as needed.


Systems Support


  • Collaborate with multiple IT teams to ensure successful team deployment of new systems or current system enhancements.
  • Perform user acceptance testing of system enhancements.
  • Respond to inquiries regarding system errors, functionality, and enhancements.
  • Propose new enhancements based on observations, and experience with the applicable processes.


Education


  • Further Education college or similar: A Levels/ Highers/ ONC


Experience


  • Must have experience in managing and coaching others and improving individual and team performance in a call centre environment
  • Outsourced Inbound Contact Centre or Case Management experience would be an advantage.
  • Through understanding of contact center technologies, CRM systems and their respective reporting systems – preferred.


Skills


  • Ability to lead and motivate teams towards quality, quantity and development objectives, achieving required results as agreed with the client.
  • Ability to monitor, give feedback and appraise direct reports, driving increased performance and achievement of objectives.
  • Demonstrate initiative in leading the team and be seen to be a driving force within the centre, role modeling behavior in line with the Percepta Values.
  • Able to meet targets and handle a high pressure environment through leading and managing others.
  • Excellent computer literacy., proficient Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).
  • Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Excellent time management, planning and organisational skills.
  • Ability to break down silos and building cross team and brand relationships.
  • Highly developed interpersonal skills and an understanding of what motivates people to commit and perform.
  • Recognize the importance of balancing tasks (getting the job done) and people - ensuring that team members are focused on their performance.
  • Exhibit patience and tolerance and make decisions without prejudice.
  • Demonstrate dependability by completing assignments and meeting commitments.
  • Ability to perform in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.
  • Good facilitation, negotiation and presentation skills.
  • Understand the need for flexibility and strong team leadership when communicating and implementing change.
  • Detail-oriented with strong organisational skills, time management and planning.
  • Self-starter who demonstrates a high level of initiative, resourcefulness and ability to work independently and interdependently among a team.
  • Must represent Percepta professionally with all clients and external organizations and contacts.


Physical and Logistical Requirements (Including equipment used)

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus, computer skills.

  • Telephone

Greece-Attica-Athens

Title: Onboarding Team Lead
Skills: Coaching|Contact Centers|Customer Contact|Customer Onboarding|FPS|Job Aids|Meeting Commitments|Negotiation|Team Motivation|Team Performance|
Job Description:
About the job

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


The opportunity


We are currently seeking highly motivated people to join the Technology Consulting practice in our Consulting Service Line, which is a leading provider of professional services to clients of all major industries.


Working together, we help clients better assess and improve their operations, grow revenue and manage risks to increase shareholder value. You will build valued relationships with clients and other members of our team and focus on high-impact opportunities and projects.


Your Key Responsibilities


  • Project management including proposals for project strategies, planning, definition of tasks and deliverables, quality control, risk analysis and management, status reports, problem reporting and management systems, follow up and organization.
  • Guide project activities and review deliverables as applicable.
  • Participate in functional and technical working groups and progress meetings, collaborate effectively with project stakeholders in Waterfall or Agile or hybrid delivery environments.
  • Estimate costs, timescales and resource requirements for the successful completion of each project to agreed terms of reference.
  • Prepare and maintain project and quality plans and tracks activities against the plan, provide regular and accurate reports.
  • Monitor costs, timescales and resources used, and take action where these deviate from agreed tolerances. Ensure that delivered IT systems/solutions are implemented within these criteria.
  • Manage the change control procedure gaining agreement for revisions to the project from project sponsors.


To qualify for the role you must have


  • University degree in a relevant subject.
  • 2- 10 years of professional experience in IT Solutions Project Management.
  • Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills in Greek and English.
  • Good knowledge of English, both written and verbal.
  • Willingness to learn and continuously expand technical and business skills
  • Travelling availability and potential work on projects abroad.
  • Completed military obligations (where applicable).
  • Proven experience in managing the full life-cycle (all phases) of an IT project
  • Knowledge and experience with Waterfall and/or Agile and/or hybrid delivery methodologies
  • Experience in an Agile team role (e.g. Scrum Master, Product Owner, Tribe/Chapter Lead, Release Train Engineer) would be an additional asset although not a prerequisite
  • Very good MS- Project and MS-Office skills; JIRA tool skills are desirable
  • Project Management and/or Agile certifications are desirable


What We Look For


What’s most important is that you’re dedicated to working with your colleagues as part of a high-performing team. You’ll need to demonstrate enthusiasm, high motivation and passion to develop fast in a multinational working environment. You’ll need to thrive in picking up new skills and talents as you go, so natural curiosity, a lot of questions and the confidence to speak up when you see something that could be improved are essential. If you’ve got the right combination of technical knowledge and communication skills, this role is for you.


What We Offer


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:


  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.


EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Job Description:
About the job

Έχεις εμπειρία ως Βοηθός Φαρμακείου και θες να κάνεις το επόμενο βήμα σου στο χώρο του φαρμακείου; Αναζητούμε Βοηθό Φαρμακείου για φαρμακείο υψηλής επισκεψιμότητας στο Κολωνάκι.

Αν σε ενδιαφέρει να γίνεις μέλος μιας δυναμικής ομάδας, τότε κάνε την αίτησή σου στην παρακάτω αγγελία για τη θέση του Βοηθού Φαρμακείου !


Αρμοδιότητες

Οι αρμοδιότητες της θέσης του/της Βοηθού Φαρμακείου περιλαμβάνουν:

  • Παροχή υψηλού επιπέδου άμεσης και έμμεσης εξυπηρέτησης των πελατών στο κατάστημα
  • Διασφάλιση της βέλτιστης παρουσίασης των προϊόντων και των προωθητικών ενεργειών στο κατάστημα
  • Φροντίδα για την τήρηση της ασφάλειας και υγιεινής στο χώρο εργασίας.
  • Συμμετοχή στον έλεγχο και τη διαχείριση των αποθεμάτων
  • Πλήρωση ραφιών με εμπορεύματα


Προσόντα

Ο ιδανικός/η υποψήφιος/α για τη θέση του/της Βοηθού Φαρμακείου θα πρέπει να διαθέτει:

  • Ιδανικά πτυχίο στην ειδικότητα Βοηθών Φαρμακείων
  • Γνώση Αγγλικών
  • Άριστη χρήση Η/Υ


Εμπειρία

  • τουλάχιστον ένα χρόνο προυπηρεσία σε φαρμακείο


Παροχές

Για τη θέση του/της Βοηθού Φαρμακείου προσφέρονται:

  • Εξαιρετικές συνθήκες εργασίας σε αξιοκρατικό περιβάλλον
  • Ανταγωνιστικές αποδοχές


Πληροφορίες

Vasia Christodoulou

6941411215


Παρακαλούμε λάβετε υπόψη ότι για λόγους διαφάνειας και ισότιμης μεταχείρισης, θα αξιολογήσουμε μόνο τις αιτήσεις που υποβάλλονται μέσω του site μας. Μετά τη συλλογή και αξιολόγηση όλων των βιογραφικών σημειωμάτων θα επικοινωνούμε μόνο με τους/τις υποψηφίους/ες που ανταποκρίνονται στις απαιτήσεις της θέσης προς στελέχωση προκειμένου να οριστεί συνάντηση για συνέντευξη. Όλες οι αιτήσεις θεωρούνται απόλυτα εμπιστευτικές.

Title: Βοηθός Φαρμακείου
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany - Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with a strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: https://www.netcompany-intrasoft.com


Job Description


As a Senior Full-Stack Developer, you will be based in Athens, working for international projects of Netcompany. You will take part in the development of some of Denmark's most complex and exciting IT solutions, where the combination of software development, task management, and customer contact will be part of your everyday life.


You will be responsible for having an overview of the sub-project, including daily stand-ups, and status reporting with the customer and/or the project manager. You will find it natural to assume leadership in relation to your team members, as in the role of an experienced IT Consultant there will quickly be team management tasks.


This responsibility is reflected in the fact that you delegate tasks to each team member, keeping track of whether someone is stuck and needs a helping hand. There will always be a project manager associated with the project with the overall delivery responsibility, which you can lean on and learn from, so you become even better when it comes to management and IT deliveries.


You will be part of a high-performing international team, consisting of professionals that have different backgrounds and competencies – common to all of us is that we prioritize professionalism highly and take pride in developing the best IT solutions together. Our tasks include some of Denmark's most important and exciting IT projects, within the state, municipalities, and the Danish business community.


Your tasks will involve:


  • System development - both front-end, back-end, and integrations
  • Planning of workflows
  • Process optimization and quality assurance
  • Translating customer requirements into the design of new features
  • Daily sparring with your team to ensure a high technical and business level


Qualifications


It is important that you have your technical toolbox in order, while at the same time feeling motivated to handle management tasks.


In addition, we imagine that you:


  • Have experience with either Java, .Net, C#, python, node.js, JavaScript, etc.
  • Has developed and delivered major IT solutions
  • Have an interest in project management and see your career going in that direction
  • Min. 4 years of experience in the IT industry, as well as a relevant IT degree


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Senior Full-Stack Developer
Skills: Back-End Web Development|Customer Contact|Customer Requirements|Front-End Development|Full-Stack Development|Optimization|Project Reporting|Quality Assurance|Software Development|System Development|
Job Description:
About the job

Location: Greece, Patras


Talent Area: Product Development/Engineering


Job posting title: Lead SW Engineer / Systems Performance


Position Summary


You will join a team of experienced and talented system software engineers based in Patras, Greece, with years of history delivering high-quality carrier and enterprise grade products, in a fast-paced business environment, and will have the potential to collaborate with fellow engineering teams across the globe.


The Lead Performance Engineer will envision, design, develop, execute, monitor, analyze and maintain system performance enhancements, performance profiling and tests, performance characterization solutions and automation for our core networking product - NetScaler.


Demonstrates expertise and tenacity in root-causing performance bottlenecks and treats the product as a white box for isolating and/or fixing associated defects. Uses clear, concise, logical steps and excellent judgment to understand the performance issue before trying to tackle it. Reaches solutions by clear-cut, methodical approaches or more creative and lateral angles. Is able to make low level code changes into the system and observe/optimize performance.


This position requires passion for designing and building excellent, performance-tuned code for systems and offers the opportunity to increase your skills and competencies to new levels. Our market leadership and large installed customer base also present a unique opportunity to experience real-life field deployments and problem-solving techniques that will become an invaluable individual career asset. You will own (multi) platform performance improvements for cornerstone networking functionality of the NetScaler product line and design/execute realistic load testing scenarios for our on-prem or on-cloud releases. You will also have the opportunity to design and execute performance comparison activities vs all key competitors. This is a position with high visibility across the organization that will give you the opportunity to make significant contributions to our product while working with a multitude of teams, across geographies, on a variety of projects.


Responsibilities


  • Identify, track and quantify system limitations & performance issues
  • Troubleshoot performance related bottlenecks and provide solutions for dealing with them
  • Ideate and drive forward themes for further performance improvements of the NetSaler product suite, ranging from platform level optimizations, to feature level enhancements. Coordinate with fellow teams across Geo’s in planning and implementing said improvements
  • Participate in performance analysis and discovery sessions with Customers, Product Management, Support, fellow Engineering teams
  • Coordinate, orchestrate and review functional and technical specifications, as well as create/execute test cases, test plans and automation scripts
  • Review capacity plans and production usage trends, assisting product and engineering teams to create suitable real-world usage profiles and baselines
  • Perform breakpoint analysis to ensure acceptable levels of performance
  • Cross check across time and releases in order to identify potential problems, omissions, and open issues
  • Present clear metrics to both technical and non-technical staff
  • Own the projects, from start to finish, with minimal supervision
  • Work under accelerated software development cycles, and help ensure that shipped products meet rigorous standards of quality and are delivered on time


Qualifications And Requirements


The position requires a Performance Engineer and/or Software engineer professional, with 4-8 years of related work experience in software requirements, design, development and maintenance, preferably in Linux. At least 3 years of work experience is required for Individuals holding a M.Sc. in Computer Science or related discipline (2 year for Ph.D.) with a specialization relevant to our product lines and/or processes.


Essential Requirements


  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline
  • Relevant experience with low level system improvements, performance or/and scaling enhancements
  • Prior experience to system level testing, performance, capacity, longevity testing
  • Programming experience (mid-level to senior) - C
  • Unix knowledge (mid-level to senior)
  • Excellent TCP/IP networking skills and related protocols knowledge
  • Proven analytical skills for data-driven decision-making with emphasis to operational efficacy
  • Relentless and tenacious approach when pursuing product issues to their root cause
  • Ability to work well with engineering and non-engineering personnel
  • Excellent verbal and written Greek and English communication skills
  • Proficient at multitasking in a highly dynamic, fast-paced environment
  • Ability to work independently without supervision


Desirable attributes


  • Exposure to cloud services: OpenStack/AWS/Azure/Google Cloud
  • Containers / Kubernetes
  • Python / Scripting programming experience
  • Relevant knowledge of performance testing tooling. E.g. Spirent, IXIA, T-Rex, Netropy, etc.
  • Virtualization experience with XenServer, VMware or KVM


Cloud Software Group is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status, and other protected classifications.

Title: Lead SW Engineer / Systems Performance

Job Description:
About the job

MAS S.A. is a niche European company in the Energy Sector, specializing in the design, development and deployment of advanced Automation, Control, Protection and Supervisory systems with focus on the Power Production, Heavy Industry, Oil & Gas, Marine & Transport sectors.

Headquartered in Athens Greece, MAS operates in over 25 countries, covering a wide geographical area that spreads from Eastern Europe and the Russian Federation to the Balkans, Turkey, and parts of Asia.


We are looking for a high potential and experienced Sales Engineer (focus Marine Industry), with proven experience in the marine sector and high passion for sales, to join our Control Systems Business Unit.


The ideal candidate would be responsible for selling into new prospects as well as farming back into existing customers to ensure high renewal and customer satisfaction levels.


Responsibilities
  • Support existing and bring in new customers.
  • Follow company’s visit plan and propose alterations if needed.
  • Support sales activity with technical oriented solution selling into prospect account base.
  • Continuous prospects’ analysis and development of new ideas for sales promotion.
  • Inquiry evaluation - Preparation, Drafting and follow-up on offers and negotiations.
  • Competition assessment.
  • Partner with sales executives to plan, prepare and execute on key deals for the company.
  • Successfully match customer needs and requirements to proposed solutions. Manage all technical aspects as per customers ‘requests.
  • Create and deliver powerful presentations and demos with a clear message regarding the uniqueness of our Sales proposition.
  • Participation in Trade fairs and Industry Sector Events.


Requirements and skills
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering
  • MSc or MBA will be considered a plus
  • Minimum 5-6 years of proven work experience as a Sales Engineer in the maritime market
  • Experience on engaging with B2B customers and long-term relationship building
  • Ability to forge strong, long-lasting relationships with senior executives
  • Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in control systems.
  • Ability to discuss highly technical concepts with prospective leads
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Negotiation skills
  • Excellent written and verbal Greek and English language
  • Excellent Command of English language and Greek language
  • Excellent presentation skills
  • Excellent PC skills (MS Office, ERP systems)
  • Availability to travel (20% to 30% of your time)


Benefits
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Private Health Care Insurance
  • Company benefits
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities
  • Stable, long-term cooperation


Join us at https://www.maseurope.com/control-systems/ to learn more about us.

If you are interested, please send us your cv at career@maseurope.com, mentioning Code SE2023

About the job

Testing Engineer (Automation) | Full-time contract | Athens - GR


Your daily work routine will include:

  • Automate test cases by using Robot Framework;
  • Coordinate the Test Strategy and Test Plan;
  • Define and execute Test Cases and prepare Test Data;
  • Search, monitor, and analyze machine-generated results and log files;
  • Communicate with users and oversee testing, where appropriate;
  • Log issues in JIRA or the Quality Center;
  • Investigate reported issues and ensure they are followed-up;
  • Monitor Test Results and check their Exit Criteria;
  • Ensure that documentation is available, complete and to a high standard;
  • Validate data by writing SQL queries is considered as an asset.


Requirements

  • University degree in Information Technology;
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in software testing including Automated Testing;
  • Proven track record in managing UAT, writing Test Reports, creating Test Plans, as well as, defining Test Cases and Test Scripts;
  • Extensive working knowledge in SQL and XML;
  • Proven track record with tools like Robot Framework, Linux, Git-Bitbucket, JIRA, docker;
  • Understanding of the Agile Software Development methodologies;
  • Experience in Python coding is considered as an asset;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (B2 or higher);
  • Good team spirit and accountable for working in a multi-cultural and international environment.


What is in it for you?

  • A permanent contract with a compensation package that includes private medical insurance, meal vouchers, mobile plan, etc.
  • Learning opportunities, in-house trainings, continuous coaching.
  • Fun, respectful and supportive work environment that promotes work-life balance.
  • Mobility opportunities to work abroad, in case of interest, as we have various job openings in our Group.


Why Trasys Greece?

  • Strong team spirit attitude.
  • Dynamic, intelligent, agile and talented teams.
  • Large-scale challenging international projects.
  • Allows you to take the ownership of your work from the beginning, having specific responsibilities.
  • Active and meaningfully present in various IT communities (MoT, Angular, JHUG, etc.).
