Job Description:
About the job

Shell & MOH Aviation Fuels A.E is the Marketing Joint Venture established by Shell Overseas Holdings Ltd (51%) and Motor Oil (Hellas) Corinth Refineries S.A (49%) with scope the marketing and supply of Aviation Fuels under Shell trademark in Greece. Nowadays, with presence in 21 airports in Greece and Bulgaria, Shell & MOH Aviation has a leading position in the domestic market. We strive to develop our people to their highest potential, through continuous education and assignment of challenging projects.


Currently, we are seeking to hire a Supply Operator based in Marousi.


More specifically:


Main responsibilities

  • Monitors and improves manuals, processes, and procedures of the Supply & Operations department
  • Closes communication with the Customs offices in all Supply locations (Terminals and Airports)
  • Manages all Customs Brokers agreements in line with their relevant obligations and legal/fiscal tax warehouses requirements
  • Responsible for duties payment and VAT refund processes
  • Manages BP accounts (supplier and customer) – supply purchases and sales in all relevant Airport locations within Greece
  • Supports Business projects and Operational strategy plan and their implementation
  • Creates and updates related supply and operations KPI’s, creates and monitors POs, invoices, and their reconciliation.
  • Responsible for monthly finance closure activities, invoices checking/matching and provisions
  • Back-up of supply scheduling and operations (incl. third party purchases, Shipping and Road Transport)

Qualifications / Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree Engineering or Finance with focused expertise in Operations, Supply Chain, Business, or another relevant field
  • Master’s degree in related discipline will be considered an asset
  • At least 3 years of related working experience (supply chain, scheduling, operations)
  • Proficient use of SAP, MS Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint
  • Knowledge of IT tools and processes
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills both in Greek and English
  • The role requires limited traveling, mainly within Greece (Greek Airports)

Key skills/attributes

  • Communication and interpersonal skills
  • Analytical skills, attention to detail and accuracy
  • Organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines

Title: Supply Operator
Skills: Analytical Skills|Communication|English|Finance|Interpersonal Skills|Microsoft Excel|Microsoft PowerPoint|SAP Products|Time Management|Written Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

With more than 20 years of proven experience, QUALCO is a leading Fintech solutions provider, offering a wide range of analytics-driven, highly scalable enterprise software solutions in over 35 countries worldwide. Our end-to-end technology solutions cover a wide range of needs for Banking, Financial Services, Utilities, Insurance, Retail organisations, and beyond.




We are looking for a Senior Integration Engineer to join our Integrated Services department. Reporting to the VP of Integrated Services, this role has the following duties:

  • Take part in the code design and implementation phases of a complex distributed system
  • Write adaptation/integration code among internal or third-party components and a central event-oriented integration platform
  • Create, expose, and consume APIs from and to individual components as above
  • Implement and execute automated tests (from unit to end-to-end, integration and performance)
  • Troubleshoot and resolve functional and performance issues
  • Write and maintain high-quality documentation
  • Participate in design, development and DevOps teams as a part of an agile methodology-based workforce


Requirements

  • A University degree (4+ years of studies) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Informatics, or related fields
  • Graduate studies in a related field will be considered a plus
  • 4+ years in software engineering positions
  • Experience in designing, implementing, documenting REST APIs, as well as in consuming third-party REST APIs
  • Experience in designing, implementing, documenting and/or consuming SOAP APIs will be considered a plus
  • Experience in at least 2 complex, multi-component projects requiring integration among components
  • Proficiency in Java, though not an absolute must, will be highly appreciated; alternatively, or complementary proficiency in C#/.Net will also be considered
  • Good knowledge of at least one, preferably two or more programming language(s), is required (e.g., Scala, Ruby, Go, Python)
  • Experience with server-side programming (e.g., servlets, API endpoints, MVC frameworks, ORMs, caching)
  • Experience in writing and executing different types of tests (e.g., unit, integration, performance, end-to-end, smoke)
  • Experience with Spring Boot or similar frameworks will be highly appreciated
  • Experience in working with Docker containers will be highly appreciated
  • Knowledge of and experience with CI/CD pipelines, Kafka or other event streaming platforms, Cloud-native services and/or Kubernetes will be considered a plus
  • Ability to cooperate smoothly and efficiently within large teams of peers, using various technologies, having various statuses (employees/vendors/subcontractors), and spanning a wide range of skills and cultures
  • Attention to detail, desire to keep learning and growing, and a collaborative profile / high-EQ team spirit
  • Excellent oral and written English language skills


Benefits

On top of a challenging work environment, we are offering:

💸 Competitive compensation, ticket restaurant card, and annual bonus programs

💻 Cutting-edge IT equipment, mobile, and data plan

🏢 Modern facilities, free coffee and beverages, and indoor parking

👨‍⚕ Private health insurance, onsite occupational doctor, and workplace counselor

🏝️ Flexible working model, hybrid/remote benefits & home equipment benefits

🤸‍♂️ Onsite gym, wellness facilities, and ping pong room

💡 Career and talent development tools

🎓 Mentoring, coaching, personalized annual learning and development plan

🌱 Employee referral bonus, regular wellbeing, ESG, and volunteering activities

Your race, gender identity, expression, age ethnicity, or disability make no difference in Qualco Group. We want to attract, develop, promote, and retain the best people based on their abilities and behavior.

Disclaimer: Qualco Group collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any third parties. We will keep your resume in our database for any future consideration. In case you want to be deleted from our database, please contact us.

Title: Senior Integration Engineer
Skills: Application Programming Interfaces (API)|C#|Code Design|Computer Science|Documentation|English|Java|REST APIs|Software Development|Spring Boot|
Job Description:
About the job

About Agoda


Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.


Get to Know our Team:


The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.


Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:


  • Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, Tripadvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
  • Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
  • Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders


What you’ll Need to Succeed:


  • Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
  • 0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
  • Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
  • Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
  • Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently


It’s Great if you Have:


  • Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
  • Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
  • Strong presentation and negotiation skills

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. Title: Business Analyst (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
Skills: A/B Testing|Ad Serving|Communication|Digital Marketing|E-Commerce|Investment Banking|Organization Skills|Presentations|Pricing Optimization|Written Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

About us

InstaShop, headquartered in Dubai, is the leading online marketplace for supermarkets, pharmacies, pet shops & other businesses in the Middle East. With a young & motivated team & an office resembling the ones of startups in San Francisco, InstaShop is the right company for individuals passionate about adding value within a fast-growing technology company.


About the role

As a JavaScript Engineer (MEAN stack) you will be responsible for creating and maintaining our online platforms, from the webpage to the back-office dashboard. Your role will be highly crucial since the smooth operation of the company's processes depends on the quality of your code. You will work on a diverse set of projects and use different technologies within an environment that fosters knowledge sharing and growth.


A casual day includes

  • Develop, maintain and extend our order management software and other in-house and customer facing apps
  • Develop source code that is highly structured, reusable and is accompanied by clear comments describing the key functionalities
  • Be eager and available to collaborate with the rest of the developers to support the full product development process in a cost and time efficient manner
  • Be readily available to discuss functionalities and code details with the Company and possibly other Service Providers
  • Safeguard the project documentations with the utmost caution against any information breach
  • Showcase individual progress and constantly raise the bar
  • Respect and meet the agreed timelines and milestones
  • To use the InstaShop services as per the company policies in order order to provide feedback on how to improve the service


What you will need

  • End-to-end experience with JavaScript, TypeScript and ES6 syntax
  • 2+ years of exposure in any of the following frameworks and technologies: Node.js, Angular, NestJS, Next.js
  • Experience in non-relational databases and ideally MongoDB
  • Be at ease with front-end or back-end development
  • Enthusiastic towards new technologies, writing clean and scalable code following best practices and paying attention to detail
  • Experience with any JavaScript testing framework, AWS, elasticsearch, Docker or SonarQube will be considered as a plus
  • Any experience with TeamCity, Apache Druid, Apache Kafka, or any other hot new technology, will be appreciated!


InstaShop Perks

🤑 Competitive compensation package

💻 Company provided equipment of your own choice (for MacOS, Windows & Linux fans)

🧑‍⚕️ Private Health Insurance Plan (family members included)

⏰ Flexible & hybrid working

🤓 Annual training budget

🚀 Part of a super talented team thriving for innovation

🌴 Extra days of annual leave upon discretion of the management

🍌 Unlimited healthy snacking

Job Description:
About the job

About the job

Allweb's mission is to streamline and accelerate the Digital Transformation across the entire Govermental & Enterprise market. Our customers embrace the Allweb approach to IT platforms for complex projects at thechnology state of the art.


Allweb PMO Project Managers are responsible for ensuring project success through owning, driving, communicating and respectfully engaging all stakeholders, valuing integrity and accountability.


Within a portfolio of projects with complex and changing software technologies, customer and partner satisfaction is only possible because of exceptional PMO Project Managers who know how to respect and engage all stakeholders.


The successful Project Manager will have solid full life cycle project management experience in a software engineering and/or information technology field, excellent written and verbal communications skills in Greek & English and experience leading remote and global project teams and customers. You will be able to "make things happen" with a professional approach and effective negotiation techniques. You must have Agile expertise and Project Management certification.


If this sounds like you and you have experience of Project Managment & Business Analysis in projects in one or more of the areas below, we'd love to hear from you:

  • Big Govermental Applications
  • Large Enterprise IT programs
  • Cloud and Public Cloud
  • Organization Change Management


What Allweb Offers:

  • Hybrid remote working
  • Learning and development
  • Recognition rewards
  • Friendly Working Enviroment


We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.


Contact us at Job@allweb.gr for more info!

Title: Senior Software Project Manager
Skills: Agile Software Development|Business Analysis|Digital Transformation|Diversity|Information Technology|Learning|Project Management|Project Management Office (PMO)|Real Estate Development Projects|Software Development|
Job Description:
About the job

( 6562 )

At One&Only, we exist to create joy for our guests through anticipation, creativity, precision, empathy and warmth. We tailor every aspect of our guests’ stay to bring their dreams and desires to life. With an atmosphere that’s chic but wonderfully unstuffy™, and a team who are meticulous but warm, we seek to exceed our guests’ expectations at every possible turn.

Shimmering in the depths of the azure Aegean Sea, a story-filled island of myths and marvels, One&Only Kéa Island emerges to honour untold beauty with authentic flavours of Greece. The warm Mediterranean hospitality is one of our most unique and valued assets. With abundant knowledge and generosity, we anticipate our guest’s every need and surpass expectations. Whether we are designing the perfect family day out or arranging a romantic private dinner, we approach everything with imagination to spark a sense of playfulness, discovery and adventure. This is not simply our job, it’s our passion.

The IT Specialist is responsible to effectively operate the daily operations of the resort’s information technology and telecommunications. This is a "hands-on" position, serving an individual contributor of internal and external resources, to meet the position's responsibilities. Contributes advanced knowledge and skill in technology and general hospitality business knowledge to support the property and technology Information Resources objectives. Position is responsible to the property for all technology planning, PCI compliance, GDPR, maintenance. Coordinate property systems technicians and interfaces with vendors, guests, owners, and Executive Committee and property colleagues.

Our brand is expanding faster than ever before. We are investing in the growth of our company, and that means we are committed to investing in you. Join a team that is open-hearted, intuitive, generous, and spontaneous in spirit. We believe in making our guests happy beyond anything they have ever imagined. We wow them at every turn and create memories that will last a lifetime. You will be at the heart of this vision, to constantly innovate to deliver Amazing Experiences and Everlasting Memories.

Title: IT Support
Skills: Computer Repair|Help Desk Support|IT Hardware Support|Information Technology|Network Administration|Networking|Operating Systems|System Administration|Technical Support|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

We are looking to hire waiters/waitresses for our client's hotel in KSA, by noting their orders, serving tables their requested meals, and preparing bills at the end of the table meal.


You are also responsible for asking customers if they are satisfied with their meal and providing any assistance should the customer not be satisfied.


To be successful as a waiter/ you must have the endurance to stand for long hours and have patience with difficult customers. A good waiter anticipates the needs of customers and provides all services in a friendly manner.


Responsibilities:


  • Greet customers and hand out menus.
  • Take meal and beverage orders from customers and place these orders in the kitchen.
  • Make menu recommendations and inform patrons of any specials.
  • Deliver meals and beverages to tables when they have been prepared.
  • Check that customers are satisfied with their meals.
  • Prepare the bill for tables when requested.
  • Cash up bills and ensure that the correct amount has been paid.
  • Administer change to tables if needed.


Requirements


  • Endurance to walk and stand for long hours.
  • Flexible work hours.
  • Ability to remain calm and professional with difficult customers.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Coordination to carry plates or trays without dropping anything.
  • Amenable to working in KSA
  • Must be proficient and well-conversed in the English Language.

Title: Waiter/Waitress (GRC)
Skills: Catering|Communication|Critical Thinking|Endurance|English|Governance, Risk Management, and Compliance (GRC)|Interpersonal Skills|Skilled Multi-tasker|Trays|Wine|
Job Description:
About the job

NOC Department - Athens, Greece (Hybrid)


EMPIST is a full-service technology firm, providing businesses with the technology they need to succeed. Each day we strive to create a teamwork-led environment that fosters the success of not just our clients and our business, but of our employees, too. We are currently seeking a Technical Support Engineer for our growing team!


The Technical Support Engineer will provide enterprise-level support to our customers. This technician will provide support via phone, web, email, chat and other channels as required.


Responsibilities:
  • Take ownership of customer issues reported and see problems through to resolution
  • Research, diagnose, troubleshoot and identify solutions to resolve customer issues
  • Follow standard procedures for proper escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams
  • Provide prompt and accurate feedback to customers
  • Ensure proper recording and closure of all issues
  • Prepare accurate and timely reports
  • Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base tech notes and articles
  • Follow the SLA for issues with respect to the severity.
  • Monitor systems using monitoring tools (PRTG, MSP)
  • Add/remove sensors, configuring monitoring thresholds
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues including but not limited to:
    • Windows servers, ESX hosts, VMs, firewalls, switches, network outages
    • Disk space issues (adding/removing disk space)
    • Performance issues (investigating, adding/removing resources)
    • Operating system issues (investigating, troubleshooting (i.e., event viewer)
    • ISP issues (troubleshooting, escalating to ISP)
    • Network access issues (troubleshooting VPNs, troubleshooting configuration, configuring network devices, adding new ones to monitoring console(s))
  • Update patching (Windows OS, LOB applications, hardware)
  • Respond to and handle user requests during after hours
    • Answer phone calls from 11pm CST to 8am CST, creating tickets that reflect the user’s request, working on said ticket to resolution
    • Escalate if needed
    • Keep the user posted on the status of the ticket for the duration that his/her ticket is open
  • Contact vendors
  • Escalate ISP or hardware outages
  • Arrange dispatch for systems that are under warranty
  • Work with Account Managers when systems are not under warranty
  • Monitor the status of the issue until the final resolution
  • Keep the client in the loop regarding the status of the issue
  • Perform tasks that SD and Sysadmin teams have passed to NOC for after hours’ work


Requirements:


  • BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalent
  • Proven working experience in enterprise technical support, IT support or as a technical engineer
  • Deep knowledge in the product that the technician is supporting.
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Excellent client-facing skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


This position includes shifts (09:00-17:00 EEST or 14:00-22:00 EEST) and two weekends per month.


EMPIST is a 23-year old company with locations in the heart of the Loop in Downtown Chicago near all major transportation, Downtown Elmhurst on York Road, and European HQ in Athens, Greece. We have been named to the Inc 500/5000 list for 9 out of the last 10 years which recognizes the fastest-growing, privately-held businesses across the nation. We were also chosen as one of the 501 most influential MSPs in the world (currently #89th in 2022) joining the MSP Mentor 501 list for 10 straight years.

Title: Technical Support Engineer
Skills: Communication|Computer Science|Firewalls|Network Operations Center (NOC)|Oral Communication|PRTG|Patch Management|Problem Solving|Technical Support|Virtual Private Network (VPN)|
Job Description:
About the job

ManpowerGroup Greece, on behalf of its client, a world’s leading FMCG company, is searching for a Talent Acquisition Specialist, based in Athens.


The job holder will partner with business leaders, source and select candidates thus ensuring best in class professionals and leaders, who will further grow the company’s business.


Workplace Location: Northern Suburbs of Athens

Working Days and Hours: Monday to Friday, morning hours

Contract duration: Until Nov 2023


Main responsibilities:

This position will provide the person with the opportunity to further develop their sourcing, selection, and assessment skills, by leading recruitment projects for various departments and levels, across Greece & Cyprus. The job holder will also have an opportunity to work on cross-country projects and work alongside like-minded individuals.


More specifically the successful candidate will :

  • Orchestrate local Talent Acquisition & Identification activities
  • Responsible for the complete recruitment process (end-to-end) for all departments of the company with special focus on Sales Teams using various recruitment channels and sourcing
  • Advising line managers in the design and implementation of the sourcing and recruitment process
  • Conduct assessment tools related to each job function and job grade
  • Build successful relationships and network with different stakeholders including candidates, hiring managers, HR business partners
  • Liaise with employer branding for more effective talent attraction and campaigns and take part in various employer brand events to represent company and attract talent people
  • Ensure 100% compliance with the company recruitment process and policy
  • Support on performing talent mapping according to strategic workforce planning for key positions & maintain ongoing relationships with candidates to create pipelines for future needs
  • Maintain and manage a full applicant tracking system and different TA platforms and tools in place
  • Ensuring reporting of Talent Acquisition & Identification key figures


Candidate profile :

  • At least 6months experience in recruitment and/or Sales experience
  • BSc or MSc degree in Business administration, Human Resources or relative field
  • MS office & computer literacy
  • Fluency in English
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Understanding of external labor market and talent acquisition trends
  • Stakeholder management


Benefits :

  • Competitive gross monthly salary
  • Opportunities for further development in a dynamic team
  • Participation in various projects and learning opportunities


#Empoweringtalent #WebelieveinTalent #ManpowerGroupGreece

Title: Talent Acquisition Specialist (fixed-term contract)
Skills: Communication|Employer Branding|Human Resources (HR)|Negotiation|Recruiting|Sales|Stakeholder Management|Talent Mapping|
Job Description:
About the job

We’ve been pioneering a world of possibilities to bring surfaces to life for well over 200 years. As experts in making coatings, there’s a good chance you’re only ever a few meters away from one of our products. Our world class portfolio of brands – including Dulux, International, Sikkens and Interpon – is trusted by customers around the globe. We’re active in more than 150 countries and have set our sights on becoming the global industry leader. It’s what you’d expect from the most sustainable paints company, which has been inventing the future for more than two centuries.


Job Purpose


The Technical Service Representative will provide technical customer support in shipyards and customer sites for Newbuilding and Maintenance & Repair projects. Also be the frontline sales support through proficient use of AkzoNobel products and services as well as a strong working knowledge of application techniques, support to customers, assisting them with product selection, answering application questions, and solving issues via phone, email or onsite.


Key Accountabilities


The Job holder will have to protect the interests of AkzoNobel, being careful of the good practice of the applicators’ companies using our Marine and Protective Coatings products.


  • He will attend paint applications and will provide Technical Advises in accordance with International Paint standards in New Building and Maintenance & Repair shipyards and fabrication sites.
  • Maintains allocated technical company equipment in a safe and proper manner. - Delivers periodical progress reports, proactively submits information regarding trends within the market and provides recommendations regarding improvements in the approach to the marketplace.
  • Assists sales department in the implementation of sales strategies and within key phases of the sales process, giving technical expert knowledge to their prospects.
  • Promotes the positive company image and develops long-term relations with customers. - Advises to the upper management on training types, recruit participants for the relevant technical courses and gains commitment for customer attendance.


Key Activities


Delivers training to customers on the use and application of the company products, equipment and documentation both on-site at the customer’s location and within the training center.


  • Conduct demonstrations of products and transfers the knowledge on Akzo Nobel process as well as on technical problem solving to the customer
  • Performs technical scans and audits at designated customers.
  • Actively participates together and as peer to allocated sales representative, in key phases of the sales process to prospects - Proactively prevents and solves problems of a technical nature occurring at existing customers.
  • Conducts and/or assists in the testing process as well as in the implementation of new products and technologies.
  • Synchronizes own activities with all department using CRM, up-dates the key customers’ databases with valid, accurate and complete information (visit, products, equipment etc.)
  • Cooperates with the technical department in handling complex technical issues and claims and in educating customers on solutions. - Supports product development with prototype selection advice and test market execution


Job Requirements


Good experience in Marine and Protective Coatings paint industry (New Building and Maintenance & Repair)


  • Good experience in inspection - Good relationship with customer/applicators - FROSIO level III certified and/or NACE 2 - Native Greek language - English spoken, read and written
  • Good Knowledge of Office (Word, Excel) systems - International spirit and culturally aware
  • Good team worker
  • Basic knowledge relating to health and safety matters under the current Greek legislation


Competencies


Accepting Direction


Accepting Responsibility


Acquiring Information


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.

Job Description:
About the job

Who We Are

Brink’s operates in Greece since 1983 and today employs more than 2.500 employees being a leading company in the highly competitive Cash Management and Security Services Industry.


  • We find ways to streamline our processes and improve performance
  • We empower our people to think creatively and work differently
  • We embrace and drive change


Our Culture

At Brink’s, our values guide the way we work and are the cornerstone of our winning culture. They ensure that we work safely to protect ourselves and others, consider the customer first in all we do, display the highest standards of ethics, engage and empower employees, continually find new ways to improve the way we work, and foster a diverse and inclusive workplace.


We are currently looking for an energetic, passionate and forward driven IT Intern to have an internship experience working with our IT Department!


The Role

As an IT Intern you will have the chance to take an active part in our day to day operations, supporting our IT team in troubleshooting and system maintenance.


Key Responsibilities

  • Support the IT team in maintaining hardware, software, and other systems
  • Participate in the deployment of new workstations
  • Assist in hardware and software inventory management


As an IT Intern you must

  • Have good knowledge of IT hardware
  • Be fluent in English and Greek
  • Be familiar with MS Office
  • Have the opportunity to attend an internship through your university or academic institution (Please note that most internships are sponsored by ESIF (ESPA) programs)


It will be considered an asset if you have

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Keen eye for detail
  • The ability to work effectively in a team


What's in it for you

  • An opportunity to work in a global environment and connect with partners from different departments
  • Empowerment & Project Ownership
  • Opportunities for progression


Click 'Apply Now' to submit your CV and feel free to visit us on our website https://gr.brinks.com/

Title: Information Technology Intern
Skills: Communication|English|Greek|Information Technology|Interpersonal Skills|Inventory Management|Organization Skills|System Maintenance|Troubleshooting|Workstations|
Job Description:
About the job

LONGi is the world’s largest solar technology company, supplying over 30 GW of high-efficiency solar wafers and modules annually, about a quarter of the global solar market. With unparalleled financial strength in the sector, LONGi is a perennial Bloomberg NEF Tier 1 Supplier and the only AAA-rated solar module supplier according to PV-Tech. LONGi’s global leadership stems for its core values: innovation and sustainable development. The company has invested well over $1 billion into R&D in the past three years and currently holds multiple world record efficiencies for next-generation solar cell technologies. Furthermore, LONGi is committed to the Climate Group’s RE100, EV100 and EP100 initiatives and will source 100% renewables-based electricity across all its operations by 2028.


ROLE: Sales Manager


LOCATION: Greece


YOU WILL…

  • Expand LONGi Solar’s sales network by identifying, pitching, and building relationships with potential partners and/or customers in key markets.
  • Lead commercial efforts in assigned region, including formulation of the sales contract negotiation and contract confirmation.
  • Assess and establish contact with potential buyers of LONGi Solar products, deepen and expand relationships and business with existing partners/customers.
  • Implement and execute monthly, quarterly, and annual sales strategy.
  • Focus on monocrystalline silicon module sales, pipeline development and fostering relationships among DG and C&I clients.
  • Build and implement sales strategies appropriate for the assigned business segments.
  • Manage existing customers from Pre-Sales to After-Sales support.
  • Communicate effectively with internal teams including marketing, technical service center, legal, finance and operation management, etc. to ensure smooth fulfillment of sales orders.
  • Occasionally be involved in strategic growth opportunities that the company is pursuing.
  • Depending on the evolving needs of the business, manage other sales personnel.


YOU NEED…

  • Bachelor’s Degree or above with relevant sales experience in solar industry.
  • Prior solar modules sales and key account management experience in assigned region.
  • Solid understanding of solar and its adjacent markets (e.g. storage & semiconductors).
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong leadership skills and result-driven capability.
  • Able to travel and represent the company in various commercial engagements.
  • Organized and able to manage sales orders end-to-end (from booking until fulfillment).
  • Proven track record in closing transactions.
  • Business fluent in Greek and English. Chinese is a plus.
  • Competency in office software tools.


WE OFFER…

  • A challenging position in a market leading photovoltaic company.
  • The chance to work in a global team with international visión.
  • A promising career development within our fast-growing organization.
  • Colleagues who are as smart, supportive, hardworking, and driven as you.
  • A competitive salary with a success-based variable, additional benefits, and other attractive perks.

Title: Sales Manager - Greece
Skills: Account Management|Chinese|Communication|Contract Negotiation|English|Leadership|Negotiation|Sales|Sales Management|Sales Processes|
Job Description:
About the job

Power BI and Data Specialist

Level: Mid/Senior

Location: Greece (Athens or Thessaloniki)


You will be responsible for the development of internal- and external-facing Power BI dashboards and interactive visual reports within the business applications team. You will write efficient DAX queries on-demand to customize visuals and to calculate Key Performance Indices, as per project needs.

You will work with the Business Process Owners and the other members of the Data Warehouse team to analyze the reporting needs and translate these into visual & analytical solutions. Through iterative steps, you will work with the Business Process Owners and departments to set scope and priorities.

The ADB Safegate analytics area covers a large business scope including Finance, Production, Sales, HR, Marketing, Warehousing, Procurement, CRM etc. We opted to go for a cloud first strategy and have created a foundation with a state-of-the-art Microsoft Azure environment (data lakes, data bricks, ...). The intention is to build further on this foundation.


Main responsibilities:


Solution design Analytics

  • Gather and define the business requirements from the business stakeholders and business process owners
  • Design the solution in line with the business requirements with the Data Warehouse team
  • Build the solution according to the overall agreed processes and guidelines
  • Track and steer project progress on agreed deliverables, timelines, and dependencies


Power BI Application management:

  • Organize the solution support according to agreed priorities
  • Make recommendations to the DWH manager on scope and priorities in line with overall applications roadmap
  • Make recommendations to the DWH manager to organize the continuous improvement of the solutions in your area
  • Keep track of new improvement opportunities in your area of responsibility and evaluate these together with your business contacts
  • Plan the releases of your solutions
  • Ensure validation and testing of all changes
  • Collaborate with external parties
  • Design, develop, and deploy business analytics dashboards
  • Define model with calculated columns, measures, calculated tables using DAX, clean and transform data with the Query Editor


Other ADBSG Application management

  • Support other business applications on our landscape


Required qualifications & Skills

  • Completed university degree
  • 3-6 years of professional experience within the area of Power BI
  • Strong quantitative and analytical skills, including programming experience in writing DAX queries
  • Cherry on top:
  • Demonstrated experience in managing and implementing DWH applications (data factory, data bricks, synapses)
  • Azure experience
  • Strong Excel skills
  • Experience working with SAP or other ERP system in a (complex) multi-country, multi-BU environment
  • Strong English communication skills – written and oral –
  • Identifies, collects, and analyzes the information needed to solve a problem effectively. Should analyze functional/non-functional requirements and seek clarifications for better understanding of requirements


Personal Competencies

  • You have a very driven, motivated, and high-energy attitude that allows working in a rapidly changing environment with cross-functional stakeholders
  • Solving and analyzing problems is your forte – you can understand and synthesize complex data to gain insights and propose solutions
  • You work well in a team
  • You can have constructive conversations with business representatives
  • Eager to learn new things


We offer an exciting, fast-paced working environment, with high top management exposure and strategic projects where you can make a tangible impact to pave the way for a management career in the industry. Of course, this is accompanied by an attractive salary package with fringe benefits and an amazing team of colleagues!

Job Description:
About the job

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.


Job Description:


Job Summary


We’re looking for people who will help us ensure that packages go on the right journey. You’ll work in our facility in Koropi City (Athens, Greece) from 06.00am to 11.00 am from Monday to Friday.


Do you want to be part of our team?


We are looking for candidates who will work for us at Koropi warehouse and help us move our world forward by delivering what matters. The job can be busy and hard work. But with your ability to pay close attention to detail and easily picking up instructions, and with the support of your teammates, you’ll excel at doing your work quickly and accurately.


Your general activities will include:


  • Sorting, Scanning, checking, loading & auditing packages
  • Work safely and accurately at speed, following instructions
  • Double-check your work as you go


What does it take to keep the World’s Largest Shipping & Logistics Company running smoothly? People with a unique combination of skill and care.


Are you the person we are looking for?


  • An eye for detail and accuracy, working at a fast pace to meet deadlines
  • A flexible, friendly approach with team spirit & can-do attitude
  • The ability to accurately follow instructions of our sorting & handling methods
  • Basic knowledge of English


Your Benefits


What’s in it for you? The professional challenges, a friendly team, as well as a working environment that puts your safety first. But what else makes this role such a great opportunity?


  • Competitive monthly salary for 5h/day
  • Additional monthly bonus in vouchers based on productivity
  • Transfer from Athens City Center in the morning with company shuttle bus
  • Work from Monday to Friday and have free weekends
  • Full paid training to help you perform at your best
  • Private Life & Health insurance
  • Opportunities to grow – thanks to our policy “promotion from within”


YOUR TEAM


In our Warehouse team, we deliver all kinds of things to all kinds of places at UPS. Whatever it is, wherever it’s going, we handle it with the care for which we’re known and trusted all over the world for.


UPS is committed to a policy of treating individuals fairly and recruiting, selecting, training, promoting and compensating based on merit, experience and other work-related criteria. We do not discriminate against any applicant based on age, race, religion, sex, disability, sexual orientation or gender identity.


Employee Type:


Permanent


UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Job Description:
About the job

ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations. With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life. Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well.


We are looking for a Clinical Trial Assistant (CTA) based at our sponsor´s office in Athens.

As a CTA, you will be dedicated to one of our global pharmaceutical clients; a company that is advancing the development of new medicines, biologic therapies and vaccines for many of the world’s most challenging diseases including cancer, cardio-metabolic diseases, Alzheimer’s and infectious diseases. Be ready to work in a solid partnership and an environment driven by innovation and continuous improvement.

Working fully embedded within the local clinical team at our client’s offices, the Clinical Trial Assistant plays a key role in the success of global clinical trials at a local level. The tasks undertaken by a CTA are varied and can include:

  • Providing ongoing administrative support to other members of the clinical study team, supporting other clinical colleagues in tracking study progress
  • Collaborating with site staff to ensure clinical trials are being run according to the protocol
  • Document management, tracking, electronic filing and review
  • Ensuring studies are run according to ICH GCP and other applicable regulations at site
  • Organizing meetings
  • Managing the delivery of non-drug related study supplies
  • Supporting the local submission process

As a Clinical Trial Assistant, you will have the opportunity to experience the full lifecycle of a project and genuinely contribute to drug development and improving patients’ lives.

For this role you will need:

  • Previous experience in a similar role at a CRO or pharma company or good knowledge of ICH/GCP.
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Proficiency in MS Office
  • The ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously
  • A quality-focused mindset
  • Good commands in English and Greek



Benefits of Working in ICON:


Our success depends on the knowledge, capabilities and quality of our people. That’s why we are committed to developing our employees in a continuous learning culture – one where we challenge you with engaging work and where every experience adds to your professional development.


At ICON, our focus is to provide you with a comprehensive and competitive total reward package that comprises, not only an excellent level of base pay, but also a wide range of variable pay and recognition programs. In addition, our best in class employee benefits, supportive policies and wellbeing initiatives are tailored to support you and your family at all stages of your career - both now, and into the future.


ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.


If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know.

About the job

Parli fluentemente Italiano? Sei pronto per una nuova avventura? Tuffati a capofitto in un’esperienza tutta mediterranea e unisciti al nostro team in una delle località più famose al mondo!


Teleperformance Greece offre un luogo di lavoro multiculturale, multietnico, sicuro e divertente; un ambiente professionale che sostiene fortemente la diversità, offrendo al contempo pari opportunità a tutti, indipendentemente da sesso, etnia, religione, cultura o età.


Vieni a esplorare un paese famoso per la sua ricca cultura, la cucina saporita, i paesaggi favolosi e la vivace vita notturna; luoghi dove avrai anche la possibilità di socializzare, costruire la tua rete professionale, migliorare le tue abilità linguistiche e arricchire il tuo CV con una notevole esperienza lavorativa.


Vivi in un'esperienza unica e scopri le magie della Grecia!


Teleperformance Greece connette i clienti con i migliori marchi mondiali da oltre 30 anni. Con un team di oltre 11.000 dipendenti di oltre 109 nazionalità, rappresentiamo con orgoglio le principali aziende al mondo, fornendo servizi di assistenza clienti, vendite e supporto tecnico, nonché moderazione dei contenuti per i social media.



Cosa farai:

• Comunicare con i clienti tramite telefono, chat ed e-mail

• Tracciare e seguire i casi per assicurarti che siano completati in modo efficiente e tempestivo

• Mantenere un'elevata soddisfazione del cliente, rappresentando un marchio importante

• Fornire e mantenere relazioni solide e professionali con tutti i partner e mostrare empatia in ogni momento

• Lavorare per raggiungere gli obiettivi stabiliti dal cliente e dal tuo dipartimento interno



Cosa è richiesto:

• Ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana.

• Buone capacità di comunicazione in inglese

• Ottime capacità comunicative e competenze trasversali, nonché capacità di risoluzione dei problemi

• Conoscenza del computer/competenza tecnologica

• Intraprendenza, capacità multitasking

• Voglia di crescere come un componente di una squadra in un ambiente dinamico ed in continua evoluzione



Cosa offriamo:

• Supporto completo per il trasferimento (biglietto aereo per la Grecia, alloggio di 4 settimane, trasporto aeroporto-hotel, assistenza per la ricerca di un appartamento, spese per d’agenzia immobiliare coperte da noi)

• Stipendio mensile competitivo + 2 stipendi extra all'anno

• Assicurazione sanitaria privata extra

• Numerosi vantaggi e sconti

• Formazione completa da parte di istruttori certificati

• Opportunità di crescita e sviluppo professionale

• Eventi speciali e iniziative di responsabilità sociale e comunitaria

• Corsi di lingua greca online gratuiti

Job Description:
About the job

ARE YOU READY to be a part of the digital reinvention of industry and revolutionize your career?

In today’s world, business leaders want to rapidly and confidently reinvent to increase resilience, mitigate risk, and grow with sustainable value.

That’s where Accenture Strategy & Consulting comes in. We bring together strategic visionaries, industry experts, practitioners from across every enterprise function, business intelligence professionals, change specialists, data and AI authorities, and many other specialized skills to co-create each client’s unique path to reinvention. You will be a trusted partner to business leaders, working with a diverse team of experts to deliver successful tech-enabled transformation and new kinds of value for your clients.

Strategy and Consulting is one of four services –the others are Interactive, Technology and Operations.

WORK YOU’LL DO

Capability Network CFO&EV team focuses on partnering with Accenture CFOEV Network teams to bring distinctive capabilities serving the CFO priorities to increase the Enterprise Value and steward the digitalization of entire enterprise

As an FP&A Analyst in CFO&EV team in Capability Network, you’ll work with key industry players in the Finance & Risk Management sectors around the world. You’ll be at the heart of a dynamic fast-paced environment of challenge, growth and continuous learning in one of the most sought-after industries. You’ll help our clients keep up with fast changing regulations, innovations as well as changing market conditions. You will be part of a team that brings to our client’s industry-leading best practices, technologies and strategies in everything from front line finance, next generation business planning, value based management, treasury & working capital, dynamic managerial accounting - to credit, market, liquidity or operational risk perspective and regulatory compliance.

Responsibilities:

  • Advising our clients from Financial Services Institutions, global corporate entities as well as other industries including Resources & Energy or Consumer Goods on a wide range of Finance & Risk Management topics

  • Building sophisticated financial models

  • Using your analytical & quantitative skills to provide clarity to complex issues and gather data as well as model driven insights

  • Design tools and dashboards to control performance and monitor results

  • Support business development activities

  • Working across a dynamic, international team where English is the common language

    • WHO WE´RE LOOKING FOR?

  • Degree in Engineering, Accounting, Finance or Business Administration. A professional accounting certification is also desirable.

  • 2+ years of experience in relevant role

  • Professional financial modelling and analysis skills and advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint

  • Knowledge of Consolidation, planning, compliance, reporting and data reconciliation.

  • Experience with EPM platforms (Hyperion, Tagetik, Anaplan, IBM, Jedox), especially in a development capacity highly appreciated

  • Prior experience with system implementation projects is also desirable.

  • Critical thinking and analytical skills, with proven ability to simplify complicated matters

  • Strong commercial and business acumen

    • WHAT´S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Competitive salary and benefits, including but not limited to: life/health insurance, performance based bonuses, monthly vouchers, company car (depending on management level), flexible work arrangements, employee share purchase plan, TEA Accenture, parental leave, paid overtime (if needed) and various corporate discounts

  • Continuous hard and soft skills training & development through global platforms & local academy

  • Career coaching and mentorship to help you manage your career and develop professionally

  • Ongoing strengths and skills based evaluation process

  • Various opportunities to develop your career across a spectrum of clients, industries and projects

  • Diverse and inclusive culture

  • Corporate citizenship initiatives (access to volunteering opportunities, charity work etc.

  • Under our Brain Regain initiative, extra relocation benefits may apply

    • In case your profile is a match for the role, you will receive an email requesting to download our new innovative mobile App, Enter Accenture Greece for Android or iOS devices . Then, you will be able to log in by using your personalized credentials provided by our Recruitment Team within 48 hours and start your Accenture Journey!

    To learn more about Accenture, and how you will be challenged and inspired from Day 1, please visit our website accenture.com/gr-en/.

    The safety and well-being of our candidates and employees remain our priority. Please note that the recruitment process for opportunities in Accenture Greece will be conducted only via online format during the current period.

About the job

Intellectica is recruiting a dynamic and results-driven Sales Representative on behalf of a leading Food Processing & Packaging Equipment Company with a 50-year presence in the field of food processing and packaging. Based in Athens, Greece and reporting directly to the Area Sales Manager, the successful candidate’s primary goal is to generate new business, build strong relationships with clients, and contribute to the overall growth of the company.


Key activities and responsibilities of this role include:


  • Promoting the company’s products by showcasing their competitive advantages
  • Conducting cost analyses for projects and preparing accurate and competitive quotations and proposals for clients in a timely manner
  • Fostering positive and long-term relationships with customers, through regular visits and effective communication to ensure customer satisfaction
  • Leading and coordinating commercial negotiations with customers, ensuring all agreements are aligned with company policies and business objectives
  • Ensuring excellent after-sales service is provided to customers, including addressing any concerns or issues in a timely and effective manner
  • Monitoring the company’s sales funnel by maintaining accurate records of all sales activity (prospects and results) and adjusting sales strategies accordingly
  • Traveling domestically to attend client meetings and international to participate in trade fairs and exhibitions of special interest
  • Keeping up-to-date with industry trends, competitor activity, and market developments to inform and improve the company’s sales strategy


Professional experience & qualifications of a successful candidate:


  • At least 3 years of professional experience in Sales, preferably in the Food and Beverage industry
  • Bachelor’s degree is considered a plus; engineering background is considered a plus
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office suite
  • Fluent in English and Greek (both written and verbal)
  • Willingness to travel as needed


Core competencies of a successful candidate:


  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; personable and engaging
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Excellent organizational and time-management skills
  • Highly motivated and target driven
  • Customer-centric mindset, with a strong focus on results


Benefits provided by the company:


  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Company cellphone and laptop
  • Continuous training and support to help develop your skills and expertise
  • Career development and growth within a fast-growing market


Apply now!

Please send your CV in strict confidence at candidates@intellecticagroup.com by quoting reference int-0076 and connect your talent and ambitions to a world of opportunities.

Job Description:
About the job

Financial Services Technology Business Analyst


#YourOpportunity


Deloitte is proud to be named the no. 1 consulting service provider in the world by Gartner and the most valuable and strongest commercial services brand in the world by Brand Finance.

We are delivering business advisory and technology-enabled business transformations across the globe, always with a focus to our vision: to make an impact that matters. Within Deloitte, the Core Business Operations team focuses on delivering trusted high-end technology advisory services.


Under this framework, we are currently looking for an enthusiastic Financial Services Technology Business Analyst to become part of our dynamic Consulting team in our offices in Athens. In this role, you’ll work with cutting-edge technologies to help clients transform their technology platforms and business operations. Partnering with some of the world’s largest organizations, you’ll help COO’s, CFO’s, CIO’s and their teams realize their ambitions – from improving financial performance, to accelerating speed to market and delivering continuous innovation.

Our diverse and passionate team is encouraged to use agile techniques in the development, delivery and on-going management of software solutions that solve complex business issues.


At Deloitte, you will offer solutions for our customers’ challenges, while subsequently working on your own career and personal growth ambitions. You’ll learn and develop a mix of advisory and technology skills that will help you define effective strategies and put them into action.

Collaboration will sit at the heart of everything you do, as you work closely with both colleagues and clients to deliver projects that drive businesses forward. Together we’ll help to imagine and deliver solutions that prepare organizations for the future — overcoming new challenges and embracing the opportunities that come with advances in technology during this new digital age.




#YourRole


Your role as a Financial Services Technology Business Analyst will focus on the delivery of client engagements, by understanding objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning your own work to objectives and setting personal priorities, teaming with others across businesses and borders and taking accountability for own and team results. In this role, you will build relationships and exercise your communication skills to positively influence your peers and other stakeholders. You will commit to personal learning and development by actively seeking opportunities for growth, you will share knowledge and experience with others, and act as a strong brand ambassador, embracing our purpose and values in order to put these into practice in your professional life.


During your tenure as a Financial Services Technology Business Analyst, you will demonstrate and develop your ability to:


  • Address client business challenges in the intersection of process and technology
  • Understand and analyze business requirements to transform them into functional specifications and act as a ‘bridge’ between business and IT tribes
  • Understand how business functions operate and analyze business processes to identify bottlenecks and pain-points
  • Produce high quality work products (such as user requirements, functional specifications, user stories, user manuals, UAT scenarios)
  • Collaborate with others to deliver a superior client experience
  • Deliver key messages with clarity, confidence, and poise to instill confidence in clients
  • Apply a global and diverse perspective to problem solving
  • Understand and articulate actions to introduce changes resulted from new processes and/or systems in the clients’ operational environment
  • Communicate expectations and results to all stakeholders in a timely and clear form
  • Develop and share reusable assets that can be readily applied to new projects



#WinningRequirements


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, Mathematics, Information Technology or related fields
  • Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance or Information Technology will be considered a plus
  • At least 2 to 4 years’ experience in Financial Services (Banking and/or Insurance) processes and products
  • At least 2 years’ experience of Business Analysis experience in IT projects preferably in the Financial Services Sector
  • Understanding, and preferably applied experience, of standard Business Analysis methods and techniques (Design Thinking, UML, BPMN)
  • Agile/SCRUM Software Development Process experience will be considered a plus
  • Certification/Accreditation in Business Analysis will be considered a plus
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong interpersonal and communications skills in English
  • Military obligations fulfilled where applicable



ABOUT CONSULTING


Five core competency areas make up our Consulting service line:


  • Strategy, Analytics and M&A
  • Customer and Marketing
  • Core Business Operations
  • Human Capital
  • Enterprise Technology and Performance



We exist to solve complex problems


Our consultants are renowned for their straightforward approach to solving some of the world’s largest and most complex business challenges. Each member of our Consulting team is energized by the challenge a seemingly inscrutable problem presents. Our distinctiveness lies in our refusal to accept a problem at face value - we draw on the depth of our shared insight to ask the right questions, and it’s these questions that uncover answers - answers with impact.


We are committed to collaboration


Our role is to unlock potential for growth and innovation. We believe this requires real collaboration – with our own networks and with our clients. It’s why we commit to truly getting under the skin of our client’s needs, developing a full appreciation for their environment, goals and ambitions. We’re also unafraid to challenge. In so doing, we build long-term and trusted affinities.


We create long-term, sustainable impact


We often work hand-in-hand with our clients to help find the right solution and to help apply that solution. Our aim is to leave behind ambassadors who are equipped to continue the transformation we began. For us, it’s about embedding sustainable change, allowing the impact of our insight to be felt for a long time to come.


WHY DELOITTE


At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.



ABOUT DELOITTE


Our services


Deloitte offers Global professional services that include Audit, Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.

We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients, in Greece and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within.


Our Purpose


Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.


Our values


At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements.


Our talent experience


From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the centre of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.


Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

Job Description:
About the job

Do you want to be part of a leading NGO with over 45 years of recognised services in the social sector? KMOP is looking for Projects Managers & Senior Project Managers for social impact and innovation projects funded by international donors (e.g. Erasmus+, CERV, AMIF, Horizon Europe, Interreg Europe). As a Project Manager / Senior Project Manager, you will coordinate internal and external teams, ensuring smooth running of activities, quality of outputs and the representation of KMOP at local and international levels. You will collaborate with researchers, finance and communication teams, and a rich network of European organisations and stakeholders to make each project’s outcome count.

📋 Responsibilities:

  • Plan, organise, and adapt taks to achieve projects’ and KMOP’s goals, foreseeing and managing risks.
  • Directly implement activities such as project meetings, documentation, progress reports, research support, development and reviewing of project outputs.
  • Coordinate the implementation of projects' tasks assigned to project partners and/or internal teams (e.g. communication, finance, translation), ensuring final delivery.
  • Initiate, manage and cultivate relations with third parties and stakeholders to ensure successful project implementation.
  • Contribute to new project ideas generation and development opportunities.

🎓 Requirements:

  • Graduate in a field relevant to KMOP’s programme areas. A postgraduate degree will be considered an asset.
  • At least 2+ years (5+ years for the Senior Project Manager role) of experience in EU-funded projects management and implementation.
  • Good knowledge and understanding of EU procedures and project design & management methodologies.
  • Excellent communication skills in English and Greek, and ability to adapt messages to fit the needs of a variety of audiences.
  • Ability to work independently, prioritize and meet strict deadlines.
  • Experience in managing teams (for the Senior Project Manager role).

🤝 What we offer:

  • Competitive remuneration and excellent career development prospects.
  • Experience and exposure to a wide range of social topics and the opportunity to contribute to positive social impact projects.
  • An international environment and the opportunity to work with renowned organizations and stakeholders from the EU and beyond.
  • A friendly, creative, and inclusive workplace.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality. If you are interested in becoming a part of our team and vision, please send your CV to: careers@kmop.org (reference quote: PM2023).


See more open jobs with KMOP: https://www.kmop.gr/work-with-us/

About the job

Description

The engineer should be competent to work at a high technical level, be a strong team player and be willing to follow applicable processes and procedures while maintaining the flexibility to “think outside the box”.

The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of experience in an Integration Security Engineering role and a solid background in Palo Alto Networks Technologies Next-Generation Firewalls (NGFW), VPNs, IDS/IPS.


Responsibilities

  • Design, implementation & support of security systems (service provider & enterprise) for clients in Greece and abroad
  • Participation in multi-disciplinary / multi-technology teams for the design and implementation of security solutions & services. Supporting and educating the Product Owner, especially with respect to refining, managing and prioritizing the product backlog items

  • At least 2 years of experience in Information Security or relevant roles
  • At least 2 years of experience in Imperva WAF, DAM solutions would be a plus
  • IASC and IDSC certifications will be considered a strong advantage

Benefits

  • Dynamic and respectful environment – our people are the core of our business, we value each and every individual and support initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance
  • Continuous coaching – work with passionate people and receive both theoretical as well as hands-on training
  • Career development. Expand your career internationally and work alongside knowledgeable people from diverse cultures and backgrounds

Job Description:
About the job

About Foundever™

Foundever™ is a global leader in the customer experience (CX) industry. With 170,000 associates across the globe, we’re the team behind the best experiences for +750 of the world’s leading and digital-first brands. Our innovative CX solutions, technology and expertise are designed to support operational needs for our clients and deliver a seamless experience to customers in the moments that matter.  

Come and work with us.

We are looking for a talented Nordic International Recruiter to support our recruiting team and help us place qualified candidates faster. If you have strong communication skills and are confident as a headhunter, we want to meet you.

As International Recruiter you're the vital link between clients and candidates.

Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include
  • Sourcing and Reviewing applications, managing interviews and tests, creating a shortlist of candidates
  • Use of candidate databases to match the right person to the client's vacancy
  • Managing the pool of candidates and matching profiles based on Client/project needs
  • Briefing the candidates about their responsibilities, salary, and benefits of the job in question
  • Informing candidates about the results of their interviews
  • Requesting references and checking the suitability of applicants before submitting their details to the operation
  • Working towards and exceeding targets
  • Maintaining candidates database updated
  • Maintaining a healthy pipeline of candidates
To succeed in the role, you will need to have:
  • Advanced level of English (C1 mandatory) and one of the below Nordic Languages: Finnish, Swedish, Danish or Norwegian
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to plan, multi-task and manage time effectively
  • Strong understanding of computer basics (Windows, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Internet)
  • Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Greece
  • Be a local candidate since it's an office based position in Athens, Greece
Education And Experience
  • BS degree in education, human resources or relevant field
  • Customer Support Industry experience
Go further with Foundever™

What's in it for you? We give our people the tools and the freedom to learn, grow, have fun and be themselves.
  • Very competitive wages and stability
  • Fully paid training
  • Permanent contract
  • Private healthcare
  • Continuous learning/development opportunities
  • Competitive career opportunities
  • A safe, friendly, diverse, supporting and technological company
  • International and multicultural environment (celebrations, initiatives to develop your skills and events to increase the team spirit)
  • EverBetter wellness program (Fitness room in our premises & Personal Trainer)
Apply Today!

Our success lies in our diversity, and our differences are our strength. We are an equal opportunity company and we value and respect diversity. You choose where you want to go; we help you get there!

Follow us.

About the job

Civil Engineer


Develop Trust is the Greek branch of Delsk group with offices in Athens. Delsk was founded in 2008. Over the years, Delsk has established its presence by partnering with over 750 enterprises across the globe.


Develop Trust has the design, construction and development of plots, alteration and redevelopments of buildings in Athens city center and suburbs. Construction has been one of the main goals of our company. We create the building structures with luxury design and top quality materials.


We have 50 buildings' constructions and renovations. More than 10 buildings are planned each year, in the next three years.

The Role:

We are seeking Civil Engineer to join our team in Athens, to support properties purchase by doing technical due diligence and to coordinate the technical part of purchase and resell contracts .

The ideal candidate must have deep knowledge of the local regulation and legalization law.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Inspect properties (apartments, buildings, plots) and do technical due diligence
  • Monitor legalizations and ID issuing
  • Contact with 3rd parties (Seller’s engineer, Notary, lawyer) to coordinate the technical part of purchase
  • Issue resell documents


Requirements:

  • University Degree in Engineer

  • Excellent communication skills in Greek & English, both written and spoken.
  • Proficient user of AutoCAD and MS Office
  • Team oriented personality.
  • High levels of creativity and imagination
  • Driving License required.
  • Military Obligations fulfilled for male candidates
