Job Description:
About the job

Στη ΦΟΥΡΝΑΡΑΚΗΣ Α.Ε. αναπτύσσουμε, εμπορευόμαστε και διακινούμε τα πιο δυνατά brands βιομηχανικών εργαλείων και μηχανημάτων. Τα τελευταία 40 χρόνια κατέχουμε ηγετική θέση στην ελληνική αγορά, ενώ βρισκόμαστε ανάμεσα στις 17 πιο δυναμικές επιχειρήσεις στην Ελλάδα (Growth Awards 2021). Παράλληλα η εταιρεία γνωρίζει μεγάλη ανάπτυξη σε 22 χώρες, με στόχο να γίνει ένας από τους βασικούς παίκτες στον τομέα των εργαλείων χειρός και ηλεκτρικών εργαλείων σε όλη την Ευρώπη. Επενδύουμε συνεχώς στην ανάπτυξη των δεξιοτήτων των ανθρώπων μας και στην ανάπτυξη τους σύμφωνα με τις δικές τους ικανότητες. Το μέλλον της εταιρείας μας εξαρτάται από τους ανθρώπους μας, επομένως η πρόσληψη νέων ταλέντων είναι πρωταρχικής σημασίας για εμάς, πέρα και επάνω από τις προκλήσεις που αντιμετωπίζουν οι εργοδότες στις μέρες μας. Η ανάγκη να έχουμε τους σωστούς ανθρώπους, με τις κατάλληλες δεξιότητες και νοοτροπία την κατάλληλη στιγμή είναι πιο επιτακτική από κάθε άλλη φορά, και αισθανόμαστε περήφανοι που αυξάνουμε το εργατικό δυναμικό μας κατά 20% κάθε χρόνο τα τελευταία χρόνια, επενδύοντας στην πρόσληψη νέων ανθρώπων.

Στο πλαίσιο λοιπόν της διαρκούς ανάπτυξής μας, αναζητούμε τον κατάλληλο υποψήφιο για τη θέση:


Junior IT


Αρμοδιότητες:


  • Παροχή βασικής τεχνικής υποστήριξης στους χρήστες, ανάκτηση κωδικών, πρόσβαση στο δίκτυο, χρήση λογισμικού
  • Υποστήριξη στην ομάδα ΙΤ σε επίπεδο IT administration, web development και ERP (Entersoft)
  • Επίλυση βασικών προβλημάτων και καθορισμός βέλτιστης λύσης σε θέματα hardware και software χρηστών


Απαραίτητα προσόντα:


  • Πτυχίο IEK ή ΑΕΙ Πληροφορικής ή συναφούς αντικειμένου
  • Προϋπηρεσία σε αντίστοιχη θέση (επιθυμητή)
  • Πολύ καλή γνώση σε Microsoft λειτουργικά συστήματα (Windows 10)
  • Γνώση λειτουργίας δικτύων TCP/IP
  • Γνώση συστημάτων backup και restoring
  • Γνώση web εφαρμογών
  • Πολύ καλή γνώση αγγλικών
  • Όρεξη για δουλειά και ευχέρεια εργασίας σε απαιτητικό περιβάλλον
  • Υπευθυνότητα, συνέπεια και τήρηση αυστηρών χρονοδιαγραμμάτων


Επιθυμητά προσόντα:


  • Γνώσεις λειτουργίας βάσεων δεδομένων
  • Βασικές γνώσεις MS-DOS
  • Γνώση Active Directory, DNS και DHCP
  • Γνώσεις σε τηλεφωνικά κέντρα
  • ESET Αntivirus


Παροχές:


  • Σταθερή και μόνιμη συνεργασία με προοπτικές εξέλιξης
  • Δυναμικό και σύγχρονο εργασιακό περιβάλλον
  • Συνεχής εκπαίδευση

Title: Junior IT
Skills: Active Directory|Domain Name System (DNS)|Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)|Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)|Infor Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)|Internet Protocol Suite (TCP/IP)|MS-DOS|Transmission Control Protocol (TCP)|Windows|Windows 10|
Job Description:
About the job

Overview


About PepsiCo


PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers more than one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo generated more than $79 billion in net revenue in 2021, driven by a complementary beverage and convenient foods portfolio that includes Lay’s, Doritos, Cheetos, Gatorade, Pepsi-Cola, Mountain Dew, Quaker, and SodaStream. PepsiCo's product portfolio includes a wide range of enjoyable foods and beverages, including many iconic brands that generate more than $1 billion each in estimated annual retail sales.


Guiding PepsiCo is our vision to Be the Global Leader in Beverages and Convenient Foods by Winning with PepsiCo Positive (pep+). pep+ is our strategic end-to-end transformation that puts sustainability and human capital at the center of how we will create value and growth by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for planet and people. For more information, visit www.pepsico.com.


Building a more sustainable food system is critical for the health of our communities and the planet we all share. Take a look at the latest efforts by PepsiCo to fight climate change, protect natural resources, and more: https://pepsico.com/sustainability/strategy


Why PepsiCo Hellas?


PepsiCo Hellas currently employs around 1000 people at its 2 sites, including our headquarters in Athens. With well-known strong brands such as Pepsi, Lay’s, Quaker and Lipton, we are constantly ranked in the Top 3 Employers in the Country. We pride ourselves on being a great place to work and were rewarded for the the 7th time with the Top Employer certification Greece and Europe.


Joining PepsiCo means joining a dedicated team where innovation and forward thinking are encouraged.


We are an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity and inclusivity at our company; it is an essential part of our success. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, pregnancy or maternity, marital/civil partnerships, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation, gender or gender reassignment, disability or race including color, nationality, ethnic or national origin.


Please also visit www.pepsico.com/about/diversity-and-engagement for more information on what we do in practice to embrace diversity and inclusivity in the working surroundings and in society.


Responsibilities


The Helpdesk & Tactical Buy agent (HD & TB agent) role has two dimensions: the Helpdesk function is to support the End Users in resolving incidents and service requests and the Tactical Buy function is part of PepsiCo’s integrated procurement process.


Responsibilities:


  • Helpdesk
  • Incident Management process, including: Identification & Logging - Categorization & Prioritization - Initial Diagnosis & Assignment - Investigation & Diagnosis - Resolotion & Recovery - Closure - Review.
  • Service requests from end users using the myBUY tool.
  • Tactical Buy
  • Execute standardized tactical buying processes, use of appropriate tactical buy tools and negotiations.
  • Identify potential vendors and obtain quotes as needed according to the company’s policy.
  • Achieve targets and maintain the appropriate control environment to secure quality and service standards.
  • Use tactical buy system (myBUY) to process requests and to increase adoption.
  • Improve purchasing process, considering procurement policies.
  • Support to deliver on Continuous Improvement agenda and myBUY automation target.
  • Support the Demand Generation activities in driving spend into the pipeline.


Qualifications


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • 6+ Years of experience
  • Good interpersonal skills (needs to be able to build relationships over the phone without meeting suppliers / customers on a regular basis)
  • Experience in Incident Management
  • Procurement and analytical background
  • ERP (SAP / ARIBA) experience
  • Ability to understand the processes and to analyze sourcing data
  • Good IT (procurement) skills. PC (Windows, Word, Excel, Power Point)
  • Greek language
  • Good English level

Job Description:
About the job

Do you want to be part of the next big thing in FinTech?


Our partner, a German based international player, is an independent payment service provider that offers a wide range of payment processing services, international merchant accounts and IPSP accounts. The company provides online and mobile payment solutions through its own international banking network, and its own connected alternative payment solutions.


A new development team is currently being established in Thessaloniki. It has both the mindset & originality of an exciting start up, with lean/agile practices, a flat hierarchy, but with the stability & security of being a world-famous organization as well.


For the strengthening of our Team in Thessaloniki, we are looking for a


Mid-level Back End Software Engineer FinTech (m/w/d), in full-time and permanent employment. On site, hybrid or fully remote.



JOB DESCRIPTION

You enjoy laying the foundations for how engineering is practiced within the company. In order to design and deliver excellent product quality, you collaborate with cross functional and cross international development teams, as well as with team leads and architects. You will work closely with front-end developers to deliver consistent and reliable app experiences. Your primary goal is to improve usability for the customers.



Your responsibilities:

  • Implement the backend of the application and ensure that the software functionality matches the product requirements.
  • Develop and document comprehensive application logic and API endpoints.
  • Handle function-testing and maintain a good quality code.
  • Maintain comprehensive documentation (user guide, release log, etc.)
  • Follow agile principles.



Your profile:

  • Bachelor’s degree (higher education in the field of Information technology desirable)
  • Previous experience as a Backend developer or similar role
  • Technical background and good understanding of Software development life cycle (SDLC)
  • 2+ years’ experience with MSSQL, C#, .NET Core
  • Experience with AWS, Docker containers, Microservices, Elasticsearch, Git
  • Good knowledge of English
  • Strategic mindset that results in new ideas that drives the business forward.
  • Team player with great problem-solving and good organizational skills



What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive remuneration above market average
  • Private health insurance & flexible work arrangements.
  • State of the art technologies.
  • Career progression, trainings, personal & professional development.
  • Employee Assistance Program - anonymous platform regarding mental health, financial aid, relationship advice, career advice etc.
  • Flat hierarchy & open-door culture
  • Tech conferences, meetups & team events.
  • Top location & high-tech equipment


Interested? Then apply for the position using the applicant button. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on +49 221 66 999-700. We are looking forward to meet you!


Your contact: Despoina Chourmouziadou, Recruiter

Job Description:
About the job

At Alpha Bank, we are shaping the future of banking in Greece.


Through our large-scale Transformation Program, we are changing the way we operate, the way we deliver results and the way we service our Customers.


· We understand our customers’ needs and design experiences around them.

· We work in partnership and invite diversity of skills and perspectives.

· We are forward-thinking and drive continuous improvement.

· We make things happen; we execute quickly and focus on what is essential.


If you are a change enthusiast who sets ambitious goals and works with a sense of purpose, we want to get to know you!


Join our team and #be_part_of_tomorrow

#AlphaBank #TheAlphaBlueprint #Tomorrow


Job Description


The Senior Cloud Engineer will be placed in the Cloud and Containers Team of Central Banking Systems section of Alpha Bank IT Infrastructure and Operations Division. The Senior Cloud Engineer will be responsible for administering our critical Red Hat Openshift Cluster installation where the Core Banking System application of the bank is hosted. The position will also assist in performing system optimization, integrity, availability and monitoring, communicating with team members and business stakeholders, and meeting very strict SLA’s.


He/She should be self-motivated with strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills, and the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and work both independently and in a team environment.


What you will be doing


  • Installing, configuring and managing Red Hat Enterprise Linux servers (physical server and virtual machines in standalone or cluster architecture).
  • Applying OS security hardening following Bank internal benchmarks and practices.
  • Installing, configuring and supporting Redhat Openshift Cluster platform.
  • Operating systems Upgrades, Patching, allocating resources, implementing backup policies.
  • Monitoring Openshift platform with Dynatrace, Prometheus and other embedded monitoring tools.
  • Troubleshooting services’ unavailability and performance tuning.
  • Manage and Execute custom ansible scripts as configuration to perform repetitive administrative tasks at ease.
  • Working in complex infrastructure projects like CBS containerization project and Web Banking Microservices EDG project.
  • Ensure the proper execution of Disaster Recovery Exercises for satisfying Business Continuity of mission critical systems.
  • Works in close coordination with development team to support new features, software releases, and other technical issues.


What you need to have


  • A Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or any other relevant technical-oriented field.
  • Master’s Degree will be considered a plus.
  • Professional certifications (e.g. Red Hat Linux, RedHat Openshift) will be considered a plus
  • Red Hat Ansible automation tool or any other relevant open source.
  • Microsoft DevOps CI/CD pipeline tool.
  • Experience in containerized environments (RH OpenShift platform, Docker and Kubernetes)
  • 5-7 years of relevant experience working as System administrator.
  • Fluency in English language, both written & spoken.
  • Business acumen, with emphasis on analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work effectively in ambiguous environments with conflicting priorities.
  • Work with tight schedules without sacrificing the quality of the deliverables.
  • Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills / Customer focus -client relationship management


What we offer


It’s all about our people. At Alpha Bank, you will enjoy:


  • A friendly and collaborative working environment that supports taking initiative and action.
  • A culture that centers around learning and continuous development and encourages everyone to bring their best self to work.
  • The opportunity to challenge your thinking through your participation in complex tasks and transformation projects.
  • Being part of a large organization with a leading role in the Greek economy and a strong presence in the community.
  • Flexible working options.
  • A competitive salary and benefits.


Alpha Bank offers a remote interview process and a work-from-home scheme during the implementation of the current social distancing measures.


All applications will be acknowledged and treated in utmost confidence.

Job Description:
About the job

Valmore Technologies is a young, ambitious, and flexible team that develops web applications in direct collaboration with an affluent American company, specializing in food safety data analytics. We are constantly looking for partners that love computer science and web technologies, with whom we will be able to grow together.


About you:


  • You are a problem solver – you do not just come back with questions. You analyze the situation, consider possible solutions, and come up with suggestions where possible.
  • You are a team player - the work of others is not only their concern, just as your work is not only yours.
  • You love computer science and you like to learn new things. A nice day at work is a day when you made something that until now you did not know how it could be done (or that it was possible).
  • You communicate timely - you discuss issues with teammates, and if something concerns you, you escalate as soon as possible.
  • You are willing, polite, and smile as often as possible.


Required experience/skills:


  • At least 2 years of prior experience in web development and Javascript in particular
  • Essential Stack skills: JavaScript/JQuery, React.js, Node.js, MongoDB
  • Nice-to-have Stack skills: Electron, Go, Vue.js, PHP, MySQL
  • Essential Tools skills: Git, Jira, Slack
  • Nice-to-have Tools skills: Docker, AWS
  • Fulfilled military obligations for male candidates
  • Excellent knowledge of English and Greek languages


What we offer:


  • An opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies, in an international, multicultural environment, alongside high-caliber IT professionals from the US and Greece, on the latest web technologies with contemporary tools
  • Competitive salary with full social security (IKA)
  • Private Health Insurance Plan
  • Remote or hybrid work & flexible hours
  • Continuous vocational training in the field of work with a perspective of development
  • Pleasant working environment


If you are interested in this opportunity and feel that your skills are compatible with the above requirements please send your CV now.


To help us evaluate your application better, along with your CV, please send us how you rate yourself in the following skills from 0 to 5:

  • HTML & CSS
  • JavaScript
  • PHP
  • React.js
  • Node.js
  • MongoDB
  • Docker
  • Git
  • CI/CD


where


0 = “I am not familiar with this technology”

1 = “I am familiar with this technology, but I am not confident working on it as yet.”

2 = “I have undergone some sort of training about this technology. I can pick it up and do some work on my own but I will need significant guidance”

3 = “I have fairly good knowledge of this technology. I have used it before in 1-2 projects and could contribute to professional work if I get moderate assistance from seniors”

4 = “I have worked with this technology in professional projects with customers and could contribute almost immediately if I join a team.”

5= "I am an expert at this technology, I could even help others"

About the job

Company Description

More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


A day in the life of a Project Manager


As a Project Manager, you will be part of highly skilled agile teams that design, develop, deploy, customize, and support break-through applications for EU Institutions/ Banking/ Telco/or Public.


Your main duties will be:


  • Perform Project Management for multiple projects, including, planning, the definition of tasks and deliverables, review of project deliverables, quality control, risk analysis & management, status reports, problem reporting & management, follow up
  • Develop a detailed project plan and track activities against plan providing regular, accurate, and timely reports
  • Draft project management deliverables such as the Business Case, Project Strategy or Vision documents; Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation
  • Ensure delivery of projects on-time, within scope and within budget; Successfully manage and minimize potential risks of the projects or any changes that may arise
  • Participate in functional and technical working groups and progress meetings; Effectively coordinate the project team (including external stakeholders) ensuring that team members are motivated; Act as liaison with the customer and sub-contractors


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, the leading IT company in Greece, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe. 


Qualifications


If you have


  • Degree in Computer Science or other relevant disciplines
  • At least 10 years of solid working experience in the IT Sector
  • At least 4 years of Proven experience in project management activities within software development field preferably with the European Institutions
  • Project Management Certification (Prince2, PMP, PMI methodology)
  • Excellent command of the English language (written & oral)
  • Familiar with Agile methodologies
  • Strong expertise in MS Project and other MS Office tools
  • Customer, Quality and Results-oriented approach
  • Efficient communicator and Team-Player
  • Highly competent in problem solving, methodical and flexible
  • Adept with reporting

…then this position is suitable for you!


This position comes with


  • Competitive compensation packages

  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment

Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

About the job

Responsibilities:

1. Assists and provides support to the Technical Superintendents in organizing, coordinating, monitoring and following-up outstanding items related to the projects.

8. Checks project-related invoices, obtains the necessary approvals and follows-up with their payment.

9. Assists in arrangement of the new equipment certification upon completion of installation and also files all forms and any relevant technical documentation.

10. Follows-up on vessels’ technical correspondence.

11. Provides any other related assistance as required by the Project Manager or the Technical Director.

  1. University degree in Naval Architecture, Engineering or any relevant field.

  3. Post-graduate studies in relevant field will be considered an asset.
  4. Fluency in English.
  5. Computer literate.
  6. Strong communication & organization skills.

We lead an active lifestyle, creating innovations to balance sports and nature, looking at the world without borders or prejudice, and inspiring change in our customers. Retail stores are the first point of contact with our consumers and the heart of adidas brand. Want to be a part of the ride? Join us now!

Job Description


Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?


Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours.


You work with the information security team as a competent and experienced information security and compliance specialist.


How You Will Contribute


You will assess information security risks in line with internal policy and external best practices, and support security of information and IT assets by testing security systems and applying security standards, policies, and procedures. Under the guidance of global information security lead, you will implement cyber security technology and provide day-to-day business support. Job Description:
About the job

About Us

Grant Thornton Greece is a member firm of Grant Thornton International Limited (GTIL), one of the leading organizations delivering audit, tax and advisory services. Every day we provide a diverse range of organizations with the kind of business and financial advice it takes to do this. Our ideas and insight empower our clients to make big decisions about the future and unlock their growth.

If you want to be part of this incredible journey Grant Thornton Greece has the opportunity for you. Our Environmental, social, risk, governance and compliance department is continuously growing, supporting clients of all different sizes across many different sectors and is currently seeking to employ a junior Internal Auditor for the positions of an Assistant or Associate.

Job Descriptions

The key responsibilities of the Assistant/Associate Internal Auditor will include
  • Participating in a broad range of internal audit as well as advisory projects
  • Helping in planning, executing and completing internal audits, business process control reviews and other activities related to regulatory compliance projects
  • Working in teams of qualified and highly motivated professionals
  • Interacting on a frequent basis with customers
  • Delivering excellent client service
  • Working collaboratively with other lines of service and practice areas to deliver other services
  • Maintain highest standards of business ethics

For Whom We’re Looking For
  • Someone who holds a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Exact or Applied Sciences. A Master’s degree or a professional qualification is a plus.
  • A 1 year experienced in Internal Audit professional standards, preferably with previous experience in an audit firm, or an Internal audit / Internal Control division of a Company/Organisation
  • A person who understands that excellent customer service is the key to client management.
  • Someone who is able to manage multiple engagements and competing priorities in a rapidly growing, fast-paced, interactive, results-based team environment.
  • Someone who is able to work in a team and to meet tight deadlines
  • Someone who is able to communicate in English and Greek and is an experienced user of MS Office

To be successful as an Assistant/Associate Internal Auditor in Grant Thornton Greece you need the following:
  • Effective communication and rapport building skills
  • Excellent report writing skills both in Greek and English language
  • Excellent analysis and data reporting skills
  • Advanced computer skills in MS Office and databases
  • The ability to work effectively on his/her own and as part of a team
  • Ability to deliver high quality services and solutions
  • An extremely high work ethic
  • Motivation for career progression and development

What will we offer to you?
  • Friendly and dynamic working environment, in which you can develop your skills and competencies
  • Competitive remuneration and benefits package
  • A work place with a strong focus on values and work-life balance and the joint aim to provide the best possible solutions for our clients
  • Formal training, coaching and mentoring
  • Your professional and personal success is our commitment

What you will need to do next?

Joining the Grant Thornton Greece family is easy! If you feel that you meet the criteria, have the passion to succeed and have the Grant Thornton values simply apply online by uploading an -up-to-date CV with your application and leave the rest to us!

We will ensure that all our resourcing activities are fair, transparent and consistent across the Greece. We want to ensure that the candidate experience is of the highest professional standard.

The Company is committed to providing equality of opportunity for all employees.

About the job

Description


Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with 105,000 employees and annual revenue of over € 11 billion. European number one in cybersecurity, cloud and high performance computing, the Group provides tailored end-to-end solutions for all industries in 71 countries. A pioneer in decarbonization services and products, Atos is committed to a secure and decarbonized digital for its clients. Atos operates under the brands Atos and Atos|Syntel. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the Next 20 Paris stock index.


The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education and research in a multicultural approach and contribute to the development of scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the Group enables its customers and employees, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably, in a safe and secure information space. www.atos.net


Unify is the Atos brand for communication and collaboration solutions. At the core of the Atos Digital Workplace portfolio, Unify technology enables organizations of all sizes to transform the way they collaborate, creating a more connected and productive workforce which can dramatically improve team performance, individual engagement and business efficiency.


Unify products represent a strong heritage of technology innovation, reliability and flexibility. Their award-winning intuitive user experience can be delivered through almost any device and in any combination of cloud or on-premise deployment. Augmented by Atos’ secure digital platforms, vertical solutions and transformation services, they set the global standard for a rich and reliable collaboration experience that empowers teams to deliver extraordinary results.


Our largest software development center , certified as a Great Place to Work since 2019, is located in Athens employing more than 270 highly skilled software professionals. Additionally, we have a team of over 30 professionals in charge of Global Operation & Service activities. Our office location is near the suburban railway, incorporating free parking slots.


Athens Center of Excellence is seeking for an enthusiastic Product Manager to join our dynamic team.


Requirements


  • Bachelor & Master in engineering school or equivalent university cycle, with a specialization in technology development
  • 5+ years of experience on sw products development
  • 3+ years as a Product Owner or Product Manager, preferably in an agile environment
  • Excellent understanding of sw development processes, methodologies and practices
  • Fluent in English language, both written and spoken
  • Good analytical thinking and decision making
  • Rigorous and adaptable, with excellent team spirit and good communication and negotiation skills


Responsibilities


As a Product Manager you will be responsible to shape and execute based on the company’s strategy via a product (line) commercial proposition/offering and roadmap


More specifically, you will


  • Create the product vision and strategy documents
  • Collaborate with Sales and Channel partners to define the best G2M approach and support execution
  • Analyze the market and based on the competition define differentiation approaches that offer unique value
  • Prototype with customers and partners and facilitate Product management workshops for exploring customer requirements
  • Explore monetization models and help define and execute on the pricing strategy and the revenue model
  • Organize all product phase activities (from initiation till phase-out)
  • Develop the business and technology partner ecosystem
  • Provide business analysis documents as inputs in project initiation phase
  • Create and manage the delivery of Product/Solution Roadmap
  • Ensure product success by working with cross-functional teams to realize the best product for the market.
  • Work with Project Management team to ensure product deliverables and assess and address technical risks.
  • Define success criteria for testing and product acceptance.
  • Review customer change requests and manage with technology teams


What You Need To Succeed


  • Demonstrated experience in leading a team as a Product Manager in a technology-focused business
  • Technical background with knowledge of software development, cloud technologies and agile processes (Agile, SAFe, Scrum)
  • Leadership DNA - proven ability to excite and lead cross-functional engineering teams
  • Proven experience in writing high-quality user stories from a persona perspective
  • Possess knowledge and act on requirement collection activities and prioritize features


Additional Skills To Be Considered As Advantages


  • Product Manager or Product Owner certifications
  • Knowledge of Project Management technics


Benefits


By joining us you will…


  • Work in a challenging multinational environment that consists of smart, talented and innovation-driven individuals.
  • Flexibility to work from our office or remote
  • A mentor will support you with your onboarding
  • Continuous training, innovation and patent opportunities
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Performance bonus
  • Meal voucher card
  • Employee Recognition awards
  • Private Health & Life Insurance
  • Employee Assistance Program- 24/7 psychological support
  • We stand by our employees with special parental benefits
  • 1 additional paid holiday per year
  • Social responsibility initiatives


If you think this sounds attractive, don’t hesitate to get in touch!


Atos does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, disability or sexual orientation. All recruitment decisions are based solely on qualifications, skills, knowledge and experience and relevant business requirements. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the applications process for people with disabilities.


Due to the current global COVID-19 pandemic we are all learning to operate in a new and different way. The safety and wellbeing of our current and future employees is and remains a top priority. We are, of course, still committed to growing and developing our organization so we will be continuing to recruit in areas over the coming months, by conducting candidate interviews remotely, using our own digital platform. If you apply for one of our positions, we will screen your application and respond to you as quickly as possible. We are confident that you will understand the measures that we have implemented given the current situation.

Title: PRODUCT MANAGER
Skills: Analytical Skills|Business Analysis|Communication|Customer Requirements|Negotiation|Product Management|Product Vision|Project Initiation|Team Leadership|User Stories|
Job Description:
About the job

Job description:



About Lightsource bp



Lightsource bp is a global leader in the development and management of solar energy projects. We are a 50:50 joint venture with bp with a mission to help drive the world’s transition to low carbon energy.

With solar set to increase tenfold in the next 20 years, we are well-positioned to capitalize on this growth. By joining the Lightsource bp team, you will ‘be the change’ on the world’s energy transition to a more sustainable future.

We pride ourselves on our entrepreneurial spirit as we continue to push the boundaries of an ever-changing energy landscape. By choosing a career with us, you can expect a challenging and fulfilling role surrounded by people who are passionate and have brilliant ideas about sustainable technology, innovation and making the world a better place.



What You’ll do (the role)

Summary



Lightsource bps Commercial Engineering Team provides technical support across all areas of the global organisation and for projects being developed across the globe.

Contributing to and supporting all areas of Lightsource bps Commercial Engineering Team, focusing on projects in early development and pre-construction phases and including ad hoc support to projects in construction.

Duties and Responsibilities



    • Focusing on projects in Greece (but also internationally), support the Project Development process (including Acquisitions), across all technical aspects including the review of the Technical Due Diligence and other internal or external reports;
    • Undertake Energy Yield Assessments (EYA);
    • Undertake LCOE Optimisation Analysis for new Projects;
    • Support the assessment of new technologies (modules, inverters, structures);
    • Perform Technical Performance Analysis for existing projects;
    • Support development of Basic Design, including layouts and SLDs;
    • Support Project Managers as needed across all technical aspects during construction period, Works Completion, PAC and FAC.
    • Coordinate and manage Technical Advisors (OE, LTA, etc) locally and internationally;
    • Review EPC Contractor bids, reports, orders, etc for compliance with Owner’s Requirements and EPC Contract appendices;
    • Undertake site visits to both new greenfield sites and sites under construction.
    • Support on engineering analysis of curtailment, performance evaluation of new technologies, etc.



Knowledge & Experience



  • 7+ years of experience in the Solar PV industry;
  • Good knowledge of PV generating technologies and constituent components (modules, inverters, structures, trackers, etc);
  • Good knowledge of EPC / O&M contracts, including Technical Appendices;
  • Experience in undertaking Energy Yield Assessment (EYA) and good knowledge of pertinent factors affecting PV plant performance;
  • Detailed knowledge of simulation software including PVsyst (AutoCAD, ArcGIS or other Solar software is a plus);
  • Experience with large-scale Solar PV plants in Greece, working either on the Developer, EPC Contractor or Technical Advisor side;
  • Good knowledge of the main players in the industry (TAs, investors, EPCs, third party labs, etc).



Who we’re looking for Knowledge / Experience



  • 7+ years of experience;
  • Solar PV industry is mandatory;
  • Good knowledge of PV generating technologies and constituent components (modules, inverters, structures, trackers, etc);
  • Good knowledge of EPC / O&M contracts, including Technical Appendices;
  • Experience in undertaking Energy Yield Assessment (EYA) and good knowledge of pertinent factors affecting PV plant performance;
  • Detailed knowledge of simulation software including PVsyst (AutoCAD, ArcGIS or other Solar software is a plus);
  • Experience with large-scale Solar PV plants in Greece, working either on the Developer, EPC Contractor or Technical Advisor side;
  • Good knowledge of the main players in the industry (TAs, investors, EPCs, third party labs, etc).



Qualifications



  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering
  • Master’s in Renewable Energy or related field is mandatory
  • Why you’ll make a great member of the team



Personal Qualities



  • Fluent English spoken and written;
  • Full Driving licence;
  • Proactive, autonomous, flexible and driven.
  • Forward thinking, a problem solver and solution provider;
  • Proactive and being able to prioritise workload;
  • Able to promote a positive working culture within the team;
  • Strong organisational and good communication skills both verbal and written.



Why you’ll want to work for us



Our company is a place where you can be yourself and grow; a place where your ideas and opinions matter.



Be you

We pride ourselves on being an inclusive community, where every individual is valued and treated with respect.



Be responsible

Our culture is driven by our core values. From operating safely to ensuring our solar projects are responsible and promote biodiversity.



Be recognized

Alongside a competitive salary, we offer a variety of benefits including annual bonus, retention bank, health insurance, pension and other local benefits.



Be inspired

Beyond your day-to-day working life at Lightsource bp, there’s a variety of initiatives that will contribute to your own personal development. Initiatives to get involved with including our charitable causes, supporting our solar honey project or our sustainability initiatives.



Our Core Values

Lightsource bp truly cares about creating a sustainable future through safe, responsible and meaningful low carbon energy projects. Our core values of Safety, Integrity, Respect, Sustainability and Drive are the guiding principles for everything we do.



https://www.lightsourcebp.com/careers/

Title: Engineering Manager Greece
Skills: Analytical Skills|Communication|Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC)|English|PV|Power Inverters|Problem Solving|Project Management|Solar Energy|Solar PV|
Job Description:
About the job

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


The opportunity


We are currently seeking highly motivated people to join the Technology Consulting practice in our Consulting Service Line, which is a leading provider of professional services to clients of all major industries.


Working together, we help clients better assess and improve their operations, grow revenue and manage risks to increase shareholder value. You will build valued relationships with clients and other members of our team and focus on high-impact opportunities and projects.


Your Key Responsibilities


  • Project management including proposals for project strategies, planning, definition of tasks and deliverables, quality control, risk analysis and management, status reports, problem reporting and management systems, follow up and organization.
  • Guide project activities and review deliverables as applicable.
  • Participate in functional and technical working groups and progress meetings, collaborate effectively with project stakeholders in Waterfall or Agile or hybrid delivery environments.
  • Estimate costs, timescales and resource requirements for the successful completion of each project to agreed terms of reference.
  • Prepare and maintain project and quality plans and tracks activities against the plan, provide regular and accurate reports.
  • Monitor costs, timescales and resources used, and take action where these deviate from agreed tolerances. Ensure that delivered IT systems/solutions are implemented within these criteria.
  • Manage the change control procedure gaining agreement for revisions to the project from project sponsors.


To qualify for the role you must have


  • University degree in a relevant subject.
  • 2- 10 years of professional experience in IT Solutions Project Management.
  • Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills in Greek and English.
  • Good knowledge of English, both written and verbal.
  • Willingness to learn and continuously expand technical and business skills
  • Travelling availability and potential work on projects abroad.
  • Completed military obligations (where applicable).
  • Proven experience in managing the full life-cycle (all phases) of an IT project
  • Knowledge and experience with Waterfall and/or Agile and/or hybrid delivery methodologies
  • Experience in an Agile team role (e.g. Scrum Master, Product Owner, Tribe/Chapter Lead, Release Train Engineer) would be an additional asset although not a prerequisite
  • Very good MS- Project and MS-Office skills; JIRA tool skills are desirable
  • Project Management and/or Agile certifications are desirable


What We Look For


What’s most important is that you’re dedicated to working with your colleagues as part of a high-performing team. You’ll need to demonstrate enthusiasm, high motivation and passion to develop fast in a multinational working environment. You’ll need to thrive in picking up new skills and talents as you go, so natural curiosity, a lot of questions and the confidence to speak up when you see something that could be improved are essential. If you’ve got the right combination of technical knowledge and communication skills, this role is for you.


What We Offer


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:


  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.


EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: IT Project Manager
Skills: Communication|Greek|IT Solutions|Oral Communication|Presentations|Project Management|Risk Analysis|Technical Writing|Waterfall Project Management|Writing|
Job Description:
About the job

Position summary:

This position reports into PHARMAQ BU LEAD SOUTHERN EUROPE CLUSTER and is based in Greece.

The KAM position will be the responsible for, upon close collaboration with the local Distributor, coordinating and executing the commercial strategy designed and agreed for the Greek aquaculture market, focusing on the direct accountability of the main Key Accounts management, through commercial and high-level technical support. Eventually should also lend some technical support to a few international customers. Promotional activities deployment with customers in the country will be upon his/her responsibility too.

Position responsibilities:

Focused on the direct accountability of main Key Accounts management, through commercial and high-level technical support: establish a list of business goals per customer and design the short and long term strategy and the PoA to reach it out.

Build and keep a positive and fluid relationship with the Greek distributor, guaranteeing a strong commercial & technical synergy before the customers and helping to reach out OP goals assigned for the country

Responsible of promotional activities deployment with customers in the country.

Lend technical support to few international customers inside EUMed Region

Education and experience:

  • Holding an University degree in any Aquaculture health related field (Veterinary, Ichthyopathology, Biology) is mandatory.
  • Additional training in finances, marketing, sales (MBA/ MSc Marketing) preferred.
  • 3-5 years of experience in commercial & technical roles linked to aquaculture companies (producers or suppliers), preferably in a KAM role.
  • Languages: Greek (native), English (fluent), other EU languages
  • Driving license

Technical skills:

  • Commercial profile with a solid technical training.
  • Negotiation, communication Seminars.
  • Proactive, autonomous, customer-obsessed, multi-task mindset.
  • Computer literacy.
  • Knowledge of statistic tools will be highly valued.

Local travel willingness (and few international ones). Estimated required travel time about 40-60% depending on seasons.


About Zoetis


At Zoetis we are passionate about our customers and the animals in their care. We discover, develop and manufacture the world's most innovative and effective products for animal health-medicines, vaccines, diagnostics, genetic tests, biodevices-and we are creating the next generation of integrated solutions and services to support this evolving industry. We know our people drive our success. Our colleagues are proud of our company culture and the meaningful role we play in caring for animals. The Zoetis Core Beliefs define the commitments we make to our colleagues, customers and stakeholders every day. They have guided the creation of our award-winning workplace and our proud position as a leading partner of choice in animal health.





Diversity, Equity & Inclusion


Our Colleagues Make the Difference, and we know their differences make Zoetis stronger. We strive to create an environment where each colleague feels valued and cared for and where we can be our best every day. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) focus and commitment begins with our leadership team of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ethnicities (50% of our executive team members are women), and it is demonstrated in our support of our colleagues and industry. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Council, representing colleagues across locations, functions and communities, serve as ambassadors and champions for DE&I initiatives. In addition to the Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Council, Zoetis has six colleague resource groups that bring together colleagues who share similar backgrounds, experiences, or interests and work together toward goals aligned with our strategic business priorities.





Our commitment to advancing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion has earned us recognitions as a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality, a 100 Best Company for Working Mothers, a Top Company for Executive Women, among many others.





For animals. For health. For you.

Title: Aquaculture Technical Account Manager Greece

Job Description:
About the job

Business Context And Main Purpose Of The Role

The main purpose of the country-based GEO IT Innovation Analyst\Technical PM is to participate and even coordinate IT projects for all their phases from idea and requirements collection to country rollout, according to global and local plans and guidelines. The daily job requirements will be a transition between service, developer, and technical project manager roles while working as a member of virtual and geographically distributed teams.

Main Accountabilities
  • Support IT Mgr. in delivering the IT agenda in co-operation with the rest of the IT team.
  • Drive and deliver local projects either as an IT analyst/developer or technical project manager.
  • Pioneer and adopt new technologies to support Proof of Concept and/or Business cases.
  • Interact comfortably with stakeholders at all levels in Business and Technology areas.
  • Coordinate technical and process changes by setting up plans and executing them.
  • Lead Software Lifecycle Management by keeping IT records up-to-date and shaping development plans.
Key Skills
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Team player, but also able to work independently.
  • Proactive.
  • Good working knowledge of pipelines, integrations, and ETL architecture.
  • Good working knowledge of Python, ideally Apache Spark.
  • Good working knowledge of Azure Cloud Services (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Logic Apps, Azure DevOps, Data Lake).
  • Knowledge of RPA tools and technologies and IT security.
Background Requirements
  • IT relevant University / Graduate degree (Master’s degree)
  • 3-5 years of experience of which the last 1 on project work
  • Excellent communication & stakeholder management skills
  • Fluent in Greek & English
  • IT Project Management experience. Agile\scrum or a waterfall methodology certificate would be considered an advantage.
  • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Power Platform (Power Bi, Power Automate, Power Apps).
Our Company Offers
  • Continuous training
  • Progressive work experience and steadily increasing responsibility
  • International career opportunities
  • Competitive remuneration
CVs will be treated in strict confidentiality.

Candidates, who meet specified qualifications, will be contacted by e-mail or telephone.

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

Title: Geo IT Innovation Analyst/Technical Project Manager
Skills: Communication|Databases|Greek|Microsoft Power Automate|Project Management|Project Work|Software Lifecycle|Software Lifecycle Management|Stakeholder Management|Technical Support|
Job Description:
About the job

Come create the technology that helps the world act together.

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world. We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

The team you’ll be part of

The pandemic has highlighted how important telecoms networks are to society. Nokia’s Network Infrastructure group is at the heart of a revolution to bring more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise.

We need talented software developers to further the tremendous success of the IP Routing product family. We are #2 in carrier edge routing world-wide with over a million platforms shipped to over 1000+ customers in 130+ countries. We lead the industry in Network Processor technology, QoS, parallel processing, Network Function Virtualization, and, importantly, product quality. Join a highly talented team, delivering the leading technology which makes the internet go!

What You Will Learn And Contribute To
  • Contribute to all phases of software development, from requirements gathering through implementation and sustaining
  • Participate in defining requirements with product management
  • Design and develop complex modules of embedded code
  • Troubleshoot and resolve defects
  • Support QA validation and sustaining team.

We believe in Subject Matter Expertise and code ownership. We keep the process simple, so developers can focus on code. If you are proud of your code, you belong on our team!

Your Skills And Experience

 Minimum Requirements:
  • Bachelors degree or equivalent in Computer Science or similar field
  • 2+ years of embedded systems development in C/C++
  • Hands-on experience on switching/routing system software development.
  • Hands on experience with software development on Linux
  • Strong communication, teamwork and problem-solving skills are essential

Preferred Qualifications:
  • IP network fundamentals, including network architecture, routing and signaling protocols.
  • Advanced operating system fundamentals, including kernel operations, scheduling, memory management, semaphores
  • Knowledge of Real Time Operating systems (RTOS) like VxWorks is a plus.
  • Experience designing and developing software from hardware specifications
  • Background in low level software like I2C, PMBUS, fan algorithm or lane tuning is a plus
  • Experience with virtualization technologies, Dockers/Containers, Namespaces, etc.
  • Experience in designing and developing programmable management interfaces using gNMI, NETCONF, gNOI.
  • Excellent debugging skills and experience using various software and memory debugging tools

What We Offer

Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.
  • Competitive salary
  • Annual bonus
  • Life/Medical Insurance plan
  • Annual Medical Check-up program
  • Pension Plan
  • Ticket Restaurant e-card
  • Company mobile device and subscription
  • Company bus transportation
  • Flexible working hours
  • Social clubs and cultural activities
  • Career growth and development opportunities

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:
  • One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
  • Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
  • Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
  • LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.

Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

Our team is growing!

Raffoul Development is a construction company based in Athens, Greece. Title: Project Manager
Skills: Analytical Skills|Communication|Construction|Critical Thinking|Employee Benefits|Engineering|English|Oral Communication|Project Management|Technical Documentation|
Job Description:
About the job

What We Will Offer

We will offer you a place where you can be yourself and where there are no limits on what you can achieve. With us, you can take ownership of your career and have honest conversations throughout. You would join an ambitious firm with a clear strategy for profitable growth where you can get early responsibility and early involvement in growing the business. Here you can expect a competitive and fair reward as well as recognition based on all round performance. This forms part of our internal promise to you, The Deal, between the firm and its employees.

Main Responsibilities

Providing secretarial assistance to the team by:
  • Proactively managing, controlling and having a full understanding of fee earner diaries using discretion and business knowledge to prioritise commitments. This will include extensive arrangements of appointments, conferences and meetings across different time zones and offices, using different processes and IT infrastructure (videoconferencing, tele-conferencing, client office software etc.).
  • Liaising regularly with fee earners to identify work commitments, prioritising workloads accordingly.
  • Prepare for all meetings, including preparation of all pre-reading documentation (if appropriate), follow up and coordinate all meeting actions, ensure they are properly recorded and dealt with, including any necessary follow-up communications.
  • Coordinate and assist with global visitors.
Coordinating the opening of new client matters

Organising client documents (delegating scanning, formatting, photocopying and collating of information where necessary)

Management and delegation of client filing and regular updating of client relationship management systems (Interaction)
  • Working within the Administration team to provide assistance to lawyers in the group - Arrange photocopying, printing, scanning, organising post and couriers, etc
Managing and maintaining diary planning and coordination for fee earners, making appointments and co-ordinating internal and external client meetings
  • Travel management, booking transport, hotels, client meetings and producing detailed itineraries. - Travel arrangements including liaison with travel company, arranging visas, booking travel and accommodation, arranging currency, preparing itineraries, ensuring compliance with the firm's Travel Policy at all times
Coordinating business development and client liaison initiatives for fee earners
  • Support lawyers in marketing activities including research and obtaining client information and data, as well as involvement in preparation of pitches and presentations
  • Support the internal business development team by undertaking an event secretary role, managing the e-alert process, assisting with legal directory administration and delegating tasks appropriately
  • Liaising with the firm's clients in a confident and professional manner - Build strong and effective relationships with, and develop and maintain a comprehensive knowledge of, internal and external clients and their teams
Dealing professionally and promptly with client calls and communications, including calls diverted to the team.
  • Act as gatekeeper for fee earners, taking appropriate messages and ensuring they are passed on/followed up appropriately
Attributes/Skills Required
  • At least three years of high-level administrative or personal assistant/secretary experience
  • Fluent or native English speaker
  • Excellent knowledge of Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
  • Excellent typing skills in both Greek and English
  • Commercial and financial acumen
  • A thorough understanding of working in a professional, service driven environment and stakeholder/client/business confidentiality
  • Confident and professional manner with the ability to build strong relationship with fee earners and clients
  • Excellent communication skills n both English and Greek and the ability to interact at all levels
  • Collaborative and supportive of the business and its initiatives
  • Adaptable and open to change showing a willingness and confidence to make suggestions for change where appropriate
  • Strong organisational skills and excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to remain proactive and flexible at all times
  • Reliable, hardworking, work to tight deadlines and have the ability to remain calm when under pressure
  • Anticipate and identify potential problems and provide innovative solutions
  • A strong team player
This job description is indicative only and does not represent an exhaustive list of responsibilities. The firm reserves the right to alter or change the responsibilities at any time, in line with the firm's strategy and business needs.

We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to having a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, disability, sexual orientation, culture or any other protected characteristics. We aim to create a culture where everyone can be themselves and is valued for their strengths and unique perspectives

About The Firm

With 8 offices worldwide and with our headquarters based in London, Stephenson Harwood is a law firm where our people are committed to achieving the goals of our clients - listed and private companies, institutions, and individuals across the globe. Our mix of expertise and culture results in a combination of deep local insight and the capability to provide a seamless international service.

Our experience encompasses corporate, commercial litigation and arbitration, employment, pensions and private wealth, finance, marine and international trade, and real estate and projects.

We assemble teams of bright thinkers to match our clients' needs and give the right advice from the right person at the right time. Dedicating the highest calibre of legal talent to overcome the most complex issues, we deliver pragmatic, expert advice that is set squarely in the real world.

We understand the power of diversity in delivering that high calibre advice to our clients. We want to attract diverse talent and we particularly encourage applications from underrepresented demographics.

Our Values

Individuality - We encourage creativity and develop talent

Commitment - To be the best and deliver the highest standard

Teamwork - We work together to build close, long-term relationships

Straight talking - We say what we mean and do what we say

These values express the personality of the individuals within our firm. They are the behaviours we encourage in our people and the standards which inform our decisions and actions.

Our vision into 2026

To be a successful firm where talented people work together in an entrepreneurial environment, building long term client relationships.

This vision is about who we want to be, as well as who we are. It is as much about our values as about our character – the attributes we want to see from all of our people. It also reflects the importance of remaining independent - a clear sign that we are confident in our own future.

That's how we unlock our entrepreneurial spirit, advising our clients with top performing teams.

A key part of the 2026 strategy is to focus on five core sectors: decarbonisation, life sciences, private capital & funds, technology, and transportation & trade. These have been identified as crucial in the drive for accelerated profitable growth.

Title: Office Administrator
Skills: Administrative Assistance|Client Liaison|Delegation|Financial Literacy|Gatekeeper|Greek|Organization Skills|Personal Assistance|Sales Presentations|Typing|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


A day in the life of a DevOps Engineer


As a DevOps Engineer, you will be a part of a vibrant and agile team responsible for designing and implementing automated solutions to support applications development at all stages (from dev environment to production ), while you will be closely collaborating with stakeholders such as the Software development engineers, test engineers, etc. of internal teams as well as on the customers’ side.


Your main duties will be to:


  • Build and set up development tools and infrastructure
  • Design and implement application life cycle management methodology based on State of the Art CI/CD tools Test and review automation Code.
  • Propose, design, implement and continuously improve DevOps services such as Logging, Monitoring etc.
  • Automate and improve development and release processes
  • Install, configure, and maintain a harmonized deployment workflow
  • Apply cybersecurity measures


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, a leading IT company, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts in Greece. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe.


Qualifications


If you have:


  • Degree in Computer Science or similar field
  • Experience in a DevOps or a similar role
  • Experience with UNIX/Linux environments
  • Strong understanding of DevOps, Agile and Cybersecurity concepts
  • Familiarity with continuous integration/delivery tools (e.g. Jenkins)
  • Familiarity with build tools (e.g. Maven) and scripting/programming languages (e.g. Python, Groovy, Bash)
  • Experience with git and git workflows
  • Knowledge of containers (e.g. Docker) and container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes)
  • Ability to take initiative
  • Accountability, attention to detail
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Good communication skills and Teamwork
  • Excellent command of the English Language (written & verbal)


…then this position is suitable for you!


It would also be a plus if you had :


  • Experience with Infrastructure-as-Code (e.g. Terraform) and Configuration-as-Code (e.g. Ansible) tools
  • Familiarity in building and operating CI/CD pipelines (e.g. using GitLab CI/CD, GitHub Actions)
  • Familiarity with cloud services (e.g. Azure, AWS)


This position comes with


  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business), and fast career growth
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: DevOps Engineer (Mid-Senior)
Skills: Application Development|Attention to Detail|Communication|Computer Science|DevOps|English|Git|Linux|Problem Solving|Software Development|
Job Description:
About the job

Wealthyhood is the first DIY wealth-building app for long-term investors. 💰


Our mission is to empower people to take control of their financial future by providing an intuitive app that simplifies the investment process. We believe that everyone deserves access to the tools and knowledge 🧠 necessary to grow their wealth, and we're committed to making that a reality.


📣 We've grown to over 20,000 users and are looking for a talented Senior Software Engineer to become a key member of our engineering team and help evolve Wealthyhood's investing experience across the web and mobile! 🚀


😎 As a Senior Software Engineer, you will...


  • Design, implement, and debug new features and products.
  • Work with modern technologies including Node.js, TypeScript, React and MongoDB.
  • Participate in code reviews and set the standards for software engineering best practices.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand user needs and develop technical solutions.
  • Ship efficient, reliable, crash-free code while working across the stack.
  • Code without fear, supported by continuous builds, tests, a constructive code-review process, and a supportive culture of identifying and fixing bugs.
  • Contribute to all phases of the software development lifecycle, from planning to deployment and maintenance.
  • Continuously learn about new technologies and modern software practices.



🔝 You will thrive in this role if you...


  • Have significant experience in software development and have delivered highly complex and critical software that is used by thousands of users.
  • Have a product mindset, care about the business impact of what you're building and understand the importance of building scalable, maintainable software.
  • Possess excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail and take ownership of your deliverables.
  • Are a team player who enjoys collaborating with others and sharing your knowledge.
  • Have a solid understanding of software engineering best practices, including testing, documentation, and code modularity.
  • Get excited about a wide range of technical topics and dig deep into them.



💪🏽 It would be great if you had...


  • Familiarity with our technology stack: Node.js, TypeScript, React, and MongoDB. (even if you don’t you should still consider applying)
  • Experience with applications that have crossed the threshold of 1M users.
  • Past experience at a startup.
  • Experience in the fintech sector, good understanding or interest in financial and investment concepts.
  • Familiarity with mobile technologies.



🧧 Our perks


  • Competitive pay and company stock options – we are all in this together!
  • 21 days’ holiday a year, excluding bank holidays (you may end up with 30 days off if lucky 🤞🏼).
  • Snacks, fresh fruit and great coffee.
  • Hybrid work: 1-2 days work-from-home per week and flexible remote working, if you need to travel!
  • Collaborative, inclusive, and supportive company culture!
  • The chance to make a real impact on how your friends and family deal with their personal finances! 💸



📩 How to apply?


If you're excited about helping people take control of their financial future and a passion for providing exceptional customer support, we'd love to get to know you. Apply now and join our mission to democratise investing for everyone!


Drop us an e-mail at hello@wealthyhood.com or apply on LinkedIn and let us know why you want to join Wealthyhood! 🚀
