Title: Restaurant Manager
Skills: Budgeting|Easily Adaptable|Finance|Food and Beverage Operations|Hospitality Industry|Leadership|Management|Operations|Restaurant Management|Skilled Multi-tasker|
Job Description:
About the job

Role: Senior Project Manager

Location: Athens, Greece (hybrid)

Global Perspectives an IQVIA business has the mission is to help scientists improve health outcomes by better understanding patients and their treatment preferences in non-interventional Clinical studies.

This is a key role within Global Perspectives, being responsible for the successful planning, design, initiation, execution, monitoring, and ultimate success of a project.

What the role looks like
  • Design effective strategies based on the characteristics and requirements of each study to engage patient groups around the world
  • Bring together multidisciplinary teams around the world: manage relationships with clients and suppliers throughout all stages of the projects
  • Participate and/or drive feasibility studies, supplier selection and proposals to the client
  • Monitor data quality, ensuring a successful project evolution and completion, as well as ensuring customer satisfaction
What you need to apply
  • University graduates from a variety of backgrounds such as business, marketing, science, social science or healthcare
  • +2 years of experience in projects in market research, clinical studies or project management within the healthcare sector. More important is an interest in business, an insatiable curiosity, and the desire to find and implement solutions via critical thinking
  • A very high level of English and experience living or studying in an English-speaking country. Our Project Managers talk every day with clients in the US and UK to create strategies to engage patients to take part in their clinical studies.
  • Excellent communication and organisation skills
  • Curious with a great interest in learning
  • An impressive track record of achievement
  • Good IT and MS Office skills
This is an exciting opportunity to be part to contribute to IQVIA Patient Voice offer. IQVIA is a leading global provider of information services, innovative technology solutions and research which focuses on the use of data and science to help its health sector clients find better solutions for their patients.

IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Senior Project Manager - Patient Recruitment
Skills: Client Relations|Communication|Customer Satisfaction|Feasibility Studies|Program Management|Project Coordination|Project Delivery|Project Management|Project Planning|Supplier Evaluation|
Job Description:
About the job

Verification & Validation Engineer - Motion Control and Robotic Systems

RoboteQ is an international company, a subsidiary of Nidec Motor Corporation, a renowned maker of Motor Controllers and Navigation Sensors for Mobile Robots, Industrial Automation, and Electrification of off-road Vehicles.

We are pleased to announce an opportunity for a Verification & Validation Engineer based near Athens, Greece.

Summary of Role

In this role as Verification & Validation Engineer, you will be working with a highly motivated team to bring to market innovative solutions for customers in the AGV, Robotics and Industrial Automation Markets. Key aspects for this role will be to conduct thorough testing and verification of software and hardware components of our products to ensure they meet functional, performance, and safety requirements.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Work closely with firmware and hardware engineers to develop and execute test programs and procedure for verifying the firmware of our motion control products.
  • Develop and deploy functional test systems for production test.
  • Debug and fix existing failed automated test cases.
  • Design and execute regression test suites.
  • Propose new testing methods, tools and frameworks.
  • Plan, create and manage the overall Quality Planning strategy.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering or computer Science and 3 years experiences of working in QA automation.
  • Proficient in LabView and test tools.
  • Understanding of Electricity and Electronics.
  • Experience in C programming and Integrated Development Environments.
  • Ability to design Electrical boards for testing purposes.
  • Knowledge of communication Fieldbuses: CAN, EtherCAT, Profinet, Modbus, etc.
  • Basic computer or/and PLC programming skills is considered as a plus.
  • Knowledge of Motion Control and Robotics is considered as a plus.
  • Good time management skills.
  • English language: good speaking and writing level.
  • Good communication skills, positive attitude, and eagerness to learn.


Location:

  • Markopoulo, Attica, Greece, 19003


Reference:

  • RQ-VVE2301

About the job

We are looking for a talented Network/Security Engineer to join our team of IT professionals on behalf of one of our major clients in the banking sector.


Responsibilities:

  • Execute technical implementations, upgrades, configurations, changes, and level 3 support for all network security systems/platforms
  • Test and maintain network infrastructures including software and hardware devices
  • Integrate new systems into existing network architectures and collaborate with IT teams on various projects
  • Keep up-to-date on new and emerging security technologies and threats


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, System Administration, or a closely related field
  • At least (3) years of proven work experience in the Network and Network Security field in which you have been doing design and engineering work for a large enterprise
  • Strong technical skills and a good understanding of networking concepts and protocols
  • Previous exposure in managing F5 or Citrix load balancers, Checkpoint Firewalls and IPS modules
  • Experience in designing and deploying LAN/WAN infrastructures and network security protocols
  • In depth knowledge of Network Security and Layer 3 Technologies
  • Experience with VPN Architecture, Remote Access Solutions
  • Advanced network troubleshooting skills, utilizing packet capture/analysis packages such as Wireshark, etc.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (in both Greek and English)



Benefits

  • Private Insurance
  • A dynamic challenging environment resulting continuous learning/education/progression
  • Ability to work with cutting edge technologies
  • Pleasant working environment
  • Ability to expand knowledge and responsibilities


UpcoMinds is a dynamic IT company with 25 years of experience that provides end-to-end web and mobile solutions helping businesses to reinvent themselves in the digital world. Our team’s skills and expertise will ensure the holistic digital transformation of any organization, which will considerably improve both business operations and customer’s experience.

Our goal is to always have our end products and services reflect our deep engineering skills and elegant progressive design aesthetic. We fundamentally believe deeply in developing long term strategic partnerships with our clients by exceeding expectations and maintaining a high level of transparency.


Find out more about us at www.upcominds.com


We commit to promote Inclusion & Diversity by creating a working environment where all employees are treated with dignity and respect and where individual differences are valued. We offer equal opportunity in all aspects of employment.


Our recruitment consultants will go through your Curriculum Vitae as soon as possible and get back to you to discuss the opportunity for which you apply. If you don’t hear from us in the coming ten (10) working days, you may consider that you have not been selected for the particular job.

Title: Verification Validation Engineer
Skills: EtherCAT|Functional Testing|Industrial Automation|LabVIEW|Motion Control|PLC Programming|QA Automation|Robotics|Test Automation|Verification and Validation (V&V)|
Job Description:
About the job

Η VARIO Α.Ε. ιδρύθηκε το 2004 και είναι το μέλος της Inpacs για την Ελλάδα και την Κύπρο. Σήμερα, η εταιρεία είναι ένας από τους μεγαλύτερους προμηθευτές επαγγελματικών προϊόντων και αναλώσιμων για επιχειρήσεις (προϊόντα χάρτου, αναλώσιμα catering, απορρυπαντικά, εργαλεία καθαρισμού, προϊόντα ατομικής προστασίας, διαχείριση απορριμμάτων, hotel amenities κ.ά.).


Οι περισσότεροι από 5.000 κωδικοί των προϊοντικών λύσεων της VARIO (το 60% των προϊόντων που προσφέρει στους πελάτες της είναι eco-friendly και, παράλληλα, έχει διακριθεί με GOLD Award κατά EcoVadis) χρησιμοποιούνται καθημερινά σε χιλιάδες σημεία σε όλη τη χώρα, όπως ξενοδοχεία, βιομηχανίες, αλυσίδες εστίασης, μονάδες υγείας, γραφεία επιχειρήσεων, αεροδρόμια κ.ά.


Το όραμα της VARIO είναι να γίνει ο “Your Business Supply Partner” δημιουργώντας για τους ανθρώπους, τους επισκέπτες και τους πελάτες κάθε σύγχρονης επιχείρησης ένα ακόμα πιο υγιεινό, ασφαλές, φιλόξενο και βιώσιμο περιβάλλον.


Ρόλος Θέσης

Ο/ Η υποψήφιος/α είναι υπεύθυνος/η για τη συντήρηση, τη διαμόρφωση και την αξιόπιστη λειτουργία των πληροφοριακών συστημάτων της εταιρείας. Θα συμμετέχει στην έρευνα και ανάπτυξη νέων τεχνολογιών για να βελτιώνονται συνεχώς οι τεχνολογικές υποδομές και να συμβαδίζουν με τις επιχειρηματικές ανάγκες πληροφορικής του οργανισμού. Ο/Η υποψήφιος/α αναφέρεται στον IT Manager.


Αρμοδιότητες Θέσης | Responsibilities

  • Παρακολούθηση και διατήρηση της ασφάλειας του δικτύου και των συστημάτων με σκοπό την εξασφάλιση συνεχούς και αδιάλειπτης λειτουργίας των υποδομών της εταιρείας (server, workstation, δίκτυα, firewall, backup process).
  • Εντοπισμός και επίλυση πιθανών και πραγματικών κυβερνοεπιθέσεων (cyber security)
  • Εγκατάσταση και αναβάθμιση εξαρτημάτων και λογισμικού υπολογιστών (Server, Storage, Laptop & Desktop)
  • Αντιμετώπιση προβλημάτων υλικού και λογισμικού εκτελώντας διαγνωστικά, τεκμηριώνοντας προβλήματα και λύσεις, ιεραρχώντας προβλήματα και αξιολογώντας τον αντίκτυπο των ζητημάτων
  • Παροχή εκπαίδευσης και τεχνικών προδιαγραφών στο προσωπικό για τη σωστή χρήση των υλικοτεχνικών υποδομών και των εφαρμογών
  • Εκτέλεση τακτικών λειτουργιών δημιουργίας αντιγράφων ασφαλείας και εφαρμογή κατάλληλων διαδικασιών για την προστασία δεδομένων και την ανάκτηση από καταστροφές
  • Τεχνική υποστήριξη υπολογιστών και περιφερειακών γραφείου, διασφαλίζοντας ότι όλες οι εφαρμογές των σταθμών εργασίας και τα προβλήματα εξοπλισμού επιλύονται έγκαιρα με περιορισμένες διακοπές
  • Επικοινωνία με προμηθευτές, εταιρείες-συνεργάτες πληροφορικής και λοιπό προσωπικό ΙΤ για την επίλυση προβλημάτων
  • Συμμετοχή σε νέα Project και στην ανάπτυξη / εφαρμογή νέων υποδομών / λειτουργιών


Προφίλ | Προσόντα Υποψηφίου | Requirements

  • Πτυχίο ΑΕΙ ή ΑΤΕΙ Πληροφορικής ή συναφούς αντικειμένου
  • Προϋπηρεσία τουλάχιστον 3 χρόνια σε αντίστοιχη θέση
  • Γνώσεις Cloud Computing (Microsoft Azure, Amazon)
  • Γνώσεις εγκατάστασης και διαχείρισης δικτύων (LAN, WAN, routers, switches, firewall, Access Point). Η γνώση διαχείρισης Fortigate Firewall θα εκτιμηθεί
  • Άριστη γνώση σε Microsoft Λειτουργικά συστήματα (Windows Server 2008/2012/2016/2019, Active Directory, Group Policies, DHCP)
  • Άριστες γνώσεις σε τεχνολογίες Microsoft Office365 / Microsoft Teams
  • Γνώσεις VMware Virtualization (vSphere, vCenter Server)
  • Γνώσεις διαχείρισης και επίβλεψης συστημάτων Blade και Storage
  • Γνώση συστημάτων Backup και Restore (Veeam, Azure backup) και συστημάτων antivirus
  • Πολύ καλή γνώση Αγγλικών
  • Ικανότητες εργασίας σε ομάδα, προγραμματισμού εργασιών και τήρησης χρονοδιαγραμμάτων
  • Άριστες επικοινωνιακές δεξιότητες, άνεση στον προφορικό και γραπτό λόγο και αναλυτική σκέψη
  • Εστίαση στη λεπτομέρεια


Η εταιρεία προσφέρει | Benefits

  • Ανταγωνιστικό σταθερό μισθό
  • Βonus scheme
  • Ιδιωτικό πρόγραμμα ασφάλισης υγείας
  • Συνταξιοδοτικό πρόγραμμα με συμμετοχή της εταιρίας (μετά από 1 έτος παραμονής)
  • Προγράμματα εκπαίδευσης
  • Επιπρόσθετες παροχές (παροχές προϊόντων, επιδόματα κ.ά.)
  • Ευχάριστο εργασιακό περιβάλλον που προάγει την ατομική πρωτοβουλία και την προσωπική ανάπτυξη
  • Συνεχής εκπαίδευση και προοπτικές εξέλιξης σε μία ταχέως και υγιώς αναπτυσσόμενη εταιρία


Αναγνωρίζουμε ότι ο σημαντικότερος παράγοντας της επιτυχίας μας είναι οι άνθρωποί μας. Γι’ αυτό προσφέρουμε ένα οργανωμένο εργασιακό περιβάλλον με ομαδικό πνεύμα και σύγχρονες αντιλήψεις διοίκησης. Παράλληλα, επενδύουμε στους ανθρώπους μας μέσω συνεχούς εκπαίδευσης και υποστηρίζουμε διαρκώς την περαιτέρω επαγγελματική τους ανάπτυξη. Εάν πιστεύετε ότι τα προσόντα και ο χαρακτήρας σας ταιριάζουν με τις απαιτήσεις του ρόλου, παρακαλούμε, όπως μας προωθήσετε το βιογραφικό σας.


H VARIO A.E. επεξεργάζεται, ως υπεύθυνος επεξεργασίας, τα προσωπικά δεδομένα που μας παρέχετε για την αξιολόγηση της υποψηφιότητάς σας για τη θέση εργασίας και για να καλέσουμε υποψηφίους για συνέντευξη. Η νομική βάση της επεξεργασίας περιλαμβάνει το έννομο συμφέρον μας για την πρόσληψη ταλαντούχων ατόμων και βάσει της συναίνεσης σας. Οι πληροφορίες σας θα κοινοποιηθούν εσωτερικά στην επιχείρησή μας, όπως, ενδεικτικά, στο τμήμα ανθρωπίνου δυναμικού, σε συνεργάτες που παρέχουν υπηρεσίες για λογαριασμό μας και σε άλλα μέρη όταν απαιτείται από τη νομοθεσία ή εάν είναι απαραίτητο για την προστασία των δικαιωμάτων μας. Έχετε δικαίωμα να ζητήσετε να διορθώσουμε τυχόν ανακρίβειες στις πληροφορίες σας, και, εφόσον δικαιούστε, να εναντιωθείτε ή να ζητήσετε τον περιορισμό της επεξεργασίας, καθώς και να αιτηθείτε την πρόσβαση, τη διαγραφή ή τη φορητότητα των πληροφοριών σας και να υποβάλετε καταγγελία στην αρμόδια επιβλέπουσα αρχή.


- Για να ασκήσετε τα δικαιώματά σας μπορείτε να επικοινωνήσετε μαζί μας στα παρακάτω στοιχεία επικοινωνίας: VARIO A.E. - Πειραιώς 205, Ταύρος 177 78 - T 210 34 18 230 - E info@vario.com.gr | www.vario.com.gr

Title: Network/Security Engineer

Job Description:
About the job

Are you looking for an opportunity to jumpstart your career in civil engineering? Do you have strong analytical and problem-solving skills? We have an opportunity for a Junior Civil Engineer to join our Cost Estimating Department.

At BALLIAN TECHNIKH SA as a Junior Civil Engineer, you will be responsible for analyzing project scopes and creating detailed cost estimates and schedules for construction projects. You will work closely with other engineers to ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Prepare Project’s Cost Estimation from preliminary stage
  • Prepare Project’s BoQ
  • Prepare Project’s Cost Budgeting
  • Prepare Cost Analyzing Reports
  • Prepare Value Engineering reports

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or related field
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Knowledge of construction methods, materials, and equipment
  • Proficient in Excel and other relevant software programs
  • Ability to work independently and with a team
  • Excellent written and oral communication in English

Benefits and Environment

  • Salary based on your skill set
  • Friendly working environment
  • Additional private health insurance
  • Continuous learning and development

If you are passionate about innovation and have a desire to learn and grow in the field of civil engineering, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today and take the first step towards an exciting and fulfilling career!

All CV’s will be considered as strictly confidential

Title: Information Technology System Administrator
Skills: Desktop Computers|Local Area Network (LAN)|Microsoft Azure|Microsoft Teams|Network Security|Office 365|System Administration|VMware vCenter|Veeam Backup & Replication|Windows Server|
Job Description:
About the job

OVERVIEW:


Guidepoint connects clients with vetted subject matter experts—Advisors—from our global professional network. Our clients leverage the insights and perspectives shared by our Advisors to stay informed and make better business decisions. Our multinational client list includes nine of the top 10 global consulting firms, hundreds of hedge funds (including five of the largest firms), and many of the largest private equity firms and Fortune-ranked companies. Guidepoint’s seventeen offices on four continents provide 24/7, quick and agile service. For more information, visit www.guidepoint.com.


Play a vital role in Guidepoint’s success.


As an Associate on the Client Service team, you will understand your client’s unique business questions and identify the experts who can best provide the answers. You will find and recruit new experts into our network of over 1,250,000 Guidepoint Advisors, determining which ones are best suited to speak with the client. For many of our employees, the Associate role represents their first job post-college, and provides a unique opportunity to put core business skills into practice, as well as gain exposure to a wide range of industries and disciplines.


Who We Are:


  • Team-oriented and collaborative
  • Hard-working professionals who strive for excellence
  • Built-in mentorship to help you drive and improve your project management and customer service skills, to deliver excellent results for clients
  • Hands-on leadership to help you develop your career and provide opportunities for upward mobility within Guidepoint
  • Guidepoint is passionate about your career growth: Check out our Client Service Career Trajectory.


What YOU will own:


  • Work with Project Managers to develop strategies for satisfying each client project request
  • Utilize LinkedIn, press releases, case studies, and the internet to identify the best experts for our clients to get their strategic or investment questions answered
  • Identify the best leads and invite them to join our network to participate in consultations with our clients
  • Screen experts to determine their suitability for each specific client project and develop professional profiles to present to your clients


Experience YOU will bring:


  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Previous internship/volunteering/extracurriculars


Skills YOU will Bring:


  • Desire to work in a sourcing/lead generation type of role
  • Fluency in English and Spanish or French or German
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Outgoing personality with the ability to speak with people at all professional levels
  • Intellectual curiosity and desire to learn
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work both individually and as part of a team


What We Offer:


  • Competitive compensation
  • Private health insurance
  • Entrepreneurial environment, autonomy, and fast decisions
  • International exposure to the global Guidepoint service teams
  • Casual work environment and compelling people
  • Summer and winter team events


Interview Process:

    • Initial Candidate Screen
  • Meet the Guidepoint Teams!
    • Hiring Manager Interview
  • Mock Assessment (Role Dependent)
    • Complete a stimulated client request and gain more insight into the role

At Guidepoint, our success relies on the diversity of our employees, advisors, and client base, which allows us to create connections that offer a wealth of perspectives. We are committed to upholding policies that contribute to an equitable and welcoming environment for our community, regardless of background, identity, or experience.

Title: Associate, Client Service - Bilingual Spanish/English
Skills: Case Studies|Client Services|Communication|Communication Training|Contact Centers|Customer Experience|French|Office Administration|Press Releases|Strategy|
Job Description:
About the job

Sunlight Group Energy Storage Systems is a world-leading technology company and provider of innovative industrial and off-road energy storage solutions, with 30+ years of experience. We specialize in the development and production of lead-acid and lithium-ion batteries for industrial mobility, leisure mobility, and ESS applications. These products are manufactured and assembled in Sunlight’s state-of-the-art facilities in Greece, Italy, Germany, Israel, and USA, and distributed to more than 115 countries.

Driven by our commitment to inspire our people and unlock their potential, and steadfast in our commitment to Diversity, Equality & Inclusion, we have created an agile and innovative environment that promotes open communication and collaboration, while offering continuous learning and development opportunities to the 3,100+ people we employ across the organization.


We are currently looking for an ingenious LiOn Support Engineer for our Global After Sales Department. The role will focus in repairing and maintain our LiOn products. Moreover, supporting partners and customers should be a part of Service Support Engineer daily job. On top of that, the role offers hands-on experience, testing and documenting - reporting in our After Sales Department at Kifisia, Athens, as well as well cooperation with the others departments it is needed.


Your role:

  • Maintains – Repairs Sunlight's LiON products
  • Operation Monitoring & adjustment remotely
  • Worldwide remote Support partner/ customer
  • Service training of partners and customers
  • Follow up claims and operation
  • Reporting and suggestions for improvement
  • Oversees account performance according to KPIs
  • Cooperates with other departments for the continuous improve of products


Job requirements:

  • 2-3 years of relevant experience (ideally in industrial sector)
  • Degree in Engineering (Electrical, Electrical Power, Electronics, Automation-Communications)
  • Fluent in English
  • Good knowledge of SAP and MS Office applications
  • Organizational skills, time management, team work
  • Customer centric mentality
  • Ability to travel extensively abroad
  • Great interpersonal and administrative skills


Despite your experience and skills, you never stop learning, cultivating an out-of-the-box thinking, a growth and entrepreneurial mindset, embracing ownership and agility. You are impact-focused, proactive and open to change. Last but not least, you are able to communicate scientific principles and applications both in Greek and English - we are a multicultural team! - , you are a real team player who can build strong relationships with various stakeholders and thrive among global talents in a positive work environment.


What we offer you back


To start with, we give you the opportunity to thrive in a restless team and grow your potential in an innovative environment. As per your compensation and rewards package, this is a preview:


• A competitive salary, based on experience and topped up with other bonuses.

• Company healthcare plan

• State-of-the-art equipment

• Continuous learning opportunities. Allocated training budget that can be spent on books, online courses or other training materials.

• Established framework for career development

• Brand new, vibrant and techy offices in Athens

• International mobility opportunities

Title: Freight Operator
Skills: Communication|Customs Regulations|Rate Negotiation|
Job Description:
About the job

Sales Representative

For us to succeed in creating the perfect hair and beauty experience through our platform, we have a highly driven sales team ready to seek new, attractive salons for us to partner with.

Joining a growing team, you will be responsible for increasing our venue base through a SaaS first approach. You will own the full sales journey from generating, pitching, and closing deals in order to create strong and long-lasting partnerships. As a consultative seller, you will ask our prospects the right questions to guide your pitch and highlight how Treatwell x Uala salon software can help them. Equipped with a strong market knowledge, you will be confident in explaining what Treatwell can do to improve both their customer and business experience.

This role is key in growing our salon portfolio and you'll be a natural in delivering a professional and friendly approach to our partners, ensuring Treatwell is their preferred and trusted brand.

You will be responsible for:

  • The full end-to-end sales cycle from initial contact to closing
  • Prospecting new salons and generating leads, leveraging multiple channels and a high activity routine
  • Hosting digital sales demos with prospective partners
  • Communicate Treatwell's software value proposition handle objections to close deals and set up successful long term partnerships
  • Manage a strong sales pipeline to hit monthly targets
  • Maintain accurate records in our CRM System Salesforce
  • Gather and provide feedback from prospects to improve our product and processes
  • Help in the development of new sales strategies to optimise productivity

About You

  • Fluent Greek & English speaker
  • Driven to overachieve on monthly targets
  • Committed to achieving high quality, long term partnerships with strong partner engagement levels
  • Winning mentality always going the extra mile to get the job done
  • Natural communicator, with strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Fast learner, enjoy and driven by professional and personal growth
  • Interest in consumer technology & digital knowledge
  • Ability to listen and active problem-solving skills
  • Self-starter, ready to take initiative, but also willing to collaborate to elevate the success of a team

About Treatwell

Hi, we're Treatwell. Nice to meet you.

We're a team of +800 (and growing) passionate and brilliantly talented people across Europe. We're the industry's smartest salon management software, all connected to Europe's leading bookings platform, working with over 50,000 salon partners across 13 countries, processing over 8 million bookings every month. And....breathe.

But we're not done yet. We're on an exciting journey to digitally revolutionise the hair and beauty community.

If this excites you, we might just have the role for you.

We'll treat you with:

  • Monthly 40€ vouchers so you can treat yourself too.
  • 28-days holiday + public holidays
  • Competitive Salary
  • Variable incentive bonus plan
  • Growth funds for you to develop and grow with your team.
  • Opportunity to be part of the beauty's industry digital revolution, in an international environment
  • Free Coffee & Snacks
  • Friday socialising - we make sure we stop working and spend time together at the end of the week
  • The opportunity to work alongside a talented, friendly, entrepreneurial team in a lovely Northern Athens office (Kifisia)

Equal Ops

Treatwell is an ‘Open to All' employer and warmly welcomes everybody to the team. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process as required. Please add any adjustment requests to your application.


Desired Skills and Experience

  • Inside Sales
  • Outbound sales
  • Sales
  • Telesales Executive
  • sales
  • sales development
  • telesales
  • πωλήσεις

Title: LiOn Support Engineer
Skills: After-Sales|Communication|Customer Satisfaction|English|Greek|Microsoft Office|Remote User Support|SAP Products|Teamwork|Time Management|
Job Description:
About the job

ARE YOU READY to step up to Accenture’s Strategy and Consulting role?

There is never a typical day at Accenture, but that’s why we love it here! This is an extraordinary opportunity to build a rewarding career at Accenture Strategy & Consulting. Working in highly collaborative teams for world-leading clients, we’ll nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. Whatever your work and life goals, we’ll help you achieve them. Sooner.

Join Accenture Strategy & Consulting and thrive in a digitally driven, innovation-led environment where you can help clients shift to the New using leading-edge technologies on some of the coolest projects you can imagine.

WORK YOU’LL DO

Technology Strategy and Consulting team help the C-Suite shape their technology vision and execute on their digital and technology-driven business transformation journeys.

As a Technology Strategy and Advisory (TS&A) Consultant, you will be at the core of understanding and responding to our clients' business and technology challenges. You are likely to be involved in a range of activities from supporting Organizations to develop their technology strategy to assisting with transformation implementation activities.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Working with industry and business specialists to develop comprehensive technology strategies, including IT opportunity assessment, investment portfolio management, information strategy, sourcing strategy, enterprise architecture strategy and more

  • Create innovative and differentiated offerings, staying relevant and in sync with market demand and technology evolution

  • Deliver technology advisory services and strategies for technology enabled business change, e.g.: package & third-party integrator selection, vendor selection, application studies, solution architecture studies and/or program diagnostics and recovery

  • Deliver advisory services to C Suite functions such as CIO/ CTO/ CDO etc

  • Interviewing client staff to understand key issues with how they operate today and identify opportunities for improvement in their operations and technology landscape

  • Leveraging Accenture’s international assets and expertise to bring new ideas to clients

  • Supporting the development of business cases and implementation roadmaps to support investment decisions

  • Providing project management and change management support on large scale transformation projects

  • Working in multi-disciplinary teams to shape, propose, communicate and implement programs

    • WHO WE´RE LOOKING FOR?

  • BSc with distinction or honors from a Top University, preferably in Computer Science/ Software Engineering or Electrical/ Electronic Engineering

  • 3-5 year cross-industry experience in consulting firms or big and international companies.

  • Ability and willingness to travel in Greece and internationally.

  • Understanding of emerging technology trends (Cloud, Big Data, API, Microservices etc) and impact on both overall enterprise architecture and operating model

  • Basic knowledge of key emerging methodologies (Agile, DevOps, Design thinking) and how to use it to improve IT related department

  • Experience in developing associated business cases and plans which are detailed, actionable and aligned with industry best practices

  • Good business acumen to find the best way to support key strategic pillar with technology

  • Background in Business and in IT architecture, as well as experience in business and IT collaboration. Ability to rapidly assess the IT implications of business strategy and the business implications of IT strategy

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in Greek and English.

  • Knowledge of and passion for technology and digital trends

  • Ambition and desire to shine in the newest strategic consultancy environment

  • Demonstrable experience of managing teams of 3-5 people driving strategy work

    • WHAT´S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Competitive salary and benefits, including but not limited to: life/health insurance, performance-based bonuses, monthly vouchers, company car (depending on management level), flexible work arrangements, employee share purchase plan, TEA Accenture, parental leave, paid overtime (if needed) and various corporate discounts

  • Continuous hard and soft skills training & development through global platforms & local academy

  • Career coaching and mentorship to help you manage your career and develop professionally

  • Ongoing strengths and skills-based evaluation process

  • Various opportunities to develop your career across a spectrum of clients, industries and projects

  • Diverse and inclusive culture

  • Corporate citizenship initiatives (access to volunteering opportunities, charity work etc.)

  • Under our Brain Regain initiative, extra relocation benefits may apply

    • n case your profile is a match for the role, you will receive an email requesting to download our new innovative mobile App, Enter Accenture Greece for Android or iOS devices . Then, you will be able to log in by using your personalized credentials provided by our Recruitment Team within 48 hours and start your Accenture Journey!

    To learn more about Accenture, and how you will be challenged and inspired from Day 1, please visit our website accenture.com/gr-en/.

    The safety and well-being of our candidates and employees remain our priority. Please note that the recruitment process for opportunities in Accenture Greece will be conducted only via online format during the current period.

Title: Sales Representative

Job Description:
About the job

  1. Communicates with Masters regarding any reports concerning PSC items, deck maintenance (PMS) and cargo hold preparedness.
  2. Visits the vessels for marine / safety internal audits, evaluates their condition, assesses potential risks and prepares them for third party inspections as per the Company’s standards, SMS requirements and all international and flag state legislation.
  3. Approves deck stores and maintenance tools as well as the activation/supply of charts and publications.
  4. Analyzes, investigates and assess the risks of hazardous occurrences on the vessel or any deficiencies, issued by PSC and third party inspections, and provides vessels with necessary feedback and instructions to avoid reoccurrence.
  5. Pursues the developments related to international rules and regulations that are associated with the SMS and evaluates their potential impact.
  6. Coordinates and liaises with other departments within the company to collectively provide an efficient ship management service.
  7. Handles pre-port state control inspections, standard deck and safety items checks, master and officers’ evaluation and random bunker checks.
  8. Provides specific training to the crew during the sea passage attendances.

Title: Technology Strategy and Advisory (TS&A) Consultant
Skills: Business Case Preparation|Communication|Design Thinking|Digital Trends|English|Greek|IT Strategy|Investment Decisions|Team Management|Written Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description


Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?


Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours.


Under broad supervision, you will reconcile and adjust general ledger accounts and/or bank statements. You may also perform moderately complex analyses of performance results. In addition, you will compile, consolidate, and analyze accounting and finance information for financial statements and reports and perform other special projects as assigned.


How You Will Contribute


You will:


  • Support accounting and external reporting activities including accurate and timely U.S. GAAP reporting and timeliness and integrity of statutory financial reporting, balance sheet reconciliations, KPIs, fixed assets, restructuring and intercompany charges. As required, you will support activities performed by Mondelēz International Business Services/third-party service providers during month/quarter /year-end close, statistical reporting and statutory audit
  • Contribute to strong controls and compliance environment and comply with Mondelēz International’s AER policies. Support audit activities and provide information on auditors' request
  • Perform moderately complex analysis of performance results as requested
  • Embrace a mindset of continuous improvement. You will also identify ways of working in your area of responsibility
  • Contribute to a high-performing Accounting and External Reporting (AER) team. Invest in personal development and contribute to the overall development of peers and the AER team


What You Will Bring


A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:


  • TECHNICAL EXPERTISE in accounting and external reporting including understanding U.S. GAAP, IFRS or local GAAP, close processes and financial reporting systems (SAP experience preferred). Knowledge in policy, controls and compliance design including SOX reporting
  • BUSINESS ACUMEN and experience working in FMCG/CPG Industry or Big Four accounting preferred
  • LEADERSHIP SKILLS including proven business partnering and communication skills. Experience working as a finance leader managing cross-functional and business partner teams to drive timely and accurate results
  • GROWTH/DIGITAL MINDSET and the ability to leverage technology to improve efficiency and effectiveness. Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools and financial system knowledge
  • INTEGRITY and sound judgement in all decisions and interactions aligned with our values, policies and external regulations


More About This Role


What you need to know about this position:


  • Preferrable work experience background FMCG.


Education / Certifications:


  • Bachelor degree in Finance or Accounting.


The responsibilities of this position are performed within the framework of a regional business model that is defined and managed by Mondelēz Europe GmbH, Switzerland .


No Relocation support available


Business Unit Summary


At Mondelez Europe, we are proud, not only of the iconic brands we make, but also of the people who make them. Our delicious products are created in 52 plants across Europe by more than 28,000 passionate people. We are the top maker of chocolate and biscuits and a leading maker of gum and candy. We make sure our powerful global brands and local jewels like Cadbury, Milka and Alpen Gold chocolates, Oreo, belVita, LU and Tuc biscuits, and Stimorol and Dirol gums get safely into our customers hands—and mouths. Great people and great brands. That’s who we are. Join us on our journey to continue leading the future of snacking around the world by offering the right snack, for the right moment, made the right way.


Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.


Job Type


Regular


Accounting & External Reporting


Finance

Title: Marine Superintendent
Skills: Construction Site Inspections|Freight|Internal Audits|Legislation|Marine Vessels|Property Management Systems|SMS|Ship Management|State Legislation|Training|
Job Description:
About the job

JD is a sports fashion, multichannel retailer of branded sports and casual wear, combining globally recognized brands such as Nike, adidas, Puma and The North Face, with strong own brand labels such as Pink Soda and Supply & Demand to provide an elevated consumer experience. JD is an industry leading retail business which combines the best of physical and digital retail to give a compelling consumer proposition which enables its customers to shop seamlessly across all channels. JD now has over 970 stores in 19 territories, 4 continents across the globe. As a Group, our portfolio stretches to 3300+ stores operating across Sports, Outdoor and Leisure brands.

The Property Design Team

The Store Development Team is responsible for driving innovation and design excellence across all of the JD Group brands on a global scale. The department delivers inspiring, commercial retail environments for our customers to maximize their shopping experience, whilst maximizing profitability for the group. This includes the strategic direction of large, complex store build programmes consisting of new, up-size and refurbishment projects with a specific focus on cost, time, and quality parameters. The team are continually reviewing processes to improve value, reduction of costs and optimization of all store design and build programmes.

The role

The position of midweight retail designer is a key role in the global expansion of JD within Greece and Cyprus. Working as part of the property team based in country, with reporting responsibilities into the Global design team at GHQ in Manchester UK. This position necessitates a high principle of design standards with the creative ability to develop each store design on a project-by-project basis using the agreed store grading guidelines. Strong leadership, communication and reporting skills are essential as is proven experience in a retail environment, designing and delivering stores.

The role is based in Athens, Greece (Average one day per week field-based attending meetings with occasional overnight stays).

The successful candidate should be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:

Responsibilities:
  • Lead design projects within agreed territory, taking projects from brief through to completion
  • Attendance of strategy meetings to obtain design briefs and general direction of projects
  • Assist with the on-going development of the JD Store design specific to the Greek and Cypriot marketplace
  • Liaising with key project stakeholders at varying stages of projects, working closely with internal departments (Acquisitions team, Project managers, Quantity surveyors, Retail, Merchandising, Marketing, Multichannel, IT, Security, Health and Safety etc.)
  • Coordinate meetings to present store designs and obtain feedback and approval
  • Attend site meetings; talking through the design with the project delivery team, check surveys and record site information, ensuring all data is up to date in all documentation
  • Set up drawings in AutoCAD using landlords or survey information ensuring all work is accurate
  • Space plan merchandise layouts using a design brief and option targets
  • Production of detailed plans, shop fronts, sections and elevations for proposed store designs and site-specific details where required
  • Liaise with external professional agencies such as architects, MEP and structural engineers, permitting departments in order to obtain statutory approvals
  • Offer assistance and support to the global design studio to support workload in other regions as / when time permits
  • Partner with the GHQ graphics team to deliver project specific designs

Requirements
  • Previous experience within a similar role is essential with a min 3 year’s industry experience
  • Manage architects and MEP consultants with regard to store design across Greece and Cyprus
  • Experience in a creative role with a leading retail design agency or in-house design team
  • Proven experience at all stages of the design process, from conception through to implementation
  • Strong retail and commercial awareness, specifically within the sports fashion industry
  • Ability to negotiate and influence at all levels with both internal and external stakeholders
  • Design creatively to set budgets, demonstrating an understanding of construction costs
  • Plan work streams and set deadlines for both yourself and 3rd party consultants
  • Interpret briefs accurately and efficiently to deadlines
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Self-motivated and driven, with the ability to manage own workload to deadlines
  • Strong spatial awareness
  • Detailed understanding of construction or shop fitting coupled with a strong understanding of permit regulations throughout Greece and Cyprus
  • Be prepared to travel and stay away from home when necessary
  • Must hold a valid passport
  • Full driving license
  • Must have excellent written and verbal skills in Greek and English

Skills:
  • Expert level AutoCAD with working knowledge of how to build dynamic blocks
  • Proficient in the use of Adobe Creative Cloud suite
  • Experience of Revit is desirable
  • Expert in visual rendering and 3D modelling
  • Ability to use all Microsoft Office programs
  • An interest in the use and specification of sustainable materials and construction methods

Qualifications:

Degree in Architecture, Architectural Technology, Interior Design or other relevant qualification

Benefits

Why You’ll Love It Here
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Career development opportunities & education programs
  • Onsite gym, as well as health & wellness programs to keep you active
  • One day off, part of our "parents’ day off" program
  • Flexitime for working parents: Open Work from Home Anytime- Anywhere you need
  • Generous employee discount in all our brands (Cosmos Sport, Sneaker10, Slamdunk, Sportsfactory, Rundome)
  • Extras, discounts and perks - Being a valued member of Cosmos Sport team means a lot to us! We offer a variety of 100+ cool extras link here!

We are committed to providing a great place to work for all of our people, without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientations, genders, or disability.

Title: Country Accounting & External Reporting Senior Analyst
Skills: Balance Sheet Review|Balance Sheets|Complex Analysis|Financial Reporting|Key Performance Indicators|Reporting & Analysis|Statistical Reporting|Statutory|Statutory Audits|U.S. GAAP Reporting|
Job Description:
About the job

Who we are


Etraveli Group is a global platform for flights, an air technology company connecting millions of flights and travelers across the globe. We want our customers to experience the world while we take care of the technology that enables traveling.


Every minute we close hundreds of deals for our partners around the globe. We are the preferred partner of some of the world’s most prominent travel companies such as Booking.com, Google Flights, Skyscanner and Kayak. As a consequence, Booking Holdings, the mother company of Booking.com, recently entered into an agreement to acquire our company.


At the same time, we open endless possibilities for our employees. Our diverse team of more than 2000 passionate professionals is what makes us the best in what we do. The Group headquarters are located in Sweden while different parts of the Group’s operation are led from the countries where we have offices (Greece, Canada, India), with the Athens office being one of the largest, hosting around 500 employees working from the center of Athens for the rest of the world.


We know that the travel business is not just a business, it is an opening to the whole world. And technology is not just a job, it is an opening to the future. We are looking for people that are as open as traveling and technology combined & we are here to guide, challenge and give you an exciting part in our mission to make our world, wide open. Join us and start today as an IT Service Desk Technician!


Responsibilities


  • Set up laptops and mobile devices.
  • Install and configure software and computer systems.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues with software or hardware.
  • Establish accounts for new users and assist with password or login problems.
  • Provide to end users first level support and training, at group level.
  • Monitor requests on our ticketing system (Jira) and resolve in a timely manner.
  • Maintain procedures and reports that provide technical support to the entire organization.
  • Maintain all office IT equipment (computers, printers, scanners and mobile devices both Android and Mac).
  • Keep meeting room equipment (PC, TV, camera, microphone & other equipment) functional at all times.
  • Manage IT asset equipment.



Requirements


  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Similar
  • Approximately 2 years of related experience in Technical Support, IT administration or equivalent role
  • Hands-on experience with Windows/Linux/Mac OS environments
  • Familiarity with Active Directory, DNS, DHCP
  • Familiarity with G Suite administration
  • MS Office knowledge
  • Basic networking skills
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Customer-oriented and patient
  • Punctual, committed, and willing to learn
  • Very good command of English language


Awesome but not necessary:

  • Basic scripting knowledge (Windows & Linux)
  • CCNA knowledge
  • Working knowledge in a deployment tool (like OCS Inventory / Microsoft SCCM / ConnectWise automate etc.)
  • Basic knowledge in a endpoint security solution (Like SentinelOne, Sophos, Avast etc.)



Benefits


We are looking for people who would make the world smaller for travelers but want a bigger world of opportunities for themselves. With us you can enjoy:


  • Health Benefits - Through partners we offer a private health insurance plan. We also offer the possibility to use 2 extra medical leave days in case of need.
  • Monthly ticket restaurant card - to spend in one of the thousands affiliated restaurants, cafes, stores or supermarkets across Greece.
  • Office in the City – We sit on bright, large floors (over 4000㎡!) in central Athens. Just a short walk from the Ambelokipi Metro station.
  • Growth – We believe in personal development and continuous education, thus we offer the opportunity of role-related training on tools and best practices.
  • Team activities - We also like to schedule company/department/team activities and events outside the office space!
  • Fun & Work - We have a relaxed work environment where you can enjoy free breakfast, coffee/tea, playing ping pong or video games.

Title: Retail Designer Greece & Cyprus
Skills: 3D Modeling|Commercial Awareness|Coordinate Meetings|Design Briefs|Greek|House Design|Interior Design|Retail Design|Shop Fronts|Store Design|
Job Description:
About the job

We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join Global Digital Operations within Pfizer’s Digital DevOps Group.


Our team provides the capabilities needed to manage both day-to-day requirements, as well as full lifecycle management ensuring that our assets are always available to our clients. Additionally, we always strive to improve our process and optimize our workflow as we keep an eye on operational efficiency. Through our team of talented technologists, we provide solution and service delivery, technology platforms managements, and optimization and application support excellence.


The Operations Technical Project Manager will be responsible for managing support and operations projects assigned.


This role will ensure close alignment with requirements of the solution delivery teams and will work closely with the DevOps Manager to ensure appropriate feedback loops are in place and exercised frequently to inform engineering, delivery, and operations teams of potential opportunities for improvement.


This role will participate and contribute as a team member, manage vendor partner deliverables, collaborate with other support teams, drive continues improvements, and ensure our solutions are supported with the highest level of customer satisfaction.


Role Responsibilities


  • Act as Release manager for assigned applications with direct responsibility to lead platform upgrades, application maintenance releases and system patching.
  • Take leadership role in application automation and other high critical initiatives
  • Manage and report on application support activities and operations processes (Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management etc.) needed to support the functional areas in a global environment.
  • Review service performance and participate in definition of Service Level Agreements (SLAs) as needed.
  • Manage and report team progress related to the work efforts of responsible areas.
  • Oversee high priority incidents, provide guidance and direction to the team, and communicate to affected business users and executive stakeholders. If required, assist the team in troubleshooting and diagnosing issues and engage others to ensure timely resolution.
  • Identify continuous improvement opportunities and engage others to define an appropriate approach and deliver results.
  • Ensure all application support activities and actions are compliant with SDLC processes and procedures.
  • ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Act as Release manager for assigned applications with direct responsibility to lead platform upgrades, application maintenance releases and system patching.
  • Take leadership role in application automation and other high critical initiatives
  • Manage and report on application support activities and operations processes (Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management etc.) needed to support the functional areas in a global environment.
  • Review service performance and participate in definition of Service Level Agreements (SLAs) as needed.
  • Manage and report team progress related to the work efforts of responsible areas.
  • Oversee high priority incidents, provide guidance and direction to the team, and communicate to affected business users and executive stakeholders. If required, assist the team in troubleshooting and diagnosing issues and engage others to ensure timely resolution.
  • Identify continuous improvement opportunities and engage others to define an appropriate approach and deliver results.
  • Ensure all application support activities and actions are compliant with SDLC processes and procedures.
  • Provide technical SME support for support area, maintenance, and enhancements.
  • Partner with Solution Delivery and Engineering leads to define and implement supportability requirements and manage transition of projects to long-term support.
  • Prepare and deliver operational updates to business stakeholder groups and solution delivery leads
  • Ensure smooth transition of application upgrades and new capabilities to production support
  • Assist with support contract renewals and manage software licenses.


Basic Qualifications


  • Bachelor of Science degree in Information Management, Computer Science, Engineering, Technology Management or relevant disciplines
  • 5+ years of relevant experience with emphasis on Project Management.
  • Excellent written, interpersonal and oral communication skills, communicate and liaise broadly across functions and the global organization.
  • Deep knowledge of SDLC processes and compliance related activities.
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively coordinate multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.
  • Experience with Drupal, AWS, Cloudflare, and Github Actions
  • Strong analytical, critical thinking, and troubleshooting skills
  • Experience managing vendors and contracted resources in both a staff augmentation and outsourcing model.
  • Ambition to learn and utilize emerging technologies while working in a stimulating team environment.
  • Project Management / PMP or ITIL certification


Preferred Qualifications


  • Process-oriented with strong organization, project management and coordination skills.
  • ITIL/PMP certified.
  • Ability to adapt to changing working conditions and work assignments, to be open, and motivated to learn and adopt new ideas and concepts.
  • Knowledge of database, storage, hosting, cloud, application, analytics and services technologies.
  • Able to work remotely with a team spanning many timezones.


Non-standard Work Schedule, Travel Or Environment Requirements


  • Expectations around travel will be minimal but candidates must be capable of travel within the region, to other regions, and to other Pfizer sites.
  • Working schedule 10.00am-18.30pm


Work Location Assignment: Flexible


LI#PFE


Purpose


Breakthroughs that change patients' lives... At Pfizer we are a patient centric company, guided by our four values: courage, joy, equity and excellence. Our breakthrough culture lends itself to our dedication to transforming millions of lives.


Digital Transformation Strategy


One bold way we are achieving our purpose is through our company wide digital transformation strategy. We are leading the way in adopting new data, modelling and automated solutions to further digitize and accelerate drug discovery and development with the aim of enhancing health outcomes and the patient experience.


Flexibility


We aim to create a trusting, flexible workplace culture which encourages employees to achieve work life harmony, attracts talent and enables everyone to be their best working self. Let’s start the conversation!


Equal Employment Opportunity


We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is crucial to building a successful business. As an employer, Pfizer is committed to celebrating this, in all its forms – allowing for us to be as diverse as the patients and communities we serve. Together, we continue to build a culture that encourages, supports and empowers our employees.


Information & Business Tech

Title: IT Service Desk Technician

Job Description:
About the job

We are Kaizen Gaming


Kaizen Gaming is the leading GameTech company in Greece and one of the fastest-growing in Europe, operating the Stoiximan brand in Greece and Cyprus, and the Betano brand in Germany, Romania, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Portugal, Brazil, Chile, Peru, Ecuador, Canada (Ontario) and Nigeria. Our aim is to leverage cutting-edge Technology in order to provide the optimum experience to those who trust us for their entertainment.


What's in it for you


We are looking for a motivated and customer-oriented person who will help and support the employees in Athens premises or/ and remote users.


As an ICT Support Associate you will be responsible for installing, setting up and troubleshooting all aspects of hardware and software issues related to our internal employees. In your role, you will help support the employees of a fast and dynamic business.


What you’ll do


  • Use your initiative and technical knowledge to diagnose any technical support / IT problems on the desktops / laptops and provide effective resolutions or information to the user;
  • Be responsible for newcomers' equipment, including setup, installation, and configuration of the software and hardware based on individual user needs;
  • Troubleshoot and support the conferencing amenities of our premises
  • Proactively provide information and regular communication to users on the progress of outstanding support calls while also providing an indication of timescale for resolution;
  • Carry out user account maintenance for the new members, leavers and role changes;
  • Collaborate with internal and external teams to resolve issues and improve processes.


What you'll bring


  • Experience providing IT technical support (at least 1 year);
  • Customer-oriented mentality and excellent problem solving skills with critical thinking;
  • Troubleshooting experience in Microsoft and Apple ecosystem;
  • Good knowledge of Windows Operating systems and MS Office / Gsuite applications;
  • Knowledgeable skills of conferencing and audio visual systems;
  • Familiar with standalone and network printers;
  • Strong teamwork mindset and willingness to collaborate with individuals;
  • The ability to prioritize according to tasks as they arise.


Nice to Have


  • Familiarity with Active Directory;
  • Experience with ticketing systems (e.g Jira);
  • Basic Networking skills.


Kaizen Gaming Perks


🏃 A buddy will support you with your onboarding.

💸Competitive salary package and bonus scheme

👩‍⚕️ Health and life insurance for you and your family

💰 Monthly allowance for lunch & commuting expenses

📚 Udemy learning account & continuous training

⭐Clear career paths & a developmental 360° feedback framework

✈️ Relocation package and "Brain Gain" relocation bonus for Greek expats

Title: Operations Technical Project Manager
Skills: Analytical Skills|Communication|Computer Science|Coordination Skills|Critical Thinking|Emerging Technologies|Oral Communication|Organization Skills|Project Management|Web Maintenance|
Job Description:
About the job

About the Role:


Yieldstreet is looking for a Senior Associate to join our Portfolio Management team full time. You will be working with/reporting to the Managing Director of Portfolio Management and Capital Markets.


The Portfolio & Risk Management team is integrated into Yieldstreet’s investment process at every juncture, from reviewing pre-transaction diligence and underwriting at the investment level, to oversight of portfolio level concentration and risk management. We collaborate with various Yieldstreet functions including the Investment teams, Product, Marketing, Finance, Valuations, and Operations.


Portfolio & Risk Management’s core responsibilities:


  • Investment Process: Understand and challenge risk assumptions and conduct upfront independent deal-level risk reviews
  • Portfolio Construction & Risk Analytics: Track post funding investment performance on a deal and portfolio level. Top-down portfolio as well as bottoms-up investment level management.
  • Investor Communications: Assist with communicating investment level performance using conceptually fluent frames and data visualizations


This role will be based out of the Athens office and requires someone to be located within a commutable distance. You should expect to be in the office at least 3 days per week.


What you'll do:


  • Assist with executing the team’s agenda including investment process management coverage and assisting with platform underwriting/manager selection, portfolio construction guidelines and oversight of post-close investments
  • Review & enhance deal and portfolio level key performance metrics to monitor deviations from original investment theses across a diverse set of investment strategies
  • Monitor, evaluate and develop reporting to highlight risk factors at the portfolio and single investment level
  • Contribute to the development of risk analytics and frameworks
  • Collaborate across functions to achieve firm wide objectives including origination, underwriting, structuring, operations, technology and marketing
  • Help with the buildout of the Portfolio & Risk Management function as it scales including automating processes (basic programming experience is a plus)


What you'll need:


  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. CFA or CAIA is a plus
  • At least 2 years of finance, investment management or risk experience, bonus for experience in a credit underwriting/risk role
  • Excellent organizational skills and high attention to detail. Deal execution oriented with a readiness to roll up your sleeves and manage a process end to end
  • Experience in financial statement analysis, financial modeling or financial valuation; preparing financial information, interpreting financial performance and assessing risk exposure is a plus.
  • Ability to articulate financial concepts and information in both verbal and written forms
  • Ability to work seamlessly in a cross-functional team environment spanning multiple disciplines and geographies
  • Excellent prioritization skills to balance multiple projects with competing deadlines
  • Passion for innovation, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Knowledge of design tools, Google Sheets, Google Docs, Google Slides, PowerPoint, Excel, Word


About Yieldstreet


Yieldstreet is the leading private market investment platform. We believe that private market alternatives should be a fundamental part of your portfolio. That’s why we’re unlocking access to make it easier than ever to get started. We partner with top-tier investment managers to provide investors with a wide range of opportunities across real estate, venture capital, private equity, art, short term notes and more. All of our offerings are curated and vetted by our team to help investors diversify away from the stock market with confidence.


Why Yieldstreet?


Join a team of diverse, smart, and friendly people from 8 different countries who speak a total of 17 different languages who are on a mission to make alternative investments a fundamental part of the modern portfolio. Our team is comprised of successful entrepreneurs with combined exits of over $1B. We get social with each other during happy hours, exercise classes and team off sites! We are a hybrid work company giving you the opportunity to connect with your peers in real time with the flexibility to work remotely a few days per week.


What’s in it for you:


Competitive compensation packages including equity


Unlimited PTO


Learning and Development stipend


Wellness credit


Paid lunch once a week


Commuter benefit


Sabbatical

Title: ICT Support Associate
Skills: Account Management|Active Directory|Networking|Printers|Problem Solving|Teamwork|Technical Support|Ticketing Systems|Troubleshooting|Windows|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description

As a Clearance Administrator Associate you will work closely with Customs to enable our on-time clearance and delivery. You will ensure checks and processes are completed that result in timely and effective processing of transactions and legal and regulatory compliance. In this position efficient, courteous and professional communication and taking ownership of issues / requirements are key to the role.

Key Responsibilities
  • Ensure tracking traces are open and correctly processed.
  • Conduct professional calls with customers or government agencies to request and provide information.
  • Provide confirmation of pricing and make correct allocation of charges and refunds.
  • Ensure the correct identification and accurate input of shipment information into appropriate systems.
  • Produce and validate customs data and paperwork to support the achievement of regulatory and internal compliance standards and to ensure timely clearance.
  • Take ownership of issues / requirements, taking the actions needed to provide the required and timely resolution.
The Ideal Candidate Will Have
  • Previous administrative experience in a busy office environment.
  • Experience or working knowledge of key clearance related principles, processes and regulatory requirements.
  • Customer focused with excellent communication skills.
  • Attention to detail and the ability to make sound numerical decisions within tight time deadlines.
  • Good analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Good Microsoft Office and PC skills.
What We Offer
  • FedEx offers employees a competitive benefits and reward package including a wide array of formal training and on the job learning opportunities.
  • FedEx is one of the most admired companies and trusted brands year after year.
  • In joining FedEx, every team member commits to our Purple Promise — to make every FedEx experience outstanding—for the customer and for our fellow team members.
Accuracy & Attention to Detail;Microsoft Office & PC Skills;Planning & Organizing Skills;Numerical Skills;Written & Verbal Communication Skills;

Qualifications

Language: English: Reading, Writing

Additional Information Posting Date: 16-January-2023

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all

Our Company

FedEx Express is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

Our Philosophy

The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

Our Culture

Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

Title: Senior Associate, Portfolio & Risk Management
Skills: Attention to Detail|Deal Execution|Financial Concepts|Google Docs|Google Sheets|Investment Performance|Investment Strategies|Manager Selection|Organization Skills|Risk Reviews|
Job Description:
About the job

Description


Our UniQue Team is growing and we are looking for a Project Manager to join us. You will be working on a number of exciting projects in a challenging, dynamic and fast-paced environment.


  • Be responsible for the delivery of the software projects according to the project objectives (quality, cost, time, scope, risk, benefits).
  • Lead the project delivery, and effectively coordinate the project teams towards the delivery goals.
  • Present ideas, concepts and alternative solutions generating added value to the project and the business in general.
  • Perform detailed project & quality planning based on best practices (e.g. PM2).
  • Facilitate workshops and participate on selected analysis & architecture meetings.
  • Participate in functional working groups and progress meetings.
  • Monitor costs, timescales and resources used, and take action where these deviate from agreed tolerances.
  • Ensure that delivered systems are implemented within these criteria.
  • Manage change in the scope and technology landscape of the project, facilitating agreement for revisions to the project between project stakeholders.
  • Ensure that projects deliverables meet quality standards and project requirements.
  • Communicate effectively with all the project stakeholders during the lifecycle of the project.
  • Work in close cooperation with the development teams in order to perform planned activities.
  • Take overall responsibility for all the risks and resolve any issues ensuring the project successful outcome.
  • Report on the project performance to selected internal and external stakeholders.
  • Establish strong and trusted relationships with the customers.
  • Work closely with the project support officers during the delivery of the project.


Requirements


  • Minimum 4 years completed university studies attested by a diploma, and a minimum of 8 years post-graduate professional experience.
  • Minimum 5 years in project management.
  • Strong experience on managing complex software projects.
  • Proven knowledge of software development methodologies (e.g. RUP, SCRUM, Agile, etc.)
  • Effective leadership, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • High analytical skills, ability to understand the project scope and to communicate with the various project roles (e.g. analysts, developers, architects, etc.).
  • Relevant knowledge of ITIL v3, COBIT, CMMI is highly desirable.
  • Excellent use of the English language (verbal & written).
  • Ability to analyze complex information and generate reports.
  • Certifications/ Trainings: Project Management, PM2 or ITIL Certification.


Benefits


What are we offering to our UniQue IT people?


  • People-first approach and open environment to express your ideas
  • Ticket restaurant – meal vouchers
  • Corporate laptop and equipment
  • Corporate mobile phone subscription
  • Work-life balance and a hybrid work model
  • Health and insurance plan for you and your family members
  • Employee consulting and guidance support by Hellas EAP
  • Continuous training and certifications
  • Discounts on the services and products of our Group’s companies
  • Gift vouchers for major life milestones
  • Special work schedule on summer Fridays and your birthday

Title: Clearance Administrator Associate

Job Description:
About the job

About the company:

Let’s be unstoppable together! Circana (formerly IRI and NPD) is the leading advisor on the complexity of consumer behavior. Through unparalleled technology, advanced analytics, cross-industry data and deep expertise, we provide clarity that helps almost 7,000 of the world’s leading brands and retailers take action and unlock business growth. At Circana, we are fueled by our passion for continuous learning and growth, we seek and share feedback freely, and we celebrate victories both big and small in an environment that is flexible and accommodating to our work and personal lives. Join our inclusive, committed team to be a challenger, own outcomes, and stay curious together. Learn more at www.circana.com

Role & Responsibilities

The successful candidate shall be highly motivated and results-driven with a passion for the analytics space. The candidate must be able to work independently, as well as actively participate with a collaborative team and be involved in the implementation of technological approaches, architectures and applications used to facilitate the provision and delivery of solutions.

Specifically, the everyday routine of the successful candidate will include:

Dealing with very big datasets (TBs) with hundreds of columns, stored in Hadoop clusters

A mix of programming languages (R, Python)

Interaction with highly skilled engineers and business people with different disciplines distributed around the globe

A mix of relational databases

Very demanding customers from the US retail sector

Participation in the delivery of analytics projects, providing supervision to more junior members of the team and enforcing best practice and quality standards

Being accountable for the performance and reliability of all product/component(s)

Building and retaining excellent working relationships

Acting proactively in flagging potential critical issues and challenges of the project to his/her manager

Skills & experience:

Required:

MSc /PhD university degree in a Numerate subject (i.e. Computer Science/Mathematics-Statistics)

1+ years working experience with SQL/Hive

Proven experience as software developer using R or Python, demonstrated success developing a variety of software systems

Extended experience with Hadoop

High command of verbal and written English

Desired:

Hands-on experience with spreadsheets

Experience in data mining

Solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design

Ability to clearly document features, technical specifications, and infrastructure requirements for self-produced technical work and job processes

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills able to present ideas and information clearly

Title: Project Manager

About the job

We are looking for an experienced BDM who will be in charge of the sales of printers & consumables for the entire country. With the sales network covering more than 80 countries and districts around the world, we are actively developing the Greek market and building our branding in the country.

Title: Data Scientist

Job Description:
About the job

SYNTAX IT Group is seeking to recruit a talented and motivated Systems Software Engineer to join our professional services team!


The Opportunity:

As Systems Software Engineer you will be part of a competent team of experienced software consultants and will be involved in pre-sales, implementation and after sales support engagements, delivering complex software solutions in major companies in the Banking, Insurance and Telco sectors.


The Candidate will work in an Agile mindset environment, which encourages team spirit, cooperation, and continuous learning, as an additional member of an experienced and skilled engineering team.


The responsibilities of the ideal candidate will include:

  • Analyze Customer’s IT systems infrastructure, applications and services setup and operations.
  • Prepare technical proposals for software solutions.
  • Implement, train and support SYNTAX’s offered solutions.
  • Cooperation with internal sales teams to promote SYNTAX solutions by conducting pre-sales activities (customer analysis, presentations, Proof of Concepts etc.)


Key Requirements & Prerequisites:

  • B.Sc. in Software Engineering, Computer Science or Information Systems or equivalent academic qualifications.

SYNTAX IT Group is a leading Information Technology Consulting Organization operating since 1984 in Greece, in the Arabian Gulf and in EU. For more than 39 years SYNTAX provides Consulting and Professional Services to a customer base that includes the largest corporations in Finance, Telecoms, Energy, Oil, Manufacturing, Transportation and in the Public Sector.


We offer a competitive remuneration package directly associated with your skills and expertise and the opportunity to evolve your career in the most dynamic business areas in today’s international marketplace.


The applications will be handled with high confidentiality.
