Title: Application Consultant
Skills: Agile Methodologies|Analytical Skills|Business Intelligence (BI)|Computer Science|Content Management Systems (CMS)|Customer Relationship Management (CRM)|Microsoft Dynamics|Project Management|SQL|Software Development Methodologies|
Job Description:
About the job

Job description:

Lightsource bp is a global leader in the development and management of solar energy projects. We are a 50:50 joint venture with bp with a mission to help drive the world’s transition to low carbon energy. With solar set to increase tenfold in the next 20 years, we are well-positioned to capitalise on this growth. By joining the Lightsource bp team, you will ‘be the change’ on the world’s energy transition to a more sustainable future. We pride ourselves on our entrepreneurial spirit as we continue to push the boundaries of an ever-changing energy landscape. By choosing a career with us, you can expect a challenging and fulfilling role surrounded by people who are passionate and have brilliant ideas about sustainable technology, innovation and making the world a better place.



This role will play a key role in developing the regional power market strategy for North and Central Europe which is a key geographical focus for our ambitious target to develop 25 GW by 2025.

To develop and implement strategy for offtake for projects in the development pipeline and optimise power monetisation for assets. Includes origination / sales and negotiation of PPA and other long-term offtake including complex and new structures and bidding strategy for government auctions. Multi country approach focused on developing partnership and relationships.



Duties and responsibilities

Identifying and developing market opportunities with major energy users focusing on Italy, Poland, and, Greece and other European locations as agreed.

Identifying and responding to tenders for renewable energy from Corporate offtakers.

Build interest, identify and secure buyers for Corporate PPAs

Work with suppliers and other market participants to develop innovative routes to market to secure bankable revenue to support solar development.

Work with legal department, structured finance and other internal stakeholders to negotiate heads of terms & PPA contracts with clients

Liaise with structured finance, development and commercial management to create power marketing solutions that optimise funding opportunities and enable development

Understand developments in the European markets and energy policy and the impact these will have on Power marketing in order to keep Lightsource BP at the forefront of the market



Knowledge

Comprehensive knowledge of the European power markets is a must along utility scale renewables experience ideally including

Multiyear experience of negotiating Power Purchase Agreements in the relevant markets.

Successful track record of executing complex energy projects and/or transactions.

Strong good interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills.

Experience presenting at many levels including internal and external stakeholders and speaking at events.



Experience

Deep experience in one or ideally more of the relevant power markets

Origination and negotiation of long-term power purchase agreements

Participation in renewable energy support auctions

Power trading and risk management



Personal qualities

Highly motivated individual who and can flourished in a dynamic, fast paced environment.

Strong communication and presentation skills. Ability to communicate effectively both written and verbally in English and either Italian or Greek.

Commercially driven, capable to leading complex negotiations

Present yourself with integrity, credibility and professionalism

Willing and able to travel across the Europe as required

Creative thinker who can find solutions, adapt to market developments and find new ways of doing things to drive value

Title: IT Systems Operator
Skills: Communication|English|Financial Transaction Processing|IBM iSeries|ISO 20000|ITIL|Information Technology|Interpersonal Skills|Multitasking|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

Are you interested in working with a leading education technology player, the global leader in the assessment and certification of the professional skills industry with a presence in more than 200 countries worldwide? If so, this is your chance to apply now! 📥

PeopleCert is looking for an Investment Analyst / Corporate Development who will join the Corporate Development Division. As an Investment Banking Analyst, you will play a key role in supporting PeopleCert's Corporate Development strategy, identifying and evaluating M&A opportunities, and supporting the execution of M&A transactions. PeopleCert is the first Greek Unicorn with a strong M&A strategy to support the goal of growing 40% YoY.

As an Investment Analyst your tasks will be to support in:
  • Sourcing and assessing acquisition opportunities
  • Executing detailed strategic and financial analysis of opportunities (market and company analysis, strategic fit, value proposition)
  • Evaluating financial modelling and pro forma financial analysis of targets
  • Covering aspects of the Due Diligence process in business evaluations/decisions
  • Executing M&A and investor relations processes
  • Preparing investor and company presentations

What we look for:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics
  • Master’s degree in a relevant field
  • 1-3 years’ experience in Investment Banking, Corporate Development, Transaction Services, Consulting or Private Equity
  • Proven experience in M&A and Due Diligence activities is a prerequisite
  • Excellent command of the English language (C2 level certification is desired, LanguageCert C2 LTE or C2 IESOL certificate would be a plus). Good knowledge of other languages, will be considered an asset
  • Excellent IT skills, ECDL Core/Expert certification will be considered an asset
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and strong communication skills
  • Strong analytical capabilities and advanced financial modelling skills
  • Team-playing approach and stakeholder management skills
  • Critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills

What we offer:
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Work in an international, dynamic and fun atmosphere 💯
  • Two free vouchers for all certifications from PeopleCert's Portfolio per year for all employees 🎓
  • Huge learning experience in using best practices and global environment 📈
  • Constant personal and professional development 🥇
  • 100% Virtual Hiring Process 💻

If you want to become a member of our international, dynamic and agile team that creates world leading software products, then we should certainly like to hear from you!

About PeopleCert

PeopleCert is a global leader in assessment and certification of professional skills, partnering with multi-national organizations and government bodies for the development & delivery of standardized exams. Delivering exams across 200 countries and in 25 languages over its state-of-the-art assessment technology, PeopleCert enables professionals to boost their careers and realize their life ambitions.

Quality, Innovation, Passion, Integrity are the core values which guide everything we do.

Our offices in UK, Greece, and Cyprus boast a culture of diversity, where everyone is different, yet everyone fits in. All of us at PeopleCert are committed to the reflection of the diversity and inclusion of our customers and the communities in which we do business.

Working on Home Office (HO) Secure English Language Tests (SELTs)

Any person who is engaged by PeopleCert to work on the SELT service must undergo a Background Check (the results of which must be acceptable to PeopleCert and the HO) prior to commencing their SELT duties. All SELT personnel will be required to complete a declaration (provided by PeopleCert) where the existence of any criminal record and/or bankruptcy must be declared.

If working on the SELT service in the UK, background checks will include:
  • A basic or enhanced Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) check
  • Right to Work in the UK check (including nationality, identity and place of residence)
  • HO security check (Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) or Counter Terrorist Check (CTC)
  • Financial background check
  • Employment reference check.
  • If working on the SELT service anywhere in the world (outside of the UK) personnel will undergo background checks that are equivalent to those stated for the UK.

In addition, if personnel are required to speak to SELT candidates they must be appropriately skilled in English language and, where SELT services are provided anywhere in the world (outside of the UK), the official language of the relevant country.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Title: Senior Manager, Power Markets
Skills: Commercially driven|Communication|Energy Markets|Energy Policy|Greek|Marketing Strategy|Power Trading|Presentation Skills|Presentations|Purchase Agreements|
Job Description:
About the job

We are looking for passionate individuals with an interest in healthcare to join our rapidly expanding Global Patient and Site Solutions team. Experience in a client facing, account management or sales type role is essential, and we are particularly interested in those with a healthcare communications or clinical trials background.

This position offers the flexibility to be home-based in EMEA.

PURPOSE

Our team of Patient Recruitment Strategy Leads collaborate with internal stakeholders and subject matter experts to develop patient recruitment, retention and site engagement support strategies. The focus of our team is on helping our clients, find, enroll and retain patients on clinical trials. Our mission is to make sure that all clinical trials are designed with the patient in mind and our strategies ensure the patient and site staff running the trial feel as supported as possible.

The Strategy Leads role is to support the achievement of new business targets through the development of proposed patient recruitment/retention and site engagement strategies. Articulate these strategies during the request for proposal process, including budget development, proposal text and slide presentations. If needed, support Sales by presenting/defending the patient recruitment/retention strategy during customer meetings.

Responsibilities
  • Serve as internal strategy consultant for new business opportunities
  • Develop strategic patient recruitment/retention and site engagement strategies for new business opportunities by working collaboratively with cross-functional stakeholders and subject matter experts
  • Build, review and update patient recruitment and retention budgets as needed during the strategy development process to reflect the most current strategy
  • Describe the patient recruitment/retention and site engagement strategies in a cohesive and compelling story for internal and external customers
  • Continuously support the Request for Proposal process including proactively following up on assigned opportunities to ensure business financial goals including, Gross New Business and Net New Business are achieved/exceeded
  • Work together with operational team to translate recruitment, retention and site engagement strategy into operational plan to positively impact recruitment and retention rates
  • Input into strategy adjustments for ongoing studies where requested
  • Mentor or support junior level staff on patient recruitment, retention and site engagement strategy development
  • Actively partner with the operational teams to stay knowledgeable about new strategic partnerships, proof points and case studies
  • Build relationships internally and externally with individuals that can help us enhance future recruitment strategy
  • Maintain knowledge of current recruitment trends, vendors, and technologies to increase productivity and recommend additional support as needed
  • Lead initiatives as assigned by management to increase productivity, efficiency and/or strategic differentiation in the market
  • Other duties as assigned by management
Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities
  • Essential
    • Experience in an account or sales role, or with direct experience driving new business
    • Passion for patient centricity / healthcare communications / clinic trials
    • Extensive experience in a client facing / relationship building role
    • Excellent presentation and negotiation skills
    • Accountability for all assigned tasks and experience proactively taking ownership of opportunities as they arise
    • Demonstrated ability to influence stakeholders at all levels, establish and maintain relationships with individuals inside and outside the organisation
    • Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills
    • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a high pressure and deadline driven environment, proactively managing competing priorities
    • Thorough grasp of all standard computer programs including Microsoft PowerPoint, Word and Excel
  • Desirable
    • Demonstrated ability to work with subject matter experts to create detailed and tailored engagement / communication strategies
    • Knowledge of the drug development / clinical trials processes
    • Experience working in patient recruitment in any context
    • Experience in healthcare communications
    • Experience developing ballpark and detailed budgets and discussing these with internal and external stakeholders
Minimum Required Education And Experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in a health care or other relevant discipline or educational equivalent
  • 7 yrs. of relevant and client facing industry experience (patient recruitment / communications / strategy)
  • Or equivalent combination of education, training and experience
Physical Requirements
  • Extensive use of keyboard requiring repetitive motion of fingers
  • Extensive use of telephone and face-to-face communication requiring accurate perception of speech
  • Regular sitting for extended periods of time
  • Some travel required
IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Investment Analyst- Corporate Development
Skills: Bankruptcy Law|Communication|Due Diligence|European Computer Driving Licence (ECDL)|Financial Modeling|Interpersonal Skills|Investment Banking|Investor Relations|Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A)|Quantitative Analytics|
Job Description:
About the job

Graduate Opportunities in Cyber Risk (Athens, Thessaloniki, Patras)



YOUR OPPORTUNITY



If you understand the very real dangers cyber threats pose and embrace the challenge of helping keep people and networks safe, then Deloitte Cyber is the right place to develop your career. We offer a wide range of opportunities to work with industry-leading clients and projects — and the technological resources to help them tackle their biggest challenges.


A role with Deloitte Cyber, isn’t just a career. It’s a calling. To help make the world more trustworthy, resilient, and secure. If you’re interested in joining a group of people who don’t just want to fix what’s broken but want to build something better, apply for a role with Deloitte Cyber.


We are currently seeking professionals with good analytical skills and a well-rounded personality to become part of our dynamic Cyber team. You will build your knowledge and experience working in a team of diverse and talented professionals who enjoy designing and implementing innovative cybersecurity and data protection strategies, for market leading clients in diverse industries (e.g., Financial Services, Energy, Telecommunications Media & Technology, Life Sciences & Healthcare etc.)



#ChooseDeloitteif


  • You want to be involved in the definition of new and cutting-edge solutions to address cybersecurity challenges for the most relevant and prestigious clients across industry verticals.
  • You want to work with inspiring, ambitious, and supportive people with diverse geographical and academic backgrounds and extensive skills.
  • You are a cyber enthusiast and visionary and you think that it will shape our future.
  • You get excitement in managing clients shifting priorities and accomplish tasks in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
  • You like to nurture people and share your knowledge with others.



#YourRole



Deloitte’s Cyber professionals help organizations focus on enterprise-level cyber risks through a strategic approach. Our services help clients reimagine cyber risk to uncover strategic opportunities aligned with their business priorities — to gain competitive advantage and become more trustworthy, resilient, and secure. We help clients conduct cyber assessments and benchmarking that set a foundation for training and reporting across the organization. And we help them identify potential insider threats and design programs to thwart it. Then we turn the lens toward helping clients modernize their core and traditional/ cloud infrastructures with next-generation security controls that help manage cyber risks and exposure.


You will thrive in a global environment, developing and managing innovative strategic initiatives for customers and collaborating with colleagues belonging to different geographies and backgrounds:

  • Become a member of cybersecurity projects, identifying, evaluating, and designing best in class cybersecurity and data protection solutions, demonstrating operational excellence, vision and strategic thinking.
  • Execute complex project activities, coordinate part of the team while supporting your more senior colleagues in managing client relations and expectations.
  • Manage own work against the project plan to ensure a superior client experience.
  • Face and solve customer cybersecurity and data protection technology-driven challenges in innovative and effective way.
  • Engage with internal and external stakeholders to strengthen business relations and create business opportunities.
  • Receive training and attain professional certifications in the use of cutting-edge cybersecurity products but also on various cybersecurity and data protection topics.



#WinningRequirements



Potential candidates should fulfill the following criteria:

  • Bachelor and/or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Cyber Security or equivalent.
  • Knowledge of Cyber Security Strategies, Cyber Security Assessments, Cyber Security Frameworks, Data Privacy & Protection concepts.
  • Fluent knowledge of English language.
  • Passion and curiosity for the cybersecurity industry and technology trends, innovations and frameworks, as well as current IT security technologies.
  • Be an independent and collaborative person who cooperates in one or more project teams to deliver high quality results.
  • Ability to conduct complex analyses and communicate them clearly and concisely to target audiences of different cultures, technical backgrounds and levels of seniority.
  • Military obligations fulfilled where applicable.




#AboutRiskAdvisory



At Deloitte, we work with clients across many industries to flag, analyze, evaluate and manage strategic and operational risks while seeking opportunities to create value by solving the most demanding business challenges in today’s evolving and volatile risk environment. Businesses across the world rely on Deloitte for advice and direction when evaluating these risks. We recognize the importance of mitigating risk – and the opportunities taking the right decisions can create for our clients.


Our distinctive combination of specialist skills, pioneering technology, industry expertise characterized our team who help our client to build effective risk strategies in the following areas:


  • Accounting & Internal Controls: includes services that focus on addressing issues and risks relating to accounting and financial reporting, assurance needs, risk assessment, and efficacy of internal controls system.
  • Cyber & Strategic Risk: helps clients address various aspects of Cyber and other strategic risks to their organizations in order to make risk informed strategic choices, prepare to respond to disruptions, assess and manage enterprise-level risks through their lifecycle, and strategize and respond to the risks associated with the reliability and protection of data, associated processes and technology. We provide advisory and managed services designed to help senior executives spot, assess, manage, and respond to risks and/or catastrophic unforeseen incidents that could undermine their competitive position and jeopardize their critical assets, reputation, and/or financial standing.
  • Regulatory & Legal Support: includes services that help our clients manage regulatory compliance, enforcement actions, financial crime, and other regulatory investigation related matters (but do not include the practice of law). These services are usually in support of the Chief Compliance Officer, Chief Operating Officer, Internal Legal Counsel, External Legal Counsel and other designated client leaders responsible for regulatory, compliance, and financial crime issues.





ABOUT DELOITTE



Our Services


Deloitte offers Global professional services that include Audit, Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.

We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients, in Greece and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within.


Our Purpose


Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size; it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.


Our Values


At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements.


Our Talent Experience


From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the centre of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.



Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

Title: Merchandiser(outsourced) Κέντρο Αθήνας
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


A day in the life of a Network Engineer (Senior)


As a Network Engineer (Senior), you will ensure that all network infrastructure complies with industry and corporate standards and policies. You will conduct routine preventative tasks, implement and maintain network security and ensure security compliance. Furthermore, you will participate in the design, planning and implementation of future IT projects.


The main duties will be to:


  • Install, configure, and manage network and network-security equipment such as switches, firewalls, and routers
  • Conduct root cause analysis of network device and service-related incidents
  • Fulfil Service Desk requests of end-users
  • Perform routine network administration tasks, proactive maintenance, and reporting
  • Prepare documentation


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, a leading IT company, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts in Greece. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe.


Qualifications


If you have


  • University or Technological Institute Degree in Computer Science or relative faculty
  • Solid understanding of Fiber Optical networking
  • Solid understanding and experience with IP telephony
  • Very good knowledge of industry protocols (i.e. TCP/IP, IPSec, Spanning tree, MSP etc)
  • Proficiency in LINUX and Information Security practices, solutions, and standards
  • Strong communication skills (written and oral), analytical & problem solving skills
  • Ability to work effectively as part of a team
  • Ability to work in an international/multicultural environment
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills in both Greek and English


…then this position is suitable for you!


It would also be a plus if you had :


  • Fortinet NSE5 or higher certification
  • CISCO CCNP certification


This position comes with


  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business), and fast career growth
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration for all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

About the job

Job Description


We are recruiting a Local IT Technician to solve customer support issues on-site, at our customer's premises. You will be responsible for providing the local support for all on-site employees and you will work along a team of skilled and motivated technicians! We are looking for an extremely proactive IT technician with a keen interest in technology, who is able to make suggestions for improvements and offer an opinion on new products or services.


  • The Deskside Technician will provide client specific IT support to the End Users, handle IT related problems in order of priority and within the optimum time scale, in accordance with procedures and project SLA's.

  • Candidates need to be flexible, efficient and able to work independently
  • Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences
  • Strong sense of customer service

The preceding job description had been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties and responsibilities required of employees assigned to this job.


What We Offer


  • Competitive salary
  • Opportunities to learn and develop: training programs;
  • Exposure to an international environment as part of a multicultural team spread across Europe.


Diversity & Inclusion


Here at the Stefanini Group, we value plurality and equity, regardless of race, sexual orientation, disability, age, ancestry, religion, gender, and nationality. We understand and encourage the importance of being you!


What's next:


It's best to apply today, because job postings can be taken down and we wouldn't want you to miss this opportunity.


In case you will need further information, just send us a message at recruitmentEMEA@stefanini.com and we'll be happy to assist!


About Us


We are a Brazilian company with over 30 years of experience in delivering IT services worldwide, ranging from IT outsourcing to application development or IT staffing. We have a direct presence in 39 countries, through our 88 offices located throughout the world and we enjoy working for over 500 active clients. While more than 300 of them are multinational corporations, we have managed to become the preferred partner of many small-to-midsize local and regional companies as well. Most of our clients come from industries such as financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical, services, technology, public sector and utilities.


Stefanini has career opportunities locally and around the world for professionals interested in a vibrant, passionate, team-oriented workplace. If you are a customer-centric person with a "get it done" attitude, come over for coffee and a talk on your future career with us!


Learn more about us on www.stefanini.com and join us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram where we regularly post insights from our colleagues.

Title: Onsite IT Technician
Skills: Active Directory|Cables|Communication|Hardware Installation|IT Hardware Support|Network Troubleshooting|Organization Skills|Symantec Endpoint Protection|Tablets|Troubleshooting|
Job Description:
About the job

At Hellas Direct, it all starts with the people. We are looking for an outstanding QA Automation Engineer, located either in Cyprus or Greece, to join our growing and vibrant team. You will be part of a fast-growing company which aims to disrupt the FinTech space in Greece and Cyprus.


The team is currently expanding, as many exciting greenfield projects need to be developed and delivered by our fast-paced agile product team. A strong work ethic, curiosity, motivation and talent are your tickets to success with us. Having a good sense of product and design is a huge plus!


Seize the opportunity to work with a multinational team, with developers in Cyprus and Greece. All teams will be working closely through a distributed agile workflow. We all work together in an environment where knowledge is shared, innovation is encouraged and achievement is rewarded.


What you will be doing

You will join our QA team to guard and validate our products. Your day-to-day activities will include designing and developing code to test applications via automation. You will be working as part of a dynamic team in a fast-paced agile environment.


What we are looking for

  • 3+ years of experience in automation testing position.
  • Deep understanding of Testing Life Cycle, with Extensive experience in Test planning, Test design and Test execution.
  • Knowledge of automation frameworks and programming languages.
  • Agile practices and experience with the Atlassian tool suite (Jira, Confluence).
  • Comfortable testing across multiple browser platforms / devices (e.g. Browserstack).
  • Strong communication skills.
  • Strong organization skills.


Would be a plus and expected from experienced engineers:

  • You think critically about assigned work to guarantee business functionality.
  • You understand and take into account business goals into technical decisions.
  • You collaborate with product managers, analysts and other functions to move company’s priorities forward.
  • Able to work across teams to tackle complex issues.
  • Able to positively influence other engineers, both directly and indirectly.
  • Mentor and grow other engineers.
  • Facilitate the team in solving the problem themselves.
  • Help the team prevent, clear or escalate impediments. Keep the product manager informed with blockers and unanswered questions.


What you will be working with

  • Java.
  • Javascript.
  • PostgreSQL.
  • Cucumber.
  • Selenium.
  • Cypress.
  • Rest Assured.
  • REST protocol.


Benefits

  • You’ll get to work in the country’s leading InsurTech company.
  • 5 days of online / offsite training.
  • Medical Insurance.
  • Employee’s discount on all our products.

Title: HR Assistant
Skills: Administrative Assistance|Daily Operations|Employee Relations|HR Policies|Human Resources (HR)|Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS)|Labor and Employment Law|Onboarding|Organization Skills|Typing|
Job Description:
About the job

At Skroutz, we have one simple yet powerful mission/vision: we aim to amaze. And this vision has been hardcoded into our DNA since day one. Back when we started our journey in 2005 as a price comparison engine, we created an innovative shopping tool for our users and shaped the future of e-commerce in Greece.


Today as the biggest marketplace in Greece, we continue to believe that happy customers equal happy merchants and it’s our job to understand and anticipate their needs and offer them an unparalleled, doubt-free experience. And to do so, we are always searching for new ways to make them say “wow”: Skroutz Plus (our first subscription-based service), Skroutz Last Mile (our parcel distribution company) and Skroutz Point (the first network of smart lockers in Greece) to name a few!


To create amazing experiences, we need amazing people! People that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce and technology as we do.


Sounds like you?

#AimToAmaze


How will you contribute to Skroutz vision

We are looking to hire a talented Product Designer Lead, passionate about designing amazing yet simple user-centered experiences. As a Lead Product Designer you will drive initiatives in one of our core product pillars, strategically lead the development of new or existing experiences collaborating closely with cross functional teams (PMs, Engineers, Designers etc) to define roadmap and increments for delivery.


How you’ll make an impact

  • Strategically lead the development of standards and guidelines that clarify expectations for the design team
  • Your impact will be a force multiplier, amplifying efforts to improve our design
  • Mentor, influence and coach other designers
  • Take a leading role in one of our core product pillars (Discovery, marketplace, growth)

As a Design lead at Skroutz you will manage 2-3 Designers and you will report to Product Design Manager.


What you will be doing

  • Collaborate closely with the product manager to define roadmap for design and increments for delivery
  • Mentor and coach product designers, helping them grow in their skills and careers
  • Own all sides of design from concept to launch: storyboards, user flows, mockups, prototypes, and pixel perfect assets
  • Participate in user studies, competitive research and usability tests alongside User Research Team
  • Work closely with developers to see design through to implementation
  • Request early feedback through rapid prototypes or low fidelity wireframes
  • Maintain consistency in visual elements and ensure that our design system and philosophy is applied across the product
  • Collaborate with internal teams; communicate thoughts and expertise to the rest of the team
  • Keep up with industry standards, new trends, UI//UX patterns etc


Requirements

  • Minimum 3 years experience in a relevant position
  • Excellent Portfolio of UI/UX design solutions across a spectrum of platforms and services
  • Experience working in a cross-discipline team environment
  • Experience in user research, usability studies, personas
  • Proficiency in relevant creative tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD), we work with figma
  • Familiarity with Adobe suite & prototyping tools
  • Familiarity with version control system (git, Abstract etc)
  • Demonstrated experience working with a design system, its curation, maintenance, and dissemination
  • Self-motivated to prioritise and manage workload and meet critical project deadlines
  • Positive attitude with a creative, solution-driven mindset
  • Fluent in Greek

*Please ensure you have included a sample link of your UI/UX Portfolio in your application. Applications with no portfolio will not be assessed further.

**Please note that this opening concerns a job located in Athens, Attica, Greece.


What's it like to work at Skroutz?

  • A great opportunity to contribute to the evolution of Skroutz towards becoming one of Europe’s fastest growing Marketplaces
  • Being part of an environment that gives employees large goals, autonomy and mentoring, which creates incredible opportunities, both for you and the company
  • Competitive full time salary
  • Ongoing training and development
  • Private Medical plan
  • Top of the Line tools and equipment
  • Access to books, online courses and relevant resources
  • Hybrid Working
  • Extra paid time off
  • Free Skroutz Plus subscription


As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Skroutz is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard to race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religion.


Disclaimer:

Skroutz collects and processes personal data in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). We are bound to use the information provided within your job application for recruitment purposes only and not to share these with any unauthorized third parties. Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy here: https://www.skroutz.gr/candidates-privacy

Title: QA Automation Engineer
Skills: Cucumber|Java|JavaScript|Jira|PostgreSQL|QA Automation|SQL|Selenium|Test Automation|Test Planning|
Job Description:
About the job

Η εταιρεία μας είναι μέλος του ομίλου Delsk, με γραφεία στην Αθήνα. Η εταιρεία ασχολείται με τον σχεδιασμό, την κατασκευή, την ανάπτυξη ακινήτων , την ανακαίνιση και ανέγερση κτιρίων στο περιοχή της Αθήνας. Η κατασκευή είναι ένας από τους κύριους στόχους της εταιρείας μας. Κατασκευάζουμε κτιρια με πολυτέλεια στον σχεδιασμό και υψηλής ποιότητας υλικά.

Έχουμε ολοκληρώσει μέχρι σήμερα 50 έργα ανεγερσης νεων κτιρίων και ανακαινίσεων. Προγραμματίζονται να ανεγερθούν περισσότερα από 10 έργα κάθε χρόνο για τα επόμενα 3 χρόνια .


Ο ρόλος:

Η ομάδα των μηχανικών μας επεκτείνεται και ψάχνουμε για έναν Πολιτικό Μηχανικό για να ενταχθεί σε μια ισχυρή ομάδα που εστιάζει στον πελάτη, είναι υποστηρικτική και φιλική. Αυτός ο ρόλος θα ταιριάζει σε ένα άτομο με υψηλές επιδιώξεις για το μέλλον και να ενδιαφέρεται να εργαστεί σε ένα διεθνή όμιλο.


Κύριες Ευθύνες:

• Συντονισμός υπεργολάβων και προμηθευτών στο εργοτάξιο.

• Επίβλεψη της ποιότητας της κατασκευής.

• Παρακολούθηση του χρονοδιαγράμματος του έργου.

• Έλεγχος του κόστους κατασκευής του έργου.

• Προ-μετρήσεις και επιμετρήσεις των εργασιών του έργου.

• Έλεγχος πιστοποιήσεων υπεργολάβων και προετοιμασία λογαριασμών.


Απαιτήσεις:

• Πτυχίο Πολιτικού Μηχανικού ή αντίστοιχο.

• Τουλάχιστον 3 χρόνια αποδεδειγμένης επαγγελματικής εμπειρίας, κατά προτίμηση στον τομέα μηχανικού εργοταξίου οικοδομικών έργων.

• Προηγμένη γνώση MS Office και λογισμικού CAD.

• Προσωπικότητα προσανατολισμένη στην ομαδική εργασία.

• Απαιτείται άδεια οδήγησης.

• Εκπληρωμένες Στρατιωτικές υποχρεώσεις

Title: Lead Product Designer (LPD 0323)
Skills: Adobe Creative Suite|Adobe XD|Figma (Software)|Mockups|Storyboarding|Usability|User Experience (UX)|User Experience Design (UED)|User Interface Design|User Research|
Job Description:
About the job

Description


Who We Are:


Persado provides the only Motivation AI platform that generates personalized communications at scale, inspiring each individual to engage and act. Many of the world’s largest brands, including Ally Bank, Marks & Spencer, and Verizon, rely on Persado to generate hyper-personalized communications. Persado’s generative AI is trained on more than 100 billion digital business language impressions across industries, enabling marketers to motivate customers and drive significant business value.


As an employer, Persado is committed to creating a place where everyone’s unique perspective is valued. We understand that our team members and our inclusive culture are what make Persado special. Persado is proud to be named on Fast Company’s World’s Most Innovative Companies list in 2020 and Built In’s Best Places To Work in 2021 & 2022.


What We Are Looking For


We are seeking a highly skilled QA Director to lead our QA Engineering department. The ideal candidate will have experience managing both manual and automated testing, with a deep understanding of software development life cycle and testing methodologies. As the QA Director, you will be responsible for developing and implementing testing strategies, managing and mentoring the QA team, and ensuring the quality of our software products.


What You Will Work On


  • Develop and implement comprehensive testing strategies, including test plans, test cases, and automated test scripts, to ensure high-quality software products
  • Manage and mentor a team of automation engineers and manual testers to ensure high-quality software delivery
  • Collaborate with the development team to ensure testing is integrated into the software development life cycle
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices to continuously improve our testing process
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with cross-functional teams, including product management and engineering teams
  • Ensure timely and accurate reporting of testing status and results to stakeholders
  • Establish and maintain QA metrics to drive continuous improvement and efficiency


What You Bring


  • At least 10 years of experience in software quality assurance, including experience in both manual and automated testing
  • At least 4 years of experience in managing a QA team
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field
  • Strong understanding of software development life cycle and testing methodologies
  • Experience with Java, Selenium and other automation tools
  • Experience with agile development methodologies
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously
  • Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively


What We Offer


Achieve your life goals and work goals at Persado.


  • Persado’s hybrid working model empowers both remote and in-office work equitably!
  • Competitive and equitable compensation
  • Generous benefits packages globally
  • 401k matching (USA); Pension Scheme (Certain EU locations) to prepare for your future
  • We encourage professional growth through our dedicated enablement and training teams, as well as on demand tools and resources
  • Employee Enrichment Fund to pursue a passion or upgrade your home office!
  • Structured onboarding program to ensure a confident start and long-term success for new hires!
  • Strong emphasis on career development and mobility, continuous feedback loops and performance management
  • Flexible time off to support work-life harmony (including Summer Fridays and a one week Winter Holiday Break)
  • #PersadoCares! 2 paid Volunteer days per year and charitable donation match
  • Robust Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives; culture month celebrations, monthly diverse speaker series, commitment to bias-free recruitment, ERGs (#culture, #mindsmatter, #parents, #women, #green, #pride and growing)!


Valuing diversity at Persado means recognizing and respecting human differences and similarities. Persado is committed to diversity with respect to all aspects of employment. All decisions regarding recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, employee training and development, and all other terms and conditions of employment, will be made without regard to race, religious beliefs, color, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, physical and mental disability, age, ancestry or place of origin.


  • Kindly submit your CV In English*

Title: Site Engineer
Skills: Buildings|Civil Engineering|Computer-Aided Design (CAD)|Construction|Construction Site Inspections|Project Coordination|Renovation|Residential Real Estate|Site Engineering|Time Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Περιγραφή εταιρείας


Καλώς ήρθες στην H&M! Έναν χώρο εργασίας που μπορείς να είσαι ο εαυτός σου & ακόμα περισσότερα!


Σχετικά με την H&M


Είμαστε περήφανοι για την ιστορία μας κάνοντας την μόδα προσιτή σε όλους και η φιλοδοξία μας για το αύριο είναι να κάνουμε την μόδα ακόμα πιο αειφόρα και προσιτή για τους πελάτες μας. Εάν έχεις θέληση να μάθεις, να αναπτυχθείς και να βοηθήσεις τους πελάτες και τους συναδέλφους σου, η H&M θα είναι πάντα ένα μέρος όπου θα μπορείς τόσο να εκφραστείς όσο και να νοιώσεις ότι ανήκεις εδώ.


Γιατί να εργαστείς στην H&M;


Πιστεύουμε πως δεν μπορείς να αλλάξεις τον κόσμο χωρίς να έχεις δίπλα σου υπέροχους ανθρώπους. Έτσι, προσφέρουμε επιπρόσθετα οφέλη, πληθώρα ευκαιριών μάθησης και την δυνατότητα να ξεκινήσεις να χτίζεις μια μακροχρόνια καριέρα ή και να εργαστείς με part- time ωράριο, κυνηγώντας παράλληλα και άλλα όνειρα.Πολλοί από τους παγκόσμιους ηγέτες μας ξεκίνησαν την καριέρα τους από τα καταστήματα.


Περιγραφή θέσης εργασίας


Ο ρόλος του Σύμβουλου Πωλήσεων είναι η αφετηρία στην H&M και η εισαγωγή σε ένα ελκυστικό περιβάλλον παγκόσμιας μόδας με γρήγορους ρυθμούς. Ένωσε την διαφορετικότητά σου μαζί μας και αναπτύξου πολύ περισσότερο από όσο πίστευες πως θα ήταν δυνατόν!


Ως Σύμβουλος Πωλήσεων θα αποκτήσεις όλες τις βασικές γνώσεις για την λειτουργία του καταστήματος, θα γίνεις μέλος μιας ταλαντούχας ομάδας νέων φίλων- και το πιο σημαντικό- θα μάθεις πως να κάνεις τους πελάτες μας να νοιώθουν ευπρόσδεκτοι και χαρούμενοι.


Να είσαι ο εαυτός σου & και περισσότερα στην H&M.


Επαγγελματικά προσόντα


Τι κάνεις:


  • Παροχή άψογης εξυπηρέτησης πελατών στους ορόφους του καταστήματος, στα δοκιμαστήρια και στα ταμεία με στόχο την αύξηση των πωλήσεων
  • Διασφάλιση της έγκαιρης και αποτελεσματικής ροής των προϊόντων, συμμετέχοντας ενεργά στην παραλαβή και την προετοιμασία τους
  • Αναπλήρωση, τακτοποίηση και εμπορική παρουσίαση των εμπορευμάτων
  • Εργασία στα ταμεία σύμφωνα με τις εταιρικές διαδικασίες χειρισμού όλων των απαιτούμενων συναλλαγών
  • Ενεργή συμμετοχή στην προετοιμασία και εφαρμογή των εμπορικών ενεργειών
  • Τήρηση όλων των διαδικασιών ασφάλειας και υγιεινής, με στόχο την πρόληψη απωλειών και την ασφάλεια του καταστήματος
  • Ομαδική εργασία και ενεργή υποστήριξη των συναδέλφων σου


Όπως όλοι στην H&M, πιστεύουμε πως διαθέτεις επιχειρηματικό πνεύμα, είσαι επικοινωνιακός, φιλόδοξος και ομαδικός παίκτης, ανοιχτός σε προκλήσεις με ισχυρό εσωτερικό κίνητρο και θετικό πνεύμα. Οι δεξιότητές σου περιλαμβάνουν:


  • Παροχή άψογης εξυπηρέτησης πελατών με στόχο την αύξηση των πωλήσεων
  • Αναπλήρωση, τακτοποίηση και εμπορική παρουσίαση των εμπορευμάτων
  • Επιτυχής χειρισμός πολλών εργασιών μέσα σε ένα περιβάλλον γρήγορων ρυθμών
  • Ξεκάθαρη και ευθύς επικοινωνία με την ομάδα του καταστήματος και ικανότητα παροχής και λήψης σχολίων με θετικό τρόπο
  • Ολοκλήρωση εργασιών έγκαιρα και αποτελεσματικά
  • Διάθεση για μάθηση και συνεχής βελτίωση
  • Τήρηση όλων των διαδικασιών ασφάλειας και υγιεινής, με στόχο την πρόληψη απωλειών και την ασφάλεια του καταστήματος
  • Ομαδική εργασία και ενεργή υποστήριξη των συναδέλφων σου


Σου ακούγεται ενδιαφέρον; Τότε Έλα μαζί μας σε αυτή την περιπέτεια!


Πρόσθετες πληροφορίες


Η H&M δεσμεύεται στη δημιουργία ενός περιβάλλοντος χωρίς αποκλεισμούς, ενισχύοντας τη διαφορετικότητα και ενεργά αναζητούμε υποψήφιους ανεξάρτητα από γένος, εθνικότητα, θρησκεία, σεξουαλική προτίμηση, αναπηρία ή ηλικία.


Στην Η&Μ η προσωπική σου εξέλιξη είναι το ίδιο σημαντική με την ανάπτυξη της εταιρίας.

Title: QA Engineering Director
Skills: Analytical Skills|Communication|Handle Multiple Projects|Leadership|Problem Solving|QA Engineering|Quality Assurance|Software Quality|Software Quality Assurance|Test Automation|
Job Description:
About the job

We are the makers of possible


BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.


Why join us?


A career at BD means learning and working alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. You will have the opportunity to help shape the trajectory of BD while leaving a legacy at the same time.


To find purpose in the possibilities, we need people who can see the bigger picture, who understand the human story that underpins everything we do. We welcome people with the imagination and drive to help us reinvent the future of health. At BD, you’ll discover a culture in which you can learn, grow and thrive. And find satisfaction in doing your part to make the world a better place.


Become a maker of possible with us!


Our vision for Sales at BD


At BD, sales go beyond selling products. As the top tier medical technology company in the ever-transforming healthcare industry, we see how important it is to provide groundbreaking solutions. This means changing how we partner with public and private-sector customers to understand their needs and improve patient lives.


Job Description


As a Sales Representative Temperature Management Therapy, the successful candidate will be responsible for developing a deep understanding of BD’s TTM Products and their indications, to fully support and develop the Greek business. Promote growth of Arctic Gel Pads usage and expand Temperature Management Therapy adoption in Greek market.


Main responsibilities will include:


  • Build a deep understanding of TTM and Arctic Sun technology, with targeted customers, by driving professional activities.
  • Acquire new customers and support existing ones with the aim to increase sales revenue and market share


About you


  • Proficient in English
  • Excellent negotiation, presentation and account management skills
  • Ability to travel outside Athens and abroad. Incumbent must have and maintain a valid driver’s license
  • Dedication to professional self-development and the ability to apply learning proactively
  • Experience with critical patients and in the field of intensive care units is an asset
  • Clinical Experience


Click on apply if this sounds like you!


Becton, Dickinson and Company is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We do not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital or domestic or civil union status, familial status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, disability, military eligibility or veteran status, or any other protected status.


To learn more about BD visit: https://bd.com/careers

Title: Σύμβουλος Πωλήσεων -Εποχιακή Μερική Απασχόληση, Αθήνα
Job Description:
About the job

About us

Nueva Pescanova is a leading multinational company in the sector of seafood commercialization. We are one of the few companies that integrate all the activities of the value chain: we fish, farm, process and commercialize more than 70 species of fish and shellfish in 80 countries all over the world. Nueva Pescanova Group has a dynamic presence in all five continents with its own fleet of vessels, aquaculture units and production facilities, employing about 10,000 people.

Pescanova Hellas started its operations in Greece in 2004. We are among the leading food suppliers of the Greek market and a dynamic player in the South-East Europe region. Οur vision is to bring the freshness of the sea to the plate of all consumers across the region. We are proud of our long experience on sea products, as nowadays, the tradition of Pescanova is more relevant than ever, ready to satisfy consumers conscious of a quality diet for health, wellness, taste and delight in their life.

Our mission is to constantly remind the value of fish and seafood, enrich and deepen the consumers’ knowledge on them and inspire you with new ideas. This is the freshness we bring to your life, through an equally fresh perspective on ethics and care: The sea is our home, the fish is our future and the children of our consumers are our children. We give the best of us to ensure the best for everyone.


The role

We are currently expanding our business and we are looking for a new member to join our team as Exports Area Manager. The role will report to the Export Director, and you will be collaborating with Customer Service, Supply Chain, Finance and Marketing Departments.

Purpose of this role is to effectively plan & carry out Exports customers activities in the assigned markets, and across the strategic business channels of Food Service/ HORECA, Retail and Private Label. The goal will be the successful deployment and execution of customers annual business plans and budget strategies, with a strong mindset towards exceeding turnover and profit targets.

You will be responsible to :

  • Actively manage & develop PESCANOVA portfolio in the existing customers in the Balkans area. Priority focus in the Food Service & Retail channels.
  • Identify new business opportunities by tapping the potential customers and new-to-open markets.
  • Conduct regular business reviews in order to monitor customer sales performance, ensuring all sales and marketing activities are carried out within the aligned targets and timelines.
  • Able to understand and handle efficiently assigned markets P&L
  • Collect and analyze market data on frequent basis. Able to spot new category trends in the assigned markets, ensuring Pescanova portfolio and commercial strategies remain competitive.
  • Able to liaise and influence all key stakeholders and decisions makers of his strategic customers.


Requirements

  • Bachelor's Degree in Business or Marketing. A relevant Master's degree would be considered a plus.
  • 4-6 years of hands on relevant experience in Key Account and Exports Customer - Business Development management, preferably in the Balkans region
  • Excellent command of Greek and English language. Knowledge of additional foreign languages will be considered a plus.
  • Ability for regular travel and time away from home.

Soft Skills Needed

  • Team player with solid team-working mindset
  • Creative, result oriented and self-driven.
  • Demonstrate effective communication skills and critical thinking.
  • Ability to plan and prioritize.
  • Ability to adapt and solve problems while paying attention to detail.
  • Ability to collect information from various sources and negotiate internally and externally.
  • Proficient user of Microsoft Suite.
  • Strong numerical and analytical competency.
  • Ability to plan and deliver with strong time management skills.
  • Ability for efficient Export customer remote management.


  • What we offer
  • The opportunity to join a passionate team of people who really love what they do and are willing to share their knowledge and expertise.
  • An inspiring and dynamic working environment in which we shape relationships aiming at building both the business and the people who work for it
  • Opportunity to influence as you will get to work in an open climate, close to decision makers and with the possibility of making a difference.
  • Strong entrepreneurial spirit - a healthy appetite for innovation and development characterizes our way of work.
  • A competitive remuneration scheme ( Bonus, Private Health Insurance and Pension Plan)

Title: Sales representative Temperature Management Therapy (Field)(Resident Athens)
Skills: Account Management|Business|Critical Care Medicine|English|Greek|Marketing|Negotiation|Presentations|Sales|Therapy|
Job Description:
About the job

ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations. With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life. Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well.


Responsibilities:


  • Planning, management, and oversight of clinical study execution in accordance with the global program strategy, through leadership of the cross-functional Local Study Team (LST).
  • Supports country-level operational planning and accountable for site selection within assigned country/-ies.
  • Contributes and develops to program/study-specific materials – e.g., monitoring plan, study specific training documents.
  • Supports and contributes to Clinical Study Teams (CSTs) / Trial Management Teams (TMTs) as applicable, agenda driven, present at meetings.
  • Communicates country status (including timelines and deliverables) to key stakeholders (e.g., Global Clinical Managers [GCM], Program Managers, CST or TMT, Development Operations Manager [DOM] etc) with oversight as required and ensures updates to relevant system
  • Accountable for site-level goal setting and study-specific deliverables for clinical sites within their country/-ies.
  • Contributes to, deliver and/or lead CRA, Investigator and Study Coordinator training
  • Provides oversight and monitoring of applicable vendor activities e.g., laboratories and equipment provisioning
  • Engages with local cluster team and local functions from a study perspective (e.g., Local Medical Affairs team, DOM).
  • Provides country level input into the Country Operational Plan (COP) and partner with the DFM through feasibility and with the GCMs to ensure local delivery of the stud
  • Responsible for approval of Baseline and Revised Enrolment Plans (Country Level).
  • Contributes to the study-level forecast for investigational product, support study level accountability and reconciliation across assigned countries, management of ELE (enrolment long-range estimates) process.
  • Monitors the execution of the clinical study against timelines, deliverables, and budget for that country.
  • Translates global start up requirements into local country targets
  • Monitors country enrolment and retention and act on deviations from plan. Identify barriers to enrolment and support recruitment and retention strategic solutions.
  • Monitors and acts upon data flow metrics - review, trend identification and analysis, with targeted follow up where appropriate.
  • Monitors and reviews country and study trends.
  • Reviews Monitoring Visit Reports.
  • Identifies and facilitates resolution of cross-functional study-specific issues.
  • Provides updates regarding the study budget and obtains approval for budget deviations for clinical sites (outside of range).
  • Escalates any issues related to delivery, timelines, or budget to GCMs (or TMT le ad if appropriate).
  • Escalates CRA performance issues to applicable Clinical Trial Oversight Manager.
  • Conducts on-site quality visits with CRAs where/when appropriate and supports the maintenance of investigator site relationships.
  • Executes regulatory agency inspection readiness activities (e.g., TMF review, story board generation).
  • Supports internal audit and inspection activities and contributes to CAPAs, including leading resolution of issues when appropriate e.g., vendor management.
  • Participates in cross-functional task forces/process improvement groups
  • Assigns and oversees deliverables of study support staff e.g., Study Management Associate, ASM/SASM (Snr./Assc. Study management) and continually reviews country level risk mitigation to ensure study delivers to plan.
  • Collaborates with local teams to ensure country level study delivery is aligned with global expectations.
  • Coordinates of the site contracting, budgeting, insurance and payment process by overseeing local support roles (e.g., CTA, SCBA, Legal).
  • Identifies risk, implementing risk mitigation strategies, and resolving issues at a country/site level, as well as informing the CST / TMT, LST and local teams of risks associated with delivery in a proactive, timely and solution orientated manner. Contribute to study-level risk assessments.
  • Leads and continually reviews country level risk mitigation activities to ensure study delivery to plan.
  • Maintains relevant therapeutic knowledge.



Knowledge:

  • Local knowledge / expertise of regulatory environment, study start up process and associated timelines etc.
  • Clinical trial processes and operations
  • Extensive knowledge of ICH/GCP regulations and guidelines
  • Project and Program management experience including oversight of study deliverable, budgets and timelines
  • Time, cost and quality metrics, key performance indicators (KPIs)
  • Relevant Therapeutic knowledge is preferred

Key Competencies:

  • Matrix team leadership
  • Project Management skillset
  • Critical thinking and horizon scanning
  • Problem solving
  • Decision making
  • Delegation skills


Benefits of Working in ICON:


Our success depends on the knowledge, capabilities and quality of our people. That’s why we are committed to developing our employees in a continuous learning culture – one where we challenge you with engaging work and where every experience adds to your professional development.


At ICON, our focus is to provide you with a comprehensive and competitive total reward package that comprises, not only an excellent level of base pay, but also a wide range of variable pay and recognition programs. In addition, our best in class employee benefits, supportive policies and wellbeing initiatives are tailored to support you and your family at all stages of your career - both now, and into the future.


ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.


If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know.

Title: Exports Area Manager
Skills: Business Development|Business Reviews|Operations|P&L Management|
Job Description:
About the job

About the company:


Greek company operates in the industrial sector.


Job description


  • Prepare reports
  • Track and determine financial status by analyzing actual results against budgets, forecasts
  • Assist with processing and analysis of financial data (planning, budgets, income statement forecasts, etc.)
  • Perform a wide variety of tasks in support of the financial analysis process, entering data across a broad range of tools
  • Prepare business and financial models (using Google sheets-Google slides) for financial analysis and future-looking results
  • Review and present end results to the General Manager
  • Collaborate in a team-oriented environment, develop innovative approaches to solving technical challenges

To qualify for the role you must have:


  • 2 to 3 years of professional experience in a relevant role
  • Academic background in Finance, Business Administration, or another related field
  • Strong numerical/analytical ability and a sound grasp of financial accounting
  • Advanced Excel skills in developing financial models
  • Very good written and oral skills both in Greek and English
  • A confident and positive attitude focused on teamwork and communication with colleagues and clients at all levels
  • Commitment to providing excellent quality work
  • Ability to take initiative and work effectively under pressure
  • Fulfilled military obligations

What we offer:


We offer a competitive compensation package where you will be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business.

Title: Local Trial Manager (LTM) - Sponsor Dedicated
Skills: Budgeting|CAPAs|Clinical Development|Critical Thinking|Delegation|Good Clinical Practice (GCP)|Horizon Scanning|ICH|Program Management|Project Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Αναζητάμε έναν IT Support Engineer, για λογαριασμό μεγάλου μας πελάτη με κύρια δραστηριότητα την αποτελεσματική υποστήριξη των εργαζομένων στη λειτουργία συστημάτων hardware & software.


Καθήκοντα

• Εγκατάσταση και έλεγχος λειτουργίας hardware & software

• Διασφάλιση ορθής λειτουργίας υποδομής & δικτυακού εξοπλισμού

• Υποστήριξη και αντιμετώπιση προβλημάτων

• Αναβαθμίσεις για ενεργοποίηση συμβατού λογισμικού σε όλους τους υπολογιστές

• Εγκατάσταση και αναβάθμιση λογισμικού προστασίας από ιούς

• Εκτέλεση δοκιμών και αξιολογήσεων νέου λογισμικού και υλικού

• Παροχή υποστήριξης στους χρήστες και first or second level support

• Δημιουργία καλών σχέσεων με όλα τα τμήματα και τους συναδέλφους

• Διεξαγωγή καθημερινών λειτουργιών δημιουργίας αντιγράφων ασφαλείας

• Διαχείριση εγγράφων τεχνικών προδιαγραφών και εσωτερικών διαδικασιών

• Επικοινωνία με προμηθευτές και εσωτερικά τμήματα για την υλοποίηση θεμάτων


Απαραίτητα Προσόντα

• Πτυχίο ΑΕΙ ή ΤΕΙ Πληροφορικής

• Επιθυμητή η προϋπηρεσία 2-4 χρόνια σε αντίστοιχη θέση

• Γνώση διαχείρισης και συντήρησης υπολογιστών, περιφερειακών και δικτυακών συσκευών

• Άριστη γνώση της αγγλικής γλώσσας (γραπτά και προφορικά)

• Γνώση συστημάτων MS Windows 10, MS Office 365

• Εκπληρωμένες στρατιωτικές υποχρεώσεις (για τους άνδρες υποψηφίους)


Δεξιότητες θέσης

• Ικανότητα ταυτόχρονης διαχείρισης πολλαπλών tasks

• Άριστες επικοινωνιακές δεξιότητες και ομαδικό πνεύμα

• Επιμέλεια και σημασία στη λεπτομέρεια

• Αποτελεσματική προφορική και γραπτή επικοινωνία

• Συνέπεια και υπευθυνότητα

• Ικανότητα επίλυσης προβλημάτων

• Ευελιξία και προσαρμοστικότητα


Παροχές

• Πρόσθετη ιδιωτική ιατροφαρμακευτική ασφάλιση

• Ελκυστικό πακέτο αποδοχών

• Ευχάριστο εργασιακό περιβάλλον

• Ιδιωτική ασφάλιση

• Συνεχής εξέλιξη και εκπαίδευση


Η UpcoMinds με εμπειρία 25 ετών στον χώρο του ΙΤ, αποτελεί μία δυναμική, πρωτοπόρο και σύγχρονη εταιρεία τεχνολογίας και πληροφορικής. Η εταιρεία παρέχει ολοκληρωμένες web και mobile λύσεις, βοηθώντας τις επιχειρήσεις στον εκσυγχρονισμό και την ανάπτυξή τους στο ψηφιακό περιβάλλον. Οι δεξιότητες και η εξειδίκευση της ομάδας της UpcoMinds διασφαλίζουν τον ολιστικό ψηφιακό μετασχηματισμό των οργανισμών, ο οποίος βελτιώνει σημαντικά τόσο τις επιχειρηματικές δραστηριότητες όσο και την εμπειρία των πελατών του.


Μάθετε περισσότερα για εμάς στο www.upcominds.com


Δεσμευόμαστε στην προώθηση της ένταξης και της διαφορετικότητας δημιουργώντας ένα εργασιακό περιβάλλον όπου όλοι οι εργαζόμενοι αντιμετωπίζονται με αξιοπρέπεια, ισότητα και σεβασμό, εκτιμώντας τις ατομικές διαφορές. Προσφέρουμε ίσες ευκαιρίες σε όλες τις βαθμίδες της απασχόλησης.

Οι σύμβουλοί μας θα εξετάσουν το βιογραφικό σας το συντομότερο δυνατό και θα επικοινωνήσουν μαζί σας για να συζητήσουν την ευκαιρία για την οποία υποβάλλετε αίτηση. Εάν δεν λάβετε νέα από εμάς τις επόμενες δέκα (10) εργάσιμες ημέρες, μπορεί να θεωρήσετε ότι δεν έχετε επιλεγεί για τη συγκεκριμένη εργασία.

Title: Controller
Skills: Accounting|Business Analysis|Financial Analysis|Microsoft Excel|Microsoft Office|Office Software|
Job Description:
About the job

The Employer:

A fresh and dynamic iGaming Organization which aspires to disrupt the Online Casino Market by presenting a proposition which will stand out and stand apart.


The Challenge:

The Online Casino Director is the lead of the Online Casino, the person responsible for defining and implementing the product value proposition and how this will be communicated to external as well as internal audiences. Key priority of the role is to manage, orchestrate and lead a team of talented and enthusiastic Online Casino Product and Marketing professionals to ensure a product offering which always meets -if not exceeds- best of class standards while ensuring the brand messages are relevant and unique at all times. As the Online Casino Director you will be the person responsible for determining, delivering and assessing the agreed performance KPIs so as to drive growth and player engagement/satisfaction. Reporting directly to the CEO, the Online Casino Director will essentially be the heart and mind and of the Casino.

Responsibilities:

  • Define and supervise the execution of the online Casino Product and Communication Strategy
  • Co-Own the Online Casino P&L
  • Set, monitor and continuously evaluate the set performance KPI’s providing useful business insights
  • Build, manage and maintain relationships with 3rd party providers and vendors.
  • Own the Product roadmap with vision and effectiveness
  • Lead product as well as the front ends' roadmap
  • Put together, execute, evaluate and constantly optimize the Casino promotions and rewards across segments
  • Be in charge of Marketing the online Casino across relevant touchpoints (Acquisition, Affiliation Marketing, Retention)
  • Be the brand champion across communication channels
  • Brief third party agencies for achieving a creative Marketing Communications output and salient media presence
  • Contribute with innovative ideas/concepts that would effectively mark the differentiation of the Online Casino vs the competition
  • Follow on competitors’ activity and global Online Casino trends to propose actionable tasks for ensuring the product is always at the forefront
  • Design team’s processes and manage workflow and deliverables in order to achieve business goals
  • Collaborate with operations to optimize User Experience across all touchpoints


Requirements:

  • Significant experience working within the casino sector, specifically the online casino product vertical
  • Highly adept at working in numbers and detail driven environment. Capable of analysing and understanding the bigger picture through site, content and campaign analytics
  • Strong understanding of the full mix of online casino operations including areas such as payments, VIP segment and multi-channel marketing
  • Experience of managing key suppliers, negotiating competitive agreements and overseeing their launch
  • Outstanding communication and presentational skills, capable of influencing and leading multiple internal and external stakeholders and presenting persuasive business cases
  • Imaginative and creative, willing to dare to break the mould
  • Excellent command of Greek and English.

Remuneration:

  • Extremely competitive monthly salary (x14 months)
  • Performance Bonus
  • Stock Options scheme with possible add-ons

Benefits:

  • Private health plan
  • Mobile plan
  • Laptop and Mobile device

Title: IT Support Engineer

Do you want to join the fastest growing channel in P&G? Read below and you will get a glimpse of what you will be exposed to!

You are asked to build a strong external and internal network collaborate with key influencers, pharmacists, doctors, academics as well as our multiple 3rd party agencies. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Title: Online Casino Director
Skills: Business Case Preparation|Campaign Analytics|Campaigns|Creative Marketing|Greek|Marketing Communications|Multi-Channel Marketing|Online Casino|Presentations|Strategic Communications|
Job Description:
About the job

SENIOR IT PROFESSIONAL


ROLE SUMMARY:


The Senior IT Professional holds responsibility for the effectiveness and efficiency of Information Technology &Telecommunications (IT&T) operation of all V+O Greece entities. Ensures data integrity and user support while at the same time plays a key role in the implementation of Organization’s IT strategy.


KEY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Support the Infrastructure Systems operations of the Group, ensuring IT Hardware and Software System Administration as well as Telecommunication operations

· Support and maintain organization's effectiveness and efficiency by defining, delivering, short and long-term plans for implementing information technologies and telecoms

· Install and configure software and hardware and implement upgrades under the guidance of the IT Director

· Set up accounts and workstations based on company's needs

· Monitor performance and maintain systems according to requirements

· Troubleshoot issues and outages

· Adhere to appropriate IT standards in all activities in compliance with IT standards according to V+O Greece policy, ISO 27001, and legislation requirements (GDPR, etc.)

· Ensure effective maintenance of IT hardware and follow up with external providers when needed

· Monitor and maintain inventory reporting systems' updated

· Coordinate & assist in the selection process of offers from external providers under IT Director's guidance and when needed

· Execute company’s IT strategy with the co-ordination of the IT Director

QUALIFICATIONS AND STANDARDS:


Education & Experience

  • University/College degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or other relative discipline
  • 5 years of relevant experience in systems and Network advanced troubleshooting.
  • Excellent knowledge of the Greek and English languages


Professional skills


  • Network & Security Certifications like Cisco CCNP, CCNP Security, Check Point CCSA/CCSE, HPE/Aruba, Fortinet NSE4-7, Juniper, Citrix ADCs/CCA-AppDS/CCP-AppDS, Azure/ AWS, etc. will be highly appreciated
  • Microsoft Business Cloud Services (Azure, SharePoint customization)
  • Routing/ Switching for Data Centers knowledge
  • Infrastructure Security Solutions Experience (Cisco, Fortinet, Checkpoint, Palo Alto)
  • Enterprise Wireless Solutions knowledge

Join us for a challenging career!

We offer an exciting business framework for you to accelerate professionally as well as a competitive remuneration package and benefits both numerical and non-numerical.

If you want to become a member of our team, please send us your CV at careers@vando.gr

Your application will be handled with the utmost confidentiality!

Title: Sales Representative P&G Health Care
Skills: Business Building|Business English|Coaching|Communication|Entrepreneurship|Interpersonal Skills|Key Accounts|Merchandising|Sales Strategy|Trade Marketing|
Job Description:
About the job

Landis+Gyr is a leading global provider of integrated energy management solutions. We measure and analyze energy utilization to generate empowering analytics for smart grid and infrastructure management, enabling utilities and consumers to reduce energy consumption. Our innovative and proven portfolio of software, services and intelligent sensor technology is a key driver to decarbonize the grid. Having avoided more than 9 million tons of CO2 in FY 2021 and committed to achieve carbon neutrality by 2030, Landis+Gyr manages energy better – since 1896.

With sales of USD 1.5 billion in FY 2021, Landis+Gyr employs around 6,500 talented people across five continents.

Key Areas of Responsibility
  • Plans, directs, and coordinates manufacturing processes in industrial plant. Develops, evaluates, and improves manufacturing methods, utilizing knowledge of product design, materials and parts, fabrication processes, tooling and production equipment capabilities, assembly methods, and quality control standards.
  • Analyzes and plans work force utilization, space requirements, and workflow, and designs layout of equipment and workspace for maximum efficiency.
  • Confers with planning and design staff concerning product design and tooling to ensure efficient production methods.
  • Confers with vendors to determine product specifications and arrange for purchase of equipment, materials, or parts, and evaluates products according to specifications and quality standards.
  • Estimates production times, staffing requirements, and related costs to provide information for management decisions.
  • Confers with management, engineering, and other staff regarding manufacturing capabilities, production schedules, and other considerations to facilitate production processes.
  • Applies statistical methods to estimate future manufacturing requirements and potential.

Required Skills
  • Educational background in Electrical/Electronic or Mechanical Engineering
  • At least 3-year proven experience in Manufacturing industry
  • World class manufacturing/lean manufacturing knowledge
  • Project management
  • Measurement Time Analysis/Ergonomics
  • Problem solving
  • Value stream analysis
  • Team working
  • Excellent communication in English (verbal and writing)

Optional Skills
  • Basic communication in German (verbal and writing)
  • Familiarity with process automation technologies like pneumatics, servo drives, motor control and sensors

Meet the team - see what your future colleagues think of Landis+Gyr as an employer.

Follow us on LinkedIn Landis+Gyr in the Nordics and Facebook .

About the job

Paralos Energy, a well-established energy projects construction company is seeking to recruit a Site Civil Engineer with or without a previous experience in construction management energy projects. The Site Engineer will be joining our projects team to plan and oversee a wide variety of energy projects from beginning to end including but not limited to: High Voltage Substations, Wind Farms and HV/MV Transmission lines, in Greece as well as abroad.


Responsibilities:

  • You are responsible on site for all construction related operations
  • You ensure that all equipment and supplies arrive according to time schedule on site
  • You coordinate subcontractor works and ensure the Paralos Energy standards are met
  • You report to the project team regularly
  • You ensure deadlines are met and take immediate actions, if necessary, to stay on track according to the time schedules
