Title: Information Technology Business Analyst
Skills: Analytical Skills|Business Analysis|Communication|Computer Science|Interpersonal Skills|Presentation Skills|Project Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Intelligencia.ai is a technology company at the heart of Healthcare and AI. Our mission is to bring novel therapies to patients faster and more efficiently by applying Data Science to Drug Development. We are pioneering the use of AI for assessing and addressing fundamental risks to maximize the odds of multiple life changing therapeutics.


Our people are the core of our success. We are a fast growing company that operates in a diverse, cross-functional and flexible environment. Our team consists of intellectually curious minds with a can-do attitude that love what they do and enjoy being part of a highly collaborative team. Together, we are solving complex problems and making a positive impact on people’s lives by building cutting-edge technologies.


We are looking for a Senior Scientific Associate with experience and a passion in Immunology. The role includes the ability to identify, extract, curate, and interpret scientific data, as well as being a thought partner in the design of novel solutions at the intersection of Immunology and big data/Machine Learning.


Join us if you are excited to


  • Extracting and interpreting outcomes data (e.g., efficacy and safety) from scientific papers that articulate the results of clinical trials in Immunology
  • Expertly curating regulatory (FDA), scientific (e.g., gene-disease association), epidemiological (e.g., incidence/prevalence), and other data
  • Collaborating with other team members, including Customer Success, Product teams as well as external stakeholders including customers


What you'll bring to the team


  • Extensive experience with inflammation pathways
  • Minimum MS degree
  • PhD (completed or close to) in the field of Immunology (desired but not required)
  • PostDoc experience, and experience in clinical trials is a plus (but not required)
  • Excellent communication and project management skills
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Self-starter; can be depended on to complete a task under minimal supervision
  • Strong analytical skills and problem-solving mindset


What's in it for you


  • A competitive salary
  • Private Health Insurance
  • Ability to participate in Intelligencia’s equity compensation plan/ future success of the company
  • Career Development Stipend
  • A great opportunity to grow and work with some of the most exceptional minds in the industry
  • Being part of an environment that offers challenging goals, autonomy, and mentoring, which creates unparalleled opportunities both for you and the team
  • You will be part of a mission to bring novel therapies to patients faster and more efficiently by applying Data Science to drug development


As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Intelligencia is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

  • Collects, prepares and co-ordinates any information or data required from departments as necessary, regarding the project description, risk analysis & risk assessment

He or she accordingly handles the correspondence with the insurance broker relating to the terms and conditions of the insurance program & evaluates insurance documentation received
  • Maintains an updated record of all policies and enters all data into the respective tools and manages premium payment mechanism (this includes data entry in the system and follow up with the relevant parties)
  • Acts as the central point of reference between our Company and the insurance broker, at all stages of construction claims

Academic Qualifications & Professional Experience


  • University Degree in Liberal Arts, Business Administration or Economics
  • About 5-10 years of relevant professional experience in the insurance industry
  • Underwriting or insurance broking experience in Construction/Erection All Risks Property & Casualty Insurance shall be considered an additional asset


On a personal side, the right candidate for this position has a…


  • High level of computer skills (MS excel, word, power point)
  • High level of verbal and written communications skills in English and Greek insurance terminology
  • Excellent organization and coordination abilities
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize daily workload
  • Teamwork spirit and communication skills
  • A proactive approach to problem-solving

Title: Senior Scientific Associate, Immunology
Skills: Analytical Chemistry|Analytical Skills|Attention to Detail|Cell Culture|Communication|English|Inflammation|Problem Solving|Real-Time Polymerase Chain Reaction (qPCR)|Scientific Papers|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


We are looking for a Project Manager for EU R&D Projects in Athens


The ideal candidate will manage and implement R&D projects (EU R&D and Innovation projects (H2020 & Horizon Europe (HE)). The candidate is expected to have a strong background in EU R&D proposals’ and projects’ management, IT/software development, and technical writing.


Your main duties will include:


  • Management and implementation of R&D projects (EU R&D and Innovation projects (H2020 & HE)).
  • Assisting in the definition of project specifications, involving all relevant stakeholders/teams and ensuring technical feasibility and resource availability.
  • Ensuring the on-time and on-budget delivery of projects.
  • Tracking progress through a solid project plan.
  • Implementing quality control processes.
  • Creating and maintaining comprehensive project documentation.
  • Managing stakeholders’ relationships and expectations.
  • Elaboration of deliverables for the technical, scientific and innovation related activities of an R&D project (state-of-art, requirements, conceptual architecture, specifications, implementation plans, innovation, exploitation, dissemination and communication planning, market analysis, business planning, etc.).
  • Organizing the project’s EU reporting tasks (activities, management, financial/costs).
  • Active engagement in business development activities, such as conception and writing of new research proposals; Finding new ideas, calls, partners; Delivery of high-quality presentations at events; Networking; Establishing and maintaining relationships with third parties.
  • Participation in scientific and/or business publications.
  • Following the evolution of new technologies and identification of new concepts.
  • Reporting and escalating to management as needed.


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, a leading IT company, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts in Greece. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe.


Qualifications


If you have


  • PhD / MSc in IT, Computer Science or related fields
  • Proven experience in project management activities within software development field preferably with EU funded programs
  • Experience in areas such as software development and integration, development life-cycle methodologies, software architectures, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Data Analytics, IoT, Transportation / Mobility, Security, Manufacturing, etc.
  • Extensive experience with MS Project and other MS Office tools
  • Customer, Quality and Results-orientation
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English, ability to negotiate, and to cooperate with international partners and clients
  • Competency in technical writing
  • Strong problem solving, organizational and presentation skills
  • Agility and team spirit
  • Available for frequent travels & short-term missions
  • Excellent command of the English language (written & oral)


…then this position is suitable for you!


Additional Information


This position comes with


  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business), and fast career growth
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Executive Secretary
Skills: Attention to Detail|Business|Communication|Confidentiality|Easily Adaptable|English|Executive Administrative Assistance|Language Skills|Operations Support|Organization Skills|
Job Description:
About the job

Site Name: Athens


Posted Date: Mar 21 2023


Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Advil, Voltaren, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.


Job Title


Brand Manager (maternity cover)


Right now, we’re in start-up mode. Giving those who join us the amazing opportunity to shape our company and the working experience we are building.


We are now looking for a great talent to join our Marketing department in Greece. You will be a part of a team reporting directly to Greece & Israel Marketing Head.


In this role you will act as a leader for several Respiratory brands to deliver winning marketing strategy provided by Area Marketing Team and the respective project execution & activation plans ensuring the sales value, MS growth & profit growth. The role involves proven project management skills, initiative to drive business objectives, ability to work closely with internal & external stakeholders.


The role of the individual is to activate & execute the consumer & expert strategy for the portfolio of Respiratory brands created by Area Team across the cluster. Ensuring the growth of brands & categories through effective resource allocation and the management of a A&P budget. A key part of the role will be close cooperation with Head of Marketing, Area Team, Digital Marketing Manager, Expert Marketing Manager and Expert Field Manager in order to ensure appropriate execution of strategy & created plans.


In this role you will be responsible for executing effective marketing plan to hit sales and profit targets across the cluster. The Brand Manager will be responsible for ensuring that we grow share in market through strong activation of marketing plans.


Your role will include…
  • Champion your portfolio of Respiratory brands/categories to drive cross-functional engagement internally and customer enthusiasm externally in order to deliver
  • Be responsible and accountable for executing the strategies and plans for a portfolio of brands/categories in the LOC in order to deliver brand growth
  • Effectively manage the brand A&P budget to deliver demonstrable return on investment across channels
  • Active participation in CCC with focus on Consumption / performance updates / business reviews
    • Forecast reviews: prep & participation
    • A&P reviews
    • Price reviews
  • Provide translation to the regional/global promotion materials within group of brands and lead local CCAT approval process
  • Care for local customer by providing insights & needs to Head of Marketing and Area Team
  • Own and execute annual marketing promo and media calendar
  • Share assets with customer marketing for tailoring
  • Preparing Inputs to MAPs. Lead MAP-2 & MAP-3 plans deployment
  • Conducting business reviews with Area Team
  • Provide B.C. assumptions, LOC approval on DRM
  • Activation of media: plans review & updates monthly, interface with media agency, websites update
  • Share all local assets for expert activation with expert field manager


Why you?


Qualifications & Skills:


  • Education: University degree in economics or business administration, sciences or engineering
  • Language: Greek and English (fluent)
  • Proven experience in Marketing/Brand Management in FMCG area
  • Cross functional experiences partnering with Sales and Commercial Excellence functions to customize winning tactics to win in market
  • Very good communication skills (both direct face-to-face and cooperating at distance)
  • Goal orientation and problem solving and decision-making skills
  • Analytical and project management skills – ability to manage multiple projects at the same time
  • Builds partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
  • Role modeling Haleon Values & Expectations
  • Role modeling Haleon CH Attributes
  • Pro-active and doer attitude


Why Join Us?


The future of everyday health is changing. And we’re the people changing it. In front of us is an incredible opportunity to go beyond what any of us have done before. And make everyday health more achievable, more inclusive and more sustainable. For more and more people. So join us, as we build one of the world’s leading consumer healthcare companies. Join us to innovate our category-leading brands. To better understand people’s everyday health needs. To tackle the biggest barriers that stand in their way. To change individual and societal behavior.  Join us to work with colleagues who share your restless energy. To explore your interests. To stretch yourself to do the best work of your career. And join us, as together we build a working experience that encourages us all to lead happier, healthier, more productive lives.  The way we see it, every day is an opportunity for better. And we’re going all in to realize it.


Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/


At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone. We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.


As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information, which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.


Haleon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.


Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, Haleon may be required to capture and report expenses Haleon incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure Haleon’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements.

Title: R&D Project Manager
Skills: Communications Planning|Implementation Plans|New Concepts|Presentations|Problem Solving|Project Documentation|Project Plans|Research Proposals|Research and Development (R&D)|Technical Writing|
Job Description:
About the job

Do you want to be part of the next big thing in FinTech?


Our client, a German based international player, is an independent payment service provider that offers a wide range of payment processing services, international merchant accounts and IPSP accounts. The company provides online and mobile payment solutions through its own international banking network, and its own connected alternative payment solutions. A new development team is currently being established in Thessaloniki. It has both the mindset & originality of an exciting start up, with lean/agile practices, a flat hierarchy, but with the stability & security of being a world-famous organization as well.


For the new office in Thessaloniki (Greece) we are currently looking for a:


Senior Frontend Engineer (m/w/d)

For full-time and permanent employment. Onsite, hybrid or fully remote.


JOB DESCRIPTION


You enjoy laying the foundations for how engineering is practiced within the company. You collaborate with crossfunctional und international development teams, as well as with UX/UI and graphic designers. You work closely with our back-end developers to deliver consistent and reliable web and app experience. Your primary goal is to improve usability for our customers, to optimize the web design for mobile and other platforms for maximum speed.


Your responsibilities:


  • Implement the frontend of the application and ensure that the software appearance matches the design.
  • Connect the frontend functions to the backend API.
  • Handle function-testing and maintain an excellent code quality.
  • Maintain comprehensive documentation (user guide, release log, etc.).
  • Implement solutions that are user responsive and efficient.
  • Follow agile principles.


Your profile:


  • Bachelor's degree (higher education in the field of Information technology desirable).
  • Previous experience as a frontend developer or similar role.
  • 3+ years’ experience with Angular technologies.
  • Familiar with HTML/CSS/JavaScript and experience in responsive design.
  • Experience with Ionic or Flutter.
  • Good understanding of the GIT version control system is essential.
  • Advanced knowledge of implementing a resilient web architecture.
  • Good understanding of the entire web development process.
  • Experience with testing and debugging.
  • Good knowledge of English.
  • Have an eye for layout aesthetics and details.
  • Willingness to learn new skills quickly.
  • Initiative team player with ability to work independently.


What’s in it for you?


  • Competitive remuneration above market average.
  • Private health insurance & flexible work arrangements.
  • International projects using state of the art technologies.
  • Flat hierarchy & open-door culture.
  • Tech conferences, meetups and team events.
  • Top location & high-tech equipment


Interested? Then apply for the position using the applicant button. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us on +49 221 66 999-700. We are looking forward to meet you!


Your contact: Despoina Chourmouziadou, Recruiter

Title: Associate of Treasury
Skills: Bank Reconciliation|Cash Flow|Credit Cards|SAP ERP|Treasury|Treasury Management|Treasury Services|
Job Description:
About the job

With you, Chubb is better!

Are you someone who pays close attention to detail? Do you notice even the smallest of things around you? Do you want to work with groundbreaking engineering mentors? If you are an experienced, passionate QA Engineer who wants to use state-of-art technologies and make an impact in our Centre of Excellence for QA Testing, then keep reading and check out this outstanding opportunity in our new Technology Hub in Greece – CBSG (Chubb Business Services Greece) as a Senior QA Engineer at Thessaloniki.

https://news.chubb.com/2022-12-08-Chubb-to-Launch-New-Technology-Hub-in-Thessaloniki,-Greece

If you are a tech freak and raring to develop your career join our growing, pioneer, diverse team within one of the largest companies in the world, we would love to hear from you!

The Opportunity

Your Responsibilities for this role may include, but are not limited to:
  • Be an outstanding teammate, meet our progressive engineering champions and assist the development of workflows
  • Ensure high quality and compliance to requirements throughout the software delivery cycle
  • Design, develop, and implement both manual and automated tests depending on the project
  • Provide test reports on a regular agreed basis which detail testing progress, issues and risks
  • Solve quality issues and modifying test procedures.
  • Review and recommend improvements to existing system designs and engineering processes.
  • Hands-on development of detailed test artifacts such as test plans, traceability matrix, test cases with expected results located within Jira
  • Maintain existing automation framework and build automation scripts across selected projects using tools like Selenium etc.
  • Communicate testing results and advance roadblocks to the appropriate individuals on the project team.
  • Run powerful technologies to improve our testing strategies
  • Collaborate with others from our diverse worldwide tech team and act as a "point of contact" to junior engineers
  • Apply a global and diverse perspective to problem solving

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • At least 4 years of relevant experience as a QA Engineer
  • Relevant experience in automated testing for UI, API, Performance, Security, Mobile
  • Excellent knowledge of project and software development lifecycles, with the understanding of project lifecycle methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall and CI/CD
  • Solid understanding and previous experience in programming languages like Java, Javascript, C# or Python
  • Solid understanding and previous experience to testing strategies and tools like Selenium, TestCafe, Cypress, SoapUI, Postman, JMeter etc.
  • Strong communications skills with the ability to cooperate with both executives and technical staff in Greek and English
  • Keen eye for detail and a commitment to excellence
  • Be willing to help and coach your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from our outstanding mentors
  • Ability to multitask working on multiple projects, across different applications
  • Be a guru analyst and a detail ninja
  • ISTQB or relevant certification will be considered a plus

Our team makes the difference, every time. For this reason, we offer in return!

We offer hybrid working model, explicit, structured career development, a competitive salary package, annual bonus, private medical cover, monthly allowance for lunch, continuous learning experiences, work in a fun, lively environment with mentoring from our groundbreaking senior mentors.

Integrity. Client Focus. Respect. Excellence. Teamwork

Our core values instruct how we live and work. We’re an ethical and honest company that’s wholly committed to its clients. A business that’s engaged in mutual trust and respect for its employees and partners. A place where colleagues perform at the highest levels. And a working environment that’s collaborative and encouraging.

Diversity & Inclusion. At Chubb, we consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness and respect, regardless of their age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or family circumstances. We earnestly strive to achieve an environment where all colleagues feel comfortable to perform to their full potential and are recognized for their contributions.

Many voices, One Chubb!

2300009P

Title: Brand Manager (maternity cover)
Skills: A&P|Brand Management|Business Reviews|Digital Marketing|Doer|Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG)|Greek|Market Planning|Resource Allocation|Return on Investment|
Job Description:
About the job

634291BR


Introduction


At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.


Your Role and Responsibilities


  • Leading the end-to-end sale of products, you'll help your teams engage 'support', 'specialty', and 'technical' experts to progress large, complex, and highly competitive sales situations – from opportunity identification (OI) to deal closure.
  • Formulating and promoting cross-brand solutions within sales territories, you'll cultivate a 'one-team' culture and lead negotiations that establish beneficial pricing and secure wins.
  • We're passionate about success. If this role is right for you, then your achievements will mean that your career is flourishing, your team is excelling, your Partners are growing, and our clients are thriving. To help ensure this win-win outcome, a 'day-in-the life' of this opportunity may include, but not be limited to:
  • Coaching sales teams to achieve account objectives.
  • Applying contemporary technology and IBM offering knowledge, and market trends to anticipate client needs and proactively propose solutions – with and through others.
  • Promoting the maximum usage of the full extent of our Technology Sales resources.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise


  • Significant level of experience with a track-record of winning through collaboration, resilience, empathy, and innovation. A natural at inspiring and motivating others to succeed in highly complex, enterprise-scale technology sales environments.
  • Solid credibility and confidence across cloud, data & AI, automation, security, and storage technologies, with deep and broad expertise in at least one speciality.
  • Palpable people, communication, and collaboration skills, with a record of c-suite networking and influencing throughout the successful closure, and post-closure expansion of complex technology sales cycles.
  • Experience of using agile techniques in addition to contemporary technology sales methodologies (e.g., consultative /Challenger selling) to successfully deliver in a way that's both nimble and fast and leads customers to our products vs. leading with them.


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


  • Experience of working with any of IBM's products and services will be highly appreciated.


About Business Unit


IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.


Your Life @ IBM


In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.


Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.


Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.


Are you ready to be an IBMer?


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Senior Frontend Engineer (Angular)
Skills: Angular|Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)|Flutter|Front-End Development|Git|HTML|Ionic Framework|JavaScript|Postman API|Web Design|
Job Description:
About the job

Gamma Technologies, LLC (GT) is looking for a Web Full-Stack Senior Software Engineer to join our growing development team in Athens, Greece, to design and implement new components as well as ongoing feature enhancements.


Position Summary:


Our new Web Full-Stack Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for the development and maintenance of our current web products (GT-Play, GT-PowerForge) and helping us move our other products to the web. In addition, this developer will interface with custom solutions for distributed computing and various back-end APIs. Our current web tech stack is Java/Spring for the backend and TypeScript/Angular for the frontend.


We are not just looking for programmers. We are looking for software engineers who are comfortable designing their own components. We do not tell our developers how to design. Instead, they have the freedom to create within scope. Want to forge your own destiny while working on fulfilling projects? Maybe you would feel at home working with us.


Job Responsibilities:


  • Under minimal technical guidance, collaborate with application support engineers on software requirements and application design, and with cross-functional teams to develop and maintain our web-based applications.
  • Develop scalable and maintainable software solutions for our platform.
  • Write efficient and high-quality code that adheres to coding standards and best practices.
  • Share your knowledge through mentoring, reviewing code, and taking part in design discussions.
  • Follow the company’s software development processes.
  • Study and propose modern solutions to remain up to date with technical best practices.


Required Qualifications:


Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the knowledge and abilities would be:

  • Ptychio/Diploma/M.S. degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Minimum 3 years of professional full-stack application development experience utilizing. Java/Spring and JavaScript/Typescript.
  • Strong experience with both client-side and server-side development.
  • Experience with RESTful API design and development.
  • Familiarity with agile development methodologies and version control tools.
  • Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.
  • Fluent in both spoken and written English.

Desirable Qualifications:

  • Solid understanding of TypeScript and experience with Angular.
  • Strong experience with server-side development using Spring Boot.
  • Familiar with cloud-centric environments, like AWS or Azure.
  • Familiar with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Knowledge of Java build/deployment systems: Gradle, Maven, or Jenkins.
  • Experience with database technologies such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB.
  • Comfortable with a Java IDE (we provide IntelliJ Ultimate Edition).


We Offer

  • A dynamic and highly talented team of experts.
  • The opportunity to bring in your own ideas, implement them and make them accessible to a large customer base.
  • The opportunity to build a professional network in various branches of the industry.
  • An attractive salary and additional company benefits.


Other Requirements and Notes:

  • Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere is at the heart of our company. We promote diversity of thought, culture, and background, which connects the entire Gamma Technologies community. As such, Gamma Technologies is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance.


About Gamma Technologies, LLC

  • GT, a leading multi-physics CAE simulation software provider, develops a suite of integrated solutions that guides and accelerates the engineering transformation of today’s products in the transportation, power generation, and industrial equipment industries.
  • At GT, we are committed to using technology to make a global impact by helping the industry deliver products for a cleaner, sustainable environment! We pride ourselves on our company culture which encourages collaboration between all levels at the company, from entry-level to upper management. Within a team, daily interactions and outside social events allow us to form bonds that result in higher productivity and job satisfaction.

Title: Senior QA Engineer @ Thessaloniki
Skills: C#|Communication|JavaScript|Quality Assurance|Software Deployment|Software Development|Test Automation|Test Cases|Test Planning|Test Procedures|
Job Description:
About the job

Celestino, counting decades of successful presence in the fashion industry, offers high quality clothes, accessories, and home items at unbeatable prices. Focusing, mainly on the customer, the company has managed to earn both the love and the loyalty of the Greek market increasing the number of new customers and maintaining the loyal ones. The company’s determination to focus on innovation and ability to constantly develop to adapt to the industry’s shifts, brought the brand to the top of the Greek market, making Celestino (in 2021) #1 Greek fashion e-shop.

With over 40 stores in Greece, a mission that focuses on customers’ satisfaction and an impressive web presence, and values that concentrate on the highest professional standards and a healthy working environment, Celestino manages to perfectly combine the modern and approachable image of high street fashion brands with the quality of luxury ones.

About The Role

We are looking for a talented Social Media & Content Specialist to support the development and execution of our marketing strategy focusing on engagement, inspiration and conversion. If you are passionate with Social Media management, influencers strategy, creative copywriting and of course fashion, then you might already be one of us!

A day in the life of our Social Media & Content Specialist
  • You will be a part of our Marketing Team and will creatively contribute to our social media content and copyrighting strategy, planning (calendar/scheduling), implementation and reporting as well as in our content for press releases and other marketing activations
  • You will work closely with the creative, marketing and commercial team to generate content for all social channels as well as with out internal studio team (everyday new arrivals, every day new shootings! Plenty of content created for you to pick!)
  • Search of the global and local market trends in order to respond to consumers' demands and increase engagement on social media and stay up-to-date with changes in all social platforms ensuring maximum effectiveness
  • Manage end-to-end brand's influencers marketing campaigns

Requirements

What you will need
  • Degree in Digital and Social Media Marketing, Communications, Advertising, Public Relations or Business Management
  • 3+ years of working experience in similar role (if you've already been in Fashion, even better!)
  • Expertise in multiple social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Tik Tok, Twitter, Pinterest, YouTube, LinkedIn, Tumblr)
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills both in Greek and in English (we welcome fashion editors/content writers as well!)

Benefits

What we offer
  • Excellent working conditions in a modern and pleasant environment
  • Career development opportunities in a constantly growing company
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Private Health Insurance program
  • Staff discount on Celestino products

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Skills: English|Gradle|Java|JavaScript|Jenkins|MongoDB|PostgreSQL|SQL|Spring Boot|Version Control|
Job Description:
About the job

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture, and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


The opportunity


At EY, we are building a better working world by realizing business transformation through the power of people, technology, and innovation. To achieve this, we’ll need help from highly motivated people keen to join our Transformation Realized™ Consulting practice. Our team is part of EY’s Central, Eastern and Southeastern Europe & Central Asia (CESA) region, delivering market leading services across industries in Greece and abroad.


The transformation imperative is urgent, challenging and opportunity-rich, interested to join us?


Your Key Responsibilities


  • Guide and coach EY and client teams in using Agile frameworks, methodologies, tools and Scrum practices, providing hands-on coaching as required at any organizational level
  • Act as the Scrum Master or Agile Coach for EY or client agile teams in a single implementation project or large digital transformation and operational excellence programs
  • Coach other Scrum Masters and deliver client or in-house trainings
  • Design client Agile implementation blueprints, conduct Agile Maturity assessment and develop Agile Transformation roadmaps for clients based on Agile scaling frameworks (e.g. SAFe, Scrum of Scrums, Spotify, Nexus)
  • Enable a high performing, self-organizing, dynamic team, minimizing impediments to work product implementation progress
  • Support the facilitation of learning and continuous improvement in effectively operating Scrum and in implementing and improving relevant practices
  • Ensure scrum teams are using standard agile delivery tools and templates for all processes including documenting and tracking features, user stories, acceptance criteria, etc.
  • Ensure scrum teams achieve their objectives keeping the teams focused on their product and Sprint goals and end-user satisfaction
  • Support the scrum team in capacity planning, scrum board usage, sprint backlog determination, velocity monitoring and burn down/up charts
  • Support Product Owner in backlog management and refinement
  • Facilitate program increment, daily scrum, sprint planning, sprint review/demo and retrospective meetings
  • Identify delivery impediments and risks, and recommend appropriate solutions or perform escalation to the appropriate levels and stakeholders as needed
  • Responsible for coordination among teams (e.g. DevOps, Architects and other Scrum Masters) and assist with internal and external communication, improving transparency and collaboration
  • Enable reporting on the status of delivery using agreed agile metrics, e.g. velocity, burndown charts, predictability, efficiency indicator, innovation rate, etc.


To qualify for the role, you must have / be able to demonstrate a combination of the following competencies and experience:


  • Strong academic background
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for technical writing and client presentations (Greek and English)
  • Excellent problem solver in a collaborative way
  • Ability to work in multicultural projects and environments
  • Proven experience in one or more of the following competencies
  • 2+ years’ experience working as a Scrum Master
  • Experience as an Agile coach, preferably to both Technology & Business audiences
  • Experience in designing Agile models, blueprints, and Agile Transformation roadmaps
  • Consolidated knowledge and application of agile methodologies (e.g. based on Scum, Kanban) as well as any Agile scaling frameworks (e.g., SAFe, Spotify, LeSS, Scrum of Scums)
  • Experience as an Agile Coach, Scrum Master or RTE in an scaled Agile environment
  • Knowledge and experience with agile delivery management tools (e.g., Azure DevOps, JIRA, Confluence)
  • Knowledge and experience in identifying and applying Objectives & Key Results (OKR) framework


Ideally, you’ll also have


  • Scrum Master or any other relevant scaled Agile industry acknowledged certifications
  • Appetite to take ownership of several complex initiatives with excellent time management skills
  • Good appreciation and understanding of impact of current market trends (e.g. Cloud, Data Analytics, AI, Intelligent Automation)
  • A willingness to travel to meet client needs (when it is safe)


What We Look For


What’s most important is that you’re dedicated to working with your colleagues as part of a high-performing team. You’ll need to demonstrate enthusiasm, high motivation and passion to develop fast in a multinational working environment. You’ll need to thrive in picking up new skills and talents as you go, so natural curiosity, a lot of questions and the confidence to speak up when you see something that could be improved are essential. If you’ve got the right combination of technical knowledge and communication skills, this role is for you.


What We Offer


EY offers an attractive remuneration package for rewarding both personal and team performance. We are committed to be an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. In addition, but not limited to our benefits include:
  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Plus, we offer:
    • Master Programs in collaboration with educational institutions
    • EY Badges – certifications digital and future-focused skills.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Plus, we offer:
    • Flexible working arrangements
    • EY Flex Day seasonal program
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Plus, we offer:
    • Mobility programs (if interested to work abroad)
    • EY Employee Assistance Program (EAP) (counselling, legal and financial consultation services).
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.


EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Full Stack Developer (Junior)
Skills: .NET Framework|API Development|C#|Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)|English|Full-Stack Development|HTML|JavaScript|User Interface Design|Web Applications|
Job Description:
About the job

KLDiscovery, one of the largest US eDiscovery providers, is currently seeking a Software Engineer for an exciting new opportunity.


The position will assist in review and analysis of applications, product development, and enhancements including documentation, code development, and unit testing of releases while adhering to KLDiscovery development processes and workflows with supervision and direction from lead developers and superiors.


Remote, work from home opportunity (anywhere in Greece).


Key Responsibilities

  • Create, Validate and Review program code per specifications.
  • Develop automated unit and API tests.
  • Support bug fixes and implement enhancements to applications in Production.
  • Create, design and review SW documentation.
  • Utilize, communicate, and enforce coding standards.
  • Provide Technical Support to applications in Production within defined SLA.
  • Adhere to development processes and workflows.
  • Assist and mentor team demonstrating technical excellence.
  • Detects problems and areas that need improvement early and raises issues.


Qualifications

  • 6 + years of experience in NET/C# and/or Java/J2EE
  • 4+ years in Frontend technologies HTML/CSS, Angular/TypeScript
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Focus on continuous improvement.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Being a team player
  • Good knowledge of English


Additional Qualifications

  • SQL databases, preferably PostgreSQL
  • NoSQL Databases, preferably SOLR
  • ASP. Net Core
  • Docker
  • Azure Service Fabric
  • PowerShell
  • Linux, Bash


What We Offer

· A Friendly and welcoming team-oriented environment

· The opportunity to work 100% remotely

· Opportunities for career advancement and growth

· Very competitive remuneration

· Fantastic benefits which include life insurance, disability insurance and health insurance for both you and your eligible dependents.



Our Cultural Values

Entrepreneurs at heart, we are a customer first team sharing one goal and one vision. We seek team members who are:

  • Humble - No one is above another; we all work together to meet our clients’ needs and we acknowledge our own weaknesses
  • Hungry - We all are driven internally to be successful and to continually expand our contribution and impact
  • Smart - We use emotional intelligence when working with one another and with clients

Our culture shapes our actions, our products, and the relationships we forge with our customers. It helps us stand out in an ever-increasing crowd of providers.


Who We Are

KLDiscovery provides technology-enabled services and software to help law firms, corporations, government agencies and consumers solve complex data challenges. The company, with offices in 32 locations across 18 countries, is a global leader in delivering best-in-class eDiscovery, information governance and data recovery solutions to support the litigation, regulatory compliance, internal investigation and data recovery and management needs of our clients.


Serving clients for over 30 years, KLDiscovery offers data collection and forensic investigation, early case assessment, electronic discovery and data processing, application software and data hosting for web-based document reviews, and managed document review services. In addition, through its global Ontrack Data Recovery business, KLDiscovery delivers world-class data recovery, email extraction and restoration, data destruction and tape management.

KLDiscovery has been recognized as one of the fastest growing companies in North America by both Inc. Magazine (Inc. 5000) and Deloitte (Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500) and CEO Chris Weiler was recognized as a 2014 Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year™. Additionally, KLDiscovery is an Orange-level Relativity Best in Service Partner, a Relativity Premium Hosting Partner and maintains ISO/IEC 27001 Certified data centers.

KLDiscovery is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About the job

Are you interested in working with a leading education technology player, the global leader in the assessment and certification of professional skills industry with presence in more than 200 countries worldwide? If so, this is the chance to apply now! 📥


PeopleCert is currently looking for a Back Office Assistant who will be part of the Marking Team overseeing the automated marking process and the clerical marking for all company’s products.


As a Back Office Assistant your tasks may include the following:

  • Review exams automated marking
  • Implement clerical marking
  • Resolve clerical marking issues so that the marking process can be completed
  • Liase with the Exam Markers and Chief Examiners so as to troubleshoot any operational issues may occur
  • Work effectively in a team environment and liaise with other teams, in order to get the job done and reach the best possible results
  • Carry out any reasonably allocated duties and tasks, relevant to the role and the scope of activities by applying a flexible & adaptable customer centric approach to serve PeopleCert’s multinational presence and global operations across multiple time zones
  • Adhere to and implements the procedures, policies and work instructions as per the PeopleCert’s Integrated Management System
  • Ensure their work and presence is aligned with company’s values “Quality - Passion - Integrity - Innovation” at all times.


What we look for:

  • Bachelor’s degree in any discipline
  • Minimum 1 year working experience in administration and/or operations role
  • Prior working experience in the certification of persons and/or training and exam fields is desirable
  • Excellent knowledge of English (C2 level certification desired, LanguageCert C2 LTE or C2 IESOL certificate would be a plus). Extra languages will be considered a plus
  • Advanced computer literacy is required. ECDL Advance level certification is desirable
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Well organized, self-driven, flexible and able to work in a high-volume, fast-paced, and deadline-driven environment


What we offer:

  • Work in an international, dynamic and fun atmosphere 💯
  • Two free vouchers for all certifications from PeopleCert's Portfolio per year for all employees 🎓
  • Complimentary coffee and tea in all our premises ☕
  • Huge learning experience in using best practices and global environment 📈
  • Constant personal and professional development 🥇
  • 100% Virtual Hiring Process💻


If you want to become a member of our international, dynamic and agile team that creates world leading software products, then we should certainly like to hear from you!


About PeopleCert

PeopleCert is a global leader in assessment and certification of professional skills, partnering with multi-national organizations and government bodies for the development & delivery of standardized exams. Delivering exams across 200 countries and in 25 languages over its state-of-the-art assessment technology, PeopleCert enables professionals to boost their careers and realize their life ambitions.

Quality, Innovation, Passion, Integrity are the core values which guide everything we do.

Our offices in UK, Greece, and Cyprus boast a culture of diversity, where everyone is different, yet everyone fits in. All of us at PeopleCert are committed to the reflection of the diversity and inclusion of our customers and the communities in which we do business.


Working on Home Office (HO) Secure English Language Tests (SELTs)

Any person who is engaged by PeopleCert to work on the SELT service must undergo a Background Check (the results of which must be acceptable to PeopleCert and the HO) prior to commencing their SELT duties. All SELT personnel will be required to complete a declaration (provided by PeopleCert) where the existence of any criminal record and/or bankruptcy must be declared.

If working on the SELT service in the UK, background checks will include:

  • A basic or enhanced Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) check
  • Right to Work in the UK check (including nationality, identity and place of residence)
  • HO security check (Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) or Counter Terrorist Check (CTC)
  • Financial background check
  • Employment reference check
  • If working on the SELT service anywhere in the world (outside of the UK) personnel will undergo background checks that are equivalent to those stated for the UK

In addition, if personnel are required to speak to SELT candidates they must be appropriately skilled in English language and, where SELT services are provided anywhere in the world (outside of the UK), the official language of the relevant country.


All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Full Stack (Remote Opportunity)
Skills: Angular|C (Programming Language)|C#|Computer Science|English|Programming|Programming Languages|Service-Level Agreements (SLA)|Unit Testing|User Documentation|
Job Description:
About the job

Job description:

Role Overview

PCCW Global is looking to expand the Technology Department with a Senior Data Engineer responsible for designing and delivering data pipelines (both streaming and batch) composed of state of the art big data processing systems, while also leading statistical and forecasting analysis efforts or willingness to delve into the ML field within an interdisciplinary Agile team.



Key Responsibilities

  • Design, implement and maintain data processing pipelines using state of the art data processing frameworks or in-house developed components. This includes ingestion, transformation, aggregation and storage of both streaming and batch data.
  • Manage and correlate data from various sources (both SQL and NoSQL).
  • Take ownership of the software development process for both customer-facing and internal BI-extraction tools.
  • Work as a key member of an Agile Team.
  • Spearhead statistical and forecasting analysis.
  • Able to appropriately convey results to both technical and non-technical colleagues.
  • Extract valuable insights and discover interesting patterns in data.
  • Ensure quality and proper curation of the data.



Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or other related technical fields involving quantitative analysis.
  • 1+ years of experience in a Data Engineering position
  • Experienced in at least one of Python, Java/Scala languages and scripting.
  • Experience with distributed data processing systems e.g. Spark, Flink.
  • Solid understanding of SQL (e.g. Postgres, MySQL) and No-SQL (e.g. Elasticsearch, Redis) database systems.
  • Experience creating and using machine learning algorithms and solid background in Statistics.
  • Superb communication and presentation skills, team player.
  • Analytical mind and business acumen.
  • Self-motivated, fast learner and dependable.



Preferred Qualifications

  • 4+ years of proven track record in Data Engineering.
  • Experience with streaming sources e.g. Kafka, Pub/Sub.
  • Familiarity with scheduling/orchestration systems (e.g. Airflow).
  • Experience with Jupyter or BI tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau).
  • Experience with various kinds of NoSQL databases (KV, Document, Columnar).
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms: Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, – certifications considered a plus.
  • Experience with Elasticsearch and its ecosystem.



PCCW Global does not sponsor for immigration and other non-immigrant visas for this role.

PCCW is an equal-opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates. Information provided will be treated in strict confidence and will only be used for recruitment-related purposes. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the employer's personal data policies, a copy of which will be provided immediately upon request.

Job Description:
About the job

As a trusted global transformation partner, Welocalize accelerates the global business journey by enabling brands and companies to reach, engage, and grow international audiences. Welocalize delivers multilingual content transformation services in translation, localization, and adaptation for over 250 languages with a growing network of over 400,000 in-country linguistic resources. Driving innovation in language services, Welocalize delivers high-quality training data transformation solutions for NLP-enabled machine learning by blending technology and human intelligence to collect, annotate, and evaluate all content types. Our team works across locations in North America, Europe, and Asia serving our global clients in the markets that matter to them. www.welocalize.com


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Overview


The Linguist performs quality control tasks and on-demand translation tasks, supports and ensures that the work is performed at a satisfactorily high standard within the specified deadlines and quality level, and follows Language Processes set by the project team, Senior Linguists and the Language Leader.


MAIN DUTIES


  • Performing on-demand translation and localization tasks from English into Portuguese (from Portugal);
  • Performing quality control tasks on assigned projects or accounts;
  • Performing review tasks, once the client's tools and specifics are mastered;
  • Preparing and maintaining language materials (including glossaries, Style Guides, work instructions) up to the quality standards and up to date as required by the account or project;
  • Supporting on project-related queries;
  • Participating in the development of new and improved working processes;
  • Achieving the goals set by the Language Leader and Senior Linguists.


Required Experience And Skills


  • Native level of Portuguese from Portugal;
  • Fluent in English, both written and spoken;
  • At least 1-2 years of experience performing EN>PT translations;
  • Knowledge of localization processes;
  • Advanced user experience of Windows and Office applications;
  • Experience using CAT tools, such as SDL Trados, MemoQ, etc.;
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills;
  • Ability to work with tight deadlines;
  • Excellent problem solving skills;
  • Fast learner, motivated, and able to work with a remote team.


Educational level


  • Bachelor's (BA Hons) or Master's degree in Translation or Applied Languages, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
