Job Description:
About the job

Description


Are you passionate about sharing your knowledge to other team members?

Do you have experience in training customer facing teams?

If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!


Our Training Team is growing & we’re looking for a talented and enthusiastic Trainer to join forces with us and help our customer-facing teams provide an awesome experience!

You will work closely with our customer-facing teams to effectively train them on how to deliver upbeat customer service & support them by creating a positive environment.



Requirements


What you'll do:


● Plan,facilitate and deliver training sessions

● Work with the Training Team Coordinator/Leader to develop on the job soft and hard skills trainings using various methods ( online, virtual, face to face etc ) to meet the developing needs of business

● Maintain training materials, including presentations, structures and assessment

● Support the development of Knowledge Base site, with manuals, instructional materials and other supporting documentation to supplement training as required

● Ensure trainings meet our quality standards and customer expectations

● Conduct trainer observations and monitor trainee performance

● Research & propose new methods for delivering training

● Actively participate in the evaluation of training effectiveness & identify areas for improvement based on the participant’s feedback, make recommendations and implement solutions

● Maintain positive, consistent and effective communication with staff, peers and management

● Actively support and train agents during their shifts, when required

● Contribute to the overall success of our company by ensuring the assigned team meets the department's goals & objectives


What you’ll need:


● BSc degree in education or any similar field

● Previous work experience in a customer care or educational environment of at least 1 year

● Strong understanding of customer expectations with a focus on quality driven support.

● Strong skills in design and delivery computer skills including MS Office, Google Suite, and other tools

● Strong presentation & public speaking skills

● Strong capability to present complicated information to a variety of audiences

● Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and Greek

● Familiarity with Coaching / Training

● Multitasking & task-management skills

● Understanding of both conventional and modern training tools, methods, and techniques

● Knowledge of effective planning & excellent organizational skills


Benefits


What we offer:


  • If you are happy, we are happy! That’s why we offer an attractive remuneration package for what you bring in!
  • We share a passion for food, so you will certainly appreciate the ticket restaurant card 💳 to spend in restaurants and/or food supplies. We are efooders after all!
  • We take care of you with Private Medical & Life Insurance from day #1 to keep you healthy and happy!
  • We want you to grow with us 🚀 ! And to help you keep improving, we provide you access to our online training platform where you can study 📖 topics for your personal and professional growth!
  • Are you a cappuccino lover ☕? Do you desperately want a cookie? Our cafeteria got you covered!
  • If you want to stay in shape 🏋️ , our in-house gym awaits you fully equipped!



Life @efood:


At efood, no day is the same as the day before! efooders know that working and having a good time aren't the opposite and that’s why every day at efood is a new adventure!

We always aim higher and we thrive in finding solutions to push our limits further! We care about our customers, our employees, our society.

We seize every opportunity to celebrate achievements and milestones, but we also celebrate small things (like Fridays!)

Job Description:
About the job

At Alpha Bank, we are shaping the future of banking in Greece.


Through our large-scale Transformation Program, we are changing the way we operate, the way we deliver results and the way we service our Customers.


· We understand our Customers’ needs and design experiences around them.

· We work in partnership and invite diversity of skills and perspectives.

· We are forward-thinking and drive continuous improvement.

· We make things happen; we execute quickly and focus on what is essential.


If you are a change enthusiast who sets ambitious goals and works with a sense of purpose, we want to get to know you!


Join our Structured Finance team and #be_part_of_tomorrow


#AlphaBank #TheAlphaBlueprint #Tomorrow



The Real Estate Finance Officer will be placed in the Structured Finance Division, which is responsible for the development, promotion and coordination of the Bank’s operations in Infrastructure, Energy and Real Estate (Commercial Real Estate, Hospitality) financing as well as of other structured finance transactions.


The ideal candidate should be passionate, analytical, innovative, a team player and eager to expand his/her knowledge of and exposure to the Real Estate sector.


What you will be doing


  • Performing business plan analyses of the underlying project/investment.
  • Building and reviewing advanced financial models.
  • Performing credit analyses, identifying areas of risk and proposing the necessary mitigants.
  • Building strong and long-lasting relationships with key Customers at senior executive level.
  • Understanding current and future customer needs in the context of market dynamics and applying insights to recommend solutions and services.
  • Coordinating the debt arrangement process for either bilateral or syndicated transactions.
  • Leading the due diligence process along with a team of expert advisors.
  • Negotiating the financing terms and coordinating the drafting of the required legal documentation.
  • Monitoring the market developments in the Real Estate sector and liaising with market players.
  • Drafting credit proposals and necessary presentations to be submitted to the Bank’s Credit Committees.
  • Performing active management of the existing loan portfolio, while monitoring its financial performance and compliance with the loan documentation.
  • Interacting with other Units of the Bank to promote the Division’s objectives.
  • Maintaining relationships with other commercial banks and financial institutions.


What you need to have:


  • A Bachelor’s degree in Finance or in a quantitative field of study.
  • An MBA, a postgraduate degree in Finance or in any other related discipline is a must.
  • At least five (5) yeras of professional experience in project finance, structured lending, investment banking or financial advisory services.
  • Analytical skills to assess market dynamics and technical capacity to build/review complex financial models.
  • Very good understanding of Corporate Finance principles.
  • Established knowledge of the Real Estate sector will be considered a plus.
  • Well-rounded personality with excellent collaboration skills.
  • Proficient use of the MS Office suite.
  • Excellent command of the English language.


What we offer


It’s all about our people. At Alpha Bank, you will enjoy:


  • A friendly and collaborative working environment that supports taking initiative and action.
  • A culture that centers around learning and continuous development and encourages everyone to bring their best self to work.
  • The opportunity to challenge your thinking through your participation in complex tasks and transformation projects.
  • Being part of a large organization with a leading role in the Greek economy and a strong presence in the community.
  • A competitive salary and benefits.



Alpha Bank offers a remote interview process and a work-from-home scheme during the implementation of the current social distancing measures.


All applications will be acknowledged and treated in utmost confidence.

Title: Trainer
Skills: Coaching|Communication|Customer Service|English|Google Workspace|Multitasking|Organization Skills|Presentations|Public Speaking|Written Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


A day in the life of a Automation Testing Team Leader


As an Automation Testing Team Leader, you will join our company’s Test Center, or one of our SW Product Development Teams. You will work with a number of experienced Test Automation Engineers and QA analysts, in an agile model, in various challenging projects.


Your everyday life will mainly consist of working in a high-performing Test Automation team developing products such as Icarus (Revenue Collection and Tax compliance) and Eskort (Risk and Compliance Management) and you will have the opportunity to be exposed to a wide variety of technologies and methodologies.


Your main duties will be to :


  • Contribute to the distribution of all Quality Assurance practices, standards, methodologies, and metrics.
  • Translate business requirements and specifications into test solutions that ensure the highest quality of the deliverables.
  • Analyze, design, plan and execute strategies for all unit, process, function, integration, and acceptance testing for covering all software lifecycle phases.
  • Design automation test plans, scenarios, scripts, and/or procedures
  • Perform automation test execution; mentor, direct and monitor other testers in automation principles
  • Partner with project management to identify areas for improved testing efficiencies, test automation and implementation of automated testing methodologies.
  • Coordinate the document test procedures to ensure repeatability and compliance with standards
  • Collect and report test results through various metrics reporting tools and communicating to key stakeholders on a regular basis.


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, the leading IT company in Greece, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe. 


Qualifications


If you have :
  • University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related discipline
  • At least 7 years of proven experience in designing, planning and execution of software testing strategies for QA
  • Sound knowledge of software development lifecycle for enterprise scale projects with Agile methodologies or Test-Driven Development and continuous integration processes
  • Hand-on experience in:
    • Issue & Project tracking tools (Jira and Atlassian product stack)
    • Automation Testing tools (JUnit, TestNG, Selenium, Cucumber & Soap UI) and Defect Tracking Tools (Bugzilla)
  • Knowledge in Java and/or .NET
  • Experience of SQL, XML, JSON, SOAP, and REST


…then this position is suitable for you!


It would also be a plus if you had


  • Testing certification


This position comes with


  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business) and fast career growth
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Real Estate Finance Officer
Skills: Analytical Skills|English|Finance|Loans|Microsoft Excel|Microsoft Office|Microsoft PowerPoint|Negotiation|Project Finance|Wholesale Banking|
Job Description:
About the job

About Agoda


Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.


Get to know our team:


The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.


Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:


  • Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
  • Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
  • Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders


What you’ll Need to Succeed:


  • Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
  • 0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
  • Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
  • Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
  • Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently


It’s great if you have:


  • Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
  • Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
  • Strong presentation and negotiation skills

Job Description:
About the job

Step out of your comfort zone, excel and redefine the limits of what is possible. That’s just what our employees do every day –to set the pace through our innovations and enable outstanding achievements. After all, behind every successful company are many great fascinating people.

The Support Analyst will provide front-line support in English to workforce management end users on various technical issues and business workflow questions relating to our SAAS software solution. The Support Analyst will be responsible for responding to customer support requests, while documenting and resolving service tickets in a timely manner.

The Support Analyst must have excellent problem-solving skills to diagnose, evaluate and resolve complex situations. Most importantly the candidate must have the ability to empathize with our customers and communicate effectively both internally and externally.

Your working schedule will be part-time, based on Shifts during daytime, including weekends for a total of 5 days/per week.

Essential Job Functions
  • Provide exceptional customer service in English via phone, email and web conference
  • Triage customer issues, troubleshoot, and follow through to customer resolution, in a timely manner
  • Coordinate with both the client team and the development team to ensure all necessary requirements for enhancements are successfully achieved
  • Thoroughly test functionality within the core product and applications to ensure changes are successfully implemented and requirements are met
  • Follow up with customers to ensure their technical issues are resolved
  • Other duties as required

Requirements
  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Excellent written and verbal English communicator
  • A positive, team-oriented attitude with a desire to help
  • Fast, self-motivated learner
  • Critical and analytical thinking skills
  • Problem-solving aptitude
  • Flexibility in scheduling including early hours, and the ability to work some weekends and public holidays throughout the year
  • Microsoft Office Suite

Preferred
  • Business level proficiency in other languages, specifically German, French, Spanish and Japanese.

Benefits
  • Competitive Salary
  • Private Insurance
  • Casual and super friendly working environment
  • Modern offices in downtown Athens right next to the Acropolis Metro Station
  • Ability to work remotely
  • Covid-19 Response: Our employees' safety and well-being is our top priority and we 're not expecting them to fully return to the office until it's again safe to do so.

Think Indeavor sounds like home? Great. We can’t wait to get to know you!

Information About The Processing Of Your Personal Data

The personal data provided by completing this application form will be processed by “INDEAVOR HELLAS SINGLE MEMBER PRIVATE COMPANY” with the distinctive title “INDEAVOR HELLAS S.M.P.C.” (hereinafter referred to as the “Data Controller” and/or “Company”), based in 7, Dion. Areopagitou St., Athens, Greece, 11742, General Commercial Register number: 136371101000, Tax Identification Number: 800686413, Α’ ATHINON Tax Office, e-mail: info@indeavor.com, acting as a Controller for considering your job application associated with a specific open role.

We process personal data as your full name, your e-mail address and your resume (which may include your home address, your telephone number, your education etc.). The sole purpose of processing the personal data included in your resume is to evaluate it, as per your request, and examine the possibility of employment. The lawful basis for processing is to take the necessary steps at your request prior to entering into a contract with you.

Your personal data will be processed by the Company's authorized personnel, which have committed themselves to confidentiality.

Retention period

Your personal data will be retained at our database for six (6) months from filling the job vacancy and afterward will be immediately deleted.

Transfer to third parties

We transfer your personal data our Parent Company “ScheduleSoft Corporation DBA Indeavor”, based in US, and our IT service providers (e.g. Microsoft Corporation), which are considered recipients of your personal data.

Your rights

You can contact us to submit requests regarding the fulfillment of your rights under GDPR (access, correction, deletion, restriction of processing, portability) or any other matter related to the processing of your personal data by sending an e-mail to info@indeavor.com.

We will reply to your requests for free, without delay, and in any case within one (1) month after we receive your request. However, if your request is complex or you submit a large number of requests, we will notify you within one (1) month in case we need to take a two (2) months extension, within which we will respond back to you.

We remind you that if you believe the processing of your personal data violates the applicable law for the protection of personal data or that your request has not been sufficiently addressed, you may file a complaint with the Hellenic Data Protection Authority (www.dpa.gr).

Job Description:
About the job

Scorpios

Scorpios is a growing hospitality brand that brings people together around music, food, and mindfulness — always within a stunning natural landscape. Taking inspiration from the culture and history of its location, each project is intended as a platform for local creatives to exhibit their talents as well as a hub for the global Scorpios community to gather. Since its opening as a beachside music venue on Mykonos in 2015, Scorpios has grown into a global lifestyle hospitality brand with expanded offerings. Scorpios is now looking to build a highly dedicated team to drive the brand to its highest potential.

Job Description

Scorpios is looking for a qualified engineer for the position of Assistant Maintenance Manager. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing the daily maintenance operations.

Opportunities For All

Scorpios was created to bring diverse communities of people together, and we take the same approach when building our teams. We thrive on differences and believe it is critical to our success as a global company. Scorpios is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace that seeks to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We therefore encourage applications from all genders, races, religions, ages and sexual orientations, as well as parents, veterans, people living with disabilities, and any other groups that could bring diverse perspectives to our business.

Responsibilities

  • Daily supervisor of technical team and subcontractors on site
  • Filling out daily reports and timeline
  • Daily correspondence with suppliers, subcontractors, collaborators
  • Final bill reports for subcontractors
  • Photo log of daily work progress
  • Reporting to the manager of dept.

Requirements

  • Proven working experience of 2-3 years
  • Driving license & personal vehicle
  • Knowledge of MS Office, Autocad
  • Good communication Greek and English(written and verbally)

Candidate Profile

  • Internal drive and willingness to work in a demanding, challenging and fast‐paced work environment
  • Strong ability and self-motivation to overcome problems at work in a resourceful, efficient, and effective way, working independently or as part of a team
  • Professional communication skills along with an innate teamwork mentality

Benefits

Scorpios offers a competitive salary with career development opportunities, based on the candidate's qualifications and skills. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to work in a stimulating and motivating environment which values and is committed towards its employees.

Title: Assistant Maintenance Manager
Skills: Communication|Construction Site Inspections|Daily Reports|Greek|On Site|Operations|Photography|Plant Maintenance|Professional Communication|Team Management|
Job Description:
About the job

At Intrum, you will grow by making a difference. You will do it in a highly international environment and in a supportive culture where effort counts.

As a market-leading credit management company, Intrum has wide-ranging expertise in debt collection services, and we do business in 24 countries in Europe plus Latin America (Brazil). We have more than 10,000 experienced employees in our group. As a result, we have a unique geographical size and scope. With market leadership however, comes great responsibility. We see ourselves as role models within our industry and have both the opportunity and responsibility to set new standards and change the way people perceive credit management. Through ethical and sustainable business practices we want to become the true benchmark of our industry.

Having embarked on a major transformation journey, Intrum is working on designing and implementing global standard best-in-class finance processes that will need to be followed by all Intrum legal entities in the 24 countries in which it operates.

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Continuous Improvements Specialist (Record To Report focus) to join our Finance Centre of Excellence. In this role, you will be responsible to analyze the route cause of inefficiencies and issues existing in the process and come up with suggestions of how such issues can be resolved once and for all.

The CI Specialist will be project managing Continuous Improvement initiatives related to his/her stream of responsibility ensuring its timely and complete execution delivering the required results

The Continuous Improvements function will also be responsible for implementing and supporting a Service Delivery Framework, working directly and closely with the Business Process Owners, that meets the requirements of all key stakeholders and customers.


Key Responsibilities:

· Drives process efficiency, quality and cost reduction through joint accountability & collaboration with the business on operational drivers of process performance

· Overseeing and carrying out detailed end-to-end process analysis both on “As Is” and “To Be” processes and working on the transition from the former to the latter.

· Implementing business discipline to increase efficiency.

· Leading the documentation of operational procedures for standardization and automation.

· Ensures the clear definition of SPAs, relevant metrics, escalation, transparency and clear accountability.

· Analysing operational procedures related alternatives and recommending solutions to meet users’ needs.

· Translate technology enhancement project deliverables into specific responsibilities per project team member, provide clear instructions and assign tasks effectively to the project team

· Use effectively available company systems and resources to improve communication and influencing skills to support successful project delivery

· Cooperate effectively with the WD project team as well as the Business Technology teams (internal service providers) in order to create win-win solutions for the benefit of Fin CoE’s key end users

· Build trustful and confident relationships with manager, peers, and project team members with the purpose of creating synergies and getting results more quickly during project implementation

· Working to achieve top quartile standards as benchmarked against other shared service operations, by continually looking to the five key drivers to reduce cost, improve service levels and improve the control environment:

Requirements:

· 3+ years’ experience in a finance or a Shared Services Organisation with at least 2 years of them managing projects

· Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as Finance, Business, or Data Science

· Experience in setting up processes, performance measures, targets, reports, are all relevant to this role

· Knowledge in establishing finance business processes; experience with the Record To Report process is a must

· Solid quantitative and analytical skills

· Cross-functional understanding

· Good command of English, both written and verbal is a prerequisite;

· Strong focus on providing the highest level of customer service to both internal and external customers

· Highly proactive and seeks continuous improvement in self and others

What we offer:

· A flexible workplace providing more freedom to get the job done while managing the responsibilities of life

· Culture of learning for individual career development and growth opportunities

· Community driven environment where your experience matters

· Full onboarding guidance to settle in comfortably

· Rewards and recognition for individual performance and contribution

· Benefit package, including healthy environment, insurance, team building & sport activities etc.

· Hybrid work arrangements allowing to combine work from home and office


Join us on this exciting journey by sharing your experience and story 🤩


Do you feel that you might be the right person? Great! Apply now. Looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Receptionist
Company: Casa Del Mar Mykonos Seaside Resort
Skills: Boutique|Communication|Computer Literacy|English|Hospitality Industry|Hotel Management|Luxury|Luxury Travel|Teamwork|Villas|
Job Description:
About the job

Let’s Build the Next Industrial Revolution Together


Behind every product is a person


At Vimachem, we’re using technology to empower the people who manufacture medicines for our world. This is why we are developing the world’s biggest manufacturing intelligence AI SaaS Platform specifically for Life Sciences incorporating AI, IIoT and Pharma 4.0 technologies, allowing pharmaceutical and biotech manufacturers to scale faster with greater flexibility.

We are a technology company with offices in Athens and NYC, currently looking for a Lead SaaS/IT Global Project Manager to join our Athens team.


What’s In for You


As Lead SaaS/IT Global Project Manager you will manage the successful development, implementation and maintenance of the Vimachem OptimZ Pharma 4.0 Platform, including software and hardware (IoT, Edge, Robotics, Machine Vision) modules. You will be deeply involved in all aspects of global projects, ensuring accountability for the business and the technical success of the solutions. You will be a part of a highly motivated, growing team and manage the definition, development, and delivery of projects for some of our largest pharma and biotech customers.



What will you do as a Lead SaaS/IT Global Project Manager?


  • Design and lead the execution of project plans that drive successful, measurable deployment aligned with Vimachem’s mission to provide Pharma and Biotech manufacturers with the fastest-to-deploy Manufacturing Operations Management (MoM) platform in the market.
  • Optimize the implementation process of existing Vimachem SaaS products and design the implementation process of newly introduced products.
  • Act as the single point of contact for the project: Develop a project communication plan and ensure execution to the plan, resulting in professional and consistent communication with the customer and other stakeholders.
  • Actively manage risks to identify changes and mitigation strategies.
  • Clearly communicate all schedule constraints and project milestones.
  • Act as a liaison between the delivery and product teams to continuously identify product improvements that can lead to more efficient implementation.
  • Effectively negotiate scope and schedule changes.
  • Accurately identify and communicate internal and external customers' needs.
  • Organize and facilitate project reviews that ensure key stakeholders are presented with accurate and concise information to make decisions.
  • Become an expert in Vimachem products so you can efficiently understand the interdependencies between technology, operations, and customer needs.
  • Influence others to ensure successful delivery: frequently collaborate with other departments such as software development, R&D, operations, quality and sales and lead with influence to ensure the success of your project and set the stage for future success of your next project working with these stakeholders. Develop a sense of urgency in stakeholders while also building a solid foundation for future collaboration.
  • Lead project analysis on resource, schedule & budget planning, and risk assessment: Monitor project duration, status, quality and costs; escalate issues when necessary. Evaluates and approves changes that impact the scope, budget, or schedule of a project.
  • Drive process and technology improvement efforts: Drive continuous improvement through successful lessons-learned / project retrospective activities that result in appropriate process or product changes. Lead initiatives to help the organization operate more efficiently and effectively. Be passionate about continuous improvement.



The main qualifications for the Lead SaaS/IT Global Project Manager role are:


  • A Bachelor's degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) discipline or equivalent work experience.
  • At least 4 years of experience leading and directing customer-facing engineering projects. Pharmaceutical or biotech manufacturing experience is preferrable.
  • Experience in one of the following fields: Manufacturing Execution Systems - Quality Management Systems- Edge and IIoT, is highly desirable.
  • Experience in managing customer-facing solution delivery with strong communication skills, presentation skills and negotiation skills.
  • Strong technical and executive communication skills.
  • A PMP or PMI-ACP certification or be able to attain one within 6 months of hire.
  • Strong understanding of business concepts such as pricing, costs, margins, terms and conditions preferred.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead, coach, and work effectively with teams.



Working At Vimachem:

We are building a strong, diverse team that values hard work, families, and personal well being.


Benefits of working with us include:

  • Competitive salary and bonus scheme.
  • We offer a hybrid working environment with outmost flexibility.
  • Benefits package including Health insurance, Life insurance, Short-term Disability, Long-term Disability, Commuter Benefits, Parental Leave, and Retirement Plan.
  • Business credit card for expenses.
  • Continuous training in Greece and abroad.
  • A buddy will support you with onboarding.
  • Latest i5, lots of RAM, fast SSD.
  • Fitness subsidies.
  • Virtual company events, free office snacks and happy hours.
  • Relocation package and relocation bonus for Greek expats.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Help us build an inclusive community that will transform manufacturing.

Title: BI Developer
Skills: Attention to Detail|Compensation|Computer Science|Employee Benefits|English|Greek|MySQL|Query Languages|Relational Databases|SQL|
Job Description:
About the job

We are Kaizen Gaming


Kaizen Gaming is the leading GameTech company in Greece and one of the fastest-growing in Europe, with the Stoiximan brand in Greece and Cyprus and Betano in Germany, Romania, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Portugal, Brazil, Chile, Peru, Ecuador and Canada. Our aim is to leverage cutting-edge Technology in order to provide the optimum experience to those who trust us for their entertainment.


The Role


We’re looking for a Reporting Principal Engineer to join our Big Data reporting team, who will help teams devise elegant and performant solutions in response to real business problems, guide them in designing and implementing these solutions in code, as well as teach coding, testing, and performance analysis techniques, while also carrying out code reviews. Will frequently attend teams' scrum events (esp. refinements) and help teams' product owners shape a better understanding of the technical challenges involved. Production problems are usually escalated to Principal Engineer for triaging before landing in a team's backlog. Principal Engineers should also stay up to date on the latest technologies and drive their adoption.



The Team


Our Big Data reporting team(s) consists of twelve members with diverse backgrounds and expertise in several fields including, but not limited to, Databricks/ Delta lake/ SQL Server/ Azure Data Warehouse/ SSRS/ SSIS.



Responsibilities


  • Lead team enablement initiatives;
  • Orchestrate the plan by motivating other team members and collaborating closely in achieving it;
  • Break the efforts down and work closely by guiding the reporting engineers through gaps to lead them to sound technical solutions;
  • Technical expertise and knowledge sharing. Present practices, innovations, and inventions inside and outside of the organization;
  • Partner with management to find new potential talent;
  • Mentor engineers to take them to the next level of their careers;
  • Set up cross-organization engineering best practice standards and guidelines. Create a culture where the contribution patterns and quality are paramount. They partner closely with teams to implement them.



Requirements


Must have:

  • 8+ years of hands-on experience in writing complex, highly optimized SQL code for data manipulation and reporting;
  • 5+ years of experience in ETL/ELT, Data Modeling, Data Warehouse Architecture and Reporting tools;
  • Knowledge of Data Governance;
  • Good people skills;
  • Team player, analytical thinker and problem solver, with ability to self-organize;
  • Fast learner - you will need to get up to speed on business, people and teams, infrastructure and the technologies used, as quickly as possible.


Nice to have:

  • A bachelor's degree in a quantitative/technical field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering) or equivalent industry experience;
  • Experience in the Microsoft BI stack (SQL Server, SSRS, SSAS);
  • Experience with Azure Data platforms such as Synapse Analytics, Data Lake, Databricks;
  • Experience in programming languages preferable in Python or Scala;
  • Exposure to CI/CD;
  • Exposure to an Agile team-working environment.



Kaizen Gaming Perks


🕑 We offer both work from the office (hybrid model) & remote working options.

🏃 A buddy will support you with your onboarding.

💸Competitive salary package and bonus scheme.

👩‍⚕️ Health and life insurance for you and your family.

📚 Udemy learning account & continuous training.

💰 Monthly allowance for lunch & commuting expenses.

⭐Clear career paths & a developmental 360° feedback framework.

✈️ Relocation package and "Brain Gain" relocation bonus for Greek expats.

Title: Continuous Improvement Specialist
Skills: Continuous Improvement|
Job Description:
About the job

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.


The Opportunity


We design and operate leading digital payment and transactional solutions that enable sustainable economic growth and reinforce trust and security in our societies. If you are a highly-skilled Agile Delivery Manager, then get ready to join our company!



Day-to-Day Responsibilities



· Champions the agile delivery methodology and leads all Cardlink Delivery Teams.

· Understands the software development lifecycle and promotes CI / CD.

· Acts as a Scrum Master for Cardlink Delivery teams facilitating all scrum ceremonies across all delivery teams.

· Facilitates all planning of the agile delivery teams to get all deliverables on time.

· Understands estimation processes and provides insights to the estimates of the delivery team.

· Ensures that delivery teams are appropriately resourced to deliver based on their needs.

· Works closely with the product owners to keep the backlog tidy and smoothly feed the delivery teams with work.

· Maintains the documentation of the deliverables across all delivery teams.

· Identifies and solves issues / impediments, escalating in advance to supervisor and / or Head of Architecture and Delivery where necessary.

· Identifies risks and mitigates them, escalating in advance to supervisor and / or Head of Architecture and Delivery where necessary.

· Protects the delivery teams putting people before process and ensure that energy is channeled to value.

· Maintains a pragmatic approach always leading the delivery teams to successful completion of tasks.

· Proposing ways to improve all aspects of project management.

· Cooperates with other colleagues on issues and processed that require cross functional cooperation.

· Participates in projects as a team member or leads projects as an accountable owner, contributing time, skills and knowledge.

· Works as the contact point for all project work picked up by the delivery teams that he leads.


Who Are We Looking For


· Minimum 5 years’ proven track record of project management using agile methodologies

· Strong influencing and persuasion skills with the ability to enthuse and inspire the project team and stakeholders at all levels

· Exceptional relationship building and communication skills in Greek and English

· Understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, Lean, SaFE)

· Risk Management techniques combined with strong planning and organizing skills

· Understanding of the payment industry business and software industry terms

· Excellent use of all MS office software as well JIRA and Confluence

Additional skills:

· Experience in software development either in a role of business analyst, developer, quality assurance


Perks & Benefits


At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:

· Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.

· Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.

· Work in an international environment with cutting edge technologies.

· Enjoy a wide range of benefits: medical insurance, tickets restaurant, 50% of remote working.


Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Learn more about life at Worldline at careers.worldline.com

Title: Lead SaaS/IT Global Project Manager
Skills: Communication|Executive-level Communication|Mitigation Strategies|Negotiation|Presentation Skills|Presentations|Project Management|Project Plans|Project Reviews|Solution Delivery|
Job Description:
About the job

With you, Chubb is better!

Is manual testing your love but automation is your real passion? Do you want to work with groundbreaking engineering CHUBBions who accelerate your knowledge of tech trends? If you are an amazing QA Engineer who wants to use pioneering technologies and make an impact in our Centre of Excellence for QA Testing, then keep reading and check out this outstanding opportunity in our new Technology Hub in Greece – CBSG (Chubb Business Services Greece) as a QA Engineer at Thessaloniki.

https://news.chubb.com/2022-12-08-Chubb-to-Launch-New-Technology-Hub-in-Thessaloniki,-Greece

If you are a tech freak and raring to develop your career join our growing, pioneer, diverse team within one of the largest companies in the world, we would love to hear from you!

The Opportunity

Your Responsibilities for this role may include, but are not limited to:
  • Be an outstanding teammate and assist the development of workflows
  • Design, develop, and implement both manual and automated tests depending on the project
  • Hands-on development of detailed test artifacts such as test plans, traceability matrix, test cases with expected results located within Jira
  • Maintain existing automation framework and build automation scripts across selected projects using tools like Selenium etc.
  • Communicate testing results and advance roadblocks to the appropriate individuals on the project team.
  • Review and analyze requirements, specifications, and technical design documents, providing timely feedback
  • Run powerful technologies to improve our testing strategies
  • Support our progressive senior leader in daily tasks
  • Collaborate with others from our diverse worldwide tech team
  • Apply a global and diverse perspective to problem solving.
  • Review and recommend improvements to existing system designs and engineering processes.

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • At least 2 years of relevant experience as a QA Engineer
  • Relevant experience in manual and/or automated testing for UI, API, Performance, Security, Mobile
  • Knowledge of project and software development lifecycles, with the understanding of project lifecycle methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall and CI/CD
  • Solid understanding and exposure to testing strategies and tools like Selenium, TestCafe, Cypress, SoapUI, Postman, JMeter etc..
  • Strong communications skills with the ability to cooperate with both executives and technical staff in Greek and English
  • Keen eye for detail and a commitment to excellence
  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from our outstanding mentors
  • Ability to multitask working on multiple projects, across different applications
  • Be open to receiving constructive feedback and turning it into process improvements
  • Be a guru analysis and a detail ninja
  • ISTQB or relevant certification will be considered a plus

Our team makes the difference, every time. For this reason, we offer in return!

We offer hybrid working model, explicit, structured career development, a competitive salary package, annual bonus, private medical cover, monthly allowance for lunch, continuous learning experiences, work in a fun, lively environment with mentoring from our groundbreaking senior mentors.

Integrity. Client Focus. Respect. Excellence. Teamwork

Our core values instruct how we live and work. We’re an ethical and honest company that’s wholly committed to its clients. A business that’s engaged in mutual trust and respect for its employees and partners. A place where colleagues perform at the highest levels. And a working environment that’s collaborative and encouraging.

Diversity & Inclusion. At Chubb, we consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness and respect, regardless of their age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or family circumstances. We earnestly strive to achieve an environment where all colleagues feel comfortable to perform to their full potential and are recognized for their contributions.

Many voices, One Chubb!

Title: Reporting Principal Engineer (Big Data)
Skills: Big Data|Data Modeling|Data Warehouse Architecture|Data Warehousing|Extract, Transform, Load (ETL)|Python (Programming Language)|SQL|SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)|SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)|Scala|
Job Description:
About the job

Role Summary


Pfizer’s belief is that all people deserve to live healthy lives. This drives our desire to provide access to medicines that are safe, effective, and affordable. We advance breakthroughs that change patients’ lives and increasingly there is a digital component to the interactions we have with patients and their health care professionals.


Why Patients Need You


Technology impacts everything we do. Pfizer’s digital and ‘data first’ strategy focuses on implementing impactful and innovative technology solutions across all functions from research to manufacturing. Whether you are digitizing drug discovery and development, identifying solutions, or making our work easier and faster, you will be making a difference to countless lives.


What You Will Achieve


The HCP Products and solutions team provides a comprehensive suite of technology solutions to enhance the Health Care Provider experience. Experiences include all aspects of medical information on products, preventative care, disease awareness, diagnosis, treatment options, payment assistance, side effect management, care programs, adherence assistance, and long-term maintenance of care.


HCP Products and solution team is driven to ensure that every doctor, pharmacist, or other appropriate stakeholder in the system are given easy access to the information and tools that they need to manage patients and get the best possible outcome. Opportunities exist in web and mobile, to empower HCPs through easier access to information and reporting of health data.


The HCP platform offers advanced features across a scalable set of technologies that allow for rapid rollout of the HCP Portal to markets and new features to be implemented on demand vs. through long lead time and release cycles. The information gathered by the analytics set on these portals is central to help derive the value of implemented features and the roadmap of future features, as well as enable data driven business decisions.


This senior position requires an individual with a proven experience working across 10-15 highly matrixed teams, prioritizing work, managing hand-offs, with precise communications skills at both the technical team and management level.


Role Responsibilities


The primary responsibility of this position is to act as the metadata & analytics data integrity lead for the HCP team – specific responsibilities include -


  • In partnership with the Analytics organization and development teams, align on strategy and implement solutions to tag all assets in accordance with the metadata strategy.
  • Accountable for the implementation of feature analytics. Create processes to ensure that analytics requirements provided by the Product Management team align with development specifications. Confirm that analytics testing is complete and working as expected.
  • Develop plans to implement ongoing audits and remediation activities (when necessary) on existing site, systems, and components to ensure that analytics have been implemented according to the Adobe Analytics Data Layer Specification.
  • Define, document, implement, and maintain an end-to-end process for testing analytics working across a highly matrixed and siloed organization.
  • Conduct ad hoc analyses
  • Develop strong partnerships with cross-functional peers, including the Content, Product Management and Personalization teams.
  • Independently manage cross-functional team dependencies


In this crucial role, you will ensure the integrity of analytics across all our portals and features globally in partnership with our Development and Product Management team’s Role Responsibilities.


You will be an integral part of the delivery teams and squads, with a primary focus on ensuring meaningful analytics are captured and easily


available to business to drive insights.


You will be a self-motivated, detail-orientated team player who enjoys both technical and creative challenges within a fast-paced agile


environment.


Basic Qualifications / Experience


  • Minimum of 7-10 years as an analyst with hands-on experience using the Adobe Analytics Suite.
  • Relevant experience as an information technology professional in roles such of data analyst or business analyst
  • Experience working in an Agile development framework, preferable using SAFE methodology
  • Experience working with large diverse teams and managing complexity across different teams to achieve goals
  • A history of working in agile, lean and/or continuous delivery development teams
  • Experience with cloud-based Web applications and building robust analytics to drive engagement.


Preferred Qualifications


As above and including Bachelor of Science degree in Information Management, Computer Science, Engineering, Technology Management,


or relevant disciplines.


OVERALL:


Detail oriented, persistent, strong desire to produce quality applications focused on user experience.Able to organize, manage and prioritize own workload as well as for others to ensure deadlines are met.


Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to establish relationships, influence outcomes, and deliver effective presentations to a variety of audiences.


Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.


LI#PFE


Purpose


Breakthroughs that change patients' lives... At Pfizer we are a patient centric company, guided by our four values: courage, joy, equity and excellence. Our breakthrough culture lends itself to our dedication to transforming millions of lives.


Digital Transformation Strategy


One bold way we are achieving our purpose is through our company wide digital transformation strategy. We are leading the way in adopting new data, modelling and automated solutions to further digitize and accelerate drug discovery and development with the aim of enhancing health outcomes and the patient experience.


Flexibility


We aim to create a trusting, flexible workplace culture which encourages employees to achieve work life harmony, attracts talent and enables everyone to be their best working self. Let’s start the conversation!


Equal Employment Opportunity


We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is crucial to building a successful business. As an employer, Pfizer is committed to celebrating this, in all its forms – allowing for us to be as diverse as the patients and communities we serve. Together, we continue to build a culture that encourages, supports and empowers our employees.


Information & Business Tech

Title: Agile Delivery Manager
Skills: Agile Methodologies|Business Analysis|Communication|Confluence|English|Jira|Organization Skills|Project Management|Quality Assurance|Scrum|
Job Description:
About the job

Είσαι απόφοιτος ή τελειόφοιτος φοιτητής στον τομέα των Οικονομικών Επιστημών και θα ήθελες να κάνεις το πρώτο σου επαγγελματικό βήμα;

Θέλεις να αποκτήσεις εργασιακή εμπειρία συνυφασμένη με τις σπουδές σου;

Θεωρείς τη διαπραγμάτευση ως το βασικό ανταγωνιστικό πλεονέκτημά σου; 🚀

Εάν η απάντηση στις παραπάνω ερωτήσεις είναι ‘’ναι’’, τότε είσαι αυτός/ή που ψάχνουμε.

Θέση Εργασίας

Η ManpowerGroupGreece, ηγέτιδα δύναμη στο χώρο του ανθρώπινου δυναμικού αναζητά για λογαριασμό πελάτη της, κορυφαίας εταιρείας διαχείρισης δανείων και ακινήτων , δυναμικούς υποψηφίους, οι οποίοι θα στελεχώσουν την θέση του Junior Financial Advisor.

Οι κατάλληλοι υποψήφιοι θα αναλάβουν την τηλεφωνική επικοινωνία, ενημέρωση & καθοδήγηση του πελάτη με άμεσο σκοπό την διενέργεια ρυθμίσεων αναφορικά με την διαχείριση για την είσπραξη των ληξιπρόθεσμων οφειλών του.

Αφορά πενθήμερη εργασία πλήρους απασχόλησης (40 ώρες εβδομαδιαίως).

Requirements
  • Πτυχίο ΑΕΙ/ΤΕΙ σχολής Οικονομίας, Λογιστικής & Διοίκησης Επιχειρήσεων
  • Διάθεση και ενέργεια για εκμάθηση και εκπαίδευση
  • Ικανότητα ανάληψης πρωτοβουλιών
  • Αναπτυγμένες επικοινωνιακές & διαπραγματευτικές ικανότητες
  • Άνεση & Ευγένεια στην επικοινωνία
  • Προσανατολισμό στην εξυπηρέτηση του πελάτη

Benefits
  • 💰 Σταθερός Μηνιαίος Μισθός, βάσει προσόντων & επαγγελματικής εμπειρίας που μπορεί να φτάσει εώς και τα 900€ καθαρές αποδοχές
  • 💰 Bonus επίτευξης στόχων
  • Διαρκής εκπαίδευση πάνω στο αντίκειμενο της εργασίας
  • Επαγγελματική εμπειρία σε εταιρικό περιβάλλον στον τομέα της οικονομίας
  • Προοπτικές ανάπτυξης καριέρας & εξέλιξης σε πιο σύνθετους ρόλους

Title: QA Engineer @ Thessaloniki
Skills: Communication|Constructive Feedback|Design Documents|Mobile Testing|QA Engineering|Quality Assurance|Technical Design|Test Automation|Test Cases|Test Planning|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description


ABOUT THIS JOB


You will be responsible for cooperating with our current retailers' clients, building up the partnership and the co-dependency between companies. You will assist clients in understanding retail trends, and advise and consult in optimizing their marketing strategies to help their business grow and develop. You will own the deliverables, business issue analysis and solution integration with our coop retailers to secure strong engagement events up to C-suite level.


a Little Bit About You


If you have the unique combination of strong communication and analytical skills this is the place for you. In fact, you’re a bit of a people person and feel energized by successful collaboration. You manage relationships and expectations as well as you manage projects, and your experience speaks for itself. Curiosity, communication, and critical thinking drive your work- with a passion for storytelling being part of your DNA.


Responsibilities


  • Proactively offer consultancy to retailers on market trends and identify points of improvement and development
  • Extract data, analyze and present findings to key stakeholders within given deadlines
  • Independently discusses analysis design to best answer retailers' questions
  • Liaise with other teams as necessary (e.g. operations, off-shore partners, technology and data science) to solve client business questions and inquiries
  • Lead client meetings, building a story and final recommendations for a C-suite audience
  • Provide training to clients on NIQ tools and solutions
  • Coordinate between NIQ departments and client stakeholders to ensure that developments are identified and implemented efficiently and smoothly
  • Continue to broaden knowledge of client business issues and needs, NIQ services and the broader industry
  • Client visits once/twice a week - travel within Greece


Qualifications


  • Minimum 3 years of experience in Marketing Research ideally in a retail business
  • Besides local language, strong business English knowledge, both verbal and written
  • Strong analytical mind and excellent numerical skills
  • Strong organizational & interpersonal skills
  • Experience in FMCG/Retail sector is a plus
  • Business acumen and good knowledge of the market dynamics
  • Effective communication & visualization skills
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and data analysis while feeling comfortable working in a digital-enabled environment


WE OFFER


  • The hybrid model of working
  • Life and health insurance (Group Insurance)
  • Internal recognition system
  • A competitive remuneration package
  • A diverse work environment
  • Learning achievement academy
  • Global exposure and engagement
  • Ongoing career growth and skill development
  • Engaging and challenging work within our portfolio of global clients
  • Culture of performance-based rewards
  • Volunteer time off


Additional Information


About NIQ


NIQ, the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, reveals new pathways to growth for retailers and consumer goods manufacturers. With operations in more than 100 countries, NIQ delivers the most complete and clear understanding of consumer buying behavior through an advanced business intelligence platform with integrated predictive analytics. NIQ delivers the Full View.


NIQ was founded in 1923 and is an Advent International portfolio company. For more information, visit NIQ.com


Want to keep up with the latest updates on our business and #LifeAtNIQ? Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook


Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us.


We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide.


Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NielsenIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion/


NIQ or any of our subsidiaries will never ask you for money at any point of the recruitment or onboarding process.

Title: Senior Manager, Analytics Analyst
Skills: Adobe Analytics|Analytics|Business Insights|Communication|Computer Science|Data Integrity|Interpersonal Communication|Marketing Analytics|Presentations|Workload Prioritization|
Job Description:
About the job

Hellenic Technologies is a leading European digital agency, located in the heart of Athens, Greece. Since 2005, we’ve been guiding businesses along the path of digital transformation. We specialize in web development and data-driven digital marketing, working with both B2B and B2C clients.


We are looking for a talented and motivated PHP Developer to join our team in Athens.


Responsibilities

What will your typical day look like? You will:

  • Develop, record, and maintain cutting-edge web-based PHP applications on portal plus premium service platforms
  • Build innovative, state-of-the-art applications and collaborate with the User Experience (UX) team
  • Prepare and maintain all applications utilizing standard development tools
  • Utilize backend data services and contribute to increasing existing data services API
  • Lead the entire web application development life cycle right from the concept stage to delivery and post-launch support
  • Convey effectively with all task progress, evaluations, suggestions, and schedules along with technical and process issues
  • Document the development process, architecture, and standard components
  • Coordinate with co-developers and keeps project manager well informed of the status of development effort and serves as liaison between development staff and project manager
  • Keep abreast of new trends and best practices in web development


Benefits

What is in it for you?

  • Competitive compensation
  • Salary increase if milestones are achieved and skills are upgraded
  • Bonus scheme
  • Working in a friendly and cooperative environment
  • Fixed hybrid work model
  • Monthly premium meals by Chefs


Basic Requirements

  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, MIS or a similar relevant field
  • 3+ years of working experience as a PHP/ Laravel Developer
  • Proven working experience with WordPress, and Woocommerce
  • Hands-on experience with SQL schema design, SOLID principles, REST API design
  • MySQL profiling and query optimization
  • Software testing (PHPUnit, PHPSpec, Behat)
  • Experience with Advanced Custom Fields (ACF), and Gutenberg
  • Knowledge of JavaScript/Vue.js
  • Exposure to contemporary JS and CSS frameworks
  • Familiar with GitHub
  • Excellent grasp of the English language
  • Team player
  • Problem solver


Good to have

  • Knowledge of Node.js
  • Involved in coding custom projects/products

Title: Junior Financial Advisors

Job Description:
About the job

As a highly-skilled Junior Technical Coordinator you will be part of our core business team. You will be expected to work in a fast and competitive environment, take on responsibilities and initiatives from day one, and collaborate effectively with the other members of the team. We are looking for a person that is diligent, hard-working & creative. Above all, a person who will be excited about the prospect of working for a pioneering technology company.


Requirements


  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in both Greek & English
  • Tech-savvy, hard-working, and a team player
  • Very diligent and able to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent organizational, operational & communication skills
  • Ability to work well with large datasets
  • Excellent computer skills (especially Excel)
  • Good grasp of IT & technological applications
  • Knowledge or experience on integrations/software connections (JSON & XML files, APIs, SFTP) will be considered a plus


Responsibilities


  • Facilitate communication between Business, Developers and Sales Team
  • Attend technical meetings with customers and drive them to correct integration specifications.
  • Cooperate with the development department to deliver specifications about the integration points.
  • Guide clients on how to use/configure Procureship’s tools and recommend solutions to technical problems
