  • Gain in-depth knowledge of the product, the market, and the clients
  • Demonstrate a pioneering spirit and a problem-solving mindset


Benefits


  • Friendly & collaborative work environment
  • Attractive compensation package
  • Career growth opportunities

Title: Retail Vertical Executive
Skills: Business English|Client Visits|Interpersonal Skills|Market Analysis|Market Research|Marketing|Marketing Research|Numeracy|Research Skills|Retail|
Job Description:
About the job

Are you interested in working with a leading education technology player, the global leader in the assessment and certification of professional skills industry with presence in more than 200 countries worldwide? If so, this is the chance to apply now! 📥


PeopleCert is looking for Online Exams Invigilators (Proctors), who is responsible for onboarding, monitoring and closing Online Proctored exams through our respective platforms. This person resolves customers’ technical enquiries that arise during the online exam, by handling inbound and outbound international calls, emails or chats to candidates.


The Online Exams department operates in Athens, Greece with rotating shifts, 24/7/365.


As an Online Exams Invigilator, your tasks will include the following:

  • Complete necessary training before onboarding candidates
  • Keep up to date with customer service department Best Practices, procedures and guidance to deal with customer enquiries and improve customers’ satisfaction
  • Ensure that candidate validation is performed according to PeopleCert exam requirements and that Customer enquiries are dealt with in accordance with the performance and service standards prescribed by PeopleCert
  • Actively monitor the candidate at all times
  • Ensure that when non compliances occur, the exam is locked and the issue is escalated to the supervisor
  • Determine and resolve candidates’ technical issues prior or during the exam, through customized platforms, chat, phone or e-mails
  • Work effectively in a team environment and liaise with other teams, in order to get the job done and reach the best possible results


What we look for:

  • Passionate with Customer Service
  • Excellent knowledge of English (C2 level) and Spanish (C2 level/ native-like)
  • Bachelor’s degree any discipline will be an asset
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Experience from a similar position will be an asset
  • Well organized, self-driven, flexible and able to work in a high-volume, fast-paced, and deadline-driven environment
  • Prior working experience in the certification of persons and/or training and exam fields would be considered an advantage
  • Advanced computer literacy is required. ECDL Advance level certification would be considered a plus
  • Ability to work in rotating shifts (including some nightshifts per month)


What we offer:

  • Monthly Bonus upon Performance 💳
  • Work in an international, dynamic and fun atmosphere 💯
  • Two free vouchers for all certifications from PeopleCert's Portfolio per year for all employees 🎓
  • Complimentary coffee and tea in all our premises ☕
  • Huge learning experience in using best practices and global environment 📈
  • Constant personal and professional development 🥇
  • 100% Virtual Hiring Process 💻


If you want to become a member of our international, dynamic and agile team that creates world leading software products, then we should certainly like to hear from you!


About PeopleCert

PeopleCert is a global leader in assessment and certification of professional skills, partnering with multi-national organizations and government bodies for the development & delivery of standardized exams. Delivering exams across 200 countries and in 25 languages over its state-of-the-art assessment technology, PeopleCert enables professionals to boost their careers and realize their life ambitions.

Quality, Innovation, Passion, Integrity are the core values which guide everything we do.

Our offices in UK, Greece, and Cyprus boast a culture of diversity, where everyone is different, yet everyone fits in. All of us at PeopleCert are committed to the reflection of the diversity and inclusion of our customers and the communities in which we do business.


Working on Home Office (HO) Secure English Language Tests (SELTs)

Any person who is engaged by PeopleCert to work on the SELT service must undergo a Background Check (the results of which must be acceptable to PeopleCert and the HO) prior to commencing their SELT duties. All SELT personnel will be required to complete a declaration (provided by PeopleCert) where the existence of any criminal record and/or bankruptcy must be declared.

If working on the SELT service in the UK, background checks will include:

  • A basic or enhanced Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) check
  • Right to Work in the UK check (including nationality, identity and place of residence)
  • HO security check (Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) or Counter Terrorist Check (CTC)
  • Financial background check
  • Employment reference check
  • If working on the SELT service anywhere in the world (outside of the UK) personnel will undergo background checks that are equivalent to those stated for the UK

In addition, if personnel are required to speak to SELT candidates they must be appropriately skilled in English language and, where SELT services are provided anywhere in the world (outside of the UK), the official language of the relevant country.


All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Title: PHP Developer
Skills: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)|Doctrine (PHP)|JavaScript|Laravel|PHP|PHPUnit|REST APIs|SQL|Vue.js|WordPress|
Job Description:
About the job

637173BR


Introduction


A career in IBM Consulting embraces long-term relationships, meaningful impact, and close collaboration with clients across the globe.


You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio; including IBM Software and Red Hat.


Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be supported by mentors and coaches who will encourage you to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and learning opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience.


Your Role and Responsibilities


Your Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


As an IBM Consulting Consultant, you’ll have the opportunity to join IBM Associate program – a development program designed to provide the full-spectrum of structured training, development, and practical experience necessary to successfully launch and accelerate your career.


  • Contributing to top clients in collaboration with smart people in a dynamic environment.
  • Working on projects that help clients integrate process, technology, and information to increase effectiveness, reduce costs.
  • Mastering new skills, working across different disciplines, and moving into new challenges.
  • Growing responsibilities for delivering Functional and Process designs for SAP/Salesforce reporting-based solutions.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise


  • Bachelor degree in , Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or an equivalent subject - eager to continuously embrace new challenges, able to perform without full experience and always interested in learning.
  • Ability to work in projects across Europe, independently and in a team environment.
  • Organizational, problem-solving, and time management abilities.
  • Authorized to work in Greece.
  • Languages: Greek (native) / English.
  • No pending military obligations.


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


  • MBA or MSc in Business/Finance/PM or other business field will be appreciated.


About Business Unit


IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.


Your Life @ IBM


In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.


Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.


Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.


Are you ready to be an IBMer?


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Junior Technical Coordinator
Skills: Account Management|Computer Literacy|Customer Support|Data Analysis|Datasets|IT Operations|Microsoft Excel|SQL|Sales|Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP)|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description: Barista

Έχεις πάθος για την τέχνη της παρασκευής καφέ και την επιθυμία να ξεκινήσεις ένα ταξίδι καριέρας γεμάτο προκλήσεις και ζωντάνια; Αν ναι, έχουμε την τέλεια ευκαιρία για εσένα. Καθώς η εταιρεία μας συνεχίζει να επεκτείνεται παγκοσμίως αναζητούμε ταλαντούχα άτομα που θέλουν να εξελιχθούν και να αναπτύξουν την ακμάζουσα κοινότητα της Mikel Coffee.

Στη Mikel Coffee, πιστεύουμε ότι η δημιουργία του τέλειου φλιτζανιού καφέ είναι μια μορφή τέχνης. Οι Barista μας είναι εξειδικευμένοι τεχνίτες που δημιουργούν αριστουργήματα σε κάθε φλιτζάνι που σερβίρουν. Κατανοούμε τη σημασία της ανάπτυξης και της εξέλιξης και επενδύουμε στα μέλη της ομάδας μας, παρέχοντάς τους ευκαιρίες να μάθουν, να αναπτυχθούν και να διαπρέψουν στην καριέρα τους.

Ως Barista της Mikel Coffee, θα τελειοποιήσεις τις ικανότητές σου στη τέχνη της παρασκευής καφέ και θα γίνεις μέλος μιας δεμένης, παθιασμένης ομάδας που εκτιμά τη συνεισφορά σου. Θα έχεις την ευκαιρία να εργαστείς σε ένα δυναμικό, ταχέως εξελισσόμενο περιβάλλον, όπου κάθε μέρα φέρνει νέες προκλήσεις και συναρπαστικές ευκαιρίες ανάπτυξης.

Η εταιρία προσφέρει:

  • Σύγχρονη και συνεχή εκπαίδευση
  • Ευκαιρίες επαγγελματικής εξέλιξης εντός του οργανισμού
  • Ευχάριστο και νεανικό περιβάλλον
  • Ανταγωνιστικό πακέτο αποδοχών

Εάν διαθέτεις:

  • Μεθοδικότητα, ευχέρεια επικοινωνίας και ομαδικό πνεύμα
  • Υπευθυνότητα και συνέπεια
  • Προϋπηρεσία στον χώρο της καφεστίασης

Και είσαι έτοιμη ή έτοιμος να απογειώσεις την αγάπη σου για τον καφέ, τότε θα χαρούμε να σε γνωρίσουμε.

Κάνε κλικ στον παρακάτω σύνδεσμο για να ολοκληρώσεις την αίτησή σου! Το ταξίδι σου ως Barista Artist σε περιμένει

Αν ολοκληρώσεις την αίτηση και πατήσεις "Ολοκλήρωση" και "Υποβολή", θα λάβεις αυτόματα feedback για το ποια είναι η κορυφαία δύναμή σου. Αυτή η πληροφορία θα σε βοηθήσει να κατανοήσεις καλύτερα τις δυνατότητές σου και να εκμεταλλευτείς αυτές τις δεξιότητες στη θέση του Barista.

Κάνε αίτηση τώρα και ας δημιουργήσουμε ένα καλύτερο αύριο, ένα φλιτζάνι καφέ τη φορά!

https://lykos.co/jobs/9907ff62-b0df-4d8a-84ef-b9bcda496f6c

Καλή τύχη, και ανυπομονούμε να σε γνωρίσουμε!

Title: Online Exams Invigilator- Spanish Speaking
Skills: Communication|Computer Literacy|Confidentiality|Customer Service|English|European Computer Driving Licence (ECDL)|Finance|Spanish|Training|Written Communication|
Job Description:
About the job

Nusr-Et is offering ‘’Accounting Specialist” role for you. If you’re enthusiastic to contribute in a fast-paced environment with F&B dynamics, please apply the post below:



Qualifications & Requirements


  • Graduated from related departments of universities,
  • At least 3 years of experience in cost accounting in the manufacturing industry,
  • Able to use ERP program, preferably Axapta,
  • Able to use advanced MS Excel, MS Access and MS Powerpoint programs,
  • Advanced analytical thinking skills and attention to detail,
  • Proficient in uniform chart of accounts, depreciation and general accounting practices,
  • Good command of English
  • Strong communication skills, follower and result oriented,
  • Open to development, able to take initiative when necessary and adapt to intense work tempo,
  • No military service for male candidates



Description

  • Controlling monthly pre-closing accounting, stock and production records via Axapta-ERP,
  • Calculating the deviations between the monthly actual and standard costs and reporting them to the relevant units,
  • Making cost and profitability analyzes by subtracting monthly costs and reporting to necessary places.
  • ·Creating reports related to the budget that will support the monthly activity report to be submitted to the senior management,
  • Making new product cost and price studies.
  • Creating reports and analyzes with a questioning approach in order to reduce expenses and increase profitability, and present them to the senior management,
  • Establishing price coordination between production, purchasing and sales, preparing income/expenditure and profitability reports
  • Carrying out stocktaking and control studies, transferring them to the ERP program and organizing them,
  • Calculation and reporting of costs by making recipe entries into the system
  • Trial balance control, control and follow-up of cost centers, control of stock records and movements.
  • Contributing to the development of cost-related planning, follow-up, control and process improvement projects,

Title: Associate Package Consultant Salesforce (Graduate)
Skills: Accounting Standards|Computer Engineering|Computer Science|English|Finance|Greek|Problem Solving|Salesforce.com|Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP)|Teamwork|
Job Description:
About the job

Description

Curated Greece is seeking a friendly and dedicated Travel Operations Specialist to join our enthousiastic team! As our ideal candidate, you will oversee and manage various travel operations including itinerary bookings, and logistics. You'll collaborate with various stakeholders, including the company's travel curators and of course our partners, to ensure the seamless execution of our clients' travel plans. Your deep understanding of the industry and attention to detail will enable you to provide exceptional service that our clients have come to expect from Curated Greece. This is not a customer facing position.


Responsibilities include monitoring daily operations but are not limited to:
  • Communicating with all suppliers, from top hotels to tour and transfer providers all over Greece
  • Ensuring an excellent client experience through backend operational support
  • Placing reservations & updating itineraries with reservation details
  • Monitoring daily operational status of trips and related services, payments, reservations
  • Contacting suppliers for any changes to client itineraries
  • Reconfirming and crosschecking with suppliers about existing bookings
  • Making sure that client trips run smoothly from A to Z
  • Working closely and in coordination with the travel sales team
  • Maintaining company supplier databases
Requirements
  • Bachelor's degree in Hospitality, Tourism, Business Administration, or a related field is a plus.
  • 1-2 years of experience in travel operations, travel management, or similar field will be preferred.
  • Excellent organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize workload in a fast-paced environment.
  • Great attention to detail, high accuracy, strong logic and problem solving skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively, build relationships, and work collaboratively with internal and external partners and suppliers.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook) and general computer literacy.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in both English and Greek (ideally bilingual).
  • Deep understanding of excellent customer service and experience for luxury travel and how this reflects on the operational side of trip.
  • Enthusiastic and passionate about Greece as a destination, the travel industry and unique experiences.
  • Knowledge and previous experience with any travel software and CRM will be appreciated.
  • Self-motivated and autonomous with entrepreneurial spirit but also a team player.
  • Basic understanding of the economics of luxury travel business.
  • Open to learn new skills and completing diverse tasks in additional to the ones mentioned above
Benefits
  • Competitive Salary
  • Laptop
  • Performance Bonus
  • Training & Development
  • Private Health Insurance

Title: Barista
Skills: Barista|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description

By joining us as an Outside Sales Engineer for Final Control Business Unit you will be responsible for all related sales activities in Greece and assigned area. Responsible to achieve the agreed Sales, Bookings, Gross Profit and strategic targets for the agreed product lines and services in the agreed sales territory.

If this sounds like a great opportunity to you, then join our team in Athens!

IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL:
  • Actively promote and sell Emerson Automation Solutions Business and Final Control offerings including products, solutions and services in the geographical area of responsibility.
  • Actively visit customers to promote the assigned product lines, entire product portfolio and services.
  • Identify the market requirements and specifics, develop and execute the strategies and tactics for growth of orders and profitability within customers in the agreed sales territory.
  • Work with other Business Units to sell higher-level solutions, leverage opportunities & win new Emerson customers.
  • Seek new opportunities to sell assigned products and services to new customers and industries.
  • Negotiate with Customer relevant Business Contracts within the agreed Delegation of Authority – including discount, price and volume structures.
  • Drive sales and proposal strategies with the sales support organization.
  • Report on quotation & project opportunity list for the assigned sales area in the associated tools like CRM etc.
  • Oversee, ensure and personally support the execution of committed contractual terms to customers in all business transaction.
  • Prepare an annual booking budget by period and be able to forecast client’s business activity.
  • Continuously drive the improvement of customer satisfaction by understanding, communicating and executing solutions to their needs.
  • Participate in customer development activities as trade shows, fairs, conferences aiming to promote the sale of products, solutions and services of designated area.
  • Maintain and continuously develop high level of products, technologies and industry knowledge required to perform the job.
  • Report regularly to the direct supervisor on market trends, competition strategies and customer behaviors which may affect the Emerson business strategies.
  • Practice and promote the “Think Customer” culture in all aspects of the role.
  • Ensure compliance with Emerson’s Corporate Governance & Compliance Standards.
  • Adhere to local and international Emerson Trade Compliance and Quality Management procedures, as well as the Emerson Ethics policy, with respect to all business activities.
  • Perform other duties as requested by the Manager.

FOR THIS ROLE YOU WILL NEED:
  • Engineering / Technical Degree
  • At least 3 years sales experience in related field
  • Good presentation and customer interface skills with proven capability of deep understanding of sales process and customer relation building
  • Highly developed communication and business negotiations skills
  • Independence, responsibility, creativity and dynamics at work
  • Fluent in English Language
  • Willing to travel in the region and international

WHO YOU ARE:

You are passionate about making an impact and always act with integrity. You continuously push yourself to achieve new goals and are not afraid to question the status quo by proposing creative solutions to problems.

Our Offer to You

By joining Emerson as Outside Sales Engineer, you will be working at the heart of our business. This means that the skills and business insight gained can serve as an invaluable foundation toward developing your career within our global organization. We offer plentiful opportunities for advancement and support this through our formal personal development planning process.

Our on-boarding program uses a blended learning approach to get you up and running as quickly as possible. You benefit from Emerson certified trainers with extensive knowledge of our customers, products and applications.

Our global Women in Stem initiative gives you the opportunity to connect with local peers that share the same interest, to promote the diversity & inclusion and early STEM education and to benefit from professional development to access leadership opportunities. Also, we are committed to maintaining a partnership with the Society of Women Engineers (SWE).

Our inclusive company culture celebrates the unique perspectives, diversity of thoughts, and exceptional innovation that come to life when we actively seek to hire and develop the best, brightest team members from all backgrounds. These unique points of view help foster fresh thinking and new ideas, ensuring our continued success into the future.

About Us

WHY EMERSON

Our Commitment to Our People

Across the globe, we are united by a singular Purpose: We drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable.

We invest in our employees to ensure they have the marketplace knowledge, skills, and competencies to bring this Purpose to life while competing and leading in a global economy.

Our training programs focus on end-to-end development, from onboarding through senior leadership.

Our success is measured by the positive impact we make on people, our communities, and the world through our unwavering focus on environmental, social, and regulatory progress. Learn more about us!

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson .

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .

About Emerson

Emerson is a leading global technology, software and engineering company providing innovative solutions for customers in industrial, commercial, and residential markets.

Our Automation Solutions business helps process, hybrid and discrete manufacturers maximize production, protect personnel and the environment while optimizing their energy and operating costs.

Our Commercial & Residential Solutions business helps ensure human comfort and health, protect food quality and safety, advance energy efficiency and create sustainable infrastructure.

We help customers in the world’s most essential industries solve the biggest challenges of modern life.

Every day, our global workforce fulfills our unified Purpose and lives out the Values we hold close as an organization: Integrity, Safety & Quality, Support Our People, Customer Focus, Continuous Improvement, Collaboration, and Innovation.

Our Causes – Planet, Humanity, Champion, Inclusion and Future – shape, define and fuel Emerson’s culture while inspiring our innovative spirit and driving our focus.

Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or recently received your master’s degree, you’ll find opportunities with us. Join our team and start your journey today!

No calls or agencies please.

Title: Accounting Specialist-Mykonos
Skills: Accounting|Analytical Skills|Communication|Cost Accounting|Depreciation|English|Microsoft Dynamics AX|Microsoft Excel|Microsoft PowerPoint|Standard Costs|
Job Description:
About the job

Riginos Yachts is looking for an ambitious and talented Sales Person who will be responsible for the expansion of our clientele and help us meet our growth objectives. The successful candidate will have to develop and implement Riginos' sales strategy, sales plan and will be responsible for the overall attraction of new sales prospects.


Responsibilities

  • Cultivate and implement strategic sales plan with the aim to accomplish the sales targets and to grow Riginos clientele
  • Identify potential markets and selling possibilities through networking and social media
  • Deliver presentation of sales, revenue and expenses reports to the Managing Directors
  • Constantly negotiate on new and existing sales ventures, closing deals and maintaining beneficial business relationships
  • Develop long-standing relationships with yacht owners and prospective buyers
  • Effectively communicate and negotiate with high net worth individuals
  • Participate in boat shows
  • Continue to provide after-sales support for sales buyers and owners
  • Work independently, while also collaborating with brokers in our firm


Requirements

  • Proven working experience in Sales 2-3 years
  • Verified capability to implement the sales plan from the planning phase to completion phase

Our company develops high traffic, high volume online properties. If you are passionate about taking your career to the next level, then join the MindGeek team and be a part of something big.

 We are looking for a Lead Frontend Developer to spearhead and coordinate the work done by our Romanian team. You will work alongside a few experienced developers to expand and update our portfolio of microfrontends as well as build new features for our premium products.

The candidate will be joining a team of dedicated individuals who share a great team dynamic and are part of a fantastic company culture which promotes flexibility, inclusion & balance..

  • Develop new-user facing features.

  • Coordinate a team of up to 5 FE Developers with mid-senior skillset.

  • Manage goals & priorities for our FE team in partnership with the managers on the project.

Nice To Have

Title: Sales Broker
Skills: Attention to Detail|Business Relationship Management|Employee Benefits|IT Solutions|Negotiation|Organization Skills|Sales|Sales Planning|Sales Processes|Sales Strategy|
Job Description:
About the job

SOFTONE is one of the largest cloud-based business software providers in Greece and SE Europe. The Group consists of six leading brands (SoftOne, UNISOFT, PROSVASIS, Regate, IMPACT and cosmoONE), employs more than 500 professionals and counts more than 75,000 active customers. SoftOne is a pioneer in offering multi-tenant cloud-based ERP since 2008 in the SEE region and has since evolved to a 360o solution provider, addressing end to end digital transformation by offering cutting-edge technological products and platforms. Beyond Greece, where the company is a market leader, SoftOne is expanding aggressively through organic growth and acquisitions in the SEE market, with staffed offices in Bucharest (RO), Sofia (BG) and Limassol (CY).

Your Role

As Business Insights Senior Analyst, you will be reporting to the Head of Strategy. You will be responsible for generating business insights for Softone’s clientle of over 75,000 clients, enabling the organization to maximize the value from its client base.

Your contribution to the success of the team
  • Analyze large data sets and work with BI teams to create dashboards and reports that will provide actionable business insights that will improve the commercial performance of sales teams
  • Collaborate with product and commercial teams to understand product attributes, end-client needs and client segments.
  • Triangulate information/data and provide business insights that will support cross-sell/ up-sell activities across the group.
  • Design and monitor the performance of cross-sell campaigns, while working with commercial teams to maximize conversions.
  • Define potential product bundle opportunities for selected client segments.
  • Deliver ad hoc analysis to support decisioning making for new product or modules.

Your Qualifications & Skills
  • ΜSc with distinction or honors from a Top University, preferably in engineering, mathematics, statistics or other STEM degree
  • Minimum 3 years of prior experience in business analytics, data analytics, finance, or consulting in a high-paced environment
  • Experience in driving insights from large-scale structured and unstructured data
  • Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis.
  • Business acumen and understanding of market dynamics in competitive industries[PM1]
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills with ability to clearly communicate ideas both with internal and external stakeholders in Greek and English
  • Proven experience of MS excel, Statistical analysis and BI tools

Nice to have
  • Experience in Business Software industry
  • Experience in designing campaign for B2B products or services

Your Benefits

We are growing our team with the vision of attracting and developing talented professionals who will contribute to the growth of the company. As a result, we offer:

💰Competitive remuneration package

❤️Private health insurance & pension plans

🏠Hybrid working model & flexible working hours

💯Opportunity to work alongside experienced people who are always eager to mentor

🚍Transportation with company’s bus from central metro stations

🚴‍♀️Bike Sharing company’s program

📖 Funded training & development opportunities

🥪Subsidized onsite high quality catering food services & snacks

🧘🏼‍♀️Psychological and Nutrition Support services

Title: Full stack Lead/Architect
Skills: Agile Software Development|Communication|Employee Benefits|Full-Stack Development|Oral Communication|PostgreSQL|Python (Programming Language)|Relational Databases|SQL|Team Leadership|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


A day in the life of an AWS Cloud Developer


As an AWS Cloud Developer , you will be responsible for designing and developing most optimal cloud-based solutions for our clients and maintaining cloud infrastructures in accordance with best practices and company security policies. You would be working closely with data engineers and solution architects to produce great technical designs and make them into a reality.


Your main duties will be to:


  • Collaborate with technical teams to evaluate and identify optimal AWS cloud solutions
  • Review requirements and develop accurate estimates
  • Resolve ambiguities with customer requirements
  • Modify and / or improve existing systems
  • Educate teams on the implementation of new AWS cloud technologies and initiatives
  • Design, develop and deploy modular or cross cloud-based systems
  • Develop and maintain cloud solutions in accordance with best practices
  • Ensure efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions in accordance with company security policies and best practices in cloud security


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, the leading IT company in Greece, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe.


Qualifications


If you have:


  • University degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other relevant disciplines
  • At least 7 years of experience in ICT sector
  • At least 3 years of experience as an AWS Cloud Developer
  • AWS Certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Developer - Associate)
  • Experience in AWS based Cloud deployment, support, and migration
  • Strong understanding of the AWS Services more specifically with respect to Networking, Compute, storage, Databases and Security (VPC, EC2, S3, RDS, etc.)
  • Familiarity with serverless infrastructures (Lambda, Dynamo, S3, Cognito)
  • Expert level knowledge of Java, Python or Go programming language
  • Expertise in automation tools and techniques related to cloud technologies (CI/CD)
  • Experience with Kubernetes and Docker for containers/deployment
  • Good understanding of Security and user identity and access mgmt
  • Experience in writing reusable Infrastructure as Code, preferably Cloud Formation
  • Formal requirements analysis and architecture modeling methodologies and tools
  • Excellent command of the English language (written & verbal)
  • Strong communication skills, methodical, quality, and results-oriented thinking


…then this position is suitable for you!


This position comes with: 


  • Competitive compensation packages.
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business) and fast career growth.
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects.
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment.
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues.


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Business Insights Senior Analyst

Job Description:
About the job

Raymetrics is a world leader in building state-of-the-art lidar systems for atmospheric applications. We are looking for a Firmware Engineer to join our team and help us build the next generation of control and processing software for our instruments.


You are:
  • Self-motivated, organized, independent – These are key descriptors that you should ascribe to yourself.
  • A problem solver – You love tackling the most difficult of challenges and know how to get to the best solution.
  • A team player – You are keep improving to become the best at what you do, and you know how to work with your colleagues to get their best.
Position description

Your position will involve:

  • Developing firmware (in C and C++) for custom boards, developed in-house, which automate the control of motors, data acquisition and system health control.
  • Testing and debugging the firmware developed on actual hardware.
  • Refactoring and maintaining existing firmware.
  • After-sales troubleshooting of hardware and firmware issues.
Required skills

● 5+ years of working experience in C/C++ in a microcontroller environment (e.g., Atmel Studio, Arduino). OOP is a plus.

● Knowledge of serial interfaces (RS-232, I2C, SPI, OneWire).

● BS/MS in computer science, information technology, electronics, electrical or embedded software engineering.

Good to have

● Experience in development using the Arduino IDE and libraries.

● Experience with AVR microcontrollers,

● Familiarity with motors (stepper, dc) and motor Encoders, sensors (temp, pressure).

● Discipline and organization in software and firmware documentation and presentation.

Benefits

  • A great opportunity to contribute to the evolution of Raymetrics
  • Being part of an environment that gives employees large goals, autonomy and mentoring
  • Competitive full-time salary
  • Top of the Line tools and equipment

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Raymetrics is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard to race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religion.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Skills: Business Analysis|Business Intelligence (BI)|Business Relationship Management|Business Requirements|Commercial Finance|Communication|Factoring|Presentation Skills|Presentations|Systems Analysis|
Job Description:
About the job

Sustainability Manager / Senior Manager in Assurance - Audit & Assurance



What Impact will you make?



YOUR OPPORTUNITY



We are currently seeking for enthusiastic team players to become part of our dynamic Assurance team in our offices in Athens, with a specialty in sustainability. Deloitte expands its Sustainability Assurance team, having great ambitions for the future and wanting you to be a part of surging our sustainability team in our Assurance practice in Greece.


Our Assurance provides a variety of services responding to our clients’ needs, exploiting our experience and expertise. We mainly provide Assurance services in relation to sustainability implementation/strategy/audit projects, complex accounting treatments under IFRS / US GAAP, implementation of new accounting standards & GAAP conversion. In addition, we help our clients in areas relating to sustainability processes and controls, by performing sustainability report diagnostics and providing business process solutions. Our palette of services include also the Disruptive Events Assurance, covering aspects such as IPO readiness, mergers, acquisitions & carve outs as well as Business Assurance.


Successful candidates will demonstrate both their ability to enhance their skills and work efficiently, under the support of more senior team members. We are seeking exceptional candidates who have the commitment to join a world-class client delivery organization that is part of one of the world's premier consulting firms



YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES



Your role as a Sustainability Manager / Senior Manager in our Assurance team will focus on the delivery of client engagements in relation to sustainability projects, by understanding objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning your own work to objectives and setting personal priorities, leading sustainability projects and taking accountability for your own and the team’s results. In this role, you will develop your leadership skills; you will build relationships and exercise your communication skills in order to positively influence your peers and other stakeholders. You will commit to the department’s goals; you will share knowledge and experience with others, and act as a strong brand ambassador, embracing our purpose and values in order to put these into practice in your professional life.


During your tenure as a Sustainability Manager / Senior Manager, you will demonstrate and develop the ability to:


  • Lead team of professionals into delivering projects with high quality and efficiency;
  • Produce a high quality work product and collaborate with your colleagues to deliver a superior client experience;
  • Develop people through effectively delegating tasks and providing guidance;
  • Deliver key messages with clarity, confidence and poise to instill confidence in clients;
  • Apply a global and diverse perspective to problem solving;
  • Address client business challenges in the intersection of process and technology.



OUR REQUIREMENTS



Specifically, candidates should possess the following attributes:


  • More than 6 years of relevant working experience (i.e. sustainability audit and/or participation in sustainability advisory projects) in an audit & consulting firm;
  • Master’ degree from top-tier universities in Environmental Management, Sustainability, Management or related subject will be considered an asset;
  • Very good knowledge of the GRI Standards, the AA1000APS principles, the United Nations’ SDGs;
  • Proficient user of MS Office;
  • Strong oral and written Greek & English language communication skills;
  • Military obligations fulfilled for male candidates.



ABOUT ASSURANCE (ACCOUNTING ADVISORY)



At Deloitte, Assurance is the insight we provide and the trust our work inspires. We leverage the skillsets of accounting professionals to enhance stakeholder confidence in client decisions that drive markets and organizations. In a quickly changing and complex world where new risks emerge all the time, the focus on Assurance actively explores new points of view and fresh ways to generate valuable insights. Deloitte provides assurance on complex accounting matters, transactional events, finance organizations, internal financial controls, and on an ever-expanding range of topics.



ABOUT DELOITTE“



Our services



Deloitte offers integrated services that include Audit and Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax and Legal. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world. We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients, in Greece and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within.



Our purpose



We are led by a purpose, to make an impact that matters with clients, people and society. This purpose defines who we are and what we stand for. It's not about being the biggest. It’s about being the first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.



Our values



At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service through our expertise and professionalism. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.



Our talent experience



From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the center of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.



Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.



All applications will be considered without distinction, in accordance with our values and in line with our inclusive culture.

Deloitte enhances all diversity as a source of innovation and individual and collective wealth. Please, visit our website for more information.

About the job

Created by Monsters. Built for gamers.™

Truly Likeable Monsters (TLM), is a world-class video game company focused on development for some of the biggest games in the industry. Our mission is to break down barriers in the video game industry and make game tech available to all game developers regardless of size.

We are looking for good humans with incredible talent to make great games.

Position Summary: Technical Director (Engine/Systems)
  • 100% Remote position & other cool benefits
  • Working with an international team on AA or AAA games in an Unreal Studio
  • Develop engine systems as well as improve workflows for our development teams on platforms including PC and consoles.

  • Lateral thinking and motivation to work independently and on a team as well as the ability to work directly with teams across multiple territories and time zones.

  • Dedication, teamwork and professionalism.
  • Great interpersonal skills.

Desired Qualifications:
  • Unreal engine experience highly desired
  • 12+ years experience
  • Previous experience in TD type roles
  • Familiarity with current and next console SDKs, Steam, Epic Game Store.
  • Expertise in Artificial Intelligence, Analytics, Mathematics, Physics, Graphics, or Audio a plus
  • Experience working within Microsoft, Sony, EA, Take Two, and utilizing publishers best practice a

Job Description:
About the job

Overview

We’re looking for a Senior HR Business Projects Partner ready to ensure the delivery of HR Projects across the organization, providing partnership, support, and guidance to HR teams and senior leaders on Global and Regional HR projects. This role will operate within the Human Resources unit under the VP of Human Resources and can be based anywhere globally.

Helping people thrive and grow in the modern digital world.

YNV group is a holding company that began as a highly successful tech support start-up. In just a few years, we grew into a multi-brand group of companies serving global enterprise clients and governments. Today, our brands include Tek Experts, elev8, Talentwize, Monifai, Everty, and Sandglass and operate across the tech, real estate, and financial services sectors. 

Responsibilities
  • Delivering HR projects to successful completion.
  • Collaborating on planning project management (including timelines), prioritizing tasks, setting milestones, and deliverables.
  • Overseeing the development of the project and ensuring that team members understand and implement HR projects locally.
  • Drafting new and improving existing project management policies and processes that adhere to the projects.
  • Designing and creating training materials before providing training and session facilitation.
  • Partnering with Marketing in defining the communication plan to cascade globally.
  • Closing out and handing over projects to ensure sustainability over time.
Qualifications
  • Master’s degree in human resources, Business, or similar, or 6 years’ of professional experience.
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification may be advantageous.
  • At least six years of experience within HR providing a full range of services supporting business needs and leading and implementing HR projects as well as stakeholder management and engagement.
  • A minimum of one year's experience in a supervisory position may be advantageous.
  • Team builder with excellent interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communication.
  • Excellent organizational skills along with a strong attention to detail.
  • Critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills.
  • Professional fluency in English is essential, both written and spoken.

Job Description:
About the job

Wealthyhood is the first DIY wealth-building app for long-term investors.


Our mission is to empower people to take control of their financial future by providing an intuitive app that simplifies the investment process. We believe that everyone deserves access to the tools and knowledge 🧠 necessary to grow their wealth, and we're committed to making that a reality.


📣 We've grown to over 20,000 users and are looking for a talented and experienced Senior Growth Marketer to join our team and help us take Wealthyhood to new heights. If you're passionate about making a difference in people's lives and have a knack for driving growth, we would love to hear from you! 🚀



😎 As a Senior Growth Marketer, you will...


  • Develop and execute data-driven growth strategies across the entire customer lifecycle, from acquisition to retention and referral.
  • Conduct A/B tests and experiments to identify high-impact marketing initiatives.
  • Analyse user data to identify trends, derive insights and optimise marketing efforts.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align marketing strategies with product development and overall business objectives.
  • Optimise our marketing channels, including SEO, PPC, social media, email, and content marketing.
  • Develop and implement customer retention and engagement strategies to reduce churn and increase customer lifetime value.
  • Drive virality and referral marketing efforts to leverage word-of-mouth and organic growth.



🔝 You will thrive in this role if you...


  • Have a strong background in growth marketing, ideally in the fintech or investing space.
  • Are data-driven and have experience using analytics tools to inform your marketing decisions.
  • Have a strong understanding of the UK and European investing market and beginner investor needs.
  • Are a creative problem solver with a growth mindset and a passion for experimentation
  • Have excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment



💪🏽 It would be great if you had...


  • Experience with mobile app marketing and user acquisition strategies.
  • Familiarity with marketing automation tools and email marketing platforms.
  • A basic understanding of investing principles and personal finance concepts.



🧧 Our perks


  • Competitive pay and company stock options – we are all in this together!
  • 21 days’ holiday a year, excluding bank holidays (you may end up with 30 days off if lucky 🤞🏼).
  • Snacks, fresh fruit and great coffee.
  • Hybrid work: 1-2 days work-from-home per week and flexible remote working, if you need to travel!
  • Collaborative, inclusive, and supportive company culture!
  • The chance to make a real impact on how your friends and family deal with their finances! 💸



📩 How to apply?


If you're excited about helping people take control of their financial future and believe you have what it takes to drive growth at Wealthyhood, we'd love to get to know you. Apply now and join our mission to democratise investing for everyone!


Drop us an e-mail at hello@wealthyhood.com or apply directly through LinkedIn! 🚀

Title: Technical Director (Engine/Systems)
Skills: C++|Computer Architecture|Console|Game Development|Interpersonal Skills|Lateral Thinking|Optimization|Optimization Software|TLM|Technical Documentation|
Job Description:
About the job

We are Kaizen Gaming

Kaizen Gaming is the leading GameTech company in Greece and one of the fastest-growing in Europe, with the Stoiximan brand in Greece and Cyprus and Betano in Germany, Romania, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Portugal, Brazil, Chile, Peru, Ecuador and Canada. Our aim is to leverage cutting-edge Technology in order to provide the optimum experience to those who trust us for their entertainment.


The Team

You will join an autonomous Agile team and work closely with the Product Owner, Scrum Master, Quality Assurance Engineer, and other Software Engineers to create a competitive advantage for Kaizen and offer a unique online experience to our customers.


The Role

Software engineers in Kaizen are responsible for a multitude of projects, from our customer-facing websites and mobile applications to our admin and internal tools and backend services, most of them withstanding high volume/traffic.


Responsibilities:

  • Create new solutions and see them through, from conception to production;
  • Turn requirements into simple and sophisticated technological systems. Our large scale, highly available infrastructure is at the core of that challenge;
  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code;
  • Research new technologies to find new and efficient ways to solve day to day challenges;
  • Ship high-value features quickly;
  • Challenge the status quo and improve the team and product.


Tech stack

Most of our sites and services are written in C# / ASP.NET and new services are written in .NET Core. New applications use vue.js or Angular in the front-end while older ones use server-rendered (Razor) views in combination with jQuery. Microsoft Orleans enables our scalable and robust distributed applications. MS SQL Server is used for most of our storage needs, but also Redis and ElasticSearch are used when it makes sense to do so. RabbitMQ is our go-to message broker. We use Gitlab for code versioning and CI, and the Atlassian stack for tickets and documentation.


Requirements

We are looking for a Software Engineer who is a team player and eager to take initiative with a can-do attitude.


Must have:

  • At least 4 years of experience developing production-level software using .NET Core;
  • Proficient in C# and MVC;
  • Experience with Testing/Metrics Monitoring/Logging on a large-scale distributed system;
  • Experience with Microservices architecture;
  • Experience with asynchronous flows using message brokers;
  • Good understanding of basic web technologies, such as HTTP, REST, etc.;
  • Practical knowledge of algorithms and design patterns;
  • Passionate about delivering high-quality code;
  • Fluent in English, both oral and written.

Nice to have:

  • Expertise in concurrency, multithreading, and event-driven architecture;


Kaizen Gaming Perks

🕑 We offer both work from the office (hybrid model) & remote working options.

🏃 A buddy will support you with your onboarding.

💸Competitive salary package and bonus scheme.

👩‍⚕️ Health and life insurance for you and your family.

💰 Monthly allowance for lunch & commuting expenses.

💻Nice rigs - 2.5K monitor, latest i7, tons of RAM, fast SSD.

📚 Pluralsight, unlimited access to Udemy & continuous training for all your learning and development needs.

⭐Clear career paths & a developmental 360° feedback framework.

✈️ Relocation package and "Brain Gain" relocation bonus for Greek expats

Title: Senior Growth Marketer
Skills: Content Marketing|Digital Marketing|Email Marketing|FinTech|Marketing|Marketing Analytics|Marketing Automation|Referral Marketing|Search Engine Optimization (SEO)|Social Media|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description


Are you having a first experience in SFDC (Health Cloud), and interested to learn how it enables personalized treatment? Janssen is recruiting a Cell Therapy SFDC IT Analyst, located in Europe.


At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. At Janssen, we collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.


The Cell Therapy SFDC IT Analyst will be responsible for translating the business needs and requirements into design specifications and user stories for the SFDC Health Cloud instance of the regional EMEA Cell Therapy digital platform. The analyst will provide an optimal solution design and will follow-up on the delivery within the squad.


Janssen’s Cell Therapy digital platform is combining multiple off-the-shelf and custom-built solutions to create and operationalize a reliable and streamlined commercial experience for our customers across the patient & cell journey. The platform will be rolled out throughout Europe and needs to support compliance to various requirements and different delivery models.


This position will reside in the Janssen EMEA Business Technology team. This team is responsible for shaping, delivering, and supporting the business applications for the Janssen organization in EMEA.


Key Responsibilities


  • Understand user needs and translate them into detailed requirements for the SFDC Health Cloud solution squad
  • Build use cases, write, manage, and clarify user stories, visualization, and process flows. Drive and improve user experience.
  • Communicate and follow-up the user stories with the developers and testers
  • Support the creation of test scripts and participate in User Acceptance Testing as needed
  • Maintain a deep understanding of the business demand to ensure that the squad’s backlog priorities are aligned with business
  • Manage dependencies with relevant squads
  • Apply compliance requirements within scope of responsibility, ensure SDLC documentation, system configuration and compliance activities are up to date as required
Job Qualifications


Education


Qualifications


  • Master’s or bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 2 years of experience in the world of technology
Experience and Skills:


Required


  • SFDC experience is required. Knowledge of SFDC Health Cloud is an asset.
  • Hands on understanding of design principles (user interface and business process mapping)
  • Strong problem-solving skills with ability to accurately analyze situations and reach productive decisions based on informed judgment
  • Excellent teamwork and collaboration in cross-functional teams
  • End-to-end thinking and curiosity about the big picture
  • Passionate to stay up to date with current trends, best practices and new technologies


Preferred


  • Knowledge of system integration technologies (especially API)
  • Experience in Life sciences or another regulated industry
  • Knowledge of Cell and/or Gene Therapy technologies is a nice-to-have


Other


  • Strong communicator in English (written and spoken)
  • Up to 20% travel


For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) have been part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Our commitment to respect the dignity and diversity of all is embedded in our Credo.


We know that the success of our business depends on having the best talent in a workforce that reflects the diverse markets we serve around the world and an inclusive culture that values different perspectives and life experiences.


That is why we are working to create an inclusive environment where diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences are valued and each and every one of our people feels that they belong and can reach their potential. No matter who they are.


Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Johnson & Johnson means “You Belong”!


Primary Location


Europe/Middle East/Africa-Spain-Community of Madrid-Madrid


Other Locations


Europe/Middle East/Africa-Czech Republic, Europe/Middle East/Africa-Greece-Attica-Athens, Europe/Middle East/Africa-Hungary-Budapest-Budapest, Europe/Middle East/Africa-Poland-Mazowieckie-Warsaw, Europe/Middle East/Africa-France, Europe/Middle East/Africa-Romania-Bucuresti-Bucharest, Europe/Middle East/Africa-Slovakia, Europe/Middle East/Africa-Portugal-Lisbon-Lisbon, Europe/Middle East/Africa-Italy-Lombardia-Cologno Monzese


Organization


Janssen Pharmaceutica N.V. (7555)


Job Function


Info Technology

Title: Senior Backend Engineer
Skills: .NET Core|C#|Concurrent Programming|Design Patterns|Distributed Systems|English|JavaScript|Microservices|Multithreading|Representational State Transfer (REST)|
Job Description:
About the job

The National Geographic Day Tours Operations Specialist will be responsible for coordination and quality supervision of National Geographic Day Tours (NGDT), ensuring a consistent delivery of a high-quality standard of service, including but not limited to, operational training, best practice documentation, operational guidelines and manuals to deliver National Geographic Day Tours


This role will be the link between National Geographic and TUI MM teams Destinations delivery, Operations Hubs, L&D and Billing in order to successfully implement Day Tours and setting the base for implementation in future destinations.


This is a locally employed position and is offered as a Seasonal Contract. You must have the right to live and work in Greece before applying. If you live in Europe and would like to work abroad – please search for our 'flexible' jobs.


About The Job


  • Act as a single point of contact with Nat Geo team, compile reports on the feedback received from cruise lines on the NGDT and share these with Nat Geo. In the same time will need to act on the comments received by Nat Geo directly and provide a resolution as response.
  • Act as a single point of contact between the project leads and the Ops and delivery team for the duration of the project roll out and implementation
  • Coordinate with the destinations the guides allocation to the NGDT, the training (onboarding and progress) and the set up in our systems as well as monitor the guides performance
  • Work with Learning & Development in perfecting the guides training based on the guides feedback and ensure that all Ops and Delivery colleagues working with the NGDT are fully trained


About You


  • 2-3 years’ experience in ground operations with several clients and multiple destinations
  • High knowledge of the cruise industry and Shorex processes
  • Very good communication skills, able to develop and maintain excellent relationships with clients and colleagues
  • Good analytic capabilities
  • Takes initiative and is able to find solutions and come up with improvement plans for operational issues
  • Travel availability
  • English proficiency


About Our Offer


  • Competitive salary and benefits as standard
  • Career progression opportunities in more than 50 countries worldwide
  • Develop yourself as part of a friendly, richly diverse and virtual international team
  • Exceptional approach to your learning - access to free learning platforms & language lessons


TUI Musement is a leading Tours & Activities business. It combines a scalable digital platform with local service delivery, to offer excursions, activities, tickets and transfers in more than 50 countries worldwide. There are over 130,000 ‘things to do’ in all major holiday and city destinations, which are distributed through B2B partners, via the Musement and TUI websites and direct to TUI customers. We also offer services to cruise lines through Intercruises Shoreside & Port Services in ports worldwide.


TUI Musement sold around 10 million excursions, tours and activities delivered by our international colleagues located around the world and is one of the major growth areas of TUI Group.


We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.


#TUIJobs #TUIMusement #LetsTUIIt

Title: Cell Therapy SFDC IT Analyst
Skills: Acceptance Testing|Business Process Mapping|Cell Therapy|Design Specifications|Enterprise Solution Design|Process Mapping|Salesforce.com|System Configuration|Technical Solution Design|User Stories|
Job Description:
About the job

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


In a world of unprecedented complexity and opportunity, organizations are looking to make new connections and find new ways of innovating. EY Consulting is continually seeking better ways of working as we collaborate with clients to help them solve their complex industry issues and capitalize on opportunities to grow, optimize and protect their businesses.


The opportunity


As a Consultant within the Risk Assurance team you will provide clients with reliable overview of their risk landscape and the controls in place. You will work with clients to help create trust and confidence in their financial reporting and internal control over financial reporting. Furthermore, you will provide assurance related to internal controls, and offer industry/sector insight and thought leadership with a focus on risk and control matters. Other areas of services include consulting work in cybersecurity, IT strategy, architecture and optimization, business continuity planning, IT Governance and IT service management, information systems requirements analysis, solution design, implementation support, and technology-related regulatory compliance.


Your Key Responsibilities


  • Supporting or leading the execution of audits/ assessments of IT processes against leading practices, frameworks and common standards (e.g. CoBIT, ITIL, ISO 27001/02).
  • Participation in IT Assurance/Audits - including the execution of evaluation and design of IT controls (e.g. application & general controls) in support of an external audit.
  • Assist in the preparation of reports for clients and key stakeholders.
  • Contribute to developing and maintaining productive working relationships with client personnel.
  • Working effectively as a team member – providing support, maintaining communication and updating senior team members and management on progress.
  • Ensure client deliverables are on time and up to the expected standards.


Skills And Attributes For Success


  • You will produce complete and accurate work by demonstrating strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills.
  • Good organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize and complete multiple complex projects under tight deadlines.
  • An ability to interact with teams at all hierarchical levels.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively within a team.
  • Ability to develop presentations that are clear and impactful, translating EY consulting services into meaningful valued propositions for clients.
  • Strong attention to detail with a logical and methodical approach.
  • Evidence of self-motivation to continuously expand technical and business skills in the area IT audit, information security and information technology in general.
  • Excellent business acumen and commercial awareness.
  • A logical and structured approach to challenges, projects and documentation.


To qualify for the role you must have


  • University degree in information technology, business, accounting, engineering or other related field with strong quantitative focus.
  • Graduate or with up to three years of experience in information systems audit/security and/or data analytics related area for IT Auditors.
  • At least three years of experience for Senior IT Auditors.
  • Willingness to learn and continuously expand technical and business skills in the area IT audit, information security and information technology in general.
  • Excellent business writing and verbal communication skills both in Greek and English.
  • Advanced Ms Office skills specially in Excel and PowerPoint
  • Strong analytical skills and conceptual attitude.
  • Willingness and ability to travel internationally to meet client needs.
  • A passion to provide high quality service to our clients.


Ideally, you’ll also have


  • Knowledge of IT architecture and network design, operating systems, database management systems, statistics, modelling and data analytics tools.
  • Software development skills.
  • Professional qualifications such as CISA, CISSP, ISO 27000, ISO 20000, ITIL or other related to IT audit/security.
  • Understanding of business processes (e.g. Finance/Accounting, Procurement, Sales, etc.).
  • Knowledge of basic principles of Accounting and Financial Reporting.
  • Knowledge of business and accounting information systems (Accounting, Billing, Payroll, ERP systems such as SAP, Oracle, etc.).


What We Look For


What’s most important is that you’re dedicated to working with your colleagues as part of a high-performing team. You’ll need to demonstrate enthusiasm, high motivation and passion to develop fast in a multinational working environment. You’ll need to thrive in picking up new skills and talents as you go, so natural curiosity, a lot of questions and the confidence to speak up when you see something that could be improved are essential. If you’ve got the right combination of technical knowledge and communication skills, this role is for you.


 


 


What We Offer


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:


  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.


EY | Building a better working world


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.


Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.


Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.


#betterworkingworld
