Title: Business Operations Support Administrator (Fixed Term Contract)
Skills: Administration|Administrative Assistance|Analytical Skills|Communication|English|General Administration|Greek|Office Administration|Presentations|Problem Solving|
Job Description:
About the job

Peninsula is the leading provider of marine energy services and solutions globally. For the last 25 years, we have positioned ourselves as the benchmark for quality in our industry. We offer local knowledge on a global scale.


WHAT YOU’LL DO:

The credit administrator will support and assist the Customer & Supply Credit teams with their daily tasks in terms of data manipulation, data entry, analysis, KYC, Sanction, and risk assessment.


The Customer Credit Risk is a core function within Peninsula. The team provides credit lines to a wide variety of local, regional, and global shipping & commodity customers. Peninsula’s approach to credit analysis combines sound counterparty risk assessment with analysis of global commodity and shipping markets to manage a portfolio of counterparties operating across a range of sectors and countries.


The supply credit team is an established function within the Peninsula Group. Some of the responsibilities of this function are to analyze the supplier base of the company and provide valuable and tangible advice on how to optimize our credit utilization. Daily interaction with internal and external stakeholders. Meanwhile, the department contributes to the forecast of payments for our worldwide supplier portfolio and assists in building the group’s cash-flow. Moreover, the department is tasked with bespoke analysis queries, contributing to the company’s in multifaceted strategy plan.



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Monitor daily credit requests and help maintain the company’s credit exposure within the framework of the company’s risk appetite.
  • Monitor company’s overdue ledger and follow-up with traders to ensure overdue payments are settled promptly.
  • Ensure credit procedures and trades are compliant with company’s sanctions policy.
  • Assist with and follow through the process of negotiating and executing credit-related documentation.
  • Continue towards improving the process and procedures of the department to optimise output and maximise efficiency.
  • Proactively engage with Front, Middle and Back offices functions and other key stakeholders to resolve credit related issues.
  • Perform ad hoc research and analysis work where required.
  • Analyse large data sets to contribute in tangible credit allocations and strategies.
  • Ongoing liaison with traders and managers to promote and encourage credit awareness in dealing with suppliers; monitor and enforce the company’s KYC policies.
  • Support Supply Credit Analyst and/or Supply Credit Manager on any other adhoc duties as required.



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Highly proficient in MS Office suite, specifically with Excel.
  • Ability to communicate at business level in a second language is an advantage.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to demonstrate confidence in presenting analysis clearly and concisely.
  • Ability to concurrently prioritize and manage multiple assignments with tight deadlines.
  • Display a flexible and adaptable attitude to respond quickly to changing priorities.
  • Self-starter and passionate about process improvement.
  • Ability to work efficiently both independently and in a team.
  • An open mind and a commitment to understanding other people’s points of view in a multi-cultural work environment.


QUALIFICATIONS / ACCREDITATIONS

  • Finance, Economics, or of a quantitative nature diploma/qualification.

Title: IT Auditor/Senior IT Auditor
Skills: Business Writing|CISA|Commercial Awareness|Critical Thinking|Data Analytics|Financial Reporting|IT Audit|IT Auditors|Report Preparation|Thinking Skills|
Job Description:
About the job

General Role


The Store Manager of Athens’ store is in charge of all the aspects of the boutique, in line with the commercial strategy approved by the management of Hermès, including supervising the staff members in all of their activities (coaching, training and assisting them in achieving sales objectives); demonstrating an active management presence on the sales floor, modelling exception al service and ensuring all team members embody the Hermès spirit.


Main Responsibilities


Sales development


  • achieving sales objectives, setting an example to the team by acting as the first ambassador to customers;
  • checking the presentation and appearance of the store in line with the brand’s representation criteria;
  • offering an excellent after-sales service;
  • surveying the competitor’s projects or events.


People Management and development


  • coordinating and motivating the team to provide a consistent level of service to customers, and ensure consistent relations with certain customers (VIPs, regular customers, etc.);
  • participating in the recruiting process, integrating and training sales staff in terms of product, customer service and the art of selling Hermès products;
  • organizing tasks for each team member, fixing objectives, assessing the results of the sales team and involving them in a continuous process of performance improvement and career development;
  • ensuring the respect of law and company policies, even in the area of health and safety of the store and team.


Purchases:


  • with the support of Retail Merchandising Office, preparing and making purchases at the bi-annual presentation of collections.


Operations:


  • drawing up and monitoring the budget in cooperation with the Retail Director;
  • achievement of objectives fixed within the framework of the operating account;
  • ensuring the control of all the activities in terms of Stock Management, Merchandising, After Sales Service, Sales administration and Internal control, in line with the internal rules and procedures.


Communications and public relations:


  • representing the Hermès name to existing and potential customers;
  • acting as the Hermès Ambassador to the customers and every other person that can interact with Hermès;
  • compiling an accurate customer database and updating it permanently;
  • proposing store promotional activities and customer service practices.


Profile


The ideal candidate must have:


  • tertiary educated and experienced Manager with a proven number of years of management experience and a strong sense of customer service;
  • used to performing a Brand Ambassador style role as well as demonstrating the skills and experience of a leading retail manager in a luxury environment;
  • good communication and networking skills, able to build good professional working relationships demonstrating the ability to work across cultures;
  • proactive, results-driven individual, demonstrating initiative and commercial creativity;
  • well organized with an ability to think multi dimensionally;
  • strong business sense with solid analytical skills;
  • hands on computer knowledge of MS office and excellent digital skills;
  • excellent spoken and written Greek and English. French is a plus;
  • an appreciation of the style and elegance of the house reflecting this in personal presentation.

Title: Production Shift Supervisor
Skills: Communication|English|Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)|Infor Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)|Problem Solving|Production Management|SAP Products|Statutory Accounting Principles (SAP)|Supervisory Skills|Team Management|
Job Description:
About the job

About Nooklyn

Nooklyn is a real estate brokerage in Brooklyn, NYC. We make finding and sharing apartments easy through our core values; good design, transparency, diversity, collaboration, sustainability & trust.


About the Role

If you enjoy and you are good at working on:

  • Accounts Payable & Accounts Receivable
  • Recording day-to-day financial transactions
  • Processing checks received for bank depositing
  • Working closely with the onsite accountant
  • Working with the management team to provide support in administrative tasks
  • Planning and delivering special projects as they arise
  • G/L review and reporting responsibility
  • 1099 payment experience


Requirements

On the technical part, all you need to have are:

  • Fluency in English
  • Proven bookkeeping experience
  • Experience with Brokerage and/or Real Estate Company
  • Solid understanding of basic bookkeeping and payable/receivable principles
  • Proficient with MS Office Suite and QuickBooks Online

Title: Graduate Credit Administrator
Skills: Analytical Skills|Communication|Credit Analysis|Economics|Finance|Forecasting|Maritime Industry|Microsoft Excel|Oil and Gas|Problem Solving|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


A day in the life of a Technical Project Manager


As a Technical Project Manager, you will be part of a vibrant and highly skilled agile team that designs, develop, deploy, customize, and support our IT projects while you will have the opportunity to be exposed to a wide variety of services and technologies.


Your main duties will be to:


  • Perform project management for multiple projects, including, planning, the definition of tasks and deliverables, review of project deliverables, quality control, risk analysis & management, status reports, problem reporting & management, follow up
  • Draft project management deliverables such as the Business Case, Project Strategy or Vision documents
  • Develop a detailed project plan and track activities against plan providing regular, accurate, and timely reports
  • Participate in functional and technical working groups and progress meetings
  • Ensure delivery of projects on time, within the scope, and within budget; manage successfully any changes that may arise. Manage and minimize the potential risks of the projects
  • Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation
  • Coordinate effectively the project team (including external stakeholders) ensuring that team members are motivated
  • Act as liaison with the customer and sub-contractors


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, the leading IT company in Greece, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe. 


Qualifications


If you have:


  • Degree in Management or Finance or Information Technology or other relevant disciplines
  • Experience in Insurance services
  • Problem-solving mindset and adaptability
  • Customer, Quality and Results-oriented approach
  • Good communication skills and Teamworking spirit
  • Excellent command of the English language (written & oral)


…then this position is suitable for you!


It would also be a plus if you had:


  • Commercial awareness
  • A PMI Certification


This position comes with


  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business) and fast career growth
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values:


Be the link of a great team that forms a unique network across departments, countries and business units and operates with trust, open communication, transparency and respect.


We make it happen with our expertise, accountability and solution-driven attitude. We always strive for improvement, always with an eye on the big picture.


We learn & evolve by embracing a culture of building on our experiences, sharing our knowledge and developing our skills. We are always open to new ideas and invite all our colleagues to contribute with theirs.


We fuel creativity in every aspect of our everyday life at Netcompany - Intrasoft; in the solutions and products we design and the initiatives we undertake.


We share customer success by understanding their unique needs, corresponding to their vision, and exceeding their expectations.


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!

All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Store Manager - Athens Boutique
Skills: Analytical Skills|Business Networking|Communication|Computer Literacy|Cooperation|Customer Service|Organization Skills|Presentations|Store Management|Supervisory Skills|
Job Description:
About the job

About Us:

OPAP is the top gaming company in Greece and among the most recognized ones in its sector worldwide. Our aim is to establish OPAP as a world-class entertainment and gaming company, having long-term strategic priorities focus on the customers, on the people, on the network, on the products and on the digital-technological capabilities. We are currently a highly esteemed employer, offering career opportunities and a unique work experience to exceptional professionals and talented young people, through our dynamic Selection & Recruitment Program as well as our Internship/Graduate Programs. Our main objective is to develop a high-performing Team by attracting new talents, as well as developing and creating stronger bonds between our people.



So what’s the challenge…


The Real Estate Retail Development Specialist’s role is to assess market and network data through statistics and data analytics aiming to identify opportunities for growth and to propose development and optimization actions for OPAP network, that will enable the effective placement of OPAP products and services and enhance physical footprint and performance.



Your day to day will include:


  • Assisting in the design and update of the network development strategy (OS, PS, Tora, HL) after alignment with key stakeholders.
  • Analyzing and assessing geospatial data and market trends to support network analysis and physical footprint optimization using GIS tools.
  • Applying statistical models and conducting thorough analysis to propose the most profitable network changes (relocations, renovations, new stores etc.), considering demographic, financial, customer and performance data to support decision making.
  • Measuring the upside of network changes and fine tuning the methodology used accordingly.
  • Challenging current status in certain geographical areas and finding ways to increase product presence or placement to achieve optimum delivery of network plan on stores & hardware.
  • Interacting with sales team to get additional information regarding network characteristics and validate proposed network changes.
  • Creating P&Ls, defining micro market potential and evaluating business cases of network changes to assess investment viability and regularly update the web-based mapping tool.
  • Supporting sales teams and agents in bringing the necessary documents for legalization and speeding up processes.
  • Providing thorough view to sales team regarding area management, supporting them in area potentiality.
  • Monitoring the implementation of Network Planning KPIs and developing reports identifying issues/ areas for improvement and proposes corrective actions.
  • Following up the changes in the legislation and informing accordingly for any impact that may have on the operation, expansion, and upgrade of the retail network (OPAP & PLAY).
  • Scouting and evaluating available properties in targeted areas through coordination with real estate agents & local field visits, to support the implementation of network development strategy in alignment with sales team & interested agents.




What you need to succeed:


  • BSc in Statistics, Information technology, Business Administration, Engineering, Mathematics, or Finance
  • 4+ years of hands-on experience in data analytics, real estate, and retail footprint planning
  • Exposure in geodata analysis tools
  • Solid data analytics and reporting skills
  • Problem solving mentality with analytical and conceptual thinking
  • Very good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to prioritize effectively and multi-task
  • Team work and cooperation
  • Experience in Salesforce platform & ArcGis is desired
  • Solid MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Proficient command of the English language (written & oral)



What we offer to our candidates:

  • Opportunity to work with #dynamic people full of #passion #integrity & #fun
  • Modern & award winning workplace environment
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Competencies’ & Career Development opportunities
  • Private health coverage

OPAP Group is an equal opportunity employer



Does this sound like you? If yes, we would love to meet you!

Title: Jr. Accountant
Skills: Attention to Detail|Confidentiality|Data Entry|Diversity|Employee Benefits|Microsoft Office|Organization Skills|Problem Solving|QuickBooks Online|Real Estate Brokerages|
Job Description:
About the job

Are you interested in working with a leading education technology player, the global leader in the assessment and certification of professional skills industry with presence in more than 200 countries worldwide? If so, this is the chance to apply now! 📥

PeopleCert is looking for a highly motivated Quality Assistant to join the IP Infringements Management Team. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying potential infringements and breaches of intellectual property rights by examining web pages and content. Your work will be crucial in safeguarding our company's valuable intellectual property and ensuring compliance with relevant accreditation schemes.


As a Quality Assistant your tasks will include the following:

  • Visit global web pages of training organisations / content providers to identify possible inconsistencies such as unauthorized training and/or certification using product TMs, potential exam collateral breaches, and unlicensed content.
  • Examine accredited organisations' content for possible inconsistencies with applied accreditation scheme.
  • Collate data, report, monitor, track intellectual property issues and maintain accurate records.
  • Work with other teams to achieve the role's objectives.
  • Process, monitor and effectively follow case progress until fully closed out and update associated tracking systems.
  • Launch investigations in relation to any possible inconsistencies found and ensure that they are carried out in accordance with the Quality department's standard policies and procedures.
  • Contribute to the development of intellectual property protection policies and procedures.


What we look for:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or similar field
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, fluency in English is required (C2 level certification desired, LanguageCert C2 LTE or C2 IESOL certificate would be also a plus), knowledge of other languages will be considered an asset.
  • Advanced computer literacy is required. ECDL Advanced level certification is desirable
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and commercial understanding
  • Ability to follow process and procedures with accuracy, achieve targets and deadlines and work as part of a team.


What we offer:

  • Work in an international, dynamic and fun atmosphere
  • Two free vouchers for all certifications from PeopleCert's Portfolio per year for all employees
  • Complimentary coffee and tea in all our premises
  • Huge learning experience in using best practices and global environment
  • Constant personal and professional development
  • 100% Virtual Hiring Process


If you want to become a member of our international, dynamic and agile team that creates world leading software products, then we should certainly like to hear from you!


About PeopleCert

PeopleCert is a global leader in assessment and certification of professional skills, partnering with multi-national organizations and government bodies for the development & delivery of standardized exams. Delivering exams across 200 countries and in 25 languages over its state-of-the-art assessment technology, PeopleCert enables professionals to boost their careers and realize their life ambitions.


Quality, Innovation, Passion, Integrity are the core values which guide everything we do.


Our offices in UK, Greece, and Cyprus boast a culture of diversity, where everyone is different, yet everyone fits in. All of us at PeopleCert are committed to the reflection of the diversity and inclusion of our customers and the communities in which we do business.


Working on Home Office (HO) Secure English Language Tests (SELTs)

Any person who is engaged by PeopleCert to work on the SELT service must undergo a Background Check (the results of which must be acceptable to PeopleCert and the HO) prior to commencing their SELT duties. All SELT personnel will be required to complete a declaration (provided by PeopleCert) where the existence of any criminal record and/or bankruptcy must be declared.

If working on the SELT service in the UK, background checks will include:

  • A basic or enhanced Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) check
  • Right to Work in the UK check (including nationality, identity and place of residence)
  • HO security check (Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) or Counter Terrorist Check (CTC)
  • Financial background check
  • Employment reference check
  • If working on the SELT service anywhere in the world (outside of the UK) personnel will undergo background checks that are equivalent to those stated for the UK

In addition, if personnel are required to speak to SELT candidates they must be appropriately skilled in English language and, where SELT services are provided anywhere in the world (outside of the UK), the official language of the relevant country.


All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality. #Li-Hybrid

Title: Technical Project Manager
Skills: Business Case Preparation|Commercial Awareness|Communication|Delivery Of Projects|Easily Adaptable|English|Problem Solving|Project Documentation|Project Plans|Project Teams|
Job Description:
About the job

About Us:


OPAP is the top gaming company in Greece and among the most recognized ones in its sector worldwide. We aim at establishing OPAP as a world-class entertainment and gaming company, having long-term strategic priorities focus on the customers, on the people, on the network, on the products and on the digital-technological capabilities. We are currently a highly esteemed employer, offering career opportunities and a unique work experience to exceptional professionals and talented young people, through our dynamic Selection & Recruitment Program as well as our Internship/Graduate Programs. Our main objective is to develop a high-performing Team by attracting new talents, as well as developing and creating stronger bonds between our people.



So what’s the challenge…


The Senior QA Automation Engineer is a member of an agile software development team responsible for establishing and applying testing methodologies geared mainly towards automated testing, while ensuring high quality of software deliverables that meet specifications and requirements for a great range of software products.


Your day to day will include:


• Reviewing and analyzing system specifications and application functionalities to understand what needs to be tested

• Producing or evaluates test plans, test scenarios and TCERs in order to conduct thorough test cycles either from internal team or third-party service providers

• Designing, enhancing, executing and reviewing testing frameworks, methodologies and scenarios as well as maintains existing test scripts according to project structure

• Organizing and executing test cycles for software acceptance in coordination with IT and business users, to verify that features and functionality meet business objectives

• Selecting the correct tools per case (Web Testing, UI Testing, Mobile Testing, Performance Testing)

• Designing and implementing automation testing frameworks according to project structure

• Identifying and selects test cases for automation testing suite from existing test cases documentation

• Creating, enhancing, debugging and executing automated test cases

• Maintaining existing tests scripts/regression suites

• Assisting the coordination of 3rd party testing teams and provides clarification and guidelines to enable high quality deliverables

• Reviewing change requests to ensure compliance with the QA and Release Management procedures and conduct regression testing to inspect any effect on the existing functionality

• Conducting performance system testing to verify system scalability, reliability and efficiency

• Validating the compliance of software testing results with the technical requirements and specifications prior their release to production

• Analyzing the test results, highlights performance issues and coordinates with the development team to provide corrective actions

• Arranging and preparing the Test Environments

• Recording thoroughly the progress of test cycles, test results and software defects, communicates them to the respective stakeholders and makes recommendations on further improvements to increase the efficiency of testing operations

• Performing regression testing for delivered fixes / applications, as well as end-to-end regression cycles

• Supporting the deployment of new applications/systems by conducting smoke tests during the roll-out process and providing post launch support and incident management assistance

• Setting up and retaining the appropriate documentation standards and specifications according to company’s quality processes

• Responding to ad-hoc assignments to meet business needs that are not specifically or previously described and are related to the content of current job and the personal skills and capabilities

• Suggesting new tools and techniques to improve test efficiency



What you need to succeed:


• BSc in Computer Science or Information Technology or equivalent

• 6+ years’ experience on Software Quality Assurance in a corporate environment

• In-depth knowledge and understanding of Quality Assurance concepts, methodology and industry-standard testing tools

• Industry certifications such as (ISTQB Certified Tester, Certified Test Automation Engineer, ISTQB Agile kTester, etc.) will be a plus

• Experience with JIRA/Bitbucket/Confluence/Bamboo or GitLab

• Hands-on experience in development and/or automation testing

• Experience in automation or load testing tools (e.g. Selenium, Cypress, Mocha, Postman, Newman, JMeter, Gatling, etc.)

• Experience with CI/CD pipelines

• Good knowledge of coding and experience in JavaScript and/or Java

• Working experience with Agile methodology

• High level of accuracy and good attention to detail

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills combined with an out of the box thinking

• Effective organizational, prioritization and planning skills

• Ability to deliver results within strict timeframes

• Excellent written and oral communication skills both in Greek and English

• Team spirit and ability to cooperate at all levels effectively


What we offer to our candidates:


  • Opportunity to work with #dynamic people full of #passion #integrity & #fun
  • Modern & award winning workplace environment
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Competencies’ & Career Development opportunities
  • Private health coverage



OPAP Group is an equal opportunity employer



Does this sound like you? If yes, we would love to meet you!

Title: Real Estate Retail Development Specialist
Skills: Analytical Skills|Communication|English|Mathematics|Microsoft Excel|Microsoft PowerPoint|Microsoft Word|Problem Solving|Python (Programming Language)|Teamwork|
Job Description:
About the job

About Us

Stromasys (a PartnerOne company) is the original and leading provider of enterprise-class cross-platform virtualization solutions for PDP-11, Digital VAX and Alpha, PA-RISC, and SPARC systems. The company extends the life cycle of business and mission-critical applications through virtualization, modernization, and system enhancement allowing owners of legacy computer systems to continue to run their mission-critical applications unchanged on new industry standard computer systems. Founded in 1998 with engineering, development and research labs located around the world, Stromasys has implemented cross-platform virtualization solutions to the world’s leading companies in over 70 countries.


Stromasys is looking for an experienced and passionate senior systems software engineer to join our team that will develop new cross-platform virtualization software and maintain our existing products. The engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-performance emulator software written in C/C++ that emulates legacy hardware platforms on modern x86-64 systems.


The ideal candidate:

  • is passionate about low-level system software and emulation and considers this kind of work as art;
  • can demonstrate a portfolio of previous emulation, virtualization, or custom compiler development work;
  • is a strong self-starter, able to identify requirements and build solutions independently with minimal input or supervision;
  • possesses strong analytical as well as technical skills;
  • can inspire and lead/guide less experienced team members.


Key Responsibilities

  • Design and develop cutting-edge emulator products that accurately reflect the capabilities of legacy systems with as much performance as possible.
  • Architect modular, scalable flexible and maintainable software that can accommodate reasonable demands from customers, field engineers, and sales engineers.
  • Implement new features for the developed systems after we launch their initial version.
  • Develop and maintain automated testing and deployment processes for the emulator products to ensure that each release meets high-quality standards.
  • Contribute to the documentation efforts of the code, internal architecture documentation, and customer-facing documentation.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers.


Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, Electrical or Computer Engineering, or relevant degree OR equivalent experience.
  • Excellent knowledge and extensive experience with object-oriented design and programming using C and C++ on Linux;
  • Good knowledge of CPU operation, computer architecture & operating systems theory;
  • Good knowledge of Unix-like kernel internals;
  • Knowledge of assembly language, either x86-64 assembly or any RISC assembly;
  • Knowledge of TCP/IP and related network protocols;
  • Experience with Git source code management;
  • Experience working on Linux/Unix;
  • Experience reading and writing Bash shell scripts;
  • Experience with documenting requirements, specifications & APIs of software components using documentation tools like Sphinx;


We Offer

  • Competitive salary based on demonstrated skills;
  • Health insurance;
  • Flexible working hours and location;
  • Multicultural and friendly working environment;
  • The opportunity to be a key member of our newest products team.

Title: Senior Systems Software Engineer
Skills: Bash|C++|Compilers|Computer Architecture|Computer Engineering|Git|Linux|Object Oriented Design|Unix|Virtualization|
Job Description:
About the job

MYTILINEOS is a leading global industrial and energy company with a strong presence in all five continents covering two business Sectors, the Energy Sector and the Metallurgy Sector, is currently seeking to hire a Project Planner based in Athens for the M Renewables.

The project planner sets out the map and makes sure the team keeps on the right path. Mapping out equipment delivery plans, site construction durations, resources, and risks, a project planner tries to guess everything that might derail a project and draws up a strategy to stop it from happening.

Main Responsibilities:

As a Project Planner at Mytilineos Renewables, your responsibilities will include:
  • Create, maintain &Monitoring, review and administer construction schedules and plans to ensure that deadlines are met
  • Liaising with managers and engineers to discuss the progress of the project and address any issues that arise
  • Producing progress reports and forecasts for team members, clients, and stakeholders as directed by the Project Manager and Director
  • Work very closely with Project Director or Project Manager to plan, schedule, and program major projects with your desired Planning Program.
  • Estimate, plan, and organize resources
  • Create a risk management plan
  • Demonstrated engineering/construction experience delivering technically challenging construction works
  • Identifying shortcomings and advising on action plans for cost-reduction efforts
  • Baseline project programs ensure the critical path works are on schedule

Requirements

As a Project Planner at Mytilineos Renewables you need to have the following skills:
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in Solar Power Plant construction is obligatory
  • University or Technical Degree in Electrical/Mechanical/Civil Engineering
  • Excellent IT skills and relevant knowledge of Planning software including MS Project (at least Level 3) and Primavera P6
  • Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills
  • Advanced use of Mircosoft office and SharePoint experience
  • Excellent use of English and Italian Language
  • Time management
  • Problem-solving
  • Organizational skills
  • Critical thinking

Benefits

For this Project Planner position at Mytilineos Renewables, you will be offered:
  • Attractive remuneration package
  • Medical Plan
  • Friendly and professional working environment
  • Career development
  • Continuous training
  • International Exposure

Title: Technical Support & Implementation Engineer
Skills: Computer Network Operations|Linux|Network Operations Center (NOC)|Operating Systems|Operations|Service-Level Agreements (SLA)|Technical Support|
Job Description:
About the job

Job purpose

Γίνε μέλος των ομάδων εξυπηρέτησης καταστημάτων της ΑΒ Βασιλόπουλος και ενδυνάμωσε την κουλτούρα Φροντίδας που δείχνουμε καθημερινά, ώστε να προσφέρουμε φαγητό που είναι καλό για όλους, τους πελάτες μας, τους παραγωγούς, τους συνεργάτες μας, την υγεία μας και το περιβάλλον.


What you will focus on

  • Εξυπηρέτηση και ανάπτυξη μακροχρόνιας σχέσης με πελάτες
  • Εμπορευματική διαχείριση καταστήματος (παραγγελίες, παραλαβή εμπορευμάτων,
  • οργάνωση & τακτοποίηση βάση πλανογράμματος, προβολές προϊόντων)
  • Διαχείριση ταμειακών συναλλαγών
  • Εφαρμογή & έλεγχος διαδικασιών ποιότητας τροφίμων


What you have

  • Εποικοδομητική Συνεργασία | συνεισφορά στο κοινό σκοπό
  • Αποτελεσματική Επικοινωνία | ενεργητική ακοή και σεβασμός του άλλου
  • Προσανατολισμός στον Πελάτη | καθημερινή επένδυση στην εμπειρία εξυπηρέτησης
  • Προσανατολισμός στην Οργάνωση και Ποιότητα | έγκαιρο, ολοκληρωμένο και ποιοτικό αποτέλεσμα


A place where everyone belongs

Στην ΑΒ Βασιλόπουλος , προσπαθούμε να είμαστε το καλύτερο μέρος για να εργαζόμαστε, όπου οι άνθρωποί μας αντικατοπτρίζουν τις αγορές που εξυπηρετούμε, οι φωνές τους ακούγονται και αξιοποιούνται, βρίσκουν σκοπό στην εργασία που προσφέρουν και μπορούν να αναπτυχθούν/ εκπαιδευτούν και να συμβάλουν στο έπακρο. Title: Senior Accountant
Company: Altair Travel Agency S.A. - Tripair GmbH
Skills: Accounting|Accounting Standards|Analytical Skills|Budgeting & Forecasting|Certified Public Accounting|Finance|Financial Statements|Forecasting|Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)|Month-End Close Process|
Job Description:
About the job

Antipollution, member of Vasileiadis Group of Companies, is growing rapidly, and we are seeking for an experienced Fleet Technical Manager in our Technical team, who will oversee all aspects of the fleet maintenance, including but not limited to vehicles and vessels.

The role is full-time and permanent, based in the area of Piraeus (Drapetsona).

FLEET TECHNICAL MANAGER

About us

Antipollution is the leading company in the provision of Port Reception Facilities and Emergency Response Services and among the leaders in Waste Management in Greece and the Mediterranean. It operates in all major Greek ports and numerous private marinas and terminals, providing integrated, tailor-made environmental solutions, in all kinds of ships even to the high spec LNG and Oil Drillings ships. Our company is fully licensed and implements high standard environmental practices for waste management based on the principals of Circular Economy and a Zero Waste approach.


Responsibilities:

· Develop fleet routine maintenance procedures and ensure implementation.

· Carry out inspections of the fleet to identify and resolve issues.

· Plan and oversee all repair and installation activities.

· Allocate workload and supervise to technical team.

· Monitor equipment inventory and place orders when necessary.

· Monitor expenses and control the budget for repairs and maintenance.

· Manage relationships with contractors and service providers.

· Keep maintenance logs and report on daily activities.

· Ensure timely and accurate processing and documentation of services related to fleet.

· Ensure health and safety policies are complied with.

· Participate in the preparation, planning and implementation of fleet activities in the team.


Requirements:

· BSc in Engineering, preferably Mechanical or Electrical.

· 3+ proven experience as fleet technical manager or other similar managerial role.

· Experience in planning maintenance and repair operations.

· Knowledge of searching and ordering the necessary equipment.

· High levels of energy and drive, willingness to work hard.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

· Strong planning, coordination, and organizational skills.

· Very good knowledge Microsoft Office.

· Experience in ERP Systems.

· Very good knowledge of English language (both written and verbal).


What we offer:

  • Competitive remuneration scheme
  • Private Medical Insurance
  • Career development opportunities
  • Training opportunities
  • Friendly working environment

Job Description:
About the job

Η PAL (www.pal.gr), κατέχει ηγετική θέση στον τομέα της συσκευασίας τροφίμων. Συνεργαζόμαστε με τις μεγαλύτερες βιομηχανίες τροφίμων στην Ελλάδα και εξάγουμε τα προϊόντα μας σε περοσσότερες απο 30 χώρες. Διαθέτουμε περιέκτες και film συσκευασίας τροφίμων και αναζητούμε εργαζόμενη/ο για την στελέχωση του τμήματος πωλήσεων. Οι ιδανικοί υποψήφιοι θα έχουν εμπειρία στον τομέα της συσκευασίας ή στην βιομηχανία τροφίμου.

Αρμοδιότητες:

• Έυρεση ευκαιριών και υποψήφιων πελατών

• Επικοινωνία με πελάτες εξωτερικού και εσωτερικού

• Παρουσίαση των προϊόντων της εταιρίας και των λύσεων που διαθέτουμε

• Κατανόηση των αναγκών του πελάτη και καταγραφή μέσω CRM

• Συντονισμός και προετοιμασία δοκιμών σε συνεργασία με άλλα τμήματα όπως παραγωγής και logistics

• Εκπόνηση report

Ιδανικό προφίλ:

• Κατ’ ελάχιστο 1 χρόνος εμπειρία σε πωλήσεις

• Επικοινωνιακά προσόντα

o Βιομηχανική συσκευασία

o Thermoforming

o Tray Sealing

o MAP packaging

o PET/PP materials

o Industrial food packaging

Εκπληρωμένες στρατιωτικές υποχρεώσεις (για τους άρρενες υποψήφιους)

PAL (www.pal.gr) is a leading Greek Food Packaging supplier. Our products are present in all major Supermarket chains and retailers in Greece, and we export to more than 30 countries. We are ISO 9001 and BRC certified. Our production includes trays and thermoforming film as well as EFSA certified food safe film. With growth rate of 20% YoY we are looking for a dynamic and passionate individual to join us as Technical Sales based in Kifissia, Athens, Greece. You should have experience working with customers in the packaging or food industry.


Purpose and Responsibilities:

· Identify market opportunities

· Initiate contact with potential customers

· Present the company’s products and solutions

· Understand customer needs and technical requirements

· Coordinate trials and tests in collaboration with production and logistics departments

· Maintain CRM on customers and present progress on management

· Produce weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reports

Candidate Profile:

· Minimum 1 year experience is Technical Sales

Knowledge of the below topics will be considered an asset:

o Thermoforming

o Tray Sealing

o MAP packaging

o PET/PP materials

o Industrial food packaging

o Dairy or Meat or Poultry or Seafood industry

o Project management

· Engineering degree will be considered an asset

· Communication skills

· Availability for traveling.

· Good command of the English language

Job Description:
About the job

We are currently looking for a Project Manager who will be responsible for a variety of projects related to the HORECA market. The job holder will report directly to the CEO.

Main responsibilities:

  • Run & implement special projects assigned by the CEO, regarding business development & new business opportunities in the HORECA Market
  • Gather, analyze and evaluate info & data to assess risk and impact of various projects & new business development opportunities.
  • Design and propose the best possible project plan given constraints of time, resources and cost for the assigned projects, in order to fully ensure the covering of all aspects (People, Organization, Processes, Technology and Facilities).

This includes development of clear project objectives, managing & tracking timelines & critical milestones, establishing contingency & acceleration plans, facilitating team decisions and issue resolution, risk management and coordinating team meetings and minutes
  • Act as a consultant coach and advisor for employees within the assigned aspect area and actively intervene when necessary, in order to better facilitate the project’s progress.

  • Very good knowledge of Microsoft Office and Asana

  • Competitive salary
  • Bonus

  • Medical insurance
  • Work in a financially healthy and growing company

Job Description:
About the job

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.

Your Impact
  • Participates in planning and implementing the Health & Safety policies and standards
  • Ensures adequate procedures are implemented to evaluate the adequacy of H&S compliance and performance across on the project
  • Provides summary strategic reports and recommendations to the leadership team
  • Provides guidance and recommendation with regards to H&S area
  • Keeps fully informed on all existing and proposed changes in applicable regulations and legislation
Here’s What You’ll Need
  • BSc degree or equivalent occupational Health and Safety qualification
  • At least 5 years professional experience with 3 years industry specific experience preferred
  • Discipline specific professional registration preferred (CIOB, PMP, PMI, ICE, RICS)
  • Previous experience in Health and Safety role on construction projects (preferably, buildings/high-rise/retail focused)
  • Previous experience of major projects/programmes
  • Previous experience of coordination of Health and Safety personnel

At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Title: Product Manager
Skills: Analytics|Business|Business Modeling|Consulting|Engineering|Product Management|Strategy|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description


KLDiscovery, a leading global provider of electronic discovery, information governance and data recovery services, is currently seeking a Manager, Software Engineering position.


The person will develop and maintain software applications in support of KLDiscovery’s family of products and services. Oversee software development projects and report on initiatives to ensure timely delivery. Remove roadblocks impeding team progress. Interact with other departments. Engineering and project management experience and skills required. Engage with direct reports on a regular basis to proactively provide coaching, mentoring, and training. Provide regular feedback to direct reports on their performance. They will also mentor, coach, and train entry and mid-level software developers.


Hybrid work opportunity.


Responsibilities


  • Oversee software development projects and report on initiatives to ensure timely delivery
  • Serve as a single point of contact for project initiatives
  • Communicate project goals and expectations to associates
  • Acting as a bridge between business and software development
  • Remove roadblocks impeding team progress
  • Interact with other departments
  • Engage with direct reports on a regular basis to proactively provide coaching, mentoring, and training
  • Provide regular feedback to direct reports on their performance
  • Conduct annual performance evaluations
  • Operate within budget, authorization limits and aligned with the current financial condition. Provides input for budgeting for next fiscal periods
  • Support recruitment, onboarding and compensation management. Provide input for and execute hiring strategy in compliance with law and internal regulations
  • Occasional travel


Qualifications


  • University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related scientific field preferred
  • Minimum of 1 year of leadership, training, and mentoring experience
  • Five plus years of software development experience and/or training
  • Or, equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Possess significant humility, hunger, and people smarts
  • Ability to work in a team or with multiple organizational departments in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment
  • Awareness of and demonstrate company values, policies and guidelines.


What We Offer
  • Opportunity to work 100% remotely
  • Generous paid time off
  • Competitive salary and benefits package
    • Benefits which include life, disability, and health insurance for both you and your immediate family
  • Refer a friend, earn a bonus!
  • Career progression and training opportunities


Our Cultural Values


We Seek Team Members Who Are


Entrepreneurs at heart, we are a customer first team sharing one goal and one vision.


  • Humble - No one is above another; we all work together to meet our clients’ needs and we acknowledge our own weaknesses
  • Hungry - We all are driven internally to be successful and to continually expand our contribution and impact
  • Smart - We use emotional intelligence when working with one another and with clients


Our culture shapes our actions, our products, and the relationships we forge with our customers. It helps us stand out in an ever-increasing crowd of providers.


Who We Are


KLDiscovery provides technology-enabled services and software to help law firms, corporations, government agencies and consumers solve complex data challenges. The company, with offices in 25 locations across 16countries, is a global leader in delivering best-in-class eDiscovery, information governance and data recovery solutions to support the litigation, regulatory compliance, internal investigation and data recovery and management needs of our clients.


Serving clients for over 30 years, KLDiscovery offers data collection and forensic investigation, early case assessment, electronic discovery and data processing, application software and data hosting for web-based document reviews, and managed document review services. In addition, through its global Ontrack Data Recovery business, KLDiscovery delivers world-class data recovery, email extraction and restoration, data destruction and tape management.


KLDiscovery has been recognized as one of the fastest growing companies in North America by both Inc. Magazine (Inc. 5000) and Deloitte (Deloitte's Technology Fast 500) and CEO Chris Weiler was recognized as a 2014 Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year™. Additionally, KLDiscovery is a Relativity Certified Partner and maintains ISO/IEC 27001 Certified data centers around the world.


KLDiscovery is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Project Manager

Job Description:
About the job

The SOC Engineer's job objective is to implement Obrela’s methodology towards security analytics projects’ onboarding, as well as to support all technical functions (administration / networking / security) for implemented projects.

Responsibilities

  • Implements, Integrates and Supports on security analytics solutions (customer on-premise and OBRELA MSS), based on Obrela methodology and directions of DevOps and SOC Officer, in order to successfully execute the MSS client technical task.
  • Maintains, Troubleshoots and Expands certain areas of the security analytics content applicable to their role.
  • Maintains and Troubleshoots the MSS infrastructure in order to ensure the seamless service delivery and uptime. This includes on-call soc engineering shifts as agreed on contract.
  • Organizes and updates the SOC technical documentation to reflect new challenges and revise older inapplicable material.
  • Collaborates with SOC team members to understand security analytics requirements to properly implement related tasks.
  • Delivers technical documentation of the work performed, as well as HLD/LLD design parts. Presents to technical teams (Obrela or Clients) and Provides walk-through of the deliverable's in order to demonstrate the work and its quality, as well as to create a bonding between the Client and the implementor.



Requirements

  • A bachelor’s or advanced degree in computer science, engineering, information systems or a related discipline
  • IT-related certifications considered a strong plus
  • One year of work experience in an IT security technical position (not required if the candidate can demonstrate technical knowledge)
  • Experience with Linux and Windows administration
  • Good knowledge of TCP/IP networks
  • Sound understanding of network, system and application intrusion techniques on IT infrastructure
  • Understanding of log formats from OS, Databases, Firewalls, Applications
  • Demonstration of analytical and troubleshooting skills on short time frames
  • Scripting abilities (preferred bash and python) will be considered a strong plus
  • Experience with Splunk or ELK Stack will be considered a plus
  • Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and open source tools
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills in English language
  • Ability to prioritize, organize and manage a demanding workload, and to work well under deadlines and pressure
  • Ability to respond appropriately to customer email communications and address effectively troubleshooting needs
  • Must aspire to a culture of service excellence



Benefits

  • Dynamic and respectful environment – our people are the core of our business, we value each and every individual and support initiatives, promoting agility and work/life balance.
  • Continuous coaching – work with passionate people and receive both theoretical as well as hands-on training
  • Career development. Expand your career internationally and work alongside knowledgeable people from diverse cultures and backgrounds
  • A competitive compensation package dependent upon your experience and qualifications. We’re focused on rewarding efforts. Our salaries and benefits package will keep you motivated throughout your career

Title: H&S Supervisor
Skills: Communication|English|Marketing|Negotiation|Occupational Health|Programmes|Research Skills|Supervisory Skills|Team Leadership|Teamwork|
Job Description:
About the job

Description


Bazaraki.com is the biggest marketplace in Cyprus and the leader in real estate, cars and general classifieds. Every month more than 750,000 unique users view more than 25 million ad pages on Bazaraki.com. Our mission is to improve daily our services and offer extraordinary marketplace services to Cyprus. To support this growth and make sure that we can scale, we continue to expand. We believe that people drive our business forward and we strive daily to build a powerful team with people that share the same passion and enthusiasm for eCommerce.


What we are looking for:


We are looking for a passionate, self-driven individual and above all a team player, who will join our Operations team. You need to have experience in policies and procedures creation and documentation and be comfortable with CRMs. You must be a people's person who enjoys working with different teams, be organised and pay great attention to detail. You also must be willing to relocate in Cyprus.


Requirements


  • A Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, IT or any other related field
  • A Master’s degree in the above areas will be considered an advantage
  • At least 3+ years of experience in a similar position
  • Fluency in Greek and English language is mandatory
  • Experienced with processes drafting, policy development and working knowledge of procedure documentation
  • Fluency with e-commerce UX
  • Capable to acquire the complete picture/needs even when not all details are specified
  • Possess the ability to pass down the chain important/complex concepts with simple yet accurate language/manner
  • Skills in the analysis and re-engineering of processes and procedures
  • Working knowledge of CRM, preferably HubSpot
  • Strong communication capabilities, emphasising in active listening
  • Ability to develop, evaluate, and edit the content, structure, and format of a range of written materials.
  • Capable in organising and coordinating team members
  • Capable to communicate professionally and effectively across all company levels
  • Pay huge attention to detail on a timely manner
  • Capable of resonating with internal teams to produce excellent teamwork
  • Expose can-do attitude in under pressure conditions and adapt in fast-paced environments
  • Self-driven personality, requiring limited guidance
  • Resilient in getting challenged at your proposals/ideas
  • Willing to relocate to Cyprus


Responsibilities


  • Posses full and thorough understanding of Company’s processes
  • Optimise existing processes, taking into account company-specific operational mode
  • Build internal processes: Analyse all the procedures, drafts and communicate new ones depending on the action/needs
  • Recommend actionable improvements in internal processes to ensure processes efficiency
  • Prepare in detail flow of work in new business initiatives, identifying all necessary steps and actions
  • Support the Operations teams, providing accurate and up-to-date information on workflows
  • Be the liaison between Customer Success and Sales departments for all new projects/business initiatives
  • Be responsible for the management of workflow throughout all departments within the Company
  • Be responsible for ensuring that the daily services are delivered to end-customers smoothly and efficiently
  • Prepare requests to later be submitted to Group Development Team, in detailed yet comprehensive specs format
  • Test and prepare reports for new developments/releases provided by Group Development Team
  • Work closely with internal teams to communicate new implementations and platform enhancements
  • Lead the interaction with all involved parties: Internal Users, Customers and platform end-users
  • Be the owner of Company’s CRM system, applying necessary changes to serve better Sales and Customer Success departments in-line with Company’s key objectives
  • Facilitate management needs in business specifications, reporting and testing
  • Prepare business related statistics and reports
  • Acquire experience with internal systems and update content
  • Prepare training material for new and current employees
  • Work closely with Management Team according to internal Organisation needs


Benefits


  • Competitive salary
  • Attractive relocation package
  • Work from home in Cyprus
  • 21 days holidays
  • Technical equipment and internet connection
  • Ongoing training and development


This is a permanent full-time position working the core opening hours of the business, Monday-Friday from 9 am to 18 pm. It is a Cyprus based job and you can work remotely from home in Cyprus. Extended working hours will be sometimes required according to business needs.


We want to be able to attract the best and make sure you keep getting better.


Bazaraki.com is an equal opportunity employer. We want applicants of diverse backgrounds and hire without regard to color, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you feel you have the skills and experience then don't miss out on this exciting opportunity.

Title: Manager, Software Engineering (Remote)
Skills: Coaching|Communication|Computer Engineering|Computer Forensics|Computer Science|Leadership|Negotiation|Real Estate Development Projects|Software Development|Team Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Senior Business Analyst | Full-time contract | Athens - GR


We are looking for a highly motivated professional that is enthused over building software applications that serve user and business needs;

You will be working with a team of talented professionals ranging from Project managers and Software architects to software developers and testers and will be using cutting edge technologies and methodologies to efficiently and effectively deliver the software;

You will act as a liaison among the client and the implementation team: you will be the “client” for the implementation team and the “implementation team” for the client;

You will “shape” the software application by proposing features and improvements and by defining the user experience with your feature specifications and UI wireframes.


Your work activities overall will include:

  • Master the related business knowledge, identify users’ goals and how the software application is expected to serve them;
  • Elicit, analyse, document and validate business requirements with customer stakeholders and propose/brainstorm on related functionalities/features; ensure that proposals made are technically feasible and efficient by engaging the proper team members, where necessary;
  • Identify and log functional and non-functional requirements;
  • Build, prioritize and groom a backlog of software features, improvements and bugs;
  • Produce detailed functional specifications accompanied by wireframes and seek the customer’s approval in a timely fashion to facilitate efficient Sprint planning;
  • Attend Sprint planning meetings and provide clarifications and priorities where needed;
  • Attend daily standups with the team and make sure that the delivered features match the specifications you provided;
  • Hold regular meetings with the implementation team to estimate the upcoming scope;
  • Provide assistance in creating/updating documentation.


Requirements

  • University degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, MBA or related field;
  • Minimum 8 years of professional experience in IT after the completion of studies;
  • Minimum 6 years of experience with business analysis tools, modelling tools and project methodologies;
  • Knowledge of how software applications work: what are their core pillars, how they communicate and how they affect the user’s experience;
  • Analytical mind and ability to synthesize, abstract and communicate the information at a level suitable for the target audience;
  • Experience with Agile methodologies is considered a plus;
  • Experience with BDD (Feature Files) is considered a plus;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (B2 or higher);
  • Good team leading skills, team spirit, ownership and accountability;
  • Fulfilled military obligations (if applicable).


What is in it for you?

  • A permanent contract with a compensation package that includes private medical insurance, meal vouchers, mobile plan, etc.
  • Learning opportunities, in-house trainings, continuous coaching.
  • Fun, respectful and supportive work environment that promotes work-life balance.
  • Mobility opportunities to work abroad, in case of interest, as we have various job openings in our Group.


Why Trasys Greece?

  • Strong team spirit attitude.
  • Dynamic, intelligent, agile and talented teams.
  • Large-scale challenging international projects.
  • Allows you to take the ownership of your work from the beginning, having specific responsibilities.
  • Active and meaningfully present in various IT communities (MoT, Angular, JHUG, etc.).


Trasys Greece, part of NRB Group, is an equal opportunity employer who welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

Title: Operations and Projects Specialist
Skills: Attention to Detail|Business Process|CRM Databases|Interpersonal Communication|Manufacturing Process Improvement|Operations|Project Management|Report Writing|Teamwork|Time Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Employment Type: Full-time & Permanent

Location: Dubai, UAE (Visa sponsorship & relocation assistance provided)

Annual Starting Base Salary range of 150,000 - 250,000 USD + performance-based bonus - 0% tax environment + Equity participation.

About Cobblestone Energy

Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company, specializing in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading. Our advanced data analytics and extensive research drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.

At Cobblestone Energy, we value diversity and believe in hiring extraordinary talent from around the world. Our flat organizational structure fosters a culture of innovation, giving team members complete ownership of their work and ensuring that ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people, along with constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways.

Cobblestone Values
  • Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
  • Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
  • The team is more important than the individual.
  • Being the best in any market we enter
  • Hiring and keeping only the most effective people
  • Others must benefit from our existence.

Role Description

We are seeking a highly ambitious Short Term Gas Trader to lead our expansion into European gas trading. As the Lead Short Term Gas Trader, you will be responsible for managing the daily operations of our gas trading desk and driving profitability. You will be accountable for the overall performance of the gas trading desk, including developing and executing short-term trading strategies. The successful candidate will have a track record of success in gas trading and a deep understanding of market dynamics and price movements. You will have the support of a junior trader, analysts, and our technology team in this endeavour. Our ambitions are to grow this desk over time to a global physical desk for both pipeline gas and LNG covering all time frames and major locations. Gas will remain key to world energy transition for decades to come.

Responsibilities
  • Develop and execute short-term trading strategies from within day to month ahead across GB and major Continental markets.
  • Analyse market trends and identify trading opportunities in the GB, FR, NL, BE, and DE gas markets.
  • Manage a team of traders and analysts to ensure smooth daily operations of the desk.
  • Collaborate with other teams within the company to ensure alignment with overall business strategy.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of regulatory requirements and market developments in the gas trading industry.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with key external stakeholders.

Requirements
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in gas trading, with a focus on short-term trading.
  • Deep understanding of at least one of these gas markets: GB, FR, NL, BE, and DE and their unique dynamics.
  • Proven track record of success in gas trading, including experience in transport and storage optimisation.
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to think strategically.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset, highly ambitious
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Experience leading others.

What We Offer
  • A full-time position on our Commercial team
  • Committed and remarkably talented colleagues.
  • Highly competitive compensation dependent on performance
  • An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career.
  • Investment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in business.
  • Equity participation to align long term interests.

Title: Product Manager
Skills: Analytical Skills|Analytics|Business|Business Modeling|Consulting|Engineering|Management|Product Management|Strategy|Team Leadership|
Job Description:
About the job

Overview


Η PepsiCo Hellas φιλοξενεί μερικά από τα πιο αγαπημένα προϊόντα τροφίμων και αναψυκτικών στον κόσμο όπως τα καθημερινά αγαπημένα σας Lay's, Quaker, Pepsi, Doritos και τους χυμούς Ήβη, για να αναφέρουμε μερικά. Έχουμε μια εκπληκτική φήμη για την ανάπτυξη και την κυκλοφορία προϊόντων που αγαπούν οι καταναλωτές μας. Είμαστε περήφανοι που είμαστε ένα εξαιρετικό μέρος για εργασία και κερδίσαμε πρόσφατα το βραβείο του Καλύτερου Εργοδότη για την Ελλάδα!


Σε μεγαλύτερη κλίμακα, η PepsiCo παράγει το μεγαλύτερο χαρτοφυλάκιο τροφίμων και αναψυκτικών δισεκατομμυρίων δολαρίων στον κόσμο, συμπεριλαμβανομένων 22 σειρών προϊόντων που κάθε μία παράγει περισσότερα από δισεκατομμύριο σε ετήσιες λιανικές πωλήσεις.


Responsibilities


Αρμοδιότητες:


  • Καταχώρηση συμφωνητικών στο Indirects Contracts με όλες τις απαιτούμενες προεργασίες-πληροφορίες (π.χ. Presice, Γευσήνους, Ξενοδοχεία κλπ)
  • Συγκέντρωση πρακτικών ή/και άλλων εγγράφων, ανέβασμα στο Adobe ID και αποστολή για υπογραφή στα μέλη του Δ.Σ.
  • Συπλήρωση ερωτηματολογίου για όλους τους προμηθευτές που υπόκεινται στο Due Dilligence
  • Συμπλήρωση ερωτηματολογίων ή/και εγγράφων και αποστολή τους συστημικά με σκοπό την προβολή/διαφήμιση των προιόντων μας ή της εταιρικής μας ευθύνης
  • Επικοινωνία με ξενοδοχεία, ζήτηση-εκτίμηση-ανάλυση προσφορών/διαθεσιμότητας
  • Εύρεση χώρου, Συντονισμός end to end όλου του συνεδρίου: μεταφορά, διανυκτέρευση, επισιτιστικά, οπτικοακουστικό, επικοινωνία κλπ
  • Έλεγχος & συντονισμός με βάση το πρόγραμμα των μελών, αποστολή προσκλήσεων και αλλαγή αυτών εφόσον κριθεί απαραίτητο.
  • Τηλεφωνική επικοινωνία και ανταλλαγή emails με εσωτερικούς και εξωτερικούς συνεργάτες για την επίλυση διαφόρων θεμάτων του εμπορικού τμήματος σε καθημερινή βάση


Qualifications


Προφίλ υποψηφίου:


  • Προσανατολισμένος στην επίτευξη αποτελεσμάτων
  • Επικοινωνία και κοινωνικές δεξιότητες
  • Πτυχίο θα θεωρηθεί επιπρόσθετο προσόν
  • Καλή Γνώση Αγγλικών
  • Γνώση χειρισμού ηλεκτρονικών υπολογιστών

Title: LEAD GAS TRADER
Skills: Daily Operations|Entrepreneurship|Hedging|Interpersonal Skills|Market Analysis|Optimization|Record Of Success|Strategic Thinking|Trading Desk|Trading Strategies|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description

OpenBet’s mission is to power growth and player engagement for operators through a global betting ecosystem that delivers at scale, at speed, at every great sports event. Our 1000 talented colleagues are the market's top team. We achieve billions of bets in a season; 60,000+ per second (more transactions than Amazon on Prime Day); 100% uptime (zero Superbowl crashes!) and we're built on 25 years of imaginative technology that is iterated daily.

Want to be part of our story?

Job Description

These are just some of the tasks you may work on:

This role’s focus will be to coordinate and create product release versions coming out of our Product Engineering teams, and to manage them through our integration and release testing processes through to handover to our Delivery teams.

You will coordinate deployments, carry out initial triage on issues, and feedback to Engineering teams, ensuring issues are fixed at source in a timely manner.

In coordination with the Release Managers, you will collate product fixes into maintenance versions for older releases, keeping close communication with the Delivery teams timescales.

A key part of the role is continuous improvement, reviewing existing processes and looking for opportunities for increasing quality and efficiency.

You will also setup and manage internal integration and test environments with the OpenBet platform, products, and APIs.

The ideal candidate will need to find innovative solutions to challenging integration problems and have the hands-on technical ability to design and implement solutions.

Responsibilities:
  • Managing versioning, branching and tagging of product releases.
  • Owning internal Integration and Release environments to ensure high availability for the QA and Engineering teams.
  • Reviewing and understanding business requirements.
  • Configuring and deploying the Sportsbook product versions.
  • Automating release and deployment processes.
  • Analysis, troubleshooting and testing of integrated software systems.
  • Providing 2nd level technical support for integration issues.
  • Contributing ideas for process and automation tooling enhancements.
  • Proactive monitoring of existing platforms to ensure on-going stability utilizing SRE dashboards and alerts.
  • Tracking and reporting key performance indicators for the Release process.
  • Preparing documentation and presenting progress reports to stakeholders
  • Training and mentoring of junior staff.

Qualifications

If you are the right Release Engineer for us, you will be able to demonstrate:
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, including the ability to communicate technical information to non-IT professionals.
  • Ability to establish confidence, rapport and foster cooperative relationships with customers, partners and co-workers.
  • Excellent analysis and problem-solving skills.
  • Good knowledge of Linux/Unix OS.
  • Demonstrable knowledge of a scripting language (Bash, Python, Perl, TCL).
  • Knowledge of configuration management tools (Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Saltstack).
  • Understanding of Version Control systems (GIT, SVN, etc.).
  • Good knowledge of continuous integration practices and tools (Jenkins).
  • Demonstrable knowledge of SQL (any vendor/dialect).
  • Highly motivated, able to work without supervision, eager to learn on the job and willing to work as part of a team.
  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, information systems, or equivalent experience.

The ideal candidate should also have:
  • Working experience in systems development life cycle (technical analysis & requirements capturing, development, testing, release, maintenance and support).
  • Understanding of containers and container provisioning (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Awareness of provisioning tools (Terraform).
  • Experience with systems integration, XML and JSON APIs (SOAP, REST).
  • Knowledge of software development methodologies - Waterfall, Agile (Scrum, Kanban).
  • Working experience with distributed systems deployment and maintenance.
  • Knowledge of web application development (HTML and JavaScript).
  • Awareness of http servers, reverse proxies, load balancers (nginx, haproxy, apache http server).
  • Working knowledge of computer networks and the Internet protocol suite.
  • Understanding of object-oriented software design principles, data structures and algorithms (preferred Java).
  • Some knowledge of different Java development frameworks: Spring, Log4j, JMS.

Additional Information

Why would you enjoy working with us at OpenBet?
  • Competitive benefits, including pension plan and private insurance for you and your family members as well as extra leave days for volunteering and other purposes.
  • The opportunity to work within a truly international Company, where you can expect the diversity and the opportunities of the world, mixed with a people friendly culture.
  • A wide palette of training opportunities and internal and external learning sources, from onboarding, to on-the-job training by our subject matter experts.
  • As a software house, we have a relaxed but highly professional environment with excellent facilities available, including on-site canteen & gym, showers, video, board and electronic sports games as well as lending library.
  • We love to get together and throw a number of group events, to celebrate new comers, enjoy some good meals together and show off our sport talents as part of company tournaments (basketball, table tennis and others!).
