Title: Senior Release Engineer
Skills: Business Requirements|Communication|Computer Science|Configuration Management|Log4j|Proactive Monitoring|Problem Solving|Scripting|Software Development|Technical Analysis|
Job Description:
About the job

OVERVIEW:


Guidepoint connects clients with vetted subject matter experts—Advisors—from our global professional network. Our clients leverage the insights and perspectives shared by our Advisors to stay informed and make better business decisions. Our multinational client list includes nine of the top 10 global consulting firms, hundreds of hedge funds (including five of the largest firms), and many of the largest private equity firms and Fortune-ranked companies. Guidepoint’s seventeen offices on four continents provide 24/7, quick and agile service. For more information, visit www.guidepoint.com


Play a vital role in Guidepoint’s success.


As an Associate on the Client Service team, you will understand your client’s unique business questions and identify the experts who can best provide the answers. You will find and recruit new experts into our network of over 1,250,000 Guidepoint Advisors, determining which ones are best suited to speak with the client. For many of our employees, the Associate role represents their first job post-college, and provides a unique opportunity to put core business skills into practice, as well as gain exposure to a wide range of industries and disciplines.


Who We Are:


  • Team-oriented and collaborative
  • Hard-working professionals who strive for excellence
  • Built-in mentorship to help you drive and improve your project management and customer service skills, to deliver excellent results for clients
  • Hands-on leadership to help you develop your career and provide opportunities for upward mobility within Guidepoint
  • Guidepoint is passionate about your career growth: Check out our Client Service Career Trajectory.


What YOU will own:


  • Work with Project Managers to develop strategies for satisfying each client project request
  • Utilize LinkedIn, press releases, case studies, and the internet to identify the best experts for our clients to get their strategic or investment questions answered
  • Identify the best leads and invite them to join our network to participate in consultations with our clients
  • Screen experts to determine their suitability for each specific client project and develop professional profiles to present to your clients


Experience YOU will bring:


  • Bachelor of Science degree (ex. Public Health, Biology, Neuroscience, Chemistry)
  • Previous internship/volunteering/extracurriculars/research lab experience


Skills YOU will Bring:


  • Desire to work in a sourcing/lead generation type of role
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Outgoing personality with the ability to speak with people at all professional levels
  • Intellectual curiosity and desire to learn
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Fluency in English and knowledge of additional languages (French, Spanish, German, etc.) is preferred
  • Demonstrated ability to work both individually and as part of a team


What We Offer:


  • Competitive compensation
  • Private health insurance
  • Entrepreneurial environment, autonomy, and fast decisions
  • International exposure to the global Guidepoint service teams
  • Casual work environment and compelling people
  • Summer and winter team events


Interview Process:


  • Meet your Guidepoint Recruiter!
    • Initial Candidate Screen
  • Meet the Guidepoint Teams!
    • Hiring Manager Interview
  • Mock Assessment (Role Dependent)
    • Complete a stimulated client request and gain more insight into the role
  • Interview Process Outcome


At Guidepoint, our success relies on the diversity of our employees, advisors, and client base, which allows us to create connections that offer a wealth of perspectives. We are committed to upholding policies that contribute to an equitable and welcoming environment for our community, regardless of background, identity, or experience.

Title: Commercial Intern
Skills: Campaigns|Communication|Contract Management|Customer Satisfaction|Daily Operations|English|Interpersonal Skills|Organization Skills|Sales|
Job Description:
About the job

Job Description

The IMS, or IT Analyst, provides direct support to end-users of the ABS Enterprise Computer Network. Receive direction and guidance from IMS Manager. The Analyst responds to, evaluates, and solves a variety of end-user hardware, network, and software problems. The IMS, in addition to other duties, configures new workstations for a variety of uses, including, stand-alone, networked, portable, dial-in, etc. This activity includes installing memory, hard disks, floppy drives, USB peripherals, PCI cards into workstations.

What You Will Do:
  • Sets up and configures print servers and attached printers.
  • Upgrades existing workstations by installing memory, larger hard disks, adding floppy drives, etc.
  • Trains end-users on a one-to-one basis about the proper use of software and hardware as necessary.
  • Draft written user instructions/manuals for PC hardware and software.
  • Provides initial support to local area end users in multiple service locations.
  • An understanding of and respect for the need to maintain standards across the entire ABS Enterprise Network. This means that this individual must constantly keep Houston IMS personnel and the IMS Manager aware of end-user and system operation needs.
  • Assists with the implementation of ABS internal and external application sets (O2K, O2E, and SafeNet for Clients and Surveyors, etc.). Lends assistance as needed to maintain the above-mentioned application sets.
  • Keeps abreast of PC business applications by maintaining contact with other administrative assistants and members of Information Management Services.
  • Serves in an administrative capacity on department project teams, as necessary.
  • Participates in meetings with other IMS functional groups and customers.
  • Participates in project teams made up of various IMS functional specialties and customers.
  • Coordinates and oversees the installation of local area networks at multiple service locations.
  • Maintains information technology equipment inventory and coordinates repairs and requisitions per approved budgets and management direction.
  • Communicates status of projects, personnel, customer concerns, etc., to the IMS Manager
  • Prepares and evaluates bid packages for different combinations of computer services, including the supply of hardware, software, and support services.
  • Installs network operating system on file servers, both in stand-alone local area networks as well as wide area networks.

What You Will Need:

Education and Experience
  • Bachelor's degree or recognized equivalent in Computer Science or a related field.
  • At least two (2) years of relevant experience preferred.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities
  • HND or recognized equivalent, preferably in Computer Science or a related field, from an accredited college or comparable on-the-job experience preferred.
  • Good understanding of the basic Intel-based Personal Computer hardware
  • Basic understanding of printing/plotting commands, including HPGL, PCL and PostScript formats.
  • Good understanding of and experience with network cabling technology.
  • Thorough, basic knowledge of and working experience with: TCP/IP, basic telecommunication protocols and operating procedures, and standard end-user computer applications, including word processing, spreadsheets, presentation graphics, communication packages, etc.
  • Clarity and conciseness in both oral and written communications.
  • Willingness and flexibility to work non-standard hours (e.g., before 7 a.m. and after 6 p.m. on weekdays and on weekend days).
  • Capability to effectively motivate co-workers and to lead workgroup teams of two or three members.
  • Ability to develop a working knowledge of ABS Rules, Guides, statutory regulations, and related instructions, as well as the ABS Employee Safety Policy.

Reporting Relationships:

Reports directly to the IMS Manager.

#dice

About Us

We set out more than 160 years ago to promote the security of life and property at sea and preserve the natural environment. Today, we remain true to our mission and continue to support organizations facing a rapidly evolving seascape of challenging regulations and new technologies. Through it all, we are anchored by a vision and mission that help our clients find clarity in uncertain times.

ABS is a global leader in marine and offshore classification and other innovative safety, quality, and environmental services. We’re at the forefront of supporting the global energy transition at sea, the application of remote and autonomous marine systems, cutting-edge technical solutions, and many more exciting advancements. Our commitment to safety, reliability, and efficiency is ever-present, guiding our clients to safer and more efficient operations.

Equal Opportunity

ABS Bureau is committed to the equal employment opportunity of its employees and prohibits discrimination against any employee or qualified applicant based on race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status, or other non-work-related characteristics that may be protected under the law of the Federal Government or specific state employment laws.

Notice

ABS and Affiliated Companies (ABS) will not pay a fee to any third-party agency without a valid ABS Master Service Agreement (MSA) authorized and signed by Human Resources. Any resume, CV, application, or other forms of candidate submission provided to any employee of ABS without a valid MSA on file will be considered property of ABS, and no fee will be paid.

Other

This job description is not intended, and should not be construed, to be an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with the job of the incumbent. It is intended to be an accurate reflection of the principal job elements essential for making a fair decision regarding the pay structure of the job. #ogjs

Title: Associate, Client Service (Healthcare)
Skills: Case Studies|Client Services|Communication|Communication Training|Consultations|Customer Service|Oral Communication|Organization Skills|Press Releases|Strategy|
Job Description:
About the job

What makes us a Great Place to Work


Convert Group is the first Greek tech company to be included 5 times in the country’s top 25 Workplaces in the small and medium-sized firms categories. This recognition comes from the Great Place to Work® International Institute which this year counts its 20th year in Greece. In 2021, Convert Group was awarded as the 4th Best Workplace in Europe in the small and medium-sized categories. We believe that diversity, inclusion, and collaboration are key to building great teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities, and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive professionally and personally.


What We Are Looking For:

We are seeking an experienced Lead Software Engineer to join our engineering team as we rapidly grow our platforms to expand to international markets. The right candidate should have a solid technical background, significant experience managing a team, a “get-things-done” attitude and the enthusiasm to build, inspire and grow engineering talent, improve team processes and deliver great software.

The eRetail Audit Stack Consists of:

  • Angular Frontend
  • Core API developed in Ruby on Rails 7
  • A suite of backend services developed in Python
  • PostgreSQL
  • Redis
  • Elasticsearch


Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead a team of software engineers, providing guidance, support and growth opportunities
  • Collaborate with product managers to identify, prioritize and plan feature development
  • Conduct code reviews and provide feedback to improve the quality and maintainability of the codebase
  • Recommend improvements to our technology stack and development processes
  • Manage hiring processes as needed to grow the team
  • Initiate and contribute ideas on the design of new services and platform optimizations
  • Ensure that the development team follows best practices, standards, and procedures
  • Stay up to date with the latest software development technologies and techniques


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
  • At least 7 years of professional experience developing and maintaining production software, with at least 2 years in a team leadership role
  • Proven track record of leading software development teams and delivering high-quality software products
  • Significant experience with both front-end and back-end development (experience with Ruby on Rails and/or Angular a plus)
  • Strong understanding of web development principles, standards, and best practices
  • Experience with PostgreSQL or other relational databases
  • Experience with agile software development processes
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • The drive to lead and make yourself and those around you better
  • Pragmatism, positivity, and a big smile

And… just for being here, we offer you a culture that is created and nurtured by super caring people and underpinned by our Values. Our Values (Integrity, teamwork, innovative thinking, passion for development, humbleness, #mehara), were created for our people, by our people; they guide our thinking, decisions, and actions, creating a truly unique place to work. You will also get a chance to be at the forefront of a professional growth, great workspaces, serious personal development opportunities and a few nice job-related perks.

Benefits:

  • Private health insurance plan both in Greece and abroad.
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Work from the office (hybrid model) & flexible working options.
  • 20% extra annual paid leave, paid student leave & birthday leave.
  • Continuous Training and Mentoring programs and other development opportunities.
  • Windows or Mac user, either way we will supply you with what you need!
  • Financially supporting employees’ post-graduation studies, marriages, newborns, college graduations, tenure.
  • Free daily hot lunches, snacks and coffee at the office.
  • Early Fridays during the summer period.
  • A variety of company activities and family perks.

About us

Convert Group is leading the Data & Analytics Market Intelligence space in the global eCommerce and Omnichannel industry. With operations across Europe, Latin America & Asia, Convert Group is leveraging its AI-powered eRetail Suite platform along with an experienced Customer Success team to unlock the digital potential of Retailers and Manufacturers. The company boasts a rich portfolio of 15 out of the 20 biggest global FMCG & Consumer Healthcare firms such as L'Oréal, P&G, Unilever, Bayer, Haleon, Johnson & Johnson, Nestlé, Coca-Cola Company, Henkel, Bayer, Beiersdorf, FrieslandCampina, Heineken, Barilla, Colgate Palmolive, Perrigo, Pierre Fabre and global retailers such as Ahold Delhaize, Carrefour and Rakuten.


Our hiring process is still virtual to ensure your health and well-being. All candidates are treated equally and respectfully. Appreciating diversity, discrimination on the basis of age, gender, race, religion, political beliefs, sexual preference, family circumstances or physical disability is not tolerated during any stage of the recruitment process. All candidates are treated in a professional manner according to Convert Group values. Hiring decisions are made based on skills, experience and abilities. All personal data and background checking findings are treated as confidential and can only be shared with the respective Hiring Team.

Σε μεγαλύτερη κλίμακα, η PepsiCo παράγει το μεγαλύτερο χαρτοφυλάκιο τροφίμων και αναψυκτικών δισεκατομμυρίων δολαρίων στον κόσμο, συμπεριλαμβανομένων 22 σειρών προϊόντων που κάθε μία παράγει περισσότερα από δισεκατομμύριο σε ετήσιες λιανικές πωλήσεις.


Responsibilities


Ζητάμε να καλύψουμε τη θέση του/της: MERCHANDISER

Title: IT Analyst
Skills: Cabling|Clarity|Communication|Computer Hardware|Computer Science|Embedded Systems|Graphic Presentations|PCL|Point Cloud Library (PCL)|PostScript|
Job Description:
About the job

Company Description


We are Netcompany-Intrasoft, a leading European IT Solutions and Services Group with strong international presence and expertise, offering innovative and added-value solutions of the highest quality to a wide range of international and national public and private organizations. More than 500 organizations in over 70 countries worldwide have chosen the company's services and solutions to fulfill their business needs.


For more information regarding our company, current projects, and openings around Europe, please consult our website: www.netcompany-intrasoft.com.


Job Description


We are looking for an SAP Project Manager for our offices in Athens.


A day in the life of an SAP Project Manager.


As an SAP Project Manager, you will join a structured team of highly experienced SAP Professionals and will undertake the delivery of our internal SAP projects and services. You will report to senior management and will be a key role in delivering the successful execution of a large-scale SAP transformation project. The most significant delivery will be the S/4HANA deployment.


Your main duties will be:


  • Provide Project Management support to a cross-functional project team delivering an SAP S/4 HANA implementation project
  • Responsible for on-time delivery of program commitments, implementing program metrics and manage associated progress reporting
  • Lead project day-to-day execution, facilitate communication and drive progress against plans
  • Track, manage, prioritize, and escalate project issues and risks
  • As appropriate, set priorities for the team to ensure task completion and coordinate work activities
  • A key component of the role of supporting the governance process
  • Have ownership for ensuring a robust project plan is in place and maintained accurately
  • Work closely with both customer's, implementation team and third-party teams
  • Provide weekly status reports to the project sponsors
  • Improve knowledge of the project team in the software of project management and delivery


By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft, a leading IT company, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts in Greece. You will work using cutting-edge technologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products for challenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe


Qualifications


If you have:


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or another relevant field
  • Proven track record in project delivery for large, highly complex, integrated application landscapes of large transformation programs
  • Project Manager experience in full-cycle SAP implementation projects
  • Good knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle
  • Excellent command of the Greek and the English languages (written and verbal)
  • Analytical thinking with problem-solving abilities, combining technical competence with a business consulting approach
  • Excellent at communication and presentation skills
  • A multi-tasking mindset and you are able to work under tight deadlines


…then this position is suitable for you!


It would also be a plus if you had:


  • Project Management certification (PMP or Prince2 or SAP Project Management certification)
  • Experience in at least 2 full SAP S/4HANA implementation project
  • Demonstrated experience in change management and cross-functional team


This position comes with:


  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business), and fast career growth
  • Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects
  • An international dynamic within a fast-paced working environment
  • The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talentedcolleagues


Additional Information


We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. At Netcompany-Intrasoft we respect human rights as part of our culture, and we focus on creating a positive workplace in which all employees are valued and where diversity and inclusivity are welcomed.


The safety and well-being of our employees remain our top priority. Please note that Netcompany-Intrasoft’s recruitment process is being conducted virtually due to preventive measures against the Covid-19 pandemic.


Our culture


Our people are the most important element of our success. Our work life is well defined by our set of fundamental Values: https://bit.ly/3SSbBzU


#BePartOfSomethingGreat!


  • Please submit your CV in English


All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

Title: Merchandiser (outsourced) Chania/Rethymno
Job Description:
About the job

Who We Are

Etraveli Group is a leading global platform for flights, an air technology company connecting millions of flights and travelers across the globe. The company is the exclusive provider of flights to booking.com in Europe and recently entered into an acquisition agreement with Booking Holdings pending competition clearance.

We want our customers to experience the world, while we take care of the technology that enables traveling. Every minute we close hundreds of deals for our partners around the globe. We are the preferred partner of some of the world’s most prominent travel companies such as Booking.com, Google Flights, Skyscanner and Kayak.

At the same time, we open endless possibilities for our employees. Our diverse team of more than 2000 passionate professionals is what makes us the best in what we do. The Group headquarters are located in Sweden while different parts of the Group’s operation are led from the countries where we have offices (Greece, Canada, India), with the Athens office being one of the largest, hosting around 500 employees working from the center of Athens for the rest of the world.

We know that the travel business is not just a business, it is an opening to the whole world. And technology is not just a job, it is an opening to the future. We are looking for people that are as open as traveling and technology combined & we are here to guide, challenge and give you an exciting part in our mission to make our world, wide open.

About The Role

The Customer Service Business Control team is responsible for controlling the Customer Services department, Etraveli Group’s largest and an organization of ~1300 employees inhouse and additional 800 outsourcing today.

Customer Service Business Controllers are responsible for:
  • Setting up controls and monitor the Customer Service activities starting with budget and forecast
  • Operational and financial controlling activities such as vendor invoice control, outsourcing management, agent incentive program.
  • Following up on queues and activities that have financial impact

We are looking for a controller with good controllership skills and who does not shy away from being analytical and explorative. You are comfortable in your communication and stakeholder management. You will have close cooperation with other departments within the global Customer Services organization and you will work closely with the Etraveli Group Finance team.

Responsibilities:
  • Budget and forecast for Customer Services (2000+ organization incl. outsourcing)
  • Create and maintain financial and business metrics
  • Build and improve existing reporting and controlling routines
  • Follow up and reporting of key business areas both of financial and operational character
  • You will play a key role in highlighting trends and patterns, adherence to set targets as well as creating awareness in order to minimize risk
  • Support other colleagues within the Business Control team

Requirements
  • Preferably have a bachelor's degree in Business Administrations, Economics, Statistics or other related fields
  • Experience from international and multicultural organization
  • At least 5 years of experience in a similar role

Critical Competencies
  • You are thrilled by challenges and have a passion for teamwork
  • Able to handle multiple stakeholders
  • Analytical and comfortable with numbers
  • Able to interpret business activities and eager to get the overall understanding of how the business works

Benefits

We are looking for people who would make the world smaller for travelers but want a bigger world of opportunities for themselves. With us you can enjoy:
  • Health Benefits - Through partners, we offer a private health insurance plan. We also offer the possibility to use 2 extra medical leave days in case of need.
  • Monthly ticket restaurant card - to spend in one of the thousands affiliated restaurants, cafes, stores or supermarkets across Greece.
  • Hybrid working environment - having the opportunity to work both remotely and at the office enabling you flexibility!
  • Office in the City – We sit on bright, large floors (over 4000㎡!) in central Athens. Just a short walk from the Ambelokipi Metro station.
  • Team activities - We also like to schedule company/department/team activities and events outside the office space!
  • Fun & Work - We have a relaxed work environment where you can enjoy free breakfast, beverages & fruits, playing ping pong or video games.
  • If interested, please send your CV in English*

Title: SAP Project Manager

Job Description:
About the job

We are the Greek Branch of a Global Real Estate Investment Group (Delsk Group) with offices in Athens, managing properties in Attica. The Company is seeking for:

Civil Engineer Junior, responsible for the technical checking, delivering & maintaining apartments.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Checking of the properties, summarizing the needed works and seeking quotations from technicians and contractors for technical works for the repairs.
  • Arrange any maintenance works with technicians and contractors, when needed or requested by tenants or owners of the rented apts.
  • On site checking of the properties condition after tenants’ departures and on site checking with the owners of the properties, when is requested.
  • Negotiating with developers, suppliers & technicians.
  • Supervising the work as it is carried out by technicians & informing counterpart colleagues of progress accordingly.
  • Communication with clients considering special after sales technical works requirements.
  • Setting schedules for each task and oversee the completion.
  • Efficient response to counterpart colleagues


KEY COMPETENCIES & SKILLS

  • Technical Institution Degree in Civil Engineering, Renovation, Restoration or relevant field.
  • 1-3 years proven professional experience, preferably in a similar position.
  • Excellent communication skills in Greek & English, both written and spoken.
  • Excellent command of MS Office.
  • Self-motivated; Strong sense of responsibility and cooperation
  • Good communication skills.
  • A sense of urgency and a commitment to timely completion of projects.
  • Attention to detail along with a commitment to quality.
  • Military Obligations fulfilled for male candidates
  • Driving License required.

BENEFITS

  • Full time job (not Freelancer) in an international company
  • Private Health Insurance on the Company’s group program.
  • Company car during the working shift, fuel card allowance.

Title: Senior ERP Software Consultant
Skills: CRM Software|Customer Relationship Management (CRM)|English|Infor Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)|User Training|
Job Description:
About the job

Περιγραφή εταιρείας


Καλώς ήρθες στην H&M! Έναν χώρο εργασίας που μπορείς να είσαι ο εαυτός σου & ακόμα περισσότερα!


Σχετικά με την H&M


Είμαστε περήφανοι για την ιστορία μας κάνοντας την μόδα προσιτή σε όλους και η φιλοδοξία μας για το αύριο είναι να κάνουμε την μόδα ακόμα πιο αειφόρα και προσιτή για τους πελάτες μας. Εάν έχεις θέληση να μάθεις, να αναπτυχθείς και να βοηθήσεις τους πελάτες και τους συναδέλφους σου, η H&M θα είναι πάντα ένα μέρος όπου θα μπορείς τόσο να εκφραστείς όσο και να νοιώσεις ότι ανήκεις εδώ.


Γιατί να εργαστείς στην H&M;


Πιστεύουμε πως δεν μπορείς να αλλάξεις τον κόσμο χωρίς να έχεις δίπλα σου υπέροχους ανθρώπους. Έτσι, προσφέρουμε επιπρόσθετα οφέλη, πληθώρα ευκαιριών μάθησης και την δυνατότητα να ξεκινήσεις να χτίζεις μια μακροχρόνια καριέρα ή και να εργαστείς με part- time ωράριο, κυνηγώντας παράλληλα και άλλα όνειρα.Πολλοί από τους παγκόσμιους ηγέτες μας ξεκίνησαν την καριέρα τους από τα καταστήματα.


Περιγραφή θέσης εργασίας


Ο ρόλος του Σύμβουλου Πωλήσεων είναι η αφετηρία στην H&M και η εισαγωγή σε ένα ελκυστικό περιβάλλον παγκόσμιας μόδας με γρήγορους ρυθμούς. Ένωσε την διαφορετικότητά σου μαζί μας και αναπτύξου πολύ περισσότερο από όσο πίστευες πως θα ήταν δυνατόν!


Ως Σύμβουλος Πωλήσεων θα αποκτήσεις όλες τις βασικές γνώσεις για την λειτουργία του καταστήματος, θα γίνεις μέλος μιας ταλαντούχας ομάδας νέων φίλων- και το πιο σημαντικό- θα μάθεις πως να κάνεις τους πελάτες μας να νοιώθουν ευπρόσδεκτοι και χαρούμενοι.


Να είσαι ο εαυτός σου & και περισσότερα στην H&M.


Επαγγελματικά προσόντα


Τι κάνεις:


  • Παροχή άψογης εξυπηρέτησης πελατών στους ορόφους του καταστήματος, στα δοκιμαστήρια και στα ταμεία με στόχο την αύξηση των πωλήσεων
  • Διασφάλιση της έγκαιρης και αποτελεσματικής ροής των προϊόντων, συμμετέχοντας ενεργά στην παραλαβή και την προετοιμασία τους
  • Αναπλήρωση, τακτοποίηση και εμπορική παρουσίαση των εμπορευμάτων
  • Εργασία στα ταμεία σύμφωνα με τις εταιρικές διαδικασίες χειρισμού όλων των απαιτούμενων συναλλαγών
  • Ενεργή συμμετοχή στην προετοιμασία και εφαρμογή των εμπορικών ενεργειών
  • Τήρηση όλων των διαδικασιών ασφάλειας και υγιεινής, με στόχο την πρόληψη απωλειών και την ασφάλεια του καταστήματος
  • Ομαδική εργασία και ενεργή υποστήριξη των συναδέλφων σου


Όπως όλοι στην H&M, πιστεύουμε πως διαθέτεις επιχειρηματικό πνεύμα, είσαι επικοινωνιακός, φιλόδοξος και ομαδικός παίκτης, ανοιχτός σε προκλήσεις με ισχυρό εσωτερικό κίνητρο και θετικό πνεύμα. Οι δεξιότητές σου περιλαμβάνουν:


  • Παροχή άψογης εξυπηρέτησης πελατών με στόχο την αύξηση των πωλήσεων
  • Αναπλήρωση, τακτοποίηση και εμπορική παρουσίαση των εμπορευμάτων
  • Επιτυχής χειρισμός πολλών εργασιών μέσα σε ένα περιβάλλον γρήγορων ρυθμών
  • Ξεκάθαρη και ευθύς επικοινωνία με την ομάδα του καταστήματος και ικανότητα παροχής και λήψης σχολίων με θετικό τρόπο
  • Ολοκλήρωση εργασιών έγκαιρα και αποτελεσματικά
  • Διάθεση για μάθηση και συνεχής βελτίωση
  • Τήρηση όλων των διαδικασιών ασφάλειας και υγιεινής, με στόχο την πρόληψη απωλειών και την ασφάλεια του καταστήματος
  • Ομαδική εργασία και ενεργή υποστήριξη των συναδέλφων σου


Σου ακούγεται ενδιαφέρον; Τότε Έλα μαζί μας σε αυτή την περιπέτεια!


Πρόσθετες πληροφορίες


Η H&M δεσμεύεται στη δημιουργία ενός περιβάλλοντος χωρίς αποκλεισμούς, ενισχύοντας τη διαφορετικότητα και ενεργά αναζητούμε υποψήφιους ανεξάρτητα από γένος, εθνικότητα, θρησκεία, σεξουαλική προτίμηση, αναπηρία ή ηλικία.


Στην Η&Μ η προσωπική σου εξέλιξη είναι το ίδιο σημαντική με την ανάπτυξη της εταιρίας.

Title: Junior Civil Engineer
Skills: After-Sales|Attention to Detail|Civil Engineering|Engineering|English|On Site|Property Management|Real Estate|Real Estate Investment|Supervisory Skills|
Job Description:
About the job

The Company


The world’s leading supplier of mineral-based specialty solutions for industry with 14,000 employees, operations in more than 40 countries, and €4.3 billion in revenue in 2022.


Imerys delivers high-value-added, functional solutions to a great number of sectors, from processing industries to consumer goods. The Group draws on its understanding of applications, technological knowledge and expertise in material science to deliver solutions by beneficiating its mineral resources, synthetic minerals and formulations. Imerys’ solutions contribute essential properties to customers’ products and their performance, including heat resistance, hardness, conductivity, opacity, durability, purity, lightness, filtration, absorption and water repellency. Imerys is determined to develop responsibly, in particular by fostering the emergence of environmentally-friendly products and processes.


If you want to grow your skills and develop your career, find out more at www.imerys.com


The Position


CRM Commercial Business Partner & Solution Architect


Job Summary


The CRM Commercial Business Partner & Solution Architect is a key contributor in the management of the various CRM releases for Imerys with strong interactions with the Commercial Excellence department in charge of both gathering the business requirements and standardizing the approach of our business processes.


Responsibilities


Commercial Business Partnership


  • Develop a deep knowledge of the Domain business and build positive relationships with business stakeholders of this Domain.
  • Partner with business counterparts to plan new joint initiatives aligned with corporate strategy, evaluate proposals, and determine how they fit into business capability roadmaps and priorities.
  • Educate business partners about IT processes, roles, and capabilities.


Solution Architect


  • Provide guidance to the business on their requirements to ensure CRM standards and sustainability prevail.
  • Assess business requirements and integration needs in order to liaise with other IT teams and support integration project implementation.
  • Advocate for an awareness and focus on the overall look and feel of the CRM platform and ensure transversal rules are documented and followed.


Project Management & Delivery


  • Manage the projects or actively participate on their implementation, or follow-up and collaborate with the technical teams, system administrators and data controllers to ensure qualitative delivery.
  • Be accountable for IT delivery and service quality through KPIs provided, communicated, discussed with business partners and the Program manager and enriched by interactions with System Administrators, Data Controllers and other IT stakeholders for the projects.


Qualifications


  • 5 years' higher education – Master’s degree, engineer training or equivalent
  • 5+ years of functional experience in IT, mostly in CRM. administration/management responsibilities.
  • 3+ years of experience working on projects using agile and waterfall methodology.
  • Has previously held positions requiring an overall perspective of structure, strategy, issues, etc.
  • Experience with managing, monitoring and scoring data quality in a transactional environment.
  • Very good communication skills.
  • Fluent English ; another language would be a plus.


Position Type


Full time


and


Permanent


Only technical issues will be monitored through the below inbox:


recruiting.support@ imerys.com


PLEASE DO NOT SUBMIT RESUMES OR APPLICATIONS TO THIS EMAIL, AS THEY WILL NOT BE REVIEWED.


To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only applications received through the online application process will be considered.


IMERYS is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and it is our policy to not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Sales Assistant
Skills: Communication|Customer Experience|Customer Service|Fashion|Infor Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)|Merchandising|Microsoft Office|Sales|Teamwork|Visual Merchandising|
Job Description:
About the job

As a trusted global transformation partner, Welocalize accelerates the global business journey by enabling brands and companies to reach, engage, and grow international audiences. Welocalize delivers multilingual content transformation services in translation, localization, and adaptation for over 250 languages with a growing network of over 400,000 in-country linguistic resources. Driving innovation in language services, Welocalize delivers high-quality training data transformation solutions for NLP-enabled machine learning by blending technology and human intelligence to collect, annotate, and evaluate all content types. Our team works across locations in North America, Europe, and Asia serving our global clients in the markets that matter to them. www.welocalize.com


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


About Adapt


Adapt – a Welocalize company – is a digital performance marketing agency with services across Paid Search, Programmatic, Paid Social, SEO, Content Marketing, Conversion Optimization, and Web Analytics. We help brands grow faster at home and abroad in over 250 languages.


We have an international presence and we are getting busier every month with new business and fantastic client retention. Adapt has recently launched a new brand, website, and proposition, making this an exciting opportunity to join a growing and ambitious digital marketing agency, helping to define a new direction for its in-house marketing initiatives


Job Description


As a Paid Media Manager within our Paid Media team, you’ll be a key part of both leading and supporting digital marketing campaigns across Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads, and many more for our diverse client base. You will be responsible for managing the delivery of day-to-day paid media campaigns to our customers and for the activation and strategy work for all clients.


The role requires technical know-how, strategic thinking, and a hands-on approach to our clients’ paid media campaigns. We pride ourselves on impact and innovation, making a real difference to our client's results, and striving to be at the forefront of media buying with this role a key driver of those aims.


We believe in supporting professional development through our career framework, helping you develop your career as a digital marketer from day one.


Role Summary


  • Manage a portfolio of clients’ paid media campaigns, both as a leader and supporting larger advertiser campaigns
  • Deliver campaign briefs from strategy and planning through to implementation and optimization
  • Own the day-to-day delivery of paid media work against customer objectives
  • Analysis of data across multiple tools to report on the performance of Junior Paid Media members and identify new opportunities
  • Mentor and tutor junior members of the team, for example with technical training on an ad platform
  • Proactively build internal relationships & communicate technical subjects effectively
  • Ensure campaigns deliver against a customer’s objectives while providing analysis and recommendations to improve performance
  • Support senior team members with strategy development
  • Define optimization strategies for customers
  • Work towards becoming a trusted advisor to clients through the communication of day-to-day performance management and strategies for short-term performance improvement


Key Competencies


  • Understand and be able to explain best practice set-up requirements for relevant paid media platforms and influence best practice sharing across squads
  • Begin to use market insight tools such as SimilarWeb to help inform customer strategies
  • Lead meetings and communication around day-to-day delivery for clients
  • Deeper understanding of analytics platforms and tagging setup
  • Demonstrate more than technical competency, for example, commercial awareness, or project management skills
  • Able to confidently build campaigns across multiple paid media platforms
  • Able to demonstrate proficiency in customer management and delivery/optimization/analysis/reporting across platforms


Experience


  • Ideally 2+ years in a role utilizing Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, Meta, and LinkedIn Ads.
  • Demonstrable experience in planning, implementing and optimizing paid media campaigns
  • Strong written, verbal, and presentation skills
  • All relevant certifications across major media buying platforms
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is desirable
  • Experience in supporting and training junior team members is desirable


You Need to


  • Be passionate about digital marketing
  • Be organised, determined, and persistent
  • Be self-driven & results-oriented, with a positive outlook
  • Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Be a natural forward planner who critically assesses its own performance
  • Be credible and comfortable in dealing with business owners
  • Have a strong customer service ethos and the ability to build lasting relationships
  • Have meticulous attention to detail with a very analytical mindset
  • Experience and knowledge of Excel are essential


Other Information


Adapt is an award-winning, fast-paced & collaborative agency, we strive to make this a fantastic place to work for everyone:


Fully hybrid – we have offices across Europe, and our teams can use this space or work remotely


Flexi working – we believe in being flexible so that your work fits around your lifestyle, rather than the other way around


Training – dedicated training time in your diary to ensure you’re continually learning and developing in the areas interesting to you


Working Abroad – work from another country for a few weeks a year, all you need is an internet connection!


Socials – we have legendary Summer & Christmas parties as well as regular social events organized by our wonderful Social Committee


Knowledge Shares – we arrange a weekly slot for the whole agency to come together and learn something new, from external speakers to sharing a new platform feature internally – these are a highlight


Wellness – we know how important mental health is, our Wellness Team do a fantastic job supporting the agency, raising awareness, and running initiatives to help look after our mental health


Welocalize is committed to equal opportunities and in compliance with the General Law on the Rights of People with Disabilities, this vacancy is also available and we encourage those candidates who have a disability certificate (equal to or greater than 33%) to apply.

Title: CRM Commercial Business Partner & Solution Architect
Skills: Business Process|Business Requirements|Communication|Data Quality|Key Performance Indicators|Project Implementation|Teamwork|Transactional Legal Services|
Job Description:
About the job

Corporate Finance Senior Consultant



At Deloitte, the spirit of the excellence is part of our DNA. We strive to hire the brightest minds from all around the globe, allowing us to excel in both long-term strategic thinking and business improvement implementation as the undisputed global leader in professional services. We are committed to delivering impacting results for diverse private and public organization clients, linking our peerless talent in audit with unrivalled opportunities for impact – committing ourselves to sustainable growth and investment in our employees’ development and inclusion along the way.


Our culture is rooted in profound shared values. Our values guide us as we live our purpose to serve our clients with quality and distinction, inspire our people to work collaboratively to deliver value, actively contribute to society, and lead the profession by challenging ourselves to do what matters most. Deloitte’s values are what unite us across cultures and geographies, and ultimately help us earn the trust and respect of our people, clients, and society.


We believe that our differences enable us to #makeanimpactthatmatters.


#ChooseDeloitteif:


  • You want to work with inspiring, ambitious, and supportive people with diverse geographical and academic backgrounds and extensive skills;
  • You get excitement in managing clients shifting priorities and accomplish tasks in a challenging, fast-paced environment;
  • You like to nurture people and share your knowledge with others.



What Impact will you make?



#YourRole


Your role as a Senior Consultant will focus on the delivery of client engagements by understanding expectations and demonstrating personal accountability for keeping performance on track, exercising effective communication and relationship-building skills and contributing to the priorities of the team and the business. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on live corporate finance transactions, valuation exercises and various other assignments for different companies and sectors. You will commit to personal learning and development and explore opportunities to make an impact by delivering exceptional client services.


During your tenure you will demonstrate and develop the ability to:


  • Prepare, analyse and explain historical and projected financial information
  • Compile, analyze, and report economic and industry data to help clients make informed decisions
  • Develop complex financial models and run valuation analyses using several methods
  • Prepare detailed presentations and marketing material (such as Teasers, IMs, pitch decks, etc.)
  • Assisting in the preparation and execution of transactions, from initial analysis of information to transaction strategy development and execution
  • Collect, assimilate, and analyze relevant data using standard tools and data visualizations to help surface insights
  • Manage own work against project plan to ensure a superior client experience
  • Gather and interpret financial information to help strengthen proposed recommendations
  • Comply with quality standards, risk rules, and confidentiality guidelines to deliver results


#WinningRequirements


To qualify for the role you must have:


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration or any related field
  • Master’s Degree (M.Sc. or MBA) in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration from a prominent University would be considered a strong asset
  • Professional Qualification (CFA, ACA, ACCA, or similar) will be considered a strong asset
  • 3 – 5 years work experience in Valuations, M&A advisory, Capital Raising, Restructuring, Project Finance/PPP, etc., preferably within a major International professional services firm (Big-4 or other) or an investment bank in Greece or abroad, would be considered as an asset but not mandatory
  • Very good knowledge of Financial Modeling in Microsoft Excel (knowledge of VBA) will be considered a strong asset
  • Excellent command of the Greek & English language
  • Excellent written, verbal & presentation skills
  • Military obligations fulfilled where applicable



#AboutFinancial Advisory


The Deloitte Financial Advisory practice provides to its clients - multinational corporates to private equity, owner managed businesses, creditors, shareholders and governments – a wide range of qualified Financial Crisis services and Merger & Acquisition services which include:


  • Financial crisis services
  • Restructuring: our team is specialized in providing in-depth business and financial advisory services to companies, their creditors, their equity holders, bank syndicates and other interested parties in both in-court and out-of-court restructuring process
  • Forensic: our team helps our clients react quickly and confidently in a crisis, fraud and financial crime or dispute. We provide investigation, litigation support, forensic technology services, business intelligence searches, leveraging Deloitte global network, deep industry experience and advanced analytical technology in order to understand and resolve issues and deliver the proactive advice clients need to reduce the risk of future problems
  • Merger & Acquisition services
  • Corporate Finance Advisory: our professionals offer independent financial, M&A and debt advice for clients whether they are seeking to expand organically or through acquisition; realize value through a disposal or restructuring; raise new finance; review debt facilities; improve balance sheet funding efficiencies. The team includes professionals with FSI and Real Estate expertise
  • M&A Transaction Services: our team provides comprehensive, focused support to acquirers and vendors, assessing the strengths and weaknesses, value areas and risks of a transaction, helping our clients make informed decisions about their transactions
  • Valuation and Modelling: we provides well-reasoned valuations and advice understanding how to quantify and present valuation analyses and conclusions in concert with prevailing accounting, tax, and regulatory codes, for transaction, financing, litigation, strategic management, and compliance purposes
  • Business Advisory: new service aimed to enlarge the FA offering through the integration of financial and business dimensions



Why Deloitte


At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles.



ABOUT DELOITTE



Our services


Deloitte offers Global professional services that include Audit, Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines insight and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.

We deliver outstanding impact on the reputation and success of our clients, in Greece and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates within.


Our Purpose


Our purpose, “To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society “- defines who we are and what we stand for. This is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.



Our values



At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service through our expertise and professionalism.

We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.



Our talent experience


From day one at our firm, practitioners are part of a community. Our development and career progression framework will help them develop the skills and capabilities to succeed. The wellness of our people and the ability to offer agile working arrangements is at the centre of our unique talent experience. We create a workplace that encourages collaboration, creativity, inclusiveness to ensure our staff are supported, encouraged and feel a sense of purpose and meaning in what they do each day.


Sounds like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

Title: Sales Assistant
Skills: Accounting|Accounts Receivable (AR)|Administrative Assistance|Databases|English|Finance|General Accounts|Interpersonal Communication|Microsoft Office|Year-End Accounting|
Job Description:
About the job

Job description

P.P.A. S.A., founded in 1930, is a modern and dynamic company strengthening the position of the port on the global map of shipping, tourism and trade, while bringing multiple benefits on a local, social and cultural level. During the past years, under the management of COSCO Shipping Group, world's biggest integrated shipping enterprise and current owner of 67% stake of P.P.A. S.A., a great number of projects have been implemented, aiming at a complete port’s upgrade and modernization. Leading by example, the port’s vision is to offer high quality and top performance port services, in a safe and sustainable manner.

P.P.A. S.A. values its own personnel as the most valuable asset. With a team of almost 1000 employees the company takes all steps needed to ensure excellent working conditions, benefits, advantages and training, along with advancement opportunities. Furthermore, the company promotes equal opportunities, protects diversity and encourages inclusiveness by not accepting any kind of discrimination either in terms of selection, recruitment, remuneration, training or other work activities.

P.P.A. S.A. is always interested in recruiting unique and diverse individuals, bringing new perspectives, energy and skill that make our team even stronger and more successful!


Currently, we are looking to bring on board a qualified Electrical Engineer for Planning and Projects Department:


Key Accountabilities

  • Provision of expert advice and guidance in project planning, project execution and project control
  • Project management focusing on planning, maintaining quality nd meeting project cost schedule and budget
  • Collaboration with project engineers and other project professionals to provide work direction and guidance.
  • Formulation and implementation of strategies to improve project planning, cost, schedule, and quality.

  • Participation in the development of standards, guidelines, instructions, policies and procedures on an as-required basis

Job Requirements-Preferred skills

  • Bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering.
  • A higher degree would be considered an asset.
  • Capability of evaluating and consulting on project problems where precedents are lacking or on problems where a specialized knowledge is required

  • A minimum of 5 years work experience including at least 3 years in engineering with an emphasis on Project and construction management stages

Title: Paid Media Manager
Skills: Campaigns|Commercial Awareness|Digital Marketing|Facebook Ads|Google Ads|Marketing Campaigns|Media Buying|Paid Media Advertising|Presentations|Strategic Thinking|
Job Description:
About the job

Novibet is looking for a Technical Global Expansion Associate to join our team in our HQ in Athens.


Novibet, founded in 2010, is an established GameTech company operating in Europe and LATAM (Greece, Brazil, Ireland, Italy, Mexico, Chile, Ecuador), through its offices in Greece & Malta. Licensed and regulated by MGA, ADM and HGC, and Irish Revenue Commissioners, Novibet is committed to delivering the best sports betting and gaming experience to an ever-expanding customer base.


Your Role


  • Document platform properties and prepare technical licensing material for new markets
  • Analyze business and technical requirements, product performance and competitive initiatives and make recommendations on actions or implications for the business
  • Develop well-formed, strategic recommendations and actively contribute to development business plans from the technical domain
  • Effectively influence up and across the technology as the subject matter expert and point person for all questions related to a project/category
  • Provide project management and cross-functional supervision for assigned initiatives, including product innovation projects by developing and executing detailed timelines for international roll-out of the in-house platform


Requirements


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Informatics / Business or Marketing required
  • MBA/Master’s Degree preferred
  • Technical writing and requirement analysis experience
  • Demonstrated project management experience
  • Demonstrated experience leading cross functional teams
  • Interpersonal skills to build strong and influential relationships across different cultures and with region teams, franchisees, and cross-functional team members
  • Proficiency in English


Benefits


Our employees are our most important asset and that's reflected in the way we treat our people! We are proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees, including:


  • Friendly working environment
  • Opportunities to learn and grow within a dynamic, fast developing company
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Private insurance scheme


Novibet regrets that due to the large volume of applications received, we will only consider those who solely correspond to job requirements as listed above.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Job Description:
About the job

The Company


Swatch Group is the world's number one manufacturer of finished watches. With its 17 watch brands, the Group is present in all price segments, and is also active in the manufacture and sale of jewelry, watch movements and components.


Swatch Group unites, among other companies, the following watch brands under its roof: Breguet, Harry Winston, Blancpain, Glashütte Original, Jaquet Droz, Léon Hatot, Omega, Longines, Rado, Union Glashütte, Tissot, Balmain, Certina, Mido, Hamilton, Swatch and Flik Flak. The Group has a strong distribution and multi-brand retail net with two sophisticated boutiques under the name of Tourbillon and Hour Passion. Swatch Group is also an important player in advanced nanomechanical, nanoelectronic and Bluetooth technologies essential to watchmaking and other industries.

  • Power Business Intelligence (BI) development and administration

Profile

Languages

Job Location: 17672 Athens, Greece


Company Address: The Swatch Group (Greece) S.M.S.A.Sygrou & 3 Mantzagriotaki StreetKallitheaGR-176 72 AthensGreece

Title: Electrical Engineer
Skills: Engineering|Project Management|
Job Description:
About the job

Enel Green Power Hellas is seeking for a Senior Procurement Engineer in Athens, Greece.

Are you passionate about working in the Renewable Energy Production? Do you have a unique combination of deep interpretation of procurement processes, business acumen and interpersonal skills? Are you an individual who thrives in a dynamic and collaborative environment?


This position is critical in monitoring the supply of products and services essential for our company’s investments and operations. This includes a variety of responsibilities, such as, negotiation of the best price and contract terms, execution of the most efficient sourcing strategies, development of successful partnerships and implementation of risk management.


Responsible for overseeing and executing the procurement activities related to major projects and ongoing operations. A role that collaborates with cross-functional teams, managing vendor relationships, and ensuring the timely and cost-effective procurement of goods, works and services in accordance with organizational guidelines, projects requirements and relevant laws and regulations.


What you will do:


  • Collaborate with project managers, engineering teams, maintenance teams, and other stakeholders to develop comprehensive procurement strategies aligned with project goals, technical specifications, and budgetary constraints.
  • Lead the tendering process, including the preparation of bid documents, technical evaluations, and commercial analysis. Evaluate vendor proposals, conduct negotiations, and make recommendations for contract awards.
  • Negotiate best price points via market intelligence and competitor analysis with the objective of meeting customer expectations on quality and timelines within stipulated budgets. Monitor project budgets and expenditures related to procurement activities. Identify cost-saving opportunities, negotiate pricing terms, and implement effective strategies to optimize procurement spend without compromising quality or delivery timelines.
  • Execute applicable/approved sourcing strategies and drive supplier negotiations to meet the quality, fulfilment, and productivity requirements of the business, including identification of suitable/appropriate suppliers & articulation of service requirements.
  • Management of contract structure and contract negotiation. Prepare, review, and administer EPC and O&M contracts, ensuring compliance with legal, technical, and commercial requirements.
  • Perform risk management regarding supply contracts and agreements. Assess and mitigate risks associated with procurement activities, including supply chain disruptions, vendor performance issues, and changing market dynamics.
  • Develop successful working partnerships with Greece and other business group leadership to understand their procurement needs.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends, market conditions, and emerging technologies in procurement. Identify opportunities for process enhancements and introduce best practices to optimize procurement operations.


Who you are:

  • 5-8 years of procurement experience.
  • Postgraduate/Graduate in Engineering (preferably mechanical/electrical/civil) or in a related field from a recognized University.
  • Additional certifications in procurement, supply chain management etc. will be considered as an asset.
  • Proven experience as a Procurement Engineer, preferably in the EPC and O&M sectors.
  • Strong knowledge of procurement practices, contract management, and supplier relationship management.
  • Excellent negotiation skills.
  • Analytical mindset with the ability to evaluate complex technical and commercial information.
  • Fluency in English is mandatory.


What we search in you:

  • Comfortable with figures and in collecting, analyzing and interpreting data.
  • Strong interpersonal/communication and group process skills, ability to build confidence with local business managers in their ability to understand their needs and execute value-added Procurement Management activities.
  • Good judgment in resolving issues; proactively seek solutions to upcoming issues and offer insights and ideas.



What we offer:

  • Place of work: Athens, Greece
  • Permanent type of contract
  • Friendly working environment
  • Competitive remuneration package & benefits
  • Career & competencies development



Who we are:


Enel Green Power is part of Enel’s Group, and manages all the generation from renewable sources in Enel’s world countries. Our pillars are sustainability and innovation. We want to build a new way of living energy, creating sustainable development and making clean energy accessible to all. We are constantly searching for solutions to produce clean energy in a more efficient and sustainable way: big data and digital technologies to increase the efficiency of solar and wind parks, drones and robots to support the maintenance of hydroelectric power stations and generation plants.

Innovation, Trust, Proactivity and Responsibility are the core values of our Organization. We are always looking for different perspectives, ideas and point of views. Each person is important to us, independently from their gender, age, nationality, ability or any other form of diversity or specificity. We are a people focused Company and we work to empower all our colleagues through development programs and lifelong learning.

We promote work flexibility recognizing the importance of well-being and work-life balance.


Find out more information on our website: www.enelgreenpower.com

Title: Technical Global Expansion Associate

Job Description:
About the job

The organization

We are driven by our purpose: We bring people more choices to enjoy life their way, by creating a world of personalized experiences, innovative services, and huge range of products; a world that cares about each of us and our common future.

Our key success driver is our people who share mutually the values of our brand: we are human2human, we work wonders, we celebrate uniqueness, we embrace betterness. We do our best to keep everyone excited and have the support they need to bring their best.

Public Group strategically invests to create an ecosystem of innovative scaleups around its core Omnichannel Retail business, with the objective to provide exciting customer experiences powered by operational excellence. We bring together technology, talent & entrepreneurship to create value in the Greek market & society.

Our Omnichannel retail, in Greece and Cyprus, consists of the love brand Public and Media Markt, a consumer electronics retailer with long lasting heritage. Innovation is part of our DNA. Through our ecosystem of startups and organizations, -Douleutaras.gr, iRepair , Instacar , our tech Public Next, Endeavour & Venture Friends - we offer pioneer services to our consumers. We operate 67 stores, 4 eShops and an ecosystem of digital properties such as: public ticketing, public business and bookfriends.gr.

#LifeAtPublic #BetterEveryDay

The role

Responsibilities
  • Liaises between stores & central warehouse in order to organize and document a reverse logistics plan
  • Creates orders so as to execute the agreed reverse plan
  • Coordinates the intra-warehouse & store-to-store stock movements
  • Administers stores' availability tickets
  • Collaborates closely with the commercial/warehouse/stores teams for effective problem solving

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance or relevant field
  • Ideally 1-2 years of relevant experience in a relevant role
  • Experience in the Retail industry will be considered an advantage
  • Excellent knowledge of MS Office; especially of Microsoft Excel
  • Excellent knowledge of the English language, both written and oral
  • Developed communication skills
  • Problem solving aptitude
  • Drive & results orientation

Desirable Qualifications:
  • Master’s degree
  • SAP user or other similar software system
  • Ability to collaborate with cross functional teams
  • Team spirit, undertaking of initiatives & innovative mindset

What we offer:
  • Competitive compensation & benefits package
  • Dynamic work environment
  • Exciting opportunity to grow with the role
  • Great experience in a well-known and respected growing business
  • LinkedIn Learning account for continuous learning

All applications will be treated with the strictest confidentiality.
